reviews.review: Overrated and expensive tourist-trap. This was the most expensive and least impressive attraction we visited in Morocco. It was very disappointing because I had high-hopes seeing as this was the top-rated attraction in Marrakech on Trip Advisor. As a garden, it's very mediocre. I guess it's nice for a garden in the North African desert, but compared to gardens elsewhere in the world, it's nothing special. When we visited, it was absolutely packed with tourists, you couldn't walk two feet without having to dodge an idiot taking a selfie.Skip it, this garden will give you a very bad impression if you're expecting it to be the top attraction in Marrakech like I was.

Jardin Majorelle. It was a bit out on a limb for us, so it was a taxi ride to get there. It was 100drm to enter, this got you to see the gardens and the Berber museum within the gardens. The gardens were okay and I got the connection with Yves se Laurent, but felt the name jacked up the price because of the name. The garden was relatively small and it was okay but nothing that spectacular for the money. I would probably only have given it an average rating but for the museum. which although small I found the exhibits well presented and very interesting and it saved the visit for me and raised it to very good.

Worth a visit.... The gardens are beautiful and very tranquil... A real contrast to the hustle and bustle surrounding Marrakech. I would definitely recommend anyone to spend an hour or so there. Best visit in the morning as it got very busy towards mid-day!

Nothing Special. I think this park is a little over hyped. It plants that can be found in most places on the med. Even the 6 yr old was bored. Its only saving grace is that you are visiting the place where Yves St Laurent had his ashes spread.
Beautiful Place. We have been with the family there. Thats the way you have to do it ;-) As a short trip not far away from the medina.

Surprisingly interesting. We stayed in a riad inside the medina and made this our first solo trip outside the city walls. It's a short walk through the more modern part of the city and quite manageable on foot. Once we found the entrance (just off a main road and not obvious) we joined a short queue of tourists but only waited a few minutes. We visited in September which meant that the weather was not uncomfortably hot - mid to high 30s.The garden is larger than I expected and densely planted with shady tropical trees and plants and the most incredible collection of cacti. Many as tall as trees and others twisted into incredible shapes.The buildings, fountains and walls within the garden are painted the stunning Majorelle Blue which makes for some beautiful photographs.One of the buildings houses a small museum containing a really impressive collection of Berber artefacts, clothing and especially jewellery which is displayed in a small mirrored room which shows off the exhibits to perfection. Make sure you buy the extra, reasonably priced ticket at the entrance.A cool and welcome respite from the heat and a peaceful retreat from the bustle of the medina.
A nice place to spend an hour.. A very beautiful garden and an oasis of calm in an otherwise frenetic city. But an hour is all you need really

Unmissable. Photographed countless times and featured in almost every guide, yet this touristy sight is unmissable. Try to visit off season or early or late in the day to avoid crowds as part of the magic is to enjoy the gardens in tranquility. The cobalt blue is iconic, and is stunning in the bright north african light.
Lovely place. Beautiful gardens well worth a visit, we walked here from the main square but you can take a taxi or carriage.

so pretty but very small and expensive. First, there is a shocking price for non-moroccan tourists (100drh) and then there is another shock how small is that garden. You can see it in less than 10 minutes if you want. it is really well maintained and it was designed by Yves saint laurent so that makes the price worth to see as you really can see the hand of the famous designer. the other thing really worth to see is the Berber Exposition/Museum - it is a magnificent collection of the different exponats connected with the life of Berber society.

Small but peaceful. Went to the jardin majorelle - two adults, to older children and two younger children.An incredibly peaceful place to walk around with water and cacti.Young children had fun spotting turtles in the pond.'Love gallery' is a must see - a collection of the cards sent from Yves Saint Laurent. Wish it was bigger, didn't take long to walk around.We had a delightful lunch which made our visit last longer- a great kids option on the menu and a beautiful setting.

Attractive gardens if you are at a loose end. These are pleasant gardens to visit but unlikely to take much more than 45 mins to walk around, and relatively expensive at 70dhs per adult. Children under 12 are free. We walked there and back from the medina via Place Du 16 November (the new part of town). Basically, if you are short on time, you won't be missing much if you didn't visit here.
Serene. A great way to spend a few hours on Marrakech. There are restaurants as the cafe is quite expensive, but good food.

Beautiful peaceful space in the middle of a chaotic whirlwind of a city. Only small but it is very peaceful. Great little Berber museum too. Great place to visit. We didn't visit the cafe but it has good reviews. Lovely little garden where you can sit and contemplate or stroll around.
Beautiful and worth a visit!! . Only 15mins by taxi from medina ( haggle for 20 dhs Max one way which is only 2 euro) Beautiful and tranquil getaway with a lovely coffee shop and museum inside!
Gardens. I really liked the gardens and the museum is actually really interesting. The museum holds a collection of Berber traditional dresses.
Must see. Loved the cactus area. I am not a garden person but following advice of other travelers we decided to visit. Glad we did. This is a must see
Beautiful garden. Beautiful garden, I just wish it would have been bigger. It doesnt take more than max 2 h in slow pace walk to see it all.

Lovely but bloomin' expensive . A world famous garden, well designed and looked after, but much copied (our kids said it was just like queuing for a ride at Alton Towers).Because of its fame it was busy & really expensive, so not the tranquil haven it was designed to be.
Nothing special. There was like five different kind of cactus in the garden and that's it. The garden museum was pretty nice though.
Crowded. More an installation than a garden but interesting for its history and the Berber Museum . Very crowded with tourists taking selfies, so not peaceful or relaxing .

Blue and yellow experience. Majorelle GardenThe garden was made in the 1920s by the French painter Jacques Majorelle, with marble pools, groves of bamboo, coconut palms and bougainvilleas and cactii. As the garden was designed by a painter, the garden is composed and coloured like a painting. Many of the built features were painted in a dark blue ('Majorelle Blue') In fact, Majorelle's garden rather than his paintings was his masterpiece. Water is an important feature of the garden - there are channels, lily-filled ponds and fountains. Majorelle was an avid plant collector. After years of neglect, the garden was then taken over and restored by the fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent and his partner Pierre Berge.

Beautiful colours in the centre of Marrakech. This is the resting place of YSL, I didn't know this when we arrived, and found it rather moving when I found out. The garden itself is small but beautifully formed, with an exquisite gift shop (all rather out of my price range) packed full of beautiful things to look at. It also has a super bookshop, and the Love posters exhibition. I gather there is a YSL museum opening here next year which would make it even more worth a visit. Very reasonable to get in, but it wont take you long so don't plan to stay here more than an hour.

Quiet in the hussle of the city. We really enjoyed the lovely gardens, so many cactus types, the typical blue colors, blossoming in late October...One tip: go early (we went at 08:30), before the busses arrive with tourists, then you can really experience the calm that Yves Saint Laurent found here.Entrance 70dh, children free under 12 yrs.
Highlight of my trio. I'm a plant lover and I enjoyed seeing the exotic varieties this place had to offer. Definitely worth a visit and a trip to the new town.
Beautiful. A great walk in lovely surroundings, the colours are amazing. Very well presented and good value, a must do visit.

Small and expensive. Not much information about plants except Latin names. There is a special price for Moroccans and a tourist price. I thought it was quite small and very busy. It s all right for Yves saint Laurent and his partner when it was just the two of them.

A nice garden, if that's your thing. . A nice garden with an array of desert flora. Not sure that it is worth the admission, but I am far from a garden aficionado. This was more of a "check the box" stop on out visit to Marrakesh. We were in and out in around 30 mins.
Interesting gardens. Ok for a break from the busy city but not very extensive nor especially inspiring. Can be a bit busy if a bus load of tourists has just arrived.
Lovely ambience and tranquility in the Majorelle! 🌴🌵🌴. Worth a visit as feels like you are in an oasis or mini rain forest.The small YSL museum very colourful and cafe inviting.

Stunning!. This beautiful garden requires several visits, because the light is amazing at different times of day. We went at about 4 p.m. to catch the "golden hour" light filtering through the grounds. Then on a drizzly day to capture the muted shading and raindrops off the cacti. Every year, the specimens get more breathtaking. Meticulously tended, it is a delight. And for color, there is nothing as remarkable as the famous "Majorelle" blue as a background for the citrus-colored pots and varieties of sculptural catci. The gift shop is dizzyingly expensive (this is the site of YSL's memorial, so expect couturier prices), but you can get a small can of the famous blue paint to take home. The Berber museum on the grounds is also worth a look. And the bookstore (Librerie) has hard-to-locate books of local interest (Lords of the Atlas, in English; Contes et Legendes Populaires du Maroc, in French).

Great Sunday stroll. For non-museum goers, the Berber museum is a painless and rather fascinating quick 25 min visit and the surround before/after are a walk in Eden. Take a book and sit in the bamboo woods, you can sped 1 hour or 5 there.

A break from the hustle and city noise. Very well worth the quick visit, which took us about an hour. Very peaceful and shaded from the sun so we kept cool. It was busy but no so much that it made the visit unpleasant. Highly would recommend.

Worth a visit. Quite nice to walk out to the gardens if you can, depending where you are staying. It is about a 15mn walk from the nearest Bab (gate) in the city wall.The gardens are not large and you can walk round in an hour or so, including stops for pics. The little museum is worthwhile too if you enjoy local cultural history. Jewelry display is particularly impressive.

Nice garden but not better than others around the world. The garden is very nice & maintained well. However, I would not say it is something more special than other gardens around the world with free or charged entry. Also, the ticketing & entry is slow, so we waited 15-30 minutes to enter around 10am. I would not come back to this personally but it is not bad. Cash only.

A shady sojourn. For a small entrance fee you can escape the heat of the day and amble through this arboreal oddity.The tall bamboo and palms are pleasant parasols allowing you to be shaded as you wander through the informal pathways that pass by water features, the odd salute to the designer of the garden, a pretty pond area but most impressive the cactus collection.For a few dirhams more you get entrance to the museum as well. The benches throughout the garden allow you to sit, admire and wonder why it was designed quite like it was? You have to visit to understand why that question popped up in the minds of all of our party but it doesn't mean it's not worth a visit, I loved it.

Alien Planting Scheme that simply works and is beautiful. Loved it - seems expensive when you're buying the entry ticket - but I thought it was worth every Dirham - an amazing and uplifting gardens with beautiful shape and form.
Beautiful . These gardens are really beautiful, we spent a couple of hours wandering round and the cafe was a nice spot for lunch.The little museum was worth a visit too.
Bliss in the burbs. Wonderful and inspirational garden - thanls to legacy of YSL. Really worthwhile and relaxing plae to be

Worth a Visit. We arrived at 8am in the morning and had the place to ourselves, it was great! Definitely worth a visit, but would be a very different experience cramped with tourists, as the site isn't that big.

Beautiful. Already very busy at 9.30 am on a Friday and it is small. Very pretty and beautiful blues and greens. Amazing cacti. Only takes about 30 mins to get round. Also a small museum at extra cost and some art (included).

Very welcoming garden. The Yves Saint Laurent garden is amazing, a truly diverse range of plants and fantastic back drops. All species of plants were listed and plants were sought out from throughout the world. The museum is also worth visiting.
Good but crowded and quite expensive.. Stunning entrance, and some fabulous trees, but I was hoping for something more special. If you love gardens try The Secret Garden.

Meh... Nice and Quiet I guess. These gardens are nice - though don't bother with these giuded tours etc - what are they going to tell you? "oh this cactus is native to Morroco" whatever...Anyway - its a very peaceful part of Marrakech which makes a nice change, so its great to come here and relax, collect your thoughts on what you'd like to do next in town etcSome great plants and photos to be taken so get your fill - and random cats here and there which are really cute :)

Very beautiful, but there is lots of beautiful in Marrakech. We traveled a long way from the medina to visit Jardin Majorellewe had heard that t was worth our time.The price is now 70 DAM for basic entry to the gardens and while they are beautiful, we were satisfied that we had seen it all after 30 minutes!When you consider that you can visit El Bahia palace for 10 DAM (!!), this is quite an expensive do.As I stated earlier, yes the gardens are beautiful, but it is small, expensive in comparison and I wouldn't recommend it to someone having a short stay in Marrakech.

What a lovely gem. The jardin is a lovely hidden gem of colors in the middle of a city where everything is reddish brown and desert looking. This garden is green with a lovely azure blue building and while there's not a lot to see it's a lovely spectacle well worth a short stop and don't miss the Berber museum on site.

Go early or late to avoid the crush. Lovely garden largely full of cacti and a great gift/fashion shop and bookshop. Garden itself is looking a little tired in places. Shops outside are pretty good too. There's a new YSL museum (attached to the garden) opening soon I hear....
Colours, colours and colours!. Very refreshing and peaceful. Must visit if you're in Marrakech. Will probably be the highlight of your trip to Marrakech!

Beautiful Gardens!!!. this was one of the highlights of my visit to the city. the Gardens are absolutely beautiful. i recommend going in the morning as soon as they open as it gets swamped with tourists very quickly and gets a bit too crowded..

oasis in the middle of the town. We loved the beautiful colorful Majorelle gardens in the middle of a the busy town. It was nice to see all the plants and water features and to enjoy the cooler temperatures in the garden.

Not quite worth the hype. The gardens were beautiful, but they weren't worth the hype, or the price. The berber museum inside the gardens was quite interesting, but small, and also not quite worth the price.

well worth a visit-spectacular!. This was originally the studio of Jacques Majorelle who originally came to Marrakesh from Paris in 1917-in 1923 he decided to live in Marrakesh. He had an artist's studio built in the Art Deco style in 1931.Surrounding the studio he had a garden built composed of rare and exotic plants from all over the world. The garden was abandoned after his death in 1962 and in the 1980's was acquired by Yves Saint Laurent and his partner. The garden was restored and more plants added. In addition to this, there is the addition of the Berber museum-full of jewelry from various tribes in North Africa. Another thing not to be missed is a small gallery of YSL's yearly LOVE artwork. It is well worth the visit-it is a small space and does not take up too much time but is fascinating.
Stunning. So so beautiful..the colours are gorgeous and the gardens are an oasis. Also the tiny museum for YSL is really pretty. A must.

Beautiful gardens. Absolutely beautiful gardens! I didn't really know what to expect, but I am glad we went in the end. So peaceful and serene. A lovely way to while away an afternoon. Price was a little steep

Nice but expensive. It was a nice place to spend 45 min at, but there were a lot of other people in the not very large space. Overall, nice to visit but I don't think it was worth the price (when compared to the asking price of the palaces)
Spikes cactus. The variety of plants are amazing jacpues majorelle did a good job.Amazing to go with a family.love to go again.

Sunday mornings are made for this. Stunning location: lilly pads and fish, turtles and frogs plus the most amazing collection of cacti I have ever seen in one place and a beautiful berber museum with a wonderful and surprising exhibition. Perfect for a Sunday morning with two ten year old boys. Cool even in the noon day sun.
Ok but not what I was expecting . Some nice elements but not at all what I was expecting.. I've seen nicer botanical gardens. I guess if you have an interest in the history or YSL then it's for you.
Paradise in Marrakech. This is a must seebeautiful and relaxing such a wide range of wonderful plants and trees that are really well kept.a calm and peaceful oasis

Beautiful gardens. Really interesting and lovely grounds. Was a bit tricky to find if you're walking on foot. The Berber museum is well worth a visit too and has a beautiful exhibit of Berber jewellery. Very peaceful gardens to spend an hour in.

Beautiful gardens. Really interesting and lovely grounds. Was a bit tricky to find if you're walking on foot. The Berber museum is well worth a visit too and has a beautiful exhibit of Berber jewellery. Very peaceful gardens to spend an hour in.

Beautiful tourist spot. Beautiful garden and lots of tourists! We went around lunch time, i'd recomend a visit forst thing when i suspect the gardens are a bit more quite, but beautiful none the less.

Great gardens and museum. The gardens are probably the most expensive place to visit in Marrakech, so if trees and desert flora are not you're thing then you can probably give this a miss. If you are interested, then you have to go! There is also a fascinating museum on Berber culture, which is worth the additional cost (70/30 drm). The gardens are outside the medina to the north west in the new city - if you don't feel like walking more than 30 minutes to get there then it may be better to get a taxi.

Beautiful, but no such thing as bleu de majorelle! It's Moroccan old mosaic tile blue.... Great garden hidden in the busy busy Marrakech. Definitely worth a trip, but annoyed at the fact that they try and make it all so commercial. It's quite tacky to market the deep blue as if Majorelle invented it. It has origins in the natural colors that Moroccans have used for centuries and still do, to color the famous mosaics, the fabrics and leather etc. Don't buy anything in the shop, as it's all branding - taking Moroccan artisanat and adding a brand equals a 3000% addition to the price, of the same items you can find in the souks. On the positive note, there was a great museum with the history of the Imazighen, which was a great surprise. Try the garden café, great surrounding to enjoy a tea or coffee, although the staff are very reserved and don't talk much.

Afternoon walking marjorelle gardens. We spent the afternoon walking the marjorelle gardens. It is very small and whilst the cactus display are quite impressive they're isn't a whole lot there. We also visited the Berber museum whilst there too also very small. It was 70 Dirham for the gardens and an extra 30 dirham for the museum. Overall worth a visit and quite pretty but can be in and out in under an hour.
Small but perfectly formed. . A tranquil oasis to escape from the heat and bustle of the city. The Berber museum inside the garden is a small extra fee but very well worth it.
Beautiful garden. The garden is so beautifully designed and crafted, just like his author, it's just amazing and impressive. i recommend this place to everybody visiting Marrakech. It's a must.

Only worthwhile attraction. From the four or five attractions we went to, this is the only one fully worth your time. The garden is exceptional, the Berber Museum is FULL of priceless jewellery and clothing from the various tribes, and the gift shop is the best place to acquire Moroccan items that you won't throw out upon returning home. The place was originally created by the painter Marjorelle, then restored by Yves Saint Laurent. There is a small gallery of his yearly LOVE artwork. Be sure to go early enough to also sit in the café with the well dressed people. Amazing walled garden to sit and admire. As we left the garden gates I noticed the only Bentley in all of Morocco (just a guess). A beautiful day out.
More hype than worth it. Nice small garden but not worth it 70 mad, could be nice place for a date. Secret plus - Near by is hidden liquor store.

Yves St Laurent Memorial in the Jardin Majorelle. We were in Marrakech for a short visit, but someone recommended a stop at the Jardin Majorelle. We were very glad we made the stop. Beautiful bamboo and cactuses throughout and so much beautiful Moroccan blue. Yves St. Laurent's memorial is within the garden which made it even more special. It's a small garden, but worth the visit.

Most beautiful gardens. Oasis in the desert is how I would describe the Majorelle gardens. On a hot day in Marrakesh this is a welcome respite.and is full of colour and tranquillity away from the mad traffic. The cafe serves good food and the shop has interesting items for sale. There is also a Berber museum to browse through. Do not miss this wonderful place

Beautiful garfen. We visited this place on our first day in Marrakech. We walked here from the medina and it was easy to find. The garden is so beautiful and you feel like you are walking around a mini paradise as it is so relaxing and tranquil compared to the rest if the city!
impressed. Tranquil and relaxing, a good way to spend a couple of hours. The shop is a bit pricey but worth a look

Beautiful relaxing oasis away from the hustle. A lovely calming place to relax away from the crowds and heat of the main square and souks. I would highly recommend taking a nice slow walk around and taking it all in. The shop is nice to pop into but very pricey, we didn't visit the museum but the gallery of love was fantastic too.
A must-see place in Marrakech. Beautiful gardens with a small museum of Berber culture which is also a must-see if you want to learn more about it.
Jardin Majorelle visit. Beautiful and peaceful, well worth a visit. And a lovely café at the end. Not very expensive to get in either.

Fairly charming but sadly overpriced. Read reviews that said this was well worth a visit but it is a good 45 minute walk from the main square in the Medina or a taxi ride away; and for that you expect something pretty wow. It is not wow - it's just 'nice'. £10 entry (which includes museum) is expensive. We went as a family of 4 and consider £40 entry very steep for a 20 to 30 minute stroll round a cactus garden with a tiny museum and very expensive souvenir shop to finish. Tea-room/restaurant prices also cater for captive audience so we didn't bother. 2015 lonely planet guide states cost is £7 so at £10 each, prices have been disappointingly hiked up.
beautiful, small garden. Somehow I was imagining a much larger place. Its a small charming garden, gift shop, museum and cafe. Doesn't take long to visit, and is the most expensive ticket in town.

well worth a visit. Small but very interesting - more of an aboretum than a garden as such, but well worth a visit, the cover provided by the trees and huge bamboo offered a cool shady micro-climate to browse through - was quite busy when we visited (approx 2pm) evidently is quieter in the mornings, take a camera!
You need to see it. Something you need to see because you are there. We finished it pretty quick! But enjoyed it. Lovely colours and has a lovely gift shop as well!
Lovely calm place. A lovely peaceful oasis. No sounds from Marrakech can be heard whilst in these lovely gardens. Cacti from all around the world, nice cafe,museum,gift shop.
Outstanding. Come early at 8 am to beat the crowds and enjoy this fabulous garden. Have breakfast diagonally opposite in a very nice cafe. Superb - really superb - Berber museum in the garden, too.
A Must See. A visit costs approx. 7€ but it's worth and the money is well invested because it is a non- profit organization/ foundation. Quite busy place but really nice
World class public garden. Great design, use of color, meticulously maintained. Mostly bamboo, cactus, other non-natives. Pictures can't do it justice. A gardener's and plant lovers paradise.

A room with a view. My husband and I visited here on a half day tour of Marrakech . Although not extensive the garden is made up of little areas which makes it easy to find tranquil spots to sit and enjoy the lush , colourful and stylish gardens. There is a lovely bookshop and museum too. If you appreciate nature, design and serenity then you will easily spend a couple of hours here.
Definitely a must see. Beautiful gardens, nice to exploreWe visited in September with a group of friends. The garden is amazing and our tour guide was very nice.

OMG - even my daughters liked this!. A little bit of paradise in the middle of the city. Enjoy the shaded gardens of this exquisite designer at your leisure. It is worth paying for the museum as it gives a different perspective of the attraction - and welcome air conditioning! Enjoy a meal and drink in the fabulous courtyard cafe/restaurant. A real jewel in the crown of Morrocco

Beautiful haven. The gardens are an absolute delight to visit and a welcome break from the madness of the Medina in Marrakech. We walked around for a couple of hours just admiring the beautiful colors and scenery and drinking peppermint tea. The museum was closed when we were there unfortunately, would have really liked to see it. Thoroughly enjoyable experience!

Nice . I was a bit disappointed I was expecting huge garden with lots of different flowers But it is nice to visit it was good for what they charge in the entry But I was expecting more The staff is really friendly

The cactus collection is worth the visit. Other than the cactus garden area, it does not look like a "garden." But the cactus collection is unique and well done. There are some interesting features, like the covered bridge and the lily pond with frogs. But, otherwise, it was a bit disappointing. Perhaps I am not enough of an Yves Saint Laurent fan to appreciate the expensive boutique in the garden? Anyway, I am not sure it was worth the price of admission.

Pretty gardens but pricey. Yeah we went as was on the to do list...but enjoyed other free botanical gardens much more. Its lovely but full of tourists and at 70MAD pp it was expensive for what it was.

Lovely to walk round and don't skip the museum!. Have visited the gardens before but this time there was water in some of the larger pools we hadn't seen before and there's an Yves St Laurent museum under construction nearby. Nice calm and cool environment to stroll around, good quality gift shop although pricey, and the jewellery and costumes in the Berber museum are amazing.

Quiet Paradise in Marrakesh. Totally relaxing inside, with
nice bookstore, cafe and museum.
The original!
There are some souvenir shops in the same street with extraordinary stuff.
That area is worth to spend a couple of hours.

Beautiful and Unique. These gardens were awesome. The array of desert plant life alone was worth the trip. The price is a little high and you can expect a crowd, but overall if you enjoy a good garden walk it's worth it.

Amazing place! 😊. If you are in Marrakesh, you should definitely visit this place! I had an amazing time here. I washed my eyes with the beautiful and charming views in the garden. You can see all the art put in the garden landscapes. Enchanted and powerful colors mixed for your eyes and heart to admire the beauty in it.
Garden oasis . Surprise in the city, beautiful gardens, cheap and shady in the heat. YsL was the reason this is here, soke homage you his art in the shop section

A lovely garden full of surprises. Jardin Marjorelle was beautifully presented and full of surprises. This is a great place for artistic photos, with its unusual plants and vibrant colours. A cool haven on a hot day.
Awesome. Really pretty! Nice to walk ! A lot of cactus and a cute cafe place inside. Really worth the visit if you like plants and walk

Nothing special. It's a nice and quite place but nothing special.
At least the fees for the entrance are going to non profit organization.

Bamboo and Cactus. The visit to the garden was part of an all day Marrakech City tour and unless you have great pleasure in seeing tall bamboo trees and many varieties of cactus is not really worth the visit, although it is a quiet oasis in a very busy city. I also felt that the entrance price of 70dhm (£6.50) was excessive

Jardin Majorelle. An beautiful little place. Very busy. nice little cafe on site where you can eat at sunny tables or indoors our of the fierce heat. The Berber Museum has amazing things in it - clothing and jewellery from high in the mountains. Don't miss that part.

Beautiful Garden. This was a beautiful garden though quite small, but definitely a must visit as it was welcome relief from the Medinas. One can easily enjoy the garden , museum and the cafe and spend 2 to 3 hours. However the only down side was the insane number of young tourists doing really lengthy photoshoots with all the possible poses. Hilarious yet avoidable I would say.

it's really worth it. well I can't describe how cheerful the colors of the plants inside it , I went there twice in two consecutive days ,and i enjoyed it each time , highly recommended from the noon time till its closing time ( 6 pm i guess ) don't go for the barber museum , it doesn't worth to waste time in a closed area and better to enjoy the different types of plants
Exquisite Garden Oasis. Well worth the admission cost, this is a place to take many many photos! The Berber costume museum (costs extra) inside the gardens is also well worthwhile.

Nice cafe but watch out for the birds. We had very limited time to see the garden and get lunch before leaving for the airport.The friendly waiters found us a shady seat in the cafe very quickly despite it being busy. One salad was delicious (the selection of Moroccan salads), the other rate tasteless. Beware the birds in the trees above the courtyard as having bird poo landing on you during lunch is not very pleasant. The gardens themselves were beautiful though you can't photograph some of the views you may have seen as the gardens seem to be slightly overgrown compared to photos I had seen.

Beautiful . Well worth a visit, this place is extraordinary. Beautifully maintained and as YSL as you can imagine! Don't miss it if you have the time - you should allow at least an hour and a half to see the garden and the museum

Lovely place to get away from the heat!. Lovely (although small) garden, upon entering the garden I was able to notice the difference in temperature (it was much cooler inside and very pleasant) The place is full with tourists, however not so much that I wasn't able to take a picture without other people being in the area. The museum was quite nice and educational too
Most enjoyable visit. Great visit, but be cautious of the slightly rip-off taxi rank outside.Nice cafe/restaurant cafe for end of tour.

Flop for me . I guess this features high on TripAdvisor and that's the reason I chose it ..though none of the locals were guiding me for it ..I just referred to TripAdvisor and upon seeing it as topspot..I had to give it a dash..So we are Indians ..read ( economically poor Indians lolol) ..taking a cab to go all the way and spending more than what we wanted to ..approx 40 dirhams each way ..considering other attractions meant for visitors were pegged at 10 /20 dirhams .This place felt suddenly expensive ..70 dirhams for the garden and a further 5p dirhams if u wanted to check the msuiem.attached .We opted for the gardens as had had enough of museums .Now don't get me wrong .it was pretty and we'll kept and all that ..but heylooo! It looked more like an indoor botanical garden with bonsai trees and pretty alleys and several parisiennes.It looked more like it has been marketed and planned for visits from rich Europeans who can wow wow again and again..No offense ..but it didn't work for us .I rather spend time ambling in the streets of medina and cafes and soaking it all in..Felt really irritated coming here and then whiling time a wee more coz ur supposed to..after all, we spent 70 dirhams each to admire bonsai and click pics...aah;those mandatory pics..Just see the photos and be content ..I wouldn't exhort this place unless u a lover of botany...Just saying.....

A must see in Marrakech. Lovely garden even in the rain! We got caught in a thunderstorm at the jardin. We sought cover in a gazebo area until it passed. Beautiful colors and plantings. Great Berber museum and gift shop. All unexpected in Marrakech.

Peaceful alternative and a heaven for photo hobbyists. A bit of tranquility away from the craziness of the old town. I would recommend going earlier in the morning if you want to avoid the influx of tourist buses later in the day. If you are a photo enthusiast, you will be able to grab some really good nature shots with great light and shadow compositions, mixed with a strong theme of blue throughout.It is small and you can cover the garden and the Berber museum within an hour. it is pleasant to hear the constant chirping of birds although the price they charge relative to everything else in Morocco a little bit on the pricier end. 100 dirhams (€10) per person for access to the garden and the museum with another 100 dirhams in the beautiful café for two simple drinks.
Enjoyable morning in a a serene place. Well worth a visit.but get there early as does get busy.cafe slightly on the expensive side and gift shops are expensive but goods are lovely
So beautiful and tranquil!. One of the highlights of our visit to Marrakech. Highly recommend these gardens, they are so beautiful and tranquil and testament to YSL style!

Elegant, beautiful and well worth a visit to Berber Museum inside. This attraction should be on your MUST DO list but make sure get there early as otherwise, you will be battling with whole crowd from Europe! The garden is small but elegant and beautiful, it will take your 30 mins to walk around, 70dhm ticket, and Berber museum inside is the most enjoyable, 30DHM ticket, please do go to visit as they have amazing display and you will be marvelling the stunning jewels of Berber women wearing and old photos of berber people is really good.
Part of a Tour. Well worth a visit. A place of calm in busy Marrakech. A little green oasis. Restful, despite many visitors.

Over rated tourist trap. Few acres of over-grown garden, over crowded with tourists. If you like cacti and other desert plants it may be of some interest to you. It is nothing to write home about - even not worth the pictures due to people being every where.
lots of cactii. amazing small space, loads of plants and really quiet. eating expensive. interesting to see but beware it will only take you 45 minutes to cover the whole lot as it isn't very big.

Peaceful, busy, lovely.. Stunning gardens. Despite being busy, still able to find peace. Sometimes you need to wait a while for people to move for photos, but no real bother! Take your time and enjoy!
Chill time. If you get to Marrakesh and after the whole beautiful chaos of the city, you should really relax for some houers in the beautiful Majorelle gardens!

Lovely and peaceful . Quiet and interesting gardens with a good but of history that's well explained. Not bad value for money, berber museum also really well set out. Restaurant looked nice but expensive. Is a really nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the City.

Exceptionally beautiful and well maintained tropical garden. This is a stunning place to visit, a private garden constructed in memory of Yves st Laurent. It is a cool place, with flowing water, dust-free pathways through stands of trees and exotic plants of the types adapted to a dry environment. It made me think of a tidier version of a Monet garden. There is an adjacent Berber museum. Everybody is sure to like it.
A place of peace and relaxation. Beautiful tranquil gardens easy to spend hours there.The Berber Exhibition is also excellent while having a Tea in the cafe surrounded by trees is relaxing
unique. a real wonder garden. Amazing plants from all over the world surround a breathtaking the art nouveau house of Yves Saint Laurent
beautiful!. Lovely gardens, spaces and colours! Crowded when we were there, but it was mid-day, so we would suggest early visits at busy times.

Always interesting . It was Sunday evening so the whole place was bustling with a melting pot of different sounds, smells and people. Every time I come to this square I imagine what it would have been like a 1000 years ago. Perhaps not so different?Great place to walk around so different to what we are used to.

Beautiful and colourful place!. Beautiful and colourful place to visit! The garden is not so big but it is something to look at! Any time of the day you can visit it as there are a very high trees hiding you from the Moroccan sun:))
Wonderfull Gardens. Very nice gardens. It is a visit that you can do in a short period of time, so you can add it to other visits in Marrakech.

Special plants, a lot of green, a must visit. Beautiful gardens, special, special plants and trees, lots of green, pleasant walking trail, fun and nice to walk around these gardens, a recommended visit

Jardin Majorelle. The Jardin Majorelle is quite hyped by the people, hoteliers and tourist industry of Marrakech. It is not without its charms, and is worth a visit, though will only last an hour or so. There are many cactus and a few very pretty canopies and walkthroughs. It is a bit samey after a while, but still worth a visit. If you have been to any of the botanical gardens of Cape Town, Kew or Sydney this is not like those. Worthwhile, but not on the same scale

Oasis in a storm. Visited these gardens early in day as in 10 am, so was not too crowded. They have some really impressive trees and a variety of cactus and agave style plants and a couple of fish ponds and we did enjoy walking around it but felt that at around £9 including a fairly dull museum visit that it was about four pounds too much. Also stopped by café for cup of tea which cost 40 Dirhams(about £3.80) each which is London style prices plus food was very expensive.Top tip don't bother with museum.
Beautiful Gardens. Lovely gardens in the new town which was in total contrast to the Medina. Worth the visit and a lovely café.
Amazing!!. So much more beautiful than I expected. Get there early to avoid the crowds. Take a camera! You will want pictures.
Beautiful relaxing gardens. Well worth a visit.. It was the most calming atmosphere you can experience, with the birds singing and the natural beauty surrounding you a worthwhile experience.
Lovely spot. No hessitation - just go - and do not miss out the small but lovely Berber Museum inside the Garden.

Gorgeous. An oasis in a very busy city. Beautiful lush growth, a must see,a lovely place to take small children, interesting plants, gorgeous colour,we even spied some wee frogs in the lily ponds. Gift shop,cafe and clean toilets

Stunning. . This was an absolutely beautiful day trip outside of the medina walls.
The colours and atmosphere were so calming and was the perfect place for photoraphs.
Great restaurant within the garden full of ambience.
I'd suggest to get there really early as it can get very busy.
Zen. A beautiful pearl in the middle of a hectic but special city, the beauty of the garden leaves a moment of zen, the restaurant also is recommended.
Beautiful serene garden. well worth a visit, eclectic plants and buildings , a loverly peaceful and cool garden that Yves St Laurent planned.
Yes saint laurent garden. . Ask your manager riad to arrange a taxi for you to discover the great majorelle garden just 10 minutes driving.
Beautiful garden. A lovely respite on a hot day, with tranquility of a few gardens including bamboo, rosemary, Bougainvilleas, lemon and lime trees and little birds singing
This Garden is so beautiful. The multitude of green forms in this garden are prolific. It was designed with restraint. So very clever. the result is overwhelming.

Lovely alternative to the chaos of the Medina. Beautiful garden in the newer part of Marrakech that's worth the taxi drive. Plantings of desert plants from around the world. Very nice book & gift store.
Beautiful. Not cheap for morocco standards...around 10€ to visit the gardens and the museum, but totally worth it...especially the gardens.
Nice to visit especially for the cool shade on a hot day. A nice reprieve from the bustle of the souks. The cactus and bamboo are quite something. Berber museum is interesting.
Amazing. It is 70durhams to go in, but definitely worth it. Colourfull, amazing nature and architecture. Can be seen in about 45mins. Didn't enter on the museum, it has to be paid separately.
Small, pretty and nice if you want to kill some time. With entry price of €7 per person I didn't think it was worth the money and the effort to visit this tourist spot.
just amazing. everything in this garden owesome, it's a gem hidden in the middel of Marrakech city. from the plantes to the new musem inside the gardens, the price is reasonble

Pleasant oasis. We wanted a different break. Got there at lunchtime. The cafe is well planned and designed. Good service and tasty Moroccan food. No alcohol served but yummy juices. The garden itself is small but had an amazing collection of cacti. Well worth a visit if you get tired of the souks and hawkers
Gorgeous!. Wonderful tranquil gardens full of cacti collected mainly from South America. Well worth a couple of hours' meandering.

Just so stylish. Great place to visit in Marrakech. A nice calm place to wander around, especially if you wish to get away from the hustle and bustle of the markets. Lovely palms and cacti look stunning against the stark blue of the museum. Do pay the extra to go into the Berber museum as it's really interesting and well presented. Nice cafe too!

Beautiful but is it worth it?. For a price of 70 dirhams, I believe the place may not be worth it for some people. There is also an inhouse museum which cost 30 dirhams. If you like nature and appreciate great aesthetics, I believe you will find that it is more than worth it. However, if you're not one then maybe it will be a waste of money for you.
Fancy garden in the middle of the city. We had spent 3 hours in this garden. I actually expected it to be bigger. It was quite busy at the time we were there. Also, I think it's a bit overpriced.
A gorgeous "cactus garden". The garden was a great spot to visit to get a feel for the "French" influence in Morocco. Gorgeous layout - alas the Yves St. Laurent Pavillon was closed for renovations.

refreshing place in crazy Marrakech. This is a lovely garden in the city of Marrakech. There is a gift shop ( a bit pricey) but with quality items and it was refreshing to stop the noise of the busy city and enjoy the garden.

Nice garden. This is a nice garden, where you can relax from the Medina caos. The cost is 70 dirham for each person, which I believe it is too much. However, they are beautiful and very well maintain.
Amazing Not to be missed. Truly a highlight of visiting Marrakech, the colors, flora and landscaping are amazing. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Marrakech

Lovel oasis in the centre of the new city. Beautiful gardens, although not extensive, just 5 minutes from the medina walls. Small museum of Berber history and lovely cafe. In 2017 an Yves Saint Laurent is due to open there.

Great place to escape to. A bit on the expensive side to get in, and smaller than we imagined, but a wonderful space nonetheless. Very soothing, with plenty of plants to admire and wonder at if that's your thing.

Holiday. A truly brilliant visit beautiful garden dedicated to yves st larent the colours are magnificent the plants and pools are a must to see there is enough to do to spend a day there food good but expensive
Nice gardens for a wander. Very nice and pleasant for a walk and wander. Was much smaller than we thought, but still nice for a pleasant walk and a bit of time out from the madness!

if you like gardens then a place to visit. Bit away from the centre, but horse carriages serve it well to and back. Not very big, but many varieties of cactus and trees and bushes if you are interested in horticulture. If you are not then it's a shady pleasing place to visit, but there are probably other places that cost less to go to for shade.

Lovely gardens. Visited the gardens only with my husband - very pretty; bamboo was gorgeous! Make sure you follow the signs from the main road to find the entrance - it's NOT the gate that you see on the road!

Obligatory stop on the standard garden tour. As a garden/plant fan, I was disappointed. As a nice place to spend 30 minutes, it is a cool respite in the busy city. The Berber museum is interesting and worthwhile more than the garden itself.

Nice chilled out garden. I agree with other reviewers that this is a nice garden but it is why too hyped up. It is the nicest garden you will find in Marrakesh and is a nice place for some peace and quite from the dusty and noisy medina. Great pictures to take if you are a photographer.
Peaceful respite from the city. Whilst not big it is pleasant and restful, avoid the coaches and go around lunch time or early morning.
Peaceful.. We thought it would be 15 minutes it looked small, after 3 hours we were still there, pay the extra for the Museum it is a truly wonderful collection.

Fantastic Garden - Tranquillity in the City. A wonderful place to visit - well maintained - spectacular plantings - helpful staff - The Berber Museum is very well set out with wonderful exhibits - The Cafe is special - the Tarte au Citron - sublime :)

Beautiful. Be sure to go very early or late to avoid crowds.I really enjoyed seeing the garden but did find the crowds a little obstructive as it is a photographers dream.It isnt very large so an hour is plenty of ime to spend there.

Stunning blue. Worth the entrance of D70. Beautiful gardens with nice ponds. Tranquil and inspiring atmosphere and a good break from the hectic Medina. Stunning blue wall offset green plants beautifully.
amazing. very fresh romantic , we took a lot of pics and we did like it a lot we did also the musume it's just an amazing experience nothing to say

Well worth a visit. I would really recommend a visit here, the gardens are beautifully kept also the fact all proceeds are kept to maintain the gardens and to support local children is also worthy of a visit in my opinion. The berber museum is also really interesting and worth paying the extra 30 dirham to learn how the tradition berber people live and its history.
Pretty but over-crowded. Nice enough but nothing to write home about. Parts of this garden are lovely but it's not one for a long visit and gets very busy so hardly tranquil. Been to better.

Dreamy garden . With all of the ceos of Marrakech you'll never imagine that a such garden exists !It's a garden+ Barbar museum + YSL mémoriel + café 10€ the ticket, you can do a lot of beautiful pics, didn't download theme yet on my devise Worth a visit

Pretty gardens in the bustle of Marrakesh. Jardin Majorelle is just outside the Medina to the north. The gardens are small but pretty - reminiscent of Monet's garden at Governy with a lot of blue.Small café serving typical Morrocan fayre.Not cheap but worth a visit.
Wonderful oasis. Go early before the crowds. The cafe was expensive but worth it. Pay the extra for the Barbara museum

No wonder YSL were so inspired!. If there is only one attraction in Marrakesh that you have to see, let it be Jardin Majorelle. It is the most unusual of gardens, and its colors, plants and architecture will remain in your mind forever.It is crowded, though, so try to go early in the morning or late in the afternoon. While a lot of Marrakesh attractions are cool, in my view they were not the best in Morocco. On the other hand, this garden is!
Family holiday . Beautiful garden well worth seeing but could have been priced less other than that worth a visit with family

Wonderful. This place was on my list to visit whilst in Marrakesh and it was well worth the visit! It cost 200,00 dh for the gardenna and Berber Museum. The plants are amazing, so many different types! It was so peaceful and serene sat in the garden, like you were transported to another world. I'm so glad i visited. There is a cafe also, it was wonderful to bask in the sunshine having coffee. The cafe is expensive, we had a lemonade & coffee 80.00 dh = £8.00. The berber museum was interesting, lots of artifacts and costumes to marvel at, the downside was all the information on the walls and cabinets was in French.Allow a couple of hours to meander round this beautiful place. Taxi for the main square was 400 dh= £4:00.
Day trip. Worth a visit but nothing special really. The house is beautiful but you cannot see inside the house and no pics of the inside either. Like most gardens in Morocco it has nice cacti etc.

Lovely garden. A lovely garden with many differenti kinds of trees and plants that impressed me for its serenity in the middle of a lot of chaos of Marrakesch. Yves San Laurent contributed to have this garden restored and well maintained all the time. Even the small Berber museum is lovely to see.

What an amazing garden in the middle of the city.. Honestly this is the best garden u can see in Morcco.It is amazing with this blue house and the decoration that make u crazy in a good mode... wow the cactus are amazing and the variety of plants....please let me know what do u think after the visit cause me i go every year and i am never tired of it.Just take your time if u want to visit cause to enter there are a lot of people also so is important that u go early so u don't have to stand 1 hour as me last time

Why Not?. Jardin Majorelle is where Yves St. Laurant is buried. He was an Algerian and died in 2008. Both he and his partner bought and rescued this place from being plowed under for a hotel project.It isn't a great big garden, it's in a Marrakech neighborhood, after all. It does display a lot of different desert flora from all over the world. The walkways and garden pools are tranquil and feature Majorelle Blue, which is supposed to be a special shade of blue concocted by St. Laurant's partner.It does house The Berber Museum which is a must see to get a sense of Proto Mediterranean history shoulder to shoulder with the Ancient Greeks, Phoenicians, and Egyptians. The Berbers still live in the mountains and speak their ancient tongue among themselves but can't write it. Who knew?Spend a few hours at both the Gardens and the Museum. Cost for both per person is $10 and there is a bookstore, boutique, and cafe too. Very nice.
Overpriced and small!. Beautiful place but for the price (70DH) we expected something bigger. It took us 20 minutes to walk and take pictures so we were a little disappointed.
Worth the visit. We visited the Jardin Majorelle during our few days in Marrakech and it was certainly worth it. The gardens are lovely to walk around as too the house with wonderful vibrant colours.

Tres chic. I give three stars because of the massive amount of shuffling tourists who make it difficult to breathe in the romance and sublime beauty of this place. A wonderful thing to do very early in the morning. The berbere costume / jewelry exhibit is brilliant and worth a visit. I will go back here for sure. Make sure you say a prayer at the Yves Saint Laurent memorial and throw a coin in one of the pools. Beautiful.

The gardens and museum are a must see in Marakech!. The YSL museum opens in 2017! But for now the Burber museum and gardens are stunningly beautiful and well kept. Plus the entire reason for the garden was to support locals. Well done!
It's fine... It's worth a visit if you have nothing else to do, around £6 entry, some nice plants etc but... that's about it.

Bit of heaven. A beautiful garden definitely worth visiting. Many varieties of plants to see.It has an interesting history too. The cafe there is lovely&has a really nice breakfast menu that is reasonably priced.We had tea there as we had already eaten our breakfast.If you go in the morning have your breakfast there as they have a nice variety of eggs&teas.Entrance fee really reasonable-about 70 dhs(£5).
nice. Nice colours. Kinda good price. Tumblr estetic and a great shop. I took some realy good photos here hehe

Nice cool afternoon. I visited the gardens in the late afternoon. The setting was much cooler than on the outside of the garden. The garden was very nicely landscaped. My only complaint would be that the need more information about the plants in the garden.
Amazing!. Definitely a highlight in Marrakech... a must! A beautiful colorful place, where Yves Saint Laurent spent a lot of time working.
Yves Saint Laurent hand on it. this park beautifly designed the colors reflecting his designed you have to visít if you have chance good place to relax little bit

Worth a short visit. We visited here on our last day to fill the time before we had to head to the airport. The gardens are well kept and presented but they only take a maximum of about 45 minutes to get around. Thought it was quite pricey for what it was and am quite surprised it is number 2 on the list of things to do in Marrakech! Worth a short visit if you have time but you won't miss much if you don't.
Good garden for selfie-lovers. No big deal, a nice house with nice design, plants from all over the world and lots of tourists. A big Hi to the Italian tourists crossing in front of the queue

Beautiful!. Well worth visiting on your trip to Marrakech, absolutely beautiful colours and so many beautiful cacti and greenery! A lovely peaceful experience away from the madness of Marrakech! I recommend walking back to the city centre through Gueliz and experiencing the newer modern part of the city.
A must see!. Wonderful gardens, a must see! Amazing range of cacti in particular, and the Berber museum is very interesting.
beautiful garden. When you're in Marrakech, this is a must go. Other than being a beautiful garden, of particular note is monument dedicated to Yves Saint Laurent in it.

Let your mind unwind in the gardens.. We had just finished an eight day tour of Morocco and had changed our minds regarding travelling for a ninth day and decided to spend a couple of days in Marrakech. Having seen a couple of reviews in tripadvisor and seeing it was within walking distance of our hotel, we walked up to explore. It's not immediately obvious as to it's location. You notice a few horse drawn wagons and petit taxis on the side of the main road and the entrance is down the side-road Rue Yves Saint Laurent. Just look for the ticket booth or the lineup. There isn't much signage, but the locals recognize the confused look of a tourist and are happy to point it out.  We skipped the additional cost of the museum, opting for just the gardens. What a wonderful place. As soon as you step through the gates, you feel your stress float away. You can no longer hear the street on the other side of the wall, the air smells cleaner and you may notice the birds singing. The plants are incredible. I never would have believed I would find such beauty inside a garden of cactus. The palm trees and bamboo provide shading for the walkways and it felt 10 degrees cooler inside the garden. The colours they have chosen for the fountains, planters and benches provide a startling contrast and serve to highlight the plants. It seemed busy, but it never felt crowded. We did have to wait for three other groups of tourists to take their photos before we could take ours in front of the house, but everybody helped each other with photos.  We wandered around for about 1.5 -2 hours and felt much more relaxed for the experience.

Overrated . It is rated as a must see attraction in Marrakech. However it is 12 or so hectare area that takes about 15-20 minutes to go around. And yes there are a few exotic plants and some water pools but nothing that a normal city park in Europe won't have. The blue colors and the contrast is nice but do I want to pay a ticket to see a house painted blue...not really!

Went because you have to. We came here because it was a must see on many websites. In all honesty I think it's overpriced and you can't even go into the house. There is a museum inside but you have to pay an additional 30DR to go into that when you have already paid 70DR.If I was to return to Marrakech I would not re-visit this place. Spare yourself the 70+DRs and have some nice food instead or treat yourself to something in the market

Avoid busy periods. A beautiful garden in Marrakech which is a must visit if you have the time. It's great for taking photos but I recommend to visit very early or just before it closes so it isn't scorching hot and not too busy.
Pleasant morning!. This garden is small and lovely. It is a tribute Yves St. Laurent and the museum is wonderful. the shop there is a great place to pick up something for yourself.

The overpriced cafe detracts from enjoyment. Small and fairly pretty gardens, a little shade which is relief from the sun. Still stung by the cost of the cafe, 3 drinks and an ice cream cost as much entry for two people.
Oasis in busy Marrakech. Was keen to visit these gardens due to the YSL connection. Beautifully laid out and well cared for. However was a little disappointed in the variety of flora. Mainly cacti.

A Tranquil Interlude in busy Marrakech. A garden of cacti, bamboo and similar plants organized in a tranquil setting explored through winding paths and fountains that is worth a visit. Located near the Berber museum, which also should be experienced for the same entrance fee makes it a interesting and worthwhile stop. A great place to sit at the café within the garden and enjoy a coffee or mint tea. Recommend a morning or late afternoon visit to avoid the heat.
Good for a short visit. Nice gardens, long queue to get in. Only takes 30 minutes to wander around. We didn't do the museum. It's nicely shaded so good to get out the sun.

BEAUTIFUL!. We visited here whilst on holiday in Marrakech. It's a beautiful,calming & serene place, just outside the Medina, in the modern part of Marrakech.We walked from the Jemaa el Fnaa to the Majorelle Gradens & it wasn't too gruelling, about half an hour at a steady amble!! Alternatively, taxi's are readily available.It costs about £8 per person to get in, and it's well worth it.Once inside, you're overwhelmed by how quiet it is & the huge variety of different cacti. You don't have to be a gardener to appreciate the gardens, there's also a museum of Berber history that's absolutely fascinating.All in all, this is an ideal way to while away an hour or two in some beautiful surroundings, away from the hustle & bustle of the Medina.
Paradise in Marrakech . It is a beautiful place ...very fresh! Totally worth the price. The museum is interesting. They should have one price for everything!

Smaller than you imagine it's going to be but still worth it.. Very chic gardens of a restored artist's house, has what has to be one of the most stylish gift shops (expensive too). Great cafe on-site. Jardin Majorelle definitely worth visiting.

Beautiful garden but 70 dirham entrance fee is a bit steep. Impressive garden to visit but not a must to see. Some interesting cacti and landscaping. the boutique inside had some pretty nice albeit expansive clothes and gift items.
Beautiful. a lovely place to spend and afternoon, in the shade, The Cafe is good too. Not easy to find this place but a taxi is recommended
thanks. again the time chosen by Karim for my family to visit the gardens was perfect... the place was enjoyable not many visitors in am
Beautiful gardens in great setting. Well maintained and great setting to spent some hours in peace! Amazing collection of cactusses. Well run place!
good. worth seeing and everyone should visit it. Very nice and wonderful planted trees and plants. I enjoyed there a lot.

Tranquil. Our second visit but the first for 15 years and they have added on a museum and memorial in that time. Difficult to believe that you are in the centre of Marrakech, so relaxing. Gardens are only small and it doesn't take long to take in but well worth a detour

An oasis of calm.. Went with my daughter as she is very keen on YSL. As you walk into the gardens you are surrounded in the peaceful atmosphere after the mad taxi ride from the hotel! A beautiful place, well cared for and clean. Staff were very attentive two offered to take photographs for us, one was a gardener and he got some fantastic photos of the house. The museum was interesting and I would imagine that when the new one opens in 2017 it would be worth another visit.

Nice natural paradise in vibrant city. Spent half a day in october 2016 in the garden. Very peacefull, sometimes a bit crowdy, but the colors are really impressive. The green of the plants, the majorelle blue of the paths and buildings and the water basins are making a great combination. A tip - take your time for a drink in the open cafeteria - very nice and relaxing !

Very overrated. Was quite disappointed with both the service and the quality of the food. We had to seek out the waiters to ask for a table, menus, to order etc... the food was also low quality. I generally would not write a negative review however we were very disappointed all around. On a positive note - the decor is lovely.
Worth to visit. Worth to visit, nice place, too many people at the same time. Prices in coffee bar too high.All in all good.

An oasis in the centre of new Marrakech. This beautiful garden with its variety of foliage and water features with turtles and frogs is a breath of fresh air after the frenzy of the Medina. Don't miss the Berber museum within the grounds - well the extra 30dh entrance fee. Thank you, Yves St Laurent!

Stunning escape - food for the eyes and a feast for the soul. Beautiful, cool, inspiring - truly beautiful and easy to wander for an hour - a lovely escape from mad Marakesh! if you find yourself there around lunch too, exit and turn right, end of road and left and you will find local cafe's with excellent food for half the price to those immediately inside or out!
Leisure traveler . Very clean beautiful garden vibrant colors If you have time visit. This garden. Good for an evening outing before dinner
Could be so much better.. Tired and dry. Needs new work to bring fascinating plants to an ideal horticultural location. Surviving on its attachment to Yves St Laurent.
Beautiful. A must see attraction if you visit Marrakech. Beautiful gardens, interesting collection of Berber artifacts. Worth getting there early to avoid the crowds, it's very popular.

Don't. Miss the Berber museum. The gardens are lovely, something really special. But don't miss the Berber museum, it is very wel curated and has lots of interesting details on Berber culture, costume, crafts, trades and architecture. It made me want to visit more of Morocco.
We spent several hours enjoying the gardens and the museum

Loved the garden and its history. Lovely walled garden with some very nice exotic plants..very cool and relaxing. A wonderful tribute to St. Laurent. I also wanted to see the museum and when we went to buy tickets I found out it was two different prices, pennies for Morrocans and dollars for everyone else. I don.t support that philosophy especially when we are already pouring a lot of tourist dollars into their economy.The garden/museum shop was gorgeous. The prices were very high. I passed items that could have been purchased in any smart boutique.

Beautiful garden, interesting museum. The Jardin Marjorelle is a great place to spend an hour or two. The museum was interesting and informative, and the gardens are beautiful. This is the perfect place to indulge your inner super-model and take a few photos.

Lovely place to relax away from the busy streets and the heat.. This is a lovely little garden in the middle of Marrakech. It is quite small but well worth a visit when if you are in the area. I left this to visit until after a 5 day trek of Mt. Toubkal and the Sahara. Myself and a friend had a free day and although numerous offers of day treks and tours we were not in the humour for more trekking of driving we just wanted to relax after a very busy and amazing 5 day trek. The price was 70 diram (€7) to enter yhe garden and 30 diram (€3) to enter the Berber museum. So that's 100 diram (€10) for both October 2016. I would recommend doing both for definite. After reading reviews on here some were saying the museum only has two rooms and was bot really worth it. No photos allowed in the museum. It has a small entrance lobby, which has a 6 minute movie showing of the history and culture of Berber life and a smaller screen with older black and white footage. Very interesting to see. The two rooms consist of one with the crafts of the Berber people from jewellery to cooking untensils to everyday tools for the different trades they had. Some very detailed work, and what time and skill went into the making of these items. The other room houses an example of all the clothes they wore from bygone times. Some simple to some very detailed. There was also a wall with examples of doors they made for dwellings and they are amazing, I spent awhile just looking at them and examining the work involved in them. One in particular looked like it was a 'work in progress' with lovely detailed art on the top half of the door, carved into the wood with maybe the idea of doing the bottom half at a later stage.

Stunning!. Can't recommend this highly enough. It is totally stunning. Calm and I can imagine very tranquil were it not for all the visitors - it's very popular and rightly so. Very well thought out in terms of the shop and café (shop not cheap btw but good quality). I would love to come back at a less busy time or just before dusk. You must come here if you are visiting Marrakech!
Nice but pricey. Jardin Majorelle is recommended by almost all portals. It is beautiful however I found the entry at 70 MAD per head a bit too expensive.
What a peaceful place. Loved it here and took some great photos. The restaurant is a little pricey so try to have lunch before coming because you can't bring food in.
Perfect lunch. Always worth visiting the gardens if only for lunch and to explore the new style of modern stores around the area.

Beautiful tranquil setting . The gardens are so beautiful. We got here about 3pm when the sun was in good position and the trees provided some most welcome shade. It was quite busy, but not stupidly so. Really lovely place. Definitely go the Berber Museum (you can get entry to that and the gardens for 100drh per person) and YSL's memorial and gallery. So beautiful and well maintained!

Small Garden?. Not really my type of place to go... To me seems like just a small garden with bamboo plants and cactus. However, the Berber museum inside is quite interesting though! Shows more about the berber culture...

Lovely day out. Went 4 a walk whilst in marrakech and noticed signs to the gardens so we wandered there, which took about 30mins from jamaa el Fnaa. Once inside, we relaxed, took r time to get fotos and read all about the history. It's a lovely, hidden escape from the hustle and bustle of the city and there's no rush once inside. Lots of photo opportunities too. If u don't fancy the trek u can get horse +carriage or taxi cheap enough. X

Beautiful gardens. Very nice garden with an elaborate history. Absolutely worth a visit. The line can be a little long, but in my opinion it's worth it. Would probably be nicest to go early in the morning or late in the day, as there are hundreds of nice photo-opportunities throughout the garden, but it can get a little crowded. Don't use the taxis that are parked outside the garden, their prices are horrible. Fetch one from the street instead.
Worth a look. Worth spending an hour or so to wander through the many exotic and bizarre flora collected over the years.

Most colourful garden. You should definitely go to this garden when you're in Marrakech. It's so unique and the blue that is used in the decoration is beautiful. It's an oasis in the city! There are different things to do in this garden. There is an art exhibition, a cafe, a very nice shop and just walking around is so relaxing. It will definitely give you perfect photo's! I would recommend the visit to everyone!

jardin majorelle, a visit for an hour or two.s. A wonderful time at these gardens, worth a visit. We did have a guide as we were two women travelling alone, which we found very useful, and saw a lot more. We organised with our travel agent beforehand. The gardens and history of them is worth it, although outside of Marakesh, need to travel about 20 minutes.

DELIGHTFUL LARGE AND VERY PEACEFUL GARDEN.. The city of Marrakech is so fortunate to have such a beautiful and most interesting garden that has a lot of shade to make the walk in the garden comfortable. The plants and decorations are unusual and very interesting and it is well worth the effort to see the garden. Yves St. Laurent took an existing garden to wonderful new heights in both plant material and color.

Not to miss in Marrakech!. Stunning grounds and a beautiful collection of jewelry, YSL's collection and home is absolutely incredible. We ate at the cafe as well which was really good. The shop also has an amazing selection of books on Yves Saint Laurent and the Moroccan subjects of interest to him. Not to miss, just for the grounds alone its worth it.
Magical. A beautiful, restful garden. The neighborhood is also fun, with high end design, clothing and gift shops. A must-see.

Beautiful peaceful gardens . When we visited these gardens it was a very very hot day in Marrakech however when tu entry into the gardens it was so cool airy with bright beautiful colours you didn't feel like you were in the city anymore. The colours and the lay out are lovely and the museum of Berber culture was also very good well worth a visit if you are in Marrakech

Nice garden, but nothing special . The garden is a nice place to visit. It will take you only a few minutes from the square to get there by cab. There is a nice fountain and a lovely house (apparently) designed by Yves Saint Laurent.But it's not really big and nothing special. It takes only 15-20 minutes to see everything. It's not a must see, but a good opportunity to get away from the rush of Marrakech.

Good for a stroll. We went here one early afternoon. The shaded areas were a nice break from the heat. This garden is beautiful and we'll maintained, and the homage to Yves St Laurent is a nice touch. If I had more time in Marrakesh I would have liked to bring a book and stay a while. The attached Love gallery and Berber Museum are nice as well.

Beautiful in every way. I love this garden it is true love beautiful! The colours of the stone and structures are magical and a real contrast against the dense forest Green trees that are everywhere. There are beautiful tropical flowers and birds that are singing away all day long. Cute little cafe to stop and grab a drink, however I would recommend to take your own water as being a captive audience here you will have to pay the price. There are ponds and pools full of little noises frogs and fishes and sometimes you might even glimpse a little tortoise. Beautiful lesuire walk, and a welcome rest from the baking African sun

An oasis of calm in a hectic city. This is a must if you visit Marrakesh. We arrived early and were able to walk around all areas, including the museum, without feeling crowded. When we left at late morning, it was much busier and there was a queue for most areas.

Nice garden but nothing special. Visited here in june 2015. Garden was nice but nothing special in comparison with other bothanical gardens. Guess it's more interesting if you'r a fan of design. Cool house tho and a quiet place away from the city noise.
A true oasis. A morning visit to this delightful garden was a true change of pace from the rest of our busy schedule. The garden is beautiful, serene and peaceful.

Fabulous. Outstandingly beautiful, photographers dream location. The plants, buildings, colours, smells, ambiance...all awesomely inspiring.Totally in love with this jewel of a place.7€ entry, well worth it

Fabulous colours, climate and amazing planting!. If for no other reason, go here for the quiet and tranquility to get our of the heat.
But a better reason would be the wonderful planting, colours and ambience.
Recommended!

Brilliant - but not worth the price!. Had a great morning at the jardin with my partner, however, we both felt that upon comparison with other attractions such as the El Bahi Palis (which is only 10DH) that the 100DH (70DH for the jardin, 30DH for the museum) was rather expensive.
Apart from that it was a lovely day!
Relaxing spot. Nice relaxing gardens which is a nice respite from the frenetic Marrakech. It's not expensive to get in but the gardens are not that large.
Tourist trap!. 100MAD for a mediocre garden and a rubbish, closet sized museum. Nothing special, not worth the journey. Time Better spent at the palaces.
Not as expected. It was a great garden, and the cactus and house were beautiful but i don't think it's worth the money. The most expensive place we've visited and the least we liked

Tranquil, shady oasis - a must see garden.. Arrive early if you can and enjoy the calm atmosphere. The garden is meticulously maintained with bamboo groves, cacti beds and buildings in the famous Majorelle blue. The small shop is a treasure trove of high quality items and there is also a cafe and a Berber museum.
Beautiful. Great garden, peaceful and quiet with a great atmosphere and interesting plants.really exotic and we'll worth the visit.
Garden. Lovely garden with a relaxing atmosphere and a restaurant with good food. The best garden I have been to.

Beautiful!. Stunning place, make sure you visit. Well worth the money.
Like a little hidden oasis in the middle of a busy, bustling, world outside.
Heaven . This is an amazing garden, a haven from the rustle and bustle of the city. The colours of the buildings and pathways are vibrant and stunning.
Jardine garden . Nice gardens decorated with amazing colours. The garden isn't huge but still enjoyed the landscape. It has a small gift shop, very nice.

Exotic cactus garden. Rebuilt by Yves St Laurent, these are stunningly beautiful gardens that you can wander in at will. Wonderful for gardeners and others as it is a very tranquil place to spend a couple of hours

Afternoon Walk. Nice well maintained gardens including the YSL museum and shops.
One hour is enough time to visit the whole site and for shopping add time as required. We just enjoyed the plants and museums. Shops were a little expensive. Worth visiting.

Beautiful!! . Definitely worth seeing! Really pretty and peaceful! We only bought garden tickets so didn't see the museum. It's quite small so we didn't spend much more than about 20 minutes there. There are taxis right outside and the square is probably only a 20 minute walk from there.

Jardin majorelle Marrakesh , Morocco . Majorelle was the son of the Art Nouveau ébéniste of Nancy, Louis Majorelle. Though Majorelle's gentlemanly orientalist watercolors are largely forgotten today (many are preserved in the villa's collection), the gardens he created are his creative masterpiece. The special shade of bold cobalt blue which he used extensively in the garden and its buildings is named after him, bleu Majorelle—Majorelle Blue.[1][2]
Worth the visit!. Beautiful garden that is an unexpected pleasure in the middle of Marraketch!This is a must see place while visiting Marrakech!
Majorell. Top ten in Marrakesh, amaizing, must see, very, very interesting place, totally deferent than everything in around

An oasis of calm. . This was one of our must do attractions when we visited Marrakech. The garden is small but beautiful and very tranquil. We ate in the cafe which was very nice and the staff were friendly and helpful. The Berber museum was worth the extra charge and was full of beautiful artifacts. Definitely not to be missed.

An Oasis with the city. What an amazing place to find in the middle of Marrakech. As part of a tour we had approximately an hour to have a wander around but it was a real surprise. Lots of interesting plants and plenty of water features.
beautiful gardens. beautiful gardens to visit - get there early and you'll have the place to yourself!!. Very well maintained and great Berber jewelry collection

Nice time. We went there as it was highly recommended to us. It is a calm and nice garden outside the Medina. However it is quite small and the price of 7€ is quite steep compared to other things in Marrakesh. So if you stay for a few days it is nice to see, but it is by no means a Must-See.

Beautiful oasis close to Marrakech city walls. Just North of the old town, a beautiful oasis restored by Yves-Saint-Laurent and Bergé. Multiple water features, gorgeous buildings, stunning ponds all under the wonderful shade of exotic trees. It is fresh and lovely out there as long as you avoid the bus load of tourist with selfie sticks that swarm the garden and block all trails. The boutique carries high quality leather goods with stunning colours and motives.
Lovely Garden. The gardens are a quiet oasis of calm in the madness that is Morocco. A little expensive to get in and we only did the garden but it was a lovely place.
