Lovely Tranquility in a mad place. We visited the gardens as it was nearby the Riad we were staying in just inside the Madina. What a beautiful and tranquil place away from the hustle & bustle of Marrakech. The gardens were lovely. We had lunch in the Cafe that was also very niceWell worth a visit

Beautiful . We stayed just beside the Jardin Majorelle when we arrived in Marrakech. The garden is beautiful but the price is a little steep at 70 dihram each. The cafe was nice but also a little expensive. Definitely worth a visit
Beautifull place,but expensive. Beautifull garden,but expensive (70 dirhams). You can see a lot of cactus,aloe vera,bamboo plants...

Beautiful. This was our second visit to the Jardin Majorell. Absolutely beautiful calming and relaxing.Take a seat and soak in the beauty and tranquility.The colours and textures are a lovely sight to see.The yves Saint Lauren memorial and prints are slso in the garden to be viewed.A very hot day so had drinks in the restaurant which again is cool and very pleasant.A must if you are staying in Marrekech and no doubt we will visit them again next year.

Expecting more. I was really looking forward to going to Jardin Majorelle as I had read many positive reviews but it was not what I expected. The place itself is lovely however it is very small and mainly overcrowded - it is impossible to find a quiet place to enjoy the garden. I am sorry to say that but the photos on the internet look far better than to experience this place yourself.

Great way to spend a couple of hours. It's lovely, but not breath-taking. Go just to see the gardens of Marrakesh and the Berber "museum" is nice although just 3 small rooms of artifacts. The gardens are nice to walk through but unless you truly love gardens, gardening, plants and greenery you will spend 2 hours here, max. That's including the 20-30 minutes you'll spend walking through the museum. However, I had young kids (ages 5 and 10) so their appreciation for the museum was very limited, we just walked the garden pathways and loved some of the animals in the river.
Beautiful cool gardens. These gardens are lovely and a welcome relief from the heat just outside the gates. It is a lovely large oasis close to the heart of Marrakech.

Calm but a bit overpriced . The bamboo groves are lovely and chilled in the sun and the blue house makes for nice photos but unless your a YSL superfan It feels a bit pricey (by General Morocco standards) for what it is.
what a beauty !. not enough words to describe the beauty of this place. make sure to spare some time to sit in the cafe.

The standout is the Berber museum.. The gardens are lovely and even prettier in pictures. But for me, the Berber museum is the standout. We were able to look at the various Berber tribe's clothes, jewelry and other pieces from their lifestyle. Fantastic night sky room showcasing the jewelry. Also, at the end the bookstore has some nice books too.

Stunning!. Unmissable! Beautiful restoration of the gardens, really interesting Berber Museum, small jewel of Marrakesh. Only downside are other people, no one seems interested in absorbing this beautiful garden, it's pose pose for photos, selfies,videos. So can be quite difficult to see the gardens properly. Would recommend to go early, to avoid the throngs
Poor garden. This garden it's expensive for low value, very small and without any particular interest. Nevertheless it's a colorful and a clean place.
Busy but beautiful and iconic. It is like stepping out of Africa but visit early to enjoy it at its best. The buildings are as important as the garden and the monument to Yves is poiniant.
Nice oasis in a busy city. Take your time to absorb the scenery and learn about the history of this place. It's worth your time.
Spectacular!. Yves St. Laurent's gift to Marrakech is not to be missed! The garden is magical...could have spent hours here.

Relaxing Hour. Spent an hour walking around these gardens. They were lovely gardens and worth a trip, although couldn't spend more than an hour here really. It was full of fellow tourists taking photos which make it difficult to walk around - however this is unavoidable.

Impressive collection . I was impressed ....very well maintained ....go earlier in the morning....one can enjoy the garden n the quietness before the crowds ..
The variety of cacti is phenomenal... ...
U can shop too ..... for genuine stuff...
If u love nature ....please go visit ....

Mesmerising colours. This garden is SUCH a gem in Marrakech and completely beautiful - full of colour, cacti and with a lovely courtyard tea room and restaurant. Go when it's quieter otherwise there are throngs of instagrammers waiting to have their photos taken at every great spot (me included!)

Beautiful scenery in Marrakech. Majorelle Garden in Marrakech, so beautiful that Yves Saint Laurent bought it..
Great scenery, breathtaking architecture and colors..
So relaxing to be there.

A small paradise of green near Marrakech. In the newer part of Marrakech, but fairly close - you can walk by foot. It is very nice - the garden very green and cool - full of Bamboo and cactus - there is also a very nice BERBER museum in the park. A must when visiting Marrakech

SKIP THE MUSEUM AT MARJORELL GARDEN. The garden is beautiful and a nice retreat from bustling medina. Locals pay 50 dirhams, foreigners pay 100 dirhams. Opt out of paying to see the museum--it consists of 2 small rooms, not much to see. There are some nice boutiques across the street from the garden. Boutiques sell jewelry and clothes that are less traditional with a western twist. It's not easy to find boutiques in Marrakech, people mostly shop in the souks. Souks are fantastic for rugs, pillow cases, lamps, leather goods, spices but they are not a place to get clothing.

Tranquil Gardens. We spent about 2 hours absorbing this beautiful place, the gardens, ponds and cacti were stunning.There were some lovely hidden parts, which were beautiful.Such vibrant colours and lovely art collection of Love to admire.Well worth a visit to get hidden peace in a busy city.

Don't miss it!. Jardin Majorelle = an oasis worth visiting. Beautiful colours, calm and quiet place. Also the museum is very interesting, as this is an introduction to berber culture. Definetly a must see for anyone traveling to Marrakech.

Gorgeous Paridise in the middle of the hustle and bustle :o). Group of six female friends visiting Marrakech Sept 2016 for long weekend.After researching for our trip we all wanted to visit the Jardin Majorelle.We did so on the Sunday morning, arriving just after 9.30am. Short queue to pay to get in. We didn't go for the berber museum, kind of wish we had now. The gardens are immaculate and so peaceful. Beautifully designed and a pleasant walk around to see the plants, ponds etc. There are benches all around so you can sit and relax. Lots of photo opportunities.Not sure what its like when really busy, glad we went first thing in morning.We spent approx. one hour, didn't use the café, did use the loos (unisex but all okay)Definitely one to see whilst in Marrakech

Splendid garden!!. We enjoy the garden very much! It is beautiful inside! The museum is also worth it. To add, they have student prices, just show your school card. Although we enjoyed ourselves, I would say it's not for everyone.
Nice garden. Nice garden- unusual plants and very colourful. It is a small attraction though and 20-30 minutes should be enough time.

No 1 attraction for Marrakesh. In my opinion this is the must visit place in Marrakesh, although is not as big as it may seem. I went there in the last hour before closing and it was still very crowded, but it did not take more than 30-40 min to explore. Nice variety of cactus plants in combination with the blue colors of the setting it creates and unique garden. The store inside it seemed overpriced to me.

BeautifuQuiet retreat. Cool, restful, beautiful...a "must" - for any visit to Marrakesh! Palatial gardens, well maintained, bursting with color, a pond, a d fountains, this is the final resting place of Yves St Laurent.

Wonderful place, heaven :-). One of the best and charming places in Marrakech!! A must to see ;-)
Be careful from Taxi drivers around the area, most of them will tell you we don't open the Taxi control "counter" which is a big lie!! Only take a taxi who will open the control. Don't accept any offers such as 50d or 100d to anywhere.

Tranquil . After days in the city, this was a welcome quiet spot within walking distance. It was cool, the cacti are beautiful, the cafe in the centre had good food and provided two of us who stupidly forgot any kind of sun hat with two fancy straw numbers to keep the midday sun off. The Berber museum was interesting but small, don't expect too much bang for buck here, same goes for anything to do with YSL, not much there other than some posters and a memorial column. Focus on the gardens, that's what it is

Attractive gardens . I really enjoyed this place as I walked round but on reflection I preferred the Bahia palace. Don't get me wrong, this place is lovely. The planting is great, lovely water features, the link to yves saint Laurent, and the striking use of colour. It is more set up for tourists (more expensive) with gift shops and restaurants but I think the authenticity of the Bahia palace just tips it for me.

Nice. This was very pretty. If you want something quiet and to look at the plants very pretty. A lot of cactuses and bambo trees. For me it's a little to quiet and I spend much of my time in costa rica

Jardin Majorelle. Lovely gardens and a very worthwhile break from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Well worth a visit. Only downside is it's a little small (as all these things are in Marrakech), only need an hour to walk around the whole thing.

Not bad just not our thing.... This was our 2nd trip to Marrakech and we did not fit it in on our first trip so decided to go this time. It is very quiet and calming after the hustle and bustle of the markets but not really our thing.Glad we went but would not go back and if time was short unless you are a huge gardening or Yves Saint Laurent fan I would not bother personally. The museum was not open the day we went.
Fresh and beautiful. Amazing gardens. The setting is beautiful, the restoration is great. Nice expositions and cafe. You can walk for a long time amongs all those trees and plants. Our kids loved it.

Peaceful escape. The amazing thing about Marrakesh is the secrets hidden away behind the high walls. Escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Enjoyable garden and especially recommend the Berber museum as well.,

Absolutely beautiful escape from the rush of the city!. The colors in the gardens are so vibrant and as busy as the garden was when we visited, it was still a breath of fresh air from the bustling streets of Marrakech. I believe it was 10 - 20 Dhs (which is currently about $1 - $2) per person to enter, absolutely worth the cost.

Nice place for a walk but a lil bit expensive. Its a good place to relax and walk but the price is a little bit high. 70 dirhams (7€aprox) for the gardens and 30dirhams (3€aprox) for the museum. The museum is quite small and contains some berber cultural information. It is ok to go if you have seen already the rest if sightseeings in Marrakesh. Otherwise you are not missing much.

An oasis on a hot day but a little over priced. So quirky and super to come to on a hot day. Really feels like an oasis. I did think it was a little expensive for a garden. You can walk there from the medina easily (and I was 6mo pregnant).
A shady escape. Lovely way to pass an hour or so. The gardens are nicely shaded and very lovely. A great way to escape the heat of the day.
Pure serenity. . Absolutely peaceful and away from the hubbel bubble of the city. Clean fresh air to breath. We loved the garden. Sorry missed the museum
A Beutiful garden - Sept 2016. A lovely place to visit, a get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. set in the new city, designed by YSL, and with a lovely museum x
A wonderful and exquisite garden. Lovely garden to visit but the real star is the museum, a must see for all things historic of the berbers, so interesting.

Cool and relaxed but overpriced and overhyped . We visited on our last day and although the setting was very relaxing, I found it very disappointing considering the hype and reviews. Half the garden was bamboo and although nice they was not to much to see and we got round it in about half an hour.The museum was interesting but we found better in a carpet shop in the Atlas Mountains.Overall disappointing but if you have nothing else to do on a hot day!!!

Exceptional and sad. Better watch the YSL movie first to capture the significance of the place. Unfortunately I only watched it after, but still Jardin Majorelle is sad and haunting, is a testament and a cemetery. Naturally, the mansion is beautiful (we could not go inside, there was some redecorating going on), and the walkways and trees and flowers are also beautiful. The YSL shop is a little bit out of place.

Jardin Majorelle. This is the garden of the late Yves St Laurent. It is so large and beautiful. There were so many different types of Cactus that it was mind boggling. The rest of the plants were also wonderful. The layout was perfect.

Nice gardens but nothing spectacular. The gardens were really nice and relaxing, but the grounds weren't anything extremely large or spectacular. Would go first thing in the morning as it gets very crowded.

Beautiful. It was an one hour trip to walk around the garden. There is a berber museum in the garden too, a restaurant, where is the meal was delicious and many plants and cactus. The fountain is that blue what we never seen this before many places to have a little rest.
Beautiful. A beautiful place, maintained very well, very relaxing and pleasantly chilled even when the average temperature is high

Great place for a little peace!. Amazing gardens, beautiful artefacts particularly in the Berber Museum....one strange thing we noticed was just how similar some of the ancient Berber clothing and pattern designs are to Native American clothing...just have a close look when you visit and you'll see it! And this from civilisations who developed completely separately, thousands of miles apart...very wierd but very cool.Try to visit quite early, or late on in the day if you just want a quick visit...that way you'll avoid the majority of the tour groups,which does change the atmosphere of the gardens a bit! It won't spoil it though...still well worth the visit, for me anyway even the Berber Museum on its own would have been great...and the Gardens are the cherry on the cake! Great little shop and library here as well as a Café - not cheap but then you do get to sit and drink coffee in the gardens where YSL himself may have sat and relaxed with a coffee himself!
Loved the Jardin Majorelle. The most romantic place in Marrakech is Jardin Majorelle. The deep blue used for the walls and jars is amazing.

Cacti and colour. The garden itself is fairly small, but beautiful and well kept. After a stroll around the gardens, you can visit the museum or bookstore. The cafe is a lovely place to sit and avoid the heat of the day. I recommend the passionfruit and coconut sorbets or a Moroccan mint tea.
Beautiful. I went twice during my stay in Marrakech simply because it was so beautiful and such a great spot for taking pictures.

Cool and elegant. The variety of vegetation was amazing, and it's arrangement simple and elegant - the Berber museum demonstrated that YSL picked up ideas from that ancient local nomadic group - splendid wandering around, and the memorial to YSL is low key and tasteful ... Wonderful few hours

Beautiful cool gardens - an oasis in Marrakech suburbs. Well worth visiting. Entry to the Garden is 70 Dirhams and the Berber Museum a further 30 Dirhams. All absolutely immaculate and excellent. No would be guides hassling you! The layout and attention to detail in the Museum is superb - dare I say other museums in this amazing city could learn from this one! I wish that we had visited before making Atlas day excursions as it gave us a much better understanding of the Berbers. Definitely on the Top 10 list for visitors to Marrakech.
Stunning. Less than £10 to get in,All signs available in French, Arabic and EnglishBeautifully kept grounds.A lovely escape from the bustle of the city

An enchanting place. As hot as it can get in Marrakech, this garden is a calm and cool place full of beautiful plants and things to see. As soon as you step inside the sounds of the busy city are gone.
Stunning colors. It is essential to visit this place. The garden are stunning...colors, trees...a really quiet and paradise closed to the city.

Garden colors dazzle, but the Berber Museum is the reason to go. Allow at least 2 hours for this garden and bring your camera. There are so many vistas for lovely photos. The highlight was the exquisite Berber Museum. It's about the only museum we found in Marrakesh devoted to the culture of the country. It is very well done, but tiny. Don't miss the gift shops. They have the best books, and carefully curated textiles, jewelry and gifts.

The Jardin is an inspiring oasis. Imagine you are in Marrakesh any time of the year and are feeling a little tired of walking around the magic city and want to find a perfect spot to sit down, rest and reflect... You've found it, it's the Jardin Majorelle! It's is just beautiful and I'd like to thank the great YSL for such a gift. Go there see/experience it yourself. It's a must if you are in town.

Pleasant relaxing retreat. We arrived as the garden was opening. This was a good thing. It was quiet and the temperature was easily manageable. The person selling entrance tickets had no idea how to be polite or smile but the ticket was purchased. Many many well maintained cacti and tropical plants. The atmosphere was very relaxing after the hustle and bustle of the city souks and medina. The Berber museum was a surprising bonus. Not really what I would normally go to look at but a well put together display of interesting exhibits and a magical mirrored room. The cafe was pleasant although the staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. 'Oh you can't buy that now. Only breakfast.' No times on the menu! By the time we left (about 2 hours after arriving) the place was very busy. Coach trips had arrived. Guided tours. Not quite as relaxing. The garden is not huge, but big enough to see without getting too tired. Look out for the turtles. As we left, we were met with a sea of taxi drivers offering their services for a range of fees. We decided to boycott the confusion, walk 100 metres away and got a taxi for a fraction of what we had just been quoted. In conclusion: go early, enjoy and don't let the eager local taxi drivers charge you too much when you leave. Oh and if you want happy smiling courteous staff, don't expect to find them here. The gardens however are lovely.

Beautiful, Manicured Garden. Although I found it a bit expensive for a small garden (70 durham entrance + 30 if you wanted to go to the Berber museum), it is a beautifully kept garden. There are plants (especially cactus) from all over the world...kinda fun to find some that are familiar. There are paved paths to follow, water features with frogs and turtles, and birds making it a nice break from noisy streets.Others in our group paid the extra for the museum and said it pulled together all we had learned about the Berber culture throughout our tour. Although small, it had great examples of the art and culture.
Small but beautiful. Not very big but nice gardens. Staff are very nice and has a good cafe. Very peaceful spot just outside of medina

Beautiful, brilliant blue!. We visited the Jardin Majorelle on a feast day when most of the other monuments and shops were closed. This meant it may have been busier than usual but this wasn't a huge problem. This is a wonderful oasis of calm. The gardens are so verdant compared to the area around it and everything is framed with the fabulous Yves St Laurent blue. If you enjoy art and love the effect of light and colour you will love it too!

Quite literally an oasis! . The gardens, restored by Yves Saint Laurent are a nice distraction to the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh city. Hidden away inside is a very nice café, clean and shady that serves up a very refreshing mint tea and much much more.
Enchanting!. Calming and peaceful with an amazing display of cacti, and a top quality collection of Berber culture - dress, jewelery etc.

Cool Oasis of Beauty. I loved, loved, loved this place! Its inexpensive to get in, and you then wander round the beautiful garden full of succulent and cacti, under tall bamboo and other trees creating a canopy which keeps you cool. The variety is amazing, the colours beautiful and such a serene setting gives you a breath of fresh air in the city. Lots of opportunities to sit and admire the views, and to take lovely snapshots of angular plants and windows etc. Would thoroughly recommend a visit here.

An essential go see while in Marrakesh a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle. This is a lovely quiet spot to get away from the busy city, with birds and turtles and lovely trees and walkways, whilst it is not amazing - as in I wasn't blown away by it, it is nice and I think worth a visit.

Quite unique. . This is really a special garden. The plants are from all over the world. The cactus plants are something to behold. The large palms are majestic. The garden is a memorial to Yves St Lauren.

the best gardens in marrakech. blue gradens in marrakech,Between concerete bld blocks and highway connection roads beatiful arberatoum. There are 2 side for entrance to area one from senol gunes blvd other from atasehir east west juntion bridge. 3 to 4 km walking available between 2 entrances. I am doing my daily walk at this area feeling myself rest and happy.
Designer gardens. Lovely layed out gardens, very clean, the outdoor cafe is lovely and peaceful. Enjoyed wandering round with a friend.

Overpriced for what it is. The Majorelle Garden is quite nice inside with a variety of plants (bamboos, cactus, trees), however, the admission for 70 Dirhams pp is way overpriced for what it is. There isn't much to see as the garden isn't very big (probably the walk around the garden will last maximum 30 minutes).

A must see!. Absolutely stunning and full of history - you can see these gardens in as little as 30 minutes or spend a few hour meandering around. This is an absolute must see for new and repeat visitors to Marrakech!

It's okay.. Pretty garden with a small museum of Berber culture. The museum had lovely examples of traditional clothing and jewelry, so it is definitely worth the extra fee. We were surprised by the line when we got there, but we only had to wait 10 minutes.

Third visit this year!. On our third visit this year we found the gardens as well kept as ever. Everything freshly painted and well pruned. Helpful staff around if needed and the café still serves good food at reasonable prices. Little more to be said except that you would de foolish not to visit during a stay in Marrakesh.

Pleasant surprise! Thank you Marrakechdaytrips. If you have had enough of the madness of the souks, come to this lovely garden to rest your feet & soul in the middle of the Marrakech. When you come in ask for Mostapha is the best guide you can have, He was very well normative and passionate about the history the restoration process and sharing this magical secret garden, he explained why the plants were chosen and where they came from in the gardens and history of the water system. His English was perfect. Thanks Mostapha and MARRAKECHDAYTRIPS for the nice time!!!

Very calm gardens. Tranquil gardens , peaceful and calming but mostly palms bamboo and cactus .. not cheap @ 70 dirhams for the gardens and 30 for the berber museum .. but well worth a visit in my opnion :D
MAJORELLE. Input 7 euros is far too expensive for what there is to see, the tour lasts 20 minutes, it's a tourist trap

Beautiful. I enjoyed wondering around these grounds -- although it seemed busy. I've read that early morning/evening is quietter so if visiting again I would definitely opt for a less popular time.There are a few places to sit and relax, plus plaques explaining plant types as you explore...was nice & relaxing. Although we didn't visit, the cafe in the grounds seemed reasonably priced. The shop and book shop is worth looking in on, even if you don't but anything...beautiful and colourful.At 70dh (c.£6) each it seemed quite hefty compared to other admissions around the city. However, I didnt realise the contributions are donated to local community support and development (I only realised this when I was handed the information booklet upon entry)...so at least the fee is going somewhere worthwhile :-)

A place restored with love.... It is very evident that Yves St. Laurant was loved by his partner - that love is present in the trees, ponds and plants. The garden is a testament of that love.This is one of the most beautiful and cared for gardens I have ever been in and just sitting in it refreshes one from the heat and nice of the streets. I particularly love the cats collection.When you are tired of shopping the Medina and dodging scooters, take a break here.

Stunning gardens. Visited these gardens 15 years ago and on this visit was amazed to see that if anything, they has matured further. They remain a peaceful oasis despite being busy and provide a brilliant interlude to any Marrakech visit.
Amazing place. If you visit this nice place, you will never forget it at all, in fact, it has all specificity that allows visiting people to be in a very good humour.

A must see.. Smaller than anticipated but beautifully maintained. A myriad of plants and trees. Well worth the extra for the museum also which provides an excellent insight into Morrican history and culture.
Tranquility in the heart of the city. Lovely peaceful gardens and cafe did wonderful food worth a visit with interesting history of the original owner then when YSL bought it and refurbished

Mainly for Moroccans. The garden's lush and green, filled with cactus, bamboo and other plants not native to Morocco. The Berber Museum is a splendid introduction to the nation's indigenous culture. Both garden and museum are deeply discounted for local folks, as well they should be.
.. not really a garden person, but apprieciated this place, you have to pay to get in, and extra for the museum.
Gorgeous. . Jardin Majorelle was stunning. Worth a visit for sure. Especially if you love YSL like I do. Its cheap to get in and also has a cute cafe to have lunch in. Very chic, very cool.

Overrated . We went to the Jardin as is seemed to be a "must do" in Marrakech. We were a bit disappointed to see that is not as pretty or different as we thought. Definitely skip it if you're short in time.

A nice relaxing garden to stroll around, with interesting plants a water features.. Away from the madness of other areas of Marrakech this is a haven of tranquility to spend an hour or so wandering around the gardens. A small entrance fee of a little over £1

Good but crowded. . This was, we were told, the place to go and although interesting, the gardens were very crowded and almost impossible to get a photo without someone else in the background.
The museum was very interesting but if you don't speak the local languages look out for the A4 laminates that have the descriptions in English.

Green shade. It is very nice/relaxing and on a hot day is good place to spend your free time as it has plenty of trees and is a home for a lot of small birds.A bit more information about the plants would be good to see and perhaps more flowers.
Beautiful, great for photos. go early morning as it gets busy, have a mint tea in the cafe, you can buy the blue paint in the gift shop!

and... relax!. Visited September 2016 as a couple.Having (stupidly) chosen to walk from the other side of Marrakech in the September heat, the Jardin Majorelle (we'll call them 'gardens' now) was a welcome retreat.Tip: the entrance is located round the side / back of the property, away from the main road You pay an entrance fee to visit, and a separate entrance fee for the Berber museum inside.On entering the gardens you will see a map of the gardens, which you won't need to memorise at all (just note that toilets are near the entrance). The gardens are actually lovely, with different trees and plants and accompanying descriptions in places. There are various water small ponds and benches to marvel at the foliage!Of course the star of the attraction is the house, painted in a luxurious deep blue with yellow highlighted around windows and features. This of course makes for some fantastic photo (or drawing / painting) opportunities, so get creative! There is a small shop, but it's expensive.The berber museum within the house was great, and it worth the extra "few quid". The museum showcases tools, clothing, jewelry, and various others items from their living.Overall 4 stars, as I felt the price was steep compared with other attractions / museums / free parks in Marrakech. You are paying for a piece of YSL history, but it was worth it really.
Excellent!. Definitely worth the taxi ride out of Marrakech! Make sure you visit, don't miss the Berber museum either.

A beautifully green dry area garden. Principally a cactus garden with a marvellous variety of dry area garden plants from all around the world. Privately owned by a trust it is immaculately maintained and presented and reasonably priced entry. Includes a memorial to Yves St Laurent who previously was an owner & benefactor.

Nice little respite.. A nice, cool, garden with plenty of cactus's (cacti?).Cost about 70 dihram for entry. Not a lot to do in there though. Just chill and look at the spikey plants if it's your thing.

Worth seeing. The place is not that big but a good place for photos. We went there with a guide so we got a bit of history of the place and John Majorelle. If you like plants and gardens then this is for you.
Beautiful hardens. A great place to visit to get away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. Beautiful colored pots and lots of lush green plants.

Lovely peaceful, tranquil and cool garden - definitely worth a visit.. An oasis of calm and coolness in the middle of a bustling city. The gardens were restored by Yves St. Lorenz and his memorial is in the garden.
A virtual oasis. The gardens are much smaller than I expected but it is a pretty and tranquil place in the city. Worth the visit but the Cafe within is very expensive.
Beautiful!. This is like an oasis - cool and with amazing plants and artwork by YSL, who owned it! Would not hesitate to recommend it.

If you want to escape the manic city. As soon as you enter you forget where you are, its quite peaceful and shaded which is great to escape the heat. There isnt a lot to see but given where it is I imagine space isnt freely available. Good place to escape for half an hour.

Little oasis - if you can avoid the crowds. A picturesque and shady garden, previously owned by Yves Saint Laurent, full of interesting and well tended plants and cacti. A bright blue Art Deco-ish building houses a Berber museum. Go early if you want tranquility as it is a very popular attraction, so the crowds do detract from the feeling of serenity! There is a very simple memorial for YSL which is at odds with his flamboyance.
beautiful gardens. Wow!! So stunning. The gift shop is amazing too!!! Plus the YSL LOVE museum!!! What a stunning garden.

peace in a hectic city. A wonderful bit of peace and tranquility in an otherwise hectic city. We spend several hours just relaxing amongst the variety of plant species that were there, enjoying watching the turtles and frogs in the water, listening to the birds chatter. Staff were friendly and very informative about the different types of plants, and the tea room had a good variety of lunches and drinks albeit a little expensive. A worthwhile afternoon, that helped to recharge the senses.

Beautiful property. I'm giving it 3 stars because the Berber museum was closed while we were there (Sept 2016) but they charged the same rate. Very disappointing because it was the main reason I wanted to visit.
Beautiful. A must do visit to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Marrakech streets. Here you can sit in peace and quite

Nice Break From the City. Hardin Majorelle are beautiful gardens which provide a nice break from the city and provide insight into local plans. The bamboo forest is lovely and the rooms also interesting. The restaurant as well is nice for a break. The surrounding streets are great for a wander as well to escape the tat of the markets and see local designers and modern design shops.

Lovely garden, great colours. This is well worth a visit. The garden is a cool and colourful oasis with lots of birds. The colours in the pottery are stunning. The Berber museum is a must see to understand the heritage of Morocco

Go early to avoid the crowds/heat. Beautiful garden and museum ... smaller than expected ... lovely contrasts of green and blues ... 70 d for entry and 30 d for museum ... cafe expensive worth the price for the quiet and ambience

A little hidden gem in Marrakech. Yves Saint Laurent purchased this little piece of paradise and saved it from real estate developers in Marrakech. It is now a major tourist site and the government maintains it. The majestic Morocco blue is everywhere and definitely a statement. A must when you to go Marrakech

An oasis of peace in a bustling city. Wonderful place to visit. Though it was quite busy when we arrived the gardens themselves were wonderful. A maze of twisted trees, towering bamboo and vibrant colours. We did not pay the extra for the museum experience through this option is available for 10 more dirhams. This place was calm and beautiful and we no trouble relaxing along the water features or sitting in the hidden areas of the garden. There was even a squirrel cat. It's not a real species, simply a cat trying and failing to climb trees too big for it.

Expensive but nice.. Very peaceful in the midst of the city.About an hour should be enough for a visit or a bit longer if you want to visit the museum and the cafe. A nice collection of Cacti and Bamboo within the grounds. There is also an ice cream parlour opposite the entrance gates. A great place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Expensive but nice place to see. If you love nature's beauty and bird watching...you wanna see this place. I understood why Ralph Lauren fell in love with the place. Serene, picturesque, except for the tourists.
Must see !! . Such a surreal feeling being in somewhere so beautiful and quiant yet in the middle of the city. A must see

Peaceful enclave in the bustling city. Great spot to spend a peaceful hour if you need a break from the Marrakech madness. The grounds are beautiful and there's a lovely cafe within which serves a full menu as well as coffee/tea and small plates.

Really pretty. We took a taxi, I think it's maybe a 40 min walk from the medina.The gardens are beautiful and a really relaxing place to spend an hour. It's quite small so I think a tour group would fill it!We had a drink in the cafe, it's not cheap but pretty and lots of shade to chill outside the noise of the city. Saw people eating and the food looked very nice

Pretty garden for pics . This garden was a 15 minute walk from our hotel. It was really pretty and we took loads of pictures. We saw so many exotic cacti. It takes about 45 minutes to look around the whole garden including taking pics. So don't take out o whole morning or afternoon for this.

Nice calm oasis in busy Marrakech . Nice garden that gave us a calm day in Marrakech. Not a big garden though - we where there maybe 3 hours and then we had lunch. Very close to the center of Marrakech
A Must Visit in Marrakech . A beautiful green space in the midst of the city. Please take the time to also visit the museum on Berber culture and history within the park.

Beautiful, tranquil gardens, done with great style.. Hardly surprising that Yves Saint Laurent's gardens are a magical place to spend time, but they really take you out of the scramble of the medina (both literally and spiritually) and they're a really good place to come for a morning, particularly when Marrakesh hits the higher temperatures. The staff uniforms in that wonderful blue are also lovely.
Beautiful. A quick visit, but beautiful gardens and amazing cactus. The museum was closed for a short time so we missed that, but it was still worth the trip.

Solo Female - 26yrs . A must see - photos/videos don't do it justice, I nearly didn't go and it was a highlight of my visit.
Bring a book and sit in an area for a while.... beyond peaceful.

A magical escape. the best times in Marrakech are the ones when I have the feeling I see the town waking up. Go at early summer mornings to Le Jardin Majorelle. Take a book and sit down and observe. It's magical!

Great cacti. I loved all the different types of cacti in the garden!
The museum was very interesting also. Thoroughly enjoyed the coolness of the garden, and the lunch at the Caffè was very pleasant. Didn't enjoy the water sprays but most welcome the cooling effect.
Worth a visit whilst in Marrakesh. A nice oasis of calm and coolness within the bustling city. A cobalt blue seems to be a general theme of the artist and this garden makes good use of it.
A most serene place. A unique and lovely garden away from the madness of the Medina. Stunning variety of exotic plants, and peaceful place to stroll. A true oasis. Nice gift shop (bring your wallet).

Pretty Green. If you're coming to see the gardens from either the old town or the Kasbah, I would certainly reccomend getting a taxi of some discription. It was quite a walk, which for a pair of healthy 30 somethings wasn't too bad, just had some throbbing feet by the time we returned back to our Riad. The good news is that once you are at the Gardens it is a lovely place to be. Certainly cooler in temperature than the rest of the area. While it may look like there isn't much there, the dDisplays are beautifully laid out and there is plenty to discover and look at as you meander through. During our visit the Berber museum was closed while a new exhibit was being installed. The cafe looked reasonably priced, and the toilets were good and clean (take some small change for a tip to the attendee). My only advice would be to watch out for young men lurking outside who try and befriend you as leave, they are very charming and try to show you around the New Town markets, which conveniently lead to a families rug shop... then request a tip for their guidance. We spotted this before we got to the shop, and palmed him off with small change.

Peaceful. I little walk away from the main area but a great way to pass some time. Owing to the shade, it's a good way to avoid the midday sun. Loads of taxis outside to get back to the main area, although we were happy to walk back

Too expensive for a garden. We visited it during our stay in Marrakech as it was recommended everywhere but we found the 7 euro entrance ticket too expensive for what they showed us. If you dont mind the money then it is a nice garden to spend the hot hours!

Pretty garden. The garden and gallery are nice despite it being busy when we were there. The cafe however was terrible (the coffee in particular) so I would avoid going there! When we left there was a man in charge of the row of >30 taxis who gave us a ridiculous price to get back to our riad (5x what we paid to get there) and was adamant we wouldn't get back otherwise. Of course when we walked to hail a taxi from the nearby street one of the taxi drivers offered to take us for the price we were offering.

Beautiful and colourful. Fabulous gardens plants and colours amazing. Would say visit whilst you are in town it's very beautiful. Watch out for the frogs and Terrapins in the large pond they are really fun to watch

A pretty little paradise. Beautiful gardens, a definite must-see for Marrakech. Not a place to spend a long amount of time and for that reason I felt it was slightly over priced compared to other Marrakech attractions, but still amazingly cheap compared to England/London prices! So many pretty views including the YSL memorial. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful gardens but nothing exciting . Really pretty and tranquil garden but 70dhs entry is a bit expensive for me. We spent about 20mins in the garden, as there wasn't really a great deal to see.

If you like cacti and the colour blue you're in for a treat. Really pretty gardens to walk around, the architecture was beautiful. Although the gardens are fairly small we spent 2 hours wandering around. 50dhs entry, it's a bit more to visit the museum which we didn't do. No queue but it was quite busy inside.
Beautiful place strongly recommended , our problem was we didnt have enough time here. Don't miss this place , visit anytime we ran out of time but next visit to Marrakech will give it time deserved

Quite nice. The gardens are quite nice and a probably worth a visit if you're close. Some parts are very beautiful but overall it's nothing spectacular. There are nicer gardens that are free to look at in other Mediterranean locations.
Amazing place!. Jardin Majorelle, developed by YSL, was the highlight of the trip! Colours of the gardens were amazing in the Spring. The museum was spectacular.
Over priced. A bit dissapointing for 70 dirham entry fee. Nic enough but just a few ponds, plants, and palm trees. Not a flower in sight.
Not worth the effort. Not overly impressed especially with the charge to get in. Overrated. Better gardens in Marrakesh and quite near the hotel. They were very relaxing

Nicely maintained gardens. Not bad. Its a bit short. But is a beautiful garden and seems well maintained. As I said it's short. Can tour it in about half an hour. And costs 70 Durham each. The museum was closed when we went. There's a little cafe there too for refreshments. All in all Worth a visit. Probably best to bring a book or something to chill there for a bit. Otherwise your in and out figuring what else to do with the rest of the day
Interesting but over rated. We had a pleasant hour or so here but it's not worth the entry fee or the travel over there really. It's nice enough but just lacked anything very different
The place to chill out. A great place to chill and lise to the birds singing..I find it overpriced a little but It's a good break from the hassle and the crowd of the Medina

Beautiful gardens but fairly pricey . Beautiful gardens but quite small and very busy with lots of tourists. We definitely enjoyed it but it was one of the more expensive places to go in. The cafe was also a bit pricey but delicious food and very relaxed atmosphere. The breakfast sounded great so I'd recommend an early morning visit

Nice place to visit. I was in Marrakech this year for 7 days everyday I go to explore different places on my schedule was to visit Jardin Majorelle it was cool and beautiful place I definitely recommend it to everyone

I didnt expect much but was surprisingly good. We were not impressed at first but then we got to the house at the end of the garden and were so impressed by the colours and shapes. Its such a cool place to see.
Great Place. Visited this in March 16. Great flower displays etc. Nice place to have lunch and only a walk away from the main square.
A beautiful and tranquil oasis. Give your self some time here, it is magical, and there is first class museum of Berber history and objects - also a great cafe.

Beautiful and serene. Lovely gardens to wile away an hour or two
Particularly liked the YSL 'Love' poster display, just a shame the museum is closed for upgrading to new exhibits.
Worth a visit

The most majestic cactai you will ever see! . Gorgeous gardens maintained by Yves Saint Laurent. Gorgeous place but quite small, can stay here for about 2 hrs max! Beautiful little cafe inside with lovely courtyard style feel. Defo a must see on any trip to Marrakech!

Very nice attraction in Marrakesch. Majorelle Garten (Jardin Majorelle) is a nice and quite place to visit while staying in Marrakesh escaping the noisy and the full street of cars and the annoying touts on the street.

Surprisingly interesting and enjoyable. Tranquil and beautiful. Wasn't expecting it to be this charming.
A quiet morning away from the crowds, beautiful gardens and afterwards you can walk to the Amal Women's training center for a great lunch

Beautiful Garden in Marrakech. This is a must visit attraction in Marrakech. The garden was the private garden developed by the fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent. Visitors will find it very peaceful and interesting.
The planting is very unusual and the use of the blue colour magnificent.
Very nice place. Lovely place, very beautiful, extremely nice memorial dedicated to Yves Saint Laurent. Also amazing to see the diversity of the plants in the garden.
relaxing. Very pretty gardens rescued by Yves St Laurent. Peaceful and relaxing hour spent wandering around and a lovely cafe, although drinks not cheap
Great colours. This is a stunning garden in the new town providing lots of shade on a hot day. It is renowned for its colours. A must see when you are visiting Marrakesh.

Beautiful.. Great garden and a quiet escape from the bustle of the city. Well worth your time and entry fee. Many cacti from around the world highlight the well landscaped grounds. The museum was closed when I was there so cannot comment. A nice little cafe, bookstore and, of course, a shop of YSL goods.
Inspiring haven. Small and carefully created garden space with clever use of colour and planting. It's not terribly exotic, but a very peaceful and beautiful environment to spend an hour or two in.
beautiful place. great and peaceful place to visit when you are in Marrakech.A must see .You will spend there around 2 hours. Some nice boutiques in the neighborhood

Great place. My husband and I we want to Morocco we arrived early morning in the evening we want to visit this place was really cool Marrakech city as well on of my favorite places I was dreaming to visit.
It's really cool and it's recommended to everyone who looks from stuff to do I'm Marrakech. Can't wait to go back
Nothing special and entrance is a lot. The place is small and you pay 70 Dhs to get it and the security staff are not friendly we had our pics removed off out mobile phone
Must visit!. Perfect example of the contribution that designers and artists can make to public spaces. Great place to spend a quite afternoon and good photo ops too.
Thank goodness we didn't miss it. Definitely worth a visit. Lovely colourful gardens with cafe and little shops. Stunning contrasting colours. Very happy that we went.

Wonderful Place to Relax. This is my favourite spot in Marrakech. It was 50 degrees the day we visited but it was cool under the bamboo. The garden is laid out in a very visitor friendly way and is easily wheelchair accessible. The brightly painted pots and planting are very well thought out and the cafe has misters to keep you cool whilst eating your icecream. If you only visit one place in Marrakech, let it be this one.
Magnificent palm garden. A must in Marrakech.Try to visit it in the morning to avoid the crowd.Don't miss the superb Berber museum!

Unlike anything I've seen before - definitely a must visit!. Adopted by Yves Saint Laurent and his partner, Pierre Berge in the 1980s to save it from a real estate project and preserve the vision of its original founder and artist, Jacque Majorelle, this garden will instantly draw you in with this whiff of refreshing cool air, a soothing calming sensation, wonder for the stunning display of cacti and most importantly, the stunning Majorelle blue house will assault your senses and how! It's unimaginable that something so beautiful and precious was considered for destruction so that another hotel resort could replace it. It's a beautiful place to spend a day in, if you have the luxury of time - walk around, admire the wondrous fauna and flora from all around the world, dine in the cool surrounds of the garden cafe (everything on the menu that I ordered was a hit!), shop in the indoor gift shop, visit the YSL memoriam or, just sit under a shaded tree and unwind.
Loved it!. Great space to spend a few hours away from the craziness of the outside world! Beautiful surroundings.... A must

Beautifully Presented and Fascinating. A lovely garden beautifully, presented and maintained. The plant specimens are fascinating especially to a temperate climate gardener. Half an hour covers the attraction. Really recommended to any gardener.

Enjoyable visit. By the time we got into the gardens it was crowded so I would recommend that you go early if you want to enjoy the gardens without the crowds. The blue of the structures is very vibrant and uplifting, the gardens are enjoyable, pick a bench and sit while reading the brochure they give you on entry with a bit of the background of the Jardin Majorelle. The Berber museum was closed while we were there. They are opening a new museum next year I think on YSL.
Beautiful. Thank you to mr. Majorelle and later on Yvette st. Laurent for this magnificent garden. And Majorelle blue is stunningly gorgeous.
Nice garden, overrated . Good to tick of your list however it's quite small and takes around 15mins to walk around. Would recommend for a few photos but that's about it.

Nice gardens - worth a visit if you have nothing else to do in Kech. Nice gardens but overall too pricey (70dhs) for what it offers. A sq km of vegetation nicely kept and organised.Vegetation wise, the collection of cactuses are worthwhile but other than that i felt a bit of visiting a tourist trap.Also bit of a walk from medina so take into account of a taxi if you not keen walker in not so 'nice' places of Kech.
Lovely oasis. What a lovely place to visit it's very calm and pleasant to walk around. There is also a lovely little cafe across the road you can have a great ice cream from.

Amazing!. Our guide mostapha from Marrakechdaytrips suggested we visit this garden and we were not disappointed "Must See" Lovely plants,beautiful buildings and a tranquil place to chill after a busy day in the city. Very reasonable entry price.Good for the whole family.

Little pricey but beautiful blue. Garden was a little prices as is the cafe! but saying that the garden was beautiful and worth a visit for a few photos.Little walk around and the building itself is pretty impressive.
Lovely Gardens. Well worth the visit. It's in a lovely little area of marrakesh, and there are some lovely shops and eateries right opposite. A heaven sent getaway from the filth of the main city
Beautiful . Great to see the gardens very well maintained. Really good spot, not only to check out the beautiful majorelle blue buildings but to unwind and enjoy

Small but pretty. You dont need long to visit this garden and compared to stately gardens in the uk its not much to write home about. That said it is cool and calm and a welcome relief from the chaos of the medina. There are some spectacular examples of cacti along with the palms and bamboo. The little outdoor cafe is made cool and serene with misting water sprayed overhead. And you can wile away a few moments pondering the works of art in the little gallery.

Expensive. Good, but expensive for such a small place.The restaurant is expensive as well Avoid to take the Taxi at the exit. They don't use the Taxi meter. Wanted to go to the palace but dropped me at the souk where I did not want to go. Told me the palace was closed ( but not true)

Underwhelming .... We visited the majorelle jardin after countless recommendations on the Internet and by local people and we found it very underwhelming. We were expecting a variety of vibrant flowers and scenery but in reality it's mostly bamboo and cacti which although nice to see, could have been seen anywhere really. There's no real explanation as to the link between yves saint laurent and this garden which is confusing but there's a memorial there and some of his artwork which is cool to see.Overall it's a pretty place that makes for some nice photographs and for 70dirham is worth a visit if you have a lot of time. Just don't go expecting a nursery.

Very nice garden. Beautiful gardens. Nice and cool and quiet. Relaxing escape from business of City.f its not too hot and you have time you can walk here from the Square like I did. There are plenty of benches to sit and just relax. Its peaceful and it aslo give you an opportunity to see the residents of Marrakesh enjoying a day at the gardens.

Good but not excellent. Visited with my partner last week. Berber museum is closed until later in the month. Good to sit and take in the atmosphere and watch everyone else rushing round. However I feel that the planting is now looking dated. It is still worth visiting when Marrekech but it will be the most expensive place you visit - 70 dirhams without the Berber museum.

Must do when in Marrakech . A hidden paradise in the middle of residential area. You can spend easily an afternoon there relaxing and enjoying the diversity of flora from everywhere. Make sure your camera or phone are charged as you wouldn't stop taking pics.
A beautiful oasis from the heat.. Not as stunning as I thought it would have been and somewhat small in size-I walked there from the old town Medina so was somewhat disappointed on arrival.

an island of culture and good taste. entering the universe of generations of artistic and cultural genius from Majorelle to Yves St Laurent. A museum is under construction, should be completed in 2017. Creations of YSL will be exhibited as well as painting private collection of Pierre Berger
Quaint but better than more time in the sukes. Much smaller than expected. Museum closed. Kind of boring. Takes about 20 min. Kind of expensive for Marrakech.

Loved it. An amazing amazing garden. It was lovely to shade from the heat and the garden seemed to have a relaxing power over me!!! Want to try and make my garden like this!! It was gorgeous! If you have time take a book and sit in the shade and relax for a while away from the busy city. 100% recommend that you visit here when in Marrakech.

A little bit a respite from the sun. We went by taxi from our hotel as it is a little bit away from the area the curtesy bus dropped us. We went early as it opened and this meant we could walk round minus the crowds. As most of if it is shady due to the large plants, it is so cool and comfortable.

Beautiful garden - if you enjoy looking at plants. I'm clearly not cultural enough. We went because of the Yves Saint Laurent connection and the gift shop was the best bit for me. Lots of lovely plants. Made the mistake of asking a guide a question who then led us around for about 15 minutes in the searing heat explaining the trees etc. My husband tipped him and he went away - that might sound mean but there are only so many times you can say 'wow' and nod and smile. Our teenage daughter took lots of arty photos and seemed to enjoy it but including the museum, we were about one hour in there. Go so you've done it and maybe have something to eat and drink in the courtyard restaurant.

We loved this garden and loved even more the cafe and the local museum within its walls. this garden is unexpectedly fantastic. We were in love with the turtles as much as the cacti.We would recommend this.

Jardin Majorelle in Marrakech. A simply stunning and lovely garden located in the center of the city. I was amazed to find myself on a street surrounding by cars and shops only to enter into an oasis of beauty, tranquility and calmness.The grounds are beautifully maintained, the quantity of plants and trees simply amazing. I also enjoyed having a cool lemon drink in the small restaurant after my visit while being refreshed by a piped-in cooling mist.The cost to enter the garden was Euros 13 for visitors and Euros 7 for locals and foreign residents.
Wonderful visit. What a wonderful garden bamboo so tall very peaceful and beautifully cool on a hot day well worth an afternoon visit

Pretty Gardend. These gardens are extremely pretty and definitely worth a visit. However, a complete circuit with a Camera took us about an hour and there is so much more Marrakech has to offer.Definitely visit, but plan it in amongst other things as part of a larger tour of the city.

Beautiful cacti. Not being into gardens, I was not particularly keen on this outing but went along with friends.I loved it, especially the beautiful cacti, of all shapes and sizes. 40 years in the making.
Lovely respite from the city. We enjoyed the gardens, the highlights were the pond with golden frogs and the cactus garden. A very nice break from the Medina and souks.

Impressive garden in Marrakesh. After touring the dessert for two days and arriving to Marrakesh we decided to visit Jardin Majorelle. If you are into landscaping or gardening this will be very enjoyable. Great spot for pictures.
A moment of calm. Stunning colours & an oasis of calm, about a 20 min walk outside of the medina walls. Nice to get out of the hustle and bustle.
Very peaceful after hectic medina. These gardens are very nice and very serene. They are a nice change of pace from medina, souks and square with all the vendors. Very clean and wonderful!

One of the top attractions in Marrakech. Beautifully set out garden. The Majorelle blue is stunning and the mature plants and water features make this a very photogenic place. There's a little cafe/restaurant, though prices are very high.
It is a romantic oasis and somewhere you really should visit on your stay in this beautiful city.

Excellent place to take photos.. Excellent place to take photos surrounded by hundreds of plants and palm trees found all of the world, especially the blue building. Go early in the morning to get the best photos and to avoid the mid day heat. Do not have a taxi from outside the gardens as they will charge expensive. Taxi should cost no more than 20 dirhams to KFC/ New town. It costs 70 dirhams to enter the gardens. It will take one hour to walk around. Also a café and souvenir shop, although expensive.
amazing. Defiantly a must for anyone going to Marrakech. Have plenty of water. Do not be fooled by Taxis who want to personally chauffer you as there are plenty of taxis to find

Great place to chill out for a bit. This is a very pleasant spot to come and chill after visiting other parts of the city. If you're interested in plants you'll love it, if not (like me), you'll still enjoy being in the green and protected from the sun. The only downsides are that the café is a bit pricey, and the week when I visited the Berber museum was closed.
Visit to Jardin Majorelle. . Absolutely beautiful as you would expect from a garden linked to YSL. Garden and museum on Berber art and culture was £10 each approx. 100Dh

Hidden paradise with incredible restaurant on site . A beautiful calm oasis just a 10mim taxi ride from the main square. The gardens are stunning and very well kept. After a mornings shopping in the noisy town it's perfect to come here and be surrounded by tropical plants. The restaurant in the gardens is surprisingly where I've had the best food while staying in Marrakech. Dainty tables set around a fountain with misters above to keep you cool. We had the cold Morrocan soup, mint tea and chicken salad. Simple dishes but packed with flavour. If you visit I would highly recommend getting lunch or dinner while here.
Lovely blue and green!. A beautiful oasis in the middle of a crazy city! It also contained a stone tribute to Yves Saint Laurent, which was unexpected.
Definitely should visit. A place where you forget that you are in the busy Marrakech. I understand how Yves could have spent here his time.
Pretty but expensive . Nice garden. Cool spot to chill. Small area and can cover in 30 mins. It's out in the new part of the city. The museum we did not see as it was closed.

A beautiful Oasis in the heart of Marrakech. A truly picturesque garden, we loved walking round the place. Everything is pretty from the red paths themselves to the stunning blue artist studio. Plenty of picture opportunities, especially when the sun is shining. Its a nice break from the intensity of the rest of the city, but don't count on staying longer than an hour, it really is small. Priced at 70 dirham which I think is about right - I wouldn't want to pay more.
A must-see!. After several chaotic days in Marrakech it was wonderful to escape to the oasis that is the Majorelle Gardens. Peaceful, colourful and very popular, a definite must-see in Marrakech!
Unforgettable. We came here 6 years ago and fell in love. Came back 6 years later and fell in love even more. Entrancing. Advice: Chat to the staff, they're lovely!
Nice escape from the city madness. A pretty garden away from the madness of the city, nice and cool in the heat. Only takes half hour to wander around and cheap to get in

Place of relaxation in the madness of Marrakesh!. The gardens are amazing. There is a sense of relaxation and peace as people meander aboutthe gardens taking in the different shapes and color plants, trees and cacti. It is clean and well maintained. The cafe is a much needed safe haven of as place to relax with a cup of tea and an ice cream. The sparodic bursts of cool mist really helped in the 40 degree heat too! Sadly the museum was closed.

Green space. It was a greet space where everything is sand color. We went for lunch to Amal Center and then to walk the gardens. It was cludy so we walk back the medina. IF you are planning to just go to the gardens not sure if it s worthy... but at least is green!!

Beautiful. Relaxing visit , a little piece of tranquility from the hustle and bustle , we lingered awhile , enjoyed a snack in the cafe there , unfortunately the Berber museum was closed but that did not spoil the visit .beautifully kept gardens
Beautiful place. A must see while vacationing in Marrakech. We were very surprised by the beauty and diversity of the plants on display. The little shops in the back are really fun too.

Slice of heaven. This is a nice quiet place to visit. The price is right $7.00. The cacti and palms were beautiful. There are plenty of photo ops and places to sit and relax. I would avoid the restaurant because food choices and beverage choices are limited. I ordered just matchstick fries that were just ok.

Beautiful. The garden is stunning, and very well kept. The ticket price of 70 dirham is a bit overpriced but OK. The museum was closed. An art exhibition was held, but we found the theme not having anything to do with either the garden or Moroccan culture. We were not offered a guide, which would have been nice since the information only stated the plants latin name and its origin, and not for all of the plants.

Beautiful garden. This is small but beautiful and well worth a visit if you enjoy gardens. Carefully maintained with a good choice of plants and trees with added bonus of a really interesting museum, water features add to the relaxing quiet of this space.
Perfect. It is like heaven all those tree and cactuses!! The atmosphere is incredible!! If you are in Marrakech you must visit this place! The entrance fee is not high 1 Euro or 10 Dirham!

Stunning stroll in the gardens . These gardens are super vibrant and a fantastic way to spend a hot afternoon. The garden offers plenty of seats and shade - I wish I had brought my book to sit and read in such a great spot. Quite different and worth a visit. Unfortunately the museum is closed so we didn't get to visit.
simple beauty. This was a nice change of pace on our trip. The colors are amazing. The museum exhibit is exceptionally well done.

Meh. The gardin is nice but nothing more... there are no good guides or information about the plants and overall dissapointing experience.
Go only if you have nothing to do in Marrakech.
Small. Very small gardens. Basicly just a few cactus and palm trees. Better things to spend 70dh on. Felt truly ripped off
dr. nice place to visit the restaurant inside is some of the best good in Marrakech it's staff are really helpful and nice and thevdaladscare divine
Too small. This is expensive for the price, it's better to use your money to drink a glas at the Mamounia and visit the garden :)

Gorgeous garden, worth a visit!!. Beautiful gardens and the best part are the bright blue, orange, and yellow colors on pots and buildings throughout. Makes for gorgeous photos. The Berber museum is also very cool and recommended.
Beautiful, peaceful and cool. Beautifully designed by Yves Saint Laurent and is very well maintained. Well worth the price of a ticket (140 MAD per person).
Good not more . The place is nice. It was 50dh years ago and 70dh now. Plants are nice what I enjoyed the most was the freshness of the place and the zen aura.

Beautiful. A small oasis of calm in a bustling city
You can easily forget where you are, it is so peaceful.
Easy to see Yves Saint Laurent influence.
Nice little cafe too.

Must See! . This garden is strikingly beautiful, the exotic plants have an almost science fiction look, and the house and walls are painted with magnificent Majorelle blue. We took our time ambling through, enjoying the shade. It's quiet and peaceful with plenty of places to stop and sit, a welcome change from the noise & hustle of the medina. We had lunch at the cafe, which was delicious (I recommend the feta & watermelon salad). It was around 300 dirhams for two which is the most expensive meal we have had in Morocco but I did not begrudge paying it at all.There is a little boutique with high end bags, scarves and jewellery and a library shop with books, pictures and postcards. Unfortunately the Berber Museum was closed which was dissapointing but perhaps I shall have to visit again. Entry to garden was 70 dirhams, and the Museum would have been 30 dirhams. Usual for Europe but expensive for Morocco, definitely worth it. There were lots of glamorous looking women taking selfies but who can blame them with such an irresistible backdrop? (I was one of the less glamorous ones!)

Lovely change from the souks. I love the hustle and bustle of the Medina and Souks but it is nice to exceed that for a brief time.This garden provides just that opportunity. Majorelle is only about a 10 minute taxi ride from the big mosque in the Medina. Try flag a taxi down rather than approach a waiting one as you will pay less. We only paid 17 dh to the gardens.It was lovely to walk through the garden and see a different side of Marekech.Very relaxing but hot place I suggest you take water with you as buying it at the cafe is quite expensive 30 dhs for a large bottle. Wander around the garden at leisure lots of great photo opportunities.Museum was closed when I visited not sure why ?Entrance fee is 70 dh per adult and 30 dh to museum ( if it was open).When leaving there is a queue of taxis waiting. If you want the cheap option turn right on exiting garden and walk to main road and flag a taxi. Great postcards for sale from vendor outside exit.

Welcomed calm and cool visit outside the medina. Jardin Majorelle is a lovely change from the hustle-bustle of the Marrakech medina. Full of trees, shrubs, and plants from around the world, the gardens provide shade, cool, and fresh air. It's peaceful with a couple of Koi ponds, as well. Do visit the Berber museum within the gardens (an additional ticket is necessary). You'll need to take a taxi from the medina. We easily agreed on a roundtrip fare with a driver, making for a smooth excursion.

Pleasant but repetitive. Visited Jardin Majorelle, as a family with 2 teenagers and a younger child. As an adult I was very interested in the plants and which part of the world they were from, so spent time reading the information on offer. My teenagers were less interested and found it repetitive, and dull. It's worth a visit and is reasonably priced. Make sure your flash works on your camera as the natural lighting inside the garden is limited and some of the best photo opportunities are in dark areas.

Beautiful oasis in the crazy city. Beautiful gardens. Nice and cool and quiet. Relaxing escape from business of City. By all accounts the Berber museum inside is awesome but was closed for renovation while we were here.

Stunning Oasis. Jardin Majorelle left a very deep impression on me. It is a standing testimony to love : the love that Jacques Majorelle had for his art & for Marrakech, and the love that Yves Saint Laurent shared with Pierre Bergé for the Berber culture and the garden which no doubt inspired the palette of the designs that came out of Yves Saint Laurent Couture House. This is an attraction that you must visit when you are in Marrakech. An additional fee is required to view the Berber collection and although it is a small collection, it is impressive.

Tranquil escape from the heat and hustle of the city. We took a taxi from our hotel to the Gardens and spent a couple of hours walking around. There are plenty of flowers and a few species of wild birds be seen, as well as the bright blue buildings which characterise the gardens.There is a book store and very expensive fashion boutique in the gardens as well as a museum. We grabbed a coffee in the picturesque onsite cafe which is set in a courtyard. We were tempted to order food as well but settled for just drinks. Prices were a little high for Marrakech but normal by European standards and worth it for the pretty surroundings.

Very nice. Not a huge garden considering there is an entrance fee but tranquil indeed. Surrounded by high walls you wouldn't be able to tell with the many different trees and plants from all over the world. Designed by Yves Saint Laurent himself the garden does have beauty and mystery. There are plenty of places to sit and contemplate (assuming there are not many visitors) and a great place to take pictures of plants you would otherwise never see. The most attractive place in the garden is the pond in the centre which is still water covered with lily pads. Take your time to view the garden and the house as the calm and relax atmosphere helps to revive you until you leave and join the traffic laden, smog filled, persistent harassment of Marrakech roads! Definitely worth the trip and of course recomended for all.

Peace oasis. In the newer part of town residential district, behind high walls and easily missed, this garden is a peaceful and verdant oasis in the city. I spent two hours plus, taking in the atmosphere and unwinding. It's a beautifully exotic place with an interesting history. Great photos. The amazing blue Art Deco house pops out of its green surroundings and deepest yellow curtains flapped from an upper terrace. I loved the Berber Museum. I felt wonderfully rested and refreshed from my visit and hold fond memories of this tranquil spot.

Just beautiful! A lovely stroll. This garden is lovely to walk through, and it's worth the 100 dirhams we paid to get in and look at the Berber museum. Try go when it's not too hot in the day, you can really take your time and sit on the benches and appreciate the beautiful surroundings.

Lovely gardens but not very big at all. We went to the gardens late afternoon. Was really pretty inside but if your expecting to spend lots of time here if probably do to a bigger gardens. We were there no more than an hour but from there reviews people had said two hours, which is well over estimated. Not much around here but if you have lunch I'd recommend eating inside the gardens in the beautiful surroundings as the ones outside are pretty average. When entering the gardens there is two prices, which caught us by surprise as on trip advisor it says the local rate. One rate for the Moroccans (40dr) and one rate for tourists (70dr). Nice place to chill, see some amazing plants and take some nice pictures. Not somewhere I'd visit again but if you're in Gueliz then pop in.

Beautiful and peaceful. The gardens are beautiful and peaceful. they also offer some shade on a very hot day in Marrakesh. They don't take very long to walk around but it's nice to take your time and sit down on one of the benches and admire the gardens. There's a nice shop and cafe too. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful garden totally worth the visit . Beautiful place with amazing colors, nice place to enjoy 1-2 hours, take beautiful photos, sit for a cold drink the cafe inside or a lunch.

Checking out the gardens . Not quite what I was expecting, but very impressive collection of cacti, palm trees, enormous bamboo plants, etcDefinitely take your camera - hopefully you'll be able to capture some of the beauty of the garden :)

Breathtaking colors. I have been to Marrakech several times before but this was my first visit to Jardin Majorelle. The way the garden is set up, the plants, colors, the museum are all amazing. Even the gift shop was so beautiful. Definitely worth the visit.
Peaceful and blue. A pleasant enough garden, very peaceful with a lovely "marjorelle" blue house house in the Art Deco style. The garden and house can be viewed in approx 30 mins or less.
Quiet and beautiful. I recommended it for a nice place to visit ,i paid 70MAD without museum and i found it very quiet place to take pictures so be your camera ready :)

Only if you are really into cactus. This garden is nicely done but unless you are really into cactus, I would suggest skip it. The admission fee was 70 dirhams per person and it costs another 30 dirhams to get into the Berber Museum inside. On the other hand if you are indeed into cactus, this place has a very large collection of very large cactus from all over the world.

Amazing oasis of calm. Beautiful gardens, loved the history behind them and the colours are incredible.
A lovely thing to do but not sure the price offers good value, you can be done in an hour.
So calm and relaxing it was a good way to start the holiday.
nice escape from hot Marrakech. A bit expensive in comparison to other sights, but worth it. Most of the people accustomed to the e.g. European or US gardens will be a bit surprised. :-)

Don't miss this beautiful oasis in Marrakech. This was one of my favorite stops in Marrakech. The flowers, cactus, and the vivid blue makes for some amazing pictures. And the Yves Saint Laurent posters are worth checking out. You won't regret going.
A wonderful garden! So stylish!. These gardens are the main reason we visited Marrakech, although quite small they are wonderful and peaceful! A perfect place to eat inside also

Feel the blue. A walk around the gardens and a thorough look through the Berber museum (for an additional entry fee) will take 90 minutes at most. The tea garden is pleasant and expensive and of course touristy. Blue paint is available for purchase in the gift shop. It’s a long, hot walk to get here from the Medina but tourist taxis are waiting outside to pounce if you want to ride in comfort.
Oasis of calm. Stunning gardens and building, great escape from hustle of city. Tranquil and peaceful. There is a lovely cafe and garden too.
Beautiful escape from the madness of Marrakech . Well worth a visit if you love gardens and nature. Peaceful and calm. Beautifully landscaped gardens.
Not what we expected. We visited it after a 11 days trip around Morocco, I expected it to be more surprising but it was very basic comparing other places in Morocco.
Nice place to relax. A bit expensive Entrance fee. However, you enjoy the amazing variety of trees and the wonderful combination of blue and yellow colour.
a small little garden where you can take some good pictures. keep aside an hour to visit this little garden. take some pictures and enjoy a break from the sun. wont take more than an hour.

Culture and Cacti in shady surroundings. interesting to see Yves St L. garden. the colours and layout made for some interesting meandering. Go early as it seems to get very busy later in morning and this makes it less of a pleasure and more of a struggle moving around the often narrow walkways.Do go into the adjoining Berber Museum - it was one of the most interesting small museums I have ever been in and the costumes were amazing.
Expensive oasis, best to go late in the day. Beautiful array of cactus and other local plants in calm spot just outside the old town, with signature Majorelle Blue details everywhere
Amazing and relaxing. Very well kept and amazing place. Definately worth going if your going Marrakech. Queues are a but long, but think you can buy online

Jardin Majorelle. Yves St Lauran's garden was well worth the visit. Large cacti, tropical plants and water features set amidst colourful surroundings in typical Marrakech style. We didn't visit the museum, so cannot comment on that.
Beautiful Gardens . Incredible oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Worth the stop. Peaceful and serene. About a 45 minute visit.
Gardens that you have to visit . A must see place. Beautiful and peaceful. It's small but cute... There is a museum as well and a shop store.
Pleasant Visit. Small garden and unfortunately the museum was closed. The bright and vibrant colors of the house and planters were nice for photography.
Beautiful place!. Very nice place: the colours of YSL, clean and helpful staff. Very good thing to do on an afternoon.
Enchanting . Christian:Must see in Marrakech, you can go when it is about to close, not too hot or crowded Fatima:Sharing pictures on Instagram

Little Oasis . Its nice to leave the dust and smells of the city behind. It's a little small but clean and nicely organized. To be honest we expected a little more of it. The 70 MAD per person is something I wouldnt charge for it, but in the end we were glad that we went there.

You have got to be kidding me....Do not bother. I repeat.... Absurd waste of money and especially critical time while on vacation. There is nothing reminiscent about Yves St Laurent here with the exception of his home which you cannot see. Museum shop silly overpriced items not even relating to him. (maybe they should consider selling YSL shirts or ties designs etc.) Ridiculous walk around seeing cactus that you can see anywhere in the world (Arizona) and especially the same species of boring cacti plants that line the streets of Marrakesh any day of the week. No special flowers or flora. Ridiculous.! Almost an outrage to put on an agenda for our holiday -

Pretty but a little dull. I was expecting a lot from Jardin Majorelle after reading the reviews, but it is a pretty small garden with a bunch of cactuses and a blue house - was a little under whelming...
Wonderful garden. A visit to this amazing place is a must when you are in Morocco.The most beautiful garden to have a nice relaxing walk around.Also interesting art if you like very nice paintings.

An oasis in Marrakech . It's not difficult to understand the passion of Yves Saint-Laurent for this place. If you like to have a pause and get out from the busy mess of the Sucks, that's the place to go.To the ones that have curiosity about the Berbers, the original people from the region, there is also a very interesting museum inside the garden.Obviously that the atelier/store dedicated to YSL is also not to loose.In brief, one of the indispensable places to go to those that want to discover Marrakech.
