Beautiful but disappointing . Great value for money. It is so small, I was disappointed and expected it to be a bit bigger . Even stopping to take pictures , you are finished in half an hour . The museum is poor . What is that all about . I can not believe they charged us extra for us to walk around a tiny museum in less than five minutes . The highlight of the day was chilling in their cafe . Nice and cool....... You are sprayed with sprinklers . The food was OK. I even dozed off it was that relaxing .
I loved it . 5 stars it's beautiful and well recommend. Beautiful garden, muslum is also really good. Clean, friendly people aswel
Nice but small. You pay 70 for just the gardens and 100 for both. It's not bad for a little serene time and relax for a while. Very pretty surrounding.
stunning sensual floral world. paradisecampheartfeltbeautifulfound love over the yves saint laurent designcafe of dreamsloved it
Favorite part of our visit . I could have spent the whole day here. We did both the gardens and museum, and it was beautiful. If I could go back and spend a whole day, I would!

Amazing. This is one of my favorite parks I have ever seen. It is well organized, clean and very beautiful. The cacteac are incredible. In the garden is also very nice Bereber museum with romantic night sky. I loved it!

Excellent scenery. The garden is very well maintained and has beautiful varieties of plants. Some extras add to the place, like a library, a mini exhibition, a souvenir shop, a cafeteria- though expensive. The museum is for extra charge. Overall, I felt it was nice to visit and have some scenic pictures, though overpriced for its size and time spent there.

Escape from the Moroccan Sun. Beautiful, shaded garden provides relief for the eye and escape from the sun in the August heat of Marrakech. Enjoy the tropical plants, reflecting pools, and desert cacti. I was a bit disappointed that the majority of the cacti and aloes were not native to North Africa, and it would have been helpful for an exhibit to explain the ecosystem and flora of the Sahara desert. Fans of Yves St. Laurent may enjoy the Garden's Love gallery. My friends and I were not fashionistas, but we still appreciated the garden and the Berber gallery.

Lovely morning stroll. We visited le Jardin Majorelle and the gardens were very tranquil and beautiful. The entry fee per person of 70dh (£6) was a little expensive considering it took less that 20 minutes to walk around however there was a nice coffee shop that did an excellent Americano and provided a peaceful place to rest before returning the chaotic streets of Marrakech.

Expected more. It's okay but a bit contrived the best part was the museum that houses all the beautiful Berber jewellery clothing and history so well preserved but it's an extra 30 MAD and worth it. The gardens were fine but a bit too over modernised and lack some integrity and beauty

Peaceful Oasis. A fascinating garden specialising in bamboo and an amazing cactus selection. Walked there from the old town, and quite hot, but garden itself was cool and pleasant with excellent seating - which sets it apart from other gardens in the palaces which could definitely do with seating.

Nice garden but small . It's a beautiful setting but expected a larger setting for almost usd10 entrance fee. The garden is very well taken care of. 15 minutes is all it takes to see. The museum is just one small room

Nice garden. I was quite disappointed as I imagined the gardens to be much bigger. We saw the whole place in about an hour. If you are there for a short while go see other places. I did enjoy seeing the different types of cactus and it is a lovely place to see but don't expect it to be big.

Save your money. It's a tourist trap. Well tended gardens but can't move for selfie-sticks and people posing next to giant cactuses etc. Morocco is full of beautiful gardens and public parks which are free. Check out googlemaps and head to the nearest one.
Stunning Gardens. Well worth spending a couple of hours here. Really beautiful and not expensive. Easy to find. The little cafe inside is also nice
Beautiful. Beautiful garden, it dosen't take a lot of time in there, but it is worth seeing. The blue house is so beautiful, and the museum is really good.

Luxurious relaxation . Beautiful and tranquil which helps you zone out from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Lovely winding paths with beautiful plants and colourful plant pots. There is a museum, book shop, boutique and cafe which are all lovely. Worth a visit.

Beautiful, A must visit. This is the most expensive attraction in morroco by far. Its about £3 in a taxi to get to it. located in the north of marrakech, and i would not advise walking to it as it is outside of the city walls, where it is extremely busy. Its just a garden thats very peaceful and with beautiful decor. you can also pay a little more to visit to museum there which shows the life of the nomads and the morrocan people through the centuries. have a great holiday!
Lovely. Beautiful but small. Make sure you bring cash as they don't accept cards! The staff there are very very helpful and the grounds are refreshing and clean. A nice escape from hectic Marrakech

Quaint, beautiful Berber garden. A little tricky to find unless locals guide you but totally worth a visit. They have the most beautiful museum of the Berbers in the whole of Morocco and a superb collection of tropical plants from all around the world. It is quiet and well-maintained, with a wealth of information available everywhere and a souvenir shop with typical Berber products. I can understand now why Yves Saint-Laurent lived in this city for so long.
my best jardin in the world. this place it remember me of lots of sorys about marrakech and morocco and north african civilisation. all the people they should visite this real heritage

Don't miss!. Truly exceptional gardens, a glorious oasis of exotic trees and plants, wonderful water features, vibrant colours. The Berber museum within was fascinating and beautifully presented. Tasty lunches & teas on offer in courtyard cafe.
View not to be missed. Amazing views, it's a must see. Plants from all over, beautiful fish's, waterfalls, have to bring a camera to capture all those moments and memories
Small but pretty. Difficult to find but is lovely to look around. The gardens/water features are nice but it doesn't compare to the likes of kew garden.

Lovely gardens. Lovely garden would have enjoyed better if the weather wasn't soo hot. 1hour you can cover the whole gardens. Jardin majorette is on a quiet road off the main road. Price for entry should be cheeper but your paying of the lable at the end of the day.My niece was very keen to see the gardens .

Beautiful oasis . The beautiful plants and trees provide some much needed shade. It was a little pricey at $100 Durham for the Gardens and the museum, but I highly recommend you visit. The restaurant is nice to relax in too.

Garden delight . This is a garden which I remember correctly was owned by Yves Saint Laurent (1936-2008) and is well maintained an was left to the Morrocon people...they charge tourists 100 dhs cheaper for locals ...a worth a visit only once ..or to keep kids busy!

Nice garden. Distination part of the Marrakeche tourist destinations so decided to visit. Nice well maintained garden offerring plenty of shade and places to sit down and relax. Felt the entry fee of 70 MAD too high.Spent approx 40 mins at the garden, which offerred plenty of photo opportunities. After the stroll around the garden popped in to Kaowa which is like a juice / shake bar just across from the entrance, which had a great variety of juices and drinks.
Ok. Not sure it was worth the trek out there really. It's a nice garden, but that's it really. Very expensive gift shop.
Beautiful!. Highly recommend, so beautiful and peaceful. The gardens are stunning and the blue is breathtaking. Lovely afternoon away from the chaos!

So beautiful. This was a very lush garden which surprised me in the middle of Morocco. It was smaller than I expected it to be but definitely a nice way to spend part of an afternoon. A nice easy outdoor activity.

Lovely, but skip if pressed for time. This place is absolutely lovely, don't get me wrong, but don't think it was worth the 70 dirhams/US$7 per person entrance fee. If you are well travelled, and have seen bamboo forests, rainforests, cactii, national parks/gardens before, then I'd give it a miss. The electric blue decor is nice, but cafe is expensive (ie. 120 dirhams/US12 for Chicken Tajine). We were in and out in 30 minutes. If you're pressed for time, I would skip it and visit other historical places instead

Great Place To Enjoy the Experience and Relax. We went here on with one of the tour guides and it was worth the short trip. It was 70D per person but well worth it. The story and background behind the gardens are also well worth reading as you walk through. You won't need much time here - unless you really want to sit and relax for a while. There are a lot of selfie takers here that can make it a bit crowded but it is worth a short stop.

A paradise hidden in Marrakech. The gardens are cool, vibrant, pretty and full of life. Well worth a visit especially as a respite from the heat and dryness of the city of Marrakech. If you do visit, make sure to stop into the Berber museum also. Although the museum is small and costs extra to enter it is interesting and well-laid out, which makes the visit to the gardens well worthwhile.

"ESPECTACULAR". A Great Place to go and see. Its variety of different Plants, it is espectacular. Nice to walk around, plenty of shade. You can even sit there and peacefully read a book. I recommend it.

What a blue !!! . I have to admit that I wasn't sure if I wanted to visit this place because it's very touristic. I don't regret it, it's peaceful, beautiful and refreshing ! The color are amazing "le bleu de majorelle" is The color in this garden ! If you are there go head I am sure you will have beautiful pictures ! Thanks to YSL
Beautifull garden. Best Garden in Marrakesh. Silent place where go if medina is to loud. Find gallery of love pictures and picture with your born year. You can buy this picture like a postcard.

Beautiful. Just gorgeous. The colours and the flowers and plants and stunning. Lovely way to spend a couple of hours. There's a great little coffee shop with fresh juice and nice food too. A must do in Marrakech

Stunning. Amazing gardens - tranquil and beautiful.
If you are visiting Marrakech this is a place definitely worth a visit to.

Perfect place . What an amazing garden . In the center of Marrakech u may join a peaceful and green garden . Spotless clean for 70 you will have a great time. Again and again u will see blue and yellow spots between all that green trees and red painted ground . It's fantastic on a sunny day on your pictures . The garden is easy to find , just follow the signs
Amazing . Pictures do not do this justice, it is a must go very beautiful we enjoyed every minute here. Staff are very helpful and speak English.
Peaceful retreat. Worth getting up early to beat the crowds. A beautiful and peaceful respite from the busy streets and lanes.
Beautiful!!. Relaxing and beautiful place to relax after a day shopping in the souks and the frantic action of the square

Great place to relax and appreciate natural beauty. Wonderful place. Very relaxing and a must see to escape the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Entry costs 70 dirhams and we paid 30 drhams for a taxi there and back. Highly recommend anyone to visit this amazing mixture of art and nature

Ysl gardens. Taxi cost from Hivernage to Majorelle Jardin cost us 40 dirhams. The journey was roughly 15 mins. you have to pay 70 dirhams to enter the Gardens. I did not really enjoy this. You see the same stuff outside in their natural parks. I personally don't think it was worth the visit. It's a small to medium size garden and there is a cafe inside.

Beautiful, but spoiled by selfie taking tourists.. The gardens are gorgeous, especially the contrast between the sterile desert plants and the Klein blue dominating the space. Unfortunately, we went in the middle of the day and it was pretty busy. It seems like everyone there needed a personal photo shoot of themselves looking into the distance in front of the iconic blue walls. If you're a polite person, this means you're pausing every ten paces so a dutiful husband--while balancing a purse under his arm--can finish snapping photos of his lady. It opens at 8, go early.Another tip: there is no special "tariff" for taking a taxi from the gardens. There's a que directly outside the gardens and were told it was 5€ back to our hotel (in the medina about 1.3 km away) because they have to pay to wait there. As we chuckled and walked away the price was cut in half.
Take a break from the city. The jardin is a little oasis in the mittle of this loudy city:) Walk through the plants or just relax at one of the benches in front of the blue walls
Wonderful Gardens!. We had such a wonderful visit to these gardens, such an enjoyable and inspiring place! The colors, the plants and the beautiful pathways were just a joy to explore.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens are beautiful, it feels surreal that they are in the centre of new town Marrakech. You step off the street into beautiful surroundings. Exotic plants and deep blue painted buildings. The Berber museum is full of amazing costumes, jewellery and artefacts (no photos our allowed so can't show you!) The entry fee is fairly cheap - 100dh for garden and museum combined. You can spend as little or as long time as you like but well worth a visit. Cafe and gift shops also on site.

Stunning gardens . A cool reflective garden to escape the craziness of the medina. Beautiful colours a must see. The Berber museum was very interesting and we learnt a lot about their lifestyle and way of life.
Beautiful. It's a beautiful place, but don't go right before closing time. Tge guards were hasting us so much we weren't able to enjoy

A beautiful green oasis. An amazing number of different plants is populating this wonderful green area of Marrakech. They have been collected and transplanted from all over the world. Many of them were totally unknown to me and the way they have been gathered among blue walls, red passageways and yellow vases is just so beautiful!Majorelle Garden is definitely worth a visit and if you go take the chance to visit also the Islamic art museum.

Stunning, wonderful photo opportunities!. The Jardin Majorelle was a wonderful experience! Definitely bring your camera to take pictures of the plants/flowers! I would also recommend the Berber museum, which is an additional cost, but absolutely worth it!

A very colorful place. Majorelle gardens besides being a retreat from the heat of Marrakehch, it is a wonderful place with different colors. We enjoyed walking alone and observing the exotic plants. We were very lucky; the gardens were almost empty the time we entered it. a must visit place in Marrakech.
Beautiful gardens . Stunning gardens to walk around. Not really worth the 7 euros per person as it is only a short time spent there.

Visited with a group. Been there several times and always a relief from the heat and hustle / bustle of the medina.. Calm oasis !! Interesting and a very good display of Berber clothing and artefacts. Good value cafe and great service. Allow at least one hour for this visit. More like two because gardens are very much larger than you think.

Seeking a cool retreat. We had enjoyed the bustle, heat and exotic nature of the Jemaa el Fnaa, market place but sought a quiet and cool place. Le Jardin Marjorelle is just that! It's a decent walk from the Medina and well worth the effort. We paid 100DH each, (around 10€, 7€ for the garden and 3€ for the museum), to walk the garden and look at the Berber museum. It's lovely and cool and well maintained. It belonged to Yves Saint Laurent before his death and there is a memorial to him there.

A must see!. This is a beautiful sanctuary in what can be a crazy place!We found this as a lovely place to spend an afternoon as a change from the hustle and bustle of the medina. Beautiful plants and very well kept. Lovely food at the restaurant here too!A must see for anyone visiting Marakech!

Overpriced. The best thing is that it offers a respite from the heat, 70 Dirhams is steep for a 15-30 min visit to see mainly cactii in a rather small garden. The place doesn't even have a water fountain!
A 'don't miss' attraction. Beautiful and peaceful garden in the middle of Marrakech. Very, very well done and relaxing.....certainly worth a visit.

Rip off. Arrived early and just as well because later loads of people arrived and nearly impossible to take pictures.The only plus point is the gardens are shaded so quite cool.you can walk round in 2 minutes.Was about £8 to get in,only stayed 15 minutes and that included a drink in cafe,which aint cheap.

Beautiful gardens. Loved this place. The colors there are spectacular. Although many people thought we were crazy going in the middle of the day when it is so hot, we actually enjoyed it because it is all shaded. It wasn't bad at all. We liked the Berber Museum too - worth the extra 3 DHS and the cafe was nice as well.

An oasis in the hear. My second visit to the Majorelle gardens and I enjoyed it just as much this time. The Berber museum is well worth visiting too. Take time for mint tea and pastries in the outdoor cafe which is pleasantly shaded with a fountain in the centre. Very pretty. A little bit of heaven in the hot hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

it's a beautiful calm place. if you have the time to walk around and enjoy the view, take pictures and imagine living there back in the day, it will make you enjoy it even more, the entry fee is a bit expensive but i loved it nevertheless
#1 Spot in Marrakech. If you found the rest of Marrakech dusty and hot, treat yourself to an afternoon in the gardens! There is also a cafe serving drinks and light fare.

The Square. I ve been here before the throng of people always surprises me. Due to the hot weather (40 o C) people including locals dare out after 6pm. Whilst here there was a mini concert taking place which brought even more people out. The long lines of dining areas are also a treat as there is lots to eat and a very wide variety of food.

OK. I can not explain the reasons why I did not like it...I think it is ok.
It is a nice garden. But I don't think it is worth it the long queue and ticket price...unless you are a super-fan of Yves Saint Laurent...
Better and more interesting things to do in Marrakech in my opinion.

YSL garden. We spent a couple of hours here to explore Yve's garden and Berber museum. The garden was stunning and museum was informational. While this was lovely, I am not sure that I would go out of my way to visit again. There is so much to see in the Medina and wider Marrakesh area, but if you need a little break from the hustle and bustle then this will suffice for a couple of hours.
Don't Miss The Museum. You have to visit the museum. It gives a lot of informations about the Amazigh. And don't forget to show your student id to get discounts.

Beautiful but small. This is a lovely venue and definitely worth a visit. The gardens are lovely and a little oasis in the heat and chaos of Marrakech. The Berber museum is interesting but a little on the small side with effectively 3 rooms of artefacts to see. One of these rooms is darkened with ceiling lights and mirrors clearing a starlit sky effect.What I would recommend is the cafe in the gardens, a tranquil ambience with cool sprays of water and a good selection of food and drinks.

Mrs S Sharma. Absolutely loved the gardens:) The plants were just amazingly beautiful! Yves Saint Laurent's memorial is there which was news to us. Apparently he owned the Majorelle Gardens. Definitely must see!

Mesmerising morning. By going early in the morning you can avoid the crowds. I got there at 8:10, just after they opened, I was the first on in. It was wonderful, everything to myself and the gardeners watering the plants. When you get there this early you can watch the turtles and frogs in the ponds. At about 9:30am it was like busloads of visitors arrived and it was impossible to enjoy the tranquility like before.My advise; get there early! Perfect way to start the day!

My favourite place in Marrakech . This was by far the my favourite place I visited in Marrakech. The gardens are a photographers dream, every area of the garden is inspiring. We got a taxi from the city centre which was reasonably priced. It took us around one hour to view the gardens however it could be visited in a shorter or even longer amount of time.

Colorful and different. This beautyful Garden by Yves Saint Laurent is really a must go!The mix between the architecture, the typical blue yellow... Very chilling, stylish and different to all gardens i saw so far.

Serene atmosphere amongst the mayhem of Marrakech.. Just a beautiful setting, well stocked and maintained gardens. The canopy keeps the sun off and a tranquil café in the courtyard. Berber museum worth the extra.
Must go. In the trip to morroco you need to see this.Beautiful and organized you will definitely take good photos :)Enjoy the ride going there with a horse.
Worth the Trip. A nice little trip from the Old Town into the colonial part of town. A good way to spend a few hours.

I keep going back and could go again!. This was my 3rd visit to the Jardin and as I've been in different seasons I get a different (equally wonderful) experience every time but I could go again quite happily. It's a beautiful place in which to relax but also to take tea, eat a good lunch or visit the Berber museum. I would highly recommend.

Striking colours and peaceful surroundings. If there is one reason to visit these gardens, go for the colour. I am obsessed with 'Yves Klein Blue' (having studied History of Art at University) and these gardens are filled with the exotic hue. The synthetic shade of blue contrasts so wonderfully with the natural greens and dusty oranges of the gardens and you'll be sure to come away with the most beautiful holiday snaps to the envy of all your friends. It's basically instagram heaven. Yves Saint Laurent certainly knew what he was doing when he designed these gardens.The gardens are big: you can meander round for over an hour, gazing into the pools and exploring the winding paths. There are lots of beautiful vistas and exotic plants to catch your eye and the location is very peaceful and serene out of the way of the main city centre.

Amazing blue. It was such a beautiful garden! The blue majorelle is everywhere combined with other vibrant colours. Such a beautiful garden. Very nice cafe to visit and shop. Also the Love Room is amazing! Not to be missed

A constant favourite. I have lived in Marrakech for ten years now, and the Majorelle Gardens are a place that I never tire of visiting.At any time of the year, it is always colourful and uplifting. Some people are disappointed by it, being used to contemporary gardens of today. However, when you realise when it was designed and created, it was well in advance of its time!This garden is a true oasis in the city, and worth giving yourself at least 2 – 3 hours to really enjoy it, along with the museum and cafe.The Berber Museum is the best presented in Marrakech, high lighting the wonderful costumes and jewellery of the Berber people throughout Morocco. Definitely not to be missed!The cafe is a lovely place to spend a lunch or snack, cool tranquil and relatively inexpensive.From experience, the quietest time to visit the gardens is between 12.30 and 2.30 when everyone is having lunch.

Beautiful oasis of calm. Fabulous gardens, an absolute dream for photographers. The gardens were very quiet when we visited (10am 16/08/2016) and the Berber arts museum attached (well worth seeing) was empty.
Wonderful Architecture. Love the burst of colors and how the garden was designed. Very artsy. Took a bunch of great pictures here.
Oasis..... Really nice surprise in the middle of the city, cool, shaded and very peaceful, good value at around £8 for the garden and museum too

beautiful garden. this is a nice peaceful placed to visit on a hot day. Quiet and calming. The majorelle blue color is beautiful and you can even buy cans of the paint in the boutique. The boutique has really nice things to buy. I did not know much about Majorelle and it would have been nice to buy a post card or something wiith his work on it. His work is not displayed at al.
So expensiv. Dont visit this Garden it is to expensiv. There are so many Gardens for free i wouldnt visit it again
So expensiv. Dont visit this Garden it is to expensiv. There are so many Gardens for free i wouldnt visit it again

Magical Place. Me and my wife were very excited to visit this place. We really love YSL and the history. The place was clean though it was pretty hot when we visited, but it was great to take beautiful photos. The house was very eye-catchy with blue paint. So in love with this place.
Beautiful. A small oasis in Marrakech. Beautifully kept, very safe and not too busy. Beautiful plants and architecture. If you need to get away from the city it's a lovely place to send an hour or 2.

Every kind of Cactuses. This plc is amazing .you can see every kind of Cactuses and some other plants from all aroud the world in this garden.If you think this is made for love its amazing YSL build this garden for his lover.What a great thing !
Great day trip. We loved these gardens, the museum and the gift shop. The grounds are incredible; the colors, the plants and pools. Highly recommend visiting.

Underwhelmed. This garden is very nice, but we were surprised how small and simple it is. If it was free, I may think more highly of it, but the admission (and cab rides) for a family of 5, was not worth it.
Beautiful. Please don't miss this jewel, it is a wonderful park/museum/gallery/store and there are very nice stores outside.
A must see. I love all the colors, it feels like you step into a Matisse painting. The cafe is a must visit and the gift shop is a must indulge.
just beautiful!. a must see ! Beautifully designed garden, so clean and well kept...the Maison of YSL is really fantastic! Lovely coffe shop , excellent service, very nice staff at the souvenir shop.

Tranquility in the heart of the city. Not much of a garden person but it is possible for everyone to enjoy the landscaping and the serenity of the gardens. There are alot of cactus (cacti?) there but so many different shapes and sizes and that is impressive in itself.We spent about an hour there walking around and sat in the cafe for ice cream and drink.Next year there is a YSL musuem opening and that also looks worth seeing.

Tranquility in the middle of Marrakesh. We walked from Sofitel to the Jardins Majorelle on a hot day. The garden offers shade and tranquility. I best liked the high bamboo and the Mexican cactus garden.
Kids liked watching the turtles in the pond.
With 70 Dh per person quite hefty, considering the price level

Worth a visit. Great garden tucked away behind some very high walls. Perfect spot for a bit of respite from the heat - at 70 dirham it is a little pricy for quite a small park.
Still, it's worth a look around. The cafe inside is pricy but very good.

A beautiful photo Opportunity. BE sure to visit. This is selfie city! The museum is worth the price of admission. Be sure to sit and have water in the cafe under the mist jets and take in the sounds of the birds. Heaven.

A haven of cool and calm in Marrakech. Smaller than I had expected, but very beautiful. It's well worth the extra to visit the Berber Museum, fantastically presented, especially the jewellery room (and jewellery is totally not my thing!).

Tranquility. A wonderful place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. It's a pity there wasn't more art by YSL or pictures of him in the gardens. But that doesn't detract from a lovely way to spend a morning.
So so.... The Garden is a good place to visit espcially when it is very hot, but the price is so expensive comparing with you will see.

Stunning Gardens - worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit. These stunning gardens are tranquil and really beautiful. As we visited in August we were there early to avoid the heat but it is quite shaded so felt cool. We also visited the Berber Museum in the gardens, which was great and holds a stunning array of jewellery! My only downside (and it really isn't a downside) is that I thought YSL would have had a more ornate memorial.It's not to get away from the hustle and bustle of the town centre too.

Nice garden, but cafe is well overpriced. This is a nice place to escape the heat and the hassle in Marrakesh and enjoy a nice walk around the exotic plants and the nice water lakes in this garden. There is also a Berber museum but with extra charge. After about an hour walk, we decided to set in the cafe and have some Moroccan tea, but this was way too expensive and nothing special about it. I would suggest taking drinks with you.

Beautiful and unique . Majorelle was the most beautiful garden I have been to. I have never before seen most of the plants or flowers. Even the cactus was interesting. There is also a lovely cafe. Both are very peaceful.

Great attraction! . We heard so much about this garden that we had to visit it during our one week trip to Marrakech. It's really beautiful garden with some stunning plants and surprisingly well maintained. We didn't go to the museum part as we didn't have much time and we were told the garden closes at 6pm. So if you are planning to go in hot summer days then go early in the morning. The coffee shop was ok bit untidy and as expected little expensive. The ticket to the garden was 70 Moroccan dirhams and the entry to the museum around 30, both were coming up to approximately £18 per person! But worth a visit!

Beautiful gardens. A 10 minute taxi ride from centre of Marrakech, this is definitely worth a visit. Away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech, a wonderful setting with lovely plants, water features,pathways as well as a nice (although quite expensive) café.

A oasis of calm in the heat of the city. Beautifully designed, yet managing to have a sense of the natural. So fresh and green in the midst of the heat and dust of Marrakech. Very well worth a visit. The surroundiing restaurants are very stylish - very French. One could almost imagine one was dining in Paris!. Good taxi service back to our Riad and the Medina

Worth The Visit To Escape The City . I always go to tourist attractions first thing in the morning so that I (usually) have the place to myself, to enjoy quietly at my own pace and take unobstructed photographs. I got there at 8:15am and already there was a full tour bus walking into the gardens and a school field trip entered after me. The property and gardens are just as majestic in person as they are in the pictures. The workers were also painting the morning of my visit which was unfortunate. The merchandise at the gift shop was not on par with the experience, and the store should be rethought. The cafe was open but there was no one working. I sat waiting for 10 minutes before deciding to find breakfast elsewhere. I did not pay to enter the Berber Museum inside.

Beautiful mysterious garden!. This beautiful garden is must to see when you are in Marrakech. It is a place with plants from five continents which Jacque Majorelle brought from his travels. It is a calme oasis in Marackech.
Wow. Came to see the YSL gardens last month despite the mega hot temperatures it was worth it, lovely place with a wealth of history and just nice to take a stroll around.

Quite nice. A very special attraction in Marrakech! Here you can see what the French have created in Morocco and if allowed, what will continue to be maintained, unlike other sites, which rot away more and more.

Beautiful!. Totally stunning garden and a welcome relief from the Marrakesh heat! The Art Deco artist studio painted Marjorelle blue is just stunning. And the pact that all proceeds go to various educational and botanical charities make the 70d entrance fee worth it.

Lovely gardens. The gardens were beautiful and a lovely place to get away from the heat of the day. They are slightly smaller than expected (and therefore a bit crowded) and the coffee shop expensive, but it is still well worth visiting!
Relaxing. Calm garden bien situated and specially the memorial of yves saint lauren a restaurant inside which serves the traditional food

Must visit. So near to busy roads.School trips visit and sound noisey outside but once inside it is so tranquil even with all the people visiting and you cant hear the traffic either, really couldnt understand how this was..perhaps a bit magical like this place .well worth a visit its beautiful .
Boring.. Visited once as I felt this was one of the must see sights in Morocco; overrated and boring. Nice to take pics for the teenagers but that's the only positive. Waste of time and money.

Gorgeous place. At 70dh it was by far the most expensive attraction we visited in Morocco, but it was well worth it. The vast array of cacti were surprisingly interesting, and the majestic bamboo sheltered us from the heat. The water features - some with terrapins - were very peaceful, even with quite a few other visitors. The blue majorelle really is a stunning colour, and the house was absolutely gorgeous. We spent well over 90 minutes here, but would happily have stayed longer. It's a very relaxing place.
Wonderful history and art. Sometimes you just don't know someone's history until you stumble across these little gems that add a dimension to someone famous' life
A Garden Gem in the middle of Marrakech. It's a small garden that has amazing scenery. This is a nice tropical get away from the chaotic city!
Obviously Wonderful . Simply lovely and of course highly recommended. Do take the time take a walk, discover, have a coffee at the Cafe and a look at the super nice shop.

A little piece of paradise. A very peaceful place, must-visit if you even pass by the Red City.. I really did enjoyed every little moment in this cute garden full of different spicies of plants, moreover the color are matching each other and the architecture is really great. A pure pleasure for the eyes!
Gardens. These gardens were good but not amazing or what we were expecting. They were really expensive and you had to pay again to go to the museum. They weren't really that big either

Cool place, however I expected more.. Went here on the advice of some of the other residents at the hotel I was staying in (Riu Tikida Palmereai) I was underwhelmed, however I must say that the actual garden was beautiful and was very cool in the sun, which I appreciated. I felt the price was steep considering you could walk around it about 20-30 mins (70 dirham entry) I know this is not much, but I felt that the locals price of 40 dirham was a much more accurate reflection of what should be paid to visit here. Despite this, it is worth a visit and I did enjoy it.

Nice visit. Beautiful and well kept garden with a very nice Berber museum.Lots of plants, trees and flowers from allover the world.Wellworth a visit, 7€ for the garden and 3€ for the museum, to be paid at the entrance
Worth a visit. This garden is small it delightful. Amazing cacti of all shapes and sizes and so well laid out. Although it was fairly crowded it was peaceful. Good cafe.

A fest for the eyes. It was my second time in Jardin Majorelle, I visit it very quickly because of the heat and the tourists, and I do recommend if one comes in August like me should definitely visit in the morning as early as possible. I wanted to go to the Berbere museum situated in the old Jacques Majorelle Atelier and the Memorial Yves Saint Laurent, but I didnt go in because of these factors. However, even just visiting briefly i can say that this garden is a unique feast for the eyes. It is an attraction one cant miss if one wants to understand Yves Sain Laurent artistic heritage.

Peaceful. Among the busy city of Marrakesh this tranquil garden is a perfect place to visit to get some quite. Although it isn't massive it has beautiful plants and is lovely to visit, highly recommend

Beautiful!!. The garden is beautiful and colorful. It is great for taking pictures.it takes less than an hour to finish it.The museum inside the garden is ok, we paid30 drhams for the museum, we were the only people inside the museum which is too small and can get done in 10 minutes.So if you not really into museums, just skip it.The cafe is overpriced, we paid 15 drhams for small bottle of water. So make sure to bring your own water bottle.Overall, it is a must visit here in Marrakech .

Paradise. This was my second visit to these beautiful gardens. I would advise going early in the day or late in the day to avoid masses of people. The cost to gain entry is 70 dh for the gardens plus 30 dh for the Berber museum which is a must if you want to learn more about the Berber people of Morocco. The gardens are kept in a superb condition and are a selfie lovers dream. Beautiful viewpoints are at every turn. The colour of the cobalt blue is truly magnificent. You can purchase the paint in the gift shop alongside many expensive items of quality designed by the gardens creative designer. The staff are very polite and there is a beautiful courtyard cafe to have a coffee and a bite to eat. I recommend the club sandwich. Toilets in the this location and kept to a high standard. You must visit the museum where you will see the finest examples of Berber clothing textiles and jewellery anywhere in the world. I wish I could recreate this beautiful environment in my own garden back home in the uk.
One of the nicest places in Marrakesh. It is like a completely different world to the rest of Marrakesh. We really enjoyed our time in Jardin Majorelle. It is definitely worth the money.

Amazing . Such an amazing and calm place to visit and stay in for hours. The thing I loved there is they have a bookshop so you can buy a book and read it there in their calm park. And when you leave the park you will have so many cafes and Resturant to eat in. One of my favorite spots in this beautiful city

Beautiful but overpriced. The gardens were beautiful with many varieties of plants. A nice way to spend an hour if it's not too hot. However, compared to all the other sights we visited it was quite expensive, more than double the price (70dhm)

Beautiful . Getting here was a bit of a mission as I was staying in the Medina but we'll worth it. A lovely place to being a book. Tourist prices but u expected it. I think k u paid 70DH. Which is about a fiver for the gardens only. So beautiful. Saw turtles mating ha! The cacti are amazing and the colours re spectacular. I cannot fault it. I had lunch in the cafe there. Stunning courtyard where blossoms fell to the ground all around. I had nice tea nd cous cous. The staff were polite. Would go back

Nice gardens.. The Yves Saint Laurent fondation took great care of the gardens. They have a lot of exotics variety of cactus and différents plants!! The little museum they have there it's all blue! Really nice!

Beautiful and Well-worth a visit.. If you are in Marrakech, you must stop by this place! It is truly an amazing collection of floral and faunas. I'm not even a big naturalist person, and I loved this!
Nice place. Nice place for walking and taking some wonderful and colorful pictures!! ;) The only disadvantage was the they were asking you extra money for the museum interrior

Amazing!. So beautiful, I would highly recommend stopping here to anyone who visits Marrakech! Such beautiful gardens and colorful architecture, very cool to see the history behind it and YSL's life as well.

A beautiful garden, really peaceful to walk through.. This was a lovely garden, and would recommend to those visiting Marrakesh. It's full of lovely cacti and succulents..It was nice to slowly walk through and see all parts of the gardens at my own pace. It wasn't too busy so you could walk calmly and truly enjoy the beauty and walk through more than once - which is what we did, taking breaks under the shade of the tall bamboo plants.The gardens to make a nice place for some good photos!

Calm oasis. Thought 70dh maybe bit expensive compared with other Moroccan places you can visit and garden isn't huge but there is something special about this place. It's a quiet serene oasis - go earlier in morning to enjoy the tranquility of the gardens.

Very disappointing - go to other impressive gardens in the city instead!. We visited the gardens a couple of days ago and were hugely disappointed. Gardens are generally pleasant to visit, but there is nothing special about this one, so use your time and money to visit other much more impressive gardens in the city, such as the Mamounia's. In Majorelle, they built bamboo fences throughout the place that ruin the view, glass would have integrated much better with the greens. It is generally small and doesn't feel particularly Moroccan. We didn't mind that there weren't a lot of areas to sit and relax because we didn't see a reason to spend much time there. Because it's small and they allow a lot of people at any given time, it is even hard to take a photo of something you like without strangers in the background. The museum is very small and all in French (French is fine for me, but for others they had to see the English explanations when entering a room and hope to remember which artifacts each portions referred to!). The coffee shop is nice, though a bit overpriced.NOTE: If you take a taxi, don't be surprised if the driver tries to drop you a couple of blocks before arriving at the actual gardens, in a busy 4-lane road you need to cross without a traffic light. At the start when you agree on a price, also make sure he agrees to drop you right in front.
Cute. We had a good weather and we took beautiful pictures.We spent 1 hour there and it is enough.. not too much to see but it was a nice walk.

Cactus and Lotus Pond. If only for the different cacti you should pay this place a visit. It's cool even during the warm July month and everything is well organized. They also have clean comfortable bathrooms if anyone's wondering ;)

Beautiful but very busy. This garden is a real oasis. It's packed full of succulents and cacti on a backdrop of bright blue and yellow walls.We arrived in the early afternoon and queued for about 15 mins to get in. The entrance charge was 70D, probably a little steep for the size of the garden which didn't take long to walk around. Nevertheless, it's a great place for photos. If you can avoid everyone else, that is! The cafe is worth a visit too - very efficient and cool.

A must visit in Marrakech. The stunning gardens are a must do on your trip to Marrakech. The colors were stunning and there is some nice history documented in a leaflet you receive upon entry. there is a small museum as well and the YSL museum is due to open next year

One more stop in Marrakesh. We visited the Jardin Majorelle out of curiosity after reading online. The place was captivating with all the exquisite plants. But there was no tour guide to give good description. You are all on your own at this one.
Brilliant colour. If your into design and art it's a must see its peaceful enclave very green nice experience in the middle of a very dry environment

Great place. It is indeed a great place, be sure to check it if you travel to Marrakech.
The price to enter the jardin is 70 dirhams and the museum inside is 30 dirhams

Oasis of calm in busy Marrakech. We spent a restful time in this shady, tranquil spot on a day when it was 46C. Loved the varied collection of plants, the whole story of its history, and the memorial toYves St Laurent. That amazing majorelle blue provides such a contrast to the muted greens.
An oasis . Came here in 2011 and again July 2016. A beautiful garden well worth the visit. Take your time and soak in the very special blue colour.

A nice respite. We spent a few hours here on a very hot day. It is a pleasant, rather shady tropical garden with quite a few benches. The museum is small but interesting and it is air conditioned! The boutique is worth a look (also cool) although very expensive. The café lunch was delicious though not a bargain. Special note: the ticket window does not take credit cards but the café does.

Best day in Marrakech. The day we visited here was easily the best one of the holiday. Decided to get a taxi from the centre who dropped us really far away so we were a bit stressed trying to find the place but when we did, instantly relaxed. Food and mint tea in the cafe was really good quality and reasonable price. Museum really interested and lovely lovely garden, could have sat on one of the benches all day.

The visit to this fascinating place will never leave you. Visited with my sister August 2015 for a special birthday the colours are captivating the majorelle blue colour isamazing, within the grounds are the memorial gardens to yves Saint lauren who loved the gardens and once had a home here.walk the pathways among the wonderful planting and soak up the tranquility of it all.
Beautiful place!. A calm getaway in the hectic city of Marrakech! The blue house and the garden are beautiful. Easy accessible with taxi.

Nice garden probably not worth making an effort to visit. A small and pleasant garden but nothing to write home about so will stop here...but as there is a minimum word requirement I have to say more. There are a couple of small water features, so fish and turtles along with YSL art and museum
Beautiful garden. Worth a visit, cool under the trees and take hundreds of pictures there. Must go especially in hot days !

Serene gardens. Beautiful collection of cactus, shrubs, and bamboo giving a great rest bite from the mad Marrakech sun. Very popular. Also great insight into the Berber culture in the museum. Incredible Yves Saint Laurent love art room. Well worth a visit!

Beautiful garden!. We visited the garden during August and visited between 10:00 - 12:00. It was relatively busy at this time, and it was getting quite hot, however, the many trees offered some great shade.Previous to my visit to Marrakech I had seen many photos of the garden which I thought looked incredible and it really does love up to expectations.We travelled from the ClubHotel Riu Tikida Palmeraie hotel which took about 20 minutes in a taxi and cost around 100 MAD both ways, and there is a taxi rank directly outside for easy access when exiting.The gardens are 70 MAD per person entree however to look in the Berber museum is an extra cost. The beautiful gardens provide great photos, and there is also a lovely little cafe situated inside which sprays light water to cool down if sat outside which is welcomed. We enjoyed a lovely mint tea which was 30 MAD per person.I would highly recommend visiting the majorelle gardens!

Peaceful place. Jardin is a place you visit, when you need a day off from Marrakech old medina hustle and bustle. It's a peacefull place where you can rest, it has also a restaurant inside, people are soo nice.

Beautiful Must-See. Go early and spend some time here before the crowds swarm. Really magnificent garden with INCREDIBLY cacti that are easily hundreds of years old. It's just a great collection with magnificent colors. Definitely go here

Yves st Laurent and majorelle 👌🏻. If you are interested in gardens and an intense mixture of pop art colours this is the place for you. Stunning back drops for budding photographers. The 'love' gallery of yves st Laurent and the memorial are great in our opinion. We spent hours here as we were keen to photograph, sit in the shade and also eat at the well presented cafe. There is also a book shop in which post cards can be purchased at usual museum prices.Students receive a good discount! Otherwise 70 plus 30 for the museum to enter pp. Staff are friendly and offered to take photos of us so full length shots looked great against the vibrant colours. We did tip one as he captured some beautiful shots of us and spent a good ten minutes expressing his skills The mixed cacti has inspired a new garden area for us.Not much to do for children and the area is not huge so needs to be something of interest to you in order to enjoy.

Too late. We planned on visiting the gardens/park. As we discovered on arrival it was more like an botanic garden with expensive entrance fee (70 dh each) and only open until 18.00. Cant say anything about the inside cause we arrived too late. (gave 4 starts cause this isnt anything to blame the gardens, just a warning for fellow tripadvisors :) )

Beautiful place. You can't come to Marrakech and not visit this place. We didn't on our first trip here but went this time. It was beautiful gardens and very shady from the very hot sun this time of year so was ideal for a nice day time family visit.

Lovely but not the most amazing garden. The garden was lovely - peaceful. I was a little disappointed by the lack of Moroccon plants. If it were cheaper, I'd go again just to read a book but not great value for money. The love gallery was my favourite! Be sure to stop by when you go.
Elegantly delightful.. This was an unmissable visit. The gardens are a peaceful oasis in the hustle of Marrakech. I'll not say more, go and enjoy.
Jardin Majorel. It was nice and gained new info about YSL. Guide had fluent English and full of energy. It is a nice place to visit. I recommend it.

Terrific museum, nice gardens, but potentially overpriced. We really enjoyed the terrific Berber museum, and the gardens were quite pleasant, but the cost (100 dirham per person for the museum and gardens) was quite steep for what it was.
Beautiful. Wonderful place to visit. So many different species of trees to see. Very relaxing to stroll round away from the heat as the trees provide lots of shade.Highly recommend a visit

pleasant . enjoyable 45 minutes spent wandering the jardin. lovely plants and scenery, it costs a little more to enter the Berber Museum but it's only 30 mad. the gallery was just as nice and we enjoyed our visit!

Nice break from busy city. Although quite a distance from main town, this was a welcome rest from the blistering heat. the gardens are beautiful and water features include fountains, and ponds with fish and frogs. Lovely.

Nice oasis in the heart of Marrakech . Both gardens and museum. Visited the gardens on a very hot day, beautifully landscaped with various bamboo trees, palm trees and cacti. Multiple ponds and fountains. Good for about 60-90 min visit. Out of the old town, so plan on a taxi ride or horse carriage. We took the horse carriage from Gamae al fanaa and back for about 2 hours including the visit, very pleasant.
A must-visit for whoever goes to Marrakech . One the highlights of our visit to Marrakech! A jewel in the heart of Marrakech. The cafeteria is also a very nice place to have a refreshment.

A beautiful oasis. Jardin Marjorelle is a treasure in Marrakech. It is a well kept example of Moroccan architecture. We enjoyed waking around. I imagined St. Laurent and his guests enjoying themselves in the cool of the gardens. I've heard that St. laurent museum will open in the fall of 2017. That is another reason for me to return to Marrakech. The bright blue of the house and accents throughout the grounds is stunning.

Get up early before the tour buses. Pleasant to visit to get away from the Marrakech masses. We arrived at the same time as a tour bus and found the gardens busy. The Berber museum was well worth the extra payment and recommended, if just to cool off..!

Must Do in Marrakesh!!. Its best to come in the evening when the light is prettiest and crowds are not as big. Take the taxi from your riad/hotel as the walk would be uneventful, hot, and sunny. After your list here, go shopping across the street as there are great boutiques with wonderful things!!! Garden is beautiful, absolutely amazing...

A peaceful retreat.. A peaceful retreat from the heat.Lovely garden with the sounds of running water, all shaded under huge trees. I can see why YSL loved this place. We also saw the collection of Berber jewellery and clothing which was interested but a small collection.They have a lovely restaurant, again in a shaded court yard. You can have a fresh juice while listening to the birds singing!Our kids loved the turtles in the pond!It is 100 dirham for garden and museum which is expensive if you compare it to other attractions, however the money is used in Morocco so we didn't mind paying it.

Colours!. The blue here is truly memorable.Seems privy to get in, 70 dirhams for the gardens and 30 for the museum. The garden is small but we'll tended, but as a family our main area of enjoyment was the museum. Top quality and gave the sort of insight that we have failed to appreciate in bigger museums in the past.We would recommend the café afterwards - especially the passion fruit sorbet - truly flavoursome!!!!!!
Haven within a very hot city. Great there early avoid the crowds and make the most of cooler weather, its small but pretty and worth a see. It opens at 8am so arrive at this time.

Beautiful garden in central Marrakech. This is a gorgeous stop. It's not particularly big, nor is it particularly cheap to get in to see it, but it's beautiful. The grave of Yves Saint Laurent rests here.

An hour of serenity away from the heat... You can't really miss this based on the fact that every guide to Marrakech includes it somewhere in the itinerary, but - coming from someone who doesn't yet think of himself as a green-fingered garden-lover - it was well worth the visit and a welcome break from the sun. And as almost the entire garden is under the canopy of trees and sky-reaching flora, it is wonderfully cool and really hardly something that anyone in their right mind can complain about. Unless you prefer the 43-degree heat lurking outside the garden walls.
Pleasure. A wonderful garden to visit with benches to stop relax and take in the garden well worth a visit. Our advice is to get a taxi there its very cheap.

Nice garden, but not a good value for money. It is a beautiful garden, but costs 7 euros. You've seen the whole garden in half an hour, so 7 euros is a bit much for half an hour.The only disappointment was the bad value for money, but it is still a must see!

Beautiful gardens & Berber museum inside well worth the additional fee. I walked to the Jardine Majorelle from the Riad I stayed at in Mouassine. It was easy to find and cost 100 Dirham to get in to see the gardens plus the Berber museum. I'm not sure what I was expecting but what I found and saw was certainly more than I imagined. The gardens are beautiful and were a really calm shaded walk and the Berber museum, which I think I am right in saying had some interior design/layout input from YSL himself, was much more than I imagined. Rather than be a small number of rooms simply full of artefacts, the layout and design of the decor definitely took it up a notch and the jewellery room was awesome. The Love Gallery where you'll find exhibits of the annual postcards YSL sent to friends is cool and I purchased a souvenir book with copies of each postcard inside. The amazing blue house itself is well worth seeing in person as the photos don't do it justice! I was tempted to buy a pot of the "Majorelle Blue" paint sold in the boutique shop after seeing it! I had a small salad plus mint tea in the gardens cafe which was also good.

Overrated.. I found the place overrated and expensive - perhaps it's just because there are so many much nicer botanical gardens anywhere in Europe. The only real value in this attraction is that it is different from anything else you're going to see in Marrakesh. The YSL memorial was disappointing. Also, the place is far from the city center so you need to take a taxi there. Next time I'd go to Bahia palace instead.

A short simple beautiful trip. We took this trip whilst on holiday at the Aqua Mirage - a small but beautiful garden & the cactus plants are wonderful! All shapes & sizes. The pond with the Lilly pads is very pretty & the Terrapins/Turtles are so cute & lots of them too!I would suggest you have something else planned as well as visiting this garden as we were there for an hour & it was just right.The gift shops here were far too expensive for our pockets.

Stunning. Entry is 70 dihrams for the gardens and 30 dihrams for the museum. This is the price for foreigners. These are lovely gardens with a selection of plants from around the world. There are also some lovely ponds with turtles! The museum is also very interesting and has cards in English at the beginning of each room explaining everything - a relief if you can't speak French well. Well worth the extra 30 dihrams to get in. It also has an Yves saint-Laurent exhibition at the end. Well worth a visit.

Must see. Beautiful gardens very well kept, the colours are stunning, great photo opportunities.
Go early in the morning to avoid the place gets crowded.

Just Beautiful. Jardín Majorelle is a must-see park in Marrakech. We visited when it was 105 outside making it a perfect cool down rest stop but it would be perfect anytime. The small garden is interesting with beautiful colors. We had a light lunch in the outdoor cafe, cooled off by discreetly-placed mist sprinklers. The museum is worth the small price of admission - it houses interesting Berber clothing, jewelry and weapons. There are several shops across the street to peruse after the visit. Taxis and caleches are plentiful right outside.

Blue!!. In my opinion, this is something you want to see during your trip. As far as gardens go, it's not necessarily the most beautiful I have ever seen, but it is certainly unique with the blue theme throughout. I also found it to be very peaceful and it is of course, nice to look at.

Average - over priced . Firstly price to enter is a little too much Secondly the garden is nice. But for those who actually plan to go there and sit down and relax doing nothing.The museum is not worth it unless you are really interested in the history. When inside you are informed no pictures are allowed which is a shame. Also they stand on your head like hawks to make sure you don't. Also felt like they wanted is out within minutes.The cafe doesn't have much variety. Only good to sit down and have a coffee or tea.I can see why this is rated highly. But just was not my cup of tea.

An oasis in busy city. Our guide book said not to leave Marrakech without visiting these gardens so we didn't. They are small but absolutely beautiful, with the plants, cacti, mosaics, tiles and fountains. They are well kept and although it does not take long to wander around the gardens are well worth the visit and the entrance fee!

Lovely atmosphere. The garden itself is a really nice place to chill out and just walk around if you have spare time. I managed to spend about 2 hours here, including a little break at the garden cafe. I definitely recommend visiting this place if plants and greenery are your thing. Especially cacti... There's lots and lots of cacti...
Not just another green place. Yes it's pricey, but when you see the gardeners etc you will see why.. (Cafe is pricey though - but if you don't mind it is also lovely!)

Superb memory to yves St Laurent. After parking our horse & carriage we spent one minute refreshed by cool spray thoughtfully sprayed on the waiting queue - the garden is elegant, shaded, a world of cactus & bamboo. Twenty minutes we were back with ' Cocotte' & ' Minute' the duo of amazing horses with toothless driver Mohammed who together canmanage to drive faultlessly through the traffic - to me this drivingexercise and odour of the horses was the highlight of my trip to theMajorelle Gardens which in 2017 will be complemented by a newSt Laurent museum. Bravo to Pierre Bergé for orchestrating thisoasis of culture.

Botanic garden. It is worth a visit, because it is a nice garden with lot of shade and beautiful cactus. But the number one attraction in all of Marrakech seems to be too much, unless your expectations where only to see a botanic garden, then you are at the right place. Don't eat at the cafe, it is overpriced. The Berber museum is worth a visit, you can by tickets to it after you entered the garden, you do not have to buy at the entrance.
great place. lovely gardem, nice place to take pictures and visit. they dont offer food,so i recommend go after breakfast

Beautiful Plants !. I absolutely love this garden ! the colors, the plants are just amazing , unique and beautiful ! The museum is very interesting with unique pieces !
It's best to visit in the late afternoon if you are in Marrakesh during the summer !
And take a lot of pictures !
Unmissable. There is something very seductive about these gardens and the buildings scattered throughout. A lovely cafe on site is an absolute must visit..even just for a mint tea.

Stunning gardens. Definitely worth a visit! Get there early or later to avoid the heat. Wander around the beautiful cactus gardens, take a seat in the shade or have a cool drink in the cafe. Great Berber museum and lovely gift shop.
Tranquility! . We visited in early into our trip and are so glad we did. Very beautiful experience and it is a must for anyone visiting. The colours are so vibrant and engaging. We were blown away!

Beautiful garden!. A nice place to visit if you are looking for things to do in Marrakech.
fyi: Cost of entry has increased to 70 Dirhams (7 euro) as of late July 2016.

Average. The fee is expensive Compare to other sight seeing in Morroco.Marakesh is so hot in July and visiting this garden in afternoon (13pm)wasn't a good idea.It is not very big garden .There were few types of Cactus and huge trees and very little flower. for people who visited extremely beautiful garden with colorful and fragrant flowers in Iran or other countries it wouldn't be interesting.This garden is located on walking distance from Mirage delux hotel.
wonderful place. We had great time here, really fresh backyard! We really appreciate it after the warm weather of the city
Good place!. We really enjoyed this visit, It is a lovely place with lots of turists, Lovely gardens, with some spectacular plants. Museum is interesting, but limited,

Major $ Gardens!. The entrance is a little pricey but once you go in you are in for a treat. This place is awesome. Loved their color schemes and all the plants they have. Cactus looks very pretty here. Lots of Insta worthy spots here ! The Moroccon blue is so captivating.
Beautiful garden. We spent a nice afternoon walking through the garden. It was a nice opportunity to learn more about Yves St Laurent.

Nice peaceful garden to kill an hour. Nice gardens but we spent less than an hour seeing it all. We didn't pay extra to see the museum element. There's a lovely cool cafe but quite pricey. Cool plants but mostly cacti rather than flowers.
Good price, a little small and out of the way though. The gardens and museum offer a great respite from the city and I feel I learned a lot about the Berbers through it's museum.

Just Amazing!. Read about the Gardens before coming back to Marrakech this year ,and on the day I entered the gates were transported to another world in both the Garden and History of the place. This garden was so lovely, definitely an oasis of calm in the busy city. There is lots of information on their history. We went there with an extremely helpful and friendly guide organised by MarrakechDayTrips, he told us more about the gardens and guided us around which was an amazing! The cafe outside are lovely and the food and drinks are not overpriced and taste delicious! Definitely worth the entry price,a must see for me!
Magical. Unbelievably beautiful, breath taking. This place has a great cafe and the whole place is stunning. Amazing
Amazing. We have visited Jardin Majorelle loads of times and love it more and more. Can't stop taking photos !!
I love this place . Best place I have ever been I eould definantly recommend this place to all my friends and family - i can vouch for them by all means

Overpriced oasis of freshness. Went there with friends and daughter. The gardens are not large so anywhere you'll take a picture you will most likely have other tourists in the frame. We had great fun because we know how to enjoy ourselves with little (that is being silly and messing about) but this 70 dirhams per person entry fee does nothing culturally wise and fails to uplift. Only redeeming feature is the extensive shade on a day where temperature was 45 celsius. Nice but price is not justified. Gives a bad name to Yves Saint Laurent.

Small Garden. The garden is relatively small but interesting, worth burning off an hour or two if you are out of option in Marakech but not in the same league at the best gardens in the Europe nor Asia

Beautiful. Never saw a beautiful colourful garden before. So much to see beautiful flowers to amazing plants. The restaurant situated had delicious food. The kids loved it so much to see and explore. The price was cheap with one paying adult child under 12 went free. Highly recommended to visit in Marrakech. Nice local shops near by to buy souvenirs.

Expensive but not that great. Different plants and the ysl gallery was OK however at 50d per head it didn't deliver. It was on the go to list for Morocco so we went however in future will not be visiting again.

Beautiful. Beautiful garden with an informative museum that is worth visiting too. For MAD 70,- at the entrance they welcome you in a clean garden with lots of special plants
There is a big variety in plants and trees which are very well maintained.Worth yo go and visit it. Just to relax and sit there!

Who Knew?. I did not know that YSL was buried in Marrakech !!Yes,his ashes are in the Garden.Such a garden!. Plant species from several Continents make an impressive botanical garden in the City centre . Very calm and relaxing on a hot dayThe Berber cultural museum is an integral part of the garden, many fine exhibits of Berber tools and crafts. Admission fee is required but reasonable , for the maintenance of this exotic space.
Variety of cactus plants . Nice garden with so many different types of cactus plants and type trees. Very limited number of flowers in the garden. Worth visiting this garden.

A Revitalizing Oasis. Stunning location which is like taking a deep breath and relaxing. As has already been said, it's great to take time out from Marrakesh's bustle. Especially sublime when we visited during Friday call to prayers. Must see bit of Marrakesh.

Wonderful break from the Souks. Take the Horse and cart directly to the Majorelle Jardins!! The gardens can be reached form the Jemaa el Fna square by horse and cart, which is actually not a bad price and is a great experience for all ages. The gardens are spectacular whatever time of year. Worth a visit but take a packed lunch with you as limited and expensive food available.
Fantastic. What a fantastic garden this is, if in Marrakech this garden is a must. We found it so tranquil and peaceful and will definitely visit again

Peaceful gardens and great museum. Pop in here for a bit of respite from the heat and bustle of Marrakech. Lovely gardens and the museum is fantastic - filled with fashions from the past from all around Morocco

Beautiful - but lots of people. This was a beautiful oasis in Marrakech. Go for a lazy afternoon with a book and your camera. You can get a light snack at the cafe and there are a few good shops on the block. A must see but lots of tourists.

Baffled why this is an attraction!. I am completely at a loss as to why so many people are so taken by this garden. I did like the shade of blue which is vivid (in places, namely on the building). Thats all I can think of. After paying to get in I was expecting something spectacular, and can only say I was massively disappointed. I understand people perceive it to be an oasis of calm from the streets of Marrakech, but you can also get that in the Cyber Park and other large park areas near the Koutubia Mosque and those parks have wonderful fruit trees, lawned areas, plants and fountains as well as being able to get a drink of tea from a tea seller. The tourist status of this place also means its busy. An oasis of calm for me is not sitting on a seat watching a train of people photographing a plant pot. There is a paved path which leads through the gardens. It passes some large terracotta plant pots roughly painted and poorly planted, why anyone would paint a terracotta plant pot orange was lost on me.....and my 6 year old niece could have done a neater job of managing not to paint the plant leaves as well as the pots. The planting lacked ideas and inspiration. Its just wholly underwhelming. Not at all worth the trip, time would be much better spent having some tea in a beautiful riad.

a true Oasis. stunning gardens, beautiful cafe and food.when you need to escape the madness of Marrakesh - spend half a day strolling, taking photos, sitting and have refreshments in the cafe. fresh pressed juices and Moroccan salads. it could take 5 minutes to walk around but that misses the point. take your time and then slow down.

Small but Stylish. Some reviewers just don't get it. This is a small garden yes. But it's designed with colour and lighting in mind and is well worth the 70 Dirhams. You must visit to see to see the gardens as designed by YSL. When ever we visit Marrakech this is a must place to visit even though we have visited before.

Okay but not special . I personally didn't think this garden is worth 70dh to enter (garden area only....other prices for additional areas). The colour is vibrant and you can smell fresh air but it was small and nothing too special.
Something different. Nice garden with lots of different plants. Also some artwork from the late YSL can be seen. Cheap entrance fee too!!

Amazing. I regularly visit Garden Majorel and love the fact that you can get lost in these fantastic gardens . Lots of activities and interesting attractions which are always changing. Generally One of the worlds best gardens.

Nice Place . Small but nice and interesting. This garden had a beautiful plants and the nice colors.
I would highly recommend it. A must in Marrakech.
Nice small garden. Beautiful colours.. Lovely small garden. Respite from the heat in Summer and a nice change from the ochre colours of Morocco.

Beautiful. We walked from the Medina not to far. Its not to big lots of cactus. Very inspiring.
The Berba museum was fascinating worth paying the extra £1.50. Especially the jewellery room full of mirrors and stars.
And a very refreshing cup of tea.
Worth the money.

Beautiful. With all the 40 degree heat days, the shaded garden was a welcomed change. Right by Gueliz it cost 70 to go in and then an extra 30 dirham to see the museum. The gardens were beautiful and well designed, it was a garden. The house is stunning, such a beautiful blue! The museum was interesting, a little information about the background of Morocco and the outfits and jewellery worn by the Berber tribes. It was a nice visit and worth taking a look.

Beautiful and a bit chily garden, which is awesome in this hot city!. The good thing about this garden is not just that you will see beautiful colors, flowers, and plants, but it is also a bit chilly place, which is great to escape from hot days in the desert. One can spend some time there. I liked it a lot!

Could spend all day here. Went really early - as the garden was opening. Dedicate at least two hours here. It is small but so relaxing and there are lots of little bits to explore. Also a great cafe nearby if the garden cafe is too expensive. This was my favourite thing I did in the whole of my Marrakech stay.

Power of color. Just the most amazing garden ever. The vivid blue (blue majorelle), bright yellow, orange and the variety of natural greens are just stunning in combination. Every change of light and angle make the picture you look at a little different. Impossible to take a proper photo there - everything looks worse than in reality. Definitely a must when in Marrakesh.

Fantastic photo opportunity. This harden is amazing. I wrote a book on colour psychology so am always interestedin different combinations in other cultures / climates - this is a colour feast.The restaurant is very pretty but rather expensive for the quality of the food. service was terrible. We got the wrong things, everything came very slowly and several times I had to go and ask them for service.So ignore the restaurant - or just have a coffee to have a sit down in pretty surroundings - and enjoy walking around the cool leafy gardens.
Beautiful. Absolutely worth seeing these magnificent gardens. Sometimes a queue but worth it . Take water as it can be very hot .

Awesome visit. Not a must, but great to see.. My family of 5 visited the garden at 70 dirhams each upfront (around £6 each). This is just for the garden and not the museum (there was some work being done on it) and we wanted to see the garden anyway.Really lovely and cool. Saw a friendly turtle along the way. Serious highlight of the visit. Beautiful plants and fountains.
Must visit . If you are in Marrakesh and don't visit this garden then u missed a lot great things to discover in this garden and its very central and it will not take more than 1 hour

Beautiful, good experience. Go earlier in the morning as otherwise it's too hot and too busy! We spent about 2 hours here and just went on our own instead of as a trip. We sat in the cafe and ate but probably wouldnt bother next time - just have a fresh orange juice!

Lovely. Really nice gardens, nice and cool with lots of running water. Not too busy. Small but interesting museum. Entry fee fair.Easy enough walk from the Mdina.They're not huge gardens so about an hour's worth. The cafe immediately opposite the entrance was nice afterwards.
Worth a visit!. The garden had beautiful plants and the architecture is also attractive. Highly recommend a visit during the morning.

A place to relax and contemplate. If you are in Marrakech for a few day you should try and visit . It is not over big and can been done in around an hour.It was nice just to find a quite spot and just sit. It is a great place to visit to get in from the sun for a few hours.

Serene Gardens in a bustling City. The gardens are an oasis of quiet and beauty in the bustling city of Marrakech. Take time to check the Berber Museum which is well laid out and informative. The bookshop at the end lets you purchase books on history, literature, photography and cooking but manly in French.
Blue Haze and Heaven. Beautiful town garden, compact and framed by blue walls and blue skies. Well worth a visit. Very nice courtyard cafe present.
Very good. A place to cool down in hot summer, wheelchair friendly and not very big, varieties of cactus and tropical plant.

Peaceful, beautiful, interesting!. This is a beautiful, peaceful area in the bonkers and lively city of Marrakech. It's a little way out from the Medina, but very walkable (reccommend downloading an "offline maps" app for your phone) - you pay something like 70 dirham which is around £6 and it's so worth it. Move around at a leisurely pace and have 100 photo opportunities. Great little Yves Saint Laurent post card display and luxurious restaurant.
Yves Saint Laurent garden!. Wauw! A big garden with palmtrees an exotic plants. Nice walk. In the middle there is a museum and a shop. Refreshing walk in sunny Marrakech.

Has to be seen, but rather shabby . The gardens are worth seeing, there are some lovely photo opportunities. However it all rather untidy and needs a tidy up. Paths need repainting etc. There are som shady spots to sit.We walked there from the old city. Taxi rank outside, but they charge a excess for being in a rank, or at least they try too. The cafe and shop are overpriced.
Interesting and offbeat place to visit. Interesting place to visit from a design point of view and also botanically. Very un-Moroccan in many ways! A nice change from the rest of the city
It's Ok.... Lovely, without doubt, but we didn't feel that it deserves quite the plaudits it gets. Don't expect a great European garden, just an interesting African one.

Beautiful relaxing garden and interesting museum.. This is a beautiful and relaxing garden. It's not very large but the water features, different plant species and gorgeous colour make it well worth a visit. The onsite museum which is dedicated to the Berber culture is very interesting and also well worth a visit.

Relaxing. A great place to escape the hubbub of the city. A cool, relaxing oasis filled with interesting plants. Also, the Berber museum is worth the visit; it is small but very well done. It only takes about an hour to do everything.

Worth a quick wander around . If nothing else, just to understand some of the history of this place.It's not expensive and, if you're into gardens or even if you're not, I'd suggest that you have a uncle cantor through.

A very strange place.. This garden wasn't in Marrakesh the last time I was there but it's an interesting addition to the city. It's quite small but calming to walk around, sit down and admire the plants.
good to see. if you have enough time try to visit majorell garden i like the cactus plants and the blue colore of the building...

Many cacti to look at.. Entrance : just for the garden*70dirham for tourist*40dirham for locals.Berber museum*30 dirhamWe payed 30 dirham from medina el fna.but it should be lower as it was near.A good side trip to go too if your looking for somewhere near. But don't expect too much from this garden you'll be seeing a lot of cactus and bamboo trees and the memorial of ysl.and a fountain.there's a cafe as well but the prices are quite expensive but a nice place to just sit relax and spend time while its hot outside.in my opinion its an ok place to go to but with the entrance fee im expecting more.
NiceplVe. Interested to visit visit visit nice place good for families and Nice place to visit if you have extra time to Marakech yessss
Pretty garden. This garden is peaceful and quite. Not big, we saw it in 15/20 minutes with some time for photos...The blue is just amazing! Entrance is paid
Beautiful, a must-visit in Marrakech. Excellent botanic gardens with truly magnificent landscaping. A serene atmosphere. Great cafe with good coffee.

Quick visit. Had a walk around the gardens. I though it was quite a nice garden, nothing spectacular, would probably look much better if everything was in flower. We visited it as part of a horse and carriage tour from the medina.

Pay homage to the inspiring Yves St. Laurent in Jardin Marjorelle. Jardin Majorelle was quite an unexpectedly pleasant surprise. The collection of plant life was very interesting and the gardens are calming and a lovely place to wander aimlessly through for a few hours on a spring afternoon. The display of Yves St. Laurent's LOVE paintings and postcards was nice insight into his appreciation of love and art and the Berber museum of textiles and jewelry was an interesting extra. The entrance was a bit pricey for what was there but it was a great experience and we love fashion and design so it was special for us.Don't forget to buy your tin of Majorelle Blue paint... Still wondering what I can paint with my Majorelle Blue paint, I'm sure I'll come up with an idea.
