Worth visiting, so beautiful!. A real oasis in the middle of Marrakech heat. Yves Saint Laurent has put his mark in this place, design and athmosphere is amazing. A calm place with lots of beauty to see. Really worth a visit while in Marrakech!

A beautiful tropical oasis. We visited the gardens as part of a horse carriage ride through the city which included entrance to the gardens. Beautiful exotic plants, great photo opportunities and watch out for the entertaining wildlife....gold fish and tortoises! A wonder, cool place to visit in the heat of the day.

As good for what it has as for what it doesn't have.. This lovely garden was a 5 minute drive from our hotel, Riad El Fenn. We thought we'd just go look for an hour and leave. We ended up staying three hours! Too many photo opps! The garden is beautiful not just because of all the various plants, but for all the urns in that Majorelle blue and bright yellow. Also, there is a superb shop that sells YSL paraphernalia and even majorette blue paint! I got a little can but still have not used it. There is a little Berber museum there as well, and a garden cafe. The date/almond/avocado/honey smoothie I had there was amazing and I have tried to replicate it. This garden, in other hands, could have been inundated with the wrong kind of restaurant and shop. Luckily, all the extras are in synch with the serene beauty of the garden. Nothing is loud or commercial in a crass way. Yves would approve.

what a wonderful experience. wow these gardens are so beautiful and one can feel so serene. the landscaping and the different plants makes this a unique experience. I fully recommend a visit to whoever is in Marrakech.

Jardin Marjorelle. An absolute must to visit in Marrakech. Beautiful stunning gardens with the most amazing blue everywhere. It really is an oasis. The cafe served lovely food & the service was great. Highly recommended.
Refreshing. Absolutely beautiful gardens colours, plants breathtaking and excellent insight into the Berber Culture

Worth the trip to the new town . This garden was smaller and more expensive than expected (bring student ID for half price) but worth the trip and fee! It is very beautiful and feels like an oasis in this dry, dry city! Highly recommended.
Lovely place. Beautiful garden with its wonderful blue and yellow colours. Make sure you go early in the morning before it gets too hot.

Stunning. Wonderful place to spend a few hours. We took a taxi out from the main square, and it's amazing how different the two places are! You feel completely out of the city. Lovely slow paced location to really soak up. Spend some time enjoying the frogs and turtles. The restaurant on site is very pricey for food, but pop in for a mint tea to enjoy the surroundings.

Smaller than expected but still very beautiful. To be honest, we didn't really know what to expect from this as we were only told about it by the concierge at our hotel. We had it in our minds that it was a botanic gardens and we would be able to get horse & carriage tour around it but this definitely isn't possible. The garden is quite small and could be walked around easily in 15 minutes, however there were plenty of spaces for quiet contemplation and the gardens themselves were beautifully maintained.We didn't pay for the museum as I don't really have much knowledge or interest in YSL's work so can't comment on the value for money for that but in my opinion the garden wasn't worth the money compared to many that I've been to for free throughout the world.In addition to the gardens and museum there are also water stands and a cafe / restaurant which serves hotel priced food.Would I recommend you go? Yes, just to say you have been and to get some shade. Will you be telling all your friends back home about how amazing it was? Probably not.

Beautiful, Tranquil and Sublime. My wife and I stepped into the Jardin Majorelle one hot (110 F) July day to find the gardens beautiful, the atmosphere tranquil, and the coolness of the shade sublime. We spent over 3 hours in the gardens taking pictures, drawing flowers while sitting on a bench listening to the frogs, perusing the museum, and eating a light lunch in the garden cafe.The gardens themselves are breathtaking - and surprisingly cool, thanks to the abundance of shade and water. The gardens provide a beautiful contrast to the Medina outside: from Majorelle's blue compared to the red city outside, or from the quiet chirping of the Garden's frogs compared to the hustle of the Souks outside. The Museum was small - just three rooms, but by far the best laid out museum we have visited in Marrakech and definitely worth a look. The cafe is also very good - and priced similarly to other tourist destinations in Marrakech (we ordered a salad, sandwich and ice cream for around 200 MAD). Visit the gardens, bring a camera and a sketch book, and take your time... breathing in the beauty... soaking in the tranquility... and living in the sublime.

Stunning and tranquil. We never expected such amazing bold colours and the feeling of tranquility once you enter the gardens. Its a wonderful place to sit for awhile and just chill out and appreciate where you are. The museum is exceptional! We liked it so much we went twice just to see it all again

Nice place to go on a hot day . Lovely small garden with Yves Saint Laurent memorial, museum and shop. Good place to take pictures. The entrance to the museum should be paid separately , but I'd recommend it as it has a fantastic collection of Berber culture artifacts .

Nice. Majorelle Garden is Great to escape the heat. A lot of trees and shadows, nice Walk but After 1h we have Seen everything.
Entrance 70 Dirham which is alright.

Always good. A lovely place to go and spend a few hours.
Wonderful gardens
Great book / gift shop.
Calm shaded cafe

Oasis in the very warm environment. The Jardin Majorelle has been very well managed.
There is a big variety in plants and trees which are very well maintained.

Beautiful Gardens, Restaurant and Shop. I don't normally go to gardens on my holidays, but this one is worth it. It is beautifully presented with a nice balance of light, shade and water. There is an excellent museum with some good video and artefacts. The restaurant is a really nice place to finish up for a cup of mint tea or a tasty snack. There is also a very upmarket shop that is worth a visit.Make sure that you go shortly after 9am. We arrived about 9:15am and were the only people in the garden. By 10:30 the bus parties had arrived and it was much too busy.

Not high on the must-see list. We felt the garden was highly over rated. There are other places worth seeing first imo. If you have an hr free during your trip then go see it, otherwise you're probably better off seeing the other more interesting places Marrakech has to offer.

a beautiful way to spend an afternoon in Marrakech. The garden is beautiful and a quiet refuge in chaotic Marrakech. The museum is a must see although small, the instillation is wonderful particularly the jewelry section.
Nice. We too expected it to be larger, but it was lovely and well worth it. The mere juxtaposition of palm trees and cactus gardens make it worth it as does the Majorelle blue. It's unreal.

Tranquil despite it being busy. Special, unique and tranquil. This garden was so beautifully designed yet still felt natural. It felt like it had been created around the area that was already there rather than destroying the land and building up again.I absolutely love water features, bridges and tall trees so I couldn't stop staring and taking it all in. It's very rare to be standing in a busy garden/park and still feel calm and peaceful like I did there.I would say this might not be for everyone, it's mostly about appreciating design and architecture rather than physically taking part in any activities or playing on open grass, so it may not be the best place to take young children.Some advice: the restaurant was overpriced without justification. There were a few places to eat just outside the gate that were relatively cheaper but still overpriced for what they served. This is becase the garden is slightly isolated from the city. I would eat before visiting the garden :)

More beautiful than expected - Do not miss it. Well worth the visit!. The Jardin Majorelle was a surprising delight. I was not sure what to expect. We rarely visit gardens. However, this YSL garden was extraordinary. It was an oasis of unique foliage, a perfectly designed garden. I loved buying a small can of Indigo Blue paint to bring home, the same color as the home of YSL. A museum honoring YSL is currently being built next door to the Jardin Majorelle. Should open in 2017.

The Berber Museum inside is the real treat!!. Don't get me wrong, the gardens itself is lovely and well maintained. But for a small additional fee, you get admission to the Blue Building - the collection of Berber art that Yves Saint Laurent's partner collected. It is extremely well curated, and the notes are in several languages - including standalone handouts in English. The jewelry collection is housed in a smaller mirrored room that is simply wonderful. The are tools, and handicrafts and lots of costumes.
So peaceful place!. We spent in the garden few hours. It is so good air there. When outside can be + 44 degrees. And the tea of mint is so good!

Relaxing Afternoon. I went in the afternoon( around 2pm) Surprisingly it was not crowded. It's quite a small garden and can be done within an hour or so. The restaurant there is very good, serving a good array of food and drinks. The park itself is absolutely stunning, the majorelle blue makes for a good background for photos. There is a very popular photo spot on the outside of the main building, so try to take your pictures fast(there was always someone waiting). Overall it was a nice stop, but don't expect to spend more than 45 minutes to an hour.

Blue Majorelle. A must-visit in Marrakesh. The green of the plants mixed with the blue of the walls and the yellow of the vases is simply magic. Even if you are not a fan of photography you will not resist the beautiful ambience and will take a lot of them. We went with two teenage daughters we were stunned and must have taken about one hundred selfies ;-). In sum, it's a perfect oasis to visit on a hot summer day in Marraquesh.
it's overrated . You can see it in 20 minutes and it's not that impressive. If you have 2 days in Marrakech I wouldn't recommend visiting this garden.

Beauitful Garden in the middle of Marrakech. A beautiful garden located in the heart of the city. The history of Yves Saint Lauren was quite interesting. Wide variety of plants in this hot and humid city. Despite going in the middle of the summer, it is well covered with the plants creating a cool shade and nice temperatures for walking around. Would highly recommend this site.
Heaven. Jardin Majorelle is like heaven in the middle of the red city which you will have unforgetable memories and wonderful photos after your visit there. It is a must in Marrakech.

Morning trip to garden. Lovely experience. Advise to visit early in the morning before it gets too busy. Visited soon after opening and by time leaving was getting to busy to take pictures without people in background etc.

A bit bland, nice if you like catcus. We were staying near this attraction so thought we would have a look. It was nice, lots of catci some water features. We did not pay extra to go the museum. It was well tended and clean. Well shaded with the tall plants and a number of places to sit down.Lots of useful signs identifying different plantsWhilst it was nice, it was not a 'wow' type of place for me, we spent about 20-30 mins inthere and then left. I was hoping for more colour, more flowers.

Beautiful garden, fascinating museum of Berber culture. Beautiful garden, full of desert plants from around the world. (Cost 70dh)For a little extra money (30dh), you can also go in the Berber Museum. Well worth it. It is full of costumes, tools, industries, arts and instruments. Placards are mostly in French. But each room has a booklet available in English.

A different sort of garden. This is a beautiful & unique garden designed by Yves St. Laurent. The use of vivid color and water pools makes it quite stunning. Worth spending an hour or two in. We stopped by on our way to the airport.
The gift shop is filled with stylish unique gifts, yet probably more expensive than any other shop in Morocco.
A tranquil oasis in Marrakesch. A must see sight in Marrakesch. The gardens are glorious and tranquil, very shady and artistically designed. There's a lovely cafe, museum and bookshop as well.

Garden of beauty. The Jardin Majorelle are a little oasis of green plants and brightly coloured pots and architecture.Part owned and restored by the late Yves Saint Laurent , his touch is all over the lovely garden. It's so peaceful and serene , an antidote to the craziness of Madina. Approx £9 entry including the berber museum which is in the grounds.Also a delightful cafe with delicious cakes and pastries and delightful mint tea .Well worth spending a couple of hours out of your day.

Wonderful to explore.. This is a must see visit for anytime of year. The gardens were the home of Yves St Laurent who donated it to the nation. It consists of a beautiful forecourt entrance with a very calming fountain that then lead to the gardens. There is also a museum, book shop, gift shop and cafe on site, so lots to explore. Or you could just sit on one of the many benches scattered throughout the gardens and relax. A safe haven from the hectic outside and a must see for all to experience. Go!!!

A must in Marrakech. Good price to get in and well worth it, the gardens are stunning, I am a park manager so I am very critical walking round these type of places.We both liked the mist sprays both for the plants and visitors, finished off the walk around with a mint tea and pastry in the cafe.

somewhat disappointing, small garden in Marrakech. not as good as I had expected, striking blue painted gardens with impressive canals but with poor selection of plants many f which appeared to be diseased.

A true oasis. One of the only real sights to see in Marrakech, and an absolute must. Gorgeous garden that lives up to its reputation. Perfect to wander around and can be done in an hour or two. It gets quite hot, but we cooled off with some fresh juices in the cafe. We did not go into the museum portion, but enjoyed ourselves nonetheless. The entrance is a bit hidden, you'll see signs at the main street intersection, but the door is actually further down the road and around the corner.
Beautiful oasis. Worth the price. Incredibly beautiful. Do the Berber museum if you want to learn about this beautiful culture.

Cool and colourful. Stumbled across this beautiful garden by default really , the garden and museum are wheelchair friendly. Inside is a beautiful colourful cool garden you can just loose yourself in for a time. The Berber museum is definitely worth a visit with a great collection of jewellery leatherwork textiles etc of the Berber culture. Yes Saint Laurent bought Jardin Majorelle in 1980 and restored it. There is a little cafe if you need to relax with a coffe or have some lunch.Thoroughly enjoyed the garden and museum.

Small but full. 70dh for the gardens, 30dh for the museum. It was 46°c when we visited so we were grateful for the shady gardens. Cacti of all shapes and sizes are crammed into the gardens , along with dipping pools and temples. The Berber museum is beautifully air conditioned but very small. We had mint tea and cakes in the cafe majorelle courtyard. Delicious citrone tarte and pain du perdu.
Not worth it. Agree with other reviewer....we were expecting more, entrance is overpriced and its mainly cactus and bamboo. Not a must see...don't waste time and money

Doesn't worth the price. It is ridiculously expensive comparing to other sightseens. The price has been tripled since last year and it is 70 dihrams now.
The garden itself is not that big. Frankly speaking, there is better garden at my hotel. If you are not a fan of cactuses or Yves Saint Laurent, this place won't be interesting for you.

Striking!. Even if you don't like taking photos, you'll want to do it here. The blue and yellow colors are so striking throughout the gardens, and interesting to see through sun and shadows.We had these gardens on our Marrakech agenda, but there was so much to see and do in a week, we almost passed them up. It's worth the visit!There is a restaurant, but it was very full when we stopped in, so time your visit if you want to eat there.We took a cab to the gardens, but opted to take a caleche back since we hadn't ridden in one yet. There is a long queue just outside the entrance, so it won't be hard to find one. It's just takes time to negotiate the price.

A must see!. Stunning gardens, even in the heat they are fine to walk around in and I recommend paying a bit extra for the museum as it is very interesting and shows more about the country's culture. The cafe there is also lovely to visit. Definitely an oasis in the city.

Peaceful escape. A beautiful setting on a hot day, bright colours and lots of nice plants and water features. One thing I wasn't so keen on is the fact that you pay less to enter if you are Moroccan (I know that's the case with EVERYTHING here) but this is actually on a sign, 70 dhm for tourists and 40dhm for citizens of Marrakech/Morocco. Maybe it's to attract more locals but I wouldn't like it if they done this in Scotland and made our tourists/visitors spend more. Other than that, it's pretty and worth a visit.

Tranquil but smaller than I expected . Everyone said you must go and see the gardens and it would have been silly to miss seeing them. At the same time it wasn't as great as I hoped/expected. Nice ponds and cacti and quite tranquil. But let's be honest for a 9 and 12 year old it is not captivating. I think I would have enjoyed it more if I had just been with my wife and we could have meandered our way through. The cafe was a hit for them with lemon tart and banana split. For my wife and I passion fruit and lemon sorbet - excellent. Stephanie also bought a great necklace in the shop made of morrocan coins which will be wonderful as a remembrance of our trip.

Expensive to look at a bit of bamboo. Was slightly interesting, but I would not recommend it as a must see. It's a small garden with not a lot happening: just some bamboo and the odd cactus. We wouldn't go back and wish we didn't waste our time going there.

Beautiful. We went to the garden in July afternoon. IT WAS TOO HOT we couldn't enjoy it properly and we didn't spend much time because of the burning sun. I was so taken with the scenery and the exotic plants. I just thought that 70 dirhams is too much for a garden. It is a must see if you are in Marrakesh.

Great gardens. Thanks YSL!. Late designer YSL bought this garden and after he passed away it is now open to public. You pay 60 dirham (~$6) per person and get to see these beautiful gardens. If you are from Mexico or Texas get ready to see a piece of home :) many cacti species from home. Money well spent. The restaurant inside had yummy food and drinks.

Complete waste of time. If you have absolutely nothing else to do, go to this garden. This over priced run-down attraction is for some strange reason a major tourist sight in this beautiful city. If you like garden employees offering to take a picture of you only to get upset when you don't tip them, this is the place for you.Do yourself a favor and skip this.

One of those tourist traps you just have to visit. I can imagine how beautiful the gardens would have been when Yves was still alive. However, the current Jardin Majorelle is an overpacked tourist trap. The cacti are still a sight to behold though.

Not for family with small children. We were told that this is a garden full of flowers of all kinds from all over the worled and the houses has a special architecture,we found lots of cactus, bamboo trees,a big pond,number of artests drawing sketches,colourful walls and a small cafe shop selling souvenirs,well it was not appealing for us as children felt bored after a short while we had to go out, we felt we lost our money as it has expensive entery fees.I advice only those interested in botany or art to visit it...or may be pepol seaking quite places.
Small but nice. Majorette gardens are a great way to spend an hour or so outside the busy medina. Plenty of exotic flowers and photo opportunities and near some great places to eat.

over priced bore. I guess when you run out of being bothered by every nasty sales person in Marrakesh you can come here .... only redeeming aspects of this place is the fact its a reprieve from the onslaught of carpet, spice, lantern, sellers you will fend off all day. third world tourist attractions are just that .. third world ....
Amazing oasis of tranquility. A really lovely way to spend 2-3 hours ! The Berber museum is really well-assembled,with plenty of exhibits . The house and the botanical garden are a must see !

Stunning. This place is magical, an absolute must see in Marrakech!! Head there early in the morning to avoid the busy times and have a superb breakfast in the café. The food is excellent and the service is perfect. Highly recommend.
Cool and beautiful gardens. Definitely worth a visit. An interesting design mix of Mediterranean plants and cacti. Cool and vibrant with colourful pots and buildings.
Amazing!. Beautifully laid out. Very clean and tidy. Helpful staff. Well priced. Can highly recommend a visit.

Great place!. We came e here as part of a tour organised by MarrakechDayTrip,com. Our local guide was outstanding and he carefully explained the history of the palace and in doing so the background to the French period of recent Moroccan history. This is one of the main tourist attractions in Marrakech and I can see why. Beautiful gardens and the Berbere museum worth a visit. The gardens are very well maintained and provide some great photoshoots.
Fantastic. Even on a very hot day this is a g rest place to visit and learn a bit about Yves Saint Laurent. You will take lots of photos in this very relaxing garden
Garden. Majorelle. Pleasant refuge from the hectic pace of life in Marrakech. Relatively quite and serene. Not a lot of variety but and nie place to visit is looking for something different

nice garden. At the heart of Marrakech a place out of time. The museum is disappointing but the garden is well worth the trip especially outside tourist inflow period. The ideal is to go early in the morning and have breakfast there.

A gem in Marrakech. This is an absolute must for anyone visiting Marrakech. Yves St. Laurent constructed the gardens and they are beautiful. Shady, cool and welcome respite from the heat and busyness of the city. If you are staying in the medina, they are within walking distance and well worth the walk and the admission price.
Fantastic. This is a wonderful little garden to visit. Beautiful with the blue. Don't miss the Berber museum in the gardens, it was really good.

Superb gardens. The Jardin Majorelle definitely has to be on your to-do list while in Marrakesh. While there may not be a lot of things to see / do in the new town, the Jardin Majorelle turns out to be an area where time stopped. The only downside is that tickets are a bit pricey compared to other spots in Morocco.Having said that, it is really like a retreat during which you'll be able to escape from this busy city. Don't hesitate to visit the small museum too, it is definitely worth a visit.
A must!. Nice and quit garden. You should visit it if in the neighborhood. A bit sober and somehow old fashioned.

Nice but not spectacular. Majorelle Gardens are a nice place, with beautiful blue walls and a nice garden area nevertheless the whole area is quite small and 7,-€ entrance fee are too much for the 20 minutes you spend in there. A bit overrated all in all

A little disappointed . Everyone we met in Marrakech advised us to visit these gardens, however I was a little disappointed, I perhaps expected too much, was hoping for more than a lot of cactus plants, I expected more colour, more scents, perhaps a fountain or two. It was nice, but underwhelming.

Peace on earth!. Walking around the Jardins Majorelle is always a treat, especially when the weather is hot outside. The overall beauty, the contrast between the Majorelle blue and the various shades of green, the pond, the shaded areas are all so peaceful and offering such a great contrast with the busy souks! A must when in Marrakech!
A nice cool escape. Lovely gardens to retreat to in the horrendous summer heat. Prices to enter are slightly overpriced in my opinion. Take a book and a bottle of water and just sit and breathe.
beautiful and peaceful. Close to the riad and very well worth a visit. Beautiful and peaceful, colourful and cool. A great way to spend a couple of hours-

Merveilleux. After this visit, I definitely prefer the blue Majorelle than the blue klein.
750 dh for the entrance fee however, without student rate.

Beautiful garden in the heart of Marrakech. Majorelle garden is a beautifully shaped natural and architectural curiosity in Marrakech. Its famous color "Majorelle blue" along with the diversity of plants there contrast with the main red color of Marrakech.
Well preserved, wonderful pictures can be shot out there.
Beautiful gardens. The gardens are intimate, imaginatively designed with a wonderful eye for colour, texture, light and shade (thank goodness!). The cafe was excellent for a light lunch.

Beautiful Gardens and Worth a Visit. These are beautiful gardens in the Ville Nouvelle area of Marrakesh. Entrance is cheap and there is lots to look at! The gardens are a fantastic sun trap in beautiful settings
Stunning cacti and beautiful water gardens.. Such a beautiful garden oasis.we particularly loved the huge cacti gardens and bamboo plantations. Worth visiting!
So convenient for a lovely patio lunch at the gardens. Don't miss the museum!!. We share appetizers and salads for the hot summer day. Lovely. Other times I enjoy the club sandwich.

Great day out. Great day out. and not expensive to get in. And you can spend a say there the little cafe is a must. And they do great ice cream. There are plenty benches. Where you can just sit and let the world drift by.

Gorgeous Oasis outside the Medina. This place is about a 30-40 minute walk from the center square, Jemaa-al-Fna, in Marrakech, but it is worth it. It was cool, and very refreshing inside the garden. Also the flowers and buildings were so vibrantly colored, which was a nice change from dusty Marrakech. All in all a very peaceful way to spend an afternoon.

Worth visiting. We visited here during a 3 day trip to Marrakech. We found the gardens to be a beautiful, colourful and tranquil space. The only down-side was that we were hurried along and asked to leave certain areas as a VIP was visiting at the same time.

Worth visiting. We visited here during a 3 day trip to Marrakech. We found the gardens to be a beautiful, colourful and tranquil space. The only down-side was that we were hurried along and asked to leave certain areas as a VIP was visiting at the same time.

Stunning. The gardens are so peaceful and serene and beautiful it is worth 2 to 3 hours of time just to be walking around perfection in peace. There are shaded areas to escape the sun.
We really enjoyed the visitaway from the hustle and bustle of marrakesh.
We went with a local taxi driver as part of a tour of marrakesh.

Good mature cacti collection. Nice relaxing and cool place to visit despite its connection with the famous artiste. We met people of different nationalities, Norway, French, UK, USA asking for photographs to be taken which is fine. Watch for terrapins and frogs around and within the pond areas. Should take about 45 minutes to walk around the enclosed garden plus 25 minutes for mint tea excluding museum which we did not buy tickets for. The entrance/exit has a beautiful fountain feature.

One of the best botanic garden . We have visited this garden during our stay in Marrakesh last week. This was one of the best attractions of the city. There are wonderful trees and plants to explore. It is very enjoyable and relaxing. It does include a souvenir shop, a small library, an art gallery, a museum and a lovely coffee shop. We treated ourselves with some mint tea and Morrocan cakes under an orange tree. This is a must see!
Nothing to see. The entrance fee is 70 dh. too expensive. Nothing to see inside.It is quite far away from the medina, so you have to take a taxi. just...not worth it.

THE BEST GARDEN IN MARRAKECH. i am not the biggest fan of gardens and similar activites to this one but compared to the other gardens this was brilliant.really colourful with very nice plants and flowers. A lot to see here!

Stunning. . Visited with my husband on our honeymoon. Entry price is 100 dihrams per person, which included a visit to the Berber museum. This place is absolutely beautiful. The gardens a full of exotic plants and YSL's house is gorgeous. I just wish you could go inside. The Berber museum is interesting and they have information cards in English, to explain all the displays. The shop however, is very expensive. Although the merchandise is excellent quality. A must visit, if you are on holiday in Marrakech.
Garden.. What do u expect.. Its just garden..what to expect . Its nice becoz its in the middle of dry area like marakkech . If you put it in indonesia or thailand maybe nobody will found it special.

overrated. I went to majorelle becasue many of my friends are in love with this place. Maybe this created such high expectations that i was a bit disappointed...The gardens are small, you can have a walk in less than 10 minutes incl stops for pictures...It is a lovely garden but I was not impressed, and expensive considering that it is such a short visit

Quiet scenic break from medina. Lovely gardens walled in from the bustle of the city. Paying for the Berber museum is worth it and a relatively quick detour. There was an attractive cafe to grab a bite. It was not too crowded in early July

Excellent photo opportunities . This place is a must see for those who enjoy calm relaxing spaces and picture taking with stunning backgrounds. The garden is big and each section has a story which is explained in writing. The colours are amazing, bright blue walls, pink trees, striking yellow vases etc. The staff are really friendly and helpful. To access certain areas there is a further fee but worth it. Recommended visit time is 2Hours with an ice cream, a book, and a good camera!

An oasis. La jardin majorelle is a lovely break from the hectic streets of the medina. The lovely shades of blue and green soothe and inspire as you wander through the gardens. The Berber museum is very well done - beautiful pieces and just enough information to keep you interested without getting bored. A must see!

Beautiful Gardens. Most beautiful garden in Marrackech ; we can see why Yves Saint Laurent fell in love with it. We loved the museum too which holds YSL collection of Berber jewellery. You need to visit it in the morning to avoid the queue and the heat.

Gorgeous!. Bring your camera and enjoy the serenity of the garden. It wasn't too busy when we visited during ramadan and was a perfect break from the busy souks. There is shaded cafe to get refreshments as well. Also pay the extra fee to see the Berber museum. It'll give you some insight, especially if you plan to visit the surrounding area.A note, if you are staying in the medina, I suggest taking a taxi unless you're ok with the heat and dust.

well worth a visit (if you can find it). I absolutely loved this garden - and generally I am not someone who wanders around gardens. It was beautifully shady and the colours were absolutely stunning. We walked here from our hotel (about 1.5-2miles away) rather than take an arranged tour - it wasn't that easy to find (even when we did find some signposts!) but was well worth the effort. Probably one of my favourite gardens anywhere.

Worth going to see perfection.. Peaceful, Tranquil all in all the most beautiful landscape Ive ever seen. Its serine, and magical. All the colors and the placement of the plants. Two thumbs up!! Plus the memorial of Yves Saint Laurent is just beautful. Go! And check out the Museum for a couple etc bucks.
Stroll in the shade . Nice to pass 2 hours! Shade to get out of the heat. There is a nice cafe inside and also one nearby on the corner.
Pretty!. The gardens are very pretty and well maintained. The cafe is expensive by our standards as too is the boutique but I guess that's not why you attend the jardin. Nice for an hour or so.
Beautiful . Absolutely lovely respite in the middle of a hot day!Also, the Berber museum albeit small was fascinating & beautiful to witness.

Beautiful!. So glad I went!!! I wasn't sure I should go to the gardens as a review on Trip Advisor said it wasn't worth it. I asked a friend, who encouraged me to go. I can't remember how much the entrance fee was, $5-$10? I didn't go into the Berber museum. The gardens are beautiful, we had lunch in the cafe which was darling. The gift shop is amazing!!!!! Although expensive. My only regret is I didn't purchase a handbag in the gift shop. If anyone at the Gardens reads this please respond as to how I can have it sent. Nice place to visit for an hour.

Nice gardens . We came here after reading that it's a spot in Marrakech that is not to be missed. It's a little over priced at 70dh per person. The grounds are very beautiful, but it's a small place, so you can walk through and feel accomplished in under 30 minutes. I would recommend coming here, it's a nice escape from the loudness of the rest of the city. It was owned by the late Yves Saint Laurent, so its history is interesting. It provides a lot of shade, so I would recommend coming in the mid afternoon because it doesn't get overly hot and it's not too crowded.

A Lovely Oasis. I have been to many gardens and I can't say that the foliage is that amazing, but this place is quite lovely and well worth a visit in the heat of summer. The Berber Museum is fantastic and there are many lovely photo ops.
The best place to be in Marrakech. This is a wonderful place. The whole concept is beaufitul. The first place where everyone should visit.
Wonderful gardens. Beautiful and inspiring tranquil gardens away from the hubbub and heat of the Medina. We veyr much enjoyed our visit.
Stunning. Stunning beauty, so peaceful, well maintained.A must place to visit museum very well presented. Café in gardens a nice stop from the July heat.

A beautiful gem near the center of Marakkesh. I would recommend going early because the gardens are popular but small so not only do you have to wait to pay admission when its crowded, but also it gets full inside. Still, it is well worth it, especially if you are interested in plants. Additionally, the Museum on the grounds is small but amazing: a video presentation with excellent information, an exhibit of Berber jewelry that is incredible - both the quality of the jewelry but also the way it is exhibited. Another part of the museum shows indigenous clothing from various parts of Morocco - fascinating. A small alcove outside has original posters from Yves St. Laurent which he sent as New Years cards through the years. Lastly, there is a boutique with gorgeous leather handbags and other items.

Tropical. Lovely gardens, and the Berber museum was worth a visit but there was too much detail in the translations. It would benefit from an English speaking guide. Don't bother with the cafe as it was too expensive, although the air water vapour jets are welcome.

Gorgeous oasis in the middle of the desert. We were expecting a nondescript garden that was a crowded tourist haven. We nevertheless decided to go because: (1) everyone kept telling us to, and (2) some of my favorite pieces are YSL, so why not pay homage?! We were pleasantly surprised to discover that our preconceived notions were wrong.The gardens are gorgeous with so many different plants and flowers from all over the world. The vivid colors of the buildings made fun backdrops for vacation photos. There's a great little cafe in the middle of the garden where were stopped for tea and dessert (and to lament that we did not each lunch there instead of at the Four Seasons pool restaurant). There's also a gift shop of extremely overpriced trinkets (think USD$350 for a silver bracelet NOT designed by YSL).Definitely a must!

Gardens to entice and interst and a superb museum. Much extended since my first trip 15 years ago. The garden has matured and been enhanced; a memorial to Yves, a gorgeous café, small shop and fabulous museum. The museum is the life collection of the 2 men and reflects their aesthetic passions and great eye for details. The guides/ guards inside were most helpful and erll informed.
Beautiful gardens. Visited in July - gardens and house were beautiful and the place was easy to get to by taxi. The cafe was expensive but served excellent ice cream!

Tiny!. Very nice, but you can walk round it in 5 minutes.
Cafe was extortionate! Didn't eat there after seeing the prices.
Taxi from medina to gardens cost 40 Dhs

Beautiful!. Amazing gardens . It's a bit far from the medina but they are worth visiting. Beautiful colours and designs and it's fresh and there is shade which you will always treasure in Morocco. Don't buy the water from more than one euro they try to scam you all the time...

Garden of Delight. If you are a botanist, gardener, or just a nature lover, you will be impressed with the size and scope of the flora here. There is also a museum that is a loving tribute to the Berber People of Morocco, a restaurant, and gift store. It was here that I really saw such a diverse cross section of people from around the world visiting Marrakech. We visited Jardin Majorelle with guide, Mohammed who was procured by Aziz, of Dadani Destinations. We very much enjoyed Mohammed, who explained the history of the gardens, up to the present day. He also gave us time to just sit and revel in the beauty of some of the rare plants found from all over the world.Take your time and take in the tranquility and sheer beauty of nature here.

Great Way to Spend a Morning. Even if you don't have any real interest in gardens or plants etc. the garden is worth definitely worth a visit. It is located outside of the Medina and so allows you to see a little bit more of Marrakech. The staff are also very nice.

Not to be missed. This garden is a photographers dream - even if you are just a holiday 'snapper', you can't fail to create stunning photos. Enter past the fountain with its eye catching tiling and into the garden. The colours are amazing. Whilst visiting, please take the time to visit the museum, especially if you love Berber jewellery.Also not to be missed are the bookshop and cafe. I've visited the gardens several times now and find something new to see each time.

Amazing place to visit!. Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful place to visit as the Berber museum, I highly recommend a visit. Keep your camera ready to take nice and coloured pictures. Make sure you use a sort of blue/green/white mixed clothes for a perfect photo!

Beautiful gardens to spend an hour. Beautiful gardens in the middle of Marrakech. A calm oasis in the middle of the busy city where you can spend an hour wandering through the gardens. Lovely outdoor restaurant for lunch and mint tea.

Designer Garden. Beautiful garden a little bit outside the medina. A variety of plants that you can walk around and look at and some really interesting architecture with funky coloring. The museum is also worth checking out, has a nice collection of Berber items and has pamphlets that explain everything. There's also a cafe, its a bit pricey, but nice to enjoy some tea in the garden.
Cute...for half hour. Cute place to get some nice pictures with friends, family and loved ones. But unless you're into south American and African plant life, you'll be bored in half hour
Jardin!. The famous gardens that were built by designer yves st Laurent lush and lovely and unexpected - take a leisurely walk and soak it in!

AMAZING GARDENS. We went to the Majorelle Gardens when we were in Marrakech, it is really great place to go to for just a short time as its very small gardens. It's beautifully done and if you have time we highly recommend this attraction.
Beautiful!. 70DH to get in and an extra 30 for the museum - lovely stunning grounds! - took us around half hour to walk around and take photos

Fabulous gardens. Didn't know about these gardens but our driver on our city tour recommended them so off we went and what a lovely surprise. Beautiful colour, huge range of plants, flower, and trees, very cool and shaded which is a nice relief from the heat. Spent an hour here and would definitely recommend.

Expensive for what it is. Had to stand in a large queue to get in and once inside I have to say it was an anti climax. Expensive for what it is, but a perfect tranquil place to chill out in this bustling city if you need peace and quiet.
very busy. Visited in April 2014 late in morning. Very crowded park but worth walking through . Especially the drawings of Yves Saint Laurant are nice. Long waiting time in the cafe.
Beautiful gardens for a walk. Lovely gardens to take a stroll through.It has a large palm and cactus collection and there is also a museum of Islamic art.

Gorgeous gardens and fascinating Berber exhibit. Never expected to see this type of garden in the middle of Marrakech. It's not your typical garden but it is magnificent and so peaceful even with the hordes of tourists walking up and down the paths. The water features are lovely and the Berber exhibit in the museum is fascinating along with the spectacular jewelry. Not my taste but I can certainly appreciate the workmanship. There is a history to this garden which pays homage to Yves Saint Laurent and there is a memorial to the designer. Also under construction is a new museum opening in the fall. I couldn't get any information about what would be in the new museum but would certainly love to visit the garden and museum again in the future.

Delightful!. Well worth a visit. Restaurant was good too. It's like an oasis in a big, busy city. Pay to enter the garden and the museum. Quite a way from city centre. Get a taxi as it's a fair walk but worth the effort.
Wonderful. Booked this trip through Thompson. It was lovely the plants are so bright and colourful. The blue they use is breathtaking Defiantly worth a visit when in Marrakech!
Definitely worth a visit despite steep entry fee. Fascinating, tranquil, spotless. All lovely. Dh70 per person to get in though quite steep versus other attractions in town. Lovely though.
Expensive but nice! . It was 7€ to get in, but even though it was an artificial garden and not a natural one it was wonderful to see! The blue houses were wonderful for pictures!
peaceful. lovely peaceful gardens full of colour..70dh to enter not 50dh...short taxi ride from central Marrakech

Great way to spend a few hours outside the Medina. A lovely experience. Worth an hour or two to take it all in. But can be done quickly as well if you are pressed for time. It's very manageable to walk around. Avoid the cab drivers hovering all around the entrance.
Yoga & Wellness. Beautiful gardens and the Berbere museum worth a visit. The gardens are very well maintained and provide some great photoshoots.

Lovely Garden. This is one of the main tourist attractions in Marrakech and I can see why. It is rather beautiful and the plants are fascinating. The Berber museum within the grounds is also interesting.
Great place to visit. -- beautiful garden . Nice visit at this lovely place. Very exotic plants and the atmosphere is very tranquil. They have an excellent gift shop.

Relaxing little paradise . This is a really interesting place with beautiful colours and a great range of cacti and unusual plants. We were there on a blistering hot afternoon but there is plenty of shade and a cafe too. It is quite small, perhaps smaller than I imagined, so it certainly won't take you very long to look around and see everything. It wasn't particularly easy for us to find it either as it is a bit out of town and signage wasn't great. But it is well worth a visit and you will be guaranteed some lovely photos. :-)

COOL AND RELAXING OASIS. Probably the most beautiful botanical garden in Marrakech. Lots of shade, relatively quiet, ample park benches and a vast variety of mature trees, foliage and water features. Entry fee is 70 dirhams, and they did not accept debit/credit cards or foreign cash.
Nice, but small. Jardin Majorelle is certainly a beautiful garden, with different species and well cared, but it is smaller than I expected.Nice place for pictures, though.

Beautiful garden with amazing Cactus tree. It's really a beautiful garden. Marrakech visit will not be completed if any one missed it. A variety of trees are there that collected from various country. Now visitor can visit only a portion of total garden as rest used for royal guest house. There is a museum and food corner inside the garden.The main attraction were various kind of Cactus tree. good collections. I never thought of such a long cactus tree which is a tall as Palm tree. Really amazing.But the garden is not so big. Walk way is narrow. And the entry fee Dhr 70 per person is too high for such a small garden. But should not be missed the green beauty.
A serene oasis. Go to see the garden, stay for the ice-cream. Its a spectacular little oasis and you won't be disappointed!

Peaceful oasis!. Beautiful gardens to escape the heat! So many different plants! The building is beautiful with that magnificent blue! Take a horse carriage from the Koutoubia: they'll take you there, wait while you visit and bring you back. So much nicer than a taxi!
An experience not to be missed!. Take a guide, provided by you're hotel. You will see so much more of this beautiful garden, he will also bring you to other beautiful places
Amazing garden. A wonderful place you should visit during your stay in Marakech, story and life style of Yve st Laurent

A breath of fresh air in a busy city. Jardin Majorelle is well worth a visit whilst in Marrakech. It is a beautiful, peaceful wonderful location to spend a few hours wandering through a beautiful garden.The cacti garden has to be seen to be believed. I have never seen such a wonderful display before. There is also a lovely little cafe to have a drink and take in the atmosphere. The Berber Museum is worth a look whilst in the gardens. Gorgeous costumes and magnificent jewellery on display.A nice way to spend an afternoon.
Beautiful. Not a huge fan of gardens but this is very pretty and well worth a visit. Like everything in Marrakesh, a surprise behind every door

Beautiful garden, arrive early to avoid line and crowds. The Gardens are beautiful! Very well maintained and a nice escape from the busy city. The shop is worth visiting as well, even just to look around at the different items.It was somewhat crowded, however most people are very respectful of each other's experience. There was a line to purchase tickets when we arrived, but it moved quickly so we did not have to wait for too long. I would suggest arriving close to the opening time, to avoid too long a line and too much of a crowd.
Beautiful. Not to be missed! Great gardens, peaceful and really well designed. We had a mint tea in the cafe which was lovely and very refreshing. Highly recommended.
Berber museum made visit worthwhile. Perhaps YSL should have stuck to haute couture rather than garden design. However, the Berber museum made the visit worthwhile.

Relaxing getaway from soaks. Beautiful garden with an informative museum that is worth visiting too. Best to get there earlier (especially to the museum as later on during the day waiting time to get in is longer). The entry is quite expensive though
A beautiful place. 1 hour is enough to visit this beautiful garden. It is not very big but it is truly so beautiful. This place made me very happy :)

Peaceful, calm and cool. The vibrant colours and the beautiful plants are a peaceful contrast to the whirlwind of Marrakesh. Well worth a visit. Take the chance to visit the museum, too - the collection of Berber costumes is stunning.

A beatiful garden, really worth to visit.... This garden is really beautiful. For MAD 70,- at the entrance they welcome you in a clean garden with lots of special plants. Also a little memorial site for Yves Saint Laurent who died in 2008. He bought and totally restored the garden as it is today. With great buildings and a blue color that really fits him. Worth yo go and visit it. Just to relax and sit there in the sun or the shade...
Beautiful gardens. Easy to take good photos. Well worth the 70 dirham entrance fee. Small gardens, beautifully laid out. The light makes it easy to take great photos

Stunning garden with a great history . Part off a excursion we paid for during our stay out off the 2 we visited this was by far the best one. Situated in the new town off marrakesh, these small and quite discrete garden has a link to one the most recognised designers in history, yves saint laurent :-)Just a quick insight its history, Jardin Majorelle was a french orientalist painter and son of the famous Art Nouveau designer, Louis Majorelle. While living in Marrakesh, in 1931 he commissioned the architect Paul Sinoir to build an artist studio in the art deco style with the walls painted the "Majorelle Blue" surrounding it with plants from his travels arcoss the globe. After his death in 1962 the garden fell into abandon. In 1980 Pierre Berge and Yves Saint Laurenta acquired the Jardin Majorelle. After Yves's death in 2008 Pierre Berge donated the Jardin Majorelle to the foundation Pierre Berge - Yves Saint Laurent. A memorial for the legendary designer is at the Jardin :-) For price, its very cheap to visit with a separate cost for families too. It has the museum, cafe and a small art gallery within the facility. Personal, I think its wonderful :-)

Quite cool, but overpriced. It could be a really nice place, it is quite beautiful in fact, but I don't recommend it. (IMPORTANT: there is a 50% student discount: 35dh instead of 70)We waited in line for 20 minutes before paying the entrance fee, discussing about going in or not, because it was a bit too expensive for our budget (we didn't have most of our student cards with us). We decided to pay it anyways, cause it was our last day in Marrakech and we had taken a taxi to get there. The money of the entrance fee seemed even more wasted when we were inside: there were more turists than plants. We spent there around 20 minutes.The place itself looks really good, but it is too crowded to be worth the entrance fee.

Over rated. Very humble garden compared to a lot of things we've seen. No exotic plants or anything exciting exciting. Just a bunch of trees and different cactus. It's a place to relax and take some pics but for 70 MAD, not worth it.

Pretty but not much else. We went to the gardens, which were nice to look at but not much else. We didn't go into the museum, although we did have a look at the cafe. Keep an eye out for the baby frogs and turtles. You won't need to spend more than an hour max.

Captivating Tranquity. The Gardens was so serene. Although we went in the afternoon of a hot day, we were still able to relax and wander and truly enjoy these gardens and the colors. A breath of fresh air in the busy city for sure.
Worth visiting!. Truly enjoyable going around Jardin Majorelle. Not to mention pleasant and relaxing to the eyes. The whole family enjoyed taking photos all around our short visit here.

Beautiful Gardens. This is a great place to while away a couple of hours away from the madness of Marrakesh, so well kept and so many wonderful plants. This was one of my favorite places we visited during our stay and I can highly recommend visiting here

very relaxing. Mt husband and I visited the gardens in January 2013. We liked it a lot. The blue colour was so vibrant. We spent a good 1 1/2 there and also visited the museum. It really was very calming and relaxing...beautiful memories

A beautiful paradise. The entry to the jardin is expensive (70 MAD) in comparisson to the regular entry fares in Marrakesh. However, you will not regret it. It is worth every dirham. A piece of heaven. Charming, special, intimate, relaxing. The mix of colors against the cactus and bambus, the birds singing, tje water sounds... One can understand why Yves Saint Laurent decided to save this plave and make it his. A must.

Quite pricey but must see . Very beautiful garden, full of tropical colours and local charm. Surprisingly interesting museum of Berber culture (you need to buy a separate ticket though). Great place to hide from afternoon heat! There is also a cafe and a couple of souvenir shops

Beautiful for pictures. At the entrance they charge u a ticket based on ur nationality. As an Indian I was charged 70 MAD. Its a nice quiet walk through the gardens where I was able to capture some lovely pictures through my iphone 6s. Maximum it could take about an hour and half to see the place. Love the colour blue and yellow around which made it look amazing in pictures.

My favourite place in marrakech. I have been here twice now and look forward to coming here whenever I visit. It is so peaceful and relaxing to spend an afternoon here away from all the noise of marrakech. There are so many different cactus and blossoms, ponds with frogs and tortoise, and the cafe serves the best ice cream. Try the orange blossom, it's delicious. You can also visit the berber museum which has a lot of pottery and jewellery on show. There are also several pieces of yves Saint laurent collages on show which were interesting to read about.The best thing about the gardens are the beautiful colours, the blue of the buildings is called majorelle blue and you can buy it from the gift shop... which I did. I look forward to having a small piece of this at home! :)

Beautiful!. Really lovely place, beautiful plants and colours, and relaxed atmosphere.We walked from the centre and it takes about 35mis, would go early if your walking and also gardens were pretty quiet (arrived about 11am).Can imagine it gets really busy later on. Nice little gift shop where i bought some YSL postcards, beautiful bags and cushions for sale but rather pricey!
Like wonderland. Such a beautiful place. Really interesting and peaceful. Like walking in the wonderland. It was a dream to go there

A great morning out!. We went to Jardin Marjorelle to escape the midday heat in traquility, and the garden's didn't disappoint. It was quite expensive as visits go, if you take a taxi from your Riad and then pay entry to the gardens, and the museum, but it was worth it. We stopped for lunch in the garden cafe too, which was again, a little pricey, but it was lovely and a stark contrast from inside the walls of Marrakech Medina.

Overrated but Cute. The garden is nice and calming. Its a good little break from the city. The museum is not needed to visit. The blue is charming and gardens are okay more greenery. The YSL dedication area was a bit of a let down.
Nice. This garden was really nice, my mother who is 75 was finding it difficult to walk and the guys got us a wheelchair. They were all really nice and its a beautiful garden

Stunning. Although these gardens seem attributed to YSL. He apparently just helped to keep them going. Even so, a tranquil oasis in the madness of Marrakech. Well worth a visit, the colours of the gardens and even the decor are beautiful.
love the colours. absolutely stunning, very tranquil, lovely afternoon but would recommend getting a taxi there- so much less stressful especially in the heat of the day!!!!!

Beautiful, calming, an oasis in Marakech. The Majorelle was a delightful surprise on my visit to Marakech...it was a beautiful oasis on a hot day of Ramadan...the gardens are well laid out and the presence of the classic "Majorelle" blue was tastefully present...a little gem inside the Gardens is a very interesting Berber exibit/ museum which was well documented and informative...Well worth a stop and rest on a hot afternoon..
It's ok. Nice garden, but not worth the time. Lots of greenery, bamboos and cactuses. Expensive compared to other attractions.

The most amazing garden - never forgets the YSL blue!. It locates outside the old Marrakech city - you can take a taxi to there. Ticket is 50 probably the most expensive ticket among all Marrakech tourist attraction. However, it worth every penny!!!The most striking colour is the YSL blue - I never see it anywhere else. There are so many exotic plants - no wonder you can creat the impressive fashion trend in this garden! I can go back for many times!!!
Oasis. Very nice and relaxing garden away from all the noise, hassling and engine exhausts. The villa is a splendid kind of blue set amidst a beautiful botanic garden. There's also a shop and cafe.

Nice oasis in the new part of the city. A great place for a short escape from hot, dusty and crowded Medina. The garden is small but beautiful. We stayed in Marrakech for only 2 days, but it was totally worth to spend one day in the new part of the city which has this amazing garden, great places to eat and is far less crowded than the old part of the city.

Wonderful Gardens. We visited here on our first day of Morocco and we loved these gardens with so many cactus, trees, plants, gallery, Yves St Laurent memorial stone etc etc.The place is immaculate, clean with loads of benches to sit down and appreciate the beautiful gardens.It costs 70 Dihram to visit the gardens and 30 Dihram to see the museum, the gallery is free and worth a visit.There is a cafe there with reasonable priced menu.I would recommend this place a visit.

Not only most beautiful gardens. Jardins Majorelle is a must in Marrakech and most people do go there. Get your ticket in advance, and come early, in the fresh air of the morning to enjoy it at the uttermost. Don't miss the Musée Berbère, small museum but so rich and beautiful - and look at the books in the library. Simply all together a lovely place to enjoy, alone, with family and friends...

Desert Sanctuary. Went to visit the garden and the museum in our last day. You don't need a long time here as the place was rather small as it was only the garden of late Yves Saint Lauren which was converted to a garden for public to see. There were loads of exotic cacti in the garden which were really interesting and fascinating if you were into gardening and plants. I found the journey quite interesting as there was a water stream in the middle. There was also a corner where you can see the paintings and arts made by YSL (love corner). His memorial was also inside the garden, you will surely not miss it. There will be gentlemen in blue tops who worked for the garden that would tell you where to go and would monitor what you would do in case you decided to take a photo close to the cacti which wasn't allowed. I got told off by stepping on garden ground LOL. The museum inside the garden would take you back to their ancestry, cultures and traditions which were very informative. The costumes were very fascinating so as the jewellery corner. It was great photo location too but be very mindful as it got crowded because the place was rather small so you have to be very patient to take a best photo. Otherwise it was a good place to visit and to know a little bit more about Marrakech.

Beautiful Gardens and a visual feast for your eyes and mind. This is a must see as it is a visual feast. The colours, the water and the arrangement of all the flora, take you into a space where time slows down and you enjoy the moment. I will take ideas back home to create my smaller piece of a tranquil garden

ne of the most beautiful gardens i've ever seen. love is in the air, should be the name of this garden. Lots of tropical plants all over the world, spectacular landscape project with this "Majorelle Blue" and yellows. Inside you have a Bereber Museum that is unique, very well planned and special lighting design. The Bereber's clothes are indescribable. See it with your own eyes, and buy a book explaining the museum and some other about those native beautiful people, the Berebers.
Beautiful Garden!. An oasis in the middle of hot, dusty Marrkech. I visited with my daughter and we loved seeing the beautiful colors and plants contained in the garden. Worth the trip!

A louche botanical garden/museum. Beautiful cactus and succulent gardens, very nice collection of Berger art and artifacts assembled by yves st. laurent and his partner. a bit overpriced admission, but a nice glimpse of a louche european lifestyle in morocco late 2oth century and an expensive collection of Berber artifacts
Secret jardin. Beautiful garden, makes you feel like you are in a different world and it's a reasonable price, be sure to check out the cafe that they have its so tasty and inexpensive.
Very nice, but small. Its a nice place. Lovely to see a collection of many cactusea from around the world. The restaurant inside is quite charming to just relax for a while.
Not colorful. This garden has many plants not to many flowers. They should add more summer colored flowers. Very peaceful place to visit.

YSL gardens. Amazing, well worth the trip... Boutique across the road is also great along with the spice/perfumery on the corner. The restaurant is well worth a visit, the best Chicken Tagine of the trip.

Beautiful garden. Oasis in a city. Book a cab to get there and arrange for him to return in 45 mins., or if you want a drink in the cafe there 1 hour. It is lovely to visit but it is fairly small. We did't do the Berber Museum so you may need to allow another 20 mins for that.

Nice. Nice place to rest some time from the chaos of the medina. The downside is that is a little expensive in comparison of other attractions and that may be a little to difficult to find without a taxi
Beautiful Gardens. I enjoyed this place. It's not very big so you can get through it in less than 2 hours. It was a bit crowded on the day I visited but other than that its gorgeous!!

Beautiful oasis in a city full of noise. We were told it would take us 20 mins to walk here but it took longer as we were not sure if we were headed in the right direction. Maps are hard to decipher and streets have little or no signage. It was a very hot day so I do recommend you get a bus, taxi or donkey! It was worth it once we got there though. For the equivalent of 80p entry fee you can escape the hustle, bustle and heat in these beautiful gardens. Some amazing plants and the tallest cacti I've ever seen. Well worth a visit.
My favorite in Marrakech. My favorite place to visit in Marrakech. All the people who love nature have to visit this very famous place.

Don't miss it. When you buy your entry ticket for the gardens, make sure you choose the option that includes the Berber Museum. While the gardens are a great place to escape the madness of the medina (in spite of the many other visitors), the museum gives a fascinating insight into the Berber culture and currently includes a stunning installation that gives you the feeling of being under the stars in the desert. There's also a nice café in the grounds and a bookshop. This was a highlight of our visit to Marrakesh.
Love garden. Fabulous place to visit. You can actually feel the spirit of Yves st Laurent. The restaurant is worth s visit too. Take loads of pics as the beauty is hard to describe.

Nice but expensive for what it is. We went there to escape the heat but after the taxi ride and the ticket to enter I was quite disappointed to see it was a rather small place..In less than an hour we had seen everything and even had coffee in the (very expensive) coffee shop inside.
Beautiful place. These are beautiful gardens and there is a fantastic Berber museum which would totally recommend visiting.Lovely little cafe also
Must view. Wonderful Garden,very peaceful very clean and lots to see.Not too far from the Hotel. You can spend hours there. There is cafe. Staff was very helpful x

Vibrant and Peaceful. My boyfriend and I went in June and it was lovely, very colourful and peaceful - a world away from the not-so-far-away souks! It's a popular tourist destination and it's lovely to see all the creatures in the ponds turtles and frogs came out to see us!

Absolutely beautiful garden... Shame about the women on the front desk . This garden in definitely worth visiting. We loved walking around looking at all the different plants. My only complaint is the woman at the front desk. As we arrived there were no queues so we were the first ones to be served. The woman behind the desk was on her phone and barely looked up at us for a good few minutes. We obviously wanted to go in and buy a ticket but she was clearly preoccupied with her phone. I don't think we even got a hello out of her, just a nod.
Relaxing garden. Un unexpected garden in the city of Marrakech. The trees shade your walk while you admire the ponds and the variety of exotic plants.

Beautiful, interesting gardens.. I have visited Jardin Majorelle twice now, and it really is a beautiful and tranquil place. I love the amazing pops of colour, within the bright blue, vivid yellow and orange.

A beautiful oasis away from the city. Beautiful gardens and certainly popular with visiting tourists. Fairly inexpensive and you can eat at the cafe hidden within the gardens - great for a mint tea and spot of shade in the summer heat. Would suggest it needs a little more upkeep with the number of visitors it has daily but otherwise a stunning place!

Vibrant Colours and Shaded areas. if you are going to to marrakech a trip to the Majorelle gardens is a must. Designed by Yves Saint Laurent, the gardens have an array of difference plants as well as having a pond filled with terrapins and gold fish.which also add colour.The visit to YSL's memorial is intriguing as its is understated yet not out of place.  A place of tranquility and serenity in an otherwise bustling place.

Beautiful and very peaceful. Quiet, peaceful and beautifully created. Well worth a trip and then perhaps a horse drawn coach to the Mellah, although be sure to instruct the driver to take you through the Medina otherwise you'll be taken on the main roads which is pretty scary and nosiey.
Beautiful place, worth the price. A nice garden, well curated. Ticket is quite expensive (70 DAM for non residents) but it is really worth it.

Beautiful . Well worth a visit including Berber museum. Expensive relative to other sites but it is unique. Very hot when we visited but they had cooling water misting system that was most welcome as well as loads of shaded walkways . Garden lovers paradise
Beautiful & Peaceful. Lovely visit. Thoroughly enjoyed it.Beautiful plants. Lots of great photo spots.A real must see! It's tranquil and a world away from the dusty streets and hustle and bustle.
Amazing. I know that it will sound really weird but Jardin Majorelle was the only thing I've liked in Marrakesh. So if you are there, please go and visit they are lovely.

Amazingly Beautiful & Inspirational Place to Visit. Based on the artistic & creative background of those associated with Jardin Majorelle I felt inspired on arrival and enjoyed every minute of the couple of hours I spent moseying around the beautiful gardens, monuments & the museum which is located within Berber's old painting studio. They have an Yves Saint Laurent inspired shop on site and there are hundreds of photo opportunities so for those of you who like photography you will love this. A little pricey in Marrkach terms but not too much to put you off ... you will enjoy every minute so I will be giving this a 5 star rating.
Amazing. We got to enter with a students discount, so it was not that expensive, it's a really nice place and perfect if thé day is unbearably hot!

Beautiful gardens. I love this place, the gardens are out of this world. We ate at the cafe there and the food was incredibly tasty. It was just a tad bit busy, the surroundings and food was worth the wait though.

A wonderful oasis but leave time to linger and contemplate. The gardens designed by Ives St Laurent are beautifully laid out with many species of bamboo, cacti and succulents.Its a fairly small site so you could visit in an hour or less. But visit in the early morning or later afternoon and it should be possible to rest and absorb the atmosphere. Follow the journey through the gardens within a garden, admire the water lillies, cacti and massive bamboos. But also leave time for the small Berber museum giving one an insight into their ancient culture, traditions and arts.Thoroughly recommended peaceful oasis in a dusty bustling city.
Jardin. Good place to go to get out of the sun for a few hours. Easy to find and well maintained. A lot of staff walking around, not really sure what for. Love a good cactus!!
Beautiful. Very tranquil and beautiful garden to visit, lots of interesting plants and wildlife to enjoy. Museum also worth a wee look.

Beautiful Oasis!. What a lovely, peaceful place to visit. We went at 2pm, which was a good time to escape the blazing afternoon sunlight and heat. Standard entry was cheaper by 30DHS but did not include entrance to the YSL Museum, which we weren't interested in anyway. The gardens have large ponds in them, surrounded by a large variety of trees, flowers, plants and cacti. We loved the tranquillity of the gardens and the memorial to YSL was a lovely touch. Such a great place to get photos with all of the beautiful colours and textures that surround you constantly. I would 100% recommend.

Beautiful Gardens, a sanctuary in Marrakech. Absolutely beautiful. Serene, well designed, sparse, beautiful colours. Went there on a day it was 40degrees plus, yet felt cool and calm throughout! Relatively small gardens (it wont take more than hour to walk around unless you're obsessed with identifying each and every plant). Museum whilst pleasant didn't seem to "match", 3 small rooms. Berbers had little to do with garden origins or design, so not sure why it was there. Cafe was extortionate, average juices poorly served (in what appear to be half-pint glasses from 1980's Britain). Was £10 for this privilege. Would recommend going first thing when is quieter (although during Ramadan this isn't possible), but as with anywhere these days the proliferation of cameraphones meant not a single sight could be appreciated without gaggles of people taking pictures of themselves next to it and you feeling like you're in their way. All in all, a welcome break in the Marrakech intensity, would recommend a visit for anyone, plant lover or otherwise.
Was Great. Ppleasant gardens with some very impressive plants and architecture. Great way to escape the city, its very peaceful inside and all the water and greenery makes you feel cooler & calmer.
Beautiful Garden!. Don't miss this beautiful garden in the north of Marrakech! There's also a little cafe to have some lunch & yummy fresh juices.

Wonderful gardens. This is a short trip from the part of Medina I was staying . This was an oasis in a crowded city with beautiful flowers walkway with a theme of blue. I would recommend tea and food in the small cafe . Outside was an excellent jewelry store.

Peaceful and beautiful.. Beautiful place brings you peace which you are missing when everyone on the street is trying to sell you something and does not leave you alone. Majorelle Blue colour is amazing. You can even buy a can of this colour in the souvenir shop. Amazing!! 🔵
Yves st. Laurence garden in Marakech. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the medina. On a hot day, it was a cooling respite. It's a good transition between old and new Marakech.

Beautiful blue.. Beautiful gardens. Well worth a visit. The blue is outstanding against the various shades of green. A little oasis in the heat and hustle of Marrakesh. The Berber museum inside the gardens was also extremely interesting if a little small, Fabulous jewellery shop nearby with excellent prices.

Small but nice. The gardens are a lovely place to walk when the temperatures are high. We found it refreshing. They are just much smaller than we expected, so really you could see it all in about 15 minutes. We had a coffee at the cafe and it was also very good. The museum is also tiny, but if you're there, you should see it. Great Berber jewelry that you probably won't see elsewhere.

Ok but pricey. Visited as a family of 4. Good to get out of the midday heat but not great for teenagers as they were a bit bored. Asked for entry to the museum when we entered and paid for it but the ticket we got (which we didn't check) only gave entry to the gardens so had to pay again for entrance to the museum. It was too hot and the kids were too tired for me to argue, which spoiled it a bit. The cafe is very pricey for Marrakech and not as good as the food in the souks sadly. Wouldn't visit again
Lovely!. Went as part of a trip but wish we'd had longer there! The gardens were so beautiful! We didn't go in the museum but it was an option.Literally so so pretty!!

Beautiful place to visit first thing in the morning to avoid crowds!. Beautiful place to visit first thing in the morning to avoid crowds! The garden is extremely photogenic and vibrant but can tend to get very busy towards mid day.

An oasis of calm, cool & pleasant. This is a lovely garden in the heart of the bustle of Marrakesh, it can get quite busy when coach loads of tourists arrive, but if you can go when it's quieter, it's a lovely place to walk round & admire the vegetation.

A must seeif you are in Marrekech.. If you are in Marrakesh, Morocco you must include this stop. Plan to arrive when the site opens to avoid the crowds. It is wonderful to experience "alone". One of the most beautiful gardens we have ever seen.

Lovely gardens. Beautiful gardens with lush green plants from around the world.
Very small though.
Perfect for taking some nice pics.

Beautiful gardens - well worth the walk!. As we were staying in the medina we chose to walk out to the gardens. The maps will tell you it will take 30mins... It takes 20 at most to get there. Whilst there was a small queue they had nice refreshing water misters spraying down to help cool us down. We only opted for the gardens, not the museum, and were very happy with everything we saw. A bit on the expensive side, but we felt worth it. The cafe was expensive compared to most Marrakech prices, and the gift shop was beautiful but also maxing the budget. Never the less we left with beautiful photos and had a very peaceful hour strolling through the shade of the lovely trees.

Beautiful inspiration. So good moments I had there. Good atmosphere. Different from everything! Strong and beautiful colors combination. In 1h30 its possible to see everything! Just stop by to Lunch or drink something in the coffee bar.. it's so beautiful!
It's alright. A garden in Marrakech- it's nice to visit but I wouldn't rate it any higher then a average experience. Unless you are into gardens of this type then this is he place for you.

Beautiful gardens for a shady retreat from the city. Although these gardens are smaller than you might think they are well worth a trip. Full of facinating cacti and unusual plants, shady walkways and the stunning Majorelle blue paint as a backdrop
Stunning. This is beautiful experience! To be honest I did expect more to be there and it to be more extravagant however I would say it is definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful gardens just a cab ride away from the Marrakech medina. We didn't know much about this garden but wow was it amazing. Take a book, spend the day there exploring and reading on a bench. Enjoy some tea at the cafe. The club sandwich was amazing as well.

A peaceful garden. A very simple and quiet garden in the new city area of Marrakech. Very relaxing after a day in the souks, and also visually appealing. Features a lot of cacti, but also larger trees and flowers. A café, museum, and store also all feature.

Nice garden, but overrated imho. The garden is for sure nice, but Ii think a bit overrated. Relatively small and mostly palm trees and cactus and succulents. Lots of people. Not really worth the entrance of 7 EUR. But nice shadows for resting a bit on a hot day.

A must-see. Beautiful. Tranquil. Go there! . The Jardin Majorelle is a sanctuary away from the chaos of the city. It is simply beautiful - that blue. Just wow. The gardens are stunning; we walked around a few times. Once was not enough. The coloured walls, plant pots, architecture, flowers, cacti; the garden is an assault on the senses (in a good way!) We had lunch plans elsewhere but we ended up staying and eating in the Jardin's cafe. The food was lovely and the age courtyard is refreshingly cool and very pretty. There is so much to take in at Jardin Majorelle. Put it at the top of things to do whilst in Marrakech.
heaven on earth. Awesome place to visit. the Cacti was the best of the best for me. most enjoyable place to spend quality time.

Stunnung!!!!. The Majorelle Gardens was simply stunning. For me it was the best thing in Marrakesh. Everything was beautiful. The color scheme for the garden was fantastic, not really what you would expect, but it matches so well with all the beautiful cactus plants. Simply a work of art!You could just spend an afternoon sitting there and enjoyi all its beauty!Please consider it a MUST if your visit Marrakesh. There isnt any garden like this one elsewhere.

A peaceful oasis. This is a beautiful place to relax in the cool on a bench, people watching. The pond is amazing I could have gazed at it all day. The lilies were beautiful & the tiny little frogs so cute. Lovely.
Dessert green. Magic place. Do check it out. Yves Saint Laurent's studio is a treat! I loved studying about the numerous exotic plants. It is a retreat in extreme heat. Fantastic.

An Oasis in Marrakech. Arrrive early when the heat is not so intense and when there are fewer visitors to contend with. It's more serene first thing in the morning with the enormous bamboo swaying gently in the ever so slight breeze and the gorgeous greens of the plants, the lighting and shadows make a feast for the eyes. The vivid colours of the entrance, pots and the few other buildings are eye catching and en vogue. Yves Saint Laurent certainly did a beautiful thing for the city when he dedicated this to Marrakech. It's an artist landscaped garden mixing the orient with the west - an oasis and a complete contrast to the bustling souks and hot streets of the city. I didn't visit the Berber Museum which is tucked away inside however the art exhibition from YSL is worth a glance and leaves you wondering more about this infamous fashion icon. Beautiful quality wares in the shop, well made but a little out of my budget. Highly Recommend a visit. It cost 70 dnh per person (2016) Open 9am-5pm daily
Relaxing. This is a lovely and peaceful place to visit and somewhere you can sit relax and take in the beautiful surroundings. An oasis in a very busy city.

An enjoyable visit to a tranquil garden. Our guide Yousseff suggested we visit this garden and we were not disappointed.
