This garden is planted with the largest collection of arid plants and shrubs we have seen, and in a very attractive way. A good way to spend an hour or so in a shady setting when the sun is hot.I suspect this attraction may not be very suitable for active children as there are narrow paths and different surface levels.To be able to enjoy the huge species of cacti when I returned home, I took a photo of the planting and a photo of the plant drawing and explanation. Perfect way to identify plants at my leisure!
Wonderful peaceful garden. If you ar looking for a peaceful beautiful place to go, this is it. The entire site is painted in Marjorelle blue and it is a wonderful place to visit.

Lovely. Visited the gardens in June, had a lovely time. It was hot, really really hot but the gardens felt cool and had lots of shaded areas to sit.It was really vibrant and calming. We didn't go to the museum but we did go to the restaurant which was delightful, a little on the expensive side for what it was but we can't fault it. The fresh juices were refreshing, the lunch menu was appealing, we ordered a club sandwich and fries which was tasty, the deserts were delish. You don't have to get a taxi back, a little further down the road are horse and carriages which are a fun way to travel.Defo would recommend it.

Oasis. What a stunning little oasis in the middle of the mad city of Marrakech. ..... interesting people milling around and the gardens are cool and relaxing.The museum I would recommend for sure and the jewelry alone is worth seeing.... beautiful couple of hours well spent!
Beautiful and unusual gardens. . Well worth a visit - unusual plants, beautiful colours and winding paths. A very pleasing view at each turn. Only small but lovely.
Stunning gardens in the heart of Marrakech. An absolute must see. Such a variety of exotic plants. The water feature in the centre is beautiful and the shaded walkway adjacent to it.

Worth a quick walk, but not a highlight. A very beautiful colourful garden, but frankly a little disappointing. Don't go there expecting to be blown away. All in all, probably worth going, but if you're only in Marrakech for a couple of days, its not a must see!
Beautiful Garden. If you appreciate the desert life, greenery, colors and plant photography. This is the place. A small place but definitely a short break with cool shade.

Fascinating place; wonderful Berber Museum. The gardens are most definitely a wonderful oasis especially for those interesting in botanical subjects. It is a very peaceful and beautiful place. The Berber Museum is however the real must-see here, as it presents excellent artifacts and is tailored to truly foster understanding and appreciation of what is on display. The cafe' also has a wonderful selection of drinks and dishes, making it really a full-rounded experience.
Good Garden . I was really enjoy, it's was very good garden. Other guests bring flowers, but Yves Saint Laurent gifted the Jardin Majorelle to Marrakesh, the city that adopted him in 1964.

Not worth the price . It's a lovely place with lots of cacti and blue walls but for 70dh I was expecting a lot more. We were in and out in an hour and a half and that includes my girlfriend making me contemplate the beauty of the blue. The most interesting thing was the gold fish. Better going to the palais de la Bahia it is exceptional and it only costs 10dh.

Blue. Green. Yellow. Orange.. The green is the foliage. But the other colours are the buildings and the plant pots. It's basically a very pretty garden. We're based the colour of our new rendering and plant pots in our home garden on the design of this garden, so I guess we must have REALLY liked it. Taxis waiting outside the garden are very expensive considering it's only a 15 minute walk to the medina. But whatevs, it wasn't too hard to haggle.
Beautiful!. Beautiful Garden!!!! Its definetly a quick walk, my husband and i were done with in 30-45 minutes. A lot of tour companies have this stop included in packages.
interesting visit. a good a way to spend a couple of hours , the garden has a vast array of cati and bamboo and is worth a visit
Beautiful!. Visited the Majorelle gardens during a Thomson excursion. Absolutely stunning but wish I had more time there to explore and take in all its beauty
Tranquil gardens away from busy Marrakech . I have been here 3 times and each time I forget how lovely they are. Really pretty, stunning colours and very quiet. A nice way to spend a few hours!
Wonderful. A must to visit if in the city. So tranquil and tasteful a real tribute to YSL . The Berber museum was amazing too.
A bit boring. Lovely cactus and bamboo - but that's all it is and you see it all in 10 mins. 70 dirham entrance. I would probably give it a miss!
pretty gardens. Very pretty gardens and very peaceful. Nothing majorly exciting. Lots of cactus plants. You wouldnt need to spend a lot of time here

A peaceful paradise!. We visited the Majorelle gardens on an afternoon in June. We got the free shuttle bus from our hotel (Riu Tikida Palmeraie) to the medina and got a taxi from there (50 dirhams). The gardens are stunning, full of beautiful plants, cactus' etc. The memorial to Yves Saint Laurent is also within the gardens, and there is a mini gallery of art work, along with book shop and souvenir shop. The café situated in the grounds is lovely, with wonderful drinks, and the water spray was lovely to cool down from the heat. A gorgeous afternoon, a photographers paradise, and a nice place to hide in the shade from the hot afternoon sun! A must see.
Jardin Majorelle - great place to find your silence. Everything here is breathtaking. Once you enter in the garden, everything will change. The landscape and the colors will surprise you.

Just Gardens. I was really in two minds about visiting the gardens, as I didn’t want a wasted journey. However, I am glad I decided to go, but it is just gardens! Very well maintained and very pretty to look at and lots of great photo opportunities. I can image this could be a very romantic and peaceful place to visit if it’s not full of noisy groups, which sadly on my visit it was. There is a lovely little café and a store too – but in my opinion nothing worth buying. You will probably only need an hour or less for this visit. As you exit the gardens there is another café and a few shops that are worth a visit.
Peaceful and cool. Park was lovely and peaceful. The trees provided a much needed respite from the heat of the day. Worth a walk around the park.
best place to see all kinds of cactus's. nice place calming atmosphere. worth the visit. you see different kinds and types of a cactus's, lots of different kinds off plants you won't locally see
Nice, but not more than that.. Lovely garden, but, like any other in the world. Lovely little getaway though from the busy city center.

Great haven. This is a great haven away from the noise and hassling of Marrakech. The entry price is a bit steep for Moroccan standards (70 dirham, 100 if you want to visit the museum too). The visit will take about one hour but the garden is well worth it.We walked to Cafe De La Poste in Gueliz upon exit for a beer and nibbles
Lovely Gardens. Worth a visit if you are in Marrakech! Also to complete the experience enjoy some tea in the cafe, it is nice!

Fantastic oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. We really enjoyed the laid back ambience of the gardens. They are beautifully tended and interesting. The Berber museum on site though small is also worth a visit.
An average experience. An average experience with family. Admission fees wouldn't justify the visit and café is a bit pricey.
Nice place for a relaxed luncb. Beautiful garden nice place to spend a relaxing afternoon and the restaurant/cafe is a nice place to stop and have lunch. Berber museum is small but interesting
gorgeous place to visit. Beautifully kept wonder gardens in Marrakesh. Defo worth a visit just to wander around and admire the amazing collection of plants and cacti and striking architecture
Cool and quiet. Cactus and palms. Nice little berber museum. Oasis of calm with water and seating. Not large. Expensive but lovely cafe on site.
Beautiful oasis. Contemporary Marrakech, relaxing, comfortable, pretty good restaurant, too! Gardens relatively small but worth a visit, especially after being in the bustle of the Medina.
Very pleasant gardens. This is a really pleasant escape from the manic city, it is quite small but well worth a visit for a hour or two
Stunning!. Absolutely stunning gardens! Perfect opportunity for budding photographers or just to chill out! Beautifully landscaped with flashes of strong colour in little hidden places-a must see!!

Amazing gardens-really worth it.. We loved these gardens and the berber museum that lies within the gardens. Really was worth the effort. Our riad organized a horse and carriage to take us there which was a really great trip.
Oasis of calm. Wonderful garden to visit and provides an escape from the frenetic pace of the Medinah. A bit pricy for entry but money goes to charitable trusts and hopefully well spent
Fabulous. Beautiful gardens with charming museums to boot. Colorful and vibrant. I'd go again and again. The shops nearby are fantastic too. Marrakech is full of charm and the Jardin adds to it.

Beauty meets serenity . I was awed by the beauty of the garden, and the sense of peace one experiences whilst walking through the garden. I appreciated the moments of quiet and actually found time to meditate. I also loved seeing the art works and pieces of Moroccan clothing which dates back to 'who knows when'! It's a definite must for anyone going to Marrakech!

Amazing, must do!. It's a must do if you are visiting Marrakech, it's a bit outside the city ~15 mins from Jemaa El Fna place. It's beautiful place/gardens/museum and restaurant. Be aware that this is small you can stay ~45mins - 1h30 if you take your time and going in the museum.Price is 10 euros (museum + garden).I do not recommend the restaurant, it's expensive and service is not the best, but the food is good.Lacks explanations to understand the history behind.
Gorgeous retreat - perfect for photography!. My boyfriend and I are both keen photographers and this place was lovely! There's wildlife too and a nice cafe for pancakes and tea ☕️

Jardin Majorelle Magic. The hustle and bustle of Marrakech was forgotten when we stepped into this beautiful garden. This shady well designed garden offered many visual treats to the eye.The Berber Museum which occupies the former painting studio of Jacques Majorelle was not only fascinating from an historical point of view but the manner in which the displays were presented was stunning.
Quiet escape. Nice to get away for some peace and quiet. Lovely cafe inside too. Although you pay to enter expect to be fleased again once inside if you want to visit the museum.

Worth a visit. Highly recommend visiting the YSL garden. It is an interesting place which isn't exhausting. Check out the museum inside and the mansion of course. There is also a cafe with wifi service if you decide to just take a little bit of downtime after the tour.
Leasure. A nice place to visit with a caring atmosphere. Walk around at your own leasure and enjoy all the plants
plants.. if your into flowers,plants and gardens this is a place to visit,plants&flowers from around the world.individual pools complement the whole gardens of natural beauty and colour.

An oasis in the middle of the marrakech madness. If you know Yves Saint Laurent creations, then you will have an understanding as to why most of his designs are beautiful and magical, it is hard to imagine that such a garden exists in the middle of the madness marrakech

This garden will transport you on a magic carpet ride. From the moment we entered, there was an almost mystical feeling about how a garden should make you feel ... transported away from the cares of the everyday world. The minimalist use of strong colors in just the right places; the mix of lush palms and succulents with dense areas of bamboo; unobtrusive benches inviting you to sit and soak it in; small ponds; even the memorial for Yves St Laurant tucked away quietly in a part of the garden. It all blended beautifully for a deliciously lovely escape from the city outside. The small museum on the grounds is well worth a visit. A tasteful mix of photos, video and artifacts tell of Berber life. Before you leave, go into the patio cafe for a delicious juice and maybe a decadent crepe.
Splash of colours . A piece of paradise! The combination of colours is so unique. The garden is a nice getaway from the heat and buzzing medina. Lunch there is also very nice!

a little pricey, but very peaceful and the pond is full of turtles!. We decided to walk to this garden, as it wasn't far from our hotel. We were surprised when we got there and the entry fee was 70dhs each (£7 approx), as this seemed quite expensive, but we went in anyway. The garden is beautiful and is so peaceful. The house is stunning and the lapis lazuli blue colouring everywhere is something to marvel at. I was also happy because I love wildlife and there were a few lovely ponds with fish and even a few terrapins! Overall it is worth the money if you want to escape the craziness of the city for a few hours

Stunning!!!!. This garden was designed by Yves St Laurent and is a real oasis in the middle of the city, with a good amount of dappled shade. The colours of the walls and pots are gorgeous and there is a pretty shop at the end selling very lovely (and quite expensive) souvenirs! There is a also a cafe though we didn't visit. Would definitely visit again...

On day out in city . Called in here at the first stop of the day. Quite and very much better than I expected the gardens are nice and keeped well and staff busy looking after them nice to spend a hour in a wonderful garden

Quick Stop with a Little Culture. My wife and I are not big into botany, but the gardens were nice and it provide a good break from the craziness of the Medina. There is also a little museum about the Berbers. This is a quick site that you should knock out on your trip as everyone goes here.

Bright colors, beautiful place!. Spent half of day walking around taking pictures. We got some amazing pictures that can compare to anyone's best pictures in any place in the world.We also ate at the restaurant. Prices were higher than average but the food quality was good.

Not worth the entrance fee. Totally boring and for sure not worth the money you need to pay for. Decided to have a coffee and found rude uninterested employees who were not so included to actually be friendly.

This is a great place to visit. This is a great place to visit. Lots of cool places to sit in the hot weather. I would have liked to see a bit more of and about YSL, even a bit more info on the man that designed the gardens n the first place.
Amazing place To Visit. During mi Trip to marrakech we included the visit of this amazing Garden its really very interesting to do
Fantastic. One of the things you must do in this city. Amazing gardens . Tranquility in the chaos that is Marakesch

Beautiful. We paid Jardin Marorelle a visit while in Marrakech. It was quite busy but that didn't distract from how beautiful the garden is. With an array of plants from all over the world and plenty of wildlife it is the perfect setting to take a morning or afternoon and relax in the shade. I loved the use vibrant colours used on the pots and walls. There is also a small gallery of some of the card YSL created which is worth going to see as well as the museum focusing on the history of the Berbers. We ate lunch here which was very tasty if not a little more expensive than the restaurants and cafés back in the medina but that was OK, we were on holidays. The ice cream was delicious so I would recommend treating yourself while you're there! The waiting team were really friendly which always makes a meal taste just that bit better.

Disappointing. after seeing the Mammounia free of charge, Jardin Majorelle was quite disappointing. Of course at the Mammounia not everyone is allowed in as they check you at the entrance...peope with shorts are ot allowed in

You should GO. Someone told us this garden was all hype and not worth a stop and I'm happy we still went. Sometimes lowered expectations helps. It really is a pretty space with a lovely garden to sit in. If you love pictures, you could kill so many hours taking pics. I greatly enjoyed and preferred the outdoor space and if I had to go again would skip the museum. While interesting, it's very small and not that much to see.

Jardin Majorelle. This is the top attraction in Marrakech so I went with two friends. The gardens are beautiful but the staff spoiled the experience for us. Disappointing to the max. Only bad experience with Moroccan people, who tend to be friendly and attentive.
Must see . Amazing and colourful gardens. Very beautiful and well worth a visit. They had a variety of different plans and cactuses.

Effortless Marriage of Diverse Beauties!. One of the most beautiful places in Marrakech is Jardin Majorelle. The entrance fee is very reasonable, 50 MAD (30 MAD for museum) and they are both worth it. The garden is not big but every corner offers a new view of trees and flowers, brought here by the original creator from all over the world. The marriage of colours, architecture and natural beauty is effortless and breath taking. This is a great place to visit with family or alone.

Beautiful - I got engaged here. Stunning setting, a nice bit of history and a lovely restaurant/cafe. Made even better by the fact I proposed to my (now) fiance here after a lovely walk around the gardens!
A little way out of town but worth the effort

Disappointed . My sister and I were really excited to see the gardens as they are hyped up everywhere. The day we went was very busy so not very tranquil at all. We were quite surprised by the price of entry 70dh whilst the palace baldi gardens were only 10. There wasn't that much to see and we were expecting it to be a lot larger we had read 12 acres. It was a peaceful walk around just not that interesting or worth it. If you're trying to save some money I'd say give it a miss.
A beautiful garden. The garden was smaller than I expected and slightly awkwardly located if in the old town, but it really is beautiful and well worth a visit.
Awesome!. A really amazing place - great for photos and escaping the heat of the Medina! The cafe was a nice place to enjoy a mint tea and the food all looked delicious!!

Stunning!. It's an absolute paradise in the midst of quite a hectic city. Even if you're not into gardens etc, this place is absolutely gorgeous. The flora mixed with the cobalt blue is to die for. Don't forget the main house too! Highly recommended.

Lovely gardens in the city. This was my 3rd visit to Majorelle and the first in 10+ years. They should be on everyone's list when visiting Marrakech. Not great for kids but it's worth dragging them round even if you only spend an hour (and there are turtles in the ponds).The gardens have really matured since I was last here and they are an oasis in the madness of Marrakech.2017 sees the opening of what appears to be a museum based on the life of Yves St Laurent so I'm sure I'll be back sometime to see that.

Very attractive gardens. Lovely garden, nice and cool on a hot day. Very interesting plants and very well kept. Well worth a visit. It isn't too large and you could spent a pleasant hour or so exploring this garden.

A visual treat !!. The brilliance of the Morrocan colours are at true exhibition here, very well maintained and impeccably managed it is a treat to the eyes. The contrast of colours and the cactus gardens are almost so unreal. Its located just a short 20 min drive from the Medina area. Do not miss it.

Superb. So good we went twice!. Peaceful garden, well laid out and very clean. Apparently it can get extremely busy when the coach parties arrive but we visited twice, both times arriving about 11am and there were no large parties in evidence. The café serves coffee, drinks and food and is reasonably priced. We had coffee one day and lunch the second. The museum was a bit disappointing but probably just about worth the extra few dirhams.

Beautiful gardens that are well worth a visit. Jardin Majorelle was Yves Saint Laurent and his partner, Pierre Berge's great passion. Originally the home of artist, Jacques Majorelle, the garden is a creative project designed with love. The shapes, colours and contrasting plants make like nothing else I've ever seen. The Berber museum that has a wonderful collection of Moroccan costumes is also a treat. It's a work of art and on a hot day, offer a cool shaded oasis in the craziness of Marrakech.
Gardens were spectacular. Be sure to visit, a must see. Go early in the day as it will be less busy and you can linger. There are lovely details so walk slow and enjoy the sitting areas
Colors.... You have to visit the place if you llike the gardes. It is ver colorful place. It is not too huge but you can have nice time here. It is one of the popular place in Marrakech.

Wasn't overly impressed. While this made a nice change from the desert landscape we had been around since arriving in Marrakech, I wasn't overly impressed by it. It was much smaller than I had expected and after about 15 minutes we were struggling to find a reason to stay longer. It did provide a bit a peace from the hustle of Medina though, and those with a keen eye for photography may find it more interesting.
Really nice gardens!. You must visit them if you go to Marrakech! Nice place to spend the morning, to have a coffee with friends or partner!

Really nice garden. The garden was really nice and cool and a nice way to spend the morning. It is not very big but is worth your while. If you are a student ask for a discount cause they dont mention it anywhere.. The cafe is nice but too expensive so I suggest to avoid it.
A dream in an oasis!. Beautiful and must-do when in Marrakech! We learned about Kline blue, Yves St Laurent, tropical plants... A visual feast and spiritual wonder.
Highly recommended for a romantic moment. A garden that will enchant all lovers that have the opportunity to visit it. Very romantic atmosphere.

A must visit. Visited on the last day of our visit to Marrakech. A beautiful garden for its amazing colour and relaxing atmosphere. There is also a museum to visit which is located within the garden. A nice but little expensive restaurant to eat lunch. Worth a visit !!

Simply Beautiful. I went to Jardin Marjorelle in June 16, and what a beautiful place. We went around 9am, and missed all of the crowds, which meant we could spend more time taking in the amazing plants, trees and cacti. We had tea and pastries in the Cafe, which was a nice way to break up the morning and have some refreshments. The Museum was amazing as well, and though most things were written in French, then staff we very happy to translate. I would 100% recommend you visit here.
Peaceful place to end a busy day.. Beautiful, soothing gardens with those rich colors to contrast nature's beauty. Perfect end to a long and busy day taking in Marrakech.

Beautiful calm oasis. Lovely lovely place to visit. Very calming and peaceful - and much cooler! Nice little cafe in the middle. Turtles, frogs and birds around to watch too while strolling. The museum inside is good too - very informative and fascinating.

Beautiful Oasis. A must see when in Marrakech - beautiful colours and amazing views. There's a memorial to Yves Saint Laurent and a guide book which explains how & why the gardens came to be. An amazing, quiet oasis in the middle of a busy and arid city
Amazing! . Beautiful, colourful, with exotic scenery, and nature. Many people there trying to make their living, many of them are poor.

beautiful colors, giant cacti. A great thing to do when in Marrakech. The gardens were stunning, the biggest cacti I've ever seen. The colors are so vivid in person. Be sure to visit the Berber museum & the book store attached.

What a beautiful place!. Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful and peaceful place to go. Plants from all over the world are present in this relaxing garden, decorated with bright blue and yellow walls. At the Berber museum, inside the garden, you can appreciate the diversity of the original people from Morroco and their beautiful costumes and traditions.
beautiful!. We loved this peaceful oasis after the hustle and bustle of Marakkech as well as the small but well curated museum

beautiful paradise away from the heat and chaos. Shady nice garden with a quaint cafe. A photographer's paradise.
Lovely hues of blue and green and yellow
An Oasis and Tribute to Yves St. Laurent. This marvelous oasis in the heart of Marrakesch is a must-see. Lovingly tended and colorful. A welcome respite.

A Refreshing and delightful Garden. This garden has some spectacularly tall palms, impressive bamboo stands and amazingly large cacti and succulents. The planting, water features, paths and seats have been well laid out. If you are staying in the Medina it is not too far to walk. Find a shady seat and just chill a while.
Pretty place but only for 15 mins. Small gardens from Yves St Laurent quite pretty but struggle to spend more than 15 minutes there. Also at €7 per person quite expensive for such a small facility
Nice way to kill an hour. Nice gardens. Standard adult price is now 70 dirhams. Nice coffee shop and peaceful setting. You'll only need an hour to enjoy a stroll around the gardens.

A delight in the city center.. When you arrive for first time to Marrakech you could think that is a dry and dessert city. No, sorry. It is a nice and green city. The green of forest and parks and the rose of the wall match perfectly. But the most beautifull place regarding gardens is Majorelle garden. Cheap entrnace just 6 euro (free for kids). It is not a big spot. But you can spend two hours without porblems. First you visit a bamboo forest, with a fresh shadows. The water running between the plants and the birds make it a pacefull place. Nice decoration and good beverage spot alcohol free.

Peaceful, colourful spot. We really loved the gardens and exhibition at Jardin Marjorelle. It was a welcome break from the bustle and well worth the visit. The cafe looked delicious but expensive so we ate nearby.

Part of our day trip of the city. This was a nice break from the rest of the city. The garden has a very large amount of different types of plants. The scenery and colors associated with the place blend together very well. If your a photographer, you would love this place. The kids were semi-entertained. It was very warm that day and they were getting cranky. Some areas are covered with the shade of the plants but other areas were not. Overall, we really enjoyed it and there is a snack stand right outside which served ice cream and cheered up the kids.
tastefully designed. The gardens were interesting, well kept and nicely designed. The Berber museum also - one of the better museums of Berber dress and lifestyle in Marrakech. An enjoyable visit.
Beautiful gardens. The garden is lovely, but was very busy the day we visited. When it is less busy it is a nice place to sit down and enjoy the garden for a while.

Average experience. Cactus collection is worth a view, but cost of Eu 7 per person is high. We were done in 30mins and didn't know what to do with the rest of the morning. And most of the stores in Gueliz were closed that day.

Beautiful to see. Tranquility in the heart of chaos. Pricey though. Gardens are fabulous to see but thought the entry price was a bit steep. Lovely cafe to sit and relax, gift shop with beautiful array of goods. Enjoy the visit. Glad I've seen it.
Mediocre. Extremely crowded, offers some nice sights, however the area is rather small and the whole tour can be done in 15 minutes.

NOT WORTH THE TIME OR MONEY. smaller than i thought it would be to crowded water features emptyI love gardening and gardens so this was the excursion i wanted the group to do. Very disappointing. Sure Monty Don from Gardeners world UK said it was worth a visit. I love Monty but if he did he was incorrect.
Beautiful graden . A perfect getaway inside hectic Marrakesh. Gorgeous plants, trees and flowers. And the most intense color blue you ever saw!
It s a garden. Nothing really special about it. It's nice and what I liked is that there are benches you can sit on and relax . There are also a boutique where you can find really nice things.

Loved it!. Beautiful relaxing visit...do not miss. Despite a hot day the garden provides shade and the little cafe in courtyard is ideal for some food and drinks...try the banana orange ginger and mint juice.

Colorful oasis. A beautiful small garden and a nice contrast to the medina. The blue and yellow colors are awesome. As we arrived the exit, we decided to take a second walk trough the park to enjoy the silence and the beauty of this small oasis.

Beautiful break from the hustle and bustle. The gardens were small and quaint. Allow yourself around 45 minutes to an hour to walk around. You can then indulge in some mint tea or food in their courtyard restaurant which was lovely - we just had tea!You can also visit the Berber Museum but we didn't head in there so maybe need a bit more time. I cheap break and pretty displays - lots of tourists but not overly busy.
Picturesque. A very nice garden with beautiful, exotic plants. It has a café, toilets, a bookshop and a boutique store. Yves Saint-Laurent created this garden.

Friday in Marrakech during Ramadan. An awesome thing to do for an hour or so on a Friday afternoon during Ramadan. Beautiful gardens, and some very nice high end shops if you are tired of shopping in the Medina. I would definitely recommend this as a cultural activity.

Great place to cool off on a hot day. We visited the garden during the hottest part of the day, and you could feel the temperature difference as you entered. The shady trees and water features leave the inside of the compound cool and relaxing. Fantastic colours are everywhere for the photographer, and the plants will impress all the gardeners of the group.The main pond that you always see pictured for this attraction isn't as tidy in person, but it was full of tiny chirping frogs. Fair swap, as far as I'm concerned :)We had a line to buy tickets for this attraction; many tour groups (mostly families or retirees) stop by here. The wait was only around ten minutes however, and worth a look.
Stunning. Amazing garden worth a visit. The blue and the fauna was from another world! Take loads of pictures and enjoy even the animals like frogs and turtles there. So nice!
Afternoon out. My second visit, interesting little visit. A lot of work going on at the minute, so a little untidy, but still worth a visit

Not sure what the fuss is about.. I don't really understand why people have given this five stars unless, by chance, they've never seen a cactus before. It's a fairly nice garden. Not incredible, not fantastic, not amazing or special out outlandish. 5 stars it isn't.What it *is* is a fairly small (probably 5 minutes walking if you didn't stop) garden full of a stream and some small ponds (which are slightly overfilled with goldfish) which have blue kerbs around the edges, and a blue house. The garden contains a lot of cacti with varying degrees of info signs telling you their names and countries of origin. There's also a museum dedicated, it would seem, to Yves Saint Laurent. We didn't visit that because we're not really fans - though there is also half a pillar in the garden as a monument to him. The most interesting part of the garden, by far, was a slightly ageing British woman and her American consort taking photos (complete with pretentious "hold the light meter up" pose) with her skirt pulled up practically to her armpits while their Moroccan guide tried not to laugh. Unfortunately for everyone who didn't make it today, I don't think they're a regular fixture. If this garden were free, it would probably merit 3 stars. As it is, it's a fair walk across some lethal dual carriageways filled with kamikaze motorbike riders to get to a garden that costs 70 MAD each to enter in order to look at a few plants. Save your money, go to Kew or similar when you get home, and enjoy something Moroccan while you're in Morocco.

Nice gardens, watch the change you're given!!!. We very much enjoyed the gardens themselves and also went to the Berber museum. This was interesting, however I handed over a 200DIR note and was short changed. I did challenge it and was reluctantly handed the right money. I personally don't think this was an accident and it did slightly affect my thoughts of the place. The gardens were lovely and we got some nice photos here.

Little Oasis. If you are looking to spend an hour looking at beautiful plants and for ambience then I recommend here. You wouldn't really spend the day, as it's very small. You can do a slow walk around in about 30 mins. There is a museum and a shop but you pay extra for the museum so not sure it's worth the money. It is a beautiful place if you don't mind there being not much of it. I've actually been in bigger garden centres. If you just want to relax and walk around then it is perfect for that. Also you'll be in the shade so come during the afternoon so you don't melt in the streets!
Beautiful gardens and interesting museum. The gardens are truly beautiful however a little small, the museum was really interesting however it was a bit upsetting you couldn't take any photos.

Beautiful but packed. It's a nice place, a must-to-visit, but so so packed with people that the experience goes down... Also there is a cafe inside that does super nice tea, with a right amount of sugar! Not not to forget to mention the museum is very very nice, no photos allowed, but worth a while!

WONDERFUL GARDEN AND MUSUEM. The gardens, the buildings, the Berber museum, the food, the toilets, and the staff were all superb. The gardens are amazingly lovely. There are many types of cacti and several types of bamboo. There is a water lily pool, a splashing fountain, wonderful shadows, and gorgeous colors in the walls and flower pots. The Moroccan light is astonishing. There is a fine book store and a nice boutique. Taxi service is easily arranged to & from the jardin.

A Beautiful Oasis in the Marrakech medina. Both the garden and the Berber museum are worth a visit. This tranquil space offers a welcome respite from the hectic medina. Though small, the museum houses a very nice collection of Berber costumes, and jewelry and is worth the additional entrance fee.

Insanely Beautiful!!!. Wow! what a beautiful gem in the Marrakech mayhem / desert. One of the most beautifully preserved / maintained garden we've ever visited. Groovy cafe & shops too! Cant wait to go back.
Lovely garden, glad I only paid student price.. Lovely garden but quite pricey for the size of it. Glad I got student price. Peaceful and a nice break from the medina.

Beautiful Gardens. I came here with a friend and spent most of the day here admiring the gardens. It's not as big as I had thought but photography lovers will have fun. We had tea at the cafe inside the garden which also has a nice atmosphere. I would highly recommend this as an essential stop for people travelling to Marrakech.
Beautiful . Stunning gardens and a fascinating Berber museum that should not be missed. Particularly the sky of star in the jewellery room. Cafe pretty but pricy.

Museum better than the garden. I enjoyed the Berber museum complete with costumes, jewelry and tools on display. The garden itself was nothing too special. I went to a random free one in Australia and it was bigger and better. But the Berber museum was worth it.

Stunning gardens. You could not find more of a contrast to the madness of the medina than these gardens. Spend a couple of hours walking around this beautiful place and you will not regret it. The Berber exhibition is really worth the extra cost as the artifacts, photographs and video give a real incite into their history and life.
Beautiful garden. It is a beautiful small garden in the heart of Marrakech. You should pay 70dh to enter it. Museum is for additional payment and no need to visit it.

Nice break from the medina. Pretty gardens and very interesting Berber museum located inside. The gardens have lots of cool plant life, but much of it was not native to Morocco which seemed a bit odd. We did take a horse and carriage back to the medina after our visit which was a nice way to have that experience for a lengthy, but not TOO lengthy ride.
Wonderful! Don't miss it. A beautiful place. Quite unique Peaceful and tranquil. The restaurant is good too. Excellent value and easy to find

A lovely place!. Although it was a pain to actually find the place, it is worth the visit! The garden has lovely fountains, all kinds of trees , plants and birds. Try out the restaurant next to the garden - I can definitely recommend the chicken tajine! A bit overpriced compared to prices in the city center of Marrakesh, but still very nice. Highly recommended!
Serene little garden. Great place to spend a few hours enjoying the natural beauty. Quite touristy however everybody is very respectful and quiet. Bring a book and picnic too!
Why is this a #1 attraction?. The most dull but also most expensive sight we saw in Marrakech. Yes it is beautiful and calm but ...meh
Calm. A lovely cool calm oasis in the busy city with a nice cooling mist spray while queuing to get in. Easy to find and well signposted.

Unique but expensive. Nice, but expensive for what it is.70 dh. Inside if you Want to go to The berber museum you will have to pay 30 dh extra. Anyway, i think it is unique. Worsts a visit!
:)

Mesmerizing!. Wow! It's mesmerizing!!The Garden is so unique with the exceptional layout of diverse cactus that anyone will not be able refrain oneself from taking couple of photos just at the beginning. The more you proceed forward the more you are enchanted!!This is a place of tranquility!The best time to visit this garden is late afternoon as the sunlight falls from behind the cactus and creates a breathtaking view of those lovely plants.
Beautiful Site. Not a large garden, but worth the stroll. Spend time int he museum as well if you go. Very interesting cultural experience.

Nice place. I liked the bright and intense blue color, the pools with many Lillys and frogs. There is a very bautiful caffe and resturent where I enjoyed an afternoon tea. Unfortunately they don't allow taking photographs in the meusium.

Totally gorgeous... Small but worth every penny.. This place is beautiful.. Do what the guides recommend and try and get there as early as possible to avoid people due to it's size of it's too busy it's hard to get lovely photo opportunitys.. Simply stunning well worth the visit..

Val& Chris . Beautiful gardens very relaxing walking around. We didn't goInto the Yves Saint Laurent museum. The gardens are very well maintained my only criticism is that there could be info with regards to the different plants by other than that beautiful

Good in contrast. Here's the thing: yes it's a nice garden area, but honestly I think it only gets so much praise because of where it's located. If this same garden were located somewhere else it would barely be a blip on the radar. Don't get me wrong, it's beautiful, it just seems to get high rating because of the contrast to everything else around it.
A must to visit. Beautiful gardens all shaded and cool and you must see the museum small but contains all traditional clothing and jewellery. A lovely treat.
A very tranquil & beautiful place to spend a couple of hours in.. Even though its small its a beautiful garden and well worth the visit. Entrance can prove a little difficult to find though.
Beautiful Oasis. The gardens are a must. Peaceful and tranquil. We could have spent longer wandering around but were on a half a day tour so were in a rush.
Paradise. Absolutely beautiful gardens. We were there in April and many things were in bloom, including the cactus. But as nice as the gardens are the museum is even more spectacular.
Mazing. Simply beautiful, relaxing, a deep breath of peace in a city that is always hectic and moving. On the other hand i expected a little more from the Saint Laurent Legacy.

Beautiful colours in the Garden. Different colours scheme used in the Garden. Beautiful plants and constructions in Moroccan style. Must visit when you are in Marrakech though the entrance fees cost 120/dir. Should stay at least 2 hours inside. Cool in the shade cos lots of trees and green plants inside. No rush.

Totally over-rated exp. I usually love visiting Botanical gardens around the world, but this was small. we were in and out within 15mins. And you had to pay 70D. I was more impressed with garden close to the fes medina.

The Sanctuary of the Sirens. Upon arriving at the Jardin walls in our yellow metal chariot, as our coachman waved us off with a charming smirk and a few copper crowns in his coin pouch, I had heard murmurs from the west of the beauties that adorn the gardens inside. I handed over my 70 dirhams and entered with the taste of anticipation gripping my tastebuds.My eyes were greeted with the wonders of all the severn kingdoms, cacti from the scorched planes of Central America, elegant palms from the Arabian peninsular and delicate water lilies serenely floating in the pool found in the inner sanctum of the Jardin. As I wondered around the gardens drinking in all the delights on offer my eyes were captivated by the eye catching, vivid blues and the creamy yet striking yellows adorning the ceramics and brick work. The groundsmen are truly a testament to the fabled owners, the elegant chic that Yves Saint Laurent evoked in his work is transient in the artwork of nature.

Beautiful and fascinating place. We visited in the morning at about 10 am, it was filling up but not too busy. The cafe served very good coffee and the museum on Moroccan life and the Berbers was worth a visit. They are currently building a bigger museum. This is a beautiful place to visit, probably only for a half day but worth the time.

Gardens AND Berber Museum. Do not miss this lovely succulent and bamboo garden in the heart of Marrakech. But even more important, take the time and slightly extra money to visit the Berber Museum situated within the grounds of the garden. It is outstanding and doesn't get the attention it deserves in the guide books. It was the best museum I visited while in Morocco for two weeks.
A truely remarkable experience . From the moment I walked into this place, I felt peace, calm and energised all at once. The beauty, and the colours.. A genius put this place together. Just heaven

Unexpected paradise. This is a very interesting and unusual place.You will see what about 40 years of work has been spent on.Yves Saint Laurent is definitely "present" here and a big project is in progress to build a museum (to be open in 2017).

Beautiful and serein. Gardens are a bit small, even if you include the museum don't expect to spend hours , and can be crowded. Too cheap to miss really (may be just pay the price and get in rather than trying to like someone did ahead of us pretend that you are living in Marrakech in order to get the discount .

Peaceful. Very pretty with lots of different plants to look at. There is a Berber museum, cafe, and memorial to Yves Saint Laurent if you would like to check those out. It's definitely a nice break from the hustle and bustle in the rest of the city. The jardin shouldn't take you longer than an hour to look at. We went earlier in the morning so the lines weren't long, it wasn't too hot, and there weren't too many people.

colorful oasis in red marrakesh. Seeing this place full of colors and nature inside an arid and all red city of Marrakesh was great relief. I also recommend seeing a movie about Yves Saint Laurent who lived there and restaured the place before going to understand a bit of its history and enjoy the experience better.

Nice Jardin. We had a short trip to Marrakech and spent a wonderful day going around the Jardin Majorelle. The plants and planting are exquisite, it is certainly worth a visit if you have half a day to explore. However, make sure you get a taxi back though, as with any where in Morocco it is very easy to get lost. Enjoy it it is worth a tour

Pleasant but smallish. If you have an hour or two that you need to fill, these gardens are really well laid out and maintained. The combination of plant variety (bamboo to cacti) and a thoughtful layout makes it feel like you are not surrounded by a huge throng of tourists. From a photography standpoint, there is not a lot here to shoot - frogs on lily pads, that kind of thing, but they are tri-pod friendly if you reassure them you are amateur.A highlight was the little cafe, complete with misters and sun filters to keep you cool.The gift shop is pricey even by US standards but they have some really nice things.If you have a couple days in the city, I can't imagine this would not end up on your list.
Fascinating . Not quite Kew gardens but still worth a trip. Great book shop. Berber museum is the best part. Quality of shop is superb, makes usual Moroccan trinkets pale in comparrison.

Relaxing oasis. A nice calming place away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. Did not take very long to walk around and although it was well maintained with a decent cafe I did not feel it was worth the trouble of getting there and back. We took a horse and carriage there which made the trip a bit more interesting.

Cool, peaceful and delightful. A lovely oasis in a busy, dusty city. We had no idea of the connection with Yves St. Laurent, who bought these gardens in 2008 and brought them back to their former glory.Lovely to spend time in this shady spot with tropical plants, trees, ponds and fountains.There is also a pleasant cafe with an outside shaded area to enjoy a coffee or orange juice.

Beautiful garden- plants, frogs and ponds.. Our driver from Fez to Marrakesh, and our host at our Dar both recommended this garden for good reason! It was a calm, lovely place, and the cafe inside was enjoyable too- worth the slightly higher cost to sip mint tea or lattes in the shade of the lovely trees there.

Peaceful and fresh when it is very hot . Worth a visit around 3pm when it is too hot to get outside Do not expect too much though it is a lovely peaceful garden, the visit doesn't take more than an hour. We went around 10 am but I would have gone a bit later when the medina is too hot to visit

Yoga retreat. . I have been several times over the years and this Jardin is always on my list to see. The Yves St Laurent memorial has been added. Some colors have been added, I preferred the original.

Lovely garden. It's so different from what you see in Marrakech,if I am not mistaken the entrance fee it was 70 DH for person, definitely worth it, they also have a coffee bar- restaurant inside where you can enjoy a nice coffee/lunch.

Quiet and peaceful. This garden is nice to visit for the peace it brings you, garden is well maintained but not wow. It's a shame a lot of people carve their names in the plants. Price is pretty high.

Oasis in Marrakech. We went to the gardens in the morning (the earlier the better) before the tour buses arrived. We got there around 9:15 or so, but I would recommend trying to get there around 8 or 8:30, you would have it all to yourself. The berber museum was very interesting, it had tools, jewelry and clothes as well as a history of the berber people in Morocco. The gardens themselves were beautiful. With all the plants and trees it was cool even though we were outside.

Its pretty.. We went to tick it of the list yes its beautiful, however we finished within 20 minutes of walking around. It is nice for pictures. From jenan al fina its about 20 mins by taxi. And entrance is 70dhs
just lovely. A gem of a place. just stunning gardens, a real dream of a place. Wander and loose track of the past, present and future.

Business . I find it hard to understand why this would be the number one activity in Marrakech . Ok some great plants and an interesting by line story - but really we were in and out within 40 minsDon't bother

Little expensive but nice garden. Ticket to see the garden is 70dh per person. In general, it was worth it though to see all the different cactus and plants from all over the world. Nice place to visit, though a little out of the way for most other things.

Lovely, peaceful gardens. We visited the gardens on our last hot afternoon in Marrakech; I was a little surprised that it wasn't larger, but it was tranquil and beautiful with a delightful little cafe for snacks and larger meals. If you want to get away from the madness and hassle of the Medina, it's a lovely respite for an hour or two.

Beautiful gardens. Very attractive and peaceful place to visit. Lovely photo opportunities. You need to pay an entrance fee but is certainly worth evey dirham. Very tidy and a lovely range of plants and soothing waters
Loved it. Amazing gardens, lovely little walk roundGet there early to avoid mad crowds. We timed it just right but as we left it was getting busy..

Stunning!. Absolutely gorgeous - don't miss. I was here with my 22 yo daughter. Sorry no category for grown children! We came in the afternoon about 4 pm. There is lots of shade so the temp was not a problem. It was just so beautiful. Admission was 100 dirhams for gardens and museum. We stayed about 1.5 h - walked the garden and went thru the small museum. A must while in Marrakech

Must see . This is one of my favorite places in Marrakesh. We did the gardens and the museum. For a small museum it was very well kept and displayed. My only regret is not planning for more time to spend on the grounds of the gardens. If you're a fashionista, the gift shop is dangerous. Well made Morrocan influenced items by Boutique Majorelle that you would actually wear vs just "something fun you got on vacation".Go for the gardens and add the museum.
Lovely place. So many different plants and so colorful. I really liked it there. It was so peaceful. It you like gardens it is a must see.
Beautiful. A beautiful place to walk around and relax in the shade of the trees with a mint tea. Obviously popular with the local community as well and not to far out of the centre of the Medina.

Underwhelming. It's a place most tourists visit because other tourists do. How else could a small botanical garden, with so little of real interest to recommend it, recruit so many eagerly paying customers? In its defence, and for balance, I live in the UK's Lake District where stunning botanical beauty surrounds our every step. So maybe I'd appreciate this place more if I lived in Arizona...SUMMARY: An underwhelming oasis of desert plants in a city with many better places to visit.
Nice garden. Nice garden to walk thru, few stray cats that were well fed, cool things to look at, Yves St Laurent history

Jardin Majorelle- Marrakech. Jardin Majorelle- definitely pop in while in Marrakech its great, kind of botanical garden you don't expect( or me didnt expect to find here)Nice escape from the buzz of the city.Definitel worse of the visit!

So beautiful! Not to be missed!. Such a beautiful place, so inspiring and the most beautiful leather goods you'll find in the city! It is very fresh there, it is great to relax and escape the craziness of the city.
Oasis in the Middle of Marrakech. Beautifully maintained garden that belonged to YSL. We didn't have a great guide, so most of the information we got was from the flyer given to us as we entered.
Okay. I was disappointed with these gardens. Lots of hype and people going but whilst it was tranquil and pleasant i have been to better in the uk. Lost gardens of heligan leave this place standing.

Beautiful and relaxing. Great experience. Most definitely worth a visit! Great to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech and just have a nice relaxing morning. Most of the plants have labels so you can see where they originate from, quite interesting where they've flown in from! Can see the YSL Love postcards in a separate small gallery. Really lovely experience.
Early morning best to get people free photos. Very peaceful and some fascinating plants in the heart of a very busy hot and dry city. Worth a visit.

Best to go early morning . This place attracts many coach trips, so go early. You'll be able to take many pictures without other tourists being in them. Apart from the small garden to walk round. There's also a Yes Saint Laurent museum. You'll probably spend about 45 mins in here seeing everything.

A good break. I took a cab from Jema AL fena square . I would not pay more than 20 Dirham for the ride, each way. The taxis in the taxi cue just outside of the garden will try to charge 100 dirham to the square. I would suggest walking away from the garden and catch a cab near by.The garden itself was relaxing and the small museum was informative, relative to the Berber culture. There is an extensive collection of native dress, jewelry and tools. They do not allow photography within the museum.

Okay. The place is okay to visit. The price was 70 dirham per person and kids under 12 are free. There are a lot of trees and plants to view. You can take the number 1 bus from the square to the garden and the cost is 4 dirhams and will take about 1/2 hour to get there. The buses are very clean.
Beautiful. Really worth a visit! Beautiful gardens and a breath of fresh air from the crazy vehicle full streets of marrakesh.

Impressive but busy. Visited the gardens on a weekday. Took about 20 minutes queuing for tickets (70 dirhams each). Once inside the gardens are well kept but it was rather dry, too many people trying to take photos and getting in each other's way. Did not visit the museum.

Wonderful . We've heard that you need around 45 min to visit but we spend there more than 2 hours, we liked it so much! It's such an amazing place... with all the trees and plants growing there you have a nice cool place to relax. Definitely worth a visit
Cool. Cool place.. mm ice botanical exposure and more in an artist house ..Yves saint Laurent.he s talking for it all
Cozy. Well preserved! a nice spot of nature close to the center of Marrakech. Wide variety of plants and cactus.

Stunning. A must go.. This garden is absolutely gorgeous. I was in awe the entire time. Although it´s not massive, I could have stayed for hours. The Majorelle blue is like nothing I´ve ever seen before and there are nooks and resting spots throughout the garden. Definitely recommend it even if you have a short time in Marrakech.

Beautiful and a Must see . The gardens are beautiful. It is must see in Marrakech. I have read some negative reviews, I have to disagree. It is like a museum, you talk around and take in the beautiful sights. There is more to it then just the gardens. There is a book store, a mini art gallery, a love room, and a cafe/restaurant.
Lovely experience.
Modernistic gardens. Not what we were expecting in Marrakech, but very nice nevertheless. Very modernistic with lots of electric-blue paint and cactii
Pleasant Garden. Small garden a close walk from boub ksour. Nice to walk around but nothing amazing. History of the garden more interesting.

Escape from madness. A great garden in tribute to Yves St Lauren in the midst of the madness and calm and peaceful oasis. Make sure you also visit the museum within the gardens. There is a little café in the gardens as well with great food although prices are a bit steep.

Was expecting more. As a brief visit to a garden it was ok, if you're looking for a great day out then plan something else for after you're visit here. The cafe in the gardens was ok, nothing special. The best part of the visit was the unexpected pond life, keep you're eyes open for special treats.

Beautiful and tranquil.. A beautiful tranquil garden just what is needed to escape the busy city centre. It is very well laid out, beautifully kept with lots of interesting plants. The museum is small, but worth the extra money for the ticket. Well worth the visit, you can sit on one of the many benches and just watch :-)
not to miss. if you have enough time in marrakech you can go and visit this amazing garden . we like it though we did not have much time ..
Stunning but small. Beautiful garden set back from busy main road. Only took about 10 to 15 minutes to walk round. Expensive to get in.

Lovely oasis amongst the craziness . Lovely historical gardens which is beautifully lush and green and although it was very busy when we were there it had a nice calm atmosphere in a hot dry crazy city
beautiful!. Made a quick stop to take some photos and visit the museum which was also lovely. There was a cafe there also if people wanted to have lunch.

Must see for Berbere Jewelry Exhibit. Yes the garden is lovely but the must see here is the display of Berbere Jewelry which is small and exquisite. Also, the gift shop is like no other gift shop. OK - it is pricey-but so dazzlingly beautiful merits a pass through.
Get there when it opens!. Beautiful place to visit, although fills with tourists very quickly! Gift shop is a little pricey, but worth a look around.

Fabulous experience. Possibly the highlight of our visit. After the hustle bustle of the medina, the gardens were so calm, so beautiful and so well presented. It was rather busy, but that was ok. Even the museum was wonderful. Lots of photos here!

Botanical wonder?. If you like plants it's worth a visit, we went as part of an organised trip but to be honest I didn't much enjoy it, there are some unusual plants and the history of YSL is all around but the shop is ridiculously over priced and I found the whole thing boring. Having been to Monets garden this I personally felt was rather disappointing but I'm not a keen plant enthusiast anyone who is would probably thoroughly enjoy the experience.
Small, nice and colorful. Very well kept and cozy. An ideal garden to enjoy the trees, the shades, the quietness, to sit and chat ...

Definitely worth a visit. Definitely not your every day garden but well worth the visit. Some very bizarre and somewhat prickly plants on display amongst the vibrant primary colours of intense blue, yellow and ochre. Definitely a labour of love by French painter Jacques Majorelle, 40 years worth. A spectacular oasis in the middle of the chaos of Marrakesh. Get there early.

Lovely garden. I don't usually love gardens, but I was struck by the impressive display of plants, and the unexpected beauty of the color scheme. The blues and yellows of the painted structures were fabulous.

An oasis of silence in the crowded city of Marrakech. Been there twice now. The garden is a great place to relax, dream, watch the birds and turtoises and eventually have a decent cup of tea and a piece of cake. The museum is okay but not a must.
Glorious garden but don't miss the Berber Museum inside.. This garden is truly beautiful but don't forget inside the garden the unmistakable Berber Museum inside!
Museum was fascinating; garden nice. The best place we visited in Marrakech. The museum was so interesting and information was in English.
amazing jardin. so beautiful jardin ;) nice trees, amazing berber museum inside the jardin, beuatiful colours, i recommended this place to visit, you will like it

Refreshing and suprising. I can search for words, but beautiful is somehow not enough.
Great gardens... great restaurant bar.
Spectacular museum . Small but does it.
Cute love shop from yves saint laurent.
Nice staff.
Just sublime!. Cobalt blue, bright yellow, fantastic taste. Pretty much sums up YSL and this oasis of calm in a city of bedlam and noise.
Tranquil oasis. Beautiful lush garden , lovely cafe, clean. Stark contrast to almost everything else in Marrakesh except for luxury hotels

Really lovely, but get there early!!. A friend had been here and recommend it for a visit. The Riad suggested going early And also going into the Berber museum, both were great recommendations!!The gardens do get busy, but were beautiful to have a wander around and admire the planting and also the beautiful blue painted on the hard landscaping.The Berber museum isn't huge, but worth having a look and taking time to read the descriptions of everything. The clothing / costumes were so intricate and the jewellery was amazing to look at too.Really lovely gift shop too - no tat, all very classy but with prices to match. Certainly worth a look. There is going to be a YSL museum in times to come and I am sure this will just make the whole site even more busy.Enjoy.

Garden of eden. I am a garden and horticulture nut and this did not disappoint. My husband and I were happy to learn the history that such gardens in disrepair were rescued from being leveled. There are huge cactus and Bamboo forests, palms, willows all plants were gathered from Jacques Majorelle's travels around the world, and the dead bamboo is then converted into fencing at the Gardens. There's a small Berber cultural museum that totally authentic and matched what we saw and learned in nearby cities. Berber clothing, wraps, instruments Etc. Wonderful. We arrived late so went through the museum quickly and then strolled through the gardens. There are also some lithographs that Yves St Laurent drew. The place is an oasis of calm in the middle of a hectic paced Marrakech. Go there !!

Most beautiful botanical garden! . Had an amazing time at Majorelle enjoying all the vibrant colours, the beautiful plants and had a lovely Moroccan mint tea at the cafe ! If you have the chance go and visit as it is absolutely magnificent!
Didn't find it worth the trip.. We were underwhelmed, seemed tired and old (or maybe that was just us). Somehow expected more, would only do this if we ran out of other things to do.
Calm in the eye of the storm!. Well worth a visit- fantastic specimens of cactus were a delight. A great place to escape the hustle and bustle of town.

See the Museum. There is a touch of the plant collection about this place which was interesting but not a lesson for the home gardener. Don't get me wrong, its lovely, but I like to see garden design ideas that I might be able to use. After a walk around I think you will find that the museum on Berber culture will be the best thing about your day. loved the exhibits and the manner of their display as well as the history lesson
Majorelle Blue. That colour is like nothing else. The bamboo forests are lovely and cool, respite from the heat of Marrakech. The children enjoyed spotting terrapins in the pools too.
how beautiful!!!. astonishing!! beyond words!!! took a lot of pictures there. love the combination of saturated blue colours with unsaturated green and grey.

So beautiful - a must see in Marrakech. If you're staying in the old town, you should take a taxi to the gardens but this is really cheap and worth it. The garden is beautiful and full of lovely plants, flowers, and the famous blue building. The highlight of my trip to Marrakech.

Stunning gardens, get there early. A lovely place, worth the effort to visit but on a Saturday morning our Riad staff told us to get there as early as we could and they were dead right. It gets very busy.

Amazing, a must see!. Paradise. Do not leave Marrakesh without a visit. Majorette Blue is so well integrated into the myriad of vegetation it is a living meditation a zen garden created by love and with love.
Interesting . Worth seeing because of its history but very crowded and I will not go there again. There are other things to see But the blue color is like UvesKlein blue. And very beautiful

Lovely garden. First, I loved the garden. The colours are so vibrant and the plants so well placed that is a joy to stroll through it. Well worth the taxi+long queue outside to reach it. They are going to open a YSL museum next year so it will make the trip even more worth.A few problems that prevent me to recommend the garden to everybody:1) it's much smaller than I imagined! Consider spending here at most 30min, and it will be plenty of time to explore the garden. If you are thinking of Versailles-size gardens, you'll be sorely deluded2) There are not enough indication of which plant/tree is which. There are a few signposts for the cactus only but they aren't very clear (if you go, you'll see what I mean). I would have loved more informationsSo from the point of view of a botanic, they are less interesting than you could expect. For everybody else, it's by far the best attraction in Marrakech. I loved the colonial feeling you get here, the quiet and the shops inside and around it with local artists' pieces and products on sale. The YSL New Year's painting are amazing and alone worth the ticket. Do not miss this place, just be aware of the size and lack of informations.

average not worth the money. This was ok, but nothing special when you live in England and parks are in abundance. I can imagine this would be nice to walk around on a hot day as the trees provided lots of shade however there was nothing in the way of plants that was particularly special or unusual especially for £13.

The Blue garden and Berber museum. The garden is worth the visit to enjoy the vibrancy of the colors, especially the vibrant blue. The best part of the visit is the Berber museum. Not to be missed. One of the finest exhibits of cultural artifacts, Berber clothing, and jewelry I've ever seen. And we visit museums all over the world.

Peaceful garden. An unusual garden by Jacques Majorelle, restored by Yves St Laurent and his partner Pierre Berge. It has plants sourced from the worldly travels of Jacques Majorelle, specifically cacti bamboo and palm trees. It is beautifully kept, and the sounds of chirruping birds, frogs and running water envoys a sense of calm and well-being. Also there is a very interesting Berber museum which gives an insight into the original people of North Africa.Highly recommended.
A nice stroll. The gardens are lovely, the colors vibrant. Me? I'm not that much of a garden guy, so I walked through, enjoyed, and left. Didn't take long. I'm glad I went.

Breathtaking!. From the early days of "Ground Force" (a gardening make-over TV programme) when lots of make-overs were done based on the Yves Saint Laurent garden in Morocco I have wanted to visit them. After the constant noise and bustle of the city these gardens are a true sanctuary. The city disappears and you can wander around and admire the magnificent plants and landscaping. The colours are astounding, vibrant and punchy, and the mix of planting is truly beautiful.A very pleasant way to wile away a few hours, before returning to the fabulous chaos that is Marrakech.
Lovely place to visit. This place is stunning, a real must to see if you are this way, just beautiful. You can visit this place yourself without a tour guide, well worth it
Visually Outstanding. The gardens are a treat for the eyes and the camera. The exhibit of Berber clothing, jewelry, and handicrafts is excellent and well worth visiting

A colorful celebration. It is not the most invested innovative garden compare to what we know in the west. But still it is a special corner that gives a new fresh look on the Moroccan inside secrets. Very bright colors, birds and plants gives the place a unique experience and really worth visiting.A small Berber museum inside , good place to understand about those lives. Also indoor cafe, and shop (fantastic but expensive )We came to the place with horse and carriage , since it is out of the Medina.Also had a nice light lunch outside of the garden, in a combined shop with a restaurant. Nice neigbour hood ... Overall worth half a day

ysl. tha garden is ok the pathways are charming your really going to see the dream that was his home .the gallery has great collection of moroccan history thats what your going to enjoy the cafe was perect.the gift shop postcards only the rest of the items you get in town for 70 % cheaper
Ok garden - homage to Yves Saint Laurent. I would not waste much time to venture out of the Medina to visit this garden. The cafe and gift shop were very expensive
Pretty but small . A beautiful garden but we were done in around 10 minutes. Great if you want to take some pretty pictures or sit back and enjoy nature's beauty.

Brilliant!. Although a smallish garden, its still large enough to have a lovely wander around. There is a shop and museum plus a café to also enjoy. We loved the courtyard café in the middle of the garden.

Nice but nothing special . As this is reckoned to be one of the main attractions in Marrakech, we decided to visit it. I do or know whether it is always like this or we choose the wrong timing (before noon), but it was very crowded and full of tourists (I had to wait in order to take nice enough pictures). The entrance fee is 70dhs only for the garden and 30dhs on top for the museum. The place is very small and I assume the entrance fee is that high just because the garden had previously belonged to Yves Saint Laurent (there is a memorial of him in the garden). The museum consists of three rooms and the only thing that is worth is the room with jewelry of the Berber women- you can see that part of YSL work is influenced by them. In general I will say that either you should choose different time to visit the garden (when it is not that crowded) or just skip it as it is nothing special (you better visit the cyber garden which is public and much bigger).

Pretty Garden. This is an attractive garden with an interesting history. The blue and yellow colors call out for picture taking. The plants themselves are native to dry climates and if you've lived or traveled in the Soutwestern U.S. they will be familiar. There are benches scattered about. It was crowded when we were there at 10:00 AM. Nothing unique and we were finished in about 20 minutes walking very slowly and taking pictures.

Nice for a stroll for an hour. Pretty gardens, definately a little oasis in the middle of chaotic Marrakech! Lovely cafe and shop. It was 35degrees which limited the length of our visit, would have enjoyed more if it hadn't been so roasting! Having said that there were. Few shady seats to be had and lots of lovely photos to be taken. I'd recommend it but probably wouldn't go back again myself.

beauty and peace. The museum is small but very good, with very helpful knowledgeable attendants.The gardens are very beautiful, amazing colours and planting and cool in the cities heat.There's an elegant and relaxing café to relax in.Thoroughly enjoyed the visit

Great Gardens of cacti and Palm trees. Well worth the 10dhm cost to see many types of cacti and Palm trees in a great setting. Yves Saint Laurant contributed to this garden and there is interesting history of him. There are some rare cacti plants from around the world and they show off the differences very well. Nice quiet setting.
A little piece of heaven. Well worth a look very peaceful place in a raving mad city you would never think a place as quiet and serene could be in a place like this

Relaxing place . Nice place to relax in a busy and hot temp of Marrakech. We had our visit midday and it was really hot. When we get inside the atmosphere was totally different. It was cool with different plants and architectures.
jardin majorelle. Beautiful garden shrubs and plants from all over the world quiet and peaceful would recommend this to all travelers to Marrekesh
Simply fabulous. Gorgeous gardens in the heart of Marrakech. This is a great place to spend an hour or two simply relaxing.
A haven from the hustle and bustle. Well worth a visit if you appreciate this kind of thing and fancy some time out from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech.

SImply beautiful. Amazing grounds and make sure you get a ticket to the museum. Although very small, it is simply breathtaking. The cafe in the gardens offers good food, although the service there is quite poor.

A nice little walk.... The garden and its layout are nice but I personally didn´t find them extraordinary! However, the Berber museum and its exhibition are very interesting and beautifully presented!
Feeling blue.... Yves Saint-Laurent's summer retreat, blue and yellow, with a very cozy stylish, and affordable courtyard cafe. Absolutely worth a visit!

Cool and pretty . A pretty garden. Great for taking photos. This was included as part of our day tour and 45 minutes was sufficient to walk around. Clean facilities and a cafe area. Nice to sit and people watch. Plenty of benches if you are with people who don't want to walk around.
small, expensive. nice, but really small (15 minutes maximum) and 7 times more expensive than for example the big Palace.

Sanctuary in the Centre of Town. By far one of the best places we visited on our trip. Well worth the open bus top ride through the town and then a quiet wander through the gardens. There's a lovely cafe here too and well worth stopping for a tea and something to eat. Take a camera as there are so many photo opportunities from the amazing plants and decoration within the gardens
Underwhelmed. Lots of hype, not very diverse garden, expensive considering. Lots of selfie sticks, not a lot of content. Would not recommend safe your money for a tour

Pretty but small and expensive. . This place was pretty but that was about it. It will be pretty busy most times during the day make picture taking opportunities minimal. The entrance fee is also much too high at 700 dh. Lastly, it was quite small. We finished looking in about 20 minutes.
Beautiful though small . The colours are stunning but it's rather small. Still a calm place in busy Marrakech though. I'd go if you have time but if you're short on time maybe don't bother.

A peaceful retreat!. If travelling from the big square, get a taxi and barter for a one way trip for 30-40 dirhams. Entrance fee is reasonable and the gardens are beautiful. Lots of beautiful photo opportunities, interesting Berber museum, gift shop and memorial to Yves St Laurent. A very calm, tranquil retreat away from the hubbub of Marrakech just a hundred yards down the road. I highly recommend visiting these gardens during your stay in Marrakech.
Worth a visit. Beautiful, calm and different to anywhere else, don't miss this if you have time while you are in Marrakech.

Sublime. An oasis in a bustling city. Jardin Majorelle is just a wonderful place. I don't need to describe it, I just need to tell you to go. You will be delighted. While there go to the coffee shop and eat or drink, it is just great

Interesting. But limited. Lovely shade on a hot day though.. Lovely gardens, and fabulous colours. Rather limited in its interest beyond bamboo and cactii though. The museum is worth visiting to round out the package.

N1 in Marrakech, really?. Basically it's not a garden, all you have there is bamboo trees and cactuses (not a single flower) and YSL's house which is pretty basic; the history behind is fairly interesting though but the site as a whole is a dissapointment. Not worth 70dh + 30dh for the house museum. The site is not very big either if you fancy a nap under a tree. The YSL shop and the book store are OK, the restaurant offers the usual tagines and brochettes at higher prices.

Relaxing place to visit. My wife and I spent a few hours in the afternoon here and the gardens were quite beautiful. We had lunch at the restaurant that is inside the gardens which was quite nice as well. Definitely a spot you should visit if you want a break from the craziness of the souks!

Is this a joke?. Nr. 1 on TA? Tiny over priced garden with rude staff and all the explanation tags are in french and arabic although 80% of people in there are tourists.Me and my girlfriend were laughing the whole time as we couldnt believe how bad this was and how everyone is saying its a must to do

Pretty but too many people to be able to enjoy. Lovely gardens but just too crowded, probably best to go really early or when it's about to close, it's not a big place I'd say an hour tops, unless you go into the museum or cafe.

Bring your camera!. This is a must see! A beautiful garden with a fantastic cafe and gift shop. It is truly memorable. Outside the garden there are a good number of stores selling beautiful jewellery, accessories, clothing home decor and even a bookstore.

Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful garden, quite small but has a lovely cafe and boutique. Well worth the €7 with beautiful colours and a nice memorial for Yves Saint Laurant. In the autumn there will be a fantastic museum dedicated to YSL. Nice and quiet amongst the noise of Marrakech.

Beautiful sanctuary in the city. Small and compact, this was a lovely retreat from the heat and bustle of the city. Interesting link to Yves Saint Laurent. The Berber Museum is well worth the extra fee.
Disappointing . A little small and although charming lacked the za za zoom. Felt the entrance fee a little high for such a small area.

A bit of peace & tranquility in hot Marrakesh. Jardin Majorelle is a short walk away from the busy streets of medina.
It offers truely calm and refreshing atmosphere. Gardens itself are quite small, but packed with various plants and trees, which form cozy niches to wander in.
Majorelles blue gives the place a real artistic outlook.

Nearly. Great garden with some fantastic plants and brilliant pond, let down by two features, firstly lack of signs we walked around the block before we found the entrance, secondly it was too crowded. But still worth a visit

Not what I expected. If you are from the Americas, this garden probably won't impress you. There are lots of cactus that are special in Morocco, but are plentiful in American desserts. Not many of the plants are labeled.

Amazing gardens -. We were advised to visit these gardens by friends - so pleased we did. They are stunning - the attention to detail and planting are beautiful. We were told to visit on a sunny day - so we could appreciate the vibrant colours ! Wow - this is a do not miss -
Amazing. the entrance is 70 mad, gorgeous inside, u could spend a good 2 hours there deff a must see. great pic to take too
what a beauty. a must visit ,one of the best places to visit in Marrakesh rare types of planets,a library,a gift shop very elegant place i enjoyed it much ,

Visit to the famous park. Oasis of tranquility in Marrakech, colours of blue and yellow dominating the park among the greens of from the tree greens.
Has a memorial for Yves Saint-Laurent, and can be an inspiration for painters.

As pretty in real life as the pictures online. Jardin Majorelle is an extremely pretty place to visit. It was 70 dirham for entrance in but 35 dirham if you're a student.
The only issue I had here is that everybody was constantly taking selfies everywhere and were ruining the ambience of the gardens.
The cafe was lovely but is slightly pricey compared to other cafes in Marrakech.
Very nice. Very nice place to visit. Full of colors and flowers. Its rather small but interesting to visit since YSL bought it when the familly went bankrupt just to keep the beauty of the place.

A bit pricy, but worth a visit. Plants in the garden are collected from all continents of the world, so imagine a crazy combination of all possible kinds of beautiful plants, trees and flowers. You won't be there more than an hour, I suppose, so it's quite pricy, but it's truly one of the most beautiful gardens you'll see in your love.
