But my husband was ill and the waiters plied us with care and hot tea until the driver of the hotel arrived and journeyed us back to our room. Nevertheless, a detour from the Medina you MUST experience when in Marrakesh. And don't miss the exquisitely presented Berber museum under HM Mohammed VI high patronage. This really gives you an unspderstanding of the true nature of Africa's most original tribalsThe city is so grateful, they named the road on which the garden and museum stands, the Rue Yves Saint Laurent. Need I say more?..
Great collection of cacti . It's a very pretty garden,as it belonged to a French painter,it's beautiful as a painting.very large collection of cacti from all over the world.the museum is excellent.

Beautiful, peaceful location!. A must see when in Marrakech, full of vibrant colours and smells. Very cheap, I think it was only 70 dirhams.. you could spend quite a while there too. They have a lovely restaurant which offers a range of amazing food and tea, a very relaxing spot.
Mt. To high a price for oversea visitors. Too much for too little.You can visit if you want to.i am not for or against

Beautiful Oasis. Beautifully kept and refreshingly quiet, this garden provided a much needed respite after an absolutely chaotic day roaming the markets of Marrakesh. You'll appreciate it more in pairing with something more energetic - a visit to the gardens alone might be a bit boring anti-climatic otherwise.

Not worth it.... Quite disappointed as it really is just cactuses. The majorelle blue is nice, but we waited in line for about 40 minutes, paid equivalent of 7 euros, and weren't left too impressed. There's a great juice bar across the road though, and a shop that has really well locally-made products.

Heaven in the heart of Marrakech. You feel in a little heaven when you cross Jardin Majorelle door, very well preserved nature and colorful place, full of history.
A must-see when you visit Marrakech.

Beautiful gardens!. Absolutely beautiful gardens a short distance from the Medina. Jardin Majorelle is an oasis of tranquility and is perfect when you want a break from the crazy busy medina!
The cafe is excellent! Slightly more expensive than average but superb food and a lovely setting.

An excellent, calm attraction.. Beautifully presented and a fabulous range of plants. Very well maintained and well sign posted. The plants were well labelled and there were plenty of water features and opportunities for photographs. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful!. Although not large, there is an amazing array of plants/trees that is beautifully laid out. It only takes 30 minutes to go round.

One of the best sightseeing spots in Marrakesh!. This magnificent place should be visited by absolutely everyone who goes to Marrakesh - the gardens are amazing, the staff is great and the little cafe in the middle of the gardens provided great service and lovely deserts!

Perfect place to escape. Away from the hustle and bustle of Djemma El Fna and the Souks this is a fabulous way to spend an afternoon or morning. Both the museum and the gardens are well worth the 100Dh entrance fee. It's busy as everyone has the same idea but the use of colour and the planting is really inspiring. Enjoy.
Worth a visit. Jardin Majorelle is busy yet still a nice escape from the chaos inside the medina walls. Feast your eyes on the layers of greenery. Beautiful place.

Gorgeous colours, pots and plants!. I loved the colours at Jardin Majorelle, the pots were amazing and all painted in beautiful colours. The plants in the garden (especially the cactus plants) were really lovely and the shops in the garden offered a nice selection of unique Moroccan goods. Definitely worth a visit!
Love the colours! !. Great variety of plants, bamboos, cactus, etc. So relaxing. Try their cafe too , serving delish food!!

Well kept and peaceful but small and over priced. The garden is very well kept and is quiet and peaceful. There is a interesting selection / variety of plants. However it is pretty small (you can probably go round it all in about 30 mins - 1h max). Also at 70d I think it is a little over priced for the size of it, I think you are really paying a YSL premium here. It is also quite a way out of the main city so perhaps it's better to take a cab. Otherwise the walk takes about 20-30 mins from the main square.
Peace and tranquility. Lovely garden to visit in Marrakech with a real sense of peace and tranquility. I would recommend taking a camera too as there are plenty of photo opportunities!
Great Location. Great place to go see, spent a hour here and was very relaxing along with it being very cool. Do check it out.

Beautiful Gardens and Berber Museum was fabulous.. Highly recommended. We enjoyed our visit to the beautiful peaceful gardens and a highlight for me was the Berber Museum. A must see while in Marrakesh
Strikingly colourful and beautiful gardens. Go early in the day to avoid the worst of the crowds. The gardens are incredibly beautiful and immaculately kept. Definitely a must-see.

Cool blue and architectural surprise. Perfect venue to spend a few hours out of the heat. Made the mistake of not including the museum which has Berber jewellery. Learnt that there is going to be a new museum to the work of the iconic Yves Saint Laurent. Good reason for a return visit.

Highlight of Marrakesh. If you enter by 0930, you should have a good 40 mins of photo time before the crowds block the subject matter. This was certainly the most colourful site we found in the city. Parking not easy so ensure you have the taxi driver's mobile number before you part if relevant.

Beautiful!. Indigo blue and beautiful gardens. Wonderful museum dedicates solely to the Berber people within. Costs 70 dirhams to enter, plus 30 if you'd like to see the museum. Plan to spend 45-60 minutes here.
Nothing special . Just a colorful house and a lot of cactus. Entrance fee ( around 7 Euro) is too expensive comparing with other places in Morocco.

Dissapointed. Nothing great. The hype is not worth it. It's a pretty garden but can be covered in about 30 mins and the entry fees of 70DHM per head is exorbitant when compared to other places. It's a good place for photo op, nothing more.
A real Wow factor. This is a number one attraction in Marrakech do not hesitate to visit you will be blown away by its attraction .

So beautiful. Don't miss this gorgeous oasis in the red city! It can be a bit crowded at times but with be patient, every area of the gardens will at one point be completely empty of other visitors so you can get that perfect picture or just sit in silence on a bench and enjoy the majorelle blue beauty. Don't forget the YSL Love Gallery!
Beautiful gardens. Not as big as we thought it would be but lovely all the same. Stunning colours on the bougainvillea, beautifully maintained and very peaceful ambience.

Jardin Majorelle amazing colours. Go early to the garden as it gets busy and it's better to experience the peace and tranquility early morning. The gardens are full of amazing plants and the colours are stunning, bright blues, vivid yellows, greens and orange. The Berber museum is fascinating and has an amazing collection of traditional costumes and jewellery.

Beautiful exotic garden but quite expensive. Visiting this garden gives you an hour of relaxing time out of the hectic environment of Marrakech. However, the entrance fee is quite high: 7 euro just for the gardens and an extra 3 euro to visit the Berber Museum within. Quite expensive for a family of 6. You can also have diner for that money in Marrakech.

Beautiful ... . Not one to be missed! Cooling, peaceful and absolutely out of this world. We walked round and around and then around again! Perfect place to escape the mad buzz outside. A lovely and not too far of a walk from Medina too.. The walk was with it!
Nice Oasis of shadow. you need to visit this, although it weas not worthy of that 7 euros. It is just a garden. Well, but in sunny "dry" Marrakech is this the oasis that please your heart.

Go for the colors and cactus. This garden is unique. The colors in any picture do not do justice to the real thing. We walked from our riad at the medina to get here. If you are decently fit, it should take you 20 min. It looks small from the outside, but once you get in, their cactus collection is unbelievable. And the colors are beautiful. Spend around an hour there.

Stunning!. These lush gardens and pools, windy paths, and the bright blue and yellow painted trim everywhere absolutely delighted me. I was in Marrakech with Trafalgar Tours, and this was an optional excursion--so glad I signed up!

Peaceful escape from the City.. This was a lovely calm place to visit (although can get busy itself, depending what time you go) for 2 or 3 hours to escape the heat & noise of the Marrakech Medina. Not overly expensive - the museum is optional but for the extra 30 dirhams, worth seeing some fantastic jewellery & costumes typical of the various Moroccan historical cultures. A beautiful oasis to escape the frenetic pace of Marrakech.

Beautiful small gardens with a huge 'wow' factor. Cost 70Dirhams to get in (approx 7 euros) but worth it because it is so beautiful and unique. The Berber museum inside also definitely worth a look for an extra 30 Dirhams as very interesting.
Nice. Was very nice a beautiful bit of paradise in the centre of marakesh, busy but parts of the gardens were off limits and the museum was a little disappointing.

Beautiful garden retreat. The Jardin Majorelle was a beautiful experience in Marrakech. It is outside the main Medina in the new city area but a perfect escape for the afternoon. The gardens were lush and green with a variety of plant species. The bright colors and moroccan details on the buildings add to the beauty of this place. I recommend a visit to the gardens and also visiting the berber museum inside is a must see.

Nice but small and crowded. The gardens are small and pretty and also expensive and crowded.There are so many public gardens in Marrakech that are thoughtfully stocked with interesting plants that are well kept and clean that are almost every bit as nice a this "must see" attraction.
Exquisite Gardens. Beautiful tropical gardens in the middle of Marrakech - an oasis of beauty and quiet. Nice to stroll and visit the adjoining museum of Berber Culture.

Very pretty with a bit of culture. Enjoyed our brief visit here - relaxing gardens and the museum is worth a look too. Had a quick tea in the café and service and food was excellent - love the "high pour" from the waiters.

So peaceful and beautiful. We visited the gardens around mid-morning and found them to be quiet, delightfully shaded and gorgeous. A lovely relaxing way to spend a couple of hours. The Berber museum is also quite interesting and very well presented and worth a tour.

Un filtre chromatique naturel!. Upon entering the old villa of the famous painter Jacques Majorelle, we are immediately struck by the chromatic palette of colors, ranging from Majorelle Blue, to the vivid green of the luxurious plant species. A never ending range of exotic flowers, trees and plants make this botanical garden such an unforgettable walk for those seeking a getaway in the busy city of Marrakech. I highly recommend.

Peaceful, slightly odd such structure admidst chaos. Very structured and attractive gardens. Arrive early before the coachloads arrive. Expensive but pleasant tea and coffee in upmarket café. Museum short but well presented. Adult visit. We walked from our riad near the Medina, not too far.
Beautiful. The Jardin Majorelle garden's were beautiful but what was more interesting was the museum inside the garden. The exhibit was amazing and very informative. Well worth the visit.

Worth the visit but do not have high expectations. The garden was nice, and the museum helped to bring the experience up a few levels. Not much to "scream hurray" about, but nice to have seen YSL's garden and his memorial place. Slightly annoying that they have double entranceprice for turists, and that the museum isn't included in the entrence. With both, I think we paid 100 dirham each person.
its ok. heard a lot about the gardens before going and to be honest they are nice but I was a little disappointed, can easily walk around it all in an hour.

Beautiful. Beautiful garden. Nice and quiet with birds singing. Just what you need as a break from the buzz in Marrakesh. Don't miss going to the museum! Great collection of things that give you a good overview of Berber life and history.
boring. With so many amazing things to see in Marrakesh it's hard to justify a trip to a garden that highlights mexican plants.

Very lovely with great tea garden. Very lovely garden go early or late to avoid crowds. Really liked the tea garden uk prices but great coffee and breakfast! Overpriced gift shop but some nice fixed price shops just outside.

Touristic destination, but a must see. YSL and Pierre Bergé's garden and art space is worth the 70dh to get in. The Marjorelle blue is truly stunning(the pigment and paint you can buy). The garden is almost too impeccably maintained, the colors,plants and fountains still retain their awe and beauty.Definitely do a loop just looking around, after taking pictures, to really appreciate the beauty.

Stunningly beautiful. Come and see the Majorelle blue, admire the cacti, the abundant bougainvillea and the generally amazing floral displays. A beautiful and compact garden that is worth making a detour for. The colors are beautiful, the layout makes it seem much larger than it is, and around every corner is another opportunity for a fabulous photo. Go!

Beautiful but skip-able. We toured Le jardin in the afternoon after a long walking tour. It is definitely interesting and quite beautiful, but not the highlight if the trip by any stretch of the imagination. It was very crowded when we went which could have contributed to our experience. The history is interesting but after a quick lap around, you are in and out in less than 20 minutes. My sister commented "it could have been a city park in the Southwest (US)", and I agree. Not worth along line...
Nice for 15 minutes. Nice, but small and crowdy garden, with beautiful colours. It's worth a visit, especially when you like to take pictures. Not really a place for contemplation.
A nice garden to visit. I have visited the Jardin majorelle while I was in Marrakech. Really relaxing place, a must to see if you are traveling in Marrakech.

Small and nothing special. The gardens are recommended by most locals, but once there prove to be quite a dissapointment. The entrance fee is quite high (70 DH) although the gardens are quite small. The nicely painted buildings and flower pots look well maintained and there are many guards around. There is little information about the plants and/or animals (insects, turtles).

Fun and tranquil. We spend a lovely hour wandering around these gardens (but 30 minutes in the queue waiting to get in). It is good that they limit the number of people who visit at a time so that you can enjoy the serenity. Not a "must-do" but a "nice-to-do" atttaction.

Peaceful garden with vibrant colors. You have to visit this garden during morning. It has lots of different cactus species, and it's a quiet place to be.
The memorial doesn't do justice to Monsieur Saint Laurent, but the museum despite of being small, has lots of interesting, garnements (such as berbere jewellry and clothes).

For those who love BLUE. I really enjoyed this little island of tranquility in Marrakech. Mostly for the cool and peace rather than the botanical extravaganza. Really nice photos to be had and the museum about the history of the Berber people should not be missed as it sets context to many of the items, clothes and jewellery you see for sale accros the city. Not to be missed. The boutique inside is more Yves St Laurent and the prices match but I am still dreaming about the lovely blue handbag I saw. It's all about and hour's walk from the centre of the medina and this was part of the day out. The cafes and boutiques around this attraction are more cosmopolitan but still good value for money.

Hidden Oasis. If you have not been in Majorelle´s Garden when in Marrakech, you have not seen the city. This hidden oasis previously owned buy Yves Saint Laurent is a respite from the Red City. The colors range from blues and greens to yellow and all the colours of the natural world. Bring some time with you because you won´t want to leave.
nice but expensive. nice garden a little bit far from the center (take a bus to get it is cheaper).the museum iside is very intersting

Beautiful, tranquil garden. It is a lovely garden with interesting plants and trees. The colours in the garden are fabulous. There are two shops - one for books and the other for a varied array of items. Lovely pools with turtles and frogs. There is a cafe but didn't have time to visit it. Depending on your interest in plants etc an hour is adequate to visit the garden. A wonderful place to be cool.
A must see. We really liked the garden a lot with lots of different trees and flowers and a great cafe to enjoy the birds in the middle. A little bit walk necessary to reach but enjoyable

Allow yourself to relax and savour all rainbow colours.. Artistic expression of taste and feelings by colour, form and different plants from all over the world. This place gives a different impression to different people, that's why it is something you must see when in Marrakech. Plan for some time to relax and savour all rainbow colours.Houses a small exhibition of Love posters as well as the Berber museum, and a small restaurant and shop in the site. Picnics and dogs are not allowed.

Hidden gem. Loved these gardens. Towering bamboo and giant cacti. A little courtyard cafe serving traditional mint tea and Morroccan dishes. Really pleasant to spend a couple of hours. Taxis outside take you anywhere for 100 Dirums which is less than £10.
Frogs on lily Pads......... So peaceful and tranquil, even with a lot of visitors. I have never seen frogs on lily pads before but they were having a fantastic time.......

A Must See. Shouldn't be missed! Although the garden is small it is absolutely beautiful. An array of bright colours and wonderful designs which make lovely pictures! However, it can get busy so expect to be waiting for the perfect photo.
Stunning Garden. Arrive early to avoid too many crowds - at 11am in April we queued about 10 minutes which was fine. There were a lot of people inside but the site seemed to absorb them well.

Worth the visit. This is a nice place but slightly out of the way. 70 + 30 dirhams entry which is a lot more than the government operated museums ( 10 dhm ). This gave access to the gardens and the museum, both worth a visit. The colour, coolness and tranquility were something to absorb and enjoy.Can do it in less than an hour, but recommend going early to avoid the coach trips.
Beautiful in the sunshine. Walked to gardens, easy to find. Lovely setting with fantastic colours. Cafe serving good food. Shop sells wonderful, great quality goods.

An oasis of green and blue. Plan on spending a couple of hours wandering and relaxing here.I went early in the morning before the crowds started arriving. This let me get some of the traditional photo angles without any people in the frame.

DON’T MISS THE BERBER MUSEUM. Jardin Majorelle is one of the finest landscape gardens that we have seen anywhere, and the juxtaposition of arid plants and palms against the vibrant colors used in the buildings, walks, and fountains creates a stunning environment worthy of the artistry and design of Pierre Bergé and Yves Saint Laurent. What should not be missed is the Berber Museum, which houses their personal collection of Berber artifacts – clothing, jewelry, textiles, carvings, etc. As one of our companions remarked, she wished that she had seen the museum at the beginning of our trip rather than the end, because she would have appreciated what we had seen so much more. As indicated by the reviews, the Jardin Majorelle is a must see. Give yourself enough time to not only enjoy the tranquility of the gardens but also to appreciate the works of art in the museum.

charming gardens. An interesting selection of trees and plants and clever layout. Lily ponds and chorus of frogs form part of the attraction. The cafe serves acceptable food and drink and enhances the attraction. There is also the Berber museum in which we learned a lot.The Majorelle is well worth a visit - we , in fact , went twice.
Peaceful garden. Beautiful place to visit with so much colour to see in the plants. Very peaceful and so many plants.

Lovely oasis in bustling Marrakech. We spent an hour in Jardin Majorelle while in Marrakech. It is a peaceful oasis amidst the bustle. The plantings and water features are calming, the art is fun, and it was a pleasure!
Fantastic experience.. Not to be missed whilst in Marrakesh. Truly wonderful and beautiful. The colours and the layout are spectacular.

A small gem. The garden is smaller than I expected so only took about an hour to go right around and look at the exhibits inside the house. It was lovely and there was a great view around every corner.
Incredibly beautiful and quiet. Do not hesitate to visit the gardens. They are incredibly beautiful and quiet. Well worth the entrance fee!

Quiet place in hectic Marrakesh. We were going there to escape from the very busy Medina.
In the garden created by Yves Saint Laurent you will find a beautiful garden with many different and coulorful flowers and trees. The employees try to keep it very clean and accessible for the visitors. It is definitely worth a visit.
An oasis. Nice palm garden with labels giving the names of the plants and where they come from. Very well-maintained and weed-free. Colourful and photogenic.

An oasis of colour in Marrakech with great history. I heard about this place from others who said it was great and they were right. It is close to the medina and the queue was pretty short. The gardens are smaller than I thought but lovely and the cactus collection is amazing. The Berber Museum was worth it and the shop had some beautiful items but they are pricey.
Great garden.. Beautiful garden with nice history and architecture. Very peaceful place, definitely worth a visit! Good restaurant inside.

YSL cremation. We spent one day only in Marrakech. After put our lugage in Bab Doukkala station for DH 30, you can go strolling the city. Ww start it from Jardin Majorelle since its the nearest from Bab Doukkala. It's a lovely garden where YSL cremation placed. Entry fee for DH70.
To visit absolutely . Nice garden to visit with adult or child. The site is absolutely fantastic with colors, different greenery, flours and birds.

Nice place to visit. It had a nice coffee shop, small museum and random things to kill your time. It was nice to visit. The museum was cool. Staff inside were a little annoying though - not so friendly.

No idea why this is no. 1 place to visit. Whilst this is a very pleasant garden, it does not feel very Moroccan (if you are after Moroccan things), it is not very big, and not really that interesting (unless you love plants). I don't know how it got to be the No. 1 sight in so many reviews.
Beautiful - A MUST See!. This place is a must see in marrakech, it is beautiful and you will get lots of nice photos inside :) Also, they have a very nice restaurant to have lunch.

The museum is the best. Well first a want to say 10 us is to much for this garden and museum ,i have seen much better gardens then this one ,yes the museum is very nice small but thy going to open nexts year a bigger one

Fantastic. We got to the gardens early - no queues and not crowded inside so got the best of it. The gardens are beautiful but the highlight for us was the museum, by far the best in town with imaginative displays and explanations of the Berber culture.When we got our bearings walked back to the Medina which was also an adventure!
beautiful garden. A must in Marrakech! Beautiful graden under the theme of Yves Saint Laurent! A lot of detail and everywhere Yves Saint Laurent is remembered<!

Super well maintained. A must see, well restored . Entertaining. Do visit the museum for a couple more dollars it is stunning. The book store has great books and the gift shop sells the blue majorelle paint that is so radiant. Enjoyed the visit tremendously
Beautiful. Beautiful garden. The color contrast, succulents and lily pond are definitely worth the trip if you're in town.

Nice visit, but didn't live up to the hype. I would say that the Jardin Majorelle is worth seeing if you have some extra time in Marrakech, however it didn't live up to my expectations. Photogenic, yes, but not much otherwise, and quite crowded.
Beautiful but busy!. Stunning gardens with lots to see and a lovely break from the madness of the medina. Also quite full of people but quieter and calmer, beautiful spot for photos

Calm space to visit. This was my first visit to Marrakesh and it was a lovely garden to start with.There are queues to get in but once inside there was enough space for people to walk around and take photos.
Feeling closer to Yves Saint Laurent. I loved walking inside le Jardin Majorelle. I would had loved to get more access to the house but I am happy of the overall experience.

Preferred the museum to the gardens. While the intensely manicured and guarded garden is beautiful, I was expecting a lot more for the #1 TA attraction, or more spectacular. I may be a bit blasé and am not a YSL fanatic bit did indeed appreciate the refreshing garden. The cafe is a nice spot for a drink. I found the gift shop very beautiful but nothing of interest to me (and pricey). I actually preferred the tiny Berber museum which was fascinating. What a rich tribal culture that is not known to many. I feel somewhat obliged to say that this is a must see (but I don't agree 100%). The ville nouvelle is not very pleasant and we left right after our visit, by taxi (25 MAD) back to Jemma el-Fna.

If you have time.... If you have time sure go and visit if you like the botanical gardens. Its a tick on the travellers list but for 70DH if gardens dont float your boat save it towards three day excursions or the sort. That being said its lovely and can be done in half a day! Taxis are just near the exit and is 50dh for the big taxi for 4 people and 30dh for smaller.The art gallery is cute maybe more for those who appreciate art.

Awsome. It is really worth visiting place on Marrakesh Great collection of cactus.Heaven for perfect photographs .Spend good time there and enjoy the calmness of the place on a busy place like Marrakesh

Go early!. We arrived before the hoards & were so glad we did. Le Jardin Majorelle opens at 8am, so do make the effort and get there early - it is worth it. Having this wonderful work of art to yourself is FAB! Go to the museum if you are interested in the Berber culture - a really good insight.
Stunning Gardens. The gardens are extraodinary and so relaxing to walk around after the bussle of the streets. Dont forget to visit the museum too

Peace amongst the madness. We visited here and would say it is worth a visit whilst in Marrakech and it has a small cafe within the grounds where you could have a drink or a light lunch. An hour was in our opinion more than enough time to allow unless you stopped for lunch or were particularly interest in the plants etc
Beautiful gardens and great Berber museum. Even when busy there are still peaceful spots to relax and reflect. The museum is exceptional, and the lighting around the jewellery room is fantastic.
A little busy with people but peaceful. It was a great garden to visit and the Berber museum helped me understand more about the culture. The mixtures of plants and color was a great change of pace.

Nice but busy and small. Nice. But nothing special. Pleased I visited but wouldn't rush back. The plans were pretty but mainly non native. There were loads of tourists so the peace and tranquility was lost a bit.
Beautiful setting. Beautiful gardens that are definitely worth a visit. It takes around an hour and provides a bit of calm if you need an escape from the hussle

Come early and dress pretty for pretty pictures. Although small, the garden has amazing color and interesting placement of various architecture sculptures that it makes for really pretty pictures. Come dress up a bit, you'd fit right in with this gorgeous garden. If you have the money to buy the Yves Saint Laurent design of blouses and scarves, it would be a nice and functioning souvenir.

Beautiful, well worth it!. This is a beautiful garden that is worth the visit, it does not take all day, it takes about 1-2 hours. It is beautiful for pictures and definitely a must go.We had an amazing driver that would take us to all of the popular spots. He was actually a driver for James Bond in the movie Spectre. He was very reasonable and had a great car, would take you all over the city and to outside places as well. His name was Lhoucine and was able to text and everything, I highly suggest him! His number is +212 661-322328, if it wasnt for him we wouldnt have known about half the places! Definitely worth the garden as well as the driver!!
An oasis in the middle of the city.. This are the gardens of Yves Saint Laurent house in Marrakech, its a must if you visit this amazing city.

Beautiful. Gorgeous placeCalm and relaxing Worth the visit Would go again !Beautiful trees and plants Very close to the city centre Helpful staff Made me feel calm and relaxed as I walked around the gardens

Simply beautifull. Nice, well maintained garden! So colourfull, relaxing break In a crowded Town ..Too small unfortunately to accommodate all the Groups.!Visit to enjoy In the morning to avoid à long queue.!
Pretty green, pretty touristic. The garden is a must see! It's a pretty calming, green oase in Marrakesh. It is a bit touristic though. The garden is in very good condition.

French Garden in Marrakech. One of my taxi stops - Early morning!! really nice tranquil gardens first in, with all types of cactus and flowers from many locations of the world, quite interesting and a bonus as i didnt know it was there was Yves st laurents memorial...

Amazing colors! Heaven on earth!. I absolutely recommend you to visit this beautiful garden and fall in love with it! It's better to go early in the morning to escape the crowds and take beautiful shots.
Beautiful gardens. Aim to arrive between 08:30 and 09:45 to avoid a long entrance queue once the tour coaches start to arrive.

So peaceful and serene. Great place to spend a morning, you should visit here if you're in the the city. The memorial to YSL is beautiful but the whole garden is a wonder, try to grab a bench in the sunshine and listen to the frogs and just sit for an hour or two to unwind from the hustle and bustle of the main square and medina.
Enjoyable. 70Dim is a little high in comparison to the rest of the city but it was worth it. Relax and enjoy it. We had to rush through and didnt see as much as i'd liked.

Beautiful respite from the midday sun. Make sure you book tickets to the Berber museum, definitely worth your time. The gardens are lovely with lots of exotic plants, the taxi from the medina shouldn't cost More than 30DH

Beautiful. Jardin Majorelle is not an open garden as such. You follow a pathway around the area and unless you want to eat in the restaurant, you'd spend around one hour there. We took a taxi to and from. Must see!

a gorgeous lush environment . I didn't think my husband and I would be excited by the gardens but I was very wrong. It was absolutely beautiful and fascinating looking at all the different flowers, plants and cacti. A must see for any visit to Marrakech.

Beautiful and Relaxing. The gardens are very pretty, cool and quiet. There's a lovely coffee shop inside that does food and drinks. It's nice just to wander around the gardens but there are very few signs and little information as you walk round. We did not visit the museum so cannot comment on that. Reasonably Priced - approx. £5 per adult for just the gardens.

RIP OFF. I honestly went to this garden because it was #1 on Trip Advisor. I was absolutely astounded both by the price and how tiny the gardens are. We paid 20€ for the garden and the museum for two people. It was hands down the most expensive thing we did in Morrocco. There are much better gardens in Marrakech that are FREE. To add insult to injury, the bathroom inside wasn't even free as you were expected to tip the attendant. I have no idea what all this money they make goes to. Save your time and money and go enjoy a free garden in the city.
Absolutely beautiful and tranquil. Great day out, beautiful gardens, great place to go. A whole world away from the hustle and bustle that characterises much of Marrakech.

A beautiful Garden to visit. A lovely morning spent at the Jardin Majorelle. We also visited the museum which was interesting. Both were done in an hour even at a slow pace. The only negative is that it did feel like the variety of plants & trees were limited.. Whilst it's not Kew, it is a lovely place to visit.

Great garden . Very pretty and unique. A must in Marakesh. We took a carriage from the main Medina market, paid 250 dirham. The carriage operator was a little sketchy, trying to get more money at the end. We ignored him.

Nice if you like blue pots - Berber Museum is great. The gardens are not huge, but a lot is packed in. The main differentiator is the placement of blue and yellow pots everywhere. It is photogenic, but the crowds of people make actual photo taking hard.If you just want to see plants, Marrakech has a great botanical garden, which is absolutely free.However, even though it is an additional cost, I would recommend the Berber museum, which is a fascinating and well laid out museum about this indigenous Moroccan people.
A haven of beauty and peace. A must see for nature lovers.The museum inside is a jewel hosting an amazing collection of Berber jewellery and tools.Try to go early before the crowds hit.
A place of tranquility in Marrakech. Beautiful garden. Nice, quiet, peaceful, colorful. It's a small garden but can certainly spend the entire morning just taking everything in. Love it.
Very beautiful . Very nice garden, worth seeing. Not a lot of space to sit but I assume that's to keep tourists moving. We didn't bother with the museum.
Beautiful. Small museum was also very interesting. Plenty of taxis outside, just make sure you don't take the high price

Must visit!. Easily one of the most interesting places to visit in Marrakech. You can read all about the history of the garden while there: suffices to know that it was brought to its present form my Yves Saint Laurent and his partner.Stunning blue colours amidst the lush green, the pond, and the flowers. There is a museum, a shop and a pleasant café. Spend half a day here!
Busy beauty. A beautiful garden, but extremely busy. Be prepared to queue to get in. The Berber museum is definitely worth the extra.
Amazing gardens. An amazing garden, not to be missed. Beautiful and rare plants and flowers. Profits go back into the Moroccan economy and provide assistance to young Moroccans.

Peace and Beauty. Arrived early in the morning to spend some time strolling through this delightful garden. The crowds had not arrived yet and we were able to stroll us impeded throughout the garden. The lily pond filled with frogs and turtles was a fun surprise, little frogs made big noises!

Beautiful escape from the Medina!. A 20 minute or so walk from the centre of the Medina, Jardin Majorelle is a tranquil haven of exotic plants, bright colours (a nice change from all the red!) and lots of shade! Definitely worth the entrance fee, the gardens are wonderful for a walk round of an afternoon when you have need a break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Great place to try and take some artsy photos too!The cafe on site is very expensive - high fashion prices to honour YSL! We just had an ice cream so can't really comment on the food quality, but a nice spot to sit if the benches around the gardens are full!

Beautiful but busy. We liked the gardens, although it is not very big. There where quite some visitors making it a bit difficult to really enjoy them.We loved the little exhibition of the drawings of Yves Saint Laurent.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens and really worth a visit. I would really recommend visiting the museum in the gardens too, it is small but very informative.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens in amongst all the madness of Marrakesh. Also holds the Berber Museum which is well worth a look.

Beautiful.... Beautiful gardens,gorgeous place to wander around, a nice escape from the madness outside the walls, lovely little cafe area too selling delicious coffee. The museum was ok but a bit boring.

Small but beautiful garden - excellent food in the cafe. Well worth a visit for 70 dhm. We got a taxi from our riad which was near the palace/ 10 mins walk from jemaa de fna and that cost us 40dhm which was more than it should have cost us. Was told by our riad owners that it should cost 30dhm max.. You can do the garden in about an hour if you don't visit the museum. We then stopped for lunch in the lovely cafe. Food was excellent.

Wow!. A wonderful experience, where the colours jumped out at you, so beautiful. Well worth the visit. We just paid for the garden, and didn't do the museum, but didn't feel we missed out on anything. The shop was OK. The book shop was interesting, and we were glad to be able to buy some of the YSL 'love' postcards.
so nice!. this is one of the must have done! Take a callege to there (pay not more than 250 diran) and enjoy this special garden. Take also the ticket for the museum. Don't miss it!

The Berber Museum in the gardens is interesting. These gardens seemed to be quite popular. It is a nice spot to retreat to from the city bustle and relax. The gardens are not large but still enjoyable to wander around, The Berber museum for me was the main attraction.
Awesome . Great Garden, full of suprises..But must visit the museum too where you find a great collection of old jewelery !!!

A peaceful oasis in Marrakesh. Definitely worth visiting. The garden is small but beautiful. It is very tranquil and cool in stark contrast to the noisy, chaotic and hot city outside. The garden is of a size that you could walk through all of it in about 10 minutes at a quick pace, however my wife and I spent about an hour there and really enjoyed it. The cafe in the grounds is very pretty and a nice place to have a mint tea. The Berber museum in the grounds was also very interesting with an accessible overview of the Berber culture, history, fashion and traditions.
Nice break away from the hustle and bustle. Beautiful gardens and very tranquil place. 70dhs for the garden entry and 30dhs for the museum entry. Very easy to take beautiful pics here

It's not bad. It's a lovely urban reprieve from the heat. I suppose if you are a lover of bamboo and cactus, you would really enjoy this place. We did enjoy the Berber museum, which costs a few dirham more to get in. The cafe was lovely and you can order from a very reasonable menu there. Excellent court yard from which to people watch. There are also numerous seating areas and photo vantage points in the garden to relax.
Beautiful!. Really lovely place to visit when in Marrakech! It has great gardens, and allows for some peaceful time away from the souks!

Yves Saint Laurent is not only a fashion genius. Yves Saint Laurent is not only a fashion geniuslovely garden, well kept and nicely maintained. The shop is just lovely, with YSL items at acceptable prices.
Very colorful jardin!. I think it's overpriced as it is not that big and you can see it in 10 minutes. However, it is a little paradise in the middle of Morocco.
Walk in Jardin Majorelle. The garden was really beautiful and definitely you should visit it!We also had a really nice lunch in the cafe there. You can also take really nice pictures there.

Tranquillity. This relatively compact garden is an oasis of calm amongst the hassle and bustle of Marrakech. The lush vegetation contasts with the vibrant blue of the building. The Berber museum within the garden is worth the additional entry charge. Allow 90 to 120 minutes to appreciate.
Nice. Nice garden and nice new museum. Beautiful colors and plants.I loved the mirror room in the museum with all the Berber jewels and the sky full of stars!
well worth a visit. very peaceful after the noise from the street. try to go before 11 before the coaches arrive and it gets busy. lovely Yves st Laurent shop on site with lovely prices
Lovely peacefull break from the souks. After an exhausting day getting lost in the medina we needed break. The gardens were lovely and The restaurant delightful and just what we needed!
A must see!. A beautiful garden and must see on your trip. Go early to avoid crowds. We went not long after it had opened and there was already a line forming.

what about starting limited visits?. the garden, the basins, the waters and fountains, the trees and all the plants around... everything makes you feel like being in Eden... wonderful paths to explore this little paradise and useful benchs to stop and just relax for a while thanking life for being in a so perfect place.ysl and his foundation did a really good job.the big question is that too much people could visiting the gardens all togheter, most of them making noise and having no respect of such a place made for silence and meditation. this is really disturbing for many visitors as l saw.may be could be an idea to understand if it could be possible to allow visits to a limited number of people at a time...
Good for pictures. Quite touristic but the vibrant colors make a good spot for photography enthusiasts.The entrance fee was a little overpriced too.

Go first thing in the morning. It opens at 8am so be there then to avoid the hoards. It is a wondrous place - buy the ticket for the museum as well - but the numbers that they allow in at any one time can spoil the experience. Fab avocado smoothie in the cafe.
Peaceful garden. Wonderful, peaceful and colorful are the most characters of Majorelle garden. It has a lot of plants. 100% Worth visiting!

mesmerizing. Rather small but heavenly beautiful with huge plants and flowers, even tortoises, frogs and fishes. It can be visited in a very short amount of time. The entrance is rather expensive though, i think around 70 MAD per adult.

Very beautiful. It was a bit expensive for our tight budget but the garden is truly beautiful. We were told later we should have gotten a ticket for the museum too, as it's small but very informative.

A green floral paradise!!!. A not to miss venue in Marrakech, we took many photos and would love to be back with a book or a canvass to paint, the restaurant is excellent setting to lunch ot drinks, color vibrant. love the tree, plant and flowers.

Wonderful, colorful, peaceful. A very nice little "secret" with beautiful flowerpots, plants and birds. Very expensive Laurent-ish souvenirshop and a cosy café. We misses a Laurent museum, but realised that it was bring building at the moment.

A oasis in the dust of the city. If you can spare an hour of your time visit this garden. It is not particularly big, but it takes you away from the loud surroundings. A little Berber museum inside as well for culture seeker's.
Ives saint Laurent had his influence here and they honoured him with a monument.
If it weren't for the people .... ... this would really be such a nice place. As it is, you'll just have to be prepared to come (very) early or be prepared for the crowd.

Too crowded, too many plants, but still worth it!. We arrived early in the morning an there was already a huge line (probably from some kind of tour).Once you enter you can see the garden is very well taken care of, but when you get to the house (the main attraction) it is almost impossible to take a good picture of it... Whether it's the tens of people surrounding the house, whether its the plants the cover most of its facade, you simply can get a nice picture of the house. But you can still take some nice pictures of the doors, windows, walls benches, etc!

Recreational visit. This was the private holiday residence from Yves-Saint-Laurent. Beautiful gardens and a wonderfully informative museum about the Berber culture inside. Definitely worth the €10 entrance fee!
Jardin visit. It was nice on a hot day but very busy. The gardens were not a big as we had assumed but very colourful and cool.

Best attraction I visited in Marrakesh. Out of all the touristic places one would find on the map, this is definitely the most impressive. Only 70 dirham for the gardens and an extra 30 for the museum (definitely worth it, the jewellery room is great). The garden is great not only due to the beautiful plants, but also due to the colourful decorations. 100% worth visiting.

Over-priced and underwhelming. It is expensive to get in and so very small. Half an hour to see it all. We would not have been sad to have missed it. We went to the Cyber Park later and enjoyed the gardens there for no entry charge.Suggest you do not bother as it is disappointing.

Small, Pretty but Doesn't Have the Wow Factor. I must admit being the number one TripAdvisor attraction in Marrakech I expected Le Jardin Majorelle to wow my socks off. Unfortunately that wasn't the case.On arrival I was surprised to find that the garden was very small and the museum was charged for separately. You can walk around the whole garden in less than 10 minutes. The restaurant looks very beautiful although I didn't eat there. In terms of the plants, many were damaged as visitors had etched their names into the bark which in my eyes ruined the experience. If a garden doesn't protect the plants they exhibit then it really depreciates it's value.In summary, Le Jardin Majorelle exhibits hardly a shadow of the beauty that can be found in other local gardens such as those in the wonderful La Mamounia hotel and the Jardin D'Agdal. I would not visit again and would suggest the management take a recess to consider how to reinvigorate the garden with the class and attention it deserves.
lovely garden i. this is not a large garden but it is lovely -has an interesting collection of Moroccan plants....we recommend it for any who like lovely things.

Plants. Bunch of palm trees, heaps of cacti and nicely painted houses!If you are a botanist or obsessed with flowers and plants this is THEplace for you. If you are looking for a quiet and relaxed hour, this might be a place for you. If not, I can't recommend it.

Peaceful oasis in the midst of the city. Beautiful garden, highlighted by bright splashes of Moroccan blue and yellow pots. Visit early in the day or at lunch time to avoid the tour bus crowds. The cafe is lovely and the Berber Museum on the grounds is worth the slight extra cost.

Stunning gardens with a vibrant splash of colour!. Well worth taking a bit of time walking around these fabulous gardens which are an absolute oasis in the middle of Marrakech. The colours are vibrant, and used so evocatively its a pleasure to be amongst them. Don't miss the wonderful shop, there are some treasures that you won't find anywhere else!

Lovely Oasis. This is a nice change from marching through the markets. It's a bit of a walk from the Medina but lovely and cool when you arrive. It's not huge but it's a relief from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful gardens. Lovely place to visit. Lush and so attractive. Great cactus area, beautiful plants and striking coloured pots, water areas, seating and a cafe, expensive we were told. Didn't try it though.
Amazing !!!. Would reccomend anyone to take a trip here. The gardens are not that big but the beauty inside is amazing.
A Quiet Haven in Marrakech. A beautiful get away from the heat and bustle of the city. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Marrakech.

Busy but lovely. Tiny compared to the other gardens and now surrounded by apparent blocks, sadly. Also rather pricey compared to other local attractions.However, the gardens themselves are well planted, mostly with cactus varieties, with some nice water features and hanging gardens too. A tall bamboo grove near the entrance gives a lovely hush to the place.It was stonkingly busy when we went around midday, which is a shame: if you can do first thing in the morning I imagine it would be best.The berber museum is mostly nothing special although what's on display is good quality, but the bit of visual trickery in the jewellery room is really, really lovely, giving a simulated starlit night effect.My only complaint of the gardens is that there isn't more.

Do the museum. The gardens are lovely, but crowded when we were there. The Berber museum however, was controlled so there weren't too many people, and it was very well done. Some incredible artifacts!! Definitely worth the extra few Dirhams.

Lovely!. the gardens are gorgeous. Make sure you allow time to really enjoy them, to just sit and listen to the frogs and breath in the smells of the garden. And the Berber Museum was really fine. Well done!
Dremy. No trip to Marrakech is complete without coming here. Lovely gardens and cafe - a little slice of heaven outside the medina life.
Tranquil oasis. The ideal place to chill out for an hour or so. Small but well worth seeing, especially for lovers of cacti.

Quote expensive but nice. The Berber museum inside the garden is nice.
The garden itself is nothing stunning.
Positive overall experience but definitely overpriced.
What is the fuzz about?. Do not understand the hype. Pretty colors but nothing spectacular. Glad i payed a visit but i wouldn't return. Cheap tho.

Not much. Place was small and fairly crowded. Gets cooler as so many plants and trees cramped in this such that limited sun light actually makes is to the ground. Good for close up photography and limited artwork. I much liked the visit to Edinburgh's Royal Botanical Garden last year, it was fairly big in size and plenty of benches to sit on and enjoy the calm of nature, and it was free. For us, Jardin Majorelle was a waste of money (140 Dirhams for 2), we only lasted 15 minutes in the garden and were out having a coffee at a café across the road from garden and waited to get picked back up.
Very peaceful. We loved the garden it was a piece of paradise in the red urban sprawling hustling city. The gardens are colourful and peaceful. With the bonus of the Berber museum which is a must

Exquisite. Most advice is that the time taken to walk around these lovely gardens is around one hour. My advice is to just slow your life down, stop regularly to rest, look, and talk. Have some lunch at the excellent restaurant/cafe, then do some more. We all rush far too much, and this very classy garden is worth spending some time in.

Beautiful Gardens. The Jardin Marjorelle are a set of beautiful gardens designed by Yves Saint Lorent and are definitely a must-see in Marrakech. The flowers and plants are amazing to see although it might be prettier during spring and summertime and less visually enjoyable in fall and winter. You can take a lot of photographs, that's for sure!

Not as good as expected . Yes, it's worth seeing and is an oasis of calm. Also, would imagine the shade is very refreshing in the intense heat. Just not as great as hoped from the reviews. I suppose when you compare it to the rest of Marrakech it is beautiful. The cafe was expensive for Marrakech & the gift shop was extortionate.

Great garden. This is one of the must see sites when visiting Marrakech It's a clever design which is smaller than i imagined but cleverly laid out.We went late Sunday afternoon and it took about half an hour to walk around and wasn't too busy.

Gardens and Berber museum. Stunning place, so well preserved, enjoyed this trip twice, good value for money. Took some lovely pictures of all the plants and pots, and bought gifts for family in the shop.

Summarize visit. This garden is gorgeous, one of the most beautiful I have ever seen! The colors are surreal! I took dozens of photos that turned out great. Also, it has the classiest gift shop ever, as fitting for an YSL memorial site. Don't miss it, even if you're not a big garden enthusiast.

A nice short getaway. Nice place to visit after seeing rocks and sand the whole week. Good place to get away from the pollution on the road. It is like a private garden in some rich person house which is really well maintained. But 70 dirhams is really pricey.

Attractive and different. The gardens were very attractive and cool like an oasis. Very nice display of cacti. Beautiful items on the gift shop but quite pricey. The Berber Museum, which is next to the gardens was very attractive and informative.
Beautiful Garden. We visited Jardin Majorelle as part of a half day tour around Marrakech. The Garden and the Berber museum were a welcome alternative to the hustle and bustle of the Medina.

Wow glad I went here!. Beautiful location to see the last home of Yves Saint Laurent. Peaceful gardens to stroll in amid the noise of Marrakech. A small Berber museum there as well as outside views of the home. I'm sure when he acquired the home this would be considered far out of old town however now it is built up with condos everywhere and this oasis sits right in the middle. So glad our tour included this stop otherwise would have done it on my own.
Overhaussed. Nothing spectacular, but something I'm glad to have seen. Beautiful colors in the architecture but the rest is just ok. Fair pricing and worth a visit.
Awesome. Perhaps best place I have seen in Marakhes, very colorful, little bit cold because of plants :) but If you go to Marakhes you need to see it.

Peaceful oasis. Don't miss this when in Marrakech. The gardens are beautiful! Can't say much because you have to see it to understand its beauty & tranquility. It's exotic, of course :)I've seen many gardens in the World. I can't really compare because all of them are lovely in their own way. Maybe let's say i wasn't shocked by the Majorelle gardens as i was when i saw the Villandry ones :))) We really liked the small museum. We didn't expect much but they covered quite a bit on the history of the Berbers in 3/4 rooms. Very nice displays of clothing, jewellery, tools, etc.Great display of the 'Love' posters by YSL when you get out of the museum. Also, a nice gift shop and cafe. Their menu & service are excellent!
Beautiful . Absolutely breathtaking and so peaceful! Definitely worth a visit. Also, not a far walk to get to the new town afterwards - 10/15mins.
Nice and calem. wonderful colours, flowers and water features. Perfect place I highly recommend this beautiful as a place to read a book

A little meh. The gardens are very pretty and well maintained - but it is a little way out so a bit of a trek to get there and to be fair it isn't that big a very leisurely stroll round takes around 20mins. I most likely wouldn't go out of my way to visit it again

Highlight of Marrakech trip!. Loved the gardens and Yves house. Small museum was also very interesting. Plenty of taxis outside, just make sure you don't take the first price as they always try and rip you off.
A must. Beautiful, calm and quiet. the Burber museum is the best in the city and the house stunning amongst the cactus garden.
Definitely worth a visit. Absolutely wonderful place. Just need to patiently manage your way around as everyone wants to get that perfect shot of the blue majorelle walls.

Much Hyped - Sadly Underwhelming. Our guide book raved about the Jardin Majorelle - more so than any other gardens in Marrakech. We made a special journey to see it and paid the approx £5 ph entry fee. Whilst it was quite nice and impeccably maintained we found it quite nice but probably not as enjoyable as many of the free entry public gardens elsewhere in the city. There was an excessive focus on YSL, with signs everywhere directing visitors to his very underwhelming memorial. The cafe was charging crazy prices for ordinary snacks and drinks.Overall okay but nothing special.
Bamboo and cactus heaven. It was nice but a little disappointing and dare I say it boring! Was expecting a bigger variety of plants and garden landscapes.

A botanical surprise in the city. Definitely worth a stop. The botanical gardens are incredible, so much to see. Very friendly staff and exhibits. Go early in the morning light to take the best pictures. The greenery makes for natures shade, nice cool spot for a break.
Stunning gardens. The gardens are absolutely beautiful, a real delight for all the senses. It's pretty cheap entry and you could easily spend a couple of hours there.
Beautiful, peaceful gardens. Great reprieve from an otherwise hectic city. Museum was a small good glimpse into Berber life, but the gardens themselves were marvelous and definitely worth it.

Wonderfully cool oasis to visit. Majorette Blue is certainly a vibrant blue and there are numerous pots painted in this colour as well as other equally vibrant colours. It is a pleasant place to wander around during the day.

Amazing to visit . Beautiful garden - well kept and also there is a nicely made museum on the Berbers history to visit - a cafe for a drink and also a gallery of paintings exhibition - do not miss the garden visit - it's fabulous

Majorelle Blue. The most fascinating thing about this garden is the delightful splashes of the vivid blue. Is it worth the price of admission? Not if you come from a dry climate - all the plants will look very familiar.

Blue me away!. The colour that dominates Marrakech is a pale sandstone pink, so the impact of the cobalt 'Majorelle Blue' was stunning. Also, Marrakech is dusty and buzzes to the sound of cars and motorbikes so this private park is a true oasis. We ate at the cafe which seemed a bit expensive for what it was and mooched around the Berber museum. Mainly it was the serenity in an otherwise manic city that was most welcome.
Beautiful. Such a wonderful and colourful place, and just a short walk from Riad El Mansour. The Yves St Laurent ashes are buried there and it is such a lovely resting place.

Nice. Pleasant enough & fairly easy to get to. This was my second visit, mainly for the benefit of my mum, who was a first time visitor. The staff could smile a bit, but given its such a popular attraction they probably don't feel the need!
beautiful. Stunning and beautiful, costs 70dh to enter and more if you want to see museum, well worth the visit, has a nice cafe inside and is just the most beautiful place

Great for photos. I'm not sure what I was expecting to experience by visiting Jardin Majorelle. Since it was on many of the "top 10 things to do in Marrakech" I went along with it. The 70 MAD for garden and museum entry made me want to stay for longer than the 20 minutes it took to navigate around the garden.. but after a while I was ready to call it a day.
A beautiful spot. Lovely gardens well worth a visit and easy walking distance from the Medina. A little crowded in the middle of the day when we visited so may be better going early in the day
Relaxation par excellence!. Our second visit to the Jardin Majorelle. Utterly beautiful and so peaceful and tranquil. A real joy to visit with a lovely calm courtyard cafe.

Beautiful. A brief walk from the medina. I enjoyed the succulents and cactus similar to my Southern California roots. The colors of the buildings added a Moroccan flair. We followed the guide book recommendation to go early and we're pleased with our visit. The gardens are small and you could see how they could be overwhelmed by tours coming through.
Beautiful Garden. A small garden of extraordinary design. Who would have thought that cobalt blue could be so magnificent in a garden. The Berber Museum in the garden is also well worth visiting.
amazing tropical paradise. Visited this fabulous garden 13 years ago, so it was great to see how it has grown and matured. The vibrant colour and tropical planting is a must-see.

Beautiful place to escape the hustle and bustle. Great place to escape to after a day in the Jemaa el Fna, worth getting there early to avoid the queues but they moved quickly and well worth a visit, lovely food in the café also!

Lovely Oasis in a busy city. Decided to walk to the gardens - hot day, traffic everywhere, not a good idea?
Never mind, once inside it was quiet albeit still heaps of people. Beautiful colours everywhere.
Not to be missed is the Berber museum, take plenty of time - lots to learn.

Tranquil, shady in hot sun. Early morning is best before lots of visitors come. Beautiful colours and plants. Doesn't take very long to look around though. There are nice gift shops/furniture near by too that are not tourist shops, very well designed products like you would find on Europe.

Beautiful gardens. Is a must see when in Marrakech, the gardens were stunning, it's not very big once inside and you have to pay to get in, children are free, plenty eating places outside the gardens, it gets called the new town and is much calmer than in the old town, plenty of taxis around, horse drawn carriages to, we didn't use the horses as they look shattered and malnurished which seem the norm for Marrakech where animals are concerned
Can't miss. An absolute treasure. Wonderful collection of Berber costume and jewelry. Try to get there right when it opens to avoid the groups of tourists.

Amazing nature. The queue was huge outside but it worth every minute awaiting. The place has a magnificent amount of plants and it is a delight to see it all. Perfect location for a stroll and for some nice pics.

Lovly. Must go and see this place and make sure you by a tickets for the barbare musium the skills of the guys are secound to none , and I'm sorry to say much much more impressive than the Crown Jewels, The work is much more refined. Bye a ticket on arrival it's more than half price cheaper ,

Small pretty shaded garden. This was a lovely place to ramble round, although once you've seen one cactus.... You get the idea. Its a nice place for contemplation probably not that interesting for children.

Not worth the visit. Spent 1 hour here, which was a waste of time. Max 30 min sufficient.
In my opinion, spend this time at the souk or just people watch from a café!

Colourful. Le Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful place to visit in Marrakech whether you're an ardent fan of Yves Saint Laurent or not. It is a beautiful, verdant oasis in the terracotta city. There are some stunning species of cacti that I've never seen before. The colours are so vivid and the place is very well maintained. The Berber Museum is definitely worth a visit while you're there. There is a gorgeous little café on site too, serving breakfast, lunch, sweets and ice cream. Le Jardin Majorelle is so tranquil and lush. Do not miss this!
beautiful!. The garden was stunning. We spend Easter there- arriving via tuk tuk and departing via horse drawn carriage. Magical experience! My 5 year old enjoyed it quite a bit as well!
Amazing!. I visited 2 and a half years ago...I WANT TO GO BACK!!! it was incredible! Gardens were exactly as I pictured!

Stunning!. I recently visited the gardens whilst in a birthday trip after being recommened to go by a friend. The gardens are stunning and the colours, art, and various plants are amazing. A must see whilst in Marrakech!
Small Garden. The gardens were nice. A bit on the small side and very busy. We visited late morning and there was a line to buy tickets.
Nice, but overblown.. The gardens are a welcome respite from the bustle of the Medina. They are, however, overpriced and not that impressive
Its a short experience. Its a beautiful garden withe some cool things in it. There isn't a lot there. In and out in an hour but could do it in 30 minutes.

Beautiful, but smaller than expected. I think Jardin Majorelle is definitely worth a visit. It is a beautiful garden, but it is quite small, so don't plan a super long time to be there. There's a little museum which I enjoyed. The gift shops have very beautiful goods, but they are far more expensive than expected.
Beautiful - Breakfast at the Cafe is a Must!. The gardens are beautiful, But what did it for me was the Moroccan breakfast at the cafe! Its a lovely outdoor cafe, with great service and great food.

Nice garden. The garden is beautiful and colourful but personally think there are better gardens in Marrakech,. The museum is however great, we learnt a lot about the berber people and the items they use or used o use.

Beautiful. Had a lovely day at the garden, it looks amazing and should be visited while you're staying in Marrakesh, it's nice and peaceful, the ponds are a great design and there is a shop on site for souvenirs.
Very nice, but crowded. The garden itself is superb, but it is very popular with tourists, so it is very crowded. The Berber Museum is very interesting

Sights . A lovely garden, with beautiful flowers and plant life. There are also many fountains decorated with brightly coloured tiles.
It is a nice way to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city of Marrakesh.
Weekend break. Definitely worth a visit.the gardens are exquisite and a re a must for a visit to Marrakech,with the cost at 70 mad(€7) approx.

Vibrant and colorful. Just lovely.. My ignorance showed since I was overwhelmed by the lovely lush garden in the heart of Marrakech. I expected an arid terrain. This garden is a must see with gorgeous flowers and a sweet café. Museum and shops are stunning, vibrant and colorful.The kitchen explained that they were out of sardines but how could that be since it was still early in the day? Our wonderful waiter slipped me a sample which I should have kept for myself but shared with my friends. They were perfect! Surely I had a convert or two since we all had a lovely sardine lunch later that week when we reached Essaouira.
Wonderful gardens. A beautiful place that everyone who goes to Marrakesh has to visit. It is very colorful and is a pleasure to walk around it.

Beautiful gardens. This is one of the places you must visit. The gardens are beautiful but can become very busy with tourists. I would go as early as possible to avoid the crowds. Take your time as you walk around and read the history provided in the leaflet. The cafe is worth a visit (even if to use those toilets and avoid the que at the main toilets), prices are more than the local streets but the environment makes up for it. Take a seat on one of the benches around the garden, lap up the sun and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

Overpriced! And crowded. It seems as of the cost of this museum and gardens keeps increasing as our guide books from last year, have a discrepancy in price of 20 dh(from 50-70) just for entry to the garden. Then entry to the worthwhile thing, the Berber museum, is an extra 30! While I expect to pay this price elsewhere, all the other museums in Marrakesh are 10 dirhams to get in and some of the Berber wear is found at the dar si said museum where you can take photos. The garden is kind of small with many cactuses and lots of bamboo. There are much larger free gardens with wifi closer to the center of town. The Berber museum was worthwhile, but you cannot choose to so this on its own and will cost you 100 dirham for entrance. The wears inside include 3 small rooms crammed with a nice display and small amount of history about the Berber people of Morocco. Photos not allowed and strictly enforced. In summary, decide if you need to go out of your way for an average attraction with articles seen elsewhere.
Stunning all way through. This place was colour, style and magic all the way through, thoroughly enjoyed it. i had a field day with my camera. the little museum inside was interesting.
Overly lrice. This place is good but it's too highly priced which doesn't make it worth it. There isn't much value to it except nice scene for pictures. I would skip it.

Beautiful escape from the chaos. Really enjoyable location, relaxed and tranquil... One of the few things you don't barter for! Enjoy x Wouldn't recommend for an Old Fashioned Man with Old Fashioned Values. I loved it.

Impressive cactuses but not worth it. We were told by trip advisor that the Majorelle Gardens were one of the top attractions in Marrakech. It's a very nice set up but really much smaller than other gardens I have visited. We were all surprised that you can walk all the paths in around 20 minutes.
The frogs were nice but it's not worth the entrance fee.

Just okay for me !!. My daughter who had been to this garden, was insisting to visit this because she loved it.
Unfortunately, I was not impressed. It is full cactus plants and bamboo treas and I am not an admirer of cactus at all.

So in love with this oasis. It's a little bit outside the medina, but we walked about 20 minutes and felt perfectly safe. It's quick to get a taxi as well. About $7USD will get you access all day to wander the grounds. In March, the flowers were blooming and the sun shone bright. Loved it!

Exotica in colour. This garden lived up to my expectations, in all ways. Beautifully maintained, reasonable size, and with the added bonus of the Berber museum in the middle, and a lovely (but out of our budget) gift shop. The entrance price is not cheap and it is a good half an hour walk (or more when you have got lost a few times!) from the Medina, but as I love plants and gardens it was well worth the money and effort.

What a surprise to find this in the middle of Marrakech!. Who knew that Yves Saint Laurent had a place in Marrakech, and one that had a garden of such beauty? And that this is the location of his memorial, and where his ashes were left? A lovely respite area, well worth the visit. While there check out the Berber museum - for a few dollars it is a bargain to visit, with a decent collection and explanations to support your understanding.

Tranquility. Really enjoyed the gardens and the museum of Berber pieces. Not as small as some reviews had me believe it was. Thoroughly well spend hour or so wandering around and enjoying the space Majorelle created.
Divine. If you head to Marrakech, a stop at Jardin Marjorelle is a must! Beautiful gardens that you can escape the heat and hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Lovely restaurant as well on the grounds.

Lower your expectations!. After reading some great reviews and articles about it.. I was sorely disappointed. It was quite expensive with not much to see. The garden felt like a tourist trap. It was tiny and nothing special! Did not take more than max 20 minutes. However, my boyfriend did enjoy the different types of.. plantation that was there (he is very big on... trees though!).

Excellent place. A lovely park, we had a small picnic, the weather was very hot, the trees helped a lot, very clean and very well looked after
Enjoy

Uneventful trip. After hearing from many that this garden was a beautiful sanctuary that we shouldn't miss, I have to say I felt misled. Aside from the relatively cool temperature/low noise compared to the surrounding area, I'm struggling with why this garden is held in high regard. There is too much intrusion of bright color and man-made structures in the natural landscape for my taste. Highlight was the cactus, I guess.

Nice relaxed eatery. Not cheap as one might expect, but the quality and quantity are excellent. If you are visiting the gardens then well worth a stop for a bite and a coffee. Very nice atmosphere, some very well known people seen in this establishment.
Beautiful. A beautiful, peaceful garden and also art gallery and museum. The blues are striking colours and they dominate the gardens. A great place to visit

Waste of time, total rip off. The entry to the garden is 7 Euros, which was the highest entry fee of all our Marrakech attractions. The plants you get to see are totally unspectacular and the Yves Saint Laurent memorial looks like a sad joke. The garden is not very big, it takes 15 minutes to see the whole thing.

A beautiful garden - this is a must for Marrakech. The garden is a peaceful paradise after the craziness of the medina. A tranquil haven. The Berber museum is interesting and well laid out. This is not a full day trip but definitely do not miss in you top five sightseeing options.

Unique experience. The Jardin Majorelle was a very beautiful and unique garden, showing off quite exotic flora. It is laid out well and is nice to visit. Unlike some international gardens we have visited it was a bit smaller and the ground was man-made which took away from the experience a little bit. Definitely worth the visit if you are in Marrakech.

Gorgeous and stylish. One of my favorite places to visit in Marrakech. The colors and the variety of plants are so striking, and the whole atmosphere is just really special. The cafe inside and the shops are interesting as well, making for a really charming afternoon out.

A little bit dissapointed. Its a very nice garden, but very small. Within 45 minutes you have seen it al and it is not special unless you never saw inheems plants... The Berbermuseum is nice and located in the garden. You pay 10 euros per person and thats not worth it.
Honnest moroccan food. Excellent restaurant in magic place highly recommended, we have a nice lunch, under beautiful sunshine, surrounded by the spirit of the Greatest Yves Saint Laurent.

Wonderfully tranquil . As the title suggests, this garden is a peaceful location located north of Medina that contrasts with the hustle and bustle of Medina and Marrakech as a whole. Formerly owned by Yves St Lauren it is full of beautifully rich colours and and array of plant life that gives the air a fresh feel. I would definitely recommend a trip to the gardens. The food in the cafe was delicious too.
Jardim Majorelle. Nice tour through the museum and gardensNice tour through the museum and gardensNice tour through the museum and gardens

Beautiful. Such a pretty place to escape the madness. You could wander around and around soaking up all the wonderful colours, flowers and water features. Perfect place to sit back with a book and just take it all in.

Wonderful way to pass an afternoon! Well presented!. We spent 4 hours at Jardin Mojorelle - the water ways throughout the garden are delightful and the plants are beautifully presented. We enjoyed the Berber Museum Exhibit a great deal with it's well displayed costumes and jewelry. The Boutique is exceptional - if you like it, buy it there because the collection is made in Marrakech and not available anywhere else!
Indigo Blue. The garden is absolutely a must see. I came home inspired to remake my back garden and painted every terra cotta pot indigo blue.
beautiful!. Beautiful succulents and colors. I loved seeing the Berber museum and relaxing in the gardens. What a pleasure!

A must see. If anyone visits Marrakesh and doesn't make a pit stop at this garden it would be a sin. The moment you step foot in this place, you engulfed with a sense of tranquility. The entrance is lined with bamboo shoots and these draping trees. The place isn't very big but beautiful nonetheless. The Yves St. Laurant Blue paint which is the theme of the garden leaves you with a sense that you went to a Caribbean island in Africa :) This place is well worth the $12 we paid for it. Give it a try.

Beautiful, tranquil gardens in the heart of this bustling city.. Gifted to the city by Yves Saint Lauren this beautiful garden paradise smack bang in the middle of Marrakesh was an oasis of calm during our hectic visit to the city. Tropical plants and pools, fish and turtles and a chance to learn some Morrocan culture and history. We really enjoyed this attraction and would recommend a visit.
Absolutely fantastic place to escape the souks. It is really worth your time visiting the garden. Though it is much smaller than I expected it is stunning with fantastic colours. Great for the senses

Beautiful garden. Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful garden. Very nice for a stroll and a cup of tea. The museum I would also recommend. It has a good overview of traditional Moroccan clothing and artefacts. The entrance is not expensive.
So pretty. Very beautiful. A must see when in Marrakech.. go early so you dont have to stand in a que for too long.

Nice Quiet Break from the Hectic Medina, But a little overpriced. Wife wanted to check out the garden so we went mid-morning in early April. The garden is a nice quiet break from the hectic Medina with a nice selection of botanicals from around the world. It is not as large as I thought it would be, but it is in good shape. Probably more of a place to take your lady friend.
Beautiful gadens. A lovely respite from the bustling Marrakech. Beautiful, colourful and peaceful gardens. Highly recommend

Beautiful and peaceful oasis. Beautiful gardens with fantastic plants and interesting buildings and displays. Good food too in a lovely setting. This was a wonderful break from the bustle of the souks.
amazing and lovely environement. one of the most relaxant places i've ever been, very colorful very clean, friendly staff, defenitely going back there.

The fnah fnah. Don't get hennaed here, watch out for hawkers. It's loud it's super busy it's full of food smells and everyone wants to sell you something but it's also an experience very lively and you'll get cheap street food which is decent quality.
Interesting quiet stop in the middle of chaotic Marrakech. Beatif gardens, quiet setting, small musueum. An hour well spent and a nice change of pace. Impressive collection of Cacti.
Just good. Nice garden, but it is just that, a garden. Nice to go if you have time, but it is not a must to see in Marrakech, at least for me.

Interesting, relaxing place to visit. Nice spot to escape to. Well designed and interesting. Colours and plants were wonderful. The Berber Museum is worth a look if you're interested in Amazigh history.

Different 'garden' . The garden is full of interesting vegetations from the desert. It is not very big, but very pretty. However, it is slightly different than a English garden. There are not many flowers in the garden. The colour in the garden is so brilliantly vivid! The blue is amazing with the some of the purple flowers. It looks really unreal. It worth the visit.
Beautiful Afternoon. I would definitely recommenced people to visit this amazing garden. Very peaceful and well maintained.

A fitting testament to the man. At 70 Dirhams and with it being a fair walk from the main medina, there is perhaps a temptation to skip the Majorelle gardens. They are well worth the visit however and the beautifully landscaped and tranquil gardens provide a stark contrast to the souks. We chose not to pay to visit the museum but spent at least an hour or so walking around. Walking to the gardens is a good idea too as you get to pass through the more modern area of Marrakech and get a feel for the city as a whole, rather than just the Medina area.
Relaxing place, great for kids. We had a great time, the Berber museum is amazing, my son loved the water ponds and the different plants he saw.
Best short break . My bucket list got another tick with a visit to Marrakesh in April. It was pleasant and the people warm and friendly. It was a good mix of modern and traditional.

Simply Gorgeous. Stunning views. Takes about 1 hour to go thru the whole place. About an extra 20 mins for the berber museum, if you have time. Its not a must see. We had a delicious avocado, date, almond shake at the cafe.
