Simply Beautiful. Great garden, mostly succulents and cacti. Pride and joy of Marrakech. Worth an hour of your time. There are 30 full time gardeners working there, and it shows. The grounds are immaculate.
Beautiful Gardens Worth Seeing!. The Majorelle Gardnes are beautiful. They are very green and offer a different perspective on the plant life in Morocco. Definitely worth the visit!

Pleasant stroll in a peaceful garden. Good for about 30-40 minutes stroll, this garden holds a bunch of beautiful and interesting vegetation in addition to the remains of Yves St. Laurent who was instrumental in preserving the grounds from selling off as real estate.
A cool oasis . The Jardin Majorelle is a cool oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. It's a pretty place to spend an hour to recharge.

Stunning gardens just outside of the city walls . There is an entry fee of 100 Moroccan dirham for the gardens and museum. The walkways are covered and easy to navigate on foot or by wheelchair as they are level. There are toilets and a cafe and with your tickets you get a simple map and a history of the gardens. You need to allow yourself at least 2 to 4 hours. All the taxis can take you to the door. Beautiful collection of cacti and bamboo. A memorial to Yves St. Laurent. The cafe is reasonably priced with both indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoors you can opt for shade or sunshine. Menus are both English and French. We paid 350 Dirham for large salads, smoothies and coffee. Lunch served with bread, coffee comes with a free bottle of water. Lovely clean toilets are free.

Calm and peaceful. Nice calm and Peaceful place to visit. Nice use of bold colours and great place to visit for someone who enjoys plants. Maybe something to see once and that's probably it. 70dhms entry for non Moroccans, (about £5), which I think is a bit expensive compared to other attractions, however I can understand that maintenance might be costly and they do also need to make a profit. Would I recommend it? Maybe. Plenty of photo opportunities too.

Peaceful. I was surprised at the layout here, it was worth waiting in the queue for 20 minutes. Very good for photographers, the museum was good and the little cafe. I'm not usually into gardens, but it was pleasant.

Date with my Wife. I whisked my wife away from the family, to have a quiet romantic afternoon. Great place to visit lovely collection of plants and trees. Loved the greetings from YSLNice to spend an afternoon sipping Tea in the garden. Memorial of YSL

An oasis in Marrakech . Although a bit of a walk from the medina where we stayed and a bit more pricey than you'd come to expect from Marrakech after being there a week, the garden proved to be well worth it and was a welcome break from the Medina. 70dirhams entry made for a lovely stroll through an impressive landscape, and an altogether enjoyable afternoon. The garden is easily reached by taxi or carriage, however for those who prefer to walk it is not that much effort; the modern area of Gueliz being on the way is an added bonus!

Colourful. A charming place. A great escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Very peaceful and relaxing even though it can be quite busy at times. There are some truly amazing colours and the plants are beautiful. I was really impressed with the various types of cactus on show. It is not a very big garden, and will take a couple of hours to look around. Worth a visit. Not an expensive entry fee
mrs. The gardens were about 20 minutes walk away.Cant remember how much it costs. it was very calm and serene but I expected more colour and flowers but it mainly consisted of greenery ie.trees.

Not sure how this is rated #1. When I selected 3 at the beginning of this review it stated "average" as the description - and that is exactly what this was for me. Average. While the cacti and museum were nice, I have no idea how this is rated #1 of the things to do in Marrakech. Enjoy the medina and the markets. They are more unique and interesting when visiting the city.

A lovely escape in the city. Just the perfect place to wind down a day of bargaining with merchants at the medina (and pay homage to a couture master - Yves St. Laurent, who also created these gardens). A quiet oasis in the middle of town. Be sure to also take in the Berber museum on the property!
Very Nice . Very charming and nice. Nothing much to see but different and away from the hustle bustle of the town

Interesting Garden. Very busy when we went, this could be a place of relaxation in a busy city if it was not for the amount of people. Smaller then we'd expected although the Berper exhibition was worth the extra 300dir each. Just a short 15mins walk back into the old city if you don't mind crossing the busy roads and dodging motor bikes. Although to be fair that's the fun of Marakesh. Alan
A must. The garden is just beautiful and very well maintained, so are the nice blue buildings. It is a must when visiting Marrakech! Do not miss the little shop!
Don't miss it. Stunning beauty. Try not to run out of storage space for all the pics you're going to take. If you lived here, you'd be a great artist, too.
Tranquility.. Beauttiful, lush tranquil gardens in the middle of the madness of Marrakech, visit early to avoid the crowds and in order to get the best people free shots.

Very Average. Not too much to say , had to queue for a while to get in, and Not a lot to see when you do get in, a few trees and a Rue Saint Laurent memorial, museum there is a bit disappointing which you have to pay for separate, they have a cafe so you can get refreshments , nothing to shout home about .your not really missing much if you dont go , but if you have a hour to spare to pass time then go just to say you have been.
Very nice place. It's poetry there Charme and elegance. The place seduced me right away, one small details if they could have some few people to explain the place In a better way that would be great

Disappointing, expensive and crowded garden . We were that this was the place to visit. Obviously everyone was told that. Hence it was very crowded and we found it quite boring compared to other gardens we have visited before. It is a little outside the Medina, still in walking distance but along busy roads. Of course plenty of taxis offer to take you. But there's a better places in the Medina like the newly opened palace across from the Cafe Arabe in Rue Mouassine.

Beautiful . Just like all the reviews below, the Jardin Majorelle was an oasis away from the busy streets of the medina. So well kept and thought out, we adored just sitting and soaking up the atmosphere. A real must when in Marrakesh.

Hidden treasure . We visited this beautifully maintained garden in Marrakesh on a Sunday and it was very busy (we queued for 30 minutes). It isn't huge so the crowds felt rather invasive and did take the edge off an otherwise pleasant experience. For a more tranquil time, chose a less popular visiting time. The planting comprises: palms, cacti, succulents and massive bamboo plantings, laid out around various water features and with 'spot' planting of eye-catching, showy displays of Bougainvillia.The garden restoration was funded by Yves St Laurent who fell in love with the garden and there is a rather strange memorial to him, comprising a fluted, ancient stone column (section), no taller than six feet, with a ragged top?Worth a visit.
Fine.. The gardens are nice but the place is small and a bit crowded with all the tourists so it's difficult to appreciate everything.

Lovely cool relaxing afternoon . Visited with my son who is older than a teenager for a birthday treat - lovely afternoon spent wandering the gardens & looking at all the beautiful plants - did not visit he cafe as it looked rather pricey .

Tranquil. Peaceful garden with fabulous colours. My friend and I took a book and read on one of the many benches there. 70DHM for adults to get in to the garden so it's worth spending a while there! Museum is an additional cost. Do not expect grass (you'll need to walk on paths) and picnics are not allowed. Free toilets. The garden doesn't take long to go around but if you have a spare bit of time and want somewhere nice to relax - go here. Hint - if you want to take a taxi back to your hotel/medina - walking to the road and hailing one is often more fruitful than going to one of the ones parked outside if you wish to lower the price of the taxi - do haggle! We went back to our hotel for 20 DHM.

Wow, Where can I get that BLUE?. I was totally surprised with this garden. Not what I expected at all. It's a lovely but busy garden with an excellent tea house. The small museum at this garden is worth a visit to learn more about the Berber culture. Definitely recommend.
Beautiful gardens. Lovely gardens that provide a getaway from the busy medina life. There is a discount for students that isn't advertised at the entrance but does apply.
YSL. would have liked the option to access more information on the garding, through audio set, sign posts or app/internet access.

Stunning Garden. This is a must-see although slightly overpriced getting in compared to other gardens in Marrakech. Adults pay, kids don't by the way. If you love plants, gardening etc. you will love it here. Mother Nature is the true artist! And if you love your photos, you will get tonnes of them in here too.

Don't miss the Berber Museum. We managed to walk from our hotel to Jardin Majorelle, but only with the help of a detailed map. While streets in Marrakech have names, there are no signs so you have to count the number of streets before you make a turn. The gardens were, as someone described, an oasis in a very busy city, but it was the Berber Museum on the grounds which we enjoyed even more than the gardens. The museum, while small, tells the story of the Berbers, their culture, their jewellery, their clothing, all beautifully displayed, with descriptions in English. Well worth the additional 30 DH.
Beautiful but a bit away from the Medina. Gorgeous Gardens where Yves Saint Laurent's spirit is still so present. Do not miss the Berbere Museum, it really shows the history of these wonderful people
Gorgeous. Don't miss it! No visit to Marrakesh would be complete without it. Plan to spend at least a couple hours and enjoy a drink in their café.

Oasis in the City!. A very nice visit to get away from the crowd of the Medina. As you enter you feel the change of temperature. It feels great and the colors are beautiful. The gardens are manicured. It is definitely a picture taking spot! There is small YSL expo and a ver expensive shop. You cannot visit the YSL house as it is beyond the wall and owned by a private entity. There s also a Cafe with a cool patio. A nice sot for a mint tea!
Great gardens. The gardens were great specially the tall cactus. Will recommend this place for a visit. We enjoyed the place and got great photos.

Far from the madding crowds. Although generally not a flora or fauna aficionado, this Garden in the new part of the city is well worth the visit and a stunning contrast to the hustle and bustle that typifies Marrakech on a daily basis. The stark contrast of the blue architecture with the various types of cacti is a sight to behold and when we went one afternoon in early April it was relatively quiet, with no pushing, shoving or queueing to get the best photo!Be aware that any child 12 or over pay the same price as an adult (70 Dirham at the time of writing) and they don't take credit cards of any description. Also, to get a taxi back to the Medina or elsewhere be wary of those that line the street immediately outside the gardens. You WILL pay a premium. Just walk to the end of the street and haggle your fare in true Moroccan style!

Beautiful Gardens, with a lovely Cafe.. Lovely gardens, we drove and parked very close on the road and gave 10MAD to the guy for parking. 70MAD for over 12s and another 30MAD if you want to visit the small museum. There is a lovely cafe which we stopped for drinks and snack. The gardens are a Great place for photos and worth a visit.

Very Beautiful! . Glad that we went to see it. Very beautiful! Next time when we have more time, we will visit the Berber Museum as well. The location is a bit far from the square if you walk. It's better to get a taxi.

a cool and relaxing garden. Initially - especially since it is a little off-center - we were a little bit sceptically whether we should take the trip. This doubts all vanished once we set foot in the garden. The whole setting is simply beautiful. Once you have seen the blue of the villa (especially in the soft late afternoon light) I am sure you will remember it for a lifetime.All in all go there and visit it - it´s definetly worth the visit.
Just okay. Hidden discounts. There are too many tourists there at one time so it's Not relaxing or charming at all. It is smaller than ee thought. They have an unadvertised student discount.

Go..!. A bit of tranquility from the hustle and bustle. It's a must go to destination. I was expecting crowds but there weren't any. Great gift shop. Forget the souk, I did all my shopping here hassle free!!
Jardin Marjorelle. This garden is really nice. It has a beautiful landscape and a range of plants. It is very vibrant to look at and is quite romantic.

Exquisite. The highlight of any trip to Marrakech. Elegant, exotic and beautiful, like every YSL production. One gripe: why does it cost Moroccans the same steep price as Europeans (€10) to see the gardens and exquisite Berber museum? Given the average income in Morocco, this doesn't seem fair. Surely the locals should pay less to see this national treasure?

stunning. Beautiful place to escape to. Well curated museum - really well done - worht getting the tickets. Delicious cafe - we had coffee by the fire in the rain and then a yummy lunch when the sun came out!

Lovely. Nice to get out of the medina chaos but it was very crowded and not enough benches. The museum is quite interesting and has English leaflets for each room for those who don't speak French. Good for an hour or so.

A BEAUTIFUL GARDEN IN THE MIDDLE OF MARRAKECH. This beautiful garden is a peaceful and relaxing place away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Once the home of Yves Saint Lauren the gardens were full of colour and well worth a visit.
Blissful escape. Beautiful vegetation against vibrant colored architecture. A peaceful place to take a break while in Marrakech m.
Anna. A beautiful garden. So tranquil, away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. I tried to transport myself to the time Yves St Laurent lived there. It would have been amazing.

Nice but overpriced. Nice garden but not overwhelming. 70 dirham just for the garden seems quite overpriced. It get's very busy and therefore you can't really enjoy the garden due to the big tourist groups.
amazing green area in the lovely city of Marrakech. This is definitely worth while visiting. Kids under 12 for free, adults 70 Dirham. Walking distance from the Medina.

Pretty but crowded . The gardens were beautiful and the colours amazing! We stayed in the old town and got a taxi here. Only negative was that the gardens were very busy! But still well worth a visit.

A breath of fresh air. What an enchanting garden, you disconnect completely from everything else and lose track of time. Fantastic types of cactus and plants, nice little paths and the opportunity to sit on benches and just enjoy.
Beautiful. Lovely place to while away an hour in Marrakech.definitely worth a look. Be aware there may be queues. Beautiful colours and flowers. Relaxing and peaceful.

For those who loved YSL. The garden was quite interesting, but was not a must do unless YSL is very special to you. It appeared to have become a bit of a spot for lovers to wander thru, but I felt the garden lacked any particular draw.
Quick trip...great colours. 70 Dihrams to get is and a queue on entry. Inside, many exotic plants and trees and some colour. Memorial to Yves Saint Laurent was a bit of a let down

The most beautiful Gardens. Prepare to wait in line to get in, but it is with it! YSLs gardens are magic! There is also a small museum with Berber things, a Cafe and a great museum shop. This is a must when in Marrakech, peaceful and solo beautiful.

Expensive but worth it!. A very beautiful place to visit. Lots of beautiful flowers and shaded in the hot sun.
Suitable for families with older or younger children and includes a cafe if you need a sit down break.
Lots of taxis outside but we were led to believe they were very expensive directly outside. Just fix your price before getting in!

Stunning. The Art Deco painted house, now an amazing museum and the Majorelle blue edging the rills and fountains show off the amazing collection of plants. The entrance, walking through the bamboo grove on a hot day is stunning. well worth a visit.
An Oasis in Marrakech. A beautiful garden and very interesting museum about the history of Berber. Spend a few hours there and enjoy the peaceful silence

lovely, interesting garden. Nice layout so that one can follow a path and see different vistas and a variety of plants, water features, and the brightly colored house. Despite the crowds, it was a very enjoyable experience.

A Marrakesh Must!!. You don't have to be a fashion victim to enjoy this beautifully-designed and well-kept garden. Though not very big, it offers many interesting perspectives and original architecture and décor. The famous Majorelle blue offers striking contrast and counterpoint to the great collection of cacti, bamboo and other subtropical plants... The photo-ops are plenty. The quiet and the shaded alleys, kiosks and fountains provide a rare and refreshing respite in this hot and bustling city! Best visited in the late afternoon.

Beautiful oasis of calm. Nice to see it in Spring on our second trip. Watch out for turtles and frogs! It is a lovely spot and highly recommended. Although obviously busy it did not feel too crowded away from the entrance. Nice cafe too.

lovely space. The gardens are small but beautifully planned, peaceful, cool ,quiet and very artistic. Found they had quite a Zen quality to them. The museum was nice, but very small and limited. i have never encountered such expensive books in my life!! Would i go back? Yes you could spend hours in the garden,.. the other parts...I would miss them out next time. Nonetheless i would definately recommend including here in your trip. Watch out for the taxi drivers. If you dont go through the booking stand at the garden gate some of them might try to substantially up the price!!
amazing garden. it is a very beautiful garden and you must go there if you are in Marrakesh ! enjoy the trees and good atmosphor there !

Beautiful. A tranquil oasis - well worth a visit. The colours are beautiful. No pictures do it justice. The art gallery is an added bonus. The cafe looked great but we didn't have enough time to visit it unfortunately.

Beautiful ! . This is a beautiful, very colourful garden located slightly away from the hustle and bustle of the square. Although not very large, it has a lot to offer in terms of things to see, and the Yves Saint Laurent memorial is in there too. We bought tickets to the Berber museum too, and if you only speak English, then it's really not worth it. Makes for a nice place to take some pictures though.

Lovely oasis, great little museum. The park is beautiful, but the museum is really special. It provides a microcosm of Berber culture, clothing, jewelry, pottery, woodworking, tools, customs and more, and there are guides to the exhibits in multiple languages. This was one of the pricier places we visited (70 dirhams for the garden and 30 for the museum). Wow, that's a whole $10 US! The restaurant is upscale and also expensive by Marrakech standards, but the food is excellent. Stay out of the gift shop or you will be dropping serious $$$, but do visit the gardens! Jardin Majorelle is a wonderful respite from the crowds and the traffic of the souks.
Not worth the 70Dhs. For the price you pay it definitely isn't worth the effort. Small, overcrowded and walked around in 20 minutes maximum (not including the museum which is an extra 30 Dhs).
Beautiful. The gardens are stunning. Colours amazing and the planting really suits the setting. The whole garden is calming and such a contrast to the Medina. The soup at the cafe was delicious!

Well worth a visit. Visited this garden designed originally by Majorelle and later brought back to life by Yves St Lauren. Lovely , lush garden with plenty shade. Display of YSL posters which was interesting. Display of traditional costumes and jewellery . Cafe , ubiquitous shop but overall a lovely experience. Can be very busy with queues outside so try to get there early in the day for the best experience

Beautiful but overpriced. Beautiful garden. It's a very pretty and worth a visit, I wouldn't go a second time though. Its far from the Medina, so you'd have to pay for a taxi to get there (15 Dhs from Jamaa El Fna is the normal fare, anything more is a ripoff- make sure they use the fare counter). This place is over priced. It has different prices for Moroccans, foreigners living in Morocco, and tourists. If you're Moroccan or a Moroccan Foreign Resident, be prepared to show your Carte National or Carte de Sejour. The price for Moroccans and Moroccan Foreign Residents is 40 Dhs, and 70 Dhs for tourists.

Beautiful perfect gardens. Beautiful place to rest your eyes, they have an Yves St Laurant memorial area to commemorate him as he lived in Morocco for a while. Everything in this garden is well cared for ,and it's clean and very relaxing . a MUSt SEE if you are in Marrakesh.
Botanic Gardens. Gardens were nice and peaceful, not very large though. The Berber museum was quite interesting, but the tearoom was very overpriced
Must see in Marrakech. Beautiful gardens designed by Yves St Laurent - lots of water and bamboo and exotic cacti all surrounded by Majorelle blue painted walls - also delicious food in cafe on site.

A wonderful 'Cool' Oasis. These gardens are wonderful and when you get in the sudden drop in temperature is very very pleasant after Q ing in the sun outside. Nice small museum and overall the whole place is very nice, but when we were there it was very busy and did not lend itself to the relaxing experience I think the designer intended. On of these 'Must Do's' but I would not bother again
Average. Small garden compared to others i have seen. Cafe is good. Boutique is expensive. Would have been better if a museum of YSL works or workplace is put on display.
underwhelming. Do yourself a favor and skip this little trap..it took us 10 minutes to walk through it and we were board.

Visit the Berber Museum whilst here. We went on Easter Sunday and it was heaving, but at quieter times of year it would be magical. We also bought tickets for the Berber Museum which is in YSL's house in the gardens. This was also fantastic and extremely interesting, a very well designed little museum.
The dullest, ugliest garden I have ever been to. We paid 7 euro each to visit. It was tiny and only filled with trees and plants. Not much information to read. Don't bother going.
Nice garden, amazing colors!. Lovely garden with well appreciated shades. Expected it to be bigger for longer wanders in the garden.

Amazing garden but don't expect to be alone. What a beautiful place. Planted Mainly with cacti and bamboo with some stunning flowering plants also. Thought we heard strange birdsong but realised it was frogs in one of the many pools. Good for a couple of hours visit if you include lunch. Pretty good restaurant, enjoyed the meatball tagine.

Beautiful oasis. A lovely place to visit, particularly if you're interested in gardening. The Majorelle blue of the buildings and pottery is stunning.
Didn't have time to visit the Berber museum but heard it is worth the visit if you're in the gardens.
Nice little garden and museum, nothing too special though. Expect to spend about 1-2 hours for the garden and the museum. It's a bit far from the main square though.
Nice little garden. It is a little nice garden to see the typical vegetation of these deserts regions. Around 6 euros the entree fee, it takes no more than 30 minutes to visit it all.

Beautiful garden but..... We wanted to see his house, but that was not possible. That was a disappointment. And there was not enough indormation about yves saint laurent.... That we missed. The cafe was ok.

Beautiful!. Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful garden that is adding a twist to the peculiar sightseeings of Marrakech. If you spend a few days in the old medina of Marrakesh and immersed yourself in the old soak, I highly recommend that you visit Jardin Majorelle because it will give you a clear contrast to the nature of the polluted air of the medina.

Very rude staff. The garden is lovely, if a bit out of the way if you're staying in the Medina. The museum is a highlight, if you go to the garden, don't skip the museum. That being said, the woman selling tickets was one of the rudest people I have ever encountered while traveling. She was talking on her personal cell phone the entire time, meaning it took us 5 minutes just to get her to sell us two tickets. Given that only one ticket window was open, this woman's personal call meant we had to wait 30 minutes in line to enter the garden. Worst of all, the garden's website clearly lists a discounted entrance fee for employees of NGOs. We pulled up the webpage to show the woman, but she was too busy on her personal call to look at it. She just kept shaking her head and talking away to her friend. Unbelievable.

Tranquil. This is a must visit to experience the lovely tranquil and cool environment away from the city bustle. The gardens are well laid out with various bamboos, cacti, flowers etc as well as cooling water features. There is an option to visit the museum which we didn't take due to the time of day we visited but we did stop at the restaurant for a cup of coffee. We travelled there by one of the horse coaches and took a taxi back to the main square.
Beautiful but overpriced. Well worth the visit, but compared to entrance prices of other attractions this felt overpriced at 70dr

Green space in the city. I loved the peace of mind you can get here. It is a green spot in the middle of brown Marrakech but it does not become too humid. It is a wonderful garden with lovely fountains all very well designed by Yves Saint Laurent

Unbelievable . I was amazed when I visited this place! Unfortunately it was a raining day, but because of the big palms and all kind of trees we didn't felt the rain. Is an amazing place, very fancy, you feel as well the fashion history. You can find a museum inside the gardens, some coffee shops and restaurants with a very warm view. There is a huge plant variety and in between all this amazing flowers you find a memorial stone of YSL. Jardin Majorelle is a must in Marrakech

Inspiration through nature. The Jardin Majorelle is an absolute must see attraction in Marrakech. The gardens were an easy walk from our Riad in the medina however the traffic is not so easy to navigate. Once in the gardens you are in a different world of calm colour water and stunning planting aspects of exotic flora and fauna. Take time to take mint tea in the quiet cafe.Explore the museum to see the beauty of the Burka culture costumes and jewellry which will inspire you to buy in the souk.Yves St Laurent could not fail to be inspired and neither will you.

If in town....worth a visit. It can get very busy, so plan your visit. Probably best to go early in the morning to avoid the crowds. It is most definitely worth a visit to wander around this calm oasis in the middle of one of the maddest cities in the world.We walked there and back from the medina where we were staying. But needles to say there are the usual billion taxi drivers haggling you for a ride. Certainly one of the highlights of marrakech, but go early to really enjoy it.
Worth to see but expensive . It's a really little garden with a lot unique plants , it's cool inside for photoshoot but the ticket price is shocking expensive.

Tranquil and beautiful. Beautiful architecture and garden. A lovely place to visit for an hour or so - not huge but a lovely and reasonably priced cafe to relax in. The Berber museum inside the house is small but beautifully curated and well worth visiting. Nice shop opposite the gardens too. Can get crowded with bus tours and watch out for taxi drivers over-charging outside!
ok. This place could be so much more than it is. In need of some maintenance and care and more info would be great.

Blues, yellows, lovely . A small but beautiful garden full of photo opportunities, though it can take a while to wait for a clear shot. The Berber museum is also small but very interesting, with English and Arabic information sheets available if you can't read French.The café is pricey, but we had a delicious lunch there. Overall, a gorgeous place to while away a couple of hours.

Not quite worth it. It's cool, calm and relaxing. Especially in comparison with the surrounding city, but I am not sure it was quite worth the entrance fee. It's not very big, and unless you find Mr YSL particularly interesting I am not sure what the fuss was all about. The coffee was good though :)

Small but a beautiful garden. Our last stop in Marrakech, but well worth it.Charges 70dh as entry free and has different timings for summer/winter and Ramadan.Spend about 1 to 1.5 hours in the garden admiring the different species of the plants. Has a small pond in the centre of the lake where one can see a cute little turtles and frogs.The visit was time well spent.

I had higher exoectations. Maybe our mistake was staying at la Mamounia, for the gardens there are definitely superior. We found it quaint and pretty but frankly I had higher expectations. What we enjoyed most, and they charge separately for, is the Berber Museum at the transformed Jacques Majorelle's old painter studio. Pierre Bergè (Yves Saint-Laurent's partner) amassed a greatly curated small collection of Berber items. Gathered during stays at the "home away from home" in Morocco. The room with the jewelry display is quite something. The cafe seemed nice, but we did not stay. Maybe we should have, as its in a pretty courtyard.
Beautiful . Must visit this garden and museum! Its beautiful and relaxing, so many different things to see, the house, the colours the different plants and trees
mainly cacti & palms - not much colour. a pleasant visit, allow less than hour, it is away from the old city, Ives Saint Laurant is the draw here.

Nice but nothing exciting. The garden has mainly two areas: the desert-like plants such as cactus and the bamboo gardens. You can see some other plants on the way. The garden is nice and peaceful; nevertheless I think is overpriced for what you see. .. It is just the name of the garden what attracts, but nothing impressive or to be remembered. Just a tick on your checklist.

Nice place. There's not much to do in Marrakesh so this could be a good place to visit and spend some of your time doing something.The decoration is nice and there's a museum with some interesting stuff .Good to go with family and there's a restaurant with good and typical food .

Beautiful . Beautiful jardin, Defo a must see and if you like selfies great for taking pics. Only costs 70 dhirims to see garden and double if you want to see museum. Might need to queue for a while as it is a busy place with lots of tourists.

The Most Beautiful Garden I have ever seen. Les Jardins de Majored are the cleanest and most amazing private garden I have ever seen. It is maintained by 70 gardeners and that is visible and totally unique.
Get there with your best book and read it in silence and peaceful ambience for as long as you would need

A visit to Jardin Majorelle. A little piece of heaven....
A must see in Marrakech....the colours are incredible....pay the 30dirhams to and have a peek in the museum....this is a private collection.
Amazing Gardens. Lovely tranquil gardens. Great picture opportunities and the food at the cafe is lovely! A nice break from the centre of Marrakech.
Beautiful!. Despite of the many tourists, the Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful place to visit in Marrakech! The garden is so quiet and beautiful! Must-see Place in Marrakech!

Day visit. Beautiful gardens, ideal getaway from the heat in summertime as large bamboos & trees giving shade & coolness. Strong blues, oranges & lemons in colour scheme. Lovely courtyard cafe offering drinks & good quality reasonable meals. Great display of cacti & ponds with goldfish & turtles.

Beautiful garden oasis.. The Jardin Marjorelle is a great morning activity! great escape from the heat and hustle of the medina. We spent at least 2 hours wandering amongst the palms and cacti. Very tranquil and great spot for photos.
Small garden nicely maintained. The garden was much smaller than we expected and consisted mainly of bamboo. A stroll is nice but for the size I find it kind of overpricced

Beautiful with lots of shade!. This garden is amazing. Lots of cactus and trees so it is nice and shady. The Berber museum in the garden is worth a visit too. You have to pay an additional fee when purchasing your ticket but if you are interested in Berber culture, the museum has a small but good collection and it is explained in English, French, and Arabic. Big Tip: go as close to opening (8:00 am) as you can because the later in the day it gets the more crowded it gets. You will stand in line to buy tickets and there will be so many people wandering around that it may mar your views and enjoyment. The line will form for the museum as well. You can not visit the home but there is a bookshop, giftshop, and cafe on site.

Beautiful gardens in the midst of bustling Marrakech . Went here during Easter stay in Marrakech based on top rated attractions of the city and the fact it was the residence of the late Yves Sant Laurent. The gardens are truly beautiful and largely under shade which makes for a really pleasant visit. You could easily spend a couple of hours here (especially if you go with your partner armed with a camera). The variety of different plants would also make it a real treat for any horticulturalist and the ponds and water features give the place a really serene feel despite heavy tourist traffic. For this reason an early morning visit is definitely recommended as well as to avoid the long queues to get in. Also on site is a cafe (didn't go in but the location and tourist clientele indicates it would probably be a bit expensive relative to local standards) as well as a small museum of Berber heritage. This costs extra to get in but is definitely worth it and was the best part of the visit. Inside you will find all sorts of items associated with Berber culture from fabrics and textiles, jewellery, musical instruments, decorative daggers and even blood-letting devices. Exhibit information plaques are all in French but you can pick up laminated cards with all the information on in other languages. Photography is not allowed in the museum itself (which is a real shame) and it's probably advisable to respect this rule as the small size of the rooms plus the fact there are attentive guards stationed in every one means you would easily get caught. Also note that the actual house of YSL is not accessible. It is possible to walk to the gardens from the Medina and it takes about 45 minutes to an hour (you will need a map). Otherwise a chartered tour bus or taxi is probably your only option, just make sure you agree on a price BEFORE getting in the latter. Overall definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful garden but overpriced and crowded. Nice place to relax on a bench, and take beautiful pictures. There are obviously many tourists and it is a quite small garden.. The entrance is approx 7 euro and that does not include entrance to the museum.
Magic Blue. A must for every visitor of Marrakesh. Go early before the crowds, wonder of in the magical garden, get educated at the museum and enjoy breakfast in the cafe.

Beautiful gardens and conservatory. The gardens are primarily high bamboos, Bougainvilleas cacti etc. With picturesque ponds.
The best part is the cafe with the conservatory which is lovely early 20th century architecture as well as the museum of Berber history.

Quick break from busy marrakech. Walked through the gardens in the middle of the afternoon. Took only 20 minutes plus about 10 minute wait in line to buy tickets. A bit smaller than I imagined and maybe a bit overpriced at 70 dh per person. Nice peaceful walk if you want a break from the heat and noise of Marrakech.

Not worth the price. Very crowded and very expensive for what it is worth.
WIll not recommend it if you only have a few days or have a limited budget.
Beautiful. An area of beauty and tranquility in a bustling city - definitely worth a trip here. Not very big, but lovely to spend a bit of time relaxing and taking photos.
Beautiful . Lovely place to while away an hour in Marrakech. Beautiful bright colours and many a picture opportunity. The museum was good too. 100 mad for both so €10 or £7
Good experience . Good experience. Plenty of benches under shades of tall bamboo trees to sit. Recommend to reserve for for afternoon, beware of long cues

Lovely break from the madness. A quick taxi ride to the outskirts of the old city, jardin majorelle is a lovely place to spend an hour or two. The planting is impressive, and the flashes of colour from the brightly painted pots really enhance them.
The cafe is a nice place to sit and relax before getting back to the crazy place that is Marrakech.

This blue..!. Very nice garden! Nice colours! The garden with the cactus is very impressive. This was the house of the painter Majorelle. I suggest you to go there early in the morning to avoid the crowd. Its something different although I feel it is a bit overpriced for a garden.
Beautiful. Lovely to visit. Vivid colours and a wonderful fountain. Cost about £6 each but was definitely worth it.
Very pretty. nice garden with pretty and shaded walkway, worth a visit! Nicely designed and upkept, museum is also worth a visit!

Beautiful gardens. Amazing place with a variety of different plants and colours, a real treat while in Marrakech to enjoy some peace and quiet away from Medina - however try to go early in the morning as we went at around 12pm (we walked there from the main square which as a bad idea in the heat) and it was really busy with tourist groups which meant waiting for about 45mins to get in and then not being able to enjoy the gardens as much as it was really busy inside with everybody trying to get photos as if it was a big photoshoot. Entry fee is higher than most sights, but it is worth it in my opinion. Students get a discount too (show your student card)! A really well kept Berber museum is inside the gardens which is also worth visiting. A must-see when in Marrakech!

peaceful and pretty. took a horse carriage ride there from the square then spent more time than expected exploring the paths, pools and plants of the garden. there was also a museum and cafe but we did not go ito either.
unexpectedly a fabulous museum on Berber livelihoods. oasis of green and art in the city, you will be rewarded if you get up early to avoid the crowds, lovely Berber museum
Wonderful gardens. This was one of the highlights of the trip. Gorgeous gardens. Large varieties of plants especially cacti. Nice but very pricey gift shop.
Beautiful Garden - A must see in Marrakech. This park is really beautiful and a must see in Marrakech.It also contains a museum about the Berbers, which is also worth to see.
Worth a visit. Beautiful gardens in the middle of a city -definitely worth a look. Be aware there may be queues. Beautiful colours and flowers. Relaxing and peaceful

Blue wonder. Tranquil garden within the noise and bustle of the city. Located just outside the city wall easily walk able by following the city walls and gate. Beautiful YSL building with tropical plants, gardens and memorial to wander, sit and admire taking in the fauna and colours that in the bright sun play with your senses. A lovely place to sit unwind and relax whilst the busy city carries on around you.

Spectacular garden and wonderful little museum. Gardeners and non-gardeners will love this beautiful little oasis in the newer part of Marrakech. The connection with Yves Saint Laurent is obviously very important but a lack of interest in fashion will not detract from the enjoyment of this wonderful garden.Don't stint on the 10 dirhams extra for visiting the small Berber museum as it is probably one of the best introductions to Berber history and culture you'll find in Morocco.

Nice but is it worth the fee?. A beautiful garden with lovely colours and exciting cacti. However, the entrance fee is about €7, which we found quite a lot for a small garden. There was also a long queue to get in (about 15 minutes), and the amount of people inside made it more like a tour of a site rather than a calm stroll in a garden. If you have the time and the money to do it, why not, but would not be my number one pick for Marrakech.
Beautiful and inspirational. The garden was busy but for all that it was a place of much peace and beauty as well. a must go to place for any plants person !
Nice . Nice garden. Wonderful maison and very good looking bar inside.. However the price 4 tourist is very high compared to what you can see: nice grass plants & stop

Beautiful, peaceful small garden with many tourists. The garden was beautiful and amazingly peaceful considering how many tourists were there. Went at 11am on a Saturday and waited almost 40 minutes in line to get in. Purchased both a garden and museum pass, but couldn't afford the time to wait in another line to get in to the museum. The garden is small, but beautiful and can easily be seen in under an hour.

Beautiful little space. The gardens are stunning, very inspiring. Easy to do and walk around during the afternoon on weekdays. Outside the museum you can find nice shops with some contemporary looks of Moroccan style.

Ok but too many people. The gardens themselves are beautiful as is the house- that blue!- but the experience is somewhat subverted by the sheer volume of tourists. Nothing peaceful or sentence about a bunch of selfie loving 20-somethings sadly. The shop has some wonderful albeit pricy blankets scarves and clothing that I couldn't resist-oops. A taxi from the medina shouldn't be more than 20 D.
Beautifully tranquil . Well worth a visit, lovely peaceful gardens and excellent museum. Would advise going early as gets busy and isn't very large.

A little haven. We intended to visit early in the morning just as other reviews had recommended... However we didn't make it until lunch time! It really didn't matter. There was a couple of minutes of queuing and we were straight in. We were immediately struck by the colours and density of the trees and flowers. It was quite unexpected. Couple this with colourful woodwork and pots, decorative water features that housed a variety of wildlife, a library, a gift shop, cafe and museum and suddenly the entrance price seems altogether reasonable. Overall review- absolutely worth it.

A nice get away from the madness of the medina but a little disappointing. A trip to the gardens is a welcome change from the madness of the medina - but don't expect too much.The gardens themselves are not very large and I wouldn't say they are the most interesting gardens I have seen before, but it was a nice change from the chaos of the souks.The 70dirham entrance fee does seem a little steep for what you get, so if you aren't a massive fan of different types of cactuses and probably what I can say is the most underwhelming memorial to someone (Yves San Laurent)- I would suggest you save your money up and put it towards a massage or Hammam!

Average garden. For a garden it is pretty standard, but I have to say it is quite refreshing to visit a garden after the hussle and bustle of the souks. It is most well known as the place which holds a memorial for YSL. Generally a peaceful trip where you can enjoy nature, especially with the wide range of cactai
Lovely little haven. Not the biggest place in the world but well worth an hours walk around. Such beautiful scenery and so peaceful. There was also a nice little cafe within the gardens.
All women family birthday trip. Beautiful and not to be missed--the landscaping and garden updated by Yves St Laurent and partner Pierre Berge is exquisite.
Peaceful ......worth a short visit. Great for an hour or two. A bit a queue to get in but worth it. Not masses to keep the kids amused but they enjoyed spotting frogs and Terrapins in the ponds.

Stunning Marrakech Oasis. Walking through Jardin Majorelle is tranquility in the midst of the Marrakech hustle. A stark contrast to the arid, sun-bleached walls of the city. The Berber Museum is a great pre-Atlas Mountain trip quick bit of history to take in. Thanks to the artists Marjorelle, Saint-Laurent, and his partner for sharing this beauty with the public.

An oasis. Lovely to see the gardens an the tranquile mood it sets you in.
The museum is great. More important than the gardens

Beautiful gardens . Visited as a group of 8. We queued outside for about 10 minutes to get in. It was 70dirhams for the gardens and 30dirhams for the museum. We just did the gardens. There were alot of beautiful flowers especially cactus. There were some great water features. Lovely bright colors. It was great to have a bit of calm in a busy city.

An island of tranquility. Yves certainly had taste. The Garden is an island of tranquility in Marrakech. The exterior of the house is bold and exciting and I personally found the exhibits inside very interesting. Well worth the trip out and the admission.

Loved it!. Very nice and quite place to visit. It is a great place to relax. I loved the colors! You can eat there, there is a museum as a memorial for Yves Saint Laurent. Entrance is 70 dirham for tourists and 40 dirham for Morrocan citizens Advice: do not pay more than 30 dirham to go by taxi from jmaa el fna to the garden (and that is even too much!!) We went to Ourika for 30 dirham per person which was a 1 hour ride with the taxi (a local fixed it for us). There was a small stand outside of jardin majorelle that arranged balloon flights. Cannot remember the company's name but it was 165 euro's per person.If you do not like nature, do not go.

Don't miss the Majorelle Garden whilst your stay in Marrakech. Wonderful Majorelle Garden.A place with soul and history. Don't miss the Berber Art Museum inside the garden, created by Pierre Bergé.A must see place !
Very cool!. Very cool place to visit in Marrakech! It can be a good excuse to exit from the chaos of Medina and take some refreshness and relax in a super nice Jardin!
Brilliant. Loved this place. Use of colours really fantastic. Beautifully laid out and very exotic. Worth visiting. YSL memorial very good. Would strongly recommend this place. Very inspiring
amazing garden in Marrakesh. This definitely is a don't miss sightseeing place if you are traveling to Marrakesh, I absolutely loved it!

AMAZING. Visited the gardens while on holiday in Marrakech. They absolutely beautiful and i managed to kale some great instagrams! Tickets are too expensive and they have a gift shop for souvenirs. Would highly recommend.

Beautiful Gardens. We left the old city in a Horse drawn carriage with was very different and relaxing, toured the new city, after leaving the old city it is a different world, The gardens were beautiful, very well kept with lots of different species of Cycads and palms which we grow in our gardens in SA so maybe for someone who has not seen so many it will be interesting. It is worth a visit.

Mesmerised. Don't go to Marrakesh without visiting this exquisite place.The beauty and tranquility of this garden brought real tears to my eyes as I entered the gates into a weaving walkway through giant bamboo. There is a photo to be had at every turn.No wonder it was made for an artist. It is quite spiritual in it's aura. YSL restored it in the 80's and it oozes style and charm. Magical. The restaurant was very good too although expensive. There is a good bookshop and quality gift shop too.

Very Tranquil. This was a very Beautiful Garden that you can just sit and relax in all day if you choose. You can see everything in about 30 minutes or less but I could just sit on the bench all day if I had the time

Beautiful place to visit. The gardens are very beautiful, though I was surprised by how small it was overall (expected something much more expansive). It was also very hot that day so we tried to find shade as much as possible and didn't stay too long walking around. Lovely for taking photos though. The majorelle blue color which is throughout the gardens is in great contrast to the many different plants. There is a cafe at the gardens so you can relax/cool off (shade and misters), nice selection of snacks and juices though a little expensive.Cost 70dh to enter, though they only charged us 50dh possibly because it was 3:30 when we arrived and the garden closed at 5p.
Nice to do on a good day. Nice place to escape the souks and walk around garden. Museum was small but interesting. Cafe served a very nice lunch outside.
Absolutely Stunning.. Beautiful and relaxing gardens.Chic and French.Really quite unique.Nice restaurant in the gardens for lunch.Only negative is you may have to queue to get on.
Magic memories. Stunning day trip with my mother. Tranquil setting. Breathtaking plants and landscapes. Well worth it.
Peaceful and beautiful. Berber museum was fascinating, the gardens were fantastically manicured and we have never seen such large cacti. Tea in the cafe was tranquil and relaxing

Very beautiful garden. The garden is not very big, but it is interesting. Beautifully planted plants along the walkways, a small pond with Fantan. Seen time about 1 hours, if you don't stay in the coffee. You must to visited that.

Colourful park. Beautiful attraction in Marrakech. It is worth visiting both the garden and the Berber Museum which is inside! One of the rooms in the museum is absolutely stunning (if you go, you will see what I mean!).
Oasis. Beautiful garden With nice gift shop and cafe, mostly cactus varieties, tranquil , and shady areas from the sun , 30 minutes unless you go to cafe

a nice walk, colorful and wonderful tribute. we spent about 45 minutes walking around and reflecting on the beauty and life that was Yves Saint Laurent. did not go into the museum. large crowd prevented a series of amazing photo opportunities, however the day was greet.

Beautiful gardens, peaceful pause. The gardens were gorgeous! Beautifully maintained and a nice break from busy Marrakech. The Berber Museum was very small but had lots of information, beautiful jewelry and traditional Berber costumes. No pictures allowed inside the museum. The Yves Saint Laurent Love Gallery was a tiny corner with interesting pictures from YSL's past; tiny gift shop but unique items.

Smaller than I thought, but very pretty!. The garden turned out to be quite small, but it's certainly very chic and holds a lot of diverse species of plants. The entire garden is like a carefully curated museum, which pleases the eye. The entrance fees (70 dirhams) was quite expensive compared to the other attractions in Marrakech, but it was good to know that it's going to a good cause.
Best garden in Marrakech . My favorite part was the bamboo woods. I never ever imagined that my first meeting will be here. Good place to chill out!
An oasis in the city . Well kept gardens with lots of cactus. The Berber museum is very interesting and beautiful.Yves Saint Laurent memorial and cafeteria inside.
Beautiful oasis. Small but beautiful. A lovely place to spend an hour or two and good food in the cafe. Lots of photos to be taken and I had no idea there were that many types of cactus!

Ok but go early to avoid crowds!. Went this morning and we were a bit dissapointed. The gardens are pretty but there's nothing amazing, we were in and out in 15 minutes not including the 30 minute que to get in. If you are a keen gardener, go but if not, it's a pleasant time filler not essential.
Lovely garden, small but stunning.. totally worth going, small garden but very well kept, lively colors and very peaceful. Long line to get in but it goes fast.

Small and overpriced. The 70dh entry fee seemed a lot for such a small garden! There are so many gardens on Marrakech which are free to go into and offer a peaceful haven from the city, that they make the Jardin Majorelle seem overpriced! The high visitor volume also means that the garden is not as relaxing as you would expect.
Something to do. The Majorelle Gardens was nice retreat from the Medina. I didn't find it spectacular but it was nice.

Beautiful gardens. Green oasis with a great variety of plants and trees from all over the world. Major tourist attraction away from the main square , expect plenty of people taking selfies all over the place. We have walked there and it took about 40 minutes. The place is not big but very lovely and we spent a lot of time there just sitting and enjoying the birds singing and plush vegetation. We have taken a horse carriage back to the main square, managed to bring the price down to 100 dhm, the ride was well worth it!

A beautiful setting. We walked to this garden from the Riad and it is a magnificent hideaway. The garden is a beautiful juxtaposition of desert and other plants to create a peaceful setting. And the museum is very well done.
FANTASTIC!. Amazing Garden and stunning Museum! Must be seen if you're in Marrakech!Thanks to Louis Majorelle and Yes Saint Laurent!

Peraceful gardens and super interesting museum!. The gardens were pleasant enough with a lot of palm trees, cactae and exotic plants but for us the real highlight was the Berber museum - a real insight into the culture, clothing and jewellery of the Berber people across the whole of Morocco

Good but not amazing. I think we paid 70dh (over £4), which is expensive for what is a very small attraction. Not as peaceful as reviews suggest due to the amount of other visitors. Still worth a visit but not 5 stars like a lot have put.

Nice place for photographers, naturfriends and cultural interested. Most people can be glad that this house was restored. The park is calming and nice to chill down while you see in the museum many information about the history of this city and country. It's for sure worth the money but if you miss it it's no tragedy.

Beautiful gem . Gorgeous garden is an oasis in Marrakech. Not very big, but everything about it is striking. The bamboo, cacti, abundant flowering trees, and the intense blue walls. Make sure you visit the Berber Museum while inside. Spectacular exhibits on Berber culture. The outdoor cafe is nice as well.

Stunning colours. We got the bus from our hotel and saw the signs for the jardin majorelle so asked our driver to let us off. The place was well signposted and stalls nearby offered free maps. Once inside the gardens were well laid out and easy accessed. A bit on the compact side but beautiful colours especially the blues and golds. Not expensive so a nice morning out.

Do not miss this!. Not only are the gardens beautiful, the museum showcasing the native jewelry and costumes is gorgeous! Do NOT miss it! There are also some nice boutique shops on the street leading up to the gardens.

Tranquil Gardens. This Garden is a must see if you are visiting Marrakech, we got there by horse and cart which was a fab way to travel, The cost of entry was very reasonable and we spent a good 45 mins looking round the garden and the museum,
Was ok. Pretty garden if you have some free time, wouldn't go out of your way to go and see it. Some interesting facts in the brochure about YSL

Beautiful garden retreat. If you appreciate landscaped gardens with collections of rare and unusual cacti then this is an ideal place to visit. The party I visited with all valved the grandeur of the gardens and design. Despite the crowds, it is always busy, there was an over riding sense of tranquility to the place and it felt cooler than the heat experienced in the centre. In addition to the gardens, there is also a small cultural museum which again we felt was interesting. We didn't eat in the cafe, though it looked nice from the outside. We did visit the shop, however, the items for sale were expensive.Tip: Get there early if you can and expect to queue.

An oasis of blue in Marrakech. If you have a few hours layover or need to get out of the buzzing Marrakech don't miss out this beautiful garden when in Marrakech. Yves St-Laurent's garden is quite a refreshing escapade in the heat of Marrrakech.

Breathtaking. Be warned, there is a bit of a queue to get in, though this moves quickly. It will cost 50Dh or so to get in but it is worth it. Simply a wonderful place to lose yourself and become immersed by the beautiful garden. Definitely go!

Oasis of calm. Beautiful gardens hidden amongst the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. Worth buying some of the trademark blue paint for a quiet corner of your garden back home where you can remind youself of your holiday!Definitely worth getting there as it opens before the bus loads arrive.
Gardens. I enjoyed seeing these unique gardens and the beautiful colors. The gardens are small so easily done in an hour or two

More like a Japanese garden. Its something you have to go to when in Marrakech but honestly its not worth it. The cost was cheap but it wasn't anything extraordinary and you have to go early as there are lines to get in.

Beautiful. This garden is simply magnificent, it is a safe heaven, the trees and the flowers are beautiful, we were able to visit Yves Saint Laurent Memorial and it was incredible to see why such a famous person was loving Marrakesh, it was crowded but the wait was really worth it.

Not much to see!. Part of the tourist route was our stop at Jardin Majorelle.
After queueing for around 30 minutes we were disappointed with what was on offer inside.
Took about 15 minutes to walk around and there wasn't much to see. Some beautiful colours but there are plenty of these colours around marrakech for free.
Glorious colour. Beautiful place with an assortment of cacti. The art deco villa of ysl is lovely. Go there in the midday sun and watch the colours come alive. Great museum and boutique too.

Place always to see. It is the place to visit, YSL and Mr Berger have done a paradise place and it is wonderful to be able to share this Fabulous garden for its trees, flowers,color,basin, just visit during you trip in Marrakesh.

Calm Oasis in the City. A visit to Jardin Majorelle was a wonderful way to spend an hour or so and retreat from the noise and chaos of the city. The gardens were well designed; plants were well marked; and the mix of greenery and colorful blooming plants was beautiful. Intense cobalt blue was used as an accent color around certain walkways, on large pots, etc and created a stunning visual effect throughout the gardens. Definitely worth a visit!

Jardin Jewel. This enchanted garden is truly unique.Garden connoisseurs will be seduced by the design and presentation of the garden and its contrasting zones of towering green bamboos, to gritty cactus garden.The garden holds a collection of buildings and planters and architectural features "popping" with neon blues, yellows and oranges that capture and radiate light.The Berber museum in the grounds is extremely well curated and has a terrific cultural collection of the Berber Culture that is definitely worth seeing.Allow enough time here to enjoy both the garden and the museum.We walked to the gardens from the Medina and enjoyed a stop for lunch en route at the lovely Amal restaurant which is also in the neighbourhood.
A totally wonderful experience. Third time and still a pleasure. The day was overcast, but the colours were very vibrant and such a peaceful place.

beautiful cactus gardens, fantastic small Berber heritage museum. very pretty garden in new part of Marrakech laid out by a French painter who came here and loved it so much he stayed, then bought by YSL who built small museum to highlight Berner tradition, jewellery and costume. Fairly pricy, but well worth seeing, and museum is well lit with excellent info. Nice cafe.

Great history, but expensive and poorly maintained. I love the history of this place but to be honest the reality wasn't that for me. By Moroccan standards it's expensive, it's very crowded and the gardens - if they we're ever great - are now maintained to a bare minimum standard that I can't see impressing anyone. There 3 dozen roads that offer more romance and excitement than this spot.
Best thing in Marrakesch. Exotic species, lovely gift shop and charming cafe.Don't miss it!A tribute to the creativity and genius of Yves St. Laurent and his partner
Peaceful and beautiful. A welcome escape from all the hustle and bustle of the main city. The colours are amazing in the early evening light.

fanntastic place. worth a visit. beautiful gardens. peaceful. the cafe is also good. nice chantilly chocolate
the museum was amazing

lovely garden. very nice and airy place. Nice to get away from the hustle of central Marrakech.
Avoid taxis outside, total rip off. Go to nearest busy street instead and flag a taxi down instead. Lots of nice shops and restaurants nearby.

Fine gardens: very much worth a visit. We visited these gardens on a beautiful sunny day and were very impressed. They are, as one might expect given their history, beautifully designed and we spent over three hours there, including having a nice lunch in the gardens cafe.
Throughly recommended.
Ok though very small!. Beautiful gardens though significantly smaller than expected! You could walk around the gardens and see it all in 15 minutes!

Four Friends Travel to Marrakesh - Riad Moullaoud. really lovely tranquil place ...well worth a visit.
You would not believe that you were in the middle of a bustling Marrakesh !!

A colourful little oasis.. After a rainy few days we finally managed to get to the gardens in the sunshine. The queue was about 50m long but it moved quite well. It is entirely your own choice to do a whistle stop tour or linger and look out for little gems of vistas to enjoy. The cafe served a small but quality menu and you can use cards and free wifi if needed, taxi back to centre of town is about 20dh more expensive from the rank outside the gate but very convenient when the rain returned!
Peaceful and tranquil. This is a retreat away from the noise and busyness of Marrakesh. Beautiful cacti gardens bordered by bold colours, although not large this is worth seeing.

Touristic and expensive garden. We only visited the garden but were rather dissapointed by how crowded it was. Considering the price (almost 7€), the garden is very small and is located in considerable distance from the Medina. For people who are not outspoken fans of Ives Saint Laurent, we would not recomment it.
Very nice, worth to go. The price scary at the beginning but once you are inside is definitely worth the price. I loved this garden, a relaxing place in a city with an eternal busy soul.

stepping into Yves Saint Laurent's imagination. A fantastical garden that mixes Middle Eastern and Asian influences together into one enchanting experience. Amazing photo opportunities if you can get around the crowds so try to visit early during the week. Also The Berber Museum inside the garden should not be missed!
Lovely garden. This is a lovely garden and well worth a visit . There is an interesting museum and a restaurant with excellent food .

Beautiful . Really enjoyed the gardens was beautiful! Variety plants and small pond flowing create peaceful surrounding , benches available to sit and admire the scenery. Not very big but totally worth visit! Ticket cost £5
Morning trip. Lovely gardens to stroll around, not expansive but peaceful and colourfull you can also add in the museum which i skipped on this trip.
Beautiful place. Loved it here. Great to visit on a sunny day rather than rainy. Visited with my neice, nephew and mum. They enjoyed it very much.
Overrated and small . Unless you're a cactus lover, this place is not the best recommendations if you are short in time. Yes, there is a great variety of cactus, but is somehow overrated

"Done" but wouldn't go back. It's a really lovely place to see and perhaps even better to visit during the summer. Although, the place is really small and doesn't really offer much. After paying 100 dirhams (garden + museum) I felt I didn't get much for this amount. The museum is ok but nothing special. If you want to learn more about jewellery and what type of clothing Berbers wore then go for it - otherwise it's really small and not that informative and educational. The whole visit took us max 30 min.

Comparing to rest of Morocco..much too expensive. So, I saw 5 places in one day and prices was between 10 to 20 dirhams, but Majorelle it is..70!!!! Not twice..but until 7 times more!!! Exagerate! Majorelle gardens management, you better accord to the neighbours, otherswise comparing to rest of your ciry and interest points..will not worth!And comparing with others, it's not so historical, not so specific Africa-Morocco, so..one point more to lower the price!And if you go, take at list one hour to visit place not like Japs clik-cli and go, or as doorman said 30 minutes!

Beautiful half day at the gardens. We walked from the medina which was a nice walk on a cool morning, though not the prettiest. We enjoyed the gardens, the museum and the gift shop. Then had a tasty (though expensive) lunch in the cafe. Shopping across the street was also very interesting--modern Moroccan designers without the pressure of the souks.
gorgeous... went there for an afternoon..doesnt feel like your in Marrakesh; so peaceful and calm inside. Can probably get it done in 2 hours. The museum is nice with the Berber history etc.

overvalued and expensive. Please go to the garden on the north of Sale. Bigger, better and certainly cheaper. Majorelle has a gruff-looking security guard on almost every corner of the garden and comes as a camp. Museum is nice furnished but not a very appealing collection. I've seen better in Morocco.

Not worth paying . It is a beautiful place but it is small and it does not offer a lot to be seen for 70 DH.It gives the impression you pay for the chic thing related to Yves Saint Laurent (my opinion). Even though they fund young Moroccan students with part of your entrance so...not bad at last.
Oasis in the city. Nice and peaceful oasis in the city! Definitely worth a visit. It's small - won't take long to walk around. The Berber museum inside the garden was so interesting.

Must go. It is not typically Marrakesh, but it is a lovely place for half a day. The building doesn't say much, it is just vibrant colors, but it works so well with the gorgeous gardens. The gardens are so worth the visit. Keep in mind that it is packed with people, so early in the morning on weekdays would be the best time to go for it.
Attractive gardens.. Lovely gardens even though it was a little chilly and trying to rain. Worth paying for entry to the Berber museum
Highlight of our trip. Loved this place so much. A wonderful oasis. Really beautiful. Enjoyed an ice cream in the lovely courtyard cafe too.
Bluest Garden I've seen. Not a big garden fan - so I can't rave too much, but nice enough. Nice YSL designed cards in the shop provide nice mementos.
Tranquility. Well worth a visit the gardens are really peaceful and well looked after. Good quality food available at the cafe.

Beautiful and vibrant . A beautiful garden. I visited the garden quite early on in the day and there was already quite a long queue forming. The ticket was pretty cheap (I only paid for the garden, u also have a museum that you can see). Once inside I was taken aback by the vibrant blues and yellows. A beautiful garden well worth the few pounds I paid to get in... For anyone lookin to go to the gardens I would recommend booking a tour, TripAdvisor has afew deals. They work out much cheaper as you get to visit 2 maybe 3 gardens depending on the tour you book, with a horse and carriage ride too! We paid separately which worked out more expensive. I would add to this activity to my list of places to visit in morocco
Spirit of Saint-Laurent. Beautiful garden, the colors are just mindblowing. Nice little memorial to the designer in a quiet spot. Great shop and cafe as well.
Spectacular. Totally worth a visit. Incredible and inspiring colours. A sanctuary. A stark contrast to the bustling medina.

haute couture gardenshowcase. For it's highly manicured layout, cleanliness, a nice break from the grayish, buzzling city centre, one should give a very good rating.Tripadvisor having only average or very good, I give the former.Cos much as it is impressive with really big cacti garden, the place gives the feeling of a haute couture (laid down by Yves St. Laurent)tight, chic and somehow not sprawling enough for the high turnover of tourists.Visual foci points are so busily photographed one does not get the possibility to contemplate, which should be the real sense of a garden..Lots of shopping possibilities for those who like this sort of thing and the "Majourelle Blue" is a most eyecatching paint but then again,it does not impart the restfulness a garden should when thronged by so many visitors...
Nice for a quick visit. It is a must see attraction, but keep in mind it'll tAke a maximum of 1 hour touring the place.Make sure you go in daytime, to take beautiful pictures
beautiful gardens. lovely gardens well worth a visit for a couple of hours. about £4.50 entrance 70 dirhams half price for students
Must see. Even have lunch at the cafe.... Colors. Colors. Tranquility. A must see. Just to imagine the wild parties and the artistic inspiration... A dream in Marrakech.

Worth a walk from the Medina. The Jardin Majorelle was as expected - terraced walks and pergolas with colourful pots and spiky plants with bamboo and climbing colourful blooms. Full of people, yet peaceful. A nice contrast to the souks.

Brilliant colors!. If you loves colors contrasts this is it. It is a small garden but the flora is fascinating. You will see cactuses you have never seen before. Sit relax at their restaurant and watch people and the sights.

Fantastic garden and Berber Museum. A really beautiful garden with some amazing cacti and a pond with singing frogs! A little oasis among the busy old town. The Berber museum was excellent. In total it took us about 2 hours with time for a drink and snack in the tea room.

Lovely visit, don't miss the museum. It didn't take long to wander through the gardens although they are lovely and peaceful and a nice place to get out of the sun. The Berber museum is beautifully curated and very lovely to visit. I learned a lot there and enjoyed. Be sure to take advantage of the English explanation cards at the beginning of each room so you know what you are viewing.
A Rest in Busy Marrakech. The Jadin was a tranquil rest from the bustle of Marrakech. The museum is a must see for any one interested in Moroccan history.
Fantastic calm in this mad city!!!. I visited here on my own as my husband was unwell. I have to say I felt totally safe a lone female visitor. Beautiful plants Great cafe and shop too. Loved it!!!
Beautiful garden.. And small museum..well worth a visit. Lovely blues to contrast with more arid plants. Go early to avoid crowds.
peaceful and tranquil. stunning gardens by yves st laurent. also includes a berber museum and a beautiful garden cafe for light snacks and pastries

Cool, colourful place. It was a simple garden dedicated to Yves St Laurent as a memorial. The gardens were well maintained and a nice atmosphere to be around. Not much to see other than plants and trees.

Slightly overpriced for what you get.. It's good but not outstanding. Rather smaller than I anticipated. Well maintained gardens. Lots of cactus plants and a water course running through it. I think a bit overpriced but worth visiting none the less.
Beautiful Garden. This garden is extremely beautiful; it is full of colourful flowers, various plants and amazing views. I strongly recommend to give it a visit.

A beautiful oasis in the middle of busy Marrakech. I'm not one for markets so Jardin Majorelle was the highlight of my trip to Marrakech. Not only did the lush greenery offer shelter from the hot sun, the little Love poster gallery was a treat (we couldn't help but go home with postcards of our favourite prints). We also stopped for tea and a bite to eat in the garden café, which was a great spot for a bit of people-watching.

Beautiful garden to visit. Beautiful gardens !! Away from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech these gardens as well as being absolutely fabulous are a haven of peace and tranquillity and a spot to spend at least 3 hours.Not extensive so suitable for a leisurely walk Enjoyed.Beautiful gardens !! Away from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech these gardens as well as being absolutely fabulous are a haven of peace and tranquillity and a spot to spend at least 3 hours.Not extensive so suitable for a leisurely walk (as opposed to a hike).we went there with very informative and knowledgeable guide organized with Toursfrommarrakech. co.uk
A wonderful respite from the city. The beautiful and lush garden is a wonderful respite from the city. This is a great place to relax for a while.

Tranquilla!. Although the gardens aren't very big i's still incredibly easy to get lost in the beauty of it and wonder around marvelling at the majestic nature of it all. It also has a fascinating museum inside. Definitely worth visiting.
Small excellent garden with excellent small museum. Enjoyed the visit. Average Brit will spend less than 45 mins. Beautiful garden with the best museum in Marrakech even though it's tiny.
Colourful gardens a place of quiet and cool in the bustle of Marrakech. Well worth a visit less flora more fauna, ie cactus and bamboo and palm contrast with paintwork of paths and walls interesting.

Peaceful. Was staying in a Riad near Jemaa El Fna and thought walk was fine. Was told 15 mins walk. turned out to be something like half an hour with awful roads to cross. Would certainly recommend taking a taxi. Paths all in a state of being repaired. Also, meeting the usual 'helpful' people that ask you where you are going and point you up in a direction that is away from anything and they tell you the place is closed (just don't get why so many of them do this - just learn to ignore all of them - such a shame - maybe one in 10 would be genuine). Gardens small but very shaded and cool. toilets there and they are clean. Doesn't take long to get around but nice to sit on a bench and relax. A lot of catci areas and a little bamboo area. 70 dirhams to get in which seemed relatively expensive compared to 10 Dirhams for Bahia palace and 20 dirhams for Ben Yousseff house. Little catment area outside with a couple of eating places and smart boutiques. Interesting. Maybe worth a visit on your trip but a little out of the way. I will definitely think about bright blue garden pots in my garden after this visit but a lot of their painting eemed a crude, matte, bright blue and then one area had bright orange and yellow pots with two shades of blue. Not quite so natural although it did seem to be done in some very chalky, matt paint. And, there is a decent toilet to go to. It's nice that the profits go towards a lot of other enterprises.
peaceful haven. This oasis of peace in central Marrakech is worth a visit. Orange blossom ice cream from the cafe is devine too.

A stylish garden in the centre of Marrakesh. We had a lovely day in the gardens, there are so many different species that you dont find in the Northern European countries and I can safely say its a cacti lover's paradise. The dominant colours are blue and yellow and I loved visiting the museum and getting to know a bit more about Yves Saint Laurent and how he decided to "save" the gardens from a disastrous project.A must if you are in Marrakesh!

Beautiful garden, but crowded with tourists. We went on Saturday, which might have been the reason why the garden was so crowded. But there was really way too many people to properly enjoy the place. Otherwise the garden itself is of course very beautiful with a lot of different types of palm trees, cactuses etc.

Beautiful and peaceful. We missed out seeing this on our last visit to Marrakesh back in 2010, wished know we had visited then as well. Don't be put off by the queues which can build quite quickly as they do go down just as quick. The cost of 100 Dirhams each is money well spent to visit this calm blue painted garden oasis. The wonderful paths which lead you around the gardens and the benches dotted around mean you can wander or just sit and take in all the superb planting of trees and succulents in the peace and quiet. If you like photography this is the place to go. The cafe near the exit serve all sorts of drinks and pastries, yes a little more expensive but you are part of a captive audience so go with the flow. When leaving don't take a taxi or a Calesh from the gate walk along to your right and take a calesh at the end of the road. We paid 100 Dirhams about ten euros for our return trip back to the square.

Too much for too little. There's very little to do or see, the garden is mostly a bunch of random flora spaciously placed on the ground, seemingly without much thought. Many of the plants were in a rather sorry state, either not fully grown yet or in the act of dying. There are 3 larger pools of water, one with some fish, another with frogs and turtles in them. The one with the turtles was very dirty. The garden didn't seem so much "wild" as just poorly taken care of.It is a quieter place than most of the rest of Marrakech, with the sound of wind bustling through bamboo trees instead of the annoying mopeds running wild. The downside to that being, there are always a lot of people, tourists and locals alike, even whole school classes, walking around, so even though the noise of the streets doesn't reach you, it's never quiet.In summary I think it's not worth the price of entry or even the time it takes to go there.

Prepare for a Long Queue but Beautiful once inside. We went straight from the airport for 80 dihrams - it was on the Northern side of Marrakesh, outside of the Medina.We didn't expect to see such a long queue and it did feel quite touristy but despite the small size it had a collection of beautiful plants, bright colors and interesting museum with traditional dresses which somehow compensated the waiting time and the fact we had to pay an entrance fee

A small, colorful, beautiful garden. I enjoy walking around this colorful garden and taking pictures. In February there were not many flowers blooming but all the pots and other greenery were fantastic. Do arrive early as it got crowded quickly.

Nice tranquil area. To be honest there are far better gardens in the world but this was a nice place to look around and a very calm area. We were there in March so there were not too many flowers out, however it is mostly a Palm & Cactus garden with some lovely pools. If you have time to spare in Marrakesh it is worth a visit.
