There is a small museum that has a nice selection of Berber artifacts with an information card in each room that you can take which explains the displays in various languages.
Beautiful Gardens. A must stop on your travels in Marrakech. The grounds are captivating and magical. Visit the turtle an frog pond
Great outdoors garden. Very relaxing outdoor garden. Various plants and water features Holds a nice coffee shop Very peaceful and relaxing atmosphere.
Pretty. This delightful garden is well worth a visit. Arrive early to avoid the queues. I found it very calming and tranquil despite the number of people around.
Lovely oasis. Located just outside the medina I would recommend visiting these lovely gardens. Great escape from the craziness of the medina

nice but not more than that. Not a must see in our opinion. No need of a guide at all. You can explore the whole garden in less then 45 minutes. Entrance fee $8Well maintained and clean. Pretty crowded!

Smaller than you'd hope but very good. The garden is tranquil and cool, with wonderful colours. It's not as large as I had imagined, but no matter. The planting is mostly cactus, but rather lovely nonetheless. The Berber Museum is the best curated we'd been to in Marrakech.
Peace in a Garden. This place boasts beautiful colours, Arabic designs, a relaxing tea shop, interesting tasteful things to buy. Lots of photo opportunities.

Pretty... but a bit of a let down.. I was looking forward to visiting this garden because i saw it is one of the top things to do in Marrakesh. But when i got there i felt like it was just a enclosed for a few pretty plants and cactuses. Don't get me wrong i got some very nice pictures here and even bought a nice bag from the gift shop. I didn't visit the museum so (because i didn't have time) maybe that would have been more interesting but all in all it wasn't what i thought it was going to be. I was hoping for a more wow factor. More pretty plants everywhere.I did like the famous Blue colour around everywhere that was nice.

Definitely worth a visit when in Marrakesh. I would recommend this as a half day excursion when you're visiting the city. It's not expensive to get in although it can get very busy peak season. If you've been before then try again at a different time of year as the gardens do change depending on the season

Lovely few hours ..... Cool away from the afternoon sun.. Tranquility and chilled.
Cafe.... Little pricey... Grab an ice cream before you go in.
Didnt see museum.
Baby loved the plants and water and the occasional gold fish.
Beautiful . Burst of colours and serenity with a nice cafe/restaurant. Good place to unwind and escape the hit/sun. Can be crowded hence better in early morning /late afternoon

Safe haven...literally. Marrakech is terrifying and within this garden I actually found beauty and peace. Definitely go there and gather your thoughts...and inner strength to go back outside into the rest of the city.

Rip off. Although the gardens are lovely, they are small and it seems extortionate to charge 70dhm for this compared to 10dhm for most of the spectacular palaces in the medina. Only unless you are a die hard Yves Saint Laurent fan or running out of things to do should you see this. The Berber museum inside is worth the 30dhm extra, very interesting.

Pretty, but best in low season I imagine. We were there in February and Marrakech as a whole was quite quiet. These gardens are lovely, but quite small, so I imagine they could get overcrowded in high seasion.

A must in Marrakech. The gardens are incredibly beautiful and so serene. We spent a very happy couple of hours wondering around the gardens watching the terrapins and the fish. The buildings are beautifully designed and a joy to walk around. Plus the restaurant does fantastic food and tea. Highly recommended
Not worth. We didn't like it. It is very small 5 min to go around. There are other attractions more interesting. I don't understand why is a must for Marakes....
Best place in Marrakech. The gardens are so lovely and have wonderful plants and colors. A place not to be missed in Marrakech!

Oasis of calm. Much smaller thanbi thought bit some beautiful cacti andvplants in this little garden. Lots of places to sit and contemplate in the most peaceful environment. Nice cafe with prices being reasonable.

Incredible colours and plants. Spent a good few hours walking round the gardens and taking pictures, and also visited the berber museum which was very well laid out and had some interesting stuff inside. Gardens start off quite serenely with beautiful brightly coloured pots among the trees, then opens up to the house and ponds in the middle surrounded by all manner of flowering cacti. Watching the terapins and frogs hop in and out of the water was fun.
Great little garden. Great little garden full of colour been back twice now and still love it. Nice cafe where you can get a Nos Nos coffee or traditional mint tea. See Yves Saint Laurent at work.

Fabulous garden and museum. Lovely courtyard restaurant. Really worth a visit. Lovely soup in the slightly over priced but charming restaurant. Gardens are firast class with an emphasis on cactii. Museum worth seeing. Brings the Berber culture alive!
Very cool. I was on a private tour and brought here and was pleasantly surprised. A great blend of indoor artifacts and gardens.

Beautiful, but Smaller than Expected. Walking into the Jardin Majorelle is a special, somewhat dissociative experience. To be surrounded by so much red and then suddenly *bam* green everywhere is jarring. There's a lovely variety of plants and a special density of greenery that lends itself to couples. Probably a great place to propose.
Worth a visit . Beautiful gardens and Berber museum. 5min taxi ride outside Medina but some taxis will wait and do a return journey make sure you agree a price beforehand.
beautiful garden, in the middle of city. Very beautiful garden, located in the city, well maintained, dedicated memorial to Yves saint Laurent charity
Beautiful!!. Possibly the one redeeming feature of Marrakech, beautiful,tranquil and an oasis of calm away from the chaos and filth of the medina and the square.

Tranquil. Lovely garden with a variety of cacti and other plants, which also includes a very interesting small museum on Barber history with a display of traditional costumes and some wonderful photographs. The gardens also include a cafe which we didn't visit as it was very busy and overpriced.

Good attraction. Great place to visit. There is a mesuem here which we did not visit. The garden is spectacular, a little piece and quite from the busy city. Great place to relax in the shade. Can get quite busy - however the pictures are worth it!

relaxing afternoon. I would suggest visiting in the morning to avoid queues. We spent the afternoon there, taking in the warmth and scenery. It was quite busy but somehow still very peaceful. We also enjoyed the lovely court yard cafe (free wifi and great service)
The blue is stunning. It's not a big garden but worth a visit. I would allow 1 - 2 hours & there are a couple of nice shops nearby
Birthday Treat. Gorgeous gardens very tranquil well worth a visit excellent photo opportunities just loved walking around seeing all the different flora
Excellent Place!. It is a lovely garden, good for walking around! Must see location, lovely cafe good mint tea! Would recommend this garden for all ages.

A very unusual garden. Expensive to visit (100 dirhams with the museum) but worth it if your budget can run to it. The garden, though small, is special and different. Was very pleasantly surprised by the content and lay out of the Berber museum.

Very interesting layout and clever use of local plants with colourful pots etc as aprt of the scheme.. The garden is not enormous so walking around is a pleasant stroll. Interesting ( though more expensive shop or 2 ) opposite the entrance . Enjoyed the Berber Museum particularly the display of jewels.
Beautiul. This is a stunningly beautiful haven. It was very relaxing and I loved the Berber museum. The only down side is it's not well sign-posted but once inside, heavenly!

Great Escape from the City. Great escape from the congestion of the city which we found to be peaceful and serene; though lacking vast variety of plants and flowers, this definitely was one of attractions we were surprisingly pleased with.
Definitely a must!

Beautiful gardens!. I'm not into gardens, but Jardin Majorelle was well worth the trip up. they are really well arranged, well thought out and provide a really relaxing experience. Incredible colours on display. A very welcome break from the busy souks in the afternoon! The Berber museum is worth visiting, too.

Rated very good for an odd reason. I found the garden only passably interesting ( maybe because it was winter or maybe because I'm from Southern California so pretty familiar plants) but he Berber Art Museum on site is very good and worth the extra entrance fee. The shop on site, oddly, had the best quality items for sale we saw on our whole trip, including the usual things on offer in Paris, France.

Interesting garden and museum. The most people are visiting these place because of the notoriety of Yves Saint-Laurent and the price of the entry is adapted for this public. What a pity! But it's a positive element to discover the origin of this garden and the the rich culture of this fabulous city of Marrakech

Litlle hidden gem out of medina walls. really nice and calm place. The best time to go there is in the morning before buses and tourists arrives.
There is museum in the garden worth visit.

The YSL Gardens. Nice relaxing morning at Jardin Majorelle - I was surprised at how small the gardens were given they had been recommended by a number of people, an hour is more than enough time to see everything. In saying this it was a peaceful, relaxing hour! The contrast of the majorelle blue and the cactus are picture perfect. Personally I probably liked the YSL exhibition and gift shop just as much as the garden! It's also worthwhile taking a quick detour to the design stores across the road from the entrance to the gardens.

Over-rated. Lovely but over-rated. Great if you are there on a sunny day, nice to walk around and relax but not a highlight. Better gardens at La Mamounia which is free to visit (although you'll feel compelled to have an expensive drink there to soak up the atmosphere but that's better value and experience in my opinion)

YSL Gardens. I payed 70 durham to get in. We only stayed for 30 minutes for the experience was enjoyable. The garden was beautiful, colourful to and perfect for pictures. I would recommend if you go to Marrakech.
Calm place. Very calm and peaceful place to be and should have have been abit more interesting and bigger. It was not worth the time
you nust see YSL jardin Majorelle. lovely garden.I wished the same in my home.So peaceful,these really nice gardens are outside the hustle and bustle of the old town and are nice cool calm place.
Beautiful. A must have visit when in Marrakech, I would advise to arrive early to beat the queues and do not forget your sunglasses and a hat! Beautiful scenery to capture some lovely memories.

Enjoyable afternoon spent. We enjoyed our afternoon mooching round the gardens, there seems to be every type of cactus planted here! The gardens are well maintained. We had a nice snack and coffee here and also enjoyed the museum, which had an extraordinary mirrored room with many historical items inside. A nice relaxing afternoon can be had here.

A peaceful haven. Away from the hustle and bustle of central Marrakech these gardens as well as being absolutely fabulous are a haven of peace and tranquillity and a spot to spend at least 3 hours. Good restaurant but get in early as very popular

Overated Cactus garden. An overrated small garden that has cacti and bamboo inside. A highly overated 'attraction' that will cost 70 MAD - which can well be spent on much better experiences. Extra 30 MAD for the tiny museum. You can see cacti in morocco for free, and in much more impressive surroundings. Maybe only interesting for Yves St Lauren fans.

Great food and a nice vibe. This was like Eden compared to the streets of old town Marrakech :P The food was very nice (and we are foodies so we have tried quite a bit) and the atmosphere very relaxed. A little empty in december though, I think it will have a great backpacker vibe in the peak seasons.
YSL memorial. This lovely garden is situated about 15 minutes drive away from the medina. It's worth visiting if you have a couple of hours free.

YSL gardens, YSL price . These really nice gardens are outside the hustle and bustle of the old town and are a nice cool calm place to visit on a hot day.The entrance fee is a bit pricey considering the size of the gardens but it is worth it. There is also the Berber museum which is interesting but you need reasonable French to understand the descriptions of the displays.Interesting wildlife in the gardens such as families of tortoises and frogs.
Amazing Garden- A must see. Lovely garden. So peaceful. I wished I could have sat at the garden for hours. So beautiful. Recommend it highly to all who come

beautiful gardens. lovely gardens, well kept with nice cafe. Can be very busy at times and best to visit at around midday when the sun gives good light as the large plants and trees give quite heavy cover.
Nice enough . Nice enough garden. some good cacti but nothing magnificent. More popular than perhaps is justified due to the Yves Saint Laurent factor.

Cactus garden in blue and yellow theme . I went there because the name Yves Saint Laurrent . Main is cactus garden . They have many types of desert tree. But the main things thats i like this garden is the color ! They use blue and yellow color ! Its 2tone match !! Recommend to go there. You will have a lots of photos !
Unmissable!. This is a stunning garden and we saw it at the best time - early afternoon - when the light added even more magic to this fabulous creation. Loved it.
Relaxing oasis in upscale area. The perfect antidote to the souks. See a meticulously kept garden formerly owned by Yes St. Laurent. Then wander the nearby beautiful shops afterwards.

An hour is waaaaay too long!. Perhaps we are spoilt in the UK with the outdoor gardens but this garden was nice for 15-20 wander around but we didn't feel it was anything too special and were completely bored after an hour tour.

Landscape Gardeners Dream. Initially a beautiful and calm oasis amid the noise and bust le of Marrakech, the Jardin begins to pale a little as the crowds just keep coming. it would be nice if it were a little bigger, and a little less hectic, but the layout, the museum and the feeling of strangeness ( in a nice way,) combine to make this a rewarding and interesting experience.Enjoyed but didn't finally get the must-see -again factor so many of the reviews hint at.

Small gardens. Worth visiting these gardens and interesting little museum. Gardens are architurally striking and beautiful. Not extensive so suitable for a leisurely walk (as opposed to a hike). Enjoyed.
Incroyable. Beautiful gardens ! Get there early in the morning to avoid crowds. Beautiful array of cacti. The Berber museum is worth going to, and contains some beautiful jewellery.

Beautiful and tranquil. A lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The cafe / restaurant was charming, the museum small but packed with beautiful displays of Berber life and history and the gardens peaceful with a fantastic array of cacti.

A nice place to relax. No doubt this is a lovely garden with lots of gorgeous plants and foliage from all around the world. It is a superb place to come to relax if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the souks and main square. There's no one trying to sell you things in here, just tourists and plants (and a few nice water features).Is it really the #1 thing to do in Marrakech? I'm not sure, but it certainly is worth a visit while you're here.
A quiet retreat. The gardens are interesting and well worth the effort to visit. A unique history is portrayed in photos and the gift shop is a must stop.

Went with friends. Wasn't very exciting wouldn't rush back. Yves saint Laurents memorial was a bit disappointing and people have written their names in the plants which is unbelievable. The museum is very interesting and well worth the visit

Enchanting. We visited the garden on our recent first visit to Marrakech. It was the most unusual and interesting garden I have ever been to. I was swept away by the blue everywhere, the shady walks and all the contrasts. The Berber museum is a definite must visit. Beautifully presented and an insight which left us wanting to learn more. We enjoyed a delicious light lunch in the restaurant. The shop was very expensive as you might expect. Make sure you strike a deal with the taxis outside, they wanted double what we paid to get there! Another one agreed to take us back for a more reasonable 50mad. Definite must see.

Beautiful visit in December. We had a quick visit to the Gardens for our only full day in Marrakesh. The fountain and desert plants throughout where beautiful! Great retreat from the sun and heat. If you don't like flowers or trees, then don't bother.
Beautiful Garden. This is a nice place to visit during the day with beautiful scenery and history. We stayed a couple hours.

Smart, well thought out and nicely done garden.. This popular purpose built garden is based just outside the Medina (walled old city centre) of Marrakesh has so many cactuses one can never together in one place. Clean very well looked after garden and a small museum with a nice cafe to go with it. I enjoyed colourful plants and walk. If you are in gardens and see a different world while outside is very hectic, this maybe a peaceful change in the day and see some amazing plantation.
Jardin majorelle. Beautiful gardens well worth a visit, the berber museum was worth the extra 30Dhs, a peaceful place.
Beautiful garden to visit. It was interesting and beautiful and photos taken very memorable. Costs 70 MAD each. Not very big, but glad we went.

For those who love Yves St Laurent probably worthwhile. It is a relative quiet place in a busy city - and quite small. I was surprised by how small it was against the entry fees that are ten-fold the entry fees of other places to visit in beautiful Marrakech.

Garden of Eden. What a beautiful, quiet, reflective place within the hustle and bustle of this magical city. We had visited before, yet it never fails to rejuvenate and inspire me. This is a must see in Marrakech, plus it's on the bus tour route so no excuse not to stop ;)
YSL Jardin Majorelle. Incredible experience and excellent gift shops. Not to be missed; such a relaxing oasis in Marrakech
Too much money for nothing. Just a garden with cacti, nothing much to write about. Save your time and money, spend the day in a hammam instead.

Small breath of fresh air. The colours, the sights and the design were just wonderful. So much to catch your attention, and well worth the short journey out of the medina for a more relaxed pace. The berber museum inside the gardens is worth the little bit more on the entrance fee and there are guides in several languages for the exhibits.

Beautiful gardens - a welcome respite . Spent about an hour at these lovely gardens, a quiet retreat from a busy city. However, the gardens are small and get quite busy so try to go early morning or late afternoon.
Stunning. Absolutely stunning, extremely well looked after, tranquil oasis in Marrakesh - loved it!!! The cafe was not so good, had a sandwich which was frankly awful - coffee was good though!!!

It's ok!. About 35 minute walk from Medina, although you can take a cab or carriage but barter the price down. Once here the gardens are very nice, go early to avoid the crowds, this way you can get some good photos. About 45 mins to walk around and enjoy.
Must visit!. After the riot of Jamaa el fna a wonderful place to spend time and enjoy the beautiful plants and the birds.

Visit to Jardin Majorelle. This place deserves its place as number one attraction in Marrakech. These gardens are spectacular - immaculately maintained and wonderful in their design. The blue of the structures within the garden is the most vibrant colour and the Art Deco house that was Majorelle's studio is simply exquisite. These gardens were restored by Yves St Laurent and Pierre Berge and their influence is noticeable. Well worth a visit.

nice escape. a bit out of the city center (Medina), this garden was saved from destruction by Yves Saint Laurent, and beside all kinds of cactus, you will fiind his monument herThe entrance fee of 70 DIR (7 €) is for the garden only. For another 30 DIR (3 €) you can enter also the Berber museum in the garden compound (well worth the little more to spend). Staying here for an hour or two, eventually with a drink or lunch in the garden's restaurant, makes a pleasant escape from the city hazzle.

Stunning but busy. The jardin Majorelle really is beautiful and offers stunning motives for any tourist or amateur photographer. But it is not a big park, and with the gardens popularity, it is a well visited attraction - which again means that if you dream of exploring the garden on your own with your camera, you will need a great deal of patience , because the moments where you are not surrounded by other tourist, who like you are eager to capture the gardens beauty without strangers on the motive are rare.
Nice visit. Beautiful collection of plants! If you want a quiet afternoon in a beautiful setting, then definitely check out this place.

Tranquil place to relax. Majorelle is described as a "must see" in our guide book, so we thought we would take a look.There was a bit of a queue to get in but we were able to get in quick enough. The gardens are lovely, tranquil and pretty although quite small, you've walked around the whole garden in 20 minutes and the museum another 15 minutes at most. You could just sit and read for a couple of hours if you have a free morning. The cafe is a nice location although high price compared to other places. Glad we visited, a little underwhelming but worth the walk when needing some time out from the Medina.
A visit in Heaven... Dont go in high season/peak times to have peace... so avoid Sundays and late afternoons. Take time to sip tea in the lovely patio (but its chilly)
Citytrip Marrakesh. Definitely a must see when visiting marrakesh! Plenty shadow, vinbrant colors. Be sure to visit the Berber museum. So good!

Jardin Majorelle. Get there early to avoid the crowds. Very peaceful gardens. Never seen so many Cactii!!! Don't stint on paying the extra 30Dirham for the museum - they have a fabulous collection of Berger costume and jewellery.

Wonderful retreat with a very interesting museum. This is a great little retreat and well worth the visit. It's not very big but the colours are beautiful. Can get a tad busy but it's not that bad. The Berber Museum should be visited - it's not very big but it charts the Berber race from history to outfits and spirituality. I found it very interesting but I know it's not to everyone's taste. If not, then make sure you don't buy the ticket for this. The cafe inside is lovely and you should chill out here. I had a lovely date and mango ice cream - yum!
Tranquillity in Marrakech . This is a piece of tranquillity in Marrakech. The gardens are absolutely beautiful and we would highly recommend visiting if you are in Marrakech
Worth the wait!. A refreshing oasis in the city heat. Beautiful gardens and very interesting museum within. Lovely to while away an afternoon
Pretty and lovely oasis in busy Marrakesh.. Prettiest of all Marrakesh' highlights. Lovely atmosphere. During March nt very busy which adds t the appeal.

Beautiful heaven. Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful garden where you can contemplate and observe the beauty of different colours. In the past, Ives Saint-Laurent, loved wandering in this place. Absolutely refreshing.

A relaxing stroll after the hassle of the souk. Well designed garden with colourful stone work. Lots of cacti and trees with attractive shop, museum and gallery too. An easy stroll around the garden is a peaceful way to enjoy half a day in Marrakech.

Beautiful but overy priced!. It is rated numer one on this website and I guess they decided to raise the price after the death of MR Saint Laurent. Seriously, 70D for Marrakech whereas all the other tourist sites would cost you about 20D. It is beautiful but if you have limited of time, go to palais el bahia, it offers more authentic experience and the place has more to offer.

Relaxing stroll. We were advised by our riad to get a taxi to the gardens but we decided to walk. It only took 30 mins and was easy to find. It cost 70Dhs and an additional 30Dhs if you want to get into the museum. We chose just to do the gardens and loved it. Wasn't too busy so could walk around leisurely and get some great photos.

Breathtaking, and don't miss the Berber Museum. Does get rather busy so try to get there early. The plants a beautifully kept and the rich colouring of the pots and stonework are fantastic. The cafe is rather nice for a short break, we spent 2 hours in the gardens and museum which is enough.

Not worth MAD 100. Nice garden but nothing special and very small. The Berber Museum is also quite small. The entrance fee is MAD 100 (EUR 10) which is the highest compare to any museum or other attractions. I don't think it worth, especially if you have seen many other beautiful gardens in other part of the world

Beautiful!!!. You should not miss this wonderful garden! especially if you love cacti! 😃
You will probably need at least an hour in here.

Disappointed. I was hoping for a well designed highly coloured garden, but it was desert plants and a bright blue building. I didn't feel the plants were really outstanding or unusual and not laid out particularly well either. Not what I expected from having Yves Saint Laurents name associated with it.

Better than I expected...Beautiful. A small but beautiful garden to wander through. Lots of different plants from across the world. A few pools around and lots of bright colours. There is a small tribute to YSL in the garden as well. A nice cafe is also within the garden. You have the opportunity to take some lovely pictures - luckily I went at a time when there were not many people around and the bright blue and yellow plant containers against the different colours of plants such as green and purple flowers etc makes it even more beautiful. Only 70 Dirhams (£5ish) to get in or 100 Dirhams (£7.50ish) including the Berber Museum which I did not have time to see. There is a small bookshop as well. You were not allowed to have food or drink inside the garden area (apart from the cafe) but it would have been very nice to sit within the garden and have something to eat. Can easily spend an hour or 2 here, even if one has no interest in plants! Very peaceful overall and very cool in the heat of the Marrakech! Worth the visit, once you've done a few other things! This wouldn't be THE top thing to do in Marrakech but would be in the top 10, possibly in the top 5!

Well worth a visit!. This beautiful garden is situated outside the walls of the old town and was recommended both online and by our riad staff. We were told to get the taxi but as long as you have a good map and some solid walking shoes, it's actually very straight forward to get to and takes about 30mins from the Old Town.The garden itself isn't particularly big but it's a peaceful haven away from the noise of the surrounding neighbourhood. Be prepared for groups of tourists (we arrived at around midday but only had to queue 5-10mins) which may scupper any attempts for photos free from the wandering stranger. Entrance fee is 70Dhs for the gardens (another 30 or 40Dhs for the museum which we did not go to) and it will take around 1 hour to get round at a leisurely pace. You can also grab a drink/ snack and even a souvenir at the gift shop though the YSL connection means that prices are higher than elsewhere.

Lovely Oasis. For about $7 US, you can spend a couple hours in this beautiful garden and tribute to Yves St. Laurent. There is also a lovely little museum attached to the garden. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area. I was able to walk there from my Riad in the Medina.
Simply stunning. An oasis of calm. We picked a quiet time to visit and enjoyed every moment we spent in these small but magical gardens when we were there last year.

Oh those colours!. We took a taxi to the Jardins but walked back (we were staying near the Main Square) so either option is fine. The entrance price can be just for the gardens or the Berber Museum too - thoroughly recommend visiting the museum. A little expensive for the entry and also for refreshments but worth the visit.

Worth a visit. We hired bicycles from a booth on the main square which is raising money for bikes for school children and were given a map and told of places which may interest us. This garden was designed by Yves Saint Laurent so riding there was something to satisfy our curiosity. Although the garden was not very big it was interesting the way it had been put together with various ferns,bamboo, water features etc. There is also a Berber museum on site but we did not visit owing to a time constraint. As part of the overall experience of Marrakech it was worth a visit and I would recommend it. There is a 70DH entry fee and anyone cycling will need to chain their bike to the railings in the street approaching. There is also a cafe on site but we thought the prices were high.
Pretty, short visit.. This is a must in Marrakesh. The visit takes about an hour and preferable go in the morning to avoid group visits.

nice garden but.... we came to the Jardin Majorelle and in fairness I have to say it is very nice but also very expensive compared to other places in town and packed with people. I guess you pay for the label of YSL... also we missed better explanations of the single plants as the few signs we have seen are not very easy to read.
Lots of blue - oasis in bustling city. Worth a visit to spend some quiet time close to the centre of Marrakesh. We walked out (and got a taxi back!) which added to the adventure.

Berber Museum Worth a Look. The gardens themselves are somewhat small, crowded, and unspectacular. Many of the plants have been defaced by people carving names or initials. However the attached Berber Museum is really well done and worth a visit.

Lovely garden, you will only spend about an hour and a half here. This was a lovely garden although not very large. It is worth going to and I took some good pics. There is a museum in there also which is small but informative.

Beautiful gardens not far from the bustle of town . The gardens were really lovely, with bright colors on the walls and lots of varieties of cacti and different plants. We walked from our hotel inside the Medina, but it was a bit of a hike. If you're not in the mood for that then you may want to take a taxi. We arrived around 10, even though our plan was to arrive at 8 in the morning when they open, and because we got there a little later we were there with a school group of children as well as a tour bus of people. It didn't make the trip any less enjoyable but it did factor into taking pictures. There was a bit of waiting for people to clear out of my shots. Definitely go for a visit it's very lovely, and the barber in EZM that's part of it is also quite interesting.

Absolutely loved it!. Though not large this is a lovely garden. The planting consists of bamboo, cacti and succulents which may not appeal to everyone but I loved it. The striking use of colour on the edging of water features (cobalt blue) and large pots around the garden (cobalt blue, soft blue, orange & citrus yellow) was really striking. The on-site Berber Museum, though small, is definitely worth the additional charge.

Breathtaking 3 hours. If you are looking to spend some peaceful time inside the city but away from the hustle and bustle then this place is perfect. Although it is located in the middle of the city once you enter you are completely cut off from the outside world and its noise. The berber museum is interesting and overwhelming. If you leave it for last then you might be tired and may not really enjoy the second half of the museum like I me but my husband enjoyed all of it. It is a bit pricey for tourists but we found it worth the money. Going early is a must if you want to avoid long queues. we went around 10am and had to stand in the queue for almost 10 minutes. It was fast moving but still took us 10 minutes to get inside.

Very pretty . It is quite a bit more than other attractions in Marrakech but it is a very beautiful place. There is also a small museum inside which is definitely worth the visit. Go early to avoid ques and pick a sunny day because it wouldn't be worth going in over cast weather.The drinks and food there is very expensive for what you get, so take water with you.

this place is an oasis in busy marrakesh!. such a great place to relax and take colourful photos amongst cactai and other tropical plants. The museum is also worth visiting, along with tea in the courtyard cafe.
Stunningly beautiful garden. Do not miss this garden if in Marakesh garden restaurant also recommended. Very interesting Berber museum which is a must to see.
Go early to avoid the tour buses. Arrive before 10am and have tea at the cafe from the lovely tea menu. The gardens are lovely and this was our second visit.
Sightseeing. Expensive to get in and the gardens were quite small. But the size of some of the cacti was an amazing sight and the Berber museum was very interesting.

Lovely green space in the red city. The gardens are small yet laid out lovely, they are interesting and eclectic. the bright colours made this space even happier. However i feel the best past of the gardens was the Berber Museum well worth the visit to look at the traditional dress and the jewelry and the meaning behind the designs. Loved it

Peaceful oasis in bustling Marrakech. Jardin Majorelle is a beautifully preserved oasis in the middle of bustling Marrakech. It's quiet and calm and completely isolated from the busy streets outside its walls. Outside the gate you can purchase a ticket for the gardens and a separate ticket for the berber Museum. I highly recommend you get both tickets so you can enjoy the wonderful Berber museum at the end of the Garden. Once inside, guests are offered a beautifully curated museum filled with berber history, jewelry, art and clothing. After a visit here -- all the pieces that you see in the souks immediately become alive! You'll enjoy the souks even more after an education on the Berber from this beautiful place.
One of the most beautiful spots in the world. The gardens are sheer magic and the house/museum is a gem in and of itself. The gardens are welcome respite from the busy streets of Marrakesh.

Quiet Oasis. Lovely garden - both formal & informal, with water & exotic (to us frozen Britons) plants. A peaceful place to take refuge from the mad bustle of Marrakech. Stopping at the café for a mint tea was an added bonus.
Inspirational and stunning gardens and museum/gallery.. Absolutely beautiful gardens with a small but perfectly presented collection of Berber artefacts, clothes and jewellery. Don't miss it!
Worth a visit if you have time to spare. Great place, but so full of tourists. The Berber museum is great though, and the Majorelle blue is heartlifting.

A visual feast for the appreciative mind. Even if gardens are not your 'thing', you will likely enjoy this zen-like experience. Not only the vegetation, but the ponds and colours assault the mind in contrast to the world outside the walls.Arrive early to avoid long 'tour group' lines. There is an entrance fee of 70D per person at the time we visited.My wife and I strolled through this venue of natural art twice. We paused for some time at the various ponds to admire the vision of the artists brought to striking reality.This is an adult venue though we watched young groups of schoolchildren being enthralled by stories told by guides, a remarkable feat!This is a must visit if only to award yourself a few moments of tranquility after battling the overwhelming vitality outside.

Very beautiful gardens and very peaceful. Really enjoyed this visit. It didn't take us long to get around the gardens because it is quite small but still well worth a look. The cactus were really good, big and prickly and great education for the children

Amazing . We did a trip for an afternoon very enjoyable. Beautiful garden very peaceful amazing plants to be seen . Don't think it's the best place for kids. The mint tea inside was lovely nice area to sit and enjoy .
Not our "cup of tea". The garden was ok, but was "just" a garden with a lot of blue coloures and it seamed like an expensive place to visit, just because it had belonged to Ives Saint Laurant.
Perfect stay and catch up. A great place to escape the city. The garden was fantastic and it was very close to the Medina. A perfect and a must stop in Marrakech

Beautiful oasis in a busy city. Jardin Majorelle is about 15 minutes walk from the central square in Marrakech. It is as stylish as you would expect, being the former home of Yves St Laurent, and beautifully laid out and maintained, with an interesting museum and display of YSL memorabilia and art. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful but expensive. Wonderful colours and beautiful surrounings in this rather small garden. One hour is more than enough here. Well worth the visit but the high price of 70 dirhams brings down overall rating.

Greater than expectations!. Well kept, has a lot of labeled interesting plants, beautiful set up: enter into a bamboo archway and walkway. Architecture is well placed and the colors are pleasing. Photographs well! Yves Saint Laurent's memorial is here. They have an awesome little museum about Berber history also that has a cool room with mirrors and lights. The museum store is also quite interesting with vintage photographs of Marrakesh.
Nice but not what I expected. The garden and plants are beautiful. However was a lot smaller than I expected I think I wandered around everything in about 15 minutes.
Garden. If you want to see exotic plants, this is the place to visit. It is calm and relaxing. There isn't much to see in the museum though.

Delight for the eys. Not the biggest garden but as with a lot in Marrakech, compact. Enough to amuse for an hour or so. Was recommended to take a horse and trap for around 100diram from the square but decided to walk but wished we'd taken the ride. Loved the contrasting colours of the cacti, plants and painted hues. Went round the museum also which was interesting seeing all the types of regional jewellery.

Amazing garden - the sound if silence. The Garden is very easy to find. It is a real retreat in the buzzing sound of Marrakech! Really quite and perfect to relax and calm down in between all that trading in the busy souks. Perfect place to breath fresh air! The 30 Dieham for the museum in the Garden are defenitely worth paying. Very interesting exhibition of the Berber tribe!

Lovely park awash with colour. We thought we'd make the trip here on our last afternoon in the city. It is a fair distance from the Medina, in the Gilesh area. As much as I loved the vibrant Medina, Gilesh is a lot less crazy and more cosmopolitan. The admission fee for the park was by far the highest we paid for an attraction in the City, but once we made our way around the garden grounds, we could see why. The park was saved from developers by Yves St Laurent and there is memorial to him within the grounds. The park is beautiful and vibrant, yet very relaxing. It is smaller than the other parks in Marrakech, but has a museum (you pay more for this), nice Cafe and a boutique. An oasis of calm in what can be a crazy city.

Nothing special . Entrance fee is 70 dirham per person. This place known as a beautiful garden but for me there were nothing . Just bamboo trees and some cactus flowers . To be honest I wouldn't go again and not recomended

A place to escape. For 70 dirham (approx 5 GBP) it is a place to escape and enjoy some greenery & nature at good value. The place is tiny so don't allow too long for your visit. We had a little picnic- sitting on a park bench inside the walk way( not ideal) but we thought the prices for the cafe were quite on the high side for Marrakech.

Beautiful! great little museum. The gardens are stunning but try to avoid the afternoon crowds to get a really relaxing experience. I would really recommend going to the museum, it is beautiful and has cards in many different languages.The shop and cafe are quite pricey.

Gorgeous. The Jardin Majorelle is ideal for escaping the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The gardens are so beautiful and the Berber museum is very interesting. The cafe and other facilities are excellent. Overall, a fascinating place to spend a few hours.
Peaceful. Well worth a visit. Interesting and beautiful. Well kept and cared for. A complete contrast to the medina and souks.

Calm Place with a nice cafe. We enjoyed a stroll around these gardens. It was a very calm experience after the noise of the city. The memorial to Yves Saint Laurent was interesting as was the poster art. It had a very nice cafe in a secluded courtyard area where they serve, amongst other things, traditional mint tea! The waiters were really nice and friendly and dressed in a traditional uniform which was smart. We tried the icecream......very good! Worth a visit just to relax and stop for a drink/icecream and it was about £5.50 (70 dirhams) entrance fee.
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens set in the centre of Marrakech. Well worth a visit and reasonably priced too! Ideal for getting some shade from the Moroccan heat.

Why pay €7 just to see flowers . I would suggest that you just visit the museum for €3 euros instead. It's a garden with flowers, I wonder what the hype is about. Maybe more interesting for a botany class or to go have a day to read in the park. I thought it was overpriced.
Calm and colour. Small but beautifully kept. Went at quiet time so able to wander at will. Paradise for cactus lovers!
touristy but nice. The garden of the former house of YSL. Striking blue amidst a lush green garden. Remarkable and beautiful. Expect tourists and a giftshop though.

Beautiful tranquil. Well worth a visit, taking a step down in the pace of the medina, walk through the beautiful gardens and find your inner peace. Enjoy a meal at the cafe, fantastic service food is wonderful enjoy the keftas.

Pleasant but relatively expensive. We chose to walk to the Jardin Majorelle, approximately 10 minutes walk from the city wall - not a difficult walk. The gardens were small and we spent a pleasant hour there but I did feel they were overpriced. 70 Dh per adult seemed expensive relative to the other visits and activities in Marrakech. Some great colours and photo opportunities.
Lovely afternoon activity. Beautiful place with incredible colors. Takes about 1 hour to meander through. Be sure to visit the Berber Museum!
Beautiful . I have never seen a garden like it in my life even if u are not interested in gardening u need to visit we had an amazing time cacti like I have never seen before stunning
Oasis of calm. Although the garden is small it is a serene place to spend an hour. Do make sure to visit the Berber museum which is a very interesting part of this garden.

Nice on a hot day. Great location to escape the sun on a hot day. Not very big and takes about 20 minutes to walk around not including the museum or shops. If you are desperate to look at something green for a change this is the place to go.
Perfectly groomed. Many exotic plants placed just so. Small, but worth strolling through. This was designed with a real eye for presentation. Not surprising considering Yves St Laurent's involvement
This is a Designer's garden. Go early to avoid the crowds. Amazing garden worthy of Yve St Laurent. This is maintained to exacting standards. Definitely a highlight for Marrakech.
Ronald souter. A place for restful afternoon a fantastic display of cactus a great water feature a burbar museum worthwhile to visate

S blue and beautiful.. lovely well laid out gardens with easy access for everyone.A lovely cool place on a hot day. Restaurant is expensive so take food there. Berber Museum is small but very well laid out

If you like your gardens this is a must. Cobalt blue used in a perfect setting. The peacefulness of these gardens is wonderful. The planning and design means that at every place there are great views through, over and behind structures and planting.

Overpriced and nothing to see. If you like blue and green plus lots and lots of bamboo and cacti then this is the place for you. There is seriously little to see unless you pay for entrance to the little museum that does have a few interesting pictures. That's it - no honestly that's it. My girlfriend now owes me 2 hours.

Not worth the money.... Considering all the FREE gardens and parks around, this place is not worth it. It's really small and crowded and 70 Dh to get in. It's pretty and well groomed, but just look at the pictures of it. Just a bunch of cactus and bamboo that takes 5 minutes to walk around.
A little piece of heaven. Such a lovely relaxing place. I'm not a gardener but even I enjoyed this. The colours are stunning and the plants at times are magical
Amazing Cacti. Fantastic gardens. exquisite plants, well planned planting,lovely cafe, interesting prints and library, gorgeous!

Stunning peaceful gardens with interesting museum attached. A little walk out of the Medina, north of the busy bus station area, this is an oasis of calm. The garden design is stunning and in the bright sunshine looks amazing alongside the Majorelle-blue painted building. Lovely cacti, bamboo and water features make for a decent hour or so of soaking up the peace and quiet. The attached Berber museum is really worth a visit and includes and stunningly displayed collection of jewellery in a breath-taking 'room of stars' - worth paying extra to visit.Note: it is pretty expensive but worth it. Likewise the café gets crowded and is also pretty expensive (and probably not worth it, especially as there are plenty of eateries nearby). The gardens themselves get pretty crowded so an early morning or late afternoon visit would be ideal to beat the crowds.

Well that was (moderately) interesting.. It was a pleasant place to visit. Not much more you can say really.The museum was interesting.Worth a visit, but watch out for overpriced taxis when you leave!
Beautiful place, expensive entrance. We must be honest: the place is beautiful, but I have been to more beautiful gardens without paying 7€. It is a bit over-rated.
Beautiful place to visit . Lovely gardens restored by Yves St Laurent. The Berber museum inside was really well done too. Lovely maintained gardens

Quaint garden in the city centre . It is a beautifully presented garden in the city centre. The garden has such history! It's worth a visit. There is a memorial to Yves Saint Laurent who owned the garden. There is also a museum to visit. That's an extra charge. I didn't go in but I'm sure there is more to see.
a dreary day but a lovely oasis. This is a must to visit on the day we went it was wet and cold but we still enjoyed the gardens, well worth the 40 minute walk from our riad

Well worth a visit. Delightful gardens, with an interesting history. It is well worth paying to go into the museum, which although small is very informative and well presented. Goods in the shop are very good quality, but expensive.
Nice. Very pretty and full of all sorts of plants. Was quite busy when we went as there was a school trip.
If you are looking for some rest.... A quiet place to take a walk and relax from the noise and hassle of the old Medina and the souks. Not very big and can easily be seen in 30 mins or less.

Beautiful Garden and story behind. I found the garden beautiful and the story impressed me behind (find out yourself what the story is ;) ). Also I liked very much the idea of having the Berber Museum in the garden. Very interesting. I loved the garden, I just imagined it bigger. But doesn't matter, its small and cute. There is also a nice shop inside where I bought a nice leather bag. I warmly recommend to visit the garden. From the Medina by taxi for around 40 dirham.

Such a beautiful and peacefull place. If you want to escape busy Marakkesh Majorelle gardens are the place to be, beautiful and peacefull settings, lovely colours, you can just have a stroll or sit down and relax.
Beautiful OAS. Being in Marrakech you ought to visit the place. Colourful, beautiful and peaceful. They have a café too but that you could easily manage without.

Beautiful gardens, tribute to Yves Saint Laurent. We loved this garden, for the beautiful plants and the majorelle blue walls, pots etc. Also for the peaceful break from the chaos of the centre if Marrakech. We also really enjoyed the Berber museum. Whilst we really appreciated our trip here, I'm surprised that it's number 1 attraction and I can understand that it may be a disappointment if you are not a garden lover. At 70 dirham entrance fee (plus 30 for the museum) We'd got a taxi there and back. Our hotel receptionist had told us to pay a maximum of 30 dirhams each way. However the return taxis were very hard to get down below 40.
Lovely . A beautiful garden with a fabulous array of plants. Really worth going and spending half a day at least. Lovely courtyard cafe and restaurant

Glorious design, one of the top 5 things to do in the town.. Stunning landscaping, breathtaking colours, a delightful cafe and very much more peaceful than crazy Marrakech. Top tip, the boutiques outside are worth a visit, BUT the taxi's rip EVERYONE off.

#1 Tourist Attraction??!!. We went to visit the Jardin Majorelle with a group of friends to escape the busy souks. It costs 70 dirham for entry to the garden but inside its peaceful and relaxing.We were hoping to discover colourful and vibrant garden with lots of flowers but it was nothing like that. It's just a normal garden with a few plants and palm trees. It was too small we walked the whole garden within 20 minutes. We did not visit the museum seemed ridiculous to pay again for entry that's within the garden.The gift shop is too expensive Overall this place is overrated as being one of the top tourist attractions in Marrakech honestly there's nothing much to see or do. Of course once inside you escape the madness of the Medina so it's peaceful and you can sit down and relax. It's the YSL legacy name that makes this place
Gorgeous Refuge from the City. While the gardens are in the city technically, they are so quiet and full of natural beauty that you would never know!
YSL GARDEN. Just beautiful and well maintained such a calm and peaceful place. The walk around the gardens leads to a museum and beautiful coffee shop where you can sit and read in peace X

Nice, quiet and beautiful garden. One of the most visited sites in Marrakech, and with good reason, it is very quiet, thoughtfully planned and well worth to spend an hour or two at (especially if it is nice weather; otherwise it's a bit dark, as there's a lot of trees and shade).
A nice garden. I found that the entrance fee was quite expensive for this garden. It is nice, but not worth the price in my opinion.

Such an amazing and beautiful experience. This is well worth the 7 dollars to get in. Also it is very relaxing as to pushy vendors are within the walls. The gift shop is pricy, but well worth a look. We also had lunch at the café, was very tasty.

Splendid. A small but beautiful botanical garden but what sets this apart is the really excellent museum of Berber life - truly a wonderful slice of their culture, most informative, and we came away with a better understanding of that sector of Moroccan society. The buildings are lovely too, that Majorelle blue - stunning.

Nice place to spend the afternoon. Lovely, colourful gardens to walk around and get away from the madness of the souks. The museum is interesting and worth the extra 30 dirhams. Quite busy but pleasant.
A definate must in Marrakech!. Lovely gardens, a definite must visit in Marrakech! We would definitely go back, it's a nice escape from the busy city.

Nice and Beautiful Garden, but still just a garden . The Jardin Majorelle is a nice- and well maintained garden just outside the medina. If you are a nature freak you will have a splendid time but for us as a couple visiting Marrakech, this was just a nice and peaceful stop from all the hustle in the city. The admission was rather expensive (about 7 euro's). We also went to the garden in Guéliz (the modern part of the city) called the Jnane el Harti parc. This parc/garden was just as nice and totally free.

Pretty place to spend a few hours. This was a nice peaceful break from the bustle of the main square and the souks. The colours are beautiful. Be sure to check out the museum of traditional Moroccan Berber artefacts.

Yves legacy. Get here early ,we arrived at 930 am on a weekday and the line was already deep with bodies , this is a lovely place and the plants and grounds are beautiful . Very hard to pose for pictures as it gets really busy as you're in there , allow an hour or so for this activity and you'll be on the money , well worth the visit enjoy

Small but perfectly formed. Beautiful garden, fairly expensive (in terms of Marrakech entry prices) and quite small. Definitely worth the visit but don't expect to be blown away- was busy in February so I imagine it's probably rammed in the summer.

Small gardens, not much to see here. We were told this was the number #1 tourist attraction in Marrakech. I thought it was a small pretty little garden. Not much to see here.Smells nice, and looks nice. Nothing more.

Beautiful spot with wonderful corners to photograph. Go in the morning at opening as it gets quite crowded in the afternoon--especially if you want to take photos. The Berber Museum is wonderful and not to be missed! Try tea at the outdoor cafe as well....

Good, international moroccan. The blue will lift your soul and set your imagination a light. Beatiful contrasts between cati buildings and sky. Good cafe with great service and the best expresso in Marrakech. Must go the Berber Museum, exquisite exhibition.
Small but really worth the visit.. Beautiful gardens with cacti, lovely bourganvillias, pools and amazing bamboos. Visit early to avoid crowds as key viewing spaces can be busy.

Very nice, but too crowded. It was my second time in Jardin Majorelle. It is still very nice, a lovely place to relax and get a little break from the busy Medina. Unfortunately it was very crowded this time and sometimes we even had to stay in line to take a picture. Still worth the 7 Euros ticket price.

the colors are amazing. it's not my first visit to the gardens. as a kid i used to live closer and had a chance to visit many times. i still take all my visiting friends and enjoy my visit each time. love the colors and the greenery. amazing garden in the heart of the city

Fantastic Berber museum here, nice cafe. The gardens are a tranquil haven, There are some interesting plants and attractive water features all set around the villa in its distinctive and vibrant " majorelle blue " inside is housed a small but exquisite Berber Museum housing examples of leather items , tools , everyday items, armoury, different tribal rugs etc. The two most impressive displays for me were the different regional costumes and the very distinctive jewellery display. Cards are available to pick up in each room which clearly show the outline of items on display and provide more in depth information about everything if you require. There is a boutique shop with some beautiful items. The cafe is set in a nice cool walled patio, we only had drinks, but the food served around us looked and smelled very good. If gardens and museums are your thing then it is definitely worth a visit.

Stunning small garden with added Berber museum. We thought this garden the most worth visiting in Marrakech - quite small but very beautiful. Filled with plants from around the world, it is a quiet shady place. Might get crowded at peak times though.

Go here if your bored!. Ok its a nice garden but 1. Its TINY2. You pay to go in3 its a bit of a walk from the medina4. There are other beautiful FREE gardens with local attractions and people in5 . Many other sites like mosques, museums and the artisanal are better!!!This is no1 obviously as old couples think its fun, its not, and the entrance is round the back .Took me 5 minutes to walk round it! The better garden is by the main square, huge and tranquil.Id stay more in the medina for REAL experiences

Beautiful Oasis. A beautiful oasis in the middle of a bustling Marrakech neighborhood. Send some time to wander through the lovely, peaceful gardens. Be sure to include the Berber museum with your admission. It is well worth the small additional charge.

An oasis of colour away from the hustle and bustle. This was our second trip as a family to Marrakech and on both occasions we came here. YSL was a lucky man living here and his gardens are as beautiful today as they were in his heyday! The cobalt blue of the building is stunning. The cacti are a wonder to behold.
Fantastic . A wonderful 2 hrs spent enjoying this peaceful oasis after the noise of marakech. Well worth a visit and only 100drm for both the gardens and the museum

Paradise!. Jardin Majorelle is not the typical botanic garden with sumptuous flowers - it is a small, very tasteful garden of cactus plants, ponds and stunning colors! You can sense the work of a designer there. It is a bit pricy (7€) but one of the nicest places I've visited in marrakech... Go there!

A must if you visit Marrakech. A few minutes from the center of Marrakech with the Horse Coach (more romantic than the taxi). Jardin Majorelle, a luxurious exotic garden with plenty of colorfull places.Quiet walking after the "turbulent and crowdy Medina.. Don't miss it.
Fantastic Gardens. Beware that staff who offer to take a picture of you with your camera will expect money in return! Otherwise very knowledgeable about the plants etc.

imaculate style. 1 hour is plenty of time to view , photograph, and pay a visit the cafe . all a unique expirience. we took the thompson tour from our hotel also visited menara gardens on same tour including an hour trotting round the sights on a horses and carriage ride. extremely good value

Over-rated and over-priced. From the average rating and some of the reviews on this place, it has been on our list of things to do for a while and on our third trip to Marrakech, we finally managed. We were pretty disappointed. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice enough private garden, but for the price, you'd think you were going to get something more akin to Kew Gardens in London. You're not. This is not a botanical garden with specimens from all over the world, or even all over Morocco. This is just a nice ornamental garden. It's a lot smaller than you'd expect as well, especially given the price. The cafe was a nice pit-stop for lunch and the food there was fine. Overall, this wasn't worth going out of our way for, queueing for twenty minutes and then paying 100 dirhams each. To say we were underwhelmed is an understatement! Also judging by the numbers of fashionistas and YSL worshippers, I think this is a destination for fans of the famous fashion designer. That's fine - but it wasn't for us.

Nice garden , but not really the number 1 attraction. Visited here as it was the number 1 attraction in Marrakesh - really ? Although it was a nice enough garden you can't really stay for more than an hour , you can have lunch but the cafe is crowded and pricey. It's links to Yves saint lourant draw in lots of French. Time better spent in the Medina area.

Beautifully kept gardens . The gardens are very well maintained and offer a bit of peace and tranquility in a busy city
There is only a small entrance charge
The gardens are not huge and it doesn't take long to walk around.
Worth a visit

Lovely colours from buildings and walls. Firstly may I say that the toilets here were absolutely fabulous and clean, we judged them ten out of ten which you can't beat
There was a lady there just to help you if you wanted it, so voluntarially I gave her a tip for keeping it in pristine condition and she smiled back and said hello

Blue. Loved the gardens and the gardeners dressed in blue to match the brilliantly coloured house! It was truly a small oasis in a bustling city, and keep that in mind: it is quite small. Personally I expected something larger to get lost in for hours on end, but this wasn't it. However it was beautiful and wonderfully atmospheric nonetheless.

Perfect retreat. This amazing garden filled with exotic plants and trees is the perfect retreat from the manic metropolis that is Marrakech!!
Call in for a wander and coffee..

Pleasant . Lovely beautiful gardens. You have to pay entrance fee then you can walk around the gardens for as long as you want.
Nice visit
Cute and so peaceful. Definitely to be seen. They have done a very good job renovating and the Berbere museum; is very interesting too.

Nice gardens but small. The gardens are very nice but it only takes 15 minutes to walk round them. There are plenty of seats in the shade so it's a nice place to be on a hot day. The 70 dirhams entry is 7x what most other places charge so it is expensive bearing in mind how small the gardens are

Get there early. If you can get there as soon as it opens and thus avoid crowds, it's well worth going. Nice green contrast to the rest of M'kech and the Berber museum inside the garden is a small gem (remember to ask for an inclusive ticket). Had it been crowded I don't think I would have enjoyed it.
Not at all tranquil. We expected something a lot bigger to cater for the crowds. For us it was not worth the entrance fee.

Not worth the entrance fee. I saw this was number 1 place to visit however for 70dh entrance it was not worth it to be honest. Just some plants and the whole place took around 30mins to view. If you want greenery I suggest you visit one of their free parks instead. If you love plants, then yeah you will like this place

Lovely. These gardens are well worth visiting. A place of peace in the noise of Marrekech. It's a bit of a hike if you walk but there are taxis all over the place and not that expensive. The garden is expensive to visit when compared with other attractions here,70 dinar for the garden and 30 for the museum entry. The museum has a collection of jewellery and clothing worn by the various Berber tribes. I found it very interesting and I was glad we had bought both.

Tranquil garden. This is a tranquil garden that is a must visit. It's a large garden with a bunch of trees, cactus and flower plants. This visit can prove to me a good escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina and Souks.Only negative point is that there is only 1 taxi rank outside and they charge over inflated fares. There is no other taxi rank, so are forced to pay this. You can try to haggle, but they usually don't budge. However this is no reflection on the garden.Best time to visit is early morning or late afternoon to avoid the crowds and groups.Definitely worth a visit and on the positive side it's only 10 Dhiram per person (roughly 80p!)

Beautiful gardens. This is a must for any traveller to Marrakech and it's worth the extra 30 dirhams to visit the Berber Museum. The plants were disappointingly not native to the region but all the same everyone's face looked relaxed and easy as they walked around the area. It is lush, green with the wonderful blue paint creating an amazing feel of being somewhere special and cared for. It was like an oasis in a seething mass of noise. I would urge anyone to go there to feel the calm and care taken over the place.

Amazing oasis . When I stepped in the garden I was absolutely amazed. I didn't expect such a colourful, vivid and breathtaking place. The plants are unique and well kept. There were many visitors and even a queue in front of the ticket box, but there was space for everyone in the gardens. It's an absolute must in Marrakech :)
Excellent Well maintained Gardens. This was truly a must visit place in Marrakesh. My wife and I had a lovely time and took too many photographs!!
A wonderful garden. An absolute must, but get there early as it becomes very crowded. The Berber museum is small but well displayed definitely worth visiting.

Beautiful small garden but exquisite Berber museum. Well worth seeing this lovely small garden of desert plants. Well maintained and although crowded, it had a restful feel. But the highlight was the excellent Berber museum with such amazing artifacts, jewelry and embroidered clothing

Jardin Majorelle. If you need a sense of serenity for a few hours or so, then this is the place. The walk around the gardens isn't as long as expected, but there are plenty of tucked away, shaded areas and a nice restaurant / cafe towards the back of the gardens.Very easy to get to by taxi from the Jemaa el Fna.

wonderful and quite. Arrive at opening time to avoid crowds. Everything was nice, just wish it was even bigger !! Same goes for the museum, if you can avoid crowds, you can really absorb the showcases.

Nice Garden. Nice garden in Marrakech full of many different plants and trees. Also, the temperature was much cooler inside the garden than outside in the city. Offers a relief from the heat. Very nice place to visit and relax.

RESTRICTED VARIETY OF PLANTS BUT EXCELLENT SPECIMENS. For what there was to see, I thought it was a little expensive .. around £7 ... but the cacti and succulents on display were excellent specimens and the bird song eminating from the trees was fantastic. The cafeteria in the cente was welcome and the staff were very friendly.
Great place. Amazing place with the beautiful and colorful plants.Weather was fairly warm with plenty of sunshine. Worth taking a walk.

Fabulous. A wonderful contrast to the lively medina - so well thought out and definitely worth stopping for something to eat in the fab cafe. The museum was very interesting and very ingenious usage of mirrors. I would recommend a trip here without doubt.
Beautiful little graden. Not a big garden, but very beautiful and charming. Nice species of flowers and plants, smells good, it has a little gift shop that is a little expensive.
Tranquil Gardens. Well worth a visit - great to get out of the madness of the other parts of the city and enjoy the peace here.
Oasis of blue rest. The blue, the green, the smell... But without a visit to the Berber Museum to explore the marvelous culture of the Berber people.

Great in any season. We had not expected so many succulents, and the upkeep of these was first-rate. The bamboo groves would provide shade in summer, and the pool was enchanting in any weather. The museum is one of the best anywhere - and I've traveled on six continents. It's small with top-notch quality ethnic exhibits. Don't miss these two places.
lovely if small attraction. beautiful gdns , easy to find although much smaller than i was expecting , the little museum inside was worth the visit though to see the fabulous costumes and jewellery

Worth to visit. We have visited Majorel Garden last Januarary and it was very very intersting spot in Marrakech Brill place.well worth it as a sanctuary for the heat of the bustling city. The museum in the park is really good too with examples of local crafts and jewellery and clothes from the region.
Unforgettable. I just loved this place, the blue "Majorelle" and all the exotic plants. I firmly recomend not to skip this place...It is unique and very well preserved.
This beautiful small garden is an oasis in the heart of new town. wonderfully kept and designed this garden is superb, very interesting museum, modern but showing traditional way of life.
nice. this wasn't a great attraction to visit , we wan to disocver reall morocco , and see local and wonderful sightseeing , not a made palce .
An amazing eperience. This quiet, beautiful garden is a very nice place to visit. Do not forget the Berber museum, which is very interesting.

Beautiful!. This garden was worth the walk from our Riad (which was about 45 minutes) with an entry price of 70 dirhams! It is so scenic and beautiful and the perfect place to get wonderful photos. It does get quite crowded so I would recommend going at an off-peak time to get the full view and essence of the garden.

Stunning gardens oasis of tranquility . This amazing garden maintained previously by Yves St Lauren is now a shrine to his wonderful designs. Cobalt blue and bright yellows off set by the multitude of green foliage , coolness beneath the hot blue skies above and so peaceful , should not be missed !

Breathtaking. Beautiful, just beautiful.
Bring a good camera. You'll need it.
And besure to buy tickets for the museum as well as the garden.

Beautiful location. We spent about 2 hours here and visited both the gardens and the museum. The gardens are stunning and the museum is small but very interesting.There is a small Yves Saint Lauren art gallery onsite as well as a small gift shop and cafe. For us it was a 20 minute walk from our hotel (Maison MK) and really easy to find. It was a lovely way to spend a morning. We arrived around 10:30 and had to queue for tickets for about 10 minutes. It is quite a tourist location so arriving early would be recommended. We really enjoyed it and thought the gardens were stunning. The gardens aren't vast but they are well worth the trip.

Nice way to spend time out of the medina. We went because our hotel suggested it and it was a short walk. It was nice to get out of the old city/medina but the garden was rather small and incredibly crowded. Walkways were enough for two people and we were constantly dodging people or stepping off the pathways. But it was a nice escape from the hustling and haggling of the city. Beautiful plant specimens, beautiful setting in general. We did not go into the museum, although I wish we had. It took us maybe 20 minutes to walk through at a slow pace. We were given a brochure explaining the history of the place. It was a decent time, but not something I'd go to Marrakech to see, or go out of my way to see.
DrJB . Beautiful garden, it's a must when visiting Marrakech. It's the perfect place to relax, read and get some great pictures.

Calm away from the Chaos. A lovely oasis of calm and tranquility, and to see some greenery away from the harshness of stone, cement and buildings.A welcome retreat for 'fresh air'..The Gardens (which are not of a grass open space type)are set out into several divided areas that contain a variety of fantastic cacti and other plants. All seen from sections of pathways.It has been the work in progress of Yves Saint Laurent to redevelop The Gardens and bring them back to their former beauty. There is a monument commemorating him.It isn't overly spacious, but it is very pretty and very well kept. There is a very attractive pond which u can walk around and also view from a wooden bridge, it's home to a variety of plants and reeds and also some of the tiniest Terrapins I've ever seen!,( far better environment than being locked inside a tiny cage in the baking sun to be sold at market)There's a lovely courtyard cafe.The Berber museum is definitely worth paying the extra dhms for.
Brief Visit. We visited the garden in February and the weather was fantastic. The food from the restaurant was good, although not massively cheap. A nice outing for something to do in the day.
Beautiful tranquil space. A short walk or taxi trip to green nature, blended with azure blue. Take a book and go chill out for a few hours to escape the bustle.

Yves Saint Laurent inspired... Brill place. A little more expensive compared to other attractions in the city 100 dirhams compared to about 10 to 30 dirhams in other places.... but well worth it as a sanctuary for the heat of the bustling city. The museum in the park is really good too with examples of local crafts and jewellery and clothes from the region.
Blue. Second visit here. Although the cost to enter is more than you may expect all the money goes into a foundation to help young people in marrakesh. Well worth a visit

Absolutely stunningly beautiful place.. We travelled to the gardens by horse and carriage and the driver suggested that we needed only half an hour. We compromised and agreed 45 mins but we could have spent longer. It was lovely with a very interesting Berber Museum included

Just stunning!. The colours will blow you away and if you have deep pockets the very stylish shop on site is very tempting indeed. The merchandise available is a real treat after the tourist wares available in the medina!
beautiful. very calm & relaxing garden, with beautiful ponds & very unusual cacti , would definitely recommend, enjoyed the onsite cafe as well.

Nice little garden . Nice garden where you can see all the plants and trees that can be found in morocco. Only 70 MDR per adult and you can visit the garden in 30 minutes to 1 hour I can easily recommend it to visit.

Lovely but smaller than expected.... Head here for the lovely courtyard restaurant for a simple, tranquil lunch.Gardens are beautiful but not as big as I had expected and quite busy. A visit won't take that long.Nice break from the Medina.

Pretty gardens, botany not local. Small, pretty gardens. Short line to buy tickets on a Sunday. No staff available to offer insights into botany or history of garden. Botany from many places around the world; had hoped for more local botany with staff, pamphlet, or other access to information about the garden.

Unique. Me and my friend visited this place and was amazed with the unique different kind of cactus place in this garden (jardin majorelle). The place has a lot of tall nice tress around and it was huge. But whenever you get tired looking at those unique plants they have benches to sit and relax also they have a small restaurant inside.It was great to see this place.

Beautiful, but crowded. We had really been looking forward to this visit, the garden is truly beautiful (if you appreciate Majorelle-blue color) The only drawback is the fact that quite a lot of tourists share that intreset - every photo spot was over crowded - we stronly advise to get in early
Nice Wander. We had a nice walk around the garden. Reasonably priced and a small brochure gives information about the gardens. We did not visit the museum inside.

Most beautiful garden I have ever seen. This was definitely the most beautiful garden I have ever seen. The plants, flowers and all the colours put together look just breath taking. I loved how vibrant the blue and yellow colours on the buildings and plant pots were. We went there on a very hot day and found the place lovely to cool down. There is also a museum and cafe which are also worth to visit.
Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful gardens in Marrakech. It's colorful and rich with history. For history lovers this is a must see

Lovely tranquil setting, well worth a visit.. Maybe we just got lucky here as we visited out of season but the gardens were not over busy and are just lovely with many cacti palms and various exotic plants. If, like me, you are not really a 'garden' person don't be put off these gardens really are a treat to visit.

Fantastic. This was such an interesting place to visit and the museum is a must seeWe visited on a lovely sunny day in February and had drinks and nibbles in the courtyard cafe which were reasonableAn enjoyable 2 hours

Beautiful place . I defiantly recommend having a look at these gardens, although fairly small and won't take you much time to explore they are very picturesque.Great colours and water features make it a very peaceful and tranquil experience

Go for the cactii, stay for the museum.. The cactus garden at Jardin Majorelle is definitely beautiful, but it's the Berber museum that I really loved. The small, three room museum features a stunning collection of jewelry, homewares and traditional Berber dress. Definitely include it when you buy your ticket at the gate.

The bluest blue. Its a bit off the beaten track and a good walk from the Old Town but we were told taxis were cheap.We enjoyed the walk from the Old Town as it took us through a very different Marrakesh.The garden is a peaceful oasis. It being February it was not too busy but clearly a popular tourist destination. It is all easily accessible for wheelchairs with smooth, hard paths.The beds are beautifully kept, very manicured. Lots of cacti, bamboo and other leafy tropical planting. In February the flowers were less in evidence other than bougainvillea which was flowering sumptuously.The star of the show is the colour blue. Rich and deep it contrasts with the planting and is set off by splashes of yellow on walls and on pots. It is a photographer's delight. Shadows on walls and reflections in water just ask to be photographed.There is a café, enticing menu but not so enticing prices. The shop was a disappointment as again, the prices were high. Clearly they were determined to avoid anything that said tourist or tat. Very much high end shopping.The museum is worth a visit if you want to know more about the Berber way of life. Information in English is available but very basic....not a lot of detail.It doesn't take long to walk around the garden but there are lots of places to sit down and enjoy what is in front of you.

Visit to the lovely Jardin Majorelle. We visited the Jardin Majorelle on our last day of Marrakech. Its very popular and there was a little bit of queuing to get in and it was a little more expensive to enter than we had expected (although for the life of me I can't remember how much!) The gardens and buildings were really lovely and tranquil. Although no-one has lived there for some time both are very well maintained! There are lots of benches dotted around so you can sit down and soak up the atmosphere. There are plaques with a little bit of interesting background dotted around and displays of Yves Saint Laurent paintings. It was a lovely place to visit on our last morning and certainly topped off our visit to Marrakesh. Wouldn't particularly recommend for people with small children.

Bit Touristy but shouldn't be missed. Its a bit out of the way from the Medina but we walked to it as would rather explore and see things than sit in a taxi.Not the cheapest attraction to get into but would recommend paying for the garden and the museum.Seeing photos cannot prepare you: firstly for how spectacular the gardens are as the paths wind there way through different climates wether the cooling shaded bamboo or the open cactus areas.secondly for just how vivid and striking the house is with its blue and yellow again the green of the garden. As you walk from the entrance you get little glimpses of the house with is unmistakable with the colour and angles.The museum is very well done, show casing elements of Berber life, i liked the fact as well that they were considerate in the sense that all the labels were in french but they provided translation cards so i could understand what the exhibits were.one defiantly not to be missed
