Not what I expected, but is fine. Some of the fountains are not as clean as it looks in the pictures. The place is OK to visit and have a relaxing moment far from the noisy of the medina. If you go by noon I recommend to have lunch in the cafe. Food is very well prepared and is a pretty nice place to sped time.
Beautiful but small. It was a beautiful setting and quite peaceful compared to the streets and medina. Quite small, only taking an hour or so to enjoy.
Stunning. A lovely way to spend the afternoon. We had a bite to eat in the on site cafe'. The museum is very interesting as well.

Good for a walking and couple relax. Its a good place to relax, near the Medina of Marrakesh, you can go there by taxi or horses, i went by horse and it was a really good experience, the price are fixed but you need to pay attention with the riders.

Beautiful but small!. There's know doubting that the gardens are a visual spectacle. This is a peaceful space that offers a quiet haven away from the bustle of the souks. I found them surprisingly small however which meant it really was only a short excursion where I'd hoped it would occupy a good few hours. Worth a visit but maybe plan for a couple of hours max rather than anything longer

Expensive view on cactuses. Entrance with museum 100dirhams, which is a lot for this. If u love cactuses, this is your thing. No flowers, at least in February. Crowded. really expensive cafe.Had good shadowy spots and a few benches for the quickest ones to relax.

Nice catus garden but expensive and not to be revisited. The layout and the plants are nice but the famous Yves St Laurent blue paint was peeling in places. It was a tourist trap in reality and you paid more here than for anything else in the city ( and most of that was for tourists too!) Perhaps if you have lots of time in Marrakech it's worth putting on your list but there are better paces to got to absorb the feeling of Marrakech than here. I was disappointed.

Beautiful garden. One of my favorite places in Marrakech. Green and lush. The museum is also worth a visit.
Come early to avoid the lines to the ticket office. Opens at 8 am

Beautiful layout with inspired use of colour. Althought he intial impression n enterign the garden is luke warm it warms up quickly to a thoroughly enjoyable insight into the minds of artists and designers in their use of colour, shape and style - do go into the Berber Museum within the grounds, the jewellery display is inspiring - well worth the effort to go.

Lovely. Lovely gardens. Great place to stroll and sit for a while. We went in February and it wasn't too busy. I would imagine in the summer it does get very busy but would be great as it is very shady and good place to escape the summer heat. Museum is only 3 rooms and cost 25 dirhams more. We went in but probably wouldn't have bothered if we had known what was in it.
Serene calm within the storm that is Marrakesh . We absolutely loved Jardin Majorelle. Such a beautiful place to just wander around and enjoy the calm and quiet. My favourite 'sight' in Marrakesh.

Very famous.. A must see which is probably a cliche so I wasn't quick to visit, was pleasant to visit,can get busy with bouts of peace. Queued to get in 9am but went fast enough.More expensive than other attractions but some goes to good causes.
Just Beautiful!. Gorgeous home in the new part of Marrakech. The Berber museum was a treat not to be missed. Made me go home and want to paint my house in matte blue!

Lots of cactus!. We visited expecting lots of different plants but most of the plants are cactus. Not sure why since Morocco has some wonderful gardens. It was a nice walk and a relaxing but unless you're into cactus I'd skip it.

Beautiful Gardens!. Such stunning gardens and a really nice place to go and relax and wander around for an hour or two. After the bustle and noise of the souks, the gardens were a nice change of pace and good to get out of the heat of the sun.
Desaponinted. I went to those gardens atracted because was the former residence of Yves Saint laurent and interior of the house is just a museum without any trace of Yves ...

Must see. Very simple. Go early in the morning, avoid the crowds. It is not big, and very popular. Do visit the little museum, it is very well done. Should not take more than 20 minutes, very worthy to understand a bit more about the Berbers
Ekram. We went but only did gardens and not museum go lost in this maze of beautiful plant and trees overall you can waste about 1 hour in here

Gorgeous. Beautiful garden and wonderful opportunity for photo shoots.
Vibrant colors, detailed design, lush greenery.
peace and quiet. lovely colours, the sound of water, the wind in the trees... it's Yves garden, his homage to the city.

Beautiful and very clean!. Beautiful gardens dedicated to Yves Saint Laurent.
Stunning plants and a lovely informative museum.
Definitely worth a visit.
Relaxing in the beauty!. Beautiful garden, amazing plants, great views, sit and enjoy! Additionally, you can see some nice small art exhibitions.
Go early. Fantastic garden, we went early when quiet. I imagine it could feel very crowded very quickly. Amazing oasis in the bustle of the city. Easily accessible on foot.
Quite an expensive garden. Nice garden - but a bit of a rip off price-wise, the museum was interesting but was quite small and not extensive

Simply beautiful. We paid 10 dirham each and the garden was beautiful. Well laid out and just a bit of Paradise in a very busy chaotic city. There are plants from around the world, with water features it was very tranquil as we visited around 10am. It was starting to get busy and that would of made it harder to see everything. There is seating areas in the shade which are welcome in the heat.The courtyard cafe was a lovely little place to re charge and plan the next part of the day. The YSL monument is in as very tranquil spot and this whole garden was a thoroughly relaxing experience a must see in Marrakech
lovely gardens but not that large. very well maintained gardens but not that great compared with gardens in other cities. We didn't do the museum so only walked around gardens
Beautiful gardens. Enjoyed our trip to the gardens. beautiful and peaceful, but very crowded. A little hard to walk around.
Unexpected gem. What a lovely tranquil garden in the middle of the new city. The museum is a must, it celebrates the Berber people.

Gorgeous. The gardens are beautiful and very well kept. Worth a visit as it offers a welcome break from the sensory-overload of the Medina. There is a price for foreigners and price for locals. Children under 12 are free.

Yves Saint Laurent Gardens. A beautiful oasis of calm in a busy city - well worth a visit. The gardens themselves are lovely and the cafe was popular with a good varied menu and not expensive. The gardens are situated away from the main area of Marrakech so quite a walk and are actually alot smaller than we thought. You only need an hour for the visit.
Small haven in Marrakech. If you want to get away for a pleasant walk and enjoy a great museum then this will suit your perfectly.
If you like gardens, interesting. You may have to queue to get in. On show is a variety of plants from around the world set out as a show piece. There is an optional museum and shops and cafe.

A beautiful retreat from the chaos of the city. This may be outside the Medina walls but, it is very worth going to. The gardens are beautiful and the extra 10 dirhams to also view the museum is well worth it.
A cool and tranquil haven. A fascinating art nouveau garden, latterly owned by Yves Saint-Laurent. Stunning colours for the buildings, including the cobalt now known as bleu Majorelle. Lovely cafe.

DREAM OF AN ARTIST. MAJORELLA GARDENS (Jardin Majorelle)Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful private garden developed by a French painter Jacques Majorelle (1886-1962) who lived in a house located within the garden which he named “Villa Oasis”. He took 40 years to adorn 12 acre garden with a varied species of plants and trees, bubbling streams, embracing pools and refreshing fountains. It is the most visited tourist place in whole of Morocco. The entry fee was 70 Dirhim (roughly 8 US$) in December 2015, with additional 30 Dirhim for an average type of Art Museum inside the garden. The garden has very charming atmosphere. The most striking feature of the garden is the vibrant blue color which is noticeable from its buildings, pool, fountains, footpaths, etc. It is one of the few places worth visiting in Marrakesh. It was open to public in 1947. After the death of Jacques Majorelle, the heirs decided to do away with the garden and plans for construction of a hotel on the site were in the offing when a French couple Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Berge bought it in 1980 and decided to continue it as a garden. After the death of Saint Laurent in 2008, his widow Pierre donated the garden to a Paris based foundation which is now successfully maintaining the garden as a best refreshing place in Marrakesh. The Foundation also built a memorial of Saint Laurent in the garden.

Nice place, 30mins max. I walked here from the old city, it took about 45 mins ( leisurely walk). Paid approx 70 dirhams as non locals (they pay approx half) just for the garden. It was nice, but you could complete a walk within 15 mins.!!We spent about an hour as we had to feed the baby, it was nice and relaxing. We didn't try the restaurant. Would I recommend, not really. You could spend the time better somewhere else.
Oasis of colour . Beautiful gardens. Amazing colours and insight into Berber history! A quiet oasis away from the madness of New town Marrakech!

Tiny!. Very nice, but you can walk round it in 5 minutes.
Cafe was extortionate! Didn't eat there after seeing the prices.
Taxi from medina to gardens cost 40 Dhs

Time out of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The best thing about this garden is its instant calming effect. Marrakech is a great city but it is crowded, noisy and hectic. Step inside le Jardin Majorelle and you can feel yourself unwinding as soon as you enter, to be surrounded by giant bamboo. The garden is quite small and if it is just another box to tick on your itinerary, you could walk round in a very short time. However if you just relax into being surrounded by beautiful plants, impressive cacti and the bright blue stonework, you can sit in the shade for a while and enjoy this oasis. A recommended breathing space

Highlight. Loved it was the highlight of my trip. Stunning and peaceful despite the high numbers do fellow tourist it was easy to find a quiet reflective spot. Lovely little cafe had an amazing rate and avocado smoothy. Could have melted my credit card in the gift shop.

Beautiful Garden. Although the gardens are a bit hard to find as a result of the fact that there are no sidewalks outside the garden. Inside the gardens are beautiful, with the brightly painted pots and the huge cacti and palm trees. The kids loved the wide array of cacti inside the gardens. There is water available for sale inside the gardens and the cafe had plenty options. Over all it was a great place to walk around and unwind and let the kids explore. After a nice visit, there are plenty of places just outside to get an ice cream and grab a carriage ride back to the Medina (old city).

Lovely even in January. We were happy to take a open can out of the medina and across modern Marrakech to the Jardin Majorelle. What a spectacular effort by one man to create an incubation area for plants being brought in from all parts of the world so they would survive and thrive. It wasn't in full bloom but the different areas of the gardens were exceptional. We particularly enjoyed the bamboo plantings, the exceptionally made fountains with koi swimming around oblivious to the world. The uniqueness of some of the plantings from far flung islands and continents showed his dedication. It was unfortunate it had begun to deteriorate and extremely interesting to find Yves St Laurant had paid to have the gardens brought back to their former glory. There is a memorial to him within the garden. What is not mentioned here is the fascinating (priced separately) Berber museum within the garden. What a spectacular collection of clothing, art, and artifacts of the original Moroccans. Between the gardens and the museum it was a wonderful afternoon spent worlds away from the hustle bustle of the medina.
Nice to see but out of the way. Lovely gardens but a little out of the way to get to. A very popular attraction, and was very busy as we walked around. A little smaller than expected.

Small and very expensive. If you like architecture, perfect. If you are looking for a garden in which you can just wander, not so perfect. The garden is rather small and is by far not a botanical garden (which they do say it is). I missed the small spots were you can just sit, relax and read a book, for a spare hour. Just walking the full round takes you some 15 minutes and sets you back around 8 euro's.

Cacti and a cacophony of colours!. Beautiful gardens, a lovely way to spend an hour. The gardens are quite small. There is also a cafe and museum here. We didn't go to cafe it looked expensive! The entrance fee was 7 Euro. I think this was over priced , 4 Euro would have been enough! We got a horse and carriage here from the square. It was a lovely way to get here. A taxi back to the main square was about 5 Euro.

An oasis of calm. Having visited here five years ago a return visit with friends was high on our list of things to do on this visit. The beautifully kept gardens, colours and tranquility make it a real oasis of calm from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. The museum is a wonderful introduction to the Berbers and the helpful information cards in each room provided a goodinsight into the country.
Beautiful peaceful garden in the heart of the city. What a gorgeous garden! This is such a beautiful place and I love the planting the the colour. Well worth a visit

Just Ok. A bit overrated to be the #1 thing in Marrakech. Better for families with young children who want to take an afternoon to sit in the cafe. It's very small and my husband and I walked around it twice in less than 20 minutes.
great place. it was a great place we really enjoyed our walk there in garden majorrel , you shoud visit it if you are in marrakech

Amazing oasis. In a hectic city this amazing space and oasis is a gentle calming place to relax and admire a great collection of plants. The cafe is a welcome surprise hidden within the gardens and at 70mad this place is well worth a visit.

Jardin Majorelle. Nice garden to visit. It's on the north, very French-feeling side of Marrakech. This garden isn't a must see, but if you have time it's a nice stop. They also offer discount admission if you show your student ID.
Nature and lovely place. Very nice place to spent when you visit Marrakech you will find different flour and trees with a Moroccan design plus a small gallery's inside

A Hidden Oasis. This Garden is a very beautiful place; nice and quite and containing the largest cacti I have ever seen. Yves Saint Laurent and his friend paid for its restoration; thank goodness he did before it was turned into a block of flats.

Oasis in Marrakesh. You should take some time for visiting the gardens as the hot day is wwll spend in a garden. There are quit a lot of people sometimes but its still a tranquil place and worth a visit.

Lovely afternoon outside of the medina. This garden is beautiful, as would be expected from Yves Saint Lauren. It isn't a full day adventure. Give yourself 30-60 minutes as an afternoon break from the hustle and bustle of the medina.

Rather small garden. A bit over rated as the "#1 attraction" in Marrakech according to trip advisor. Took me only 5 minutes to walk through it. Filled with mostly tourists, many of whom in the past have carved their names into lots of the plants. If it were in the central part of the Medina, it'd be a nice reprieve, but it's a bit out of the way to get to if you're staying in the central part of the old town. Spent about 20 minutes taking photos and left.
Fantastic place. Very tranquil and exceptionally tidy and well maintained. Great cafe and the museum is well worth the extra cost. Never seen such tall Cacti in my life!
Peaceful . This is an extraordinarily place in Marrakech- the only disappointment was it was very busy.... However worth a visit. Very very well maintained

An oasis of caln. So grateful we ignored the people who told us that the garden was closed the day we went. Beautiful colour scheme and relaxing paradise just a few minutes walk from the medina. A must see

Beautiful gardens, plenty of seats. We walked here from the Medina, took us about 20 mins. Finding the entrance was a bit challenging but locals helped. There are plenty of seats to sit and admire the palms, bamboos and water features and there are plenty of interpretive boards for those with a particular botanical interest.

Cool Place in the Middle of Hot City. We came here in Sunday so it was many people there. We had to queue for around 10 minutes to buy the tickets. We didn't buy ticket for the museum. However you can still visit Yves Saint Laurent gallery because it's in the outside of the museum.I love to see the cactus plants in this garden. I didn't know that cactus can grow that tall.Overall it's a nice garden. It's clean. They place officers in almost every corner of the garden. And the ambiance is cozy.

Overrated. Expensive and touristy.. I had high hopes for this place, especially considering the pricy entrance fee. However I was quite disappointed with the garden and the museum. The garden looks nicer on pictures than in real and the museum is pretty small (it only has 3 rooms inside). I recommend going only if you have a lot of time to kill. Otherwise, go to the gardens of La Mamounia hotel; they have one of the most beautiful gardens in Morocco.

Tranquil oasis. I can imagine in the height of summer, this is a cooling oasis to visit, lots of shade. We enjoyed having a wander round the gardens .... and the vibrant colours. You can buy the iconic Majorelle Blue paint in the gift shop. Am looking forward to giving my garden a splash of that colour. 70 dirhams entry fee, free for under 12s. 70 dirhams felt a bit steep.
Beautiful . Stunning gardens and a fascinating Berber museum that should not be missed. Particularly the sky of star in the jewellery room. Cafe pretty but pricy.
Must see in Marrakech!. Beautiful gardens and a lovely break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Spectacular colors in the building and loved taking pictures of it all. Highly recommend!

Very beauriful. Ok, it isn't huge but it is beautiful. For a trip out with the children it was perfect for an hour. It is very well kept and some beautiful planting- the children loved the huge variety of cacti and the bamboos make it very serene. The pools need a good clean, but the blue and yellow walls and pots are stunning and we had a lovely visit
Beautiful, nothing else like it. We went there and walked around for a couple hours and took some amazing pictures. We had lunch at the cafe inside and it was very good as well

Busy. This is by far the most expensive tourist sight to visit in Marrakech, though this didn't stop the hordes of tourists there. It's a peaceful garden nonetheless, quite small, and if the entrance fee was reduced by 50% it would be an essential visit.It's well worth paying the extra 30 dirhams to see the Berber museum.The courtyard restaurant was extremely busy and the staff perfunctory - although one waiter was very helpful and considerate. The food was middling, prices high, but it was OK. It's probably best to eat before visiting, though restaurants outside the main gate were pricey and very busy at lunchtime.

A gorgeous oasis. I am not a huge fan of 'gardens' but this place is a must. Tranquil, beautiful and stylish. A great spot for pictures. The small cafe area is idyllic if a bit pricey. A perfect stop to get away from the hustle and bustle of the souks and city centre.

Oasis! . After reading a few reviews that said the garden was mediocre, we were unsure whether or not to visit. We are so glad we did! It's incredibly lovely!! Beautifully maintained with a huge variety of cacti and amazingly coloured buildings. A lovely, cool oasis in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Highly recommended!
Expensive and Standard.... Not worth a visit. Just a simple garden without much interest. Much better places to see in Marrakech than loosing time here.

TAKE ME BACK!. Stunning place. Absolutely loved it. We took a horse carriage to the gardens and it was just sublime! Really fascinating, amazing for pictures and just beautiful. A trip to the YSL gardens is a MUST if you're in Marrakech. You will not be disappointed.

Lovely place. I have visited Morocco many time and all the time I go to Marrakech i loved to visit the Jardin Majorelle such a great place. If u are planning your trip to Morocco and you been to Marrakech this is one of the greatest place to visit.
Cute place . We had visited this garden and we really liked it. We walked around it and it's a great place to relax and to enjoy moment in marrakech,
Beautiful gardens. Tourist hotspot. Well worth a visit. Beautiful gardens. Many different plants and a chance to get away from the hussle and bussle of Marrakech

Relaxing and beautiful garden. Lovely to spend some time away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. The weather was perfect and made the garden all the more perfect.Try going earlier in the day when its not so busy.
beautiful garden and interesting. this garden was beautiful and the walk through it is amazing , relaxing and pacefull , you should visit it

Return visit. We love this place. Worth an hour of anyone's time when in Marrakech. Such a contrast to the Medina. We walked here from the square in about 45 mins. Quite easy to find if you head first for Riad Larousse and then head straight on out of the city walls. Cross the big road and head for the Palm trees ahead of you!
Dissapointing. We had heard it would be so beautiful but it's really not that big deal. Can be seen in 15 minutes and is not located in the best area of Marrakech
Beautiful. Amazing gardens, beautiful plants and the house/museum had a lovely blue colour. Loved the giant bamboo

Nice, but not amazing. If you have free time to kill, it's worth a wonder but it's nothing to fret if you miss it. Lots of plants/trees from all over the world so that's always interesting... if you're into that sort of thing.

Lovely but overpriced. It's hard to say whether this garden is worth the price: 200 Dirham to include the museum. It was beautiful but there are many other gardens and parks for much less or even free in other parts of the world. The colours and plants were lovely and the garden is well kept. If you are happy with this price you won't be disappointed

The YSL Gardens. A snip of history where fashion meets architecture, meets landscaping. The striking blue masonry and mature plants make this a must see for anyone travelling to Morocco. As you would expect, the entry is a little more expensive than Bahia or Madrasa because of the celebrity connection, but its not extortionate.Again, no queues and plenty of photo opportunities. There are some famous places to strike a pose. Namely, the house and 30ft cactus plant. Stef and I visited with friends who hadn't even heard of the Jardin Majorelle, but once they were in, we found it hard to pull them out. The gardens have been sympathetically maintained and the art gallery and shops are a good place to buy trinkets . You can't go inside the house, so don't get your hopes up. It takes around 20-30mins to see everything but you might find yourself staying much longer to take pictures in every corner of this amazing attraction. Make sure you take a drink and something to eat if you do plan on staying longer, as there wasn't anywhere to buy proper food nd the drinks dispenser outside the gardens wasn't cheap.

calm and beautiful. even though the park/garden is far from being empty, the set up, the green and the shade in Jardin Majorelle are like an oasis in chaotic and dusty Marrakech. if you're tired or simply if you want to enjoy some tranquillity, sit on a bench and watch the birds

Beautiful, interesting and tranquil. My daughter loves the color blue, so we decided to take her, beautiful gardens and ponds, interesting plants to look at, loads of photos to take. The only problem is there are no picnic areas, so probably a no go to take your own food as there is no where to eat apart from an expensive cafe. But worth going. Not expensive to get in, but any info is in French no English to read whilst walking around. Shame.
Beautiful. A great visit in a very romantic garden. The trees are amazing and the atmosphere is very enchanting.

A peaceful paradise in Marrakech. The former residence of the French fashion icon designer Saint Laurent is now a garden open to public and managed by its charity foundation. It has a very interesting collection of cactus and threes, with romantic sounds of birds and water. The central house contrasts the plants with its shining blue, it's a piece of art.

A beautiful place for a peaceful afternoon of tranquil garden viewing other great stuff.. We stopped at this amazing place on our way out of town to return to our home in El Jadida. It is a true hidden gem.
Beautiful gardes filled with exotic plant collections from around the globe and a very interesting museum of well currated collections of Moroccan native dress, jewelry, and

Vibe colors, amazing trees and plants from all over the planet. Relaxing atmosphere. . YSL house, gardens and graphic work.
Totally worth it to go for a relax wolk The perfect place to escape from the noise of the city and enjoy the vibrant colors of this garden. Beautiful and memorable Majorelle blue building surrounded by a spectacular garden. Ideal for a photo shutting ;).

Not the Marrakech norm.... Jardin Majorelle us something of an oddity in Marakech. It definitely has a western feel, the gardens not layed out as you would expect in this area of North Africa. There is an abundance of well tended cacti and palms between formal features in Majorelle Bleu. The gardens are calm if you visit before the selfie taking hoards arrive. Make sure you visit early and do take in the Berber Museum. Worth the extra fee

Blue oasis. The jardin is absolutely amazing. A huge variety of different plants gathered in one place around a beautiful villa. The water, plants and atmosphere are remarkable; an oasis of quiet in the middle of Marrakech. Can see why Yves St Laurent bought the place.
Amazing Place. This place is charming and amazing! You can walk around, relax and take many pictures :)I absolutely recommend it!

Excellent . Fabulous gardens well worth the visit and also the little berber museum. As well as the plants there is a nice little court yard where refreshments are available and it's lovely to sit back in

Seriously overpriced!. Entrance ticket is 70dhm/person and you have to pay extra for the museum. It's ok, various plants and cacti and some YSL prints on display. Not sure why this is the number 1 attraction.

Cool place but expensive ... for Marraakech!. It is definately a nice place to visit, particularly when it is hot as it is a very nice shady garden. Definately the 70dhm ticket and the 30dhm for the museum is way too much for what you get. Yves Saint Laurent name adds value but nothing else except of some stuff in their shop. In contrary there is a very nice modern cafe opposite of the entrance.

Get there early!. A pleasant enough, well-maintained garden with lots of well-labelled plants. Hard for pedestrians to find the entrance. Home also to a Berber museum which, though only a few years old, was mostly of old-fashioned presentation (captions in French but English translations of patchy merit on clipboards) except for a stunning jewellery room, dark, mirrored, "star-lit". Entrance (100dh with the museum) is pricey by marrakesh standards but still the place was overwhelmed with selfie-sticks.

Mood Indigo. These gardens are little short of spectacular, with an introduction via mature cactus plants, and all the surroundings backed up with the intense blue indigo (Souvenir cans of which can be purchased from the gift shop in Acrylic form). There is a small monument to Yves St Laurent, There is also a museum, a print shop, and a coffee shop. Lovely to just amble around on a half-day trip.
great place. we visited this garden in marrakech and it was a beautiful place that must to visit if you are in marrakech

Go early. I like gardens, but we were disappointed with this one. Very small, very busy and not particularly interesting. We walked round it twice in 10 minutes!! Probably best to go early in the day if you want to catch the peace, tranquility and beauty enjoyed by Yves St Laurent

Well worth the visit.. As beautiful as you'd expect. It's outside the Media but if you're not in a hurry then get a horse drawn carriage to take you there, wait a hour (or even two) and then bring you back to your hotel/riad. Entry to the Jadin and museum was 100 Dirham and the carriage ride was about 400 Dirham (about £30/$45 - Feb'16). Well worth it for a romantic afternoon.
Peace and tranquility. This is a beautiful garden - level to walk around and not too large. There is a small museum for a small additional charge.
Relaxing Retreat. A must see attraction while in MarrakechA great way to escape the insanity of the city and enjoy the serenity of the gardens

Stunning gardens. These gardens are absolutely stunning, and well worth a visit to escape the hustle and bustle of the markets and the heat of the sun. They can be a bit tricky to find, but we were taken there by a guide, then got a taxi back to the main square very easily.

A Pleasant Distraction. This is a bit of a strange attraction, it's main appeal is that it is so different from what else is on offer in the city but you wouldn't be missing much if you skipped it. It is indeed very pretty and it's fairly cheap, but at the end of the day its a garden. If you are there a short period of time there are better things to be doing.
Beautiful. Lots of (other) turists ;-) but we still find it worth going there because of the fantastic colors. Majorelle Bleu!!

Underwhelmed. A nice cafe but slightly disappointing gardens. It felt quite busy even though we visited at lunchtime as we were advised this was the quietest time; perhaps as the gardens are quite small. The gardens are planted with bamboo, palm trees, cacti and a few tropical flowering plants.
Visit of Jardin. Nice lunch program since the plants and trees provide shade during the hot midday sun. More a 1-hour stay than a half-day program.

Worth a detour!. An excellent contrast to the crowded souks and squares in the in the old town.
We did enjoy the modern cafe next to the garden too after we had spent two days in the traditional areas of Marrakesh.
great garden. our visit to majorelle garden was so niice , it was so beautiful and fantastiic we had a great time exploering this place

Quiet and relaxing however not worth the money. What I liked:* Quiet and relaxing garden in the middle of city* A lot of birds and fish* Colors of the building are vivid and niceWhat I disliked:* 70MAD for entrance in the garden seems too much for what it offers* Garden is not very big - all can be discovered in less then 10 min* Mostly full of tourists
Not many flowers . Not sure if it's the time of year but not many flowers. Small but well worth a visit. Make sure you haggle with the taxi drivers. We paid 30d from the square and 40d back.

Beautiful but Expensive . The gardens are probably the most fashionable attraction in the city which is what I assume drives the price tag. However, I recommend paying the extra for the Berber museum inside the gardens, it breaks up the short walk around the garden itself and allows you to immerse in culture and history.

Vibrant colors. The perfect place to escape from the noise of the city and enjoy the vibrant colors of this garden. Beautiful and memorable Majorelle blue building surrounded by a spectacular garden. Ideal for a photo shutting ;).
Nice place to spend a morning. Beautiful gardens, very calm with wide variety to view. Arrive early as it gets busy. Well worth a visit
Very nice. A must to visit in Marrakech, the garden is beautiful. Great spot to take fotos. There is also a Berber Museum
Tranquil gardens. Lovely, peaceful gardens to visit - there is a café so try to go at lunchtime and enjoy the lovely food
a wonderful respit. This is a charming little garden in the middle of Marrakech outside of the old city where you can spend an hour or so walking the gorgeous gardens.
nice garden and so beautiful. We visited Jardin Majorelle and we had a great walk and amazing time during our walk in this garden , so beautiful

Ikea with cacti and palm trees. Very peaceful and cool garden. Ikea colour scheme is somewhat deflecting.
Highly amusing phallic memorial to YSL and somewhat of a mecca for gay travellers but overall a great experience. Gallery is great. Berber museum somewhat interesting. Great cafe.
Good place to while away a few hours.
nice garden. nice garden , we have visited this attraction , and it was so nice , we love it and so lovely , you must to visit it if you are in marrakech
Beautiful!. For a nice afternoon lunch and stroll and great if you love cactus. I skipped the museum but the garden were amazing. Great place for pictures.
this is a must. choose early or late to beat the crowds nice café as well it will give you a haven of peace and tranquillity after all the hurly burly

Indeed the most beautiful garden i Marrakech. Yes, you can take some amazing pictures here. It truely is colourful and different.
Smaller than I expected, but nice!
Beautiful tranquillity. A beautiful place with a truly wonderful collection of cacti. The quiet, water features and shady ambiance encourage a contemplative mood.

Overpriced but tranquil and lovely place. This place cost 70 MAD for an adult. For the price, it's very small and there were not much variation in the types of plants. There were only bamboo, agave, cactus, and Palm trees. Additionally, there were some different colored flowers on various vines.The only redeeming fact was that it completely blocked out all the sounds and sights of the busy city.We did not bother going into the museum as it is another 40MAD. Our time was better spent enjoying other greenery in the city such as "cyber parc". It is better located and not packed with tourist lining up to take pictures at various spots. I would recommend Cyber parc which is next to the main square (Jamaa el fna). Additionally, you can see local Moroccans enjoying life with their family and you feel more immersed in Moroccan culture.

Now I get it :)!. When I first saw that the first place on TP for Marrakesh is a Garden, I didn't understand it. Why a garden is a favourite place in a north-african city, but after I visited I get it. It's a very beautiful garden, a quiet place in a shaken city. Isn't my favourite place in Marrakesh, but I understand how this jardin is a favourite for european tourists.

Designer Desert. This is what happens when an artist designs a tropical garden and it is restored by designers. It's a rather beautiful tropical garden with a gorgeously coloured building as the focus. Don't miss the Berber Museum there, beautifully designed and pretty interesting.
Garden design. An interesting garden to visit with cafe, museum and shop. There were however too many people when we visited so would suggest going either early morning or late afternoon/evening.
Nice view. The place is very calming, lots of trees and blue buildings. Very different from the typical view of Marrakech. Highly recommended.
nice garden. we visited this garden in marrakech , and it was so cute and atraktive place , we really enjoyed our tume there

Favorite place in Marrakech . This was a stunning reprieve from the noise and exhaust of the city. I would go back again if I could. It was not expensive but the garden and the Berber museum left a big impression. There is no better place in Marrakech for Berber culture.
place to visit when in marrakech. If you love nature and colors this is a nice place for you . The visit might take 2 hours. There is entrance fees and it's a good place to visit when in marrakech.
Blue pearl of Marrakech. Such a beautiful and tranquil garden where to spend your afternoon. The ticket costs 40 MDH for an adult (non-resident).

Beautiful gardens with wide variety of plants. This is a beautiful garden with a lovely monument to YSL. Although entry is slightly more than at other sites, it is a top Marrakech sight and worth a view. Take time to admire the scenery and the vibrant colours that adorn the pots and walls

Relaxing Retreat. A 45min walk around these beautiful gardens are a lovely way to escape the hustle and bustle of the medinas. Located outside of the old walled city, they are an oasis of calm and tranquility, with water features and an array of exotic plants. There is also a Berber museum, a shop selling YSL goods, expensive but nice to look at, and a cafe if you fancy a drink or light meal. A nice way to spend a sunny afternoon.

Beautiful Peaceful place. Really lovely Oasis in a very chaotic busy place! Stunning gardens, small but fantastic.. the entrance is a challenge to find and the hoards of taxi drivers trying to lure you was a trial but once inside this oasis of calm was a refreshing change from the chaos I found in Marrakesh.

Nice garden but a bit too crowded. It is a beautiful garden a bit out of the city centre. It is not very big and a bit overpriced. Do not go there on Weekends as it is crowded then and loses its charm a bit.

Awesome Garden and Berber Museum. A must visit place whenever in Marrakech where we can find the Memorial of Yves Saint Laurent and the story of Berber (Berber Museum). Awesome garden with many kinds of Cactus, nice place for Succulent Lovers, huge Palms etc.
Small but tranquil. Probably a couple of hours is all you need, at the most! However the gardens are still worth seeing. Very tranquil and pretty.

Lovely hour in this small, beautiful garden.. You don't need more than an hour or so to soak in Jardin Majorelle's lovely blue-soaked surrounds, and it's such a nice stop off in Marrakech. I can imagine it's an absolute oasis when the weather gets baking -- glad we had a chance to visit.

Absolutely stunning. This little garden is so beautiful and colourful , it was 70 dihram to get in and well worth it , even though it was busy it felt calm an serene I would definitely go back and sit there again
Amazing colours. The gardens are stunning, with a huge variation of plants all beautifully situated in the most vibrant colours of pots, buildings, bridges, fountains....just amazing.
Peaceful retreat. Lovely setting for a stroll and a seat in an oasis of plants and colour. Small gardens so can be seen within an hour but worth it. Also has a lovely cafe.

Crowded on a sunny afternoon. Initially wondering through these architectural gardens was pleasantly peaceful, apart from the odd gaggle against the water feature. The Berber museum was interesting for me, love jewellery and textiles! However, DH was not so impressed. Heading outside again the gardens had become busy and full of selfie stick wavers, creating tedium as you tried to avoid photo bombing...though at times was tempted! At 100DH for the gardens and museum was a tad overpriced when compared with the content of special exhibitions at the V&A or British Museum. Advice is to go early to avoid the selfies!
peaceful garden in a bustling city. Spent the afternoon of our arrival here. We had a little lunch in the cafe and then spent some time in the Berber museum before enjoying the colours and cacti.
Amazing beauty and peace when not crowded. Second visit but seemed to have improved in 12 years! The new Berber museum was beautifully presented

Beautiful . Well worth a visit. Stunningly beautiful gardens. Plenty of shade. Allow a couple of hours to wander around the gardens visit the berber museum and stop for a drink in the café. The shop has top quality items so you'll need deep pockets but the only offer are well worth it.

Beautiful gardens. We really enjoyed wandering around these gardens. It was nice and quiet when we arrived but seems to get busy in afternoon. The trees, plants, museum, walkways, water features are all bright, colourful and pleasing to the eye.
A tranquil spot close to the the very busy streets and medinas of Marakesh.

Beautiful gardens . We visited these lovely gardens in the second week of February. They are beautiful in their simplicity and are an oasis of calm. Do not take a taxi from outside as they operate a cartel. Walk to the main road and hail one there. The restaurant in the garden is great for lunch. The Moroccan salad being a highlight. Well worth a visit.

Stunning . A real must on your list of places to visit. Quite unique in its design. The history is interesting. The indigo blue house which incorporates the Arab sensibility to water and perspective. Enchanting. Word of warning ... Do not eat in cafe totally overrated, expensive and surly waiter. You are much better off having something in the cafes outside.
Beautiful garden, worth a visit. I think this is one of the sights in Marrakech you should not miss. An oasis in the desert. Just the right size and well maintained. I would visit again.
this is amazing a tranquil oasis. this is such a beautiful place ,, try and go when it is quiet ,, and sit peacefully .. the colours the light .. the tropical plants .... argghh !

Interesting, but crowded and overpriced. Very touristy, very crowded. The interpretative signs are few, far between, and generally disappointing. For me, just walking around Marrakech let me find something more interesting to do.
Beautiful, tranquil and worth a visit!. Beautiful garden and well worth the walk or taxi ride out of town. Peaceful and cool in the heat of the Marrakech day.
Amazing!. This place is amazing to visit and a definite recommendation - it is a great place to go to take some amazing photos due to the wide variety of plants and other items

Beautiful oasis in the heart of Marrakech. This is a beautifully designed garden with a stunning collection of cacti...The Berber museum inside should not be missed - gorgeous collection of Beber jewels & clothing...

Lovely gardens, great Berber museum. Just outside the main medina are the Majorelle gardens - providing a calm, relaxing retreat away from the in-your-face old town and Jemma al fna.Lovely mix of trees, exotic plants, water, and birds. Along the paths are brightly coloured pots with lots of the brilliant majorelle blue on show. Then proceed to the excellent little Berber museum with dress, art and artifacts over a few centuries. Lovely

The blue paradise in Marrakech heart. It was such a beautiful place to see a pretty nice garden in Marrakech , I enjoyed our walk there , get visit. Yves Saint Laurent and his partner, great and amazing!!!
Garden visit. Peaceful atmosphere although many Tourists best early morning or late afternoon arrived by horse drawn carriage a colourful experiance.

slightly less than average, the most expensive out of the marrkech sites and the least impressive. slightly less than average, the most expensive out of the marrkech sites and the least impressive, i wouldnt bother with this if i was you

Could have skipped the gardens. This a garden created by Yves Saint Laurent, the famous fashion designer. Plants have been brought to the garden from all over the world. The garden is well manicured and they take very good care of the grounds. The wood is painted in an amazing blue and there were some very interesting cacti to look at. That being said, it wasn't anything that exciting and I found the Medina to be much more interesting. Skip this destination since you have to take transportation to get here and they charge for admission. I didn't find it to be a compelling place to every return to let alone see just once.

Blue garden in the red city. Jardin Majorelle is definitely worth visiting. A wonderful blue and quiet oasis in Marrakesch. The entry fee is rather high compared to the size of the garden but it is well maintained and therefore a "must see". Avoid peak times as it easily gets crowded.
nice. the garden majorelle was out of the old city madina , nice to discover beautiful plantes and strong colors .
Robert. Well worth a visit very peaceful great place for morning coffee don't miss the Berbar museum definitely the highlight

Landmark Garden. Not far outside the city walls, this is an attraction of international renown, and rightly so.It is pricey for Marrakech but worth it, especially if the Berber Museum is also visited - a class above any other museums in the city, beautifully laid out and imaginitively presented.The gardens themselves are remarkable for the cactus and succulents collection and for their history but do not expect a display to the standard of a botanical garden. The cafe is top notch.

one of the best relaxing garden in Marrakech. Majorelle Garden gives the impression to the visitor to fly with the birds of Jean Jacque majorel the creator . full of symbolism and impressionism , this place is realy a liitle peice of Art
Majorelle Gardin. Nice place with interesting flowers and plants, I went because my wife wanted to see them. If I was by myself, I wouldn't of bothered.
Beautiful. Beautiful place. Spent about an hour there walking around taking pictures and having tea at the cafe. Spent 40 dirhams to get there from the medina. Would go again

Oasis of calm in the chaos of Marrakech!. The Jardin Majorelle was saved from development by Yves Saint Laurent in the 1980s, and it is typical of the structured style that the designer brought to his clothes. It provides an island of cool calm in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the city. The Berber Museum (separate admission charge) in the converted studio within the garden, provides a fascinating insight into the art, clothing and lifestyle of the ancient people of Morocco.

Definitely worth a visit . Lovely garden! Well worth a visit when you're in Marrakech. It's 70dirham just for the garden and another 30 if you want to go into the museum. Museum is really interesting.
It's OK.. Did not meet the expectations... Basically only trees. Nice place to walk around in shades of blue but not a big deal

Beautiful photo opp. I liked this delightful place. Expensive yes, but it provides lots of opportunities for wonderful pics. We went there at 16:45, 45 minutes before the gates closed and were rewarded with plenty of opportunities to take pictures without people in it. The place has a quiet beauty to it. Very charming. You don't need more than 30 minutes if you don't want to visit the museum or the cafe.

Blue heaven!. After walking here from the medina along a hot and fairly ugly stretch of road (about 30 minutes) the garden was just amazing to walk into.The three of us split up and went exploring the cacti garden and ponds our own pace. The cobalt blue cubist inspired villa is just stunning! Tip -wear something that matches/compliments the colour. Such a brilliant backdrop. Just had a light meal in cafe . Berber museum is an incredible and well thought out display. The shop was interesting. The garden was one of the highlights of our trip. Stunning visuals. Allow a couple of hours, don't rush it.
beautiful garden. full great tuff and nice walk around this garden , we feelt free there , to enjoy it , we had a great time there

Jardin Majorelle - Mémorial Yves Saint Lauren. Totally must see.An amazing memorial garden in memory of life and art of Yves Saint Lauren.Includes a little Berber museum, one delicious bar, where u can drink a mint the in the middle of this amazing park, and a little exposition of Yves paper art.
Lovely gardens just outside medina. These gardens are easy to get to and well sign posted. The entrance to the garden is just outside of the medina. A lovely oasis of peace and quite.
Amazing Gardens. This is a great place to visit but it is best to get there early before the bus and hotel tour parties arrive and queues get big. Beautifully kept gardens
Glorious garden. A must for all garden/Yves Saint Laurent fans the world over. A remarkable combination of art, design, use of colour and wonderful plantings.

Definitely not worth it. 7 euros to see some plants? In Marrakesh? When there are so many other fascinating things to see? I don't understand why this place is so highly recommended. I love plants, this is pretty but not that big and not worth the time and money. The only thing it did for me was provide some calm and green after the souks, still don't get it.

Totally disagree with reviewer PavoEs!. I felt somewhat underwhelmed with some of the attractions Marrakech has to offer but these (I think mainly cacti) wonderfully tended gardens are a magnificent, tranquil haven set off by the vivid cobalt blue building and the entry fee of around 7 eur (10 with the museum) is far from being overpriced. I'd recommend seeing the Berber exhibits, beautifully displayed and the little room displaying the jewellery with the cleverly angled mirrored walls and tiny white lights evoke a North African starry sky perfectly, hats off to whoever designed it it's quality. Good also to see YSL's 'Love' posters...to sum up, a great all-rounder and you don't have to be a fashion fan for this to be a must-see.

Beyond description. Take your camera! The gardens are so wonderfully laid out. You can see the design was well thought out. Had some lovely exhibitions of nomadic culture. You can't go to Marrakech without stopping here.

A park for all tasts. If you love natural beauties, love trees and cactuses, if you are looking for a refuge from a bustling city than this is the place. The entrance is a little bit higher than in other attractions in Marakch but still affordable for what you see....
Nice garden... But nothing amazing!. Nice garden, with a ridiculous price for such a small place. Guess you have to pay for the name. I am sure you can find something better to do in Marrakech.
Beautiful place. Great time in the Garden of Ives Saint Laurent. Very well maintained. Not very big but rich in beautiful plants, berbermuseum, gallery of art. Recommend!

The spirit of YSL. This garden had been on my top 5 to do on my recent visit to Marrakech. Smaller than I had expected but quite delightful and a nice contrast to the hustle and bustle of the medina. A must do if visiting this great city.
Very nice place but smaller than expected.... Lots of plants, nice colours and light... perfect for foto shootings.. good for 2-3 hours of excitement... a must seen in marrakech...

Stunning colours. This was a lovely surprise. The variety of plants was very broad. It was a gentle stroll around the gardens. The bright majorelle blue adds to the vibrancy of the colours. The studio with Yves St Laurent pictures was an added bonus. Stop at the cafe and have a mint tea. Definitely worth it
Magnificent garden. A tranquil oasis of exotic cacti and plants proving a cool atmosphere to the hot and hectic pace of Marrakech . Amazing museum to see also.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens were lovely; such a calm oasis away from the busy Medina! I would definitely recommend visiting. Although they are a little small, don't let this put you off as they are well worth a visit.

An escape from the chaos. Nice place to escape from the chaos of the medina. Located outside the walls of the old city it's definitely worth making the effort to visit. Beautiful gardens with brightly coloured features throughout. The memorial for YSL was slightly disappointing as the rest of the garden was so vibrant. There is a little museum within the gardens which costs extra to visit but I would recommend doing so. Overall a morning well spent.

Nice but over rated. We saved our February visit for a sunny day and arrived at 10.30 to a long queue. It took 15mins to buy 2 tickets (100dhs each including the Berber museum). This is 5 times the price of any other site of interest in Marrakech. The garden is quite small - and unless you want to sit at one of the very few seats - you will need no more than 30mins to walk around. Lovely colours on the building against the sky but personally I thought Ben Youssef is far more rewarding in terms of culture, photos and fewer crowds.
Beautiful . Wonderful place, great for pictures and taking a break on the busy crazy streets of Marrakech. Ask for a taxi in your hotel, I think they will be cheaper than the ones in the street

Worth visiting. Really interesting with some lovely colours. You can also visit the museum and learn all about the Berbers, plus you can shop at the boutique which is not cheap!! Nice little cafe to have something to eat.
Very pretty. I would recommend a trip here - its very pretty and is interesting if you like Yves Saint Laurent. Has a nice cafe to sit and enjoy the surroundings.
beautiful place. Great place. Such relief to be out of the dirty Medina! Worth a visit for sure! There is an extra fee for Berber Museum-not too worth it-Definitely not if you have young kids.

Not worth of spending 7 euros!. Nothing special, the most expensive attraction in Marrakesh and the most disappointing! Overcrowded, far from the Medina and overpriced. If you not a huge fan of plants or a maniac of YSL don;t fond there anything interesting,
Beautiful. If you go to Marrakech, you must try and come here, especially on a sunny day, the colours are exquisite!

Rather pricey but a lovely experience. 70 dirhams just for the gardens and 30 dirhams for the tiny museum totalling 100 dirhams- 10 euros is I think quite steep but it is a must in a city that does not have too many sites and monuments to visit that have been well maintained. The gardens are lovely but if they are crowded you cant take a single photo - the exhibition of YSL collages is small but lovely and it is a great shame that on my 3rd visit here they still do not offer posters of these collages for sale - the sales assistants in the library are disinterested and almost rude and I walked straight in and out after the gentleman at the cash desk was more interested in his computer than giving out any information. The tea room which is outside in a little courtyard is sweet but very pricey by marrakech standards as is the shop. However it is a joy to walk around these gardens with vibrant colours. Worth a visit.

A little haven.... The place is a little haven; a real havre de paix located just between the old and new parts of the Marrakech. It's just 15 -20 minutes walk from the famous Jamaa Elfna square, and 10-15 minutes walk from Gueliz. If you're lost, feel free to ask anyone you come across. Marrakchis are really cheerful and very helpful.Furthermore, the garden has also a small museum showing some Moroccan antique pieces ( clothes, jewelry, manuscripts...).
A dream come true. I have no word to describe this plase which is absolutely astonishing!! A visit to this place is worth the trip to Marrakech!
enjoyable. Quiet retreat, lovely gardens.An enjoyable escape from all the hustle and bustle of the Medina.The cafe served a good reasonably priced lunch.One of the best we had.

A lovely, peaceful, don't miss, spot in bustling Marrakech. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Jardin Majorelle in the heart of Marrakesh. The gardens are beautiful; the inside displays are fascinating, and the gift shops are absolutely top drawer. We took a horse-drawn carriage ride to get here (highly recommended) and strongly recommend this spot.

Haven in the madness. Beautiful, peaceful oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Don't be tight and not visit the Berber museum in the gardens. Well worth the extra 30Dhs, the best museum we visited whilst there.

Beautiful Gardens. An amazing selection of differing plants and trees in a well laid out and beautiful setting. The Majorelle Blue and Yellow are a constant and enhance everything about the place. A quick tea in a relaxing garden was a pleasure and would also recommend this as a must if visiting Marrakech!
LOVELY PLACE TO VISIT. As with most places you can walk here from the old part of the city, well worth a visit and the Café is good too!

The best £5 I spent during my visit to Marrakech. After the hustle and bustle of the Souk it was wonderful to find this oasis of calm and tranquillity. The colours, the plants, the way the light reflected off the water - it was like entering another world.The site is quite compact and is easily covered in less than an hour - but do allow longer if you just want to chill out. There is a memorial to Yves Saint Laurent (a co-owner) and a small museum (extra £2) which I didn't visit so can't comment on.The gardens are a bit off the beaten track. It took me about 30 mins brisk walk from the main square so you may want to take a taxi to get there.
Beautiful garden. Very well presented and quite, beautiful and big range of cactuses. Barbarian Museum worth to see. Nice place to have a coffee inside too.
pleasant and quiet. Very pleasant and quiet place. It is quite a small for a garden though. I wasn't too keen about the garden. A little pricey

140 Dirhams well spent!. Absolutely stunning garden, the vibrancy of colours and the calm provided by the shadding from the trees is definitely worth some of your time in Marrakesh. The Jardins are outside the Medina.

HEAVEN. Whenever you are bored from crowded streets öf Marracesh come to this garden. It's very clean and be happy whit the singing of birds and lovely plants. Lots of cactus in the garden, a small museum and a cafe.

Cool, calm and pleasant . The gardens aren't huge, but they were a pleasant, tranquil space to wander round. In the winter season they close at 5.30 so we initially thought we would be sport on time for the museum as well, as we arrived around 4. However, half an hour let us see all the gardens and so we did pop in to the museum too. It is also small, but has some interesting exhibits, and the room with the starry sky effect is beautiful. Our 10, 11 and 16yr olds were noncommittal..
Expect better. . Quite small. It has nice shape. It has different plants, from all the world. Organize well. Prices of ticket is more. Finally I can say: Expect more.

Expensive & Overrated. It's got a great collection of plants from five contents and the bold blue color used all over makes for a great picture taking opportunity but for 100 dirhams (70 for the garden & 30 for the museum) it’s a waste. Most of the plants are single specimens and no symmetrical theme is used for making them more appealing. Worst part is, just the names of the plants along with from where are given without any other explanation. It’s overcrowded and had security in every lane, as if the King himself was residing here. The museum was also a waste, had a decent collection but one could probably find more in a Medina shop. It’s the storytelling which makes an exhibit comes alive, which was lacking here.

Few cactuses and a nice blue building... . We have seen lots of positive reviews online and of course this attraction is number on on TripAdvisor so I guess it was a must see. It's a nice garden (actually I thought there aren't many plants there) cactuses and palm trees. The building itself commissioned by mister Majorelle is pretty. The Majorelle blue colour is lovely. And that's it.Yves Saint Laurent bought the garments and after his death they have added a memorial, not very creative (simple column at the end of the garden) to honour him.Sadly enough there aren't many things to see in Marrakech so comparing to other "attractions" this garden probably deserves number 1... Pretty to take a picture to put it on Facebook...

Yves Saint Laurent stayed here. This is on the outskirts of the medina but really worth the effort if you like gardens. Very tranquil and a nice little cafe inside for a refreshing drink and light lunch.

Nice garden and relaxing atmosphere. We visited the garden around 10 am before most people arrive here and really liked it. The entry is not cheap, that's true (70 MAD for the garden and 30 MAD for the Berber Museum) but it's worth the money if they use it to preserve this oasis in the busy and loud city. There are a lot of different plants from different tropical and desert regions of the world. The park is well maintained and has a great atmosphere which invites to sit down and relax. The Museum is interesting too if you like to know about the history of the local natives.We also had a tea at the really nice café and had a great time there too.If you like botanical gardens and calm places, come here, but try to come early before most other tourists arrive.

Amazing colour. Stunning gardens filled with intense colour and cacti. So worth the entry fee. These colours are among my favourites. Yves Saint Laurent owned this garden after Majorelle and there is a display of some of his prints. You can also visit the Berber Museum which shows Berber designs/tool/crafts. The last room is really good and has loads of mannequins dressed in various forms of Berber clothing. Such beautiful fabrics and jewellery.

Fantastic garden feel like a HEAVEN. I've visited several time Jardin Majorelle it's immaizing you will feel some thing very special. My family like to visit again and again. Plus I've recommended a lot of my friends to visit Jardin Majorelle they like it.

Beautiful afternoon. Beautiful gardens to walk through and admire. It was quiet in the early afternoon. It was lovely to see the contrast between the natural beauty of the plantlife and the colour of the building. The Berber museum is worth a visit also
it was really nice. we spend 2 hours right there really one of the beautiful places in marrakech we will back next time .
Amazing for a break. In the middle of the caos, these gardens are the most amazing place to breathe in and get some silence. It's very well preserved.

Beautiful. A stunningly beautiful gardens in Marrakech. Away from the madness of the souks. Turtles swim in the pond, bananas grow overhead, the colours are gorgeous and the whole place is just lovely and well designed, it flows. There is a cafe in the gardens as well as a small gallery displaying some of YSL paintings. We went there 3 times in 2 weeks and didn't get bored of it. Would love to go back.

Lovely morning stroll. These gardens have some amazing cactuses as well as other plants and very peaceful walk through the garden (even when busy). The cafe serves some good food but very expensive...
Great. Took taxi as too far to walk for us - only cost £5.The gardens only take about 1-2 hrs to go round - small but worth the visit

Pleasurable way to spend time. Nice gardens well presented. Away from the medina so good for a bit of quiet although they are popular so lots of people there.The blue accents are what makes the gardens different but planting and water pleasant too. I liked the museum too as I love textiles and costumes. But hubby less impressed. Cafe nice and not overpriced.Most disappointing is Yves Saint Laurent memorial which was a rather unimpressive old stone column. Hardly fitting for a man of his talent I thought, unless I missed the point!
Worth a visit. An interesting and calm garden oasis in the hectic city. Very different from 'English gardens' with interesting small galleries to look at as well. A pleasant , calm , interlude.
Jardin Majorelle. Wonderful! A tranquil and beautiful garden in the middle of the bustling new city. Best to go early as it does get extremely busy. The Berber museum is well worth a visit.

Disappointing. Pretty garden but very small, and over-priced for what you are getting. It took us 10 mins to walk around the garden, and it was not what I would have expected compared to gardens I have visited in other countries. I would go to the Cyber park instead.
Haven wishing the bustle of marrakesh . Lovely trip. Definitely worth a visit when in Marrakesh. Loved the chilled nature writhing the city. And the food at the cafe is worth a visit for lunch

Very nice break from the city chaos. Beautiful and well kept. Cheap entrance and a wonderfull break from the busy city.
Worth a visit when in town.

Majorelle Garden. I spent a couple of hours relaxing and reading the in the January sunshine in this beautifully kept public garden. The height of the palm trees is extraordinary and the bamboos create a sheltered calm.

Stunning!. Beautiful gardens and house (now used for Berber Museum).
Not large gardens but definitely worth a couple of hours during your stay in Marrakech.
nice garden. majorelle was a great garden in marrakech it was amazing ,; the walk on it is more than beautiful ...

Respite in the madness. This was a very welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Beautifully maintained and set out, these gardens were cool and tranquil and I could have stayed for much longer had we not lots of other things to see and do.
Garden and Museum.. Garden was small but pleasant, relaxing and cool. Museum was very good and the best part for me. Need a couple of hours to really enjoy.

Beautiful . Amazing garden which shows the different types of trees and plants which grow over the different continents. Though, ofcourse, it was given by Mr Yves, it can be still seen as close related to his heritage.

Inspiration place. Jardins majorel, i only can say wow wow its amazing garden, was found by the famouse celebrity iyve saint Laurent, it's place you can easily ro release the strees, extraordinary garden, beatiful flowers, a lot off different cactus most of them are imported form different continent of te worde
Jewel in the crown. Unbelievably relaxing even though it is in the city! Beautiful garden colourful and exotic, well worth a visit.
A bit small but enjoyable. Nice gardens, plenty of people so difficult to take photos. Nice atmosphere, cool and shady, perfect for staying out of the sun

Not what we had expected . We had some time left. So we went to the Jardin Majorelle by taxi. You pay 70 DH for the garden and another 30 DH if you would like to visit the musea. The garden was small and took us just 15 minutes to see. If you are a huge Yves fan, you might have an other experience. For us is was disappointed.

Gorgeous gardens.. Really enjoyed the Jardin Majorelle. Beautiful, tranquil, a little haven amongst all the chaos of Marrakesh. The gardens were much smaller than I had anticipated and we made several rounds to while away an hour or so but well worth a visit. The entrance fee of 70dirhams seemed a bit steep but I would definitely recommend a visit here.
Good place to relax. Just a shrot walk from our riad in the madina, it is a great place to have a walk far away from the busy city.

Don't Miss this Beautiful Garden. If you're in Marrakech be sure to visit the Jardin Marjorelle. You will miss something very special if you don't go there. It is a beautiful oasis in the midst of the busy city. Even if you think you're not so interested in plants you will be happy to wonder through this wonderful place. Be sure to pay the extra to visit the Berber Museum within the gardens. It's a little gem
Was good place. This place was good and beautiful . There are much to know and to discover . Enjoy your walk there . It worth a visit if you are in marrakech

Beautiful, but pricey.. Considering the cheap price of things in general in Marrakech, we thought this was pricey for what it is. It is undoubtedly beautiful, but it only took us half an hour to walk around. And if, like me, you are indifferent to Yves Saint Laurent it may be a little un-exciting. Worth a visit if you have some spare time, but don't make time especially for it.

A liittle oasis of calm with Berber museum. Thought we could walk from the main square to the Jardin Majorelle. Came out of the square by the horses and carriages and turned right. kept walking ahead, down Mohammed V avenue towards Gueliz the new town walked for a bit then asked this French chap for directions who said we were better getting a taxi. He managed to hail a cab with an occupant and checked price before we got in 300dm. Once in the cab the Dutch occupant said he had lived in Marrakech for a time and you only paid 10dm for short journeys and 15dm for longer ones. (Local and tourist prices)!! but very little either way. Dropped off at the YSL gardens they are quite small but lovely and the Berber museum is worth a visit. Cafe/ resturant loooked expensive so ate outside and up street to your right. Marjorelle cafe which have lovely food and good prices.
Stunning!. Beautiful and peaceful! The gardens were stunning. A nice little cafe within the gardens when a bit peckish. Some of the plants were amazing to look at. Never seen real cacti before
Peaceful retreat. If you want a break from the busy pace of life, this is a beautiful place to visit. It is not large but is lovely. The cafe is also very nice.

Relaxing escape from the madness. . Visited fairly late in the afternoon after a day spent walking around the souks and found it to be a very welcome break from the heat. A bit overpriced but to be expected from anything bearing YSL's name.

A tranquil spot away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city. A tranquil spot to relax away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The gardens are beautiful, but are relatively small. Busy travellers on a tight schedule might want to skip the gardens as it may not be worth a short visit. But the Majorelle blue does make for a fantastic photo.

Incredible cacti. A very pleasant retreat away from the bustle of Marrakech with an attractive restaurant near the museum. Of particular interest were the groves of thriving bamboo and the huge variety of cactus plants.

Nice, if small gardens. Quite relaxing, very pleasant hour or so. Not so big so rather pricy to get in and the cafe inside is expensive. Being linked to Yves Saint Lauren the 'boutiquie' on site is stylish, but again the prices are a joke. Go, but f don't be tempted to spend anymore !!!
Yves Saint Laurent Gardens. A must see when visiting Marrakech, beautiful gardens,small museum great art and to see where he lived beautiful.
Small but perfectly formed. The Majorelle Gardens are a haven of shady tranquillity in the bustling city of Marrakech. Small, but so attractive, and a great cafe on site too.

A beautiful oasis in the desert!. What a wonderful surprise! The gardens are a little out of the way - but worth the trip. We decided to walk from our hotel to check out the stores and neighborhoods along the way - not much to see - I would recommend taking a horse drawn carriage - but with all the food we were enjoying walking was just fine! The gardens are primarily cacti accented with water pools, - some of the cacti I have never seen before - very unique. The gardens are highly manicured - workers everywhere maintaining the grounds. There is a lovely café and small gift shopping. The gardens have a tribute to Yes Saint Laurent. It was a very relaxing experience with benches to sit and enjoy the lovely cacti. A nice break from the bustling city of Marrakech!
jardin majorelle. Beautiful gardens, immaculately kept. A haven of tranquillity away from the dust of the city. Lovely cafe and amazing museum.

Stunning, Small Garden Offer a Tranquil Oasis. Tucked away in the centre of Marrakech these small botanical gardens are simply stunning. Beautifully laid out with palm trees, exotic plants, bamboo, cactuses and water features. There's lots of shady spots and plenty of seats and makes it the perfect retreat from the heat and the busyness of Marrakech. They were originally created by Louis Majorelle in the 1920s and 1930s and his studio and garden furnishings are decorated in a vibrant shade of blue. Yves Saint Laurent, the fashion designer, and Pierre Bergé bought it in the 1980s and a memorial to YSL is in the garden.In the grounds is a Berber Museum, which has a separate admission change, which has a small but interesting display. There is also a luxury gift shop and separate bookshop. The open air café is delightful, although expensive by Marrakech standards but nice for a treat. Just check your change if you go as I was short by 10 MAD but when I called the waiter back he gave me the correct change. The gardens are quite small and can easily be done in less than an hour but I ended up staying over two hours walking round, taking photos (the place is very photogenic) and sitting down relaxing. It was my favourite place in Marrakech and I would highly recommend it.

turtles!. peaceful, no hassle, serene, slow - compared to the area around it - traffic and noise is blocked out by the trees. the turtles in the pond are by far the attention grabber, but even if you missed them, its still wonderful. there are also frogs and fish to see.

Beautiful oasis. This is a beautiful place to visit on your trip and I would highly recommend it. The only downside is that it is very busy and so not as relaxing as it should be. Also it is quite small and so doesn't actually take very long to look round. We only did the garden and had walked around it in 15 mins.

Worth spending an hour or so.... Its a nice garden full of amazing cactus plants. Naturally being a garden it generates a peaceful and tranquile environment. If you wish to relax and have nowhere to rush to, several hours can be spend here.

Tranquil delightful gardens, an oasis in Marrakech. The gardens make a stark contrast with the hustle and bustle of the souks. There's variety in the layout and planting and it makes for a very pleasant hour or so. Some nice photos to be had if you don't mind competing with the other photographers. The cafe was nice but pricey.
J. We were admiring it. We strongly recommend this place to visit. It takes less than an hour to see all plants from all the world.
beautiful garden good museum. Ace place. Go see it, garden is gorgeous. The jewellery and clothing on display are amazing stuff too.
Beautiful garden. Not a large garden but well worth a visit. Well designed to provide many different views - structure contributed by bamboo, palm trees and huge cacti. Don't miss the Berber museum.
A place well worth the visit. Relaxing morning out - thank goodness YSL saved this place for future generations and bought it back to it's former glory
Gorgeous. Beautiful, peaceful garden on the outskirts of the crazy medina. Get there early to avoid the tourist coaches
A Marrakech must . One has to go there, if only to visit YSL's memorial (not his grave!). The Berber museum is small, but items are well displayed.
A guided tour. Great colours, various plants, a must to see. Interesting history, reasonably priced. Great place to take photos.

It was OK I guess.. Felt like it was a waste of money. It's incredibly expensive for what it is and overrated. About £10 or so.
It's more for older people/women.
Nothing exciting or amazing.

Pretty but smwll. Very pretty but very small, overpriced in my mind 70dh for gardens and 30dh for museum. It says picnics not allowed so read a book instead. Its stunning which means lots of people see the whole thing through their camera lens
Overrated. Beautiful but overrated, there are other more special gardens around the world that are worth a visit. Liked the atmosphere and colors though!

An oasis on the outskirts of the old city of Marrakech. Jardin Majorelle cnnot be missed. A house (and garden) created and occupied by Yvves Saint Laurent.The garden features plants from all points of the globe and the colours are amazing.By local standards, entry is expensive but well worth the tariff.Be sure to take the combined ticket to visit the separate Berber Museum within the gardens - a fascinating insight into Berber culture

Peaceful, Colourful and Beautiful. My second visit to the garden, it’s a lovely place to see and a must do when in Marrakech! Very quiet compared to the busy streets and markets of the city, and a wonderful place for the Yves Saint Laurent memorial. Tickets are very cheap and a small Berber museum is located in the garden which is also interesting (additional small fee to enter the museum) as well as a gift shop and some YSL art displays.

Lovely tranquil contrast to noisy city. Marrakech is an amazing city to visit, the Medina is busy, noisy and full on. For a real contrast and a tranquil break, you must visit the Jardin Majorelle. It is in the new town and a simple 20 min walk form the Medina. Huge cactus and palm tress are set in a walled garden, interspersed with clear blue pools and fountains. A real joy.
Pretty. Expensive 70 dh/ pers but pretty.Smaller than expected but clean and interisting cactii species!For plants lover a must see!
YSL paradise. Great to see the place where Yves Saint Laurent once isnpired himself! with more than 700 variety of plants its eye candy! colorfull places and perfect to get inspired!

A must see!. This was our first stop on day 1 in Marrakech and we loved it! Stunning, impeccable gardens, small museum...relaxing and lovely. It does get very crowded so we arrived here first thing in the morning after it opened. As we were leaving, there were 100's of people pouring in from their tour buses. The gift shop has gorgeous items in there all hand picked by Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Berge.

A tad overrated but still enjoyable . Everyone will tell you how amazing this place is, however it's at the most good.
Marrakech itself is beautiful this place has a beautiful garden but ruined by the red path to take you around.
There is an awesome cafe which brought the score up!

It just a garden . While the scenery at Jardin Majorelle is beautiful it doesn't excuse the fact that it's just a garden. The most me and my friends got out of it was we had an abundant amount of picture opportunities. While I enjoyed myself and the scenery is beautiful l wouldn't say it was top five things to do in Marrakesh. However if you do decide to go don't forget to visit the YSL Love Gallery which me and my friends almost missed.

High quality oasis. If you are looking for acres of space and lots of flowers, this is not what you will get. Hardin Majorelle is a relatively small site, but it is high quality - a bit like YSL clothing where it isn't a case of never mind the quality feel the width. The gardens consist of beautifully laid out cacti, palms, bamboos and generally green foliage. The contrasts are amazing. The Museum is more than worth the extra - do NOT miss the museum. It is small, but exquisitely laid out and while the exhibits do not run into the thousands, they are of exceptionally high quality, with cards in English, French and Arabic to explain and are beautifully presented. Yes, you could whizz around the gardens in 10 minutes, yes, you could speed through the museum in 5. Don't, treat this place like a fine wine to be sipped and savoured slowly. Didn't try the cafe, so no comment. Toilets very clean. 100 dirhams for the garden and museum, yes, it was well worth it. Signposting to the place is naff, so do your map homework up front.
Oasis in Marrakech. Oasis in Marrakech perfect to have a break from the dissaray outside! here you can enjoy a peaceful afternoon.
Beautiful. Enjoyed visiting these gardens. Interesting, vibrant colours, beautiful plants and trees and a great café! Really like the style.
