Beautiful Garden. Do not miss this landmark in Marrakesh. Well taken care off. A nice place to relax and different from most of Marrakesh. A Botanic Garden with a nice diversified Flora.
Enchanting!. This place is a must visit on your trip to Marrakech. Its enchanting and dreamlike. Very well maintained.

Beautiful & interesting gardens. I've never seen a garden like it - quite obviously designed for private use originally, but so interesting. Great for taking a little walk around, sitting and pondering, having a bit to eat/mint tea in the cafe, learning about Berber history in the Museum and admiring the mixtures of colours. Great for photography. TIP: the entrance is well off the main road, there's a horse/carriage stand and plenty of taxis, that's how you know you're close!
Day in gardens. The plants and succulents were stunning in the setting u would not believe you were in a massive town so speacail the shops and resturant had amazing selections staff great
A small piece of tranquility. Take the time to experience this little oasis amongst the madness of Marrakesh! Have a little stroll through immaculately kept gardens and interesting museum.
Well worth a visit. Interesting place. Avoid weekends as it gets very busy. Do go to the museum, the local costumes on display are amazing and the jewellery is wonderful.......such skill.
Picturesque. Well worth a visit and great backdrop for pictures. A little disappointed you can't actually visit the YSL house. Once finished in the garden, explore the area for shops and restaurants.
Truly beautiful.. All manor of flowers and a stunning array of Cacti. A little oasis in this bust city. Cool and refreshing.
Great garden . Nice way to laze away a few hours in Marrakech . Very Moroccan and I especially enjoyed the really tall palms and the bamboo forest .

Beautiful haven of birds, plants and colour. A glorious place, beautifully designed with scientific planting - this is a genuine botanic garden. The architectural use of form and colour is stupendous and the plants provide shelter for hosts of birds of various species. It's worth sitting and relaxing and drinking in the ambience for a few hours. The well-designed Berber museum is engaging and informative and well worth the few extra euros to get in. If you're into gardens, art, 1920's architecture, local history, birds, chilling out, this is a must-see place. There is also a very nice cafe, bookshop and boutique.
alright. these gardens are quite small. Great if you are a cactus lover. Nowhere to sit and relax. Too much made of the connection to Yves St Laurent for my liking.

Absolutely stunning and blessedly peaceful.. The Berber Museum was fascinating and beautifully laid out. The gardens were strikingly beautiful. the cafe was delightfully peaceful and the food was excellent.
breath taking. if your into gardening like my partner then you would enjoy all the different plants they have i wouldn't pay to see the museum though
nice garden. jardin majorelle was amazing and so cute , i fall in love with this garden , you must to visit it when you are iin marrakech
A small jewel. Berber museum is interesting, the garden is small and quite busy. Pretty, but the no. 1 in Marrakech? I don't think so

You can skip this one. There's nothing really special about this place and I don't understand why you have to pay 7 euros for it. It's small, nothing really special to see. Staff is cranky, cafe is extremely over-priced. Save your money and skip this place
The color!. Just the most amazing blue in the world. My daughter, an artist, said "It's everything I always wanted in a blue."
Amazing catcus plants. Tranquil garden lovely plants. Only need 15 mins here. Very nice pity you have to pay extra for museum.

An Oasis in the City. Our Guide brought us to the Gardens and it is a "Must See"
Lovely plants,beautiful buildings and a tranquil place to chill after a busy day in the city.
Very reasonable entry price.Good for the whole family.

Fabulous gardens. Not to be missed. They are open all year.. Beautiful peaceful gardens. Excellent price for entry. Fabulous for photos. Excellent museum which helps to understand the history of Morrocan culture .

waste of money. this is my first ever review. i just came back from Morocco and have to tell people that this is 70 dirhams per person (about 7 euros) for entry. all it is is a little blue building with a few gift shops and a cafe, and then a pretty small garden with just a bunch of cacti, bamboo trees and a fountain or two. the only reason to go in here is to get away from the busy street life for a while, if you have money to throw away. after we exited this place, we were then told by a harassing taxi man that the locals have a huge and free and much more beautiful park with gardens only a bit further away! ***an added important side-note - someone followed us from this place all the way back into the center of the medina, then asked for money and said "i know you have money - i saw you at the garden with those girls earlier today". NO WAY!

Lovely garden. A visit to these gardens is a must when in Marrakech. Great to escape the bustle of the city. It's a beautiful, p'leaceful oasis with an interesting museum too. Spend a couple of hours just soaking up the surroundings. Cafe seemed quite expensive, but a pleasant spot to while away another half hour.

An oasis of calm and beauty. The garden itself is a place to chill and enjoy the peace and calm away from the wonderful craziness of the Marakech Medina. The colours of the man-made structures contrast beautifully with the green of the trees and shrubs. It's also worth visiting the museum and seeing the native Berber art, jewellery and clothing. It's truly stunning and worth going round twice.
Peace and Tranquility amongst a frantic hub. Absolutely loved Majorelle Gardens. I've been twice and think if you are in Marrakech then its a mus go palce :-)
Stunning. Beautiful and serene garden dedicated for Yves Saint Laurent. Located in the city of Marrakech. Stunning design and colorful. Amazing!

An amazing oasis of calm in a mad city.. These gardens are a must if you are in Marrakech. The staff are very attentive and pleasant and the place is kept immaculate.The comalt blue pavillion contrasts so well with the green of the plants.Its simplyba lovely place to spend an hour or more.The Berber museum on site is also well worth a visit. Extremely well layed out it tells and shows the story of the indigineous people in a compelling and sensitive way.We loved it here.

So tranquil . I spent a whole morning here, getting there early before there were too many people: the gardens are so peaceful, with an eclectic mix of plants. The studio is a wonderful little building, painted in a vibrant blue said to be inspired by French workman's overalls

Moderate garden and peaceful. The garden was nicely layout done and you able to see the colour of indigo everywhere. My favourite is the cactus plant, nice cafe, museum, YSL products available. Entrance fee require and maximum an hour is fine. Have a look, surrounding the area have nice little boutique shop for gifts outside the Jardin

Peaceful escape from the medina. This is something totally different from the hectic medina. Serene and secluded, with lots of colors and funky plants to feast your eyes on. There's a monument to Yves Saint Laurent and a Berber museum too.
Nice place to chillax. I like walking around here, a nice calm place to check out if your coming on vacation.There are many kinds of plant species in the garden.

Overrated. We were very disappointed with this overprized garden.. Having read the reviews on tripadvisor we definitely expected more than just a few cactus plants and a blue house. Not worth your money and time.

Peace and calm. Quite small but a must see. The contrast between city and gardens is immense! The colour scheme works well too. The museum is worth a look too. Very small but a great use of space and lighting.
amazing. we had a lovely time inside this garden , it's so amazing and great the stuff was so beautiful , we loved it

Over rated! maybe coz it's there's no other garden as nice?. The most expensive attraction in Marrakech. Dhs70 for Garden + Dhs 30 for the museum It's beautiful but not really worth the money. Very Small. I've seen better gardens.

Nice but a little overrated. Lovely gardens and colours but rather artificial and small. For it being the most expensive entrance fee to all attractions in Marrakech I felt it was a bit overrated. Good place for taking nice photos and finishing off with a drink in the Café. If you need a break from the hustle and bustle of the Medina it's a nice escape though.

An oasis. It's really a beautiful site and a "must do" in marrakech. The only thing, for me, is the different prices for Morrocans and tourists. And it's a huge difference. Even though it's was not super expensive, it was moderatly pricey and this difference depending on where you came from really shocked me. I was seriously considering not going in.
Stunning gardens. Make sure you go in the museum inside. Wonderful to learn about the Berbers and very well presented display

A welcome oasis of calm and colour. As a major gardens attraction this place is pretty poor, just a bunch of cactus and a few goldfish ponds. The museum is well curated however and well worth a look. A nice break from the hustle and bustle of the main square and medina.
Interesting . OK for the price and entrance fee helps local causes. Colourful a little cool oasis. Mainly bamboo and cacti with a few water features.
Absolutely Beautiful!. Well worth the money to go see. Will definitely be a highlight of your trip. We also visited the museum which was a great insight into Berber life!
Moorish charm. Exotic and unique, even though plant species are from all over the world, the Moroccan blue does the magic and creates a relaxing and refreshing atmosphere away from the bustling city.

Stunning!. In a rat race city these gardens are a must to visit. Once you are in its all about peace calm and tranquality Well impressed and wish I had nt had breakfast when we got there as the food looked amazin in the small café Well worth it.
Beautiful. Lovely and beautiful gardens with beautiful buildings around, one of the must do things in Marrakech
Beautiful garden but.... the garden was beautiful but pretty uneventful. I would most likely skip it should I return to Marrakech again
Nice Gardens. If you are visiting Marrakech really worth a visit as this is a little oasis and a welcome change from the busy streets

Tranquil . Beautiful gardens away from the manic Marrakesh. A bit difficult to find the entrance but we found it eventually.
Beautiful coffee shop if you want to rest.
Free WiFi.

Very nice for an hour visit. Very nice gardens, 70 dirham's entry. Cafe in side is a bit on the pricy side and not that good. Lots of cactus and green plants, not a lot of colour, but my wife was impressed.
Lovely garden. Very beautiful garden. Quiet and relaxing. You should check this out if you are in Marrakech. Did not go to the museum though.
Beautiful oasis. Gorgeous gardens, very peaceful and unlike anything I had seen before. The restaurant looked really nice but didn't get the chance to eat there.

Serenity in the City. I knew this wasa must due to the great reviews I read.The first thing you notice as you enter is the vibrant blue which makes the Garden stand out beautifully.Which impressed my girlfriend and I the most was the fact that there were employees walking around picking up individual leaves by hand. It is that type of care and hard work is which keeps the Garden what it is.The layout is fantastic and the mini map given mean that every square inch wont be missed as you take in the beauty.It is a photographers dream setting as there are so many photo opportunites.It is somewhere you could go to read a book or to just relax with friends. Remember though that picnics are prohibited.Remember, bring a camera.
Very beautifull and peacefull. It was very nice and peacefull even though it was high season (right after New Year). We spent around an hour walking around!

Just so calm!. It was really hot outside but all this changed once we stepped inside the gate. A very well planned garden, mainly cacti and succulents (not my favourite but they looked at home here). An excellent Berber museum, well worth paying the extra. Stunning colours, water features and cool leafy areas. The cafe and gift shop are both worth visiting. We were glad to have had a break from the bustle of the old town for a quiet, peaceful morning. Well worth making the effort.
Beautiful place. Good value for Money, once inside you feels like an emperor or a king in this enchanting garden. The museum visit is worth it you get a good knowledge of the Amazigh people

Tranquility. Beautiful and exciting, this is a real treat and an oasis in busy, dusty Marrakech. Highly recommended for gardeners, artists, peace lovers and those who appreciate the beauty of art and nature.
Nice chilling place. Good place to escape from the loud streets, drink a coffee, read a book, empty your mind and feel the vibe
Absolutely Amazing. garden by artist jacques majorelle with exotic plants ,water&features and a berbere museum.you can feel love in this place

The gardens were fine... the museum inside was nice. The gardens were fine... nothing too amazing, but a nice place to relax for the afternoon. It was busy in the low season, so I'm guessing in the high season, it's a mess! The berber museum inside the gardens was a treat though.
Nice but not a must. Nice place to spend couple of hours and maybe to escape from the old city and get a bit of quieter time

Underwhelming. We visited the Jardin Majorelle on a cloudy January day. The main thing going for it is that you can sit in the cool shade & get away from the frantic city outside the walls. If that's all you're looking for then you'll love it. If we'd gone in the heat if summer I'm sure we'd have welcomed the shade too. But I have to say after the 5 star reviews on here & some fantastic photos I'd seen with the amazing Majorelle blue walls/pots I was expecting something spectacular. Perhaps my expectations were just too high. We got a couple of good photos, but for the price (note: they also ask for a separate entrance fee to go into a small museum within the garden!) it really wasn't worth the money or time spent for us. Each to their own of course, but I wanted to express our opinion in contrast to all the people raving about this place, in case it helped visitors more like us!
Beautiful Gardens. A must to visit while you are there!Museum very interesting too!Lovely cafe and gift shop.Great calm place in a crazy city!

Waste of30 mins. Vastly overrated to what's essentially a cactus garden. Not worth the £5 entry fee in my opinion. It might have been because of winter buttherewas absolutely no colour whatsoever. For cactus connosuiers only.

Enchanting. Worth a visit for enthusiastic YSL fans. It s vibrant colours dedicated to the wonderful designer are to be seen to be appreciated. The plantation is beautiful and in full array. It s smaller than I imagined and a little expensive if you only visiting the garden area. The prices are divided for garden only option or garden and museum. The cafe is expensive better options just outside in the street.
One of the top places in Morocco. A very unique place, think maybe a Japanese garden in the middle of the desert. One of my favorite places in Morocco.

Cool Blue. Lovely charming site.The café is just wonderful. Recommended is the Majorelle Shake. Not certain of the exact name of it, it has orange water, and dates. DO visit the museum. It is intriguing. DO visit the book shop, with a nice collection of texts and post cards. It all benefits the museum.Bought some Majorelle Blue paint in the gift shop. Later found out a MSDS is required to ship it out of the country.The paint doesn't have any ingredients on it at all.
Beautiful!. The garden is worth a visit even you have to pay entrance. It is very well taken care of. Also have a look into the library and exhibition.
Beautiful. Isolated from the rest of Marrakech, this garden offers plants/trees from all over the world in a beautiful setting. A must see.
excellent museum and gardens. The garden contains the best museum we saw in Morocco. it has an extensive collection of Berber costumes, tools, jewelry and everyday implements.

beautiful. Though not very Moroccan this is a must see.
Calming and relaxing, a beautiful visit.
Take water, snacks and a book if you have the time to unwind for walking through the medina.

Beautiful gardens. Lots of amazing plants to see.. This is a must go if visiting Marrakech. Our tour guide took us here and the history is fascinating. I don't usually enjoy visiting gardens, but this place was fascinating. The cactus collection is amazing and there is a nice onsite cafe.

Beautiful - fantastic and tranquil. We decided to visit the Jardin Majorelle during our long weekend anniversary trip. It was amazing and well worth a visit! I'm not a big 'garden' fan but this place was amazing! So beautiful, colourful and tranquil. The Berber Museum is within the grounds and really worth the little extra to visit. A nice cafe inside, but the cafes by the entrance are a little cheaper and wider menu selection !

Tranquill Garden. I enjoyed strolling around this beautiful garden that was so tranquill and listening to the many birds sing. Many varieties of plants and a beautiful fountains plus some souvenir shops...

My favorite peaceful place!. I love Le Jardin de Majorelle! I have visited maybe 10 times and own a riad nearby. It is one of the most peaceful and happy places I have visited, especially in a city as busy and bustling as Marrakech! The bright colors are soothing and the place is meticulously tended. I like to visit the Berber Museum as well. And the cafe is a perfect place for a light lunch and cup of tea. It's all just so relaxing and wonderful! Don't miss it. Plus, there are some great upscale shops nearby!
Nothing Outstanding. We were brought here by a tour guide and felt underwhelmed by the garden. If we had been more aware of what it was, we would not have paid to visit the site.

Beautiful gardens. We visited during a four night stay and found the gardens to be a little oasis of calm and beauty.The gardens house a YSL memorial which we thought "is that it" but we are not fans of labels so that's just us.The birdsong that could be heard whilst sitting on one of the benches in the sun is a definite highlight.We also paid to visit the Berber museum inside the gardens. This was an interesting visit in the middle of the gardens and we thought worth it.

Eh... it was nice.. The garden was nice, and pretty well maintained. The blue walls everywhere were gorgeous! It was a nice place to go and take a few pics for instagram or facebook, but that's about it. The cacti were pretty cool too. The Berber museum was nice, if you're in a museum type of mood. It's worth checking out if you're in the area, or if you need a new profile picture, but it didn't quite live up to my expectations. One thing that was pretty crappy is that a lot of people carved their names into the plants throughout the garden. Most of the plants were all scratched up with people's names. Not cool.
Beautiful and relaxing !. Beautiful garden,full of beautiful plants arranged in lovely designs. It is very relaxing and the colours are amazing! Dont miss the shop!!

Jaw dropping . Must visit place when in Marrakech. Words can not describe the beauty in this place. We cycled from the old city to the Majorelle and it took approx 20 mins. Pay no more than 30 dirhams to taxi to here if your staying in old medina

Must do. Small, beautiful and offers great photo opportunities for the holiday models ;) You can probably walk the entire place in a leisurely pace in under an hour. The gift shop is not cheap but has some wonderful pieces. If you go to Marrakech, make sure you check it out.

Overpriced, undersized. You pay 70 dirham for a 10 minute walk. Nice trees and a beautiful enviroment, but it is really small and not thát special. Although, it is cool and quiet, a nice get away from the busy streets.
Lovely space. Nice space and very peaceful, great place to sit with a book or just to think. Downsides are that the garden was smaller than expected and the Berber museum is underwhelming

COOL . Best exotic garden in the beautiful Marrakech. All kind of rare exotic plants took by Jacque Majorelle. & the celestial blue painting is straight from stars. & there is an Yves Saint Laurent Exposition in the middle of the Garden since the Fashion Designer loved the city of Marrakech

Fantastic, nothing I've ever seen before!. Breathtaking garden, beautifully maintained. don't miss out on the great museum! Worth to have a tea in the jardin cafe, a bit pricey but wonderful ambiance!

Beautiful!. Such a lovely day out, very peaceful and beautiful. After taking a slow walk round we stopped in the cafe for a lemonade and banana split, take a seat and someone will come to your table! Definite must-see when visiting Marrakech.
A beautiful garden not to be missed. make sure you go there. Price in January 2016 approx. €9 which includes the Berber museum. A €5 taxi from the Medina
Quiet , green gardens behind walls. Loved our visit to these perfectly groomed gardens. A quiet cool oasis, that is well maintained, clean and peaceful

Surprised at the hype. This garden had so much publicity that the visit was a must. Although my friends liked it, I was not that impressed. The ticket was 7 EUR (70 dirhams) and I'd say, that this is way too expensive (you can visit all the local palaces with 1 EUR (10 dirhams)). As the garden is very small, the whole tour took about 20 minutes. The cafeteria in the garden was just awful and very dirty. The only thing about it was the wide range of cactuses and most of our time went there. I would suggest to skip the garden and visit all the palaces and free gardens of the town instead.

Pretty, colourful and peaceful. A great couple of hours to spend away from the hussle and hussle of the Marrakech medina. Beautiful grounds with some stunning plants and cacti. Definitely worth a visit
A Zen Moment. We love gardens but didn't expect to be so affected by this one. I think we were expecting a 'vogue' experience but, instead, found a place of profound peace and beauty.

Just such a beautiful, tranquil garden, well worth a visit.. Stunning, a welcomed retreat from all the noise and excitement!We traveled there by horse drawn carriage, ,which was such fun. The garden itself was very well kept and wonderfully cool. The colors outstanding!

Walk around the gardens. A beautiful place, lovely and tranquil and great way to escape the craziness of the medina! We spent about an hour walking around and if we hadn't already eaten we definitely would have tried the cafe as it looked great, a very picturesque setting.
A restful and beautiful place. A lovely respite from the busy city. Get a horse and cart there. The Museum inside is very much worth a visit
Very Peaceful. A great place to spend some quiet time. Located within the crazy and loud city center, but once inside, you will feelinh nothing but serenity. It was tastrfully done by YSL.
Oasis!. Wonderfully magic garden that is worth visiting. After walking around the hot streets of Marrakech, we entered these gardens and were shaded and surrounded my peacefulness. Highly recommend.
Jardin majorelle. Don't miss this place if you go to visit MarrakechOriginal trees Take a break in the cafe insideVery beautiful place

Somewhat over rated. Everyone raves about the 'Yves Saint Laurent' garden, but for me it is somewhat over rated.It is a garden planted with cactus and palm trees, in which there are a couple of water features. Does splashing some blue paint around make it that special?I suppose it's horses for courses, but obviously this is not my thing.The entrance fee was also quite pricey compared to other attractions in Marrakesh, and if you are staying in the Medina you have the added expense of a taxi to get there.

Do not miss out!. Simply beautiful with so much history, we spent a good few hours there as it was so peaceful compared to the street outside . The cafe is also good, fairly cheap. If you're in marrakech this really is worth a visit, dont forget your camera!
beautful. lovely gardens, plants from all over the world and a beautiful layout. well organised with friendly staff who are happy to help

unique garden in Marrakech. An enjoyable quick trip during a walk around Marrakech. This garden is a little pricey for what you get, but maybe that keeps it a little lest busy. The former property of Yves Saint Laurent, there is a museum on site for an additional fee. Bright blue colors and interesting flora. A welcome respite from the busyness of Marrakech
Nice garden in the middle of chaotic Marrakech.... Worth the visit. Peaceful place to visit when you are tired of getting lost in Narrow streets of Marrakech

Relaxing morning. Took a horse drawn carriage for the 20 min ride from the main square to the gardens. Good to see local life along the way. The gardens are not very large but they are picturesque and well worth a visit. We enjoyed a coffee in a pretty courtyard then after an amble around went to the museum. This is quite small but interesting.

The Garden is unique - but visit the Museum!. I visited the garden some years ago, but missed the Berber Museum within the garden. It is quite small but worth the time... extremely well presented, very informative with great displays of costumes, crafts, jewelry, and explanatory display cards in various languages. The Berber are a unique and very resilient peoples and here you can learn much.

A garden lover's paradise. A delightful place to visit in an otherwise dusty and bustling city. Go early to miss the crowds (9ish is good), take tea in the delightful tea rooms and savour the beauty that Jacqueline and Louis Majorelle and more recently, Yves St. Laurent created. Fabulous use of colour, cacti and succulents beautifully maintained. Take your sketch pad and/or camera: beauty at every turn! Don't miss the small museum in the centre of the small gardens.It's quite a walk from the Koutoubia. Take a Petit Taxi for about 60DH. Agree your price before you get in!

Restart button for your brain. Since this is Marrakech, I'll say that the best way to describe this place is to say that this garden is a hammam for your soul.Insanely refreshed after just 30 minutes spent soaking in the zen vibes of the place.
Very nice, calm beautiful place!. This garden was surprisingly pretty. If you want the visit a garden this is the one to go to. The garden is not very big but the way it's designed is very nice!

An explosion of colour and beauty - not to be missed. I went here in October 2014 (for some reason Trip Advisor won't let me enter a date so far back in the future) and absolutely loved the trip! It was a relaxing day after a hike up Mount Toubkal, and it was the perfect thing to do. It's really beautiful and serene here, and it's close enough to Marrakesh to make it an easy visit.We took a taxi over, which really shouldn't cost you very much, though I think we only managed to bargain it down to 30-40 dirhams. With the entry price of 70 dirham, it was still under £10 for a very nice day out. There is probably nothing to do here for more than a couple of hours, but it's a nice place to sit and relax for a bit, and also learn a little about Yves Saint Laurent, who is behind the creating of this beautiful oasis. It's nice to get away from the busy streets of Marrakesh as well!

Beautiful garden. The garden is full of beautiful flowers, plants and ponds. It's a nice place to take pictures or just sit down and relax for a bit. There is also a museum inside, which costs 3e extra. Worth a visit!

Lovely Gardens and Good Restaurant.. I am not really a gardening person but really enjoyed visiting this place. It is peaceful, immaculately clean and laid out in a nice manner.
We found a lovely café restaurant in here and had a really nice meal for a very reasonable price giving the location.

Beautiful Gardens. Beautiful peaceful gardens an oasis from all the hustle and bustle outside. The blues and greens are very calming. Equivalent to £5.00 to get in. Very nice coffee shop also. Well worth a visit, we did it as part of a tour which included a trip to the tombs and a palace then into The Atlas Mountains. Great day out.

Gorgeous garden. Really enjoyed the visit to Jardin Majorelle, which was a surprising highlight. The Garden is unique because it is based on an old mature garden - so you are seeing 100 year old palm trees, and 50 year old cacti which have been integrated into a beautiful more modern space. Its mainly cacti, which are not my thing to be honest, but still wonderful, with gorgeous painted colours somehow accenting (rather than dominating) the garden and ponds. Also terrific was the small museum on Berber culture, and the café for a refreshing mint tea afterwards.

You must go. One of the best visits we made in Marrakech. We were staying in the Medina and we walked to the gardens in about 25 mins. The whole experience was wonderful. The museum is so interesting. The layout and design of the garden makes viewing so easy and the seats in shaded places a pleasure to enjoy the garden and the day. Do not miss this
Gorgeous. I gotta be honest, I was expecting a little more glamour since it is also known as the YSL garden... It was really nice though.

piece and quiet in bubbly Marrakech. a must do. beautiful park and the colours are divine. Take 2-3 hours and enjoy the serenity and have a Moroccan tea in the little courtyard cafe. Also THE spot for the photography lovers. Do NOT buy anything in that shop! Over priced by far!

Nice garden, away from the crowded Medina. We went to Jardin Majorelle on a warm day in January. We walked over there from the big square, it is 35 to 40 minutes of walking. Bare in mind you walk along some major streets with a lot of traffic, so I can imagine there is some sort of smog in the summer. The garden itself is nice to see and a very silent place. The contrast with the crowded Souks can't be much bigger. But, I can imagine the garden gets quite crowded during more polular seasons. Entrance is 70 Dirham, and some extra for the YSL-museum. We only visited the garden. Don't expect to visit the garden any langer then about 45-60 minutes. The garden offers a free toilet and a restaurant wich prices are quite high.

Simply beautiful. Jardin Majorelle is made with love. This beautiful, well kept garden is worth a visit! The lovely blues of the tiles, the greenery, the orange of the gold fish, the mystique, the poetry are all lovely! Closeby as well as inside the garden you can pick up nice bites to eat or relax with a coffee. This place can be slightly crowded, but is well kept, clean and with plenty of benches to relax in. You can definitely make some lovely pictures here! Everyone would like this place - solo or a group of people.

Stunning Garden Oasis. Escape the hustle and bustle of the city and visit this enchanting tranquil garden to see a stunning collection of cacti and exotic plants. There is also a Berber Museum, café and shop. Definitely worth visiting!

Stunning oasis. Loved our visit here. Beautifully kept tropical garden and really interesting and well presented museum showing the different cultural attire. Nice shop too. Cafe was expensive- there are lots just outside which are much cheaper!

Very Beautiful.. A must se when going to Marraketch! It was soo beautiful here , it took us just about 45 minutes to go through it was soo lovely. I went in the gift shop and saw some very lovely things if you have the time a stop in is well worth it.t!
Absolutely beautiful.. The plants and flowers here are gorgeous. The garden is not very large so it's very easy to visit in a few hours.

Beautifully maintained quiet setting amongst beautiful natural gardens.. Enjoyed our visit here very much. People were over the top friendly. The grounds are very well maintained. There are a variety of unique plants and pieces of architecture you won't find elsewhere. The history is rather interesting. I would recommend going in the summer months not the winter.

A good place to get out of the sun.. A nice contrast of colours with the colbalt blue and greenery. Cafe is not great, avoid the bean soup. It is quite a long walk from the main square. Take a horse taxi if you can afford it

Beautoful. Small chunk of paradise amongst the madness of Marrakech. Immaculate gardens with calm atmosphere and beautiful colours. Well worth entry price of 70dh. Does not take long to explore but can easily lose a few hours in here. Also has museum, restaurant and toilets. Picnics not allowed
Oasis. Peaceful spot. This place suddenly takes you in its calmness forgotten where you are and what time is. Singing birds. Great gardeners!
Pleasant way to while away time.. Lovely gardens and a very interesting Berber museum. You can wander around comfortably and there is a boutique selling the softest leather goods, cafe and toilets

An absolute heaven in the middle of a busy city. Marrakech in the summer is hot, dry and dusty. This place is a green oasis of calm in the middle of the city.The garden was Majorelle's life's work and hosts the most spectacular array of plants. The design of the gardens and use of water and colour is stunning. This place was beloved by Yves Saint Laurent and when he died his ashes were interred there.An absolute must-see.

Beautiful gardens, splendid colours.. These gardens are a good place to spend time in Marrakesh. The colours are beautiful and the views stunning. The restaurant inside is not cheap but still worth the money.

Highly recommended. Must check out the Jardin Majorelle while in Marrakech. It's a nice place to visit to get out of the hectic city. I love the blue hues on the walls and the pottery. It's a great place to take pictures.

A must see in Marrakech. Vivid, vibrant gardens that the pictures just can't seem to do justice to. Relaxing vibes and a great cafe for lunch. This is one not to miss if you're in Marrakech for more than a day.
Jardin Majorelle. An incredible place , so colorfull and very elegant i just adore it also the Berber Museem , tells the history about tradition life .
Always worth a visit. The beautifully laid out and very colourful Jardin Majorelle should be a must on every visitor's agenda!

Beautiful, historic gardens with fun bookstore and wonderful Berber exhibit!. I have visited the Majorelle Gardens many times and have thoroughly enjoyed each visit. It's a must if coming to Marrakech. The cafe is in a quant, lush courtyard. But do not skip out on the Berber exhibit. This is also a must see! Do skip the shopping and opt for the medina instead (the boutique is very pricey $$$$$).

Beautiful and relaxing!. Nice gardens in an upscale, residential section of the new Marrakech. The gardens, especially the wide variety of cacti, are lovely. Pay the extra to visit the wonderful Berber museum with an incredible collection of Berber jewelry, household items, and clothing. Berber craftsmanship is amazing and you'll discover differences in style amongst the different Berber tribes. The boutique is pricey but combines the best of modern day Moroccan craftsmanship with modern design, creating pieces that are unique - perfect purchases to remind you of your trip to Morocco.
Amazing colour. This is an amazing garden, a must see. All i would say is go as early as possible to beat the crowds.

An unexpected delight. The gardens are well worth the walk and initially you may feel that the gardens appear quite small but be prepared to be amazed by the selections of trees and succulents.The memorial to Yves Saint Laurent is worth looking at peacefully and is a tranquil spot in the garden.The museum is interesting particularly the costumes and the descriptions.Do take time for a mint tea in the cafe area and make sure you take a seat in the sun.
Beautiful gardens and interesting musuem.. A little oasis near the medina. Such a nice little place. Very relaxing, colourful and beautiful. A complete opposite to the medina.

real masterpiece in gardening. although I am not a fan of gardens, I liked this one very much. it's different in many ways, with a great way of organizing the vegetation, and with a museum with unbelievable colors, contrasting with the nature around it. you can find here the monument to Yves saint Laurent and to jean Jacque majorelle.

Uniquely beautiful. These small gardens are beautiful and unlike anything you will see elsewhere. They feature cactus and succulents with bright colored pavilions, bridges, and pottery. The Berber museum is on the premises and is superb.

Its not that great. We went with three couples to this place. Because the prices was in my opinion very high, i thought this is a great garden like kew gardens in london. But actually it was very small and not allot of different plants. Using colours like marine blue and yellow was excellent done. It was a small own tour through the gardens, if you dont mind the people who are taking pictures of everythin, it is quit peacefull. But there are no sitting areas for enjoying this view. Because of the price ill give it a 3 star rating.
A peaceful Oasis in the middle of the city. This garden is well worth a visit. Beautifully laid out & maintained. A real treat. The Berber museum in the old artist's studio is very interesting.

Go with a piggy bank full of change!!!. This is a very nice place yet the disappointment in my group was that anywhere they had a cash register they had change. Wich in my opinion for such a visited place is a very bad thing. Since tourists are usually traveling the local currency and banks in Morocco will only give you big bills. Besides this is a very nice Oasis full of Nice Botanical Species. The staff was not friendly wich this is thumbs down especially for Morocco where people are so nice. The Boutiques and Café are Extremely Expensive. Ok for YSL but I bet the food and beverages are not Haute Couture.

" Relaxed place". We wisited this jadrdin with my friend we like it very much .its save place and everything organized I hope to come back as soon as possible to visit jardin majorelle highly recommend to this place to everyone who visit marrakech
Serene . Calm and peaceful place to be to get away from the hustle of the city. Although small in size, it does offer colourful delights for the eyes.
Beautiful but a tad overpriced. The gardens are stunning, and it's a lovely place to go and get away from the craziness of the souks, but it is a tad expensive

Add this to your list of things to do in Marrakech. Beautiful gardens and very informative museum. Privately run so entrance fee was 100 dirhams per person for both the garden and the museum and worth every dirham. Lots of different plants and arrangements and photo opportunity. No one is rushed and they ensure that the museum is not over crowded so you may have to queue to enter the musuem, again, worth waiting for and the queue is in the shade. The staff are all very helpful and informative. YSL would have been proud of the staff. We walked from our Riad in the north of the Medina, cooo how exciting was that?! Its ok to walk but would probably be easier to take a taxi and make sure you negotiate the price before you get in. Dont miss out on this little oasis.
Very pretty. . Worth a visit. Really well kept garden. Very soothing environment. Good break from the "hectic" city. Expensive café. Entré 70 Dh, museum is not included.

Refreshing after spending a couple of days in the busy city. you have to go there by the end of your trip to Marrakesh .. spend some time enjoying the peaceful and colorful atmosphere. it's worth a visit for sure.

Peaceful and Pretty. This garden is such a treasure, totally in contrast the the rest of Marrakech. It's really quiet and tranquil.
It has a nice courtyard restaurant and a couple of shops.
Definitely worth a visit.

Two interesting places on one site. The Jardin Majorelle and the Berber Museum were both very interesting in their own ways. The gardens were well maintained, with photo opportunities and space to walk around. The Museum showed fascinating displays of the Berber lifestyle and artifacts. The staff controlled the visitor numbers, allowing adequate space and time to view the exhibits.
Capture the classic Majorelle Blue. A great change of pace after a hectic day in the crowds. Brilliant for lunch and a pleasant afternoon.
As oasis within this crazy city. We loved the garden, it was gorgeous. Come with some food and snacks to have a picnic in this beautiful garden.

One of my favourite gardens - ever!. I have photographed gardens all over the world - this one stands out as an extraordinary example of design and understanding of plants. The combination of bamboos, succulents, cacti with immaculate raked surfaces was extraordinary. A must see in Marrakech.

Well worth a visit. Entry was very cheap (around 5 pounds) and there are some fantastic plants/trees. I'm not a garden lover, but it was worth the trip. The location is flat, so accessible to people with mobility problems

Beautiful Gardens. The gardens are a lovely, peaceful break from the bustling Medina.The restaurant in the gardens is lovely, we had a gorgeous lunch before walking around the gardens. The little museum is very interesting, definitely worth going to while you're there. The gardens aren't as big as I thought they would be but don't let this put you off, they are beautiful - there are lots of places to stop and sit as you're walking around to watch the world go by. Overall, it's lovely relaxing place to visit.
I could have stayed for hours more!. The gardens are stunning, the colors amazing and the Berber museum well worth spending some real time there. I was not ready to leave!
Beautiful. Beautiful place and beautiful restaurant. Can't pay with euro to get in but excepted inside. The boutique is VERY expensive. Nice lot of trees and lovely photo opportunities.

Beautiful garden and memorial of YSL. Nicely maintained gardens - outside the old Medina. Easy to get to via taxi/horse carriage. Entry is 70 dirhams per person and an additional 30 dirhams if you want to visit the Berber museum (maybe seasonal). Expect to spend 60 - 90 mins here - its nice and relaxing. There is a cafe in here as well for tea and snacks.

Jardin Majorelle. Lovely gardens, beautifully kept, & great for photos ! The cafe was lovely too had a lovely hot chocolate & mint tea, great for a quick afternoon away from hussel & bussel of rest of town,

A nice escape from medina. Highly recommend for a stroll, the bright colours and the 'Moroccan blue' are spectacular. Can be busy so go earlier and take a taxi which is very reasonable. There are a few lovely gift shops just opposite worse a browse too

Marvelous garden!. Cactus lovers can meet here the most precious, unique and exotic collection of succulents! In a perfect environment and luxury care!
Awesome!
Very special garden to see. It's interesting mixture of oriental and European design. Kids had a great fun. It was also good for their education.

A place to breathe in Marrakech.... What a beautiful place! We wondered around the gardens for a few hours, enjoying the peace and utter beauty. There's also enough shade to help you hide from the sun for a while. If you enjoy photographing plants, you will adore these gardens.
Beautiful and interesting. I never expected to find such a beautiful and interesting garden. This is not normally my thing but this was just too cool and unique not to like.

Nice place. If you are a lover of cacti, this is the place to go :) The tickets to go in are a bit pricey compared to the other sights we've been to in Marrakech. The place has an amazing collection of cactus and it also has a small museum full of interesting berber artifacts. There were benches scattered all over the garden which was nice if you want to rest for a bit. Before we left we had tea and some cakes at the Cafe inside. All in all, nice but nothing spectacular.

Amazing gardens, beautiful and colourful, worth a visit. These gardens are so beautiful and colourful, I loved them! It's nice to get away from the madness of Marrakech and escape to this peaceful little place. The gardens are very small, and 70 dirhams may seem a bit expensive, but it was one of the highlights of my trip and I got some gorgeous photographs.

must see for cactus lovers!. the cactus is incredible. i felt like i was transported to the southwest. really cool. the bright blue house was my favorite part though. the color is so vibrant!! worth a visit. we were done in less than an hour.
Worth a visut. We really enjoyed our visit to Jardin Majorelle. Even went out and bought pigments as a souvenir :-) best to visit in the morning.
Stunning Garden!. Quick 15mins walk from the medina, the garden was a great little hideaway from the rush of the Marrakech old town!

A peaceful gem in a noisy city. This garden is beautiful and much better than I expected. 70 Dirhams to enter which is about £5, all proceeds go to maintaining the garden and the foundation set up in memory of Yves Saint Laurent by his partner Pierre Berge, they rescued the garden from development and it really is lovely. (It is currently being added to by means of parking/facilities)Locals only have to pay 30 dirhams to enter and the garden is used to host educational events and botany lectures for free, all part of the YSL legacy.You only need an hour to look round unless you want to add on the Berber museum inside this is an extra 30 Dirhams and I only had an hour to spare so gave it a miss.We saw frogs and Terrapins in the ponds, cacti and bamboo which were an awesome sight.The monument to YSL is small but those who weren't impressed by it I think miss the point that the garden itself is a fitting tribute and the "love" gallery by the shop is also a tribute.
Breath taking. The colours are exquisite, so tranquil, fab cafe too. Walked round twice in fact didnt want to leave. Get a taxi to it !

A moment in the paradise. Extremely wonderful, if you want to have an idea of the Paradise let's go to the Jardin Majorelle. This beautiful artistic garden where colors, flowers, rare plants are lavishly matched put you in the heart of real Nature in sense of perfection.

OK but nothing special. In fairness this is a lovely area but it is certainly not one of those unforgettable experiences. There are park areas of equal quality all around the world, so probably not worth the entrance fee.
Quiet with a great museum. Beautiful house and garden a long walk from the medina. Come for the Berber museum and some peace and quiet.
A must see!. Such a beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle! So tranquil with beautiful gardens which made me feel such peace! I would recommend everyone to visit when visiting Marrakech.

Experience ruined by staff. This is the top attraction in Marrakech so I went with two friends. At the entrance I planned on buying the ticket to visit the garden as well as the Berber museum. The clerk said she didn't have change so I could only purchase the garden ticket (she refused to get change and sell me the two tickets). She said I could purchase the museum ticket at its entrance. We visited the gardens and went to the museum. No change either. I was missing half a dirham, which is like 0.05 euro. They refused to sell me a ticket unless I came up with half a driham and would not go get change somewhere else. The rest of my party could not visit the museum because I was not able to purchase the entry to the museum, and again, they said I could not get in because of half a dirham! We got really aggravated and left, my friends went to the front ticket office to get a refund since they couldn't visit the museum either. The clerk said it was not her problem that I did not have half a dirham, but yet did not make the slightest attempt to fetch change. The gardens are beautiful but the staff spoiled the experience for us. Disappointing to the max. Only bad experience with Moroccan people, who tend to be friendly and attentive.

Stunning and peaceful!. What a hidden gem in the new town. Take a horse & carriage ride to 'Jardin Majorelle' for a few hours of tranquillity. Wander through the peaceful and well designed gardens, filled with cactus and plants from all over the world. The vivid colours and water features are a treat for the senses and provide some fabulous photo opportunities. Finish off the trip with a coffee or delicious lunch in the well designed garden cafe as the salads & meatballs were out of this world. A must do!

Awesome. Visiting Majorelle garden brought the peace and tranquility to accept the Marrakesh culture. Had a pretty big cultural shock after we got to our accommodation Riad Lotus Perle inside the Medina and I felt like I wanna go back home, but after visiting Majorelle I told myself: Wow this place is not that bad, it' actually awesome. So yes Majorelle is a great place like an oasis, nice garden, and they also have nice coffee place inside the establishment, to relax and have some drinks and food.It's a must see if you visit Marakesh

Wonderful. This is a real MUST of a visit in Marrrakech.The garden is in the new part of the city. There are no indications for tourists coming on foot from the Medina area. People is very helpful to give indications.
The garden is stunning with lots of palms and cactus.A relaxing oasis from the crowded city.

Must See in Marrakech. The absolutely marvelous gardens are a must see for all the really old and beautiful plants as well as the Berber Museum to learn a little more about the local traditions and culture.
But the plants, color and architecture of the gardens are absolutely unique.
Any cactus lover should have visited this place!

Great Spot Outside the Rat Race.. The Jardin Majorelle is both good for escaping the city, and seeing some true character The house itself is beautiful, and for an extra 30 dirham, making it 100 dirham total, you can visit the Berber museum too. It was definitely a highlight of my visits in Marrakech

Wonderful place to relax and learn. This garden is the perfect day trip. It was a very relaxing walk through the lovely garden and the museum is full of Moroccan history. The cafe is excellent! I would totally recommend this excursion to anyone visiting Marrakech.

A peaceful respite from the mania of Marrakech. The grounds are relatively small, but an oasis of calm in the madness of Marrakech. The property, once inhabited by Yves Saint Lauren, is now a Berber museum which was the best museum we visited on our travels.
It costs 100Dirhams for tourists (50 for locals) for entrance to both the gardens and museum, but it is completely worth it.
Just ok garden. Just OK garden....not a must see... Expensive....have seen much better gardens for free in many places....
Good for plant lovers. Nice and beautiful garden. A relaxing atomsphere quiet and soothing. Entry fees is 70 dirhams for each adult and free for under 12 yrs.

Very over rated attraction. In our opinion this is a very over rated attraction, it took us 10 minutes to walk around it all and there was nothing of note to see. We enjoyed the park which was a short distance away and was free entry and contained more floral life than this Garden.

Cactus GALORE. A lovely escape from amidst the desert and heat. It is truly worth visiting to see the difference both in atmosphere and temperature. I never knew there were so many different varieties of cacti in the world...here you pretty much have them all and the wonder around is a delight to the colourful contrasts.

Something else!. Beauty.
Truly beauty, full of colours and nature.
It will recommended for sure, a little far... but worthy!

Vibrant Marrakech. Must go if your visiting Marrakech, for fashion lovers. Gorgeous place to take pictures, full of cacti's, and pond. The jewellery shop is full of gems, just a tad on the pricey side.

Beautiful Gardens and interesting Amazigh Museum. This is a wonderfully beautiful place for couples to take pictures together. There are bamboo everywhere and some old ones where people carved their names. There are many types of different plants including cacti and lotus. The Amazigh Museum is small but interesting. Well worth the visit.

Worth the $ & time. Read conflicting reviews of this Garden. Have to agree that 70DH seems a bit much for a garden visit (+30DH for museum, which we did not go for). However after the visit, we felt it was worth it, especially when one reads that the funds goes to foundations for the locals in need.

Walkways a Pleasure. I really am not sure why this place is so magical but I have visited three times now and I love the ambience and the tranquility. Beautiful, ever trendy, I can see exactly why YSL fell in love with the place. Always worth a visit - it will bring your stress levels down from the madness of the medina! You can pick up a cab to go back to town from the rank outside the main gate.
Gorgeous. We just loved this garden! Come and visit and spend some time and even have lunch. It was busy, but a lot of fun.

A lovely little garden,but not majorly worth seeing. The garden is full of stunning colours and is well kept,however,I wouldn't say it's worth £5 for the entry (it's 70 dirhams).It's pretty small, so you will end up staying for up to an hour or less if you don't want to go to the museum (it's additional 30 dirhams for the museum).There's a lovely caffe inside where you can get Moroccan breakfast for 110 dirhams.It was so filling that we didn't get hungry until very late in the afternoon!
a perfect escape. Jardin Majorelle is the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of jamaa-el-fna. The gardens are large, peaceful and luxurious. Make sure you go there if you are in Marrakesh.

Over-hyped. I expect in its day this sort of garden design was new and different and worthy of much note. Now, to many, (I have chatted to others) if one is to be honest, the garden has a couple of very nice parts but the majority is not very interesting and I wonder if it is lacking sufficient funds to keep up its planting. I did not look at the photographic or any indoor display , so I make no comment on that.

Small Heaven. A really small garden and Museum which you have to pay good ticket money to see.But if you spend the day in Marrakech so it will worth it.You will start Feeling civilized again when you stepped in that place.Birds are singing, water sounds and well english speaking tourists Around you .

a must!. if you are in town this is just a simple advice: Go! and enjoy a bit of fresh air in there.. the succulents and the caktusses actualy were my best pictures in the end.... amazing blue and yellow...also i want to add: outside a few steps down the road, where the first house is , the shops in the basement: they sell excellent parfuem, and i bought : Jardins de Marochmmmm:)

Loved the vivid colors!. We had a day to visit Marrakech and took a horse carriage from the square to Jardin Majorelle. We loved the gardens and especially the interesting artistic blue building and accent colors designed in the space.

Lovely Oasis in the middle of Marrakech. It cost 100DH each for entry into the gardens and the museum (its worth doing both for the sake of £8.
The gardens are lovely and well kept. Thee museum is small but brief.

It was good but i expected more!. I heard a lot about the YSL garden so my expectation were really high. We finished the tour in 20 min.
We paid 70 Dirhams each.
It was okay but nothing major like Valentinos garden.

Yves Saint Laurent house and garden - a colourful sanctuary. A peaceful visit to the gardens house and memorial of famous designer Yves Saint Lauren. He lived in Marrakesh for a long time and lovingly created the Gardens and house to be his unique home.Perfect for all the family to visit - maybe a tad on the boring side for youngsters - but what child really likes wandering around museums, a house and a garden THAT much? Although the wonderful cactus garden is something my younger daughter would have loved. You buy your tickets and walk through the gardens and the outside of the house - rich blues and yellows.There are galleries of art and an amazing museum of traditional Berber Moroccan jewellery and costumes - from over many many years. Bohemian heaven .... The jewellery is stunning. For me this was my favourite part.There's a book shop and gift shop with jewellery and some clothes and arty bits and bobs. And lastly a outside café - a pretty courtyard serving drinks and light food for lunches etc.Worth a visit to see the the house and gardens of a style icon. Go see the jewellery :-)

best maintained garden in Marrakesh. Very pleasant oasis of calm. Gift shop has silly prices. Surely they'd make more money with more mainstream souvenir? I'm not going to spend the same amount as my flight for a simply souvenir gift!
Beautiful. One of my favourite parts of our trip to Marrakech. A lovely and peaceful contrast to the bustle of the Medina.
Garden oasis! . Beautiful gardens with lots of photo opportunities! Quaint restaurant onsite with great options and friendly service!

just a small Garden .... if you need to breathe some fresh air ( after staying in the crowdy Medina area )then it could be a welcome break in the small garden wich in in the YS Laurent foundation.For us - coming from Ibiza and Mallorca nothing special since the vegetation and plantation was quit normal.However the art shops around the corner are very good

Not so many to see. It was not a little bit disappointing for 70dirham visit per person. It has only a small garden containing so many "cactus" trees. If you are a botanist, probably this is the perfect place. but for the normal tourist, it was fine if you dont mind to spent €7 euro for this. but, if you do mind, better to visit somewhere else.

Beautiful . Worth visiting but didn't really spend more that 1.5 hours. Views are breathtaking and an oasis of wonders. Price has been escalating though (could be on high season) and paid the high amount in the end. Would help if they have a fixed price and state it on the website and this seems to be a major problem in Marrakech.

Tourist trap! getting the most out of Yves Saint Lourent!. Entrance is way too expensive (70 D) for what it is, unless you haven t seen a cactus in your life. The garden is nice but full of tourist and you can t definitely find peace over there. There are many different plants but there is no explanations at all, just from which part of the world they are from (not even all of them!)better to spend your day in a different way

Go early in the morning. Don't miss the Berber Museum. As a garden it's only a 3 star, but it's still a "must do" in Marrakesh. Very nice but it's so crowded it's not peaceful, except in the Berber Museum which is quiet and had gorgeous displays of Berber custom dress and jewelry.

Beautiful and peaceful. This is a beautiful garden designed by the famous Yves Saint Laurent, and it has many exotic plants. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you want to escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina and the heat.

Lovely, with very diverse plants. Such a wonderful oasis in chaotic Marrakech! Take an hour to wander around and be certain to leave enough time for the wonderful boutique with very cool fashionable items, YSL would approve!

Beautiful and restful. A must-visit in Marrakesh. A beautifully laid out garden near the New City. It's not huge but offers a respite from the crowds.If nothing else, you need to visit to see the origin of "Majorelle Blue" - the most vivid blue you can imagine. Make sure to visit the berber museum as well - it is nicely laid out and offers very interesting glimpses into Berber culture.
Fabulous garden. Very pretty garden and worth the approx. 10€ ticket. Feels like stepping into a whole different world when you enter the gate, perfectly calm after the bustle outside.
Wonderful garden. This is a must see and I had great food at their cafeteria. It can get too crowded though so go early if you want to be able to take pictures.
Little over priced . The gardens are really beautiful. The house is beautiful and a few nice different gardens. Cactus, palm etc. For me it is over priced though. Only takes an hour to walk around.

Well worth a visit. Well worth a half day. The gardens are well laid out and quite beautiful. Do get the extra ticket for visiting the Berber museum. It turned out to have many more interesting artifacts than I'd anticipated.
Very Pretty. Very nice garden - difficult to get to if you are walking. Takes about 45 minutes to an hour to see.
Very Pretty. Very nice garden - difficult to get to if you are walking. Takes about 45 minutes to an hour to see.
A very beautiful Garden. This is a beautiful garden designed by french artist, and it has many exotic plants, but the best part was the museum, definitely worth the visit
Worth a visit. Beautiful and relaxing gardens. Perfect for a iphone photo shoot. My friends and I felt like royalty in this place. WORTH IT. x

Beautiful gardens. I've visited these gardens on both visits to Marrakech and wasn't disappointed on the second visit. Peaceful despite the number of visitors. I love the YSL gallery and the gorgeous colours around the garden buildings, as well as the rich abundance and depth of foliage in places. I'd go again!

Different from other attractions in Marrakech . The Jardin is very beautiful, calm and with an atmosphere quite different from other attractions in Marrakech with colorful houses, interesting shopping options and a nice cafe. Not very close to the Medina main attractions but very easy to access by taxi. Expensive compared to other places in Morocco. Go early to avoid the crowd.

Expensive visit to a nice garden. The gardens are truly nice, but the entrance fee is way overpriced. If you want to visit garden and museum, you have to pay extra. The line to get into the garden is very long - so best time to visit it is in the morning or late afternoon. We enjoyed walking around and taking photos of all the colours. Sometimes there are small plates with the names and origin of the plants, but way too few. Also, the plates offer no further information on the various plants. Since the entrance fee is so high, I hope they will use the money to put up more information on the plants that grow there.

Lovely gardens. These gardens are definitely worth a visit; they are largely cactus gardens but with a small, but fascinating, Berber museum as well. I would suggest an early morning visit as it can get very busy.
Not cheap. expensive, so make sure you like gardens.. of course they finish with a very expensive boutique. kind of crowed.

Visually stimulating. This is a must see place in Marrakech. Our heart sank on arrival to find long long queues but on checking with the people at the front to find they'd only had to wait for about 20 minutes we stayed. It seemed to be even shorte than that. These are really beautiful gardens and you'll find yourself talking a million pictures!
Relaxing. Lovely if you like plantation and a nice place to relax. Was around 70 dirhams for admission. Has a cafeteria inside and a museum inside (extra fee)

Small. I saw this was the top attraction in Morocco according to TripAdvisor reviews so I had high expectations. And was pretty disappointed. Yes, it was a nice garden. But very small. Kids were quickly bored out of their minds. More tourists than trees and plants. But a break from being run over by mopeds in the medina.
Beautiful. Certainly a beautiful/calm gardens and worth the trip. Been here a few times and always amazes me that this is such an oasis of calm in a crazy city

Beautiful, but overrated. This garden is filled with all sorts of exotic plants, history, and beautiful scenery. After paying the entrance fee (I believe it was 70DH or 7 Euros) you have access to the garden, the gift shop, and a very very small art gallery. You learn that this is where the artist Jacques Majorelle lived and created his art in the 1920s, and you can pay an additional fee to enter his house and museum. I enjoyed seeing all of the nature and architecture that inclosed the garden, but I believe the whole experience was a bit overrated. After walking around the entire garden, we saw less than a handful of plants that were actually from Morocco, or even Africa as a whole. The majority of these plants were taken from areas of Mexico, China, and various islands. We figured there would be more local plants, but it was cool seeing plants from all over the world. I say it was overrated because you spend 7 euros to walk around this garden that doesn't include a whole lot of history. Bring a camera and some walking shoes, but the kids may complain, so this may be more of a "grown ups" activity.

Peaceful gardens, excellent museum. Just don't spend too long enjoying the shade of the bamboos, the variety of cacti, the frogs beside the pools, or too long enjoying beautifully presented food in the cafe; make sure you leave enough time to study the excellent Berber museum, particularly the stunning jewellery!
Fantastic!!!. We just loved that garden. The plants, the cactus, the colours...It is a must when you come to Marrakech!
Great. Nice but expensive _ I didn't pay for museum because of garden price but that in itself was beautiful

Worth a visit . Probably the best tourist attraction we visited in Marrakech. Really beautiful place! If you're in the area you should definitely have lunch at Amal, some of the tastiest food we had on our trip and all proceeds support the wonderful foundation.

Worth a visit. The place is very tidy and you need about 1 hour to do it justice. Pay the extra 30 MAD for the museum, it is well done, but of course the signage is in French, but they have English guides. MAD 70, is a bit steep, but if it helps to keep the place in good condition then it is worth it. Very cooling place with plenty of bamboo and cacti from around the world. The YSL monument, is rubbish, I lump of cylindrical rock??
wonderful gardens .... just the most beautiful gardens and well worth a visit .. think this has got to be the no. 1 attraction

peaceful, unique, hidden garden. While in Marrakech, we stayed in the Medina, so this colonial garden in the new city was very different from almost everything else we saw there. Definitely worth a visit, especially if you want a tranquil little escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Although, I would suggest you take a taxi. The walk from the Media is not far and certainly doable, but not very pleasant.
An oasis. Its a beautiful and peaceful garden that is well tended. Try to go at times when it might be less crowded to experience the full benefit of the beauty and nature.

A nice break from the medina. If you're looking for a break from the medina, Jardin Majorelle is a great stop. Secluded from its busy surroundings, once can stroll around the picturesque gardens, and forget about the hustle and bustle of the medina.If you're staying inside the medina, and don't like to walk, a petit taxi is a good idea, which you can catch from the south side of Jemaa El Fnaa.
Beautiful garden. Beautiful garden but tourists pay more than local people :( the toilets are very clean! Its not very big

Great way to escape the noise. These gardens are a great way to escape the high paced medina and relax for a few hours. There is a large, somewhat random, collection of plants which makes for a very interesting time. The entry fee is quite high at 70mad but I still think it was worth the visit. You should be able to get a cab to and from the square for around 20mad.

Stunning place. The spirit of Yves Saint Laurent is still present in the design of the garden, the harmony of the colors blue Majorelle and ochre yellow. Such a oasis of beauty and stillness opposite to the busy and mediaeval medina of the city.
Amazing place!. You feel like in antoher world! Colourful, full of amazing plants and architectural views! Totally recomended

Beautiful Blue. These gardens are quite amazing and am sure in the height of the summer are an oasis of cool. They are not very big and it really takes no more than half an hour to get round them, strolling and taking pictures. But still well worth a visits

Oasis in the busy city. Marrakech is not as calm as most of the pictures found online and here on TA. But Jardin Majorelle did provide a peace of mind. Friends told us guards ask for money if they help you take your picture so prepare a selfie stick or tripod with timer, anything DIY. The cafe inside the garden is a bit pricey but I feel like it's worth it for the scenery.

Enchanting garden in blue!. A haven of peace and beauty in the european part of Marrakech. Beautiful, simply beautiful to walk among the cacti and ponds, and it is as well fantastic decor for pictures :-)
Nice garden but completely overpriced. Jardin Majorelle is nice, with a large variety of palm trees. However I find it overprices as it is rather small for 70Dh

pretty and relaxing visit in busling Morrocco. Great 2 hour visit to chill and refresh in busing Marrakech! I really enjoyed walking around the gardens and eating at their little café! I can understand why Yves Saint Laurent fell in love!
A very serene and relaxing place. We never miss a visit here on our Marrakech visits. Very relaxing hour or two away from the bustle of the souks.

Absolutely Gorgeous!. Jacques Majorelle's life work is one of the most visited attractions in Marrakech and for good reason. Art Deco combined with Moorish influences and vibrant primary colours mix with the luxurious desert plants, bubbling fountains and peaceful environment are an absolute must see. Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Bergé found unlimited inspiration in this magnificent oasis and restored it to its current glory. Put Jardin Marjorelle high on your list and enjoy a horse drawn carriage ride to get there. 5 stars!

Not worth it . I don't know how this is rated no 1 attraction. Weird combinations of Africa and Asia garden design. Clearly influenced by Chinese gardens with Bamboos, lotus pond and long covered corridors around etc. Not much originality, unsophisticated.
Beauty in simplicity. The remembrance statue is not really unique nor remarkable but the garden is very pretty and well maintained especially if you like bold blue and yellow decor.
Beautiful but crowded. The Jardin Majorelle was beautiful and relaxing to walk through. My suggestion is to get there early int the day to avoid the crowd and waiting too long in line.

Loved the Amazigh museum inside. The garden it self is lovely but what was most attracting is the Amazigh museum inside, the tour inside it with beyond informative and I loved how they presented the Amazighi culture in such organized way. A Must see!
Beautiful ! A Must go to place!. We enjoyed going to the garden. What was inside was so beautiful. Just like all of Morocco you never know what awaits you inside!
Nice cacti. Though the variety of the cacti are amazing, I find the display items are disappointing. Not really worth a visit if you don't like cactus.

Overpriced entry fee for such small garden. The area of the garden is really small but beautiful. There are more beautiful gardens in Morocco, of course, at better price and bigger area.If you are there to picnic, it would be fine but please note that there are not many benches. You can slowly stroll around the garden and done in 1 hour.I would be happier if the price is lower.

Garden with history . Home of YSL.
Very cheap to enter with the visit.
Various foreign trees and plants.
Perfect for plant lovers spend and hour can tour the whole garden.
excotic and beautiful. was ncie and relaxing to walk around. Luckily it is winter time so there wasn't too crowded. Impressive cactus garden.

A Beatuiful Legacy. If you are a hortculturist, you'll love it, as there is clearly a lot of variety here. If you are interested in fashion, you'll love it as the garden has a display of YSL's collage art that he created over the years for his holiday cards to his friends ; if you are neither, you may want to give this a pass.

Very pretty, get there early. Took approx 20mins to walk to from the old town where we were staying. Spent around 30mins inside the garden as it was relatively small. V peaceful and tranquil but get there early to avoid the crowds. We didn't use a tour guide but had a nice gentle stroll as it was easy to self-navigate around. Well worth a visit
Even on a wet rainy day still amazing. 70 DH for entry to garden additional 30DH for museum. Lovely little spot away from the hectic souks and Medina of Marrakesh.

A pleasant way to spend an hour. We arrived early before the crowds. We spoke to someone in our hotel who arrived after us and they said the queues we so long they couldn't get in so best go early to avoid disappointment. I was expecting more flowers but it was all rather green. Maybe it will be more colourful in summer. I can imagine it would be lovely to get out of the heat in summer but we were quite cold under the shade of the large trees so didn't stay as long as we would have done had it been warmer.
Not great.... The gardens were really busy which was annoying. They aren't really that big or varied... The locals all seem to be really proud of this attraction, but the appeal of it was lost on me.

Green and Blue..with Nature. Far from the Medina. We took around 30/40 mins by walk. It's very particular big garden in which you can see and exploring exotic plants from South America. It's not that relaxing since it's very packed of visitors. We paid 70Dr each.
Beautiful, but small. It's a must, it is incredibly beautiful but quite small and probably over priced. Probably best late afternoon as the crowds die down and the light is best for photos.

Quite difficult to find, nice to see but not a must.. We struggled to find the gardens and considered not bothering. There was a queue of about 30 people at 4.30pm on a Saturday afternoon. Once you are in they are lovely and peaceful.
Niceeeee!. Very nice with very bright colour! We liked to walk around in this park. It is a must see in Marrakech.

Pretty... Disappointed . Lovely gardens if you are on a lunch break so quite small (remember this is someone's back garden). Not really worth the trek/expense as a visitor. Locals get less than half price entrance.

Garden Oasis. This garden now revived and maintained by the foundation after the death of Yevs St Laurent, is worth a stop to see. Plants from around the world. Mostly desert type plants. The place was well maintained and clean. Bathrooms are available. Take the 30min to an hour (Or More) to visit this place. You will be glad you did!
Small and overrated. With its slightly remote location and rather high entry fee (70dh) we were a bit disappointed about this place. A bit overrated in our opinion.

A Must See in Marrakech. We were told that this is the most visited place in Marrakech, and it is easy to see why. Even though there were a lot of tourists here when we visited, the place is so calming and lovely that it was still an incredible experience. The gift shop, art gallery and book store offer many tempting mementos.

Calm and pretty. This is one of the calmer places in Marrakech getting away from the hustle and bustle of the main town.
It is not too big and quite easy to walk around and take some pictures.
Pleasant and relaxing way to start your day.

Beautiful . My husband, son, his girlfriend and I took a carriage ride from the main square and part of the ride included this garden. What a beautiful oasis of calm!! We all loved every minute of our visit. The numerous photos we took do not do it justice. My son's girlfriend who works in fashion found it really inspirational and they both loved the book shop. Would definitely recommend!!

Great way to spend a few hours. Really great trip - 70dh per person, 40 for the museum, which was okay.The shop was mega expensive, the cafe was good. We only had drinks, lovely setting for a quick pit stop.We did queue but not for long, 10 mins if that.It does get busy, but people soon move around. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful as usual..... Bring a bottle of water,long line up...But worth not good for handicap,long waiting.....beautiful relaxing moment.
Number 1 in Marrakech. There is only one word to express: stunning. It is must in any visit to Marrakech. The gardens are one of the best we have ever seen.
Don't miss the museum. Allow plenty of time to soak up the tranquility and beauty of this shady respite from the blazing African sun.

Peaceful and tranquil. This small garden is a complete surprise. Looking at the entry from the street one would not expect to find the comfortable, lovely gardens. We only had 45 minutes but that was sufficient to tour the gardens and not feel rushed. The songbirds sang to us and we were very happy with this visit. What a wonderful surprise in Marrakech!
Great day trip. Enjoyed visiting the famous gardens. Well worth making the effort to find this park if staying a few days in Marrakech.

Small but nice, don't miss the Berber museum. We visited the garden on an early weekday morning and had the place to ourselves. The gardens are very well tended but much smaller than I thought it would be, it could be viewed in 30-45 minutes. The Berber museum was worth the money for the extra ticket, it had a really cool display of all the traditional Berber dresses and jewelry. The museum is small but very informative. We looked at the posted menu for the cafe and prices were pretty overpriced and there's no view of the gardens from within- we skipped it.
Could have stayed all day.... Small but perfect garden! Well worth a visit. See the Berber museum, and do have lunch outside. Thoroughly enjoyed my time here.

Take a break in this amazing garden. Marrakech is caotic and full of smells: after a tour in the majoir square and in the suq, take a break in this amazing garden. A painter designed this house painted with this gorgeous blu color. Around he house an amazing garden with several types of plants placed according to a symmetrical geometry.

Nice, but not recommended. You pay 70 MAD and we were out in less than an hour. It is quite tiny, we spend Some time sitting around, otherwise we would have been done in 15 mins, without the feeling that we've done something special.

Calm down dear. In the midst of the heat and dust and frenetic activity that is Marrakesh, the Jardin Majorelle is a welcome oasis of calm.Entry is steep, the cafe overpriced and there may well be a long queue, but the gardens, the Yves St Laurent memorial and the small, but excellent Berber Museum are well worth a visit.Avoid peak times, snack at one of the cafes outside and you'll enjoy a tranquil break from the traffic and the souks.
Blue and beautiful. Imagine being transported away in this tranquil garden... Berber Museum for an extra price is a must also.

Delightful gardens in a tranquillity setting.. What a fantastic day out, just chilling in an enchanted garden and pleasurable surroundings. This is fantastic value for money. The contract between the Majorelle blue and natural greens of the plants is just magical. If I happen to be passing by again on my next trip to Marrakesh, it will be on my agenda of places to visit again.
