Following the visit you have the opportunity of visiting the cafe bar for a very welcome cup of refreshing Moroccain tea.

Visit to the garden, museum and restaurant . The garden was full of people so it was hard too get a decent photo taken. Very Nice though. Interresting museum. The kefta and The sardines at the restaurant was really deliscious. The best kefta in town. Hard to get the waiters attention to pay though.

A cool break from busy Marrakech. The gardens are definitely worth a visit to escape the heat and buzz of busy Marrakech. The artists studio contains a great collection of historic and cultural items.

A little oasis in central Marrakech. Lovely place to visit in Marrakech. It's a little outside the main areas, but worth going to. The cafe is great, and serves nice food and great coffee. The house, shops and gardens are all gorgeous, and many good photo ops.

Nice garden. Went there before lunch. The garden is not very large and the museum either. A little too expensive for the price, but nice garden with a lot of colors and fantastic bamboo and cactus. We had lunch there. It was okay but again a little expensive, except for the child menu for 50 MAD for french fries, crispy chicken nuggets and a tasty smoothie.
Lovely. Def worth a visit - if not just for instagram content! Priority after the main square and the souk..

Beautiful gardens and interesting museum. We went early in the morning around 10am which I would recommend doing as it was quieter and very serene in the garden. It started to get busy later on. The gardens are beautiful seen in the clear morning sun and the museum is worth paying the bit extra for as it is very well presented and informative. Nice cafe as well.

Beautiful oasis, a lovely way to spend a day peacefully. I loved the garden with its bold blue ('Marjorie Blue' I'm told) and yellows. It was an oasis of calm after the hectic life of medina. This is the place to come to spend a day of calm. There is a small museum and if you can grab an attendant they and filled with wonderful information about the pieces in collection, especially the symbolism in design. Would have loved to have spent more time both with them and the gardens. Like a lot a Marrakech museums they do not cater well for English speakers (a universal language I thought). Such a shame as to convey their culture and history serves to extend understanding of its people . It is a beautiful place.
Ok place to find a bit of shade. Found it quite hard to find then very busy when we got there. Gardens were pleasant and a nice change of pace

Lovely little oasis. We had a relaxing walk through the gardens and found the Berber Museum very fascinating. Its 100dh entry for both garden and museum which is pricey compared to other places but worth it I think. Great place to chill and take pictures. But go early gets very busy.

Stunning. These gardens were the highlight of my trip sightseeing wise. Beautifully planned and maintained. A riot of colours and an amazing selection of fauna and flora interspersed with water features. Interesting museum about Berbers too. Great shop. A lovely way to spend a few hours. Go early to avoid the crowds and experience it at its most serene.
Pointless. 70 Dh for a place without much to do/see but still crowded. Reminds me of those free botanic parks you can find everywhere in Europe... Don't waste your time

Beautiful, calm & relaxing.. Always wanted to visit this garden & now I have, lovely! There is a Berber Museum within the garden, but my husband was unable to walk further so will have to revisit another time.

Stunning views and so much history!. For anyone who ranges from smature to professional photographer, the jardin majorelle is a location you won't want to miss during your stay in Marrakech.
The colours of the buildings, the artistry and most importantly, the increfible flora make for a sensational backdrop. Make sure to visit before 5pm as the sun sets quite early.

Second Time Was Not So Great!. My opinion is based on two visits. My first visit to the Jardin Majorelle was 20 years ago. Now this is when YSL was still alive and the area was not as developed as it is today. At the time it was a true oasis in the desert. Today Marrakech has seen an influx in foreign monies that has changed the landscape. I gotta say my recent visit was very disappointing. I felt the true essence of the gardens have been lost. Sorry for being such a downer, but this is true for Marrakech on a whole.
pretty site. nice spot to take pretty pictures :) Unfortunately it was a little crowded when we were there, so I would recommend not going on a saturday.
Nice Garden. Probably the best payed attraction in Marrakesh. This garden shows you the best of the culture mixing between the nature of Morocco and France.

Not worth the money, small garden with some blue paint. Not sure why this place is ranked so high with a queue to get in. The garden is nice, but for a 100dh per person it's no wonder it's nice, they can afford an army of gardeners to rake all the soil flat and paint stuff bright colours. If it was 20dh, maybe 3 stars.

In love with Majorelle Blue. A bit small but it was time well spent in a new part of the city to explore. I would recommend pairing this visit with the Amal Cooking Class / Restaurant since it's a close walk. The admission of 70Dh was more than other palaces or museums but not outrageous.
In the memory of YSL. No doubt, it is so peaceful, colorful and worth to visit... It is just like a oasis in desert. And the story lying beneath makes this place more meaningful...

A Peaceful Place before 9am. I visited this place on my own as it was supposed to be on an organised tour which didn't arrive. I arrived before the hoards of tourists before 9am. It was so peaceful and pleasant to get away from the leaded petrol pollution, with the sound of bird song amongst the vegetation. It costs 70 Dinah plus extra 30 for the museum. I didn't visit this museum.
Not to be visited. They can not be visited anymore !! They were availabe at some point to be visited but now they are not available anymore.

Very beautiful in blue and yellow. This is a great place to visit for lovers of design, impressive colours, gardening and the Berber culture.
Do not miss the Berber Museum and enjoy a coffee in the beautiful restaurant.

Wonderful. Well I am not one for gardens generally but this was just a beautiful setting - not as large as I thought it would be but it made up for it with the planting - birdsong - and or course the colours. We stayed and had some lunch in the garden - this was very nicely done too. I would visit again as I have discovered something I like!

Beautiful trip to le jardin. We had a great visit to le jardin marjorelle. It was easy to get to from the medina (30 dirhams in a taxi from el moukhef). The garden itself is beautiful and full of plans from regions all over the world. The berber museum is also worth a visit, even if just to admire the traditional dress. Avoid the petit taxis that queue outside the jardin. They will overcharge by 50 dirhams to go back to the medina. I suggest walking a bit to find petit taxis with more reasonable rates.

Beautiful oasis. Situated just outside of the medina, this is a beautiful, peaceful garden that is full of great plants, landscapes and that beautiful vivid blue. The cafe is excellent too. The only thing I was slightly disappointed with was the Berber museum; seemed very lacking in detail but that wasn't the main point of the visit.

Tranquil, beautiful and interesting. We spent the best part of a morning wandering the gardens, taking in the peaceful atmosphere (despite the people falling over each other to grab the best photo spots!) The best part is the museum which was fascinating and well curated. The cafe is also gorgeous with a lovely terrace to relax over coffee or lunch. As walkers we struggled to find the entrance because it's set well back from the main road and not well signposted. If you come by taxi that wouldn't be a problem. 100% worth a visit.
Beautiful. Gorgeous garden. Magically done. Berber museum incredibly well curated. Nice complement to the one in Ourika valley.
Blue. Lovely and quiet garden. Beautiful blue walls and pretty interesting museum. But try to avoide the most busy time of the day. Not Worth standing in long lines.
Well worth a visit!. Beautiful and unique gardens - well worth a visit - nice café to sit in, not big so only need an hour

Waste of Time and Money. We waited in line for about 20 mins to the pay a rather spicy entry fee. We were expecting something of a WOW-factor but sadly couldn't find it anywhere. Yes the blue buildings are very beautiful and the ponds and fountains are quite delightful, but apart from a few holiday snaps for facebook this was not worth the drive nor the entry fee. While we were there some member of the royal family was visiting so we were told rather harshly to walk back and wait. The garden is very small and having 30% cordoned off was a definite downer.One of those things that land in the "been there, done that, don't need to go back" folder.

Beautiful . A tranquil haven. Beauty for the senses. Even though there are many other travellers I could imagine myself sitting peacefully on a bench and while away an hour in contemplation. The Gardens are immaculately kept. A small oasis in Marrakech.

Peace and tranquility . Very peaceful gardens that are lovely to walk around and out of the busy hustle n bustle. Great photo opportunities. We enjoyed the Berber museum and how all the mirrors reflected and lights twinkle. Amazing room. The information cards were informative too and easy to follow.

over-rated over priced . we were expecting so much more than just a small "blue" garden with a museum inside "not free" as well. we could have done much better for 110dhs than just walking around and taking pictures which are already on this app.
GORGEOUS !. An essential visit whilst in Marrakesh.The Jardin is exquisitely beautiful and colours are amazing. The Museum is very interesting and well worth seeing.

Crowded Beautiful Garden. A small garden but gorgeous.
Cactus, cactus, cactus so you better be in to cactus!
Very crowded on New Year's weekend and LOTS of French people who still seem to act like they own Morocco.
Not a quiet day because of too many tourists, again, largely French.

a magical escape. a really beautiful garden that encapsulates the botany of morocco in a peaceful and unique setting... we enjoyed wandering through the garden and looking at the myriad of cacti... would recommend a trip to this garden

Worth a visit. A tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of the city, this garden is well worth a visit. You can cover it off in less than an hour or take your time, relax on the many benches and just enjoy the cool.

peaceful. I expected this to be very colourful, the museum is the blue building in all of the pictures other than this its a lot of cactus' - It was lovely and peaceful so good to see, I wouldnt go back though. The area surrounding it has some great places for lunch so check those out
Refuge from heat. Nice place ... nothing fancy ... great place for botany lovers! there is a nice cafe in the middle of the place

Waste of time. I have no idea why this is so highly rated on TA.... The location is ages from everywhere and therefore requires a taxi there and back to the centre. It is relatively expensive to enter (70 dirham, whereas palaces in Marrakech are 10dihram) and not impressive inside. It's small and full of cactuses and bamboo with little else. Perhaps it was the time of year and therefore there were no flowering plants, but I would give it a miss and definitely regretted going.

Great experience . It's a must see in Marrakech, it's real journey in history
The colors, the garder and the variety of plants is just incredible, you can feel the inspiration source of hsl when walking through

must see Marrakech Garden. One of the most unique Gardens in Africa, different plants from all over the world, different colors and a berber Museum.
If you are visiting Marrakech dont miss M Yve Saint Laurent famous Gardens.
amazing place. terrific place to chill out. If you want to relax in the city center that is the place to be! YSL gardin, amazing color :-) good inspiration place for creatif people ;-) check it out
FABULOUS MUST SEE. at long last after many years and several visits to Marrakesh, I finally made it to the Jardin Majorelle. do NOT. Miss the dab museum with Berber jewellery. A treasure
An absolute gem! . An absolute gem of a place and not to be missed. Gardens are beautiful and the cafe was well managed. The museum was an added bonus.

Sublime !. Love this place, very green and sunny, it's like an oasis in Marrakech :)
Take the time to breath and enjoy ( and look all the differents cactus, its crazy)
Worth a visit. This is beautiful place and the small Berber museum on the grounds is very interesting. This is definitely worth a visit but you only need to allow one hour or so.

Nice Gardens in the heart of Marrakech. The Majorelle Gardens offer a beautiful selection of plants and trees around the world. It is maintained at a very high standard and care. The entry price is however a little excessive in my view at 70 DH per adult excluding the entry to the museum which is set inside. Good experience nevertheless.
Green Hide Out. The garden is green and lush - and a nice break from the bustling souk. There is a museum in the garden which I did not visit.

Small but beautiful. We were taken here on our horse draw carriage outing on Christmas Day. We had to queue to get in and once inside we found out why. The gardens are very small so numbers had to be limited and it only takes 15 minutes to walk around. Having said that they are beautifully laid out and well worth visiting. You will get some lovely photos here. I have never seen such big cacti in all my life! There is a small cafe, and a gift shop for any presents you want yo buy.

Jardin Majorelle - Not anything to write home about. We fitted this into our trip around Marrakech as we felt we should. It was OK as a fill-in thing to do but I wouldn't be sorry to have missed it. As it's outside the old city gates, we took advantage of the distance to have a horse and carriage ride back to our Riad - that was my favourite bit of the trip!
Really great escape from intensity of Marrakech. This is a great place to visit whilst in Marrakech. The gardens are beautiful and it feels like an escape from the hussle and bussle of the square.
Utterly Beautiful. Gardens do not disappoint, would visit again and again. Close proximity to main square and easily reached by taxi or bus.
AMAZING. You must visit this beautiful garden, it is gorgeous and very reasonably priced. Please don't just take photos-LOOK-you are missing out!

a bit gimmicky. I know I was supposed to be wowed by this space, but it all seemed very contrived. Yes, a lot of stuff is painted blue. Great. And the pots were painted lots of bright colors. Super. But the plantings are sparse with little context or depth. There's also a strong, commercial, "exit through the gift shop" air about it that left me feeling generally disappointed, slightly poorer after the not-cheap entry free, and, well, a bit blue.
Lovely serene garden. Loved the garden and the small gallery space dedicated to Yves saint Laurent, very vibrant colours and beautiful plants.

Highly recomemded. Although the photos you see of the Jardin Majorelle look lovely they really do not do it justice and you need to see it for yourself. It's worth doing the Berber museum in the corner of the garden - disappointingly no photos allowed, but it does present facts and information about the berber way of life that would have otherwise passed us by. You can buy a joint ticket at the entrance or pay separately to go into the museum, there is no price difference.

Beautiful Gardens . Don't miss this beautiful garden! We had planned for a 1 hour tour, and didn't want leave at the end of it.It was a little crowded, as it was the Christmas holiday. But so worth it!

nice but small. interesting garden with lots of cacti . they make a thing out of the buildings being painted a deep blue but don't know how authentic it is.Can be a bit out of the way and an effort to get there. we took a taxi to take you there -25 dirhams. The Berber museum is great and worth the visit to the gardens.
full of wonder. Although a small garden, this is well worth a visit - even if you are not an artist. The colours, layout and design of the place is really inspiring.

For 70 dh I can do better things. Nice & calm garden to relax in but because all the signs were in French I couldn't understand any history of the place. If you're an adventurer/backpacker like me you will probably find better things to spend 70 dh (or 100 dh if you go inside the museum) on. A bit of a walk from the medina too.
oasis of calm. Nice place to hang out for a few hours,especially if its hot, nice little cafe, beautiful gardens, well maintained.

Amazing plant varieties . Beautiful cactus plants probably from the Mexico and other countries were one of the main attractions.Yves Saint Laurent gave it to Marrakech according to history. The lovely architecture and the garden were certainly inspirational for YSL as there were painting on LOVE as exhibits. The souvenir shop was of high standard with YSL designed household items to accessories and handbags. They were expensive but worth buying if you like his designs.

Beautiful Garden to Stroll Around. 70dH for entrance. Garden is very picturesque. The famous Majorelle blue really is something to see. Definetely a must visit in Marrakech. I'd recommend reading the Wikipedia on it before you go, you'll be able to appreciate it a little more.
Interesting gardens. The garden shops and exhibition were interesting but the long queue to go into the museum spoilt the experience.
Beautiful. The gardens are an oasisofpeace. They are colourful witplants collects from all parts of the world and carefully arranged to maximize the views and get the best from the garden
Jardin Majorelle. A delightful place well worth visiting. Very peaceful and lovely to see with a very nice shop and museum. An hour or so is enough time there.

Waste of time and money. The place is very overrated. I didn't visit the museum so I can't say nothing about it. The entrance is the most expensive I payed during the whole trip in the city. It has well maintained cactus gardens (small ones), but that is all you'll see. If you want a place full of tourist, a short walk in a garden and an entrance for 70 Dirham, then go. But I find this a waste of time.

Majorelle Blue. This place is worthwhile see. It will take couple of hours to go around the garden. After the tour there is a nice coffee across where you may spend some time. Being a private garden in the past, now it is open for public. I liked the plants, colors and landscaping.

Beautiful & Colourful. Must visit for anyone in Marrakech. My wife and I were in Morocco for about 10 days, this garden is worth seeing. Not very far from old town where we stayed. The garden is very beautiful and the indigo and yellow paint combination is very picturesque. One of the guards was very helpful and took a few pictures for us with different backgrounds. Definitely Recommend!!

Spectacular gardens! . We visited here on New Year's Day and we were very happy with our decision. The gardens are beautiful, very well maintained. There was a long queue when we arrived but don't let this put you off as they queue moved very quickly and we weren't waiting more than ten minutes to enter.

A place of beauty. Although the garden is planted primarily with cacti, it was so thoughtfully and artfully created that visitors are still stunned by the variety and beauty on essentially non-glowering plants. The garden provides a wonderful breather from trecking around Marrakech and is well worth the visit.

Overrated botanical garden. The garden itself if just fine, witha god collection of cacti and extra merit considering the difficulty of maintaing a botanical garden in the middle of Marrakech. But beyond this, the place is pretty uninteresting, rather small and I oersonally do not see how it can be so highly rated. The connection with YSL is an interesting element of the visit and the gift shoo actually good with designs made by Yves Saint Laurent
Gorgeous. The colors and the plant-life are breath-taking! And it is so clean. Jardin Majorelle is definitely worth a visit!!

Relaxing, peacefull and nice. Even a long queue to get inn is is worth it.Nice and peacefull garden. Lots of photo opportunities and helpfull employees.We really enjoyed.Tourist pay 100 Dhm and local 50. Very fair since foundation support education and development for Morrocans!

Lovely oasis in Marrakech. This is a great botanical garden with varied cacti. It is owned by Yves Saint Laurent . The colours are the most intriguing with pots and buildings being cobalt blue with accents of yellow. It really stands out amongst all the green. It's a lovely break from the hustle and bustle of the Red City.
The best view of Marrakesh. It's a well designed and maintained garden! The plants themselves are eye-opening, the fountain and museum win extra stars for it!
Beautiful Garden!. Beautifully manicured and landscaped garden. Very peaceful to venture through, or simply for a quiet seat.
Colourful oasis in a dusty city. Well worth a visit, some truly spectacular cacti and dazzling colours. Choose your time to visit carefully as it can get very busy.

Delightful Oasis. We took a taxi from our hotel so that we could get here early before the crowds. This was a good move as it got fairly busy towards lunchtime even in December. I had heard that the garden was very small so I was pleasantly surprised at the size of it, we spent a good couple of hours here including a visit to the Berber museum and some refreshments in the cafe. There was enough in flower to be interesting and the tall bamboos would be a cool place to linger in the summer. We enjoyed seeing how many frogs there were hiding in the central pool.

Delightful Oasis. We took a taxi from our hotel so that we could get here early before the crowds. This was a good move as it got fairly busy towards lunchtime even in December. I had heard that the garden was very small so I was pleasantly surprised at the size of it, we spent a good couple of hours here including a visit to the Berber museum and some refreshments in the cafe. There was enough in flower to be interesting and the tall bamboos would be a cool place to linger in the summer. We enjoyed seeing how many frogs there were hiding in the central pool.

Wonderful garden, sensitively developed and well-maintained.. It may be more expensive to enter than most local attractions, but 70Dhs is still less than GBP5 and it helps keep-up this delightful garden and buildings. Quite a small area, densely planted, water features, and some architectural gems including a little painting pavilion of Arab-Andalucian style, and the Villa-Studio in a Modernist-Cubist style. Planters and surfaces often finished in deep blues and yellows which glow in the light dappled by giant bamboo. Places to sit and contemplate, listen to the birds singing, and wish you owned it! Nice terrace to purchase your mint tea, again a little more expensive than average, but good quality and service. Palms, other trees and cactus are often named if you have expert interest. Children seem happy with the surroundings also. Not to be missed on a visit to Marrakech if you have any sensitivity at all :)

A tranquil oasis. We arrived by horse drawn carriage and it was a welcome oasis to step into after the madness of the souks. It was peaceful, fascinating and immaculately maintained. Garden was intriguing. Colours were bright yet there was a calmness. The Museum within the grounds was stunning and the artwork fun.
I love this place. So beautiful and divine. A great place for peace and awesome photos. Worth every single dime. A must see.

If you have too much time, this could be an option. The Jardin Majorelle is a little overrated. At the first step you take inside you have seen it all. It is very small and it not really special. We didn't go into the museum, so I cannot say anything about that. Afterwards we went to the five-star hotel Mamounia to drink something and their garden is more impressive than Jardin Majorelle.
Worth it!. A beautifully played out museum and garden. I especially liked the relics and clothing from Berber peoples.
Completely overrated . This is completely overrated and expensive. Whilst it is an oasis of calm, it is comparatively expensive to go in, and the photo opportunities aren't that great.

Beautiful and unique . Found these gardens really nice but entry fee if a bit too highDifferent concept beautifully designed very well maintained They are definitely worth a visit if u visit marrakech

Gorgeous Gardens. Unique gardens. Formerly a palm grove turned into private gardens and a studio now filled with cacti and palms and large grasses with carefully raked sands and gravels and water features. It is an oasis of calm in a busy and sometimes smoggy city. Delightful vistas and in the evening the light creates wonderful effects. 16.30-17.00 in late December is perfect.

Relaxing, interesting, enchanting. Well worth a visit. Costs 70DH for the garden plus 30DH for the museum although I wouldn't bother with the museum. Enchanting and relaxing garden. Fun to watch the wannabe-fashionistas walking around, sketching and taking selfies. Take a book and read under the trees on one of the many benches there.
The. Oasis of Marrakech. Take time to relax and walk through these gardens. Get away from me hustle of the souk into a lovely garden.

It's an overpriced garden . This garden is very pretty but I would not say it's worth the fifty dhm cab fare (from the main square of the medina) and 70 dhm entry fee. It was not even close to being tranquil as we were surrounded by hoards of tourists. If you want a break from the crowds go elsewhere.

Lovely Garden & YSL's paintings. Lovely peaceful place to visit, YSL's paintings are super, an eye opener.
Though I feel the entrance fees are abit higher.
Peaceful escape from the medina. Beautiful gardens, quite respite from the noise and congestion of the medina. Its less crowded early mornings, a nice way to spend a few hours.
Cacti at it's best. This is an amazing garden filled with unique cacti. If you have never seen this type of a garden it is definitely worth a visit.
Average. Nothing special. Beware... There is an Expensive overrated cafe.... 35MAD for poor quality orange juice
Takes 30 minutes to see.. Nice surprise in Marrakech - small gardens but worth the visit. Lots of cactii and grasses. Well kept, small average museum

Small and beautiful. The gardens are beautiful and small and easily covered in one hour ( or less). The monument to Yves st Laurent is a bit of a disappointment! Worth a visit but wont take long. We did not go to the museum - which if you did would add a bit more time.

Nice but a bit overrated . It's a beautiful garden. Lovely and serene in the midst of a big city.
I did feel it was a bit overrated. There's not much to do and it's not that big.

Oasis of beauty in a busy place. The gardens are beautiful and well worth a visit, it is a place of tranquillity and it is obviously still a labour of love, beautiful colours and stunning planting... a must while y ou are here... the café is good too....if you are a garden lover then this is one not to miss...

Cool and shady on a hot day. A very pretty garden with photo opportunies at every step. Not too big so you can't get lost but packed with beautiful plants and "cool" in both senses of the word - it was owned by Yves St Laurent after all!

Lovely, peaceful haven. Lovely gardens and a photographer's paradise. The sunlight through the trees is amazing. 45 minutes is long enough to look around. The entry fee is more than reasonable. A lot of people have found the need to scrape their names into the bark of some of the trees and bamboos.....shame, perhaps this is why there are quite a few security guards scattered around. All in all, a lovely atmospheric garden, hard to believe it's in the city centre.

An Unexpected Oasis. I visited the Jardin Majorelle and the Berber museum on 27 December 2015. It's an oasis of calm in what can be a rather frantic city. Definitley worth a visit if you have the time. The only downside is that it is very popular so you have queue for the good photo opportunities and hope that you're not assaulted by a selfie stick. The museum is small and gets quite crowded. Resist the urge to let the volume of people force you into flying past the exhibits. They really are worth stopping for.

Nice garden, place to take pictures. The garden is not big but very beautiful. We had lunch in the garden, the environment is good but the price is high (approximately 100 dirham for Couscous). The taste is just the average level. It's better to have lunch outside.
Fun and relaxing place to visit. This is a great place to wander for an hour or so. Do not miss the Berber Museum within the garden--a lot of people skip it, but it is great.

A beautiful and tranquil oasis located on the outskirts of Marakech.. One of the 'Must See's' of Marrakesh especially if it's a hot hot day.A little out of the old town but worth the walk or cab ride.The 12 acres of the Majorelle Gardens surround a small modernist house (no access) and former art studio once owned by the artist Jacques Majorelle. It took him some 40 years to landscape the gardens and winding walk ways which are stunningly planted with palms, ferns and cacti providing much needed shade and plenty of 'Kodak' moments at every turn. Later the house was more famously owned by the fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent. The former art studio now houses a small Berber Art Museum and there is also a walled cafe in the grounds but take lots of water with you. (Visited in October 2013)
Stunning. Fabulous garden with amazing planting .. Very different to traditional gardens .. Really peaceful ..well worth visiting .. However coffee shop very expensive and over priced ..
Loved it!. This beautiful garden reminds me of Frida Kahlo house in Coyoacan, Mexico City. A very nice change from busy dusty streets of Marrakech.

Even in Winter, beautiful enough. Some reviewers said that the park was too small and entrance fee were too high etc. It depends on what the visitor expected and their senses of travel budgets. If you are relatively young and not interested in the beautiful things and highly sophisticated art concept, you need not visit this place.On the contrary, if you like luxury atmosphere and high class society things; do not hesitate to visit here.The size of the park does not matter, what the park would present you is important.Whether you can feel good or not must be decided by how you are spending your life until now.The cafe of the park were also worth while being there. Either just having a tea or having lunch. Lunch portion were not huge, very good size for elder people, I think.The museum in the park charged MAD 30 in addition but it was worth enough for me. The mirror room was so beautiful and artistic. You can learn the culture there.Highly recommending to stay more than 1 hour at least. 2 hour is ideal, having short break at the cafe.

Blues and yellows. Beautiful must see gardens. Lovely walks through cactus and banana trees. Wonderful bright blues and yellows frame the gardens. Enjoy a tea or yummy moroccan salad in the cafe attached to the gardens. Don't forget to go to the museum which is located inside, great exposition of Berber clothes, history, and jewelery.
Lovely place - not much for kids to do. It was a nice garden, but our daughters didn't have much to do, but it also didn't take up tons of time, so it was fine.
Beautiful . Beautiful, relaxing and serene. A must visit if you are in Marrakech. Lovely restaurant, shop and museum. Highly recommended!
Nothing much. Had to pay around £5 pp entry fee, disappointed with it. Just a bunch of tees from around the world in a small space. Not worth it.
Beautiful garden!. wonderful place to visit for a nice relaxing walk around the garden! Food was ok at the restaurant, was decent for a quick bite to eat.

They were lovely. An oasis in the chaos that is Marrakech. We were expecting the beautiful gardens but the Berber Museum came as a surprise and was one of the most informative museums we visited in Morocco. Outstanding exhibits. Also we were pleased to find a bookstore and were entertained by the high-priced "gift shop" dedicated to Yves Saint Laurent takes on Moroccan fashion.
Lovely..... The plants and colours in this place are simply magical but it's very small and they really like to cram people in so don't expect much peace and quiet. Definitely worth a visit though.

Lovely -- with an hour or two. A lovely stop whilst in Marrakech. A relatively quick stroll but leisurely for taking photos. The museum inside is worth the extra few dirhams, and the gift shops are actually nice. We skipped the cafe as it didn't strike is as a must-do.
A welcome break in a busy city. Stepping into the garden you immediately feel the calming and cool atmosphere. It is a lovely garden well worth a visit but don't expect to be whisked off your feet.

Calm oasis in a busy city. Although this costs 70 dirhams to enter, it's an enjoyable walk along pathways in the shade, looking at many varieties of cacti and enjoying the peace. The way the lights filter through the palms is lovely and you can take lots of beautiful pictures. The giftshop has many nice but expensive possibilities.
Amazing gardens!. Visited the gardens in April.. Loved the way the plants are organised. Loved the colour blue and yellow around the gardens.It's such a beautiful tranquil place away from the souks.

Good but not awesome . Like the titles says, good but not awesome. Kind of feel it's too samey. Staff are lovely though. A little extortionate for what your getting. But clean and well kept compared to other attractions so price is kinda justified.
Hoilday. Its not cheap to get into and isnt worth what you pay as its only a few pathways. The museum that's inside the place is at a more cost.

Xmas holiday . Not recommended at all. It's just a waste of time and money. Nothing interesting to see. Before going there I though it's a massive garden because we were give 1 hour to explore and free time. We visited the garden in 10 mins and did not know what to do after that. It's a boring trip with boring guide.

Colourful and Calming. This attraction is a credit to the legacy of Yves St. Laurent with it's colour and exquisite layout. A lovely calming garden with unusual succulents and water features. A great place to chill out with a good book and enjoy the serenity of a meticulously maintained garden.

Go on foot from jeema el fna. The gardens are great, an oasis, especially if you are staying close to crazy jeema el fna. If you are able to, go on foot from the main square to the gardens. It takes over 30 minutes, but the way is enjoyable and you end up experiencing other faces of the city. Besides this, you don't need to deal with taxi drivers and save some energy!

Oasis in Marrakech. A wonderful place where a lot of 'best of Marrakech' meet! Garden, Museum, Café and Shopping! Don't miss one of them!Make sure, when buying your ticket, that you get the one for the small Museum too, it's worth the visit! Great shopping in the bookshop and at the boutique, where you'll find carefully chosen products! Don't miss this jewel!
Great park . Cool park ,absolutly loved it .The only thing what was not so nice is the caffee inside the park ,over priced and not good food.
High end garden. Best and well kept garden. Expensive to enter but worth the fee. Taken loads of photos and very nice to see the intricate design of the garden.
Wonderdul sight !. Don't miss the jardin Majorelle ! It's a calm place far from the crowd of the souks, don't be afraid, it's not far away from Jemaa el Fna ! The colours are magnificient !
Nice and green. It's great for a desert climate like Morocco, but it is not the best botanical garden that I have visited

Just OK. Went with family. Unfortunately if was very hot. One can spend few hours in the Garden.
Nice restaurants outside gate. I recommend it
Small garden. Small and very touristy. All there is cacti and more cacti. Museum is small and not worth the 40min wait . However if you like Cactus, this is the place to go .

Ok, but worth to visit. For YSL sake, you should go there.
The entrance fee is sort of pricy comparing to all the other ones in Morocco.
Has nice garden
Pretty garden. I enjoyed an afternoon in the gardens, its beautiful. Wished I taken a little snack for picnic. Lovely colours, Understandable why Yves Saint Laurent bought the garden.

Oasis in the city. The gardens are a treat in a city that doesn't have much green space. Although it was busy, it still feels very tranquil. The gardens are beautiful and the colours striking.
The Berber museum is also very interesting and worth spending the time to visit.

Absolutely stunning. This was one of my favorite places we visited while in Morocco. This garden is jaw droppingly beautiful and it's so peaceful. I suggest going as early in the morning as you can because this place gets packed with tourists and it was a little hard to get pictures towards the end.
Beautiful. Beautiful and definitely a must see in Marrakech! The gardens are lovely to walk around and the house just look magnificent from all angles!

Beautiful . Beautiful and quiet place worth visiting (expensive though 70MAD- December 2015 =7€)
Amazing colours and views, nice for a relaxing moment away from all the caos from the medina!

Beautiful spot to relax! Also, great photo op!. These gardens are beautiful and serene. My favorite was finding a little bench to relax on and take it all in. The museum is great too. Especially the jewelry. Definitely visit these gardens and take some beautiful photos - the colors are vibrant and beautiful. Don't need to stay more than a couple of hours at the most.

Eden in the city!. Lovely place, definitely worth a visit!
Was a little expensive but splendid plants and colours all round.

Nice, rather small and popular. The garden is well maintained, different plants offer pleasant visit (and nicebphotos) even in winter season and although the place is not large at all, it is worth a short visit. The entry fee 70dhs - without museum - is fair, but be prepared to share the garden with many other tourists, it is very popular. You can also relax in a café or buy presents in local butique, which is decently arranged.

Very peaceful . It was a little hard to find but once we followed the signs it was a hidden oasis of greenery.Took about an hour to go round the gardens and the museum. The cafe was very expensive so we chose not to eat there.

Hidden jewel. A beautiful, secret garden in the middle of the craziness that is Marrakech! Peaceful gardens, stunning colorful structures, lovely gallery of YSL art, and a very cool little Berber museum. The courtyard cafe made amazing tea and was a nice place to sit and soak in the experience. Parking is a bit of a challenge and it's not easy to find, but there are lots of photo opps here. Well worth the trip!

Nice garden with exotic plants but not necessarily best value for money. Would recommend for people that like strolling in parks and gardens and taking their time to enjoy nature but not sure at 70 dhs or around 7 euros per person, it is the best value for money considering other more affordable/cheaper and more authentic Moroccon activities available in the city.

A quiet spot in the city. After a long day of walking around Marrakech it was nice to take a moment away from the hubbub of the city. It's definitely one of the nicer, more lush gardens in the city but it isn't large and can be walked around in less than an hour. We walked from the main square which is about 30 minutes away and was easy enough to find (with a map). If you don't mind the walk I'd recommend a jaunt from the main square to the Cyber park, Park El Harti then Majorelle gardens and back which ticks off a good section of Marrakech since you won't spend long in the gardens. The gardens are worth seeing and it has an outside cafe which serves some lovely tea too.

Really nice place. We sopouse to walk to the garden, but out side Our hotel was this Nice guy - we did not take any - agry With a price and ib stead to walk we got nice driver.Hes name i Ahmed and his phone is +212661741861You are not going to regreat. He took as to meny places

Magnificent ! A must see in Marrakech. Jardin de Majorelle is like a dream, oasis and heaven after one exhausted day. If you just visit Marrakech for one day, don't go other place, you must visit here. There are also many cactus, bamboos and plants, if you need some fresh, stay here for a evening. And there is a Berber museum inside, it's also worth to see. 位於馬拉克什的聖羅蘭花園非常美，美的超現實又充滿野性。那個藍色非常有魔力，會讓人在此一直狂拍照片。如果在這裡只待一天，我很推薦只來這與舊市集。
So So. . Its OK. Nothing to write home about. If you have been to other similar places you will be disappointed, not sure why its number one activity!Nice and quite from the hassles of Marrakech.

Excellent place for a stroll through the gardens..... A wonderfully cared for garden of desert plants and trees inside a walled garden in the City. The cobalt blue color is everywhere, and we loved it.

Go early!!! Bit expensive entrance fee.. Nice place to visit and take photos.Go very early when opening up. Gets very crowded by 11am.Entrance fee is higher than most attractions. Whopping 70 dhirams!

Great place to get away from the heat.. This is a beautiful garden with history and a very interesting small museum and shop. Best to get there early or late to avoid the large parties. One of the highlights of the city.

Tranquil Place in Marrakech. Missed going to this place last year when we visited the city so decided to make it this year and wasn't disappointed. It is a little expensive I thought to get in but it is worth it. The gardens are very lush and the architecture and design is attractive. The colours uses in the garden are also very vivid. I went there mainly for the photography but if you like plants and gardens you will love this. Plenty of places to rest around the garden and sit and enjoy the peace and tranquility. Toilets on site are well maintained. There is also some nice places to eat around and about the location when you have visited the site.It is definitely a place to put on your 'to do' list for your visit to Marrakech. Great for photography.

Beautful. Went as first of 2 gardens visited booked through Thomson Rep. Well worth the visit. Well maintained and interesting dating back to 1920s then refurbished by Yves St Laurent somewhat later. Amazing cacti. Shop nice but very pricey, a true oasis in Marrakech.
Good ambiance . Visit at sunset for a treat of birds returning to their nests. The Berber museum was informative. Otherwise not very special.
Nice garden. A nice garden, worthwhile to visit. There is a cafe just across the garden, it is nice to have a seat and have a coffee there.

Calm and friendly. This is well worth a visit if staying in Marrakesh. The gardens are very relaxing and the cafe is a very peaceful place to spend an hour. Be wary of the taxi arrangements... We were charged twice as much for a shorter journey ... Make sure you get a price before you get in!

Paradise Found. Whatever else you do in Marrakech make sure you find time to visit these exquisite gardens and when you go take your time to enjoy their magnificence to the full. A real oasis in a dust-bowl of a place
amazing cacti. lovely unusual Moroccan teas in the cafe, e.g. Blue tea. Gardens clean and beautifully tended garden. Definitely worth a visit.

very beautiful .. but. Oh mon Jardin Majorelle et belle , it's what all the people are saying , according to them one of the most beautiful garden in Marrakesh . Yes it is : big enough ( but there are begger ), beautiful ( there are more beautiful) , has a lot of things to admire ( there are places opened for free and more intersting ). What i liked more was the museum , including it's books and the LOVE sector , oh yes that's my favorite and what i liked more .
Must do. It would be on my must do list... A lovely garden, not huge, but very tasteful and very Moroccan. A great place to visit in a free afternoon in Marrakech.

Lovely to visit if you are in the area. A little oasis in Marrakech and lovely to walk around. We were there in December so no queues and very quiet. Nothing really but a beautiful garden so the entrance fee is a little high. Might have something to do with the number of people they employ!

The berber museum was such a jewel, really worth paying a visit!. The Jardin Majorelle are really enchanting, but don't forget to go to the berber museum, it is really worth it! Such a rich culture and the jewelry is amazing, the room dedicated to it is completely magical! Enjoy...;)

Oasis in Marrakech. The gardens are an oasis of peace. The atmosphere is quite magically, everything is well maintained and the colours and plants are beautiful. Definitely stop for lunch at the restaurant in the gardens, the sandwhiches and salads are very tasty.

Not really my thing. There are so many beautiful gardens in Marrakech and I thought this one must be special. I was wrong! It is very clean there but you'll manage to walk through it in no time and there is not much else to do around the garden. Therewith nothing really special for me.

Surprised. Was surprised to find a lovely garden in tribute to Yves Saint Laurent behind a wall at the back of a side street. The contrast from the street to a beautiful shade garden with different sections and water features. Highlighting art work painted each year by Yves within a small gallery.
An oasis in the middle of Marrakech . visited le jardin Majorelle while staying in Marrakech last November. What a beautiful oasis of percé in the middle of the busy Moroccan city. A Must to go!!

Relaxing Stroll. A relaxing space outside the hustle and bustle of the Marrakech streets. Beautiful gardens and a nice well priced restaurant tucked away at the back! Can get very busy so pick your times right!

Must see in Marrakesch. I went to the Jardin Majorelle in the beginning of dezember.
We didnt had to wait long to get entrance.
It is cozy place a bit outside the medina of marrakech.
It is a nice place to flee from the stressfull city.
But the entrance fee is a bit overpriced the the museum inside wasnt worth it for the price

Amazing but not in Morocco. it was a main stop for me when i was on the hop on hop off bus and i insisted to check it out. the queue was scary but i wanted to go in but it was quick. during this time i picked up the brochure and read the story of the garden. the entrance fees is relatively high 70 dirhams and 30 dirhams for the museum which i skipped. once i was inside i felt as if i am in another world more off thailand or any asian country. the plantation inside is from all over the world and is very interesting. the design is capturing but i only felt that it is as if they brought it from so place of the world and they throw it here. the cafe inside is really a must if you have time.
Relaxing get away . The Jardin Majorelle is a nice place to visit just get away from the craziness that is Marrakech. It has an interesting history too.

An oasis in Marrakech. I'm so glad I visited--the array of plants, especially cacti, was beautiful to see. We arrived early, so it felt like the garden was all ours for the first twenty minutes or so. I hear it's at its quietest early and late in the day, and I think others will enjoy it most when you can enjoy it in relative silence. Other reviews have complained about the price: 100 dirhams to visit both the Berber Museum and the Jardin Majorelle, but at £7 for the two, that's a very good price compared to many US and UK museums and gardens.
Botanic garden. It's exquisite botanic garden. Rather small, so unless you have a specific interest, one hour will cover it adequately.

Beautiful Gardens. Lovely gardens, small but well-kept, with plants from all over the world. The blue paint all over the inside is gorgeous. The Berber Museum inside was also interesting, another small but well-kept collection.
loved this garden!. the majorelle gardens is a MUST see place. We loved the place and we also liked the museum that is attatched to it. We ate in the cafe there too which was nice and cool

A nice garden but .... a little overrated and expensive. For $7 in Marrakech, that's expensive. Of course, if this were Paris, you'd pay a lot more. If you also want to see the museum, it'll be $3 extra. $10 is enough to buy you a nice dinner with drinks here. It's a pleasant little place, sometimes can be crowded with tourists. It takes less than 15 minutes to stroll through the entire garden while taking a lot of pictures. I went through 2 times in 20 minutes to make sure that I didn't miss any nook or cranny. I understand that this is part of a foundation that does good social work in Morocco and your proceeds probably are for good causes but I think it's still overrated. So don't put it on top of your list. If you can't visit it, you won't miss much.
Very beautiful Garden. Such a nice and unique garden to visit, i would recommend to go for a visit if you have time. Only negative part was it is quite expensive for the entrance fee.
Visual feast. Hot but shaded gardens. Well kept planting, paths and buildings. A calm and tranquil site to visit which was a relief from the hustle of the City.
Peaceful and romantic. My husband and i were impressed by the plants maintained in the garden. We went with a guide who explained every thing in details.

Interesting but smaller than I expected for the entrance fee.. My daughter was very keen to visit these gardens and she thoroughly enjoyed them. However, as I was the one paying I didn't think it was particularly good value for money, and when I re-visit Marrakech, I wouldn't go back. However, the cafe was delightful, and although overpriced, some experiences can't have a price put on them. The loos were good too.

Tranquillity . Tranquillity, calmness and lots of gorgeous vivid colours to assault the senses. We went on quite a sunny day. The garden is fairly small in size but beautiful location for photos. Sit around Yves Saint Lauren's memorial pillar to gather your thoughts and plan the next hours of your trip. Natural beauty with lots of cacti surrounding the area.
Color and style. Definite must do if you are visiting Marrakech. I loved the vibrancy of the building colors and the jewellery exhibition is stunning.
Lovely gardens.. Lovely gardens rescued by Yves St. Laurent and Pierre Bergé. Worth a visit.....shops nearby worthwhile as well.
Fun day at jardin Majorell. We enjoyed part of our day walking around the gardens. Beautiful plants and water. Also enjoyed learning about the history.

Beautiful garden, must see Berber museum. Berber musem is excellent, interactive and well designed. The garden is a relaxing place in the heart of a chaotic city. It is a clear and quiet place. Entrance fee is 10 euro. We gave only 4* because it is forbidden to take photos in the museum and we thought that the garden could have been more interesting.
Very beautiful jardin.. The color is very stunning. You should take a photo. The garden is very natural feel like home. The garden is not far from the city, you can walk only 20 mins. Recommend!
not worth it.. The most expensive place we visited on this trip at 70 Mad's about £5. It is beautiful but small. Good if you like flowers.

Dissapointed. As a resident of Marrakech I have visited the gardens many times over the past years.I have taken friends and family from overseas and gone solo.On my last visit I observed the increase in entrance fee when I questioned the receptionist she told me quite abruptly that this was the case wit no explanation.As we entered the gardens I observed discarded water bottles and rubbish which had not been collected.The vines had not been pruned making the areas look like a jungle.My guests who had not visited before commented on this.The lack of gardeners and staff was apparent .When we arrived at the boutique ( to purchase the Yves St Laurent perfume) I was surprised to see the whole boutique had changed its stock of Artisan and products.There was no perfume on show so I asked the staff I was given a website address to make my enquires.Overall I was disappointed on this visit.The increase in admission fee does not reflect the quality of the gardens.

Tranquility!. Had read about this and my wife wanted to go so I went along for the ride. I was very impressed with the gardens, they were immaculate! Huge variety if plants, mostly labelled so you knew what you were looking at. It only takes 30 - 45 mins to go around, you could do it in 15 mins or you could stay much longer, it's that sort of place!

Beautiful, definitely recommend it. . Lovely place, make sure to visit. Entry was expensive though. It is near the new medina so if you are staying at the old medina it is worth walking around the town to see the contrast between the two areas of Marrakech.
simply normal. it was a normal garden , and i didn't Enjoy it so much , it's not my favorite place , it was okay ,,,

Great visit combined with the Berber museum. Definitely worth while.. Oasis of peace in busy Marrakesh. Several blocks away from Medina and in process of expanding the garden area, opening in spring 2016.

A perfect spot. This is one location not to be missed during your visit the gardens are stunning and the museum is superb too.
One of the best collection of cacti from all over the world I've ever seen and so tranquil too ...
Expensive. 50 minute walk from Jemaa el Fna, and at end you will pay 7 euros for entrance, great view but there are still lovely jardins/gardins near by.
YSL Garden. Take a horse and carriage ride from the Square and spend an hour in the tranquil setting. It was a great experience for us and we recommend this for couples travelling to Marrakech
Calm fresh and beautiful. Beautifull and peaceful...we can not visit Marrakech and not walk in this mitic garden...everything is beautiful and l recommended with no doubt...

A Paradise of Succulents and the Berber Museum. Just a really beautiful garden located just outside the Medina. If you like succulents then this is a particularly wonderful sanctuary and stop on your Marrakesh visit. There's also an interesting Berber museum and a great bookstore, if not an expensive one.
Beautiful oasis on hot day. Beautifully laid out gardens - eye dropping colours - a must visit if in Marrakech - a cool oasis amidst the heat
Peace and tranquil.. Lovely gardens, full of life. It's a little oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

So beautiful and peaceful.. We were recommended to go here and are so pleased we did. In a hot and noisy city, it is an absolute oasis of tranquility. The story behind it is fascinating, well done Yves St Laurent for rescuing it from the developers, renovating it and donating it back to the people. Highly recommended for a visit.
so nice. i have a a nice walk , and i enjoyed so much , it's so amazing and pretty nice , my friend and i had a great time
Stunning. These gardens are stunning, elegant and inspirational. The colours bold and dramatic. Beautiful and peaceful.
Beautiful!. Really enjoyed the tranquility and colours. A lovely walk around and wonderful gardens. Great little restaurant.
So beautiful and very photogenic!. Fantastic place to visit, I stayed for an hour but would have liked to stay longer. If you like architecture, plants and blue, this is your place

must see!. very beautiful park...
Suitable for families where you can explore nature & Moroccan typical gardens.
Highly recommended.

In the low season this is paradise!. A lovely garden full of history and lushness... The perfect escape for a few hours away from the bartering and fumes of the medina. Not sure it'd be so great with queues of tourists... Go early morning, breath & relax.
Gardens. A garden at the former home of. Yes Saint Laurent. Lots of cactus lots of palms. With a French design A very relaxing way to spend a morning. Something the local population is very proud of

Oasis of calm . Spent a wonderful morning at the garden and Berber museum. It's hard to believe that you step inside from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech to find an oasis of calm.
Had coffee in the cafe and enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere.
nice garden. It s one of the nicest places i ve seen in marrakech, definitely it s a must ! it s a place to visit !
Lovely tranquil spot. To get away from the hurly burly of the Medina go to Jardin Majorelle for a couple of peaceful hours

Beautiful , quiet gardens. Loved our visit to Jardin Majorelle. Not huge, but beautiful & tranquil .........gorgeous variety of plants & birds. A very nice museum showcases clothing & jewelry from the different regions of Morocco. Loved beautiful blue accents :-) ...... :-)
Peaceful place. Lovely garden, many plants and trees, very peaceful place to stay in for a while. Definitely a good place to visit!
Oasis of Tranquility. Well worth the effort to find. Calm oasis from the madness of the Medina or the square. Wonderful plantings and indigo paint, simply stunning !
Very Pretty. Nice but absolutely heaving with fellow tourists. The museum is good but also restricted so be prepared to wait.
Nice garden. Nice but little, price was like 40 dirham (4chf) only garden, museum costs extra... But we had no interest in it
Very nice gardens. Great gardens, I believe you need an hour to view them but it's easily possible to spend more. Make sure you take your student ID for discount!

Stunning gardens in the heart of Marrakech. These beautiful, peaceful gardens are a delight. The variety of plants and artistic layout make them well worth the time to visit. One can understand why Yves St L. found them a rejuvenating retreat.

Average gardens - expensive for what you get. The gardens are decent, but did not think they are deserving of the top attraction in the city. They are a 15 min walk from the edge of the medina and cost 70 dirham to get in. Yes this is cheap, but is overpriced when compared with paying only 10 or 20 dirham for the other sites such as Ben Youssef Madrasa. We arrived shortly after opening, and walked through the entire gardens (including with pictures) in less than 30 mins. There were only five ppl at the time, so go early if you do decide to visit.

Beautiful gardens, especially for cactus lovers!. Well worth a visit to these beautifully manicured gardens in Marrakesh, the former home of Yves Saint Laurent and his partner. It contains an interesting museum, shop and restaurant, as well as a memorial to YSL. You won't need more than an hour to see it as it is not that large.Take a camera for a photo of your partner, kids, friends on one of the bridges.

Magical. I love Yves Saint Laurent and felt just that much closer at his memorial.The gardens are very well kept and are absolutely stunning. The only thing I'd be negative about is perhaps the food and service at the restaurant in the gardens - they could do with more staff and friendly staff. The waiter complained when he brought over our french fries and we asked for ketchup, said we should have specified we wanted sauce beforehand because he didn't want to walk back to get it.. not as hospitable as we'd have liked!

Open every day. The Marjorelle gardens really are an oasis in Marrakech. Vibrant colours intermingle with exotic planting - it's a lovely way to spend the day or just a few hours. There's a restaurant there too. We walked there from our Riad in the Medina and were approached on a couple of occasions by chaps (wanting to take us round the souks, which we'd already visited). They both told us the garden was closed that day. I'm very glad we persevered as the garden is open every day and is well worth a visit!

Busy, expensive, though very pretty.. I wouldn't call it world class, though it's a lovely respite and no hassle once inside. Expensive in local terms, and the restaurant is pricey.
In the new area of town, so not so nice around it. Take a taxi back, and negotiate fare hard - don't believe them that they can't use meter.

Beautiful small gardens. The Jardin Majorelle is a small but beautiful gardens located to the North of Marrakech and just outside the Medina.
It is certainly worth a visit and is one of the few places that has decent English translations explaining the meaning behind what you are seeing (take note every other building in the city).

Quaint. Beautiful colour palate . Lovely little oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of new town.
Café is mediocre.
Museum, in our opinion not worth entry.

Bit far out, but worth it. The Jardin Majorelle is very good for a half day out. Inside there is a cafe serving some of the most expensive coffee you'll drink in Morocco, However, the gardens themselves are exquisite and well worth a visit. Keep in mind that this is either a good 30 minute walk or a 50 Dirham taxi ride from the market. Also, the Jardin Majorelle is one of the more expensive attractions in Marrakech, but still worth a visit!
Jardin Majorelle. A little bit of calm in the middle of chaos. Get a taxi to this destination as difficult to find. Very cheap and well worth the walk round

A very special garden. The park is actually not very big and you can easily walk around on all the different paths in an hour. The first sight that meets you are the enormous bamboos, but when you continue walking on the shaded paths you will see a lot of different trees and beautiful flowers. The area with cacti is spectacular and so are the ponds and flower pots painted in an intense blue or very bright yellow colour.

Le Jardin Marjorelle. These gardens were developed by a French architect Marjoelle. Sadly after his death they fell tnto disrepair. The late couturier Yves St Laurent fell in love with the gardens & restored them.The gardens, themselves contain trees, particularly bamboos which keep the place cool & colouful plants. There are a number of buildings, mainly in a dashing bright Meditterannean blue.Profits from the gardens are now used for life cal charities.R M R

Merveilleux!. One of the MAIN reasons i wanted to visit Marrakech and i m not disappointed at all! Luxurious gardens along vibrant colours. Vivid place to calm down from the craziness of Marrakech. Yves Saint Laurent itself worth the visiting. 70DHR adult fee.

Nice reprieve from busy Medina. This was a nice area to walk around for a little while -- to get out of the hustle and bustle of the Medina. I wouldn't say that it is a "must-do" in Marrakech, but worth checking out if you have the time.

A Jewel in the Crown. Located on the outskirts of Marrakech Medina, not the easiest of places to find, but certainly well worth it!It consist of a relatively small botanical garden, with a Berber museum and an attractive walled garden cafe. It is an immaculately kept garden, predominantly of cati and palm collection.If you went in each of these it would likely take 2 plus hours / short half day. There is a separate fee for the Berber museum.You cannot use plastics to pay to get in (Dec 2015), however they will accept Euros as well as Dirhams, you are likely to have to queue.This is an exceptional garden even to the novice, a very leisurely stroll, with art decor, symmetry and bright colour used for emphasis contrast, which blends in beautifully.If you didn't come by taxi, almost immediately outside are taxis, it is worth bartering over the fare
Pleasant. Only took about an hour to look around. The museum was interesting. It was much smaller then I expected.

One of the great gardens of the world. Such a beautiful garden! Immaculately kept, creatively designed and stocked with many huge and perfect specimens of plants many of which one rarely sees and seldom grown to such size. Arrive early as it rapidly becomes very crowded. It is a bit of a walk from the Medina, in a mainly residential area but we had no trouble walking there nor finding it. We bought tickets to include the little museum and this was worth seeing although ticket holders still have to queue to get in as numbers entering the building are controlled.
Gaudy. If cacti are your thing then you will enjoy these gardens if not then don't bother. Not much in the way of colours other than the very gaudy blue paint everywhere

Lovely and relaxing. This was a nice trip for us. Sun was out and got to sit amongst the lovely plants! You have to pay to get in and could walk around it in 30mins as its not very big, but there is coffe shop inside and benches for you to sit. It was tranquil.

Stylish garden by a Style Icon. Difficult to find but well worth it. 100 dirums for access to gardens and museum or 70 for just the gardens £7/£5 spend around an hour to an hour and half away from the noise of Marrakesh... There is always a queue but persevere.

Most expensive garden in Marrakesh. This garden is outside the medina and is a little bit hard to find. Unfortunately, when you look even the tiniest bit lost in Marrakesh, someone will try to help you and then ask for money at the end. Luckily, my friend and I took a cab and did not have trouble finding the place. The entry cost is 70 dirhams. It's quite a small garden and can be visited in less than an hour. It uses art deco style and lots of bright colors. The YSL memorial is unimpressive. For the price, I was quite disappointed, especially considering how it was esteemed to be the best garden in Marrakesh. It was much too modern and ordinary for my taste. There's a pamphlet inside that explains that it is non-profit. I think I would've rated this much higher had it only been 30 or 40 dirhams instead (which is the price that Morrocans pay... yup...). To compare, Kew Gardens in London is my favorite garden in the world and I would pay to go regardless of the price. Can't say the same for this place...

Beautiful little garden. A varied selection of plants, particularly cacti. The admission price is a bit high for the size, but it's a lovely little place. Not a must see, unless you are particularly interested in YSL, but very nice if you have extra time and don't mind the entry fee. You can also buy admission to the museum, but we didn't bother to do so.
Fantastic garden in Marrakech!. Although it took a while to walk from our hotel to this garden, it was well worth it! The garden was beautiful and peaceful, and it also has a cafe and museum.

Majorelle/Yves St Laurent Gardens Marrakech. It was much smaller than we expected, but absolutely worth a visit. Definitely the most touristy place we visited in Marrakech, but very beautiful and really well maintained. The cacti were impressive and it was lovely to sip on a mint tea in the cafe! I thought the admission price was a bit steep, but hey ho - it is very well looked after.
Jardin Majorelle. Weather was perfect and the garden was beautiful. It was quite hard finding our way with a car, however. A must see.
Beautiful garden. Beautiful garden with a varied selection of plants and trees.Admission price is bit steep hoeever. The Berber museum can also be visited for an extra charge

A morning visit. We walked there from our Riad in the city. Took about 30 mins.
Well worth the trip and enjoyed the chance of sketching in the garden and cafe

Fantastic gardens and museum. The YSL gardens were a nice break and breather from the hustle and bustle. Beautiful gardens and not very big in size so not tiring. A nice museum at the end. Ticket price was probably more than you would pay anywhere else in Marrakech but definitely worth a visit.
peaceful. stunning gardens recommended my our hotel manager,do not miss it, the plants a amazing with some great water features, take a camera

Peaceful. Costs 70 mad to go to gardens without enterence to museum (thats a further 30). Gardens are lovely - very peaceful. Spent approx an hour there. People sketch their names in the trees. Just watch because the keepers ask if they can take your photo and then demand money off of you.

Stunning garden. Arrive early to avoid crowds. Allow at least two hours. The colours of Yves St Laurent are amazing. Great water features that are so photogenic. No picnics allowed. Shop very interesting and art gallery with Yves St. Laurent early poster based o 'Love Theme'!'

Peaceful, cool and serene. Slightly more expensive than we might have hoped, but it did not disappoint. A definite "must see" in Marrakesh. Exactly what you need to relax after this very hectic city has taken it's toll. We walked there, which was fine, around 25mins from the centre of the medina, though it was a bit scary crossing all the major roads once we were out of the old town!

Definatly worth a visit whilst in marrakech !!. Definatly worth a visit whilst in marrakech !! amazing !! if your an art lover, fashion lover , gardening fanatic , was well worth the visit ,was on the top of my list to see whilst visiting marrakech stunning garden with memorial ,great coffee shop in the middle and museum and shop the art gallery shows some of YSL art work a must see !!

Wonderful oasis of calm and colour. Loved it! It's not large but a wonderful collection of cacti and palm trees in a beautiful, peaceful setting. The colour scheme of the garden's design - azure, yellow and terracotta - is just brilliant. Fascinating Berber museum and delightful cafe too. Well worth a visit
A tranquil oasis. A great way to spend an hour or so wandering around these beautiful tranquil gardens. Beautifully inspired planting and very clean and well kept.

relaxing garden. rather small but beautiful. watch out for the guys in brown who want to ask for money to take your picture. We thought they would have a museum or shop that would sell the Yves saint Lauren cologne and they did not.

Good to go.... ...even if you're not a gardener! It's not the cheapest of options in a place where there is so much to see BUT it is still well worth a visit. The price, I think, reflects the coast and the amount of work it takes to keep this amazing space up to scratch. I don't if there is a 'quiet time' when it's best to visit, but when we were there it was heaving. However, it's not too much of a stretch to imagine this place with just you in it and how tranquil it could be.

Oasis. This is an incredibly green place. Surprising considering Marrakech is in a desert environment with very little rain. Many varieties of cactus, water features and memorials. Certainly worth an hour of photos, relief from the madness of Marrakech and enjoyment of a very unique garden.
O Yves et Pierre. what an emotion to see where Yves and Pierre lived...the place is something else, beautiful peaceful, the gift shop has great stuff too

Blue and yellow pots and flowers!. This is a calm, restful spot amongst the hurly burly of this rapidly growing city, a haven a quiet in the otherwise overcrowded heart of Marrakesh. The beautifully laid out gardens around water features, and lined everywhere with blue and gold pot of flowers is truly a sight for sore eyes. There is a small cafe inside the garden walls and the sound of frogs in the end provides a contemplative backdrop to the physical beauty of the garden; the walkways are spread out enough that one never gets the impression of overcrowding.

Very different...a delight. Although the gardens are very popular, they are arranged so that you never feel crowded. The overall design and colours are magnificent. The museum itself is small, but in a beautiful building which brings back the 'old' expat touches from long ago restoration.

Nice peaceful retreat. When the noise and heat of Marrakech get too much head to the Majorelle gardens for a little peace and tranquillity. Great gardens and a lovely place to sit and enjoy a mint tea

Nice but overpriced. I was glad I went to the Majorelle Gardens, but was really surprised by the 70 DH admission charge, which seemed a bit much for such a small visitor attraction. Gift shop and onsite cafe similarly overpriced.

Lovely, Quiet Gardens. These gardens are well worth a visit, as they make for a nice quiet break from the busy city. There is a nice cafe inside that serves Moroccan crepes, and the atmosphere is generally peaceful. Go in the morning to avoid the crowds.

VERY GOOD WITHOUT THE BERBER MUSEUM: EXCELLENT WITH IT. This is a very small garden but delightful - and the perfect antidote to the bustling ville nouvelle and the super-bustling old city.However, the real gem is the Berber Museum (Ecomusee Berbere) that you access via the Jardin. Do look at the separate reports on this. Jardin+museum = *****.

Review. This is a beautiful place to visit in Morocco I really appreciate and had a good time there, 15 minutes, you can find all the flowers of the world, the ticket is expensive, but every penny worth!!

wonderfull. Great place to visit. Cactus of all variety and plants and trees from all over the world collected together to form a wonderful display. Also worth seeing is the Berber museum in the grounds.
Nice quite place in the middle of bustling Marrakesh. Worth the visit! It is just a pretty garden with incredible plants and landscaping. The museum is very informative regarding the berber culture.

Very peaceful garden. I visited the garden and museum and found the garden is very peaceful. If you stay around at 6 PM closing time, please look at the sky. You will find lots of birds circling the garden where they spend the night in the trees.

Peaceful Visit. The gardens are right in the middle of a busy traffic area, but once inside the gardens, there was no noise from the outside world. Beautiful and exotic plants and a lovely place to roam. Went in December so tourists were few; would not want to visit during prime vacation time.
Tranquil small ornamental garden. If you like gardens or are a fan of fashion and YSL then this could be a must see, otherwise it is lovely but a diversion for an hour or so at most.

Colorful and quiet gardens in Marrakech. In a busy city like Marrakech it is hard to get away. But in the Jardin Majorelle you find both beauty and calm. Yves Saint Laurent bought this garden and with the bright colors and plants you can definitely tell.
wonderful garden. Must visit! Most beautiful garden in Marrakesh. You have to take a taxi (around 30dh), it's outside the Medina, and the entry is not the cheapest (100 dh), but it's worth the ride!

Peace and quiet. Particularly loved the amazing selection of cactuses.
Café nice for lunch.
You only need around 1/2 hour to 1 hour there.
Nice. The gardens are okay, they are not amongst the word's most beautiful, exotic or interesting and have a relatively small number of species - a refreshing break during an urban tour.

Go to the Berber museum. The garden is nice, but not extremely special. A lot of trees and some cactuses
But do go to he Berber museum inside of the garden! This is very well dons and gives an overview of Berber culture and jewellery.
Turist trap. The garden is pretty and delicate. However very small and nothing too special. The visit was definitely not worth the price of the ticket.
Peaceful and very well cared for cactus and palm garden. Good lunch at the outdoor cafe at a reasonable price. We had spiced meatballs (kefta) which were only around £7 with mint tea.
Small Site. A bit expensive for what it offers. Not that interesting. However, yo can see some saint Laurent original draws.

Worth it. We only paid for the gardens since we were more interested in the architecture and exterior design and plants. It was a very artistic and inspiring place. Make sure to go to every corner of this place and take lots of priceless photos

All blue and turquoise !. It is almost a "must" to visit "Jardin Majorelle" when in Marrakech. Famous because it was the french designer Yves St-Laurent's residence in Morocco... The house and studio were buildt by the french painter Jacques Majorelle, in Art Deco style. The garden itself is interesting. But or us, it is our visit to the Berber Museum, inside the garden, which made this tour perfect. This collection of about 600 objects shows the best of the berbers skills, a rich panorama of their culture through magnificent jewellery, finery, splendid costumes, carpets,music intruments.....we enjoyed it very much ! Do not miss it !

Breath taking! . It took a while to find as me and my partner did everything by foot! Crazy right? But it was definitely an experience. We visited the Jardin Majorelle one day and it was breath taking! We spent most of the day there and admired the beautiful culture and plants. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful place but a bit costy. It's one of the mythic places in Marrakech, and deserve the title. But it is the most expensive site to visit.It's a putty it is so costly ... but otherwise it's pretty beautiful.

beautiful and such a change from the chaos of the rest of the city. Really relaxing. The pictures just don't do it justice. I wasn't very eager to go, but did so on the advice of others. Part of the experience is just how different it feels and sounds inside of these gardens in contrast to the chaos of Marrakech. Very much worth a visit and the Berber museum is fantastic. Definately get the ticket for both attractions.
Delightful gardens in town. Wonderful walkways and garden areas, and the museum is worth a visit. Nearby cafes and shops...recommended.

Way Over-priced. This is kind of an oasis in the middle of the city. It has a large variety of trees/plants from around the world. However, the cost of £5 does not justify a visit (its cheaper for the locals). The gardens are so small that you can walk around in 10 mins and you are done. There are not many benches around; I suspect they don't want you to get comfortable and hang around for too long. You have to go early morning or late afternoon to avoid the harsh sun otherwise your photos/videos will come out lousy with too much of shade. This has to be the worst value-for-money attraction in the city, even if YSL had something to do with it. Disappointed.
Beautiful and quiet Oasis. Lovely gardens. Very well kept and very accessible. Definitely recommend as the best thing to do in Marrakech.

Garden Wonderland. If you are one that appreciates the botanical nature "Jardin Majorelle" is a definite sight to see. You can wonder for hours through various gardens and beautiful landscapes, excellent fro photos.
Beautiful Gardens. Great Gardens, so beautifully kept and so peaceful. A great escape from the hustle and bustle outside.
An quiet oasis in the heart of busy city. A lovely place to go and chill whilst enjoying the gardens that Yves Saint Laurent donated for the people of Marrakech
Worth the visit. Absolutely gorgeous! We loved the garden which is superbly laid out and makes you feel just like spending the day there!
The Berber Museum. A lovely peaceful haven in a busy town, beautifully kept.So many different plants there all labelled. The Berber museum is very interesting too.
I love majorel. Very nice garden,is 15 min working from our riad,is really romantic,we had a good time,and for sure we come back
