There is also a little cafe here which I decided not to stop in, it looks very pretty but from what I can remember the menu was a little disappointing. If they worked on improving the cafe I think the visit would definitely be enhanced. The visit cost around 70 dirham per person and lasted around 20 minutes, but like I mentioned before, you can take your time.

A nice garden but nothing special - and Expensive !. a very attractive garden with a tropic and desert theme but really not that great if you have seen other major gardens in Europe, US, South Africa, etc. Nice walkway but the garden really only takes about 40 minutes to see it all.Overall, the cost is very high (about 10 euro) for not very much.
Overpriced but nice garden. Too expensive (70 dh) for a nice but small garden. Nice usage of colors but not mindblowing. Many plants have been manhandled

Beautiful!. Absolutely stunning! A lovely calming atmosphere in comparison to the souks of the city. Easy and spacious to walk around and a great variety of plants. Enjoyed much more than I thought I would, much more interesting than expected.
Lovely afternoon. We really enjoyed these gardens and had lunch at the cafe. It was an oasis on a hot and sunny late October day.The gardens are stocked with stunning plants. So very relaxing

Stunning Blue Buildings and Gardens. Fantastic opportunity to get away from the bustle and rush of the city; the gardens are magnificent, and great to sit in the shade and reflect. Cafe is good, but pricy. The museum is worth a look round for the Berber jewellery and clothing, but only small.
Stunning garden. Real oasis of beauty and testament to vision of yes st Laurent. Incredible contrast to much of the city. Shame some people felt need to carve their names on trees

A must to see. Majorelle blue garden, a lovely place to see, small and beautiful, absolutely romantic, a nice coffee inside to have a break even if it is a little bit overprice, highly recommended. Sara from Marrakech.

A little disappointed . I was a little disappointed, although the the gardens are beautiful and peaceful away from the hustle and bustle of the medina there isn't a huge amount to see. We had brought tickets for the museum but the cue was that long we didn't bother in the end. The cafe on sight was delicious serving well priced local dishes and we were lucky enough to grab a free table without having to wait.
Beautiful. Overpriced but worth a visit while you're here. Beautiful gardens. Worth taking a few snacks and just chilling out under the trees and in the peace
Beautiful place, but small. A tour of the place can be finished in 15-30 mins. Rather expensive for local standards: 70 dh. However a very nice park, more of a bothanical garden

Secret Garden. The Jardin Marjorelle certainly did not disappoint. It was absolutely beautiful and no trip to Marrakech is complete without visiting. The cafe is also very good and worth a visit afterwards.
A beautiful garden. Really nice getaway from the noisy streets in Marrakech. Beautiful garden and lovely atmosphere, the whole history is well told. The berbermuseum was great.

Overcrowded, not really worth it. Beautiful but small gardens, so overcrowded that you can't really enjoy them. The museum is tiny and quite interesting but you just can't get close enough to the displays for people, and the shop is Parisian prices.

An oasis of calm well away from the frenetic bustle of the centre of Marrakech. Lovely to just be able to wander in a beautiful calm garden that inspired Yves Saint Laurent to preserve it , and the beautiful cobalt blue building.
Would recommend going early before 10.30 am to avoid the coaches of tourists arriving.
Well laid out outdoor courtyard café , if a little expensive
Beautiful and tranquil. Go earlier in the morning to avoid the crowds. Gorgeous gardens and nice shop where we bought some YSL prints, would recommend.

Best place in Marrakech. The heat was scorching in Marrakech when used to the Scandinavian tempatures. This was a lovely and fascinating respite. A small but excellent berber museum is well worth the extra 30 dirhams.
A tranquil haven in this mad city. Worth a vist - very peaceful, with beautiful plants and tranquil water features. There is a cafe and washroom facilities also

A LOVELY HOUR OF RELAXATION AWAY FROM THE MEDINA. I have now been here twice. This is a lovely relaxing hour away from the Medina madness. Grounds are kept beautiful with lots of little nooks & cranny's to see. Well worth a visit

Nice but overrated. The "Jardin Majorelle" is an nice garden in the centre of marrakesh, which is a bit overrated and very crowdy. You can take great pictures, but it is not very big, so after an hour, you have seen it all!

Nice but busy. Its was good lovely setting but rather busy and not that large but really lovely when you are inside smells great but there are alot better things you can do in Marrakech to be honest! Plus its about 70 dir

Beautiful tranquil gardens.. Beautiful gardens - very busy but still worth a look. We did not visit the museum but had a refreshing mint tea in the quiet courtyard café - good service and very restful.
Wasn't as great as expected.. Though the children ejoyed the walk. I had expected it to be more coourful, and quite frankly there is more colour in London on a wet winters day.

Gorgeous, peaceful, inspiring. A peaceful walk around a garden you'd love to call your own! Interesting museum and gift shop with some beautiful items, not your average tat, exquisite pieces you'd keep for years. Cafe was lovely if a little expensive compared to the rest of the city, still worth sitting with a drink and enjoying the atmosphere. If you can, speak to Steven in the shop, what an interesting man!

Relaxing couple of hours. It was lovely walking around, being away from the busy streets of Marrakesh. It is an advantage to like plants, cacti and succulents. The garden is small, but beautiful and also contains an interesting museum about Berber Culture.
Tired but still lovely. Smaller and more tired than the guidebooks would have you believe (not "rave worthy"..) but still worth a visit - though an hour is enough...
Absolutely beautiful gardens. Lovely quite area of beautiful trees and local cactus, sadly people more interested in selfies that than the Gardens

Beautiful and Peaceful. The gardens are a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. They are very beautiful and quite peaceful compared to many other areas in the city. The entry price may be a little much for what is there (70DH for the gardens + 30DH for the museum so about 10EUR overall) but it is still worth a visit. In the museum you can see some traditional pieces and get a flavor of the Berber history. The area is also nicely shaded and provides a nice break from the sun and heat.All in all, definitely worth a visit for some very nice photos.
Beautiful garden. A little gem... Nice to visit ... We felt entrance ticket was little over priced 70 dirhams for garden and 30 dirhams for a museum .

Lovely and relaxing way to get away from the hubub of Marrakech.. Easy walk from central Marrakech. Beautiful garden with focus on cacti, succulents and other plants as opposed to flowers. Fabulous museum about Berber culture. Do not miss.

Great way to spend a spare hour in Marrakech . Very nice setting 70dh for gardens then 30dh to go into house that is 2 rooms of clothes, jewellery and artefacts that YSL had collected. Very quaint and enjoyable.

Overpriced. It is a pretty place to visit ad take a few pictures, especially if you're into plants trees and flowers, but I think charging 70 DH (+/- 7 euros) jus to visit the garden area is a little too much.

Colors and that's all. Colorfull place but that's really just it. Overpriced for what you get: palms and cactus and a bunch of sites in construction or renovation.
Didn't bothered to enter the musem. Also, prices at the boutique are astronomical.

A Beautiful Oasis in Marrakesh. We spend a wonderful morning walking around the gardens at Jardin Marjorelle. It is a stunning place, cool from the heat of Marrakesh, with a real feel of calm about it. It can get busy - I think the tours tend to go in the morning, but the day we went never felt crowded. We took our two boys (6 & 7) and they enjoyed looking at the wildlife in the ponds particularly. It is not massive, but such a beautiful place doesn't have to be. The taxi & horse and cart drivers can be a little over inflated on their prices back into town (with so many tourist about) so haggle hard if you think you are not getting a fair price, and just walk down the road a bit to find someone a bit further away if you need to.Highly recommended.
Colourful garden. Definitely worth a visit....include lunch in the lovely restaurant. Peaceful and quiet with exotic plants.

Calm in Chaos. These gardens were a peaceful retreat in the chaos of Marrakech. We were surprised by the lack of traffic noise, the cleanliness and beautiful atmosphere. The Berber museum was very interesting and a huge variety of plants were displayed in a very creative way with colourful buildings and huge ponds (with small frogs and fish). It ws not too crowded and there were many people just sitting and relaxing. There were also some unusual birds to watch! A very pleasant visit.

Not huge, but stunning. We went as a family so the exploration and colours alone were worth it, it was very crowded when we went, but it didn't detract from the day, however go later to avoid the tour crowds if you can. I imagine that without the boys with us I would have happily sat with the book and soaked in the atmosphere if I could! Cafe not the cheapest, but lovely selection of both hot and cold drinks. The Museum was incredible, again small, but visually stimulating for both us and the boys.

Imagine: a garden with a color named after it !. The vibrant color "Majorelle Blue" got it name from its use at this beautiful garden. Jardin Majorelle will take you an hour or two to walk through, if you pause to look at the cacti from around the world and sit to enjoy the beauty. There is a lovely lily pond: see how many tiny frog you can spot. I got up to over thirty, with a couple of large ones and some terrapins as well. You should be able to spot some birds, such as house buntings and common bulbuls, as well. While you are there, be sure to visit the Berber Museum, as well.
Long queues. Lovely gardens, in a residential area of town. Amazing legacy by YSL and his partner. Lovely Berber museum inside.

Small but perfectly formed. A fantastic retreat from the hustle and bustle of busy Marrakech.
A lovely, secluded garden that was fun to walk around and enjoy. The Cobalt Blue buildings against the fantastic array of cacti is so great to be around.

Beautiful and Tranquil. A beautiful and tranquil place to while away a morning.The winding paths meander around the collections of exotic plants from around the world creating a haven of calm in the middle of a bustling city.I could have spent hours watching the fish, frogs and terrapins in the various ponds.It was definitely worth paying the additional fee to visit the Berber museum - an amazing building filled with fascinating artifacts.

Don't expect to much.... The garden is nicely kept, not much flowers and not a very big garden. More like plants, palm trees, cactuses. The museum is extra cost and if you don't speak French, you will have no idea what are the things what you see. It is kind of a let down of the whole experience that they don't do English translation.

Sizzling blue!. This is a lovely spot, and the use of the gorgeous, sizzling blue of the pavilion and other elements contrasts beautifully with the brightly coloured plant pots to create a scheme that looks fabulous in the strong sunlight of Morocco.

Stunning blues. Lovely place to sit quietly amid the trees and startling blue decorated pots and vases scattered around. The Berbere museum on site is also a fascinating place to learn a bit more about this country.
Not too be missed. Stunning and Tranquil gardens. Fabulous to visit which also gets you away from the heat and noise of the city.
special place. very beautiful garden, interesting story, a little bit crowdy - take your time and come as an early bird

Beautiful colors. Worth a visit.. This is a beautiful setting, but I found myself wishing for solitude. I don't think it was even a particularly crowded day, but sharing this space with 200 strangers was non-ideal. It has a zen garden, contemplative feel, so to be surrounded with others' chatter and laughter distracted from what could be serenity. Even so, it's worth the 7euro entry fee. Even with other people the shady spots and juxtaposition of brightly colored paints and cacti was very pleasant.We walked to get there, but there are plentiful taxis and horse carriages at the entrance.
Beautiful. Gorgeous garden to walk around. Lovely little coffee shop too! Enjoyed the visit - didn't bother with the museum.

not worth visiting for 70 dirhams. for how much it costs, it's not worthy. It has many kinds of flowers and plants from many parts of the world, but it's difficult to appreciate them, unless you're a botanist.
Wonderful atmosphere. A wonderful atmosphere in this beautiful garden. An oasis of peace where nature and colours meet. One of the best sights of Marrakech.

Lush Green in the Desert. What absolutely beautiful gardens in the middle of the Desert. So wonderfully maintained. It was a treat visiting them. Actually has motivated me to something similar at home around the city I live in. May be one day i will do it.

A beautiful garden. It's a beautiful garden and a nice place to go to if you want to escape the big city vibe you get every else in Marrakech. It's not very big so you can see it all in about 20 min. However if you are into gardening you can easily spend much more time here and just enjoy the garden. I especially loved the cactus garden. There is a small museum in the garden which I did not find that interesting, but that depends on ones taste.There is a cafe that offers food and drink. The entrence fee is very much overpriced, having written that I would still recommend the garden if you need something green or just a little get away. When leaving there if going by taxi walk a bit away from the entrance in order not to be overcharged.

Overrated . I agree with the other comments people have made, in that it's a very small area of exotic plants and we are privileged to enjoy more spectacular gardens for free in the UK. I'm puzzled as to why it's the No.1 thing to do in Marrakech. Maybe because of the YSL name. There's a free garden at the edge of the Medina and I wish we'd gone there instead.
A must to visit. Superb. Beautiful garden, very tranquil place to visit. The Berber museum was extremely interesting.
A wonderful gem in the city. Jardin Majorelle was a nice, cool respite from the bustling medina. It is a lovely place to spend some quiet moments.

disappointed. Seeing this was rated the No. 1 attraction in Marrakech, we wre pretty disappointed when we got there. The gardens are small and really quite unspectacular, unless you like cacti. Its also expensive. The Berber Museum in the grounds is, however, terrific. Overall disappointed nonetheless.
Nice. A nice relief in the shade with some lovely scenery. Wouldn't take more than 15-20 minutes to look around actual gardens the museum is separately priced.

Gardens were average, but the colours incredible. The gardens themselves were a bit average, but the colours on the buildings were like nothing I have ever seen before, almost iridescent, I can't really describe them and they were reflected in the bouganvillia. You have to see to believe - don't think of this as a 'garden' think of it as an experience!
BEAUTIFUL YSL GARDENS. Get there early as over crowded as large queues. Very beautiful with a great book shop. 830 am is the best time or later in the day.

Nice way to spend the afternoon. This is a very beautiful garden but not very big so if you have an hour to spare try to go here. You do need ot pay entry but I would say it is worth it. Cooling place to be when its hot!

Stunning colours. Dream come true for a photographer. Lovely gardens full of exotic plants and stunning colours in the building and plant pots.
Interesting museum of Berber costumes and jewelry.
Go early or late to get good photos without other people getting in the way

Gloriously stylish and calm. I was really surprised at how captivated our two teens were with this place. The cacti, the layout, the colours, the tranquil atmosphere really struck a chord with them. Don't skimp on the entrance fee - the Berber museum is a little gem and well worth the extra. Top marks for the cafe too - really nice food, stylishly presented. It may be a bit more expensive than some places around Marrakech but the setting and the staff make it good value for money (which is more than can be said for the items in the boutique and the bookshop - the pricetags merited a very sharp intake of breath!).

An oasis of tranquility.. This garden belonged to the late Yves St Laurent who rescued it from developers. The garden is fairly small with lots of cacti and bamboo. There was also a small but interesting museum of Berber history. Well worth a visit. Can be crowded at times.

colorful and amazing experience. what a magical place to visit whether you are are fashion (YSL) lover or not. the grounds are immaculate and the colors are just amazing. every element was fantastic and a great way to start our time in town. even the gift shop is amazing with beautiful items for sale, inspired by the work of YSL himself and his muses. a must see!
Definately worth going to. We had a lovely hour or so exploring these beautiful gardens, highly recommend a visit, not expensive to get in
just amazing. the colours, the cacti, the history... all just stunningyou need about half an hour minimum to fully experience the gardens
Fantastic gardens. Get there early - very popular. We got there at 10.30am and it was already very busy. A great asset to have been saved for the city.

Good place. The garden is nice at an average level. there is not so much to see on there Nothing really special apart from many bamboos. We didn't visit the museum as we had seen several Berber houses on our trip allready. Personally I thought the gardens were a bit small and boring

Beautiful exotic . A beautiful place to visit when in Moroccan. If you're Moroccan you gain entry at half the price, if not it come at a slightly higher entrance fee of 70md (around £4). It's a great place for photo opportunities and makes you feel like you're in a different country all together with the bamboo and exotic plants and animals- it definitely made me feel as though I was in a rain forest. The garden closes at sunset so be sure to goa few hours before dark- they're very strict about closing time and will literally shoo you out! Any one who works there will most likely expect a tip if they take a photo of you or oh ask them questions so do your research and ask other tourists for photos!
WELL WORTH A VISIT. Very interesting gardens which are very well maintained. Museum a must see. Book shop also worth a visit

Cool, funky gardens. If you have already seen the main attractions in Marrakech and have time, take a cab out to Jardin Majorelle. The gardens are pretty quirky with tons of cool cacti. Worth a trip if you can squeeze it in!
An Oasis. Stunning gardens in the centre of Marrakech and a really inspiring museum celebrating Berber History

An oasis of beauty in chaos that is Marrakech. If you visit one place in Marrakech, this should be it! Founded by French haut couturist Yves Saint Laurent, it is an immaculate forrest of green bamboo, intersperced with bright blue fountains, pools, buildings and follies in a sort of 'walk around jungle'! In addition it contains an excellent museum dedicated to Berber culture - beautifully put together - well worth the 100 dirhams entrance for both attractions. Afterwards you can relaxe in a modest garden café in the grounds. A little oasis in the dust and noise of Marrakech.
nice blue. excellent place to visit especially if you like plants and nature . unfortunately it was very crowded but we liked it a lot . better to go in the early morning befor big groups arrive .
Worth a visit. Nice gardens, very well maintained. We walked from the main square which took 25-30 mins. If you like nice gardens I would visit the ones at La Mamounia hotel instead, stunning.

Tranquil place. Peaceful atmosphere. We had a relaxing morning there with 2 children. 2 year old enjoyed running around and enjoyed the water features. Our 10 year old appreciated the history and artwork of YSL. She loved the paintings in the gallery area. The gift shop and bookshop are sophisticated. It's very cool inside on the grounds due to the high trees offering shade considering Marrakech can get very hot.

A must see for Marrakesh. Really really beautiful gardens. Best seen in my opinion when sun at its highest as the colours are better - towards late afternoon and on cloudy days it loses a little of its beauty as the colours less intense.

A real oasis with stunning colours. The Majorelle Blue is a beautiful rich colour and has become a firm favourite colour. The gardens have plenty of shade so even on a really hot day, you can still find shelter and enjoy all this attraction has to offer. It does get busy, so go really early to beat the crowds (and the heat!). But if you're looking for souvenirs, this is probably not the best place to get them - we found them to be very expensive. Well worth a visit.
Ffffantastic place to visit. Great couple of hours here . Gardens great and the blue colour everywhere is amazing. Museum and gallery interesting

Beautiful. We enjoyed the visit of the garden and the museum. Having tea in the garden was also great. We arrived at 8.40 and had the place to ourselves.But by 9.15 the garden was already packed with tourists. To enjoy it, wake up early!
Beautifully peaceful and relaxing. An absolutely wonderful experience. Would definitely recommend to anyone going to Marrakech. Be sure to stop off for tea or a snack halfway round.

Yves Saint Laurent's legacy-a wonderful gift to Marrakech.. A beautiful oasis of calm where you can escape the mayhem of Marrakech. Relax in these cool and tranquil gardens before treating yourself to lunch or a mint tea in the equally restful and welcoming restaurant. Spend a few dirhams on some of the prints of atmospheric pictures of old Marrakech from the bookshop. If you have more cash to splash, the clothes, jewellery and accessories in the boutique are exquisite. Well worth a visit.

Peaceful haven in Marrakech. This is a lovely break from the hustle of Marrakech. We went at opening time to see the gardens without other guests getting in the way. It gets very busy so I would recommend taking breakfast after you have had your visit.
Tranquil and beautiful!. A lovely place to visit in the Ville Nouvelle. Shady and calm and some beautiful exotic plants.Very reasonably priced.
Great scenery. This is a great place to visit however the gardens are not very big. The design and layout are very pretty.

Beautiful gardens to wander around and enjoy. See the multicoloured bougainvillea, rows of bright orange nasturtiums, and the beautiful groves of bamboo, date palms and various lily covered pools. It is a beautiful garden to wander around and admire the buildings in cobalt blue . Don't forget to see the Museum of Marrakech within the gardens to see North African textiles, Berber jewellery, ceramics and traditional carpets of Arabic and Berber design along with traditional Berber clothing.

Cool and different spot in Marrakech. I didn't expected to see to much in this garden but I was surprised, first of all, by the colors! That electric blue match perfectly with the green of cactus. Lovely!The price isn't big for what you get - 70 dirhams for the garden

The Best Garden I've ever seen. This garden belonged to Yves Saint Laurent and turned to a museum after his death. The outside of the building is painted completely blue which is called "majorelle blue" and it's actually a great color. The garden is full of mostly cactus and succulents and they are quite beautiful. The entrance for the garden is 70 dirhem (around 7 euros) and 30 dirhem for the museum. There is a very nice coffee-house inside. I'd recommend to stay day few hours or half day because the ambiance is really amazing.
Beautiful. Gorgeous gardens in an unexpected area. Lots of vibrant colors and beautiful plants from around the world.

Peaceful. This is the 3rd time I visited this attraction in the last few years and it hasn't failed to impress me again. It's so calm and peaceful you can easily forget it's a very short walk to the main road. Lovely plants, and very good value for money.
Nice quiet garden. It is a really nice garden to take a walk through if you need some rest from the busy and loud medina.
small but beautiful. Take a local taxi, 60 dirhams at the most from the city center. A lovely way to spend an hour (max) was very busy when we went in October half term, would be lovely if less busy

Worth seeing. This is a beautiful garden and museum. The garden is so lovely and worth the walk from the Medina (about 30 minute walk). The Berber Museum was the small, but probably the best museum we saw in Morocco. Again, worth seeing

Peace and tranquility. Beautiful gardens and a fitting tribute to Yves saint Laurent. A welcome respite from the heat and the vibrant nature of Marrakech streets! Cafe quite expensive, but high quality food.
plants !!!!. this was number one thing to do, I was not impressed ,if you like green plants and stuff you will be very happy, 20 quid for three of us not good value

Meh!. I dont see the fascination with this place. yes it is maintained by YSL and yes there is a memorial to the legendary designer but overall the place leaves a lot to be desired. it is basically a big garden of cactii and while they may be of immense interest to a botanist to a casual traveller they offer no intrigue. the stark blue building in the middle of the garden also isnt anything special. overall I was left underwhelmed by this place and I wish I had visited some other place that Marrakech has to offer.
A must see. Unbelievable place. the tranquil gardens a real contrast to the hustle and bustle of the medina and the museum amazing
Impressing. You´ll could get the inspiration of what art could become of and of what YSL was about. An extraordinary island in the mid of Marrakech.
Lovely lovely lovely . What a beautiful garden. Enjoyed every minute of my visit here.We also ate lunch here which was delicious

Tranquil in OCT and Amazing Colors. Walked about 20min from our hotel one morning to see this garden and it was well worth it. Cost 70 MAD a person without the extra 30 MAD for the Berber Museum. The 70 MAD was well worth it. The relaxed atmosphere (due to it being very quite in OCT) was well worth the trip. We spend 35-45min walking around the paths and taking pictures. The blue color of the building is an amazing back drop to the flowers and other fauna. Sipped on some over priced mint tea with a few friends and bought a book from their book store. Overall the experience was very good.

Not so worth it. The garden is nice at an average level. I would not repeat it. In my opinion is not worth it to pay to see the garden, there is not so much to see on there. Just go if you have plenty of time to spend in Marrakech.

A peaceful place amongst the madness that is Marrakech. Had a lovely couple of hours in the Jardin Majorelle, it is so nice to find a quiet place to visit once in while when the noise of the market square gets too much.The gardens are beautiful and there are terrapins, frogs and fish in the cool ponds in the gardens. My son got a great little Go Pro video of the fish and another of the Terrapins. It isn't expensive and well worth a visit.
Worth a visit!. Gorgeous gardens with amazing colours.Berber museum is interesting and the cafe is a fantastic setting for some lovely Moroccan food in the sun
ordinary. Nothing really special apart from many bamboos. The gift shop is a plus. Loved the little gadgets but other than that have seen better gardens.

Stunning garden. Basin at the entrance point will grab a lot visitors attentions. Visiting this garden is a relaxing activity. Green and cool of the garden are great environment to read a book, have conversation with friends and (for sure) take selfie at Marrakech's attraction.
A stunning oasis of calm. Well worth a visit. Simply beautiful. A stunning tribute to Yves Saint Laurent. The berber museum within the house in the gardens is worth the additional entry fee.

A must visit. A must-visit, beautiful gardens with all sorts of overwhelming cactus and fountains, all in mindblowing tones of blue and yellow. The history beding it since it was built in 20's is very interesting. Can get very busy with long queues so avoid weekends.

Busy but worth it. The garden is actually rather small and so if you are short of time this is a perfect place to go, although the queue to get in can be rather long so don't leave it too late. It takes about 15mins to walk from the main square in Marrakech. The gardens are lovely, but the museum is not that interesting.

Tranquil gardener's paradise. We were apprehensive when we heard the high cost for this sight, but then heard that this funds a non-profit foundation that helps with projects throughout Morocco.I am a gardener with a passion for cacti and succulents, so it was worth every cent. Absolutely beautiful! Ponds with frogs, fish and turtles. Birds!A completely different side of Marrakech.The Berber Museum was fascinating, worth the extra fee.

A nice morning activity. Lovely garden, worth seeing if you're in Marrakech. Staff offer to take pictures expecting tips in return (though what's new when you're in Marrakech?). Lots of shade for those hot days too!

Breathtaking gardens.....very calming after the mania of the medina!. One of the prettiest most relaxing places ever. Make sure you pay for the entrance to the gardens AND the museum...both worth every penny. Only a small café on-site which was very busy with queues when we there (we had planned to have lunch there). No problem in going out of gardens where there are several good cafes and restaurants across the road, and then gaining entry to the gardens with your ticket again after lunch.

Lush gardens you can linger in. These gardens contain a memorial to Yves St. Laurent, who spent a lot of time in Marrakech. There are many different sections to the garden. One area has huge cacti from all over the world. Even with a lot of visitors, there are small areas you can relax and feel alone with the plants.

Lovely Gardens. An oasis in the middle of a busy city. Lovely gardens well worth a visit but does get busy. We walked from our Riad which was daunting but we managed it. If you are looking for a half a day excursion look no further.

Expensive and small. Go early to avoid the crowds.. The Jardin Majorelle is expensive for what you get. 70 dirham p.p. without and 100 dirham with the berber museum. We didn't visit the museum as we had seen several Berber houses on our trip allready.The garden is small and buzzing with tourists, but there are some nice photo opportunity's as the colours are very blue and yellow and there are lots of different plants. It stays however a botanical garden and if you are not very interested in plants a short visit is enough. Cafe is nice but has european prices. Cheapest was the tea for 30 dirham (approx. 3 euros). That is 3 times more than in the test of Marrakesh.The garden is quite different of the rest van Marrakesh as it is totaly European.

Cool and calm. Lovely gardens and a nice calm atmosphere amongst the community of visitors though it is a shame so many people can't take in the beauty other than through the lens. Give the restaurant a miss.
was a nice walk. kids did get bored after a while, maybe due to the eat also. Nice and relaxed walk. some areas were bit tight for a pushchair.
Stunning Garden. Nice place to visit and if you're into photography you'll shoot some amazing photos. You'll see many different cactus's and other flowers. Worth a visit.
Outstanding beauty. An opulent garden to visit if you wish to have sometime for yourself or share a moment of grace with someone special..
Beautiful garden, lovely cafe. Beautiful gardens with a lovely cafe and a great museum. Don't miss the museum, it's superbly done and the building it is housed in is beautiful.

Big let down and rather boring!. This attraction was top of the list on Trip Advisor so we ere looking forward to it. Arrived expecting to to stay for a couple of hours, we were in and out in 20 mins and that included the museum!
If you are into horticulture then maybe of interest, we are not!

First visit to Majorelle. You may well need a guide or taxi to find this exceptional garden but you simply must get here if you are in Marrakech. This is NOT a large garden - one can see it all within one hour IF it is not too busy. Apart from the garden there is the Berber Museum (worth the little extra expense) a Boutique and a very pleasant cafe with fabulous coffee.
Beautiful oasis. A nice quiet spot that is wonderful. Really nice to step out of the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh streets. The berber museum shouldn't be skipped either.
Beautiful gardens. This is a real oasis in he city. The gardens are stunning with colourful flowers and wonderful blue terracotta walls and pots. The cactus collection is the best I have ever seen.

Colourful Garden. This garden is a must to visit when in Marrakesh. Lovingly restored by Pierre Berge and Yves Saint Laurent in 1980 it is a hidden garden treasure. After the death of YSL in 2008, Pierre Berge donated the gardens to the Foundation Pierre Berge - Yves Stain Laurent. The foundation Jardin Majorelle was established at this time. A memorial to the French Fashion designer was built in the garden. The colours are amazing and one can spend a quiet tranquil time just sitting in the garden. I would recommend a visit here for all garden lovers.
worth a visit very interesting. This trip was just for a afternoon ,very good value for money , a trip to the gardens , half hour horse carriadge ride and the government park all very interesting
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens, well worth a visit as is the Berber museum. Many cactuses and other exotic species, beautifully laid ou with shady seating areas and a cafe

SOOOOOO AMAZING. I am not a green fingered person but WOW this garden is soooo amazing let alone all the amazing history with in it I've recommend this place to every one of my friends and the ones that have Been have also said how wowed they were. Please go soooo pretty

Yve St Laurent Garden Memorial. There is a lovely memorial to Yves St. Laurent in the gardens and is placed near the entry to the garden pathway. There are lots of beautiful cacti, palm trees and a water lily pond that is very picturesque. There is also a museum but costs an additional amount to your ticket.

Peaceful and Beautiful gardens, Highly recommended!. Peaceful and Beautiful gardens, if you want to escape from the Medina's fuss, this is exactly the place to goDiscount for students presenting student card.

So Colourful and tranquil. Just out of the centre of the city, in the new town, Majorelle Gardens are so peaceful and tranquil and quite cool out of the heat of the city. It costs around £4.50 to get in to the gardens and extra to visit the museum. The colours are fabulous. There is also a cafe to stop and have a drink. Not a full day's visit, but definitely worth a stop for an hour or so.
Nice garden . Very pretty garden in new town wed the blue majorelle the museum of the garden is nice but to expensive i like this please.

Nice break from the hustle of the medina. The gardens are very peaceful and a nice break from the busy centre. They are quite small so you do not need much time to go around them. The Berber museum was a highlight, with lots of interesting artefacts.

A visit to the gardens. Everyone told us to visit this lovely garden exhibit. It was very nice, crowded with tourists. The Berber museum in the gardens was very interesting as well. I say go but it will take you no longer than 2 hours to visit, take pictures and depart.

Besitiful. Peaceful, elegant, gorgeous gardens. Walk around at your leisure and enjoy tranquil moments. 70 dirhams to enter the garden. Relax and take in the surroundings in the coffee shop. Best time to go is early morning before the coach loads arrive.

Gardens - overrated. museum good. Personally I thought the gardens were a bit small and boring - but I am not a great lover of art or afficanado of gardens so that may be a bit harsh! The Berber museum however was very interesting and the food in the cafe was good - particularly enjoyed the asparagus and citrus fruit salad and the Avocado, date and almond milkshake

Favourite place in Marrakech. I thought that going round a garden just looking at mostly plants and trees may be a bit tedious after a while, however it was quite the opposite. It's one of the more busier attractions in Marrakech so make sure you have your elbows out to get the best pictures. It is more expensive than other attractions so either visit at the beginning of your stay or make sure you have enough left over towards the end. There is also a cafe/restaurant at the gardens to enjoy a traditional tagine, salad or refreshing drink.
A beatiful oasis in Marrakech. You really must visit the garden. It was our second visit after 10 years and it has really been improved.

Peace amongst craziness!. We visited Jardin Marjorelle as a way of escaping the madness of all else Marrakech. We were not disappointed. It was peaceful and enjoyable. Not Eden Project or Kew Gardens but lovely. The courtyard restaurant served delicious ice creams (all we wanted) but everything served to tables around us looked fab too. Enjoy if you go!

AVERAGE. Nice place but take note NOT A PLACE FOR YOUNGER people i would say good for 45 plus yes.I was there with my teens from 13 to 23 they got bored very quick...And it is tad pricey for what it is...

Blue hue. Jardin Majorelle is a slice of blue heaven in a chaotic city. The variety ofl plants will amaze you with their varied textures and colours. The winding oaths mean you are not in others way and the memorial to Yves St. Laurant a peaceful nock. Take time out for a mint tea in the cafe to observe the passersby.

If you go nowhere else, go here!. A short distance outside the Souk this is a quiet haven. It is also full of plants from tiny cactus to established trees. Age has improved it and even when busy it remains a design icon.

A very favorite treat in Marrakech. This wonderful botanical garden and museum is not to be missed. Loved all the cactus and palms growing and labeled in the gardens, but the Berber Museum is the biggest treat of all. The collection of Berber traditional dress and jewelry is fantastic. The domed star light room adds to the atmosphere. Do not miss!

It's a garden. I think the fact that this is one of the main tourist attractions in Marrakech says more about Marrakech than it does about these gardens. Sure, they are peaceful and picturesque, but they are nothing special and you really could be anywhere in the world. The museum (if you can call it that) is 3 small rooms, oh and a shop.I can see that this would be a nice shady escape in the height of summer, but it was crowded and that takes away from any sense of getting away from it all.
Vibrant. The gardens are a beautiful and peaceful retreat from the madness if Marrakesh. It is an absolute colour explosion inside. The shops are lovely. Definitely worth a visit
Love this place!. It's an oasis. The house/studio of Yves Saint Laurent is painted in the most amazing shade of indigo blue. Took lots of pictures here. Entry is about 7 euro.

Stunning. Well worth a visit, amazing cactus and other exotic plants, stunning colours, loved the museum, cost 200 dhm, about £20 for 2 which I thought was a bit much but never the less , a must see .
Great gardens . I visited these gardens in the best season of the year. Not too much tourists great weather and at the end I had a traditional Moroccan tea at the bar.

Beautiful!. Loved this garden. Cactus yard was beautiful, everything is well kept. Museum was very informative. Definitely worth a visit while in Marrakech. I could have spent another hour there and not be bored. Just beautiful!
must see. Great place to go, very colourfull interesting plants and house very peacefull surrounding lovely pond

Amazing. This place is absolutely amazing, the staff made you most welcome and nothing was not too much trouble for them, the food is the best I have ever tasted and the price was out of this world for what we received
beautiful garden. small but stunningly maintained gardens, awesome paint colors of walls, pots etc, great photo opportunities in the middle of Marakech
A joy to visit. What a find in the new city, and on the advice of our hotel we visited well before the tourist buses arrived

extraordinary colours and shapes. quite magical..if you sit and wait the crowds move on and you get time on your own. The choice of colours is sensational and you just want to go home and recreate it...
lovely place to relax in. Great place to relax in on a sunny day. Gardens are lovely and the shops and cafes outside are worth a visit too

A hidden jewel in Marrakesh. Loved visiting this oasis in Marrakech. Lovely display of cacti, water pools, and flowers.
The Berber Museum is worth the visit

Beautiful plants and trees. I liked most the cactus yard + museum, where explains the Morocco history and culture. Take a time to have a drink in the Museum's coffee and marvel the atmosphere.
Also, next to the Museum has some nice shops. Save a time to go and enjoy the local art!
Beautiful garden. Pretty nice garden but crowded at times and entrance is about 6-7 euro. Worth to stroll through in slow pace and enjoy the catchy colours.
Beautiful Place. Smaller than we expected but a fascinating place to wander round. The Berber Museum was particularly interesting
Definitely worth a visit. Not a particularly large garden but if you have an interest in fashion, design or plants as I do then you will enjoy it.

Tranquility in the madness of Marrakech. Visited this stunning garden in October and it was just what we needed after staying right in the hustle and bustle of the medina. If I'd bought a book with me I could have sat in here all day. There weren't too many people visiting to feel over crowded and the canopy of trees created a lovely cool oasis in the 33 degree heat we had. You can easily wander around the gardens, have a look at the memorial for YSL and look in the gallery and shop in about 1 hr 30 which is probably the only negative comment as we thought the garden would be a little larger. Rather than booking a taxi we jumped on the open top bus which dropped us off at the end of the road and walked back to the New Town in about 10 minutes making it easily accessible.

Enjoyable but crowded!. We visited here on a Sunday morning. While good value and enjoyable, the gardens are very crowded, in part because they are actually quite small. We enjoyed our visit but much of the interest is due to Yves St. Laurent's involvement rather than the gardens themselves. They are lovely in the sunshine but worth going early to have some peace!

Gorgeous garden and fabulour museum. The Berber museum is a must see - so well displayed, well explained, informative and fascinating. The Berber jewellry is spectacular and clearly they are very sophisticated in many ways.
Paradise in the middle of Marakkech. Fascinating place. Too many people are let in at the same time to enjoy the garden´s beauty properly though. Not worth more than an hour unless you use the cafe.

Trip to Jardin Marjorelle Marrakech. Beautiful relaxing botanical garden in the heart of crazy Marrakech - really tranquil with some beautiful gardens. there is also the Berber Museum to see too - I loved it. The gift shop was nothing exciting though
Enjoy the Jardin Majorelle. The Jardin Majorelle is beautiful and we spent an enjoyable hour strolling around enjoying the colour and plants.
Breathtaking... Had the pleasure of visiting the majorelle gardens with my partner! What a lovely place with lots of history!

Pricey but Worth. In a country where most attractions require a fee of about 10 Dirhams (one dollar US), this attraction was 70 dirhams (seven dollars US). It was well worth it to see this beautiful garden.

Beautiful and serene!. Really enjoyed the use of plants and space as well as colors. The Berber Museum was small but mighty. One of the best displays I 've ever seen. Excellent exhibit of their collections of Berber jewelry and dress.

Underwhelming, but pretty. The Majorelle is carefully plotted and planted, and full of tourists. It's not exactly a nature walk. In fact, it's a relatively small place. But it's interesting to look at the varieties of succulents amassed in one space. Perhaps the most interesting are the bold paint colors of the building. They are a nice counterpoint to the green and brown surroundings.
Its a garden with Cacti and a pond.. Its a garden with Cacti and a pond. Not sure its worth the trip, or the entrance fee, but an unusual oasis outside the city walls.
An oasis of colour. Beautiful gardens, mostly because its 'majorelle blue' colour combined with the colours of the nature perform an incredible spectacle. Must-see!!

Eden in marrakech. A beautiful sanctuary in the middle of the bustle of marrakech.The entrance fee is about £6.50 I personally felt it.was a fair price.The plants trees waterpools are a photographers paradisel ,the ambience is tranquil and relaxed a perfect place for peace and quiet.
OASIS. Oasis of peace and tranquillity away from the hustle and bustle. Fascinating plants, beautiful bamboos. Amazing colours.
Beautiful. A must if visiting Marrakech. Beautifully kept gardens, amazing colours and a great variety of plants.

Beautiful Gardens. These gardens are so unusual, filled with exotic plants,. Cacti, black bamboo, trees and of course flowers. The hard landscaping is all painted a glorious vibrant blue, with touches of yellow. Altogether a stylish and beautiful garden and so different to an English garden. There is a cafe on site as well. It does get very busy, as it is a popular tourist attraction, so not a peaceful place. Still worth a visit though.
Great place to visit. you must pay a visit if you are in marrakech this place has a lot to see and is YSL gardens we loved it and would def go back there

Colourful and very interesting.... Nice place to visit first thing in the morning, especially on a really hot day as it is an extremely cool and relaxing environment. Make sure you also visit the Berber museum which is located inside the garden.

Disappointed. A bit overpriced. Mainly cacti and bamboo. The colour was from the pots and the paintwork. The Berber museum was good but the staff on the door and inside the museum weren't very polite.

Beautiful and peaceful. Even with lots of tourists this was relaxing. Loved the colour contrasts of plants with buildings, that cobalt blue is something else! I don't know much about gardens but it seemed very well laid out as well.

Disappointing. I had high hopes for the garden, but it was simply utterly crowded and nothing spectacular really. The entrance fee with 70 Dirham was also quite high (compared to the general price level of the city). Would not necessarily go there again.
A little disappointing..just a pretty garden. We expected something more spectacular, but for a shaded place to escape the hustle and bustle it was fine. Pretty garden
Worth a visit. Beautiful gardens - so many greens - rivers, ponds - you will leave feeling unbelievably relaxed and content!!
Gorgeous, relaxing garden. Lovely place, a good contrast to the hot, noisy streets outside. Not a long visit but worth a look. The attached museum is interesting.

Beautiful and tranquil oasis. Well worth a visit to these gardens if you want to get away from the frenetic hustle and bustle of the Medina. It is quiet, peaceful and very beautiful. You just hear the sound of the wind in the trees and the songs of the many varieties of birds. Great variety of plants and the Cactus garden is spectacular! Have a mint tea in the little courtyard cafe, but don't bother with the food-not good and way overpriced. This is a nice place to go in the afternoon after the hectic haggling in the souks, just to unwind!

An oasis!. If you have time to do some exploring in the new town of Marrakech, I absolutely recommend this garden - it's such an inspiration! Cool and quiet oasis in the middle of the city, and the museum has a very informative exhibition of the Berber lifestyle.

Tranqul oasis. If you get the chance to escape the mayhem of the medina then an hour or two spent in this wonderful garden is just what you need. Calm cool and beautiful with plenty of plants, trees and water. Yves St Laurent memorial is peaceful and a lovely place to gather your thoughts.The café is expensive but delightful. We visited the boutique and it was a pleasure to not have to haggle for the goods. Again expensive but quality items for sale. To get to the gardens we hired a horse and carriage from the far side of Jemaa el Fna. Much haggling took place but we were able to eventually get the price down to an acceptable 250 MAD for 4 people including an hour at the gardens and return journey back to the square.

Definitely worth visiting - don't bother with the Museum. Beautiful gardens - slightly maze like, which added to the fun! Our taxi driver advised to pay only for the garden and not the Museum, which we'd agree on, and only cost 10 dirhams. Worth a a visit!
Well worth a visit. We arrived an hour before closing ~ I would say an hour is long enough to tour the gardens.It was a unique and unexpected pleasure! Highly recommended.

Fashion Takes Many Forms. Let Jardin Majorelle in Marrakech is a tribute to the incomparable Yves Saint Laurent. It is a beautiful compilation of color, quiet and plants of the Mediterranean with a special interest in cacti. The colors are hot, vibrant walls and huge planters make for quintessential Moroccan photo ops.Set up in the gorgeous riad where Monsieur Laurent spent so much time, resqued by Ed Sullivan, it is a living example of grace. Go early to avoid crowds. It boasts a lovely cafe, library and boutique. A small collection of whimsical Laurent posters has its own chamber. Very welcome respite from the chaos of the medina in Marrakech.
Worth a visit. Worth a wander round, very peaceful. We had coffee in the cafe which is delightful, wished it was open for supper as we would have gone back.
Must visit . Gardens well maintained. Cost 70DR admission with 30DR for the museum. Great way to spend an hour. The courtyard in the cafe serves great coffee with water.
peace and quiet. Beautifully maintained gardens in the new town. well worth a visit. Entrance fee 70 dirham at time of writing. We enjoyed a lovely ice cream and lemonade in the cafe there too.

The Berber museum is excellent. At the entrance you get the choice of gardens only or gardens and museum. The museum is the best we've seen in Marrakech, and one of the few with language translation notes for the exhibits, so a must do. Super collection of Berber items. The gardens were great too although a little crowded. We didn't use the cafe but both it and it's menu looked very good.

disappointing. I found Jardin Majorelle very disappointing and quite unkempt. Litter strewn around the olive trees and fish pool. I could not believe that such an attraction in Marrakech could be left in the state it was left in. Someone with a good broom would be all it would take to clean this place up. Shame on those who leave their rubbish in such public attractions.

Nice Garden. We walked to the garden. It is nice an oasis in the middle of the city. Lots of cacti and a couple of ponds with koi fish. The colors of the buidling are pretty.It is nice. is it a must see? Not sure. The gift shop sells nice items, We had tea in the cafe. This is a quick stop.

Worth a stop. I visited these gardens recently and found it to be relaxing. The gardens were very well-kept and had a variety of interesting plants. That said, I didn't find the varieties particularly unique or exciting. The setting was lovely and very peaceful (not always common in Marrakesh). The restaurant in the garden was also very good and I particularly enjoyed the Berber Museum that is embedded within the Gardens.

Beautiful and cool oasis in the middle of city. A wonderful visit to this little oasis of calm and serenity. Beautifully presented to visitors, slightly expensive. Go early or late to enjoy more of the peach and tranquilty that can be disturbed by others.
Delighful Oasis. Good value for a walk around lovely gardens and museum.Great shopping and eating on offer too. This was a trendy area very different form rest of the city.

Majorelle Gardens. Stunning gardens . . .originally created by French artist Jacqueline Majorelle and then owned by Yes Saint-Laurent. An array of bamboo,cacti and palms with pools floating with water lilies. A tranquil haven hidden in the hussle and bussle of Marrakech!
an amazing garden.. An amazingly calm garden in a bustling city ....The colours of the buildings against the cool greens is spectacular......make sure you visit the Berber Museum whilst there

Jardin Haute Couture!!. When I first heard about the famous Marrakech Attraction designed by none-other-than-the-extremely-famous-French-Designer "Yves Saint Laurent", I was not quite tempted to go see it, frankly, I was afraid of being disappointed....In Haute Couture & Design, I fell in love with YSL since I was a teen, and I didn't know what to expect from a Jardin he designed....but the visit was a good surprise: I was marked by the Lines, the Colors, the Shapes, the Grace of "Ensemble"....I was assisting to Nature's Haute Couture Fashion Show, not visiting a Jardin.... I believe you should never under-estimate what "The Designer" can create and beautify....
Beautiful. Gorgeous gardens where you can while away a whole afternoon. A real highlight of our stay in Marrakesh.

Uninspiring and a bit naff. Expensive entry and not much to see. Expensive café which was crowded. A small place that crams people in to see a few cactuses and goldfish and a blue house. Bit of a let down.

Lovely, tranquil, unique. Away from the concentrated noise of scooters, donkeys and people in the Souk of Marrakechyou should visit the garden. Peaceful, relaxing, different, emphasis on species in dry and desert conditions. A good trip.
Nothing spectacular.. Probably better to visit in the summer to enjoy the shade and quiet. Otherwise, personally wasn't worth it.
Gorgeous. Best to visit early and avoid the crowds. Lots of taxis available there and easy walk to main places.
Beautiful!. This is fabulous gardens in the heart of Marrakech. Staff were so helpful and friendly and the setting is just beautiful. Highly recommended.

Beautiful Gardens. Small, beautiful, serene gardens in the heart of Marrakech. The grounds were gorgeous. The Berber Museum, although small, was quite nice to visit as well. The lighting at mid-morning was beautiful and I'm not sure I'd want to be there in high afternoon.The shoppe is rather lovely. And, I love the Yves Saint Laurent Love postcards exhibit.
Beautiful. Jardin Marjorelle is not the biggest garden, but it's visually stunning with the arrangement of plants and bright colours - I'm going to paint all my plant pots blue, yellow and orange!

Quirky oasis. The gardens are quite different than others in Marrakech. They offer a quirkiness which makes them a must visit. You may have to line up for a ticket, but it is worth doing. i also visited the Berber Museum and while small it was worth it if you are interested in the history and displays of jewellery and historical dress.

relax and breathe. i'm not into tourist-spots, but this garden is very beautiful and gives you air to breathe and some quiet after a long walk around the hustle bustle in the medina. 70MAD per person.

its okay. This was nice to see since its one of a view attractions however its okay , nothing special... We paid the money because its a charity that reinvest in Marrakesh and I think that that makes it worth the while, since its a beautiful city.
Impressive. Great gardens and a small museum. The museum has beautiful jewelry, costumes and crafts. The plants are well tended and thoughtfully presented. A nice place to visit.,

So lovely. A beautiful, calm garden in the middle of Marrakech. Looked after with care and love, these gardens are just lovely. We wandered around for a couple of hours, sheilded from the heat and found it very relaxing. The cafe was good with nice snacks and coffee. All staff were helpful and friendly. Well worth a visit
Skip It. Waaayy too many people in this place, I would not recommend it. The gardin was okay, but nothing out of the ordinary. Save your money and time.

Beautiful scenery and photo ops.. The gardens are full of bright, lovely colours and architecture which wonderfully combines the creativity of Yves Saint Laurent and the intricacy of Moroccan designs. The gardens consists of a large variety of exotic plants, a Berber museum (which unfortunately you can't take photos of), a very expensive little café, a boutique which offers Moroccan and Berber style home furnishings and accessories, Yves Saint Laurent's Memorial, and a small space featuring some of Yves Saint Laurent's work. There are some cafés nearby if you don't fancy paying alot, and taxis are always coming and going. Definitely recommend.

Beautiful place to visit. The Jardin Majorelle is definitely worth visiting. The grounds are beautiful, with all sorts of trees and flowers, and the colors are amazing. Do not miss visiting the Berber Museum while you are there, it is very small but it presents, in a wonderful way, the interesting history of the Berbers.

Stunning!. We visited these gardens earlyish in the morning and avoided the crowds. I loved the vivid coloured buildings and pots and the wonderful variety of plants from all over the world. The Berber Museum was very well curated and there were information guides in English available. Good choice of refreshments in the pretty café.

A beautiful oasis in the city. The garden is beautiful with colourful fountains and pots that looks wonderful against the green plants. We visited the restaurant and had a good tajine. Prizes are a bit high.

Immaculate gardens by Ive St Laurent. This is a magical oasis of largely-cacti gardens, immaculately maintained in homage to Ives St Laurent who lived here with his lover(s). You weill not find more varieties of cacti anywhere in the world, (including Kew Gardens in London) and laid-out in such beautiful and well-designed style. A 'Must See' on any visit to Marrakech.

Interesting museum, gardens are ok.. I learned a lot about the Berbers in this museum (clothing, jewelry, items they used daily, etc). It was very helpful and I would suggest seeing this early in your trip. The museum has helpful cards that explain EACH display in English, German and I believe they're offered in a couple of other languages as well.The gardens are nice, but not that interesting to me. You will see Yves Saint Laurent's gravestone on property as well.

A will do, not a must do.... I would suggest that Marrakech is not somewhere you visit to see beautiful gardens. You will visit Majorelle....it's on the guidebook lists. Enjoy the fine specimens you will see, the relative tranquility, the beautiful blue pots and house and a good little museum.Don't expect to be there too long and do expect to rate it questionable value for money against other Marrakech paid for attractions (although it's relative really).
paradise in the city. stunning gardens with plenty of shade and pools full of fish frogs and terrapins. Small art gallery with designs displayed drawn by Yves Saint Laurent himself
A absolute one off - has to be seen!. A feast for your eyes - shape - colour - design - a magical garden - but wildly different ! Worth every diram.
Lovely place but rather busy.. Go early or expect queues. This is a unique venue, in the top-ten of must see locations in Marrakesh (personal opinion).
Beautiful. Don't miss this! The garden is sheer tranquility and so beautiful, with ponds full of life. Don't miss the Berber museum - extraordinary insight into the life, dress and jewelry.

Beautiful peaceful garden inside a vivid city. Great place to visit while being in Marrakech, beautiful plants and colours create a peaceful tranquil athmosphere inmidst the turbulent life in the city.

Paradise in the city . Jardine marjorelle is a beautiful place, my partner and I enjoyed the gardens peace in a busy crazy city! The entrance price is now 70 mad.There is also a berber museum on site which is very interesting. In the berber museum take the paper guides which describe each object in each room. The Berber museum is worth the additional 30 mad entrance price. Tip do check out the love room to find your birth years art work (if young enough!)

Gorgeous gardens.. Everyone who has been to Marrakech recommends visiting this garden and they are absolutely right. It is outside of the Medina but it is well worth the visit. It was one of the highlights of the trip.
Oasis in morrocco. Beautiful and relaxing. Lovely walk through the gardens. A bit overpriced, however. Also a bit crowded. Go here when you are sick of all the sales people on the medina.

Gorgeous atmosphere. I loved it from beginning to the end...and the fact that it provides a cool shade for the entire exploring in the moroccan heat is nearly as great as the garden itself! Very pretty, well maintained, colourful and refreshing place! Could spend hours there but you can also rush along in half an hour. Ponds, cactuses, palm trees....and the YSL shop is amazing at the end! Highly recommended!

Its all about the blue. Calm and shady gardens (bamboo and cactus) with intense blue paint used to colour the stonework. Good for an hour or so, but almost impossible to get a photo without another tourist in it

Very pretty an peaceful. The garden was beautiful and was Berber museum was insightful. We went to the cafe for some lunch which was a nice break. Worth the visit, even if it's just to avoid the midday heat!

Beautiful garden worth a visit. I'd definitely agree with reviews that this garden is worth a visit. Stunning, very different and a tranquil place to visit. I'd recommend going early because when we went it was really busy and you couldn't really see everything as the paths are quite narrow. The cost was 70 dirhams each to entry - about £5. If you don't want to sit and reflect you'll finish walking around in 1 hour. You can then bumble around in the local area and have a coffee - it's nice around the area.
A stunning garden. An oasis in the city. The plants and colors make this place a very special place. Located in the new town the easiest way to get there is by taxi.

Oasis in the madness of Marrakesh. Spent a lovely 3 hours or so enjoying these fantastic gardens and the museum. They are peaceful and tranquil in the hubbub of Marrekech, there is also a little a restaurant which offers the usual array of drinks and food. The best place we visited in Marrakech

Nice Break From The City. Nice enough garden and worth the entrance fees. It's an oasis of calm in the middle of a crazy city. It does get quite busy so you have to pick your photo opportunities perfectly. The museum is OK a bit strangely set out but nice to look at but the information provided isn't great. Go to the end of a busy week for a break.

Not to be missed. Beautiful gardens, the colour scheme just sums up Marrakesh. The Berber museum is fab too. I enjoyed wandering around and then had a lovely coffee in the cafe and bought some lovely souveniers in the shop.
Nice.... Good stroll in the garden. Interesting to see different types of plants. The restaurant is probably the high point...

beautiful. the colors and the gardens are gorgeous. You don't need to spend a ton of time there though. You could easily do this and the medina during the day and still have time for an afternoon activity (we went camel riding!)

world-class garden. If you enjoy gardens at all, definitely include this on your visit to Marrakesh. Both the plantings and the house are perfect works of art--our eyes were drinking in the colors. It's about a half-hour walk from the medina (taxi would also be fine--not a particularly fascinating walk).

It's beautiful, but beware of tour bus crowds. Jardin Marjorelle was a nice, lush green space just outside the main city. While it was nice to walk around, it was a bit bland in my opinion. All in all, I spent maybe 30 minutes there. It was also packed with tour groups, so if you go, make sure that you're not there at the same time as the tour groups as you will be miserable getting caught up in the crowds.

Expensive but relaxing. These gardens are quite expensive for what they are, but our daughter very much enjoyed running around in a bit of shade when it is very hot. However, you cannot come off the paths which can be a little frustrating with a child.Overall, a lovely place and a calm getaway from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Just a little expensive

An Green Oasis Away From The Medina. Whether you are into your gardening or not this is a great place to visit. The museum is a good way to find out more about the Berber people who live in the Atlas Mountains. Certainly worth a visit.
A nice place to spend a few hours away from the hustle and bustle. A lovely and well maintained garden with a nice coffee/tea shop for a welcome break away from the medina

Overrated. In my opinion it is an ovverrated attraction. A very well kept, but small garden which wouold must probably go unnoticed in any European city, visited by hundreds of admirers of the "French tailor". Also probably the most expensive attraction of the Country, as the ticket cost ten times the price of any entrance to any other museum you may visit. The berber museum shows the same artifacts you will have repeatedly seen if you visited other parts of Morocco. Particularly unpleasent, in a place of this kind, to be harrased by one of the supervisors who was insistently pretending I was taking pictures of one of the workers painting a pot. Instead of directly asking for money, as it would experience anywhere outside, he insisted I had to ask for permission to the worker (who could not care less) and take I picture I had not intention to take in exchange for a tip. With what the Management asks to pay for the entrance or a coffee in the restaurant, that staff could be the better paid and put in condition not to harrass tourists.

Amazing gardens. We walked to the gardens from our riad in the centre of Marrakech. It took us 15 minutes. We then queued for another 10-15 minutes to enter the gardens. But it was worth the wait - the gardens are truly amazing all white walls and cobalt blue.

A must in marrekech. I had read and seen pictures of these gardens before, but you have to pay and see these beautiful well kept gardens for your sell, the colours used on the brick work and plantpots make the place,
Away from the madding crowd!. After the hustle and bustle of the souks, this was a lovely tranquil place to visit. It takes about 1 hour to have a good look round.

Great to visit and see. Though could be a bit over rated , not much of a garden other tan the bright blue painted walls me the cactus garden , also visit the YSL shop for some YSL goods with exorbitant prices

Beautiful place to visit. Jardin Majorelle was a really nice place to visit during our holidays in February! Spent about 30 minutes there and had a very nice walk. Would I recommend this place to friends? Probably yes. Would I come back? Probably not. But worth comming once!

Photogenic Oasis. The Jardin Marjorelle winds up on everyone's list of what to see in Marrakech for good reason. Its lush plant life, calm from the crazy city and instantly recognizable Marjorelle blue makes this spot the best to photograph in the city. I would have given it 5/5, but the 70 dirham entry fee was higher than any other in the city, which I felt was uncalled for considering it's very small and takes only 20 minutes of slow walking to see.

Cant get excited. If you are in Marrakesh you have to visit the gardens as it is pointed out as the place to go . They are nice but they were built up to be so much more than they are quite disappointing really

Beautiful tropical plants and cacti. Nice place to spend an hour or so, plus a museum and cafe. Lovely and well kept, quite pricey for entrance, especially for tourists (foreigners). Enjoyed it, but not as good as people sold it to me..
Superb gardens, highlight of Marrakech. Fantastic, One of my highlights from Marrakech. The gardens were superb and as a photographer an absolute delight. Well worth the entrance fee
A must for Marrakech. A really nice place to visit and especially for relaxation. Impressive mix of colours, exotic plants and architectures.

Worth a visit. We walked from the Horse pickup area in the Medina, but you can take the tour bus (but be aware of bus finishing time's). The Marjorelle Garden's were lovely to explore, very pretty, not expensive to go into. Café was good too

Oasis in the city . What a lovely garden indeed! So odd to see lots of bamboo this side of the world. The cacti were also very interesting. The place is quite small mind you. Just a few pathways so it gets crowded easily. It's 70 dirham to enter the garden and another 30 for the Berber museum. Do not miss the museum! Also very small but well executed. The jewelry room was tantalizing! The cafe and boutique were also small in scale but stylish and relaxing.:) After a day at the souls dodging motorbikes and haggling left and right, jardin Majorelle was a nice change of pace indeed!;)
Tranquility on a hot day. Beautiful gardens and a little bit of tranquility away from the hectic city. A lovely morning spent here taking lots of photos keeping out of the heat of the sunc
Beautiful Gardens. The gardens here are beautiful. This is a small site but feels like an oasis in the city. Also, the bookstore and gift store had wonderful things.

An Oasis in Marrakech. Definitely take your camera as the gardens are stunning. Would recommend seeing both the gardens and museum. It is worth the visit especially after you have experienced the hustle and bustle of the souks.Anyone that loves gardening or just looking at beautiful gardens this is the place to visit. As the land is arid it offers the ability to see different plant life than you would see in a typical garden in the UK. Take time to soak up the wonderful plants by making use of the many seating opportunities.Would recommend visiting between 12-2pm as offers shades and the ability to get out of the mid day sun. Takes no more than a couple of hours.
Stunning. Fabulous gardens in the heart of Marrakech. Staff were so helpful and friendly and the setting is just beautiful. Highly recommended.
Tour of the gardens. It was an over cast day when we went, would not recommend as think the colours of the garden need a brilliant blue sky
Beautiful gardens. A must when in Marrakech, a very interesting place to visit. Excellent place to take photos and the workers are very helpful

Beautiful and calming. Despite the crowds, it is possible to lose them and wander around in the cool shade of the trees. The planting is superb, the colours are amazing. The museum is well worth a visit and full of fascinating content - not at all like the museums elsewhere! We had a cool drink in the café and then just had to go for the ice cream too, both of which were excellent. Overall, I highly recommend this garden as a place to visit when in Marrakech.
beautiful. these gardens are absolutely beautiful and very different. the story and history surrounding their construction and renovation was also interesting
Great place to visit. Beautiful gardens and very interesting small Berber museum. Definitely worth a visit. Also some very nice boutiques opposite the entrance.
Garden visit. Gorgeous serene gardens and Yves St. Laurent house in Marrakesh - banyon and bamboo trees, lily pools, stunning colors.

Quiet and tranquil. Well worth a visit just to get away from the hussle bussle of Marrakech. As others have said it's smaller than I expected but still very beautiful and quiet. I'm still 50 / 50 about the museum if it's worth the extra. The only thing I would say is if I was to visit the gardens again I wouldn't visit the museum but the cafe is great for lunch and I would definately vist the garden and cafe again.

Beautiful gardens in peaceful location. Well worth a visit inexpensive entry compared to UK charges.
lots of shaded seating and interesting plants.

Nice cool and quiet garden with a great museum on Berber culture. Pricier than other places to visit ($10 for gardens and museum per person) it is a haven of tranquility with lovely plants and colors. The Berber museum is better than any museum in town. It is small but informative.
Good place to rest and have a light lunch.

Beautiful. I am so pleased we visited this garden, it is stunning. Obviously it's not a green garden like we have in Northern Europe but the cactii and palms are amazing and the garden's design is stunning. The smoothies in the cafe are lovely too

Beautiful Gardens - A must see if going to Marrakech. The YSL Garden is iconic and is a must see. Its not far from the main square so should cost no more than 50dh.
Beautifully painted and landscaped.
Well worth seeing if in Marrakech

Bright and cheery!. The gardens are smaller than you suspect, but there is still plenty to pique one's interest and to linger over. The actual gardens might interest you for only an hour as basically it's a few ponds (with frogs and turtles) and various types of tree and cacti etc. Having said that the gardens have a certain beauty borne out of their simplicity and the azure blues everywhere.Within the gardens is the Berber museum (a small but highly instructive and interesting collection of artefacts such as jewellery, clothing, doors (?)) which will also provide a good half hours enlightenment and entertainment.There are a couple of gift shops too and although we only tried some snacks at the cafe/restaurant these were very nice.
Cool and Stylish. Lovely place to be during the heat of the day. Good value and a wonderful backdrop for photos. The plants are beautiful and the design elements are sensational.
You have to visit . One of the best places to visit.Lovely and great cafe too :) was relaxed and loads of trees, nice walk back via avenue mohammed 5 to the main square too

Nice garden. The garden looks very nice with a variety off tropical plants.The fountain, blue house and memorial are interesting to see.We thought the gardens were bigger so calculated 2 hrs for the visit.For us one hour was more than enough. Just think that the 7 Euro entrance fee helps them to keep the gardens the way they are though in my opinion is a bit too much for what you "get"
Great way to spend a few hours. Nice gardens, small Berber museum and a very nice café for lunch. Worth a few hours for sure. In between old and new town.

Visited whilst on a short 3 day break to the Medina and Marrakech. The Jardin Majorelle are really beautiful gardens and a must see whilst visiting Marrakech , beautifully maintained and lovely colours to take some fantastic photo's .
Very interesting garden with a special atmosphere. Nice shop.. It is not a large garden but very interesting to visit it early in the morning. You should stay for about 30 Minutes.

Beautiful gardens. Plenty of trees flowers plants birds . lovely shapes. Camera a must . little cafe for lunch , was reasonable ,they have a museum also you have to pay a little extra ,it was very interesting . just relax

A haven of tranquility. We decided to walk through the souk to the Jardin. Big mistake. This meant crossing a few main roads which was scary. Should have taken a taxi.
When we got to the Jardin we were very impressed - cool and calm in a manic city. Lovely just to sit in the shade and take in the ambience.
Not very colourful. It was a very simple garden. Not to my taste. A lot of people would enjoy it though. its nice that it is away from the hustle and bustle of everything else.

Cool and relaxing in the new city. Lovely gardens in a very cool and tranquil setting in the new city, easy to find if your hotel gives you good directions like ours did. I wouldn't recommend the cafe it is very highly priced for low quality in my opinion. Have a nice walk around and visit the museum and then go around again, a lovely way to spend a couple of hours in a peaceful setting.

Divine sactuary .......if you arrive early.. Get there early before 10 to beat tour groups.The exotic cactus collection and palms are dramatic with the blue, yellow and orange contrasting buildings and flower pots.The museum of tribal desert costumes is beautifully presented and quite small and therefore not overwhelming.A highlight in Marrakech. The garden is relatively small and can be seen even with a tranquil repose in an hour.
Nice garden but nothing more. If you are in Marrakech you have to stop as everyone talks about this garden.Inside is nice but we were expecting something more. The ticket is overpriced.
Vision in blue. This is a must see when in Marrakech. A beautiful and well maintained garden consisting mostly of cacti and succulents
A little expensive compared to other sites. Lovely garden but a little expensive compared to other attractions in marrakech. Camomile and orange blossom tea was amazing!

Wonderful place. Tranquil and Devine. What a wonderful little place this is, full of beauty. Well worth a visit. A camera is a must, there are stunning things to see, it's just Devine. Take your time.

Beautiful. Everything you could hope for...peaceful, relaxing, birds, insects, flowers...and that was in October :)
As well maintained as the best London park but without the litter or dog doings.
I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Expected a massive beautiful garden but it was not so impressive. Quoting my girlfriend "it's a nice garden, but nothing breathtaking". Charm of it might be that it is supposed to be a calm oasis just out of the buzzing city life. However, since the place is filled with tourists it ruins the essence of the place. The café has nice food and drinks.

What a colourful place. Jardín Majorelle is such a stunning nice place, so colourful, peaceful, even though in the middle of Marrakesh with so many different cactus, bamboos, and in such a great garden architecture.
Quite nice but not that special. As a keen gardener I think this failed to live up to the hype. It is nice and cool and interesting but not amazing.
A Marrakesh Must. Small but perfectly formed. One of the most memorable pieces of Marrakesh. Majorette blue in the sunshine makes the garden absolutely delightful.

Solitude amoungst the masses.
