The gardens are a tranquil retreat from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech, even though they were packed with tourists and there was a queue to get in (though it moved quite quickly). Do not think you can spend a merely 30 minutes here. It is t be experienced. The contrast of bold colours and vegetation deserves at least an hour or an afternoon. This is one of the highlights of a trip to Marrakech.

Tranquility in the Gueliz. A touch of calm and beauty in the new town. Amazing place to visit even if you have no particular interest in plants. If, however, you love plants and trees this is a must visit. Bamboo the size of palm trees and water lilies the size of tea trays. Great for simply sitting in the garden, soaking up the scents and people watching. The museum is also a must see.
Peaceful Gardens. A small garden full of plants and water pools. A delightful restful garden, just the place to sit and contemplate.
You can't visit Marrakesh and not visit Marjorelle Garden. A must do in Marrakesh for it's beauty, history and ambiance. Definitely in my TOP 5s to do in Marrakesh!
Very pretty. Attractive gardens. Only need about an hour to stroll around. Lovely photo opportunities. Visited as part of trip including gardens, reservoirs and horse and carriage ride.

Spectacular!!!. Beautiful gardens of the home of the late Yves St, Laurent.
No wonder he loved Marrakech so much.
Magnificent setting...beautiful colors and lively museums.

Beautiful and relaxing. So glad i visited here....it was lovely to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
There is a little cafe inside too that you can sit and have a mint tea!

Highly recommendable. I always suggest that foreign friends pay a visit here as it has a very unique atmosphere. You may say that it has nothing to do with Marrakech and really could be anywhere but nevertheless less it IS here and it's worth seeing what Yves St Laurant made of it. It has a good restaurant which does not serve alcohol.
Beautiful . Really enjoyed the peaceful tour of the beautiful gardens. They were well cared for with beautiful plants, trees, fountains, and ponds. Certainly worth your visit.

Not too impressed. If you hve a spare hour with nothing to do you might pay these gardens a visit. A green oasis in the middle of the city thats true but the same could be said of the public parks. There is a range of plants but none with any wow factor. The pond, the water lilies and the house may be unusual for Marrakech held no great attraction. To be fair the Berber Museum had an attractive selection of items especially the silver jewellery. A memorial to Yves St Laurent and some Christmas cards of his design are also exhibited.My wfe however thought the place had some charm. Horses for courses.

Beautiful place to visit, lovely gardens and great tea rooms. Fantastic Berber museum, and relaxing gardens, well worth a visit! Stroll around and take in the blue colours, feel tranquil where Yves St Laurent spent his time.
relaxing spot. beautiful place full of history and emotions. walking through the gardens, you will definitely feel at ease and relaxed. It offers such an amazing ''paysage"

Nice Garden. we had a lot of fun ,it nice garden with different colors and birds and plants If you aren't interested in nature and trees then it may not be for you. However, a lovely well spent hour, walking around the beautiful gardens and learning about the different kinds of cactus/trees. Also a museum inside and cafe :),it's recommendable

Average for high price. August2015. this is a small nice park of plants. there is a little history museum inside this park. no pictures allowed to be taken inside. a little accident happened inside the park which is one of the high trees suddenly fell from high onto the people walking beneath it

Beautiful. Well worth a visit and a little haven from all the hustle and bustle of the city. We went early so nice and tranquil , a little later and I think it might be somewhat busier which could take away from the calmness of the place. Shaded spots which is a relief from the heat at times...bliss!! I was amazed at the high levels of maintenance nothing seemed out of place, perfect and stunning photos to be taken too. There is a café there although we didn't get to sample anything.

Very nice but very small. We paid the gardens a visit as part of a gardens tour and just as the tite says, they are very nice but can be walked around very easily at a snails pace in 20 minutes so if you want a chance to get out of the sun for a while (the gardends are very well shaded) then it makes a good short break.

A little gem . Spent a couple of hours here, relaxing looking at the many plants and visiting the museum. Try to get here before the coach parties turn up and ask the attendants to take your photos, they were really helpful and took some really nice photos of us.

An oasis. Reasonably interesting (though I'm not into botany), but it was the coolness and the tranquillity that amazed me. It was a very relaxing time, even though there were lots of people there. The toilets are western style and very clean which was a major plus.
Unexpected garden in Marraketch . The garden is well kept. Inside there is a museum about Berber culture which is excellent. I would go back just for the museum. You can pay extra and avoid the line.
almost too polished. Nice garden and house, but somehow it just seemed a bit artificial - too much like a setting for a fashion photo shoot ... too over-thought.
worth a visit. Not many pretty places in Marrakech but this one is worth seeing at a cost of 100 dinar for entry to garden and museum.

Fairly good but costs more than most in Marrakech. We are not big garden fans but this whiled away about 1hr and us pretty interesting. However if you go to parks along Mohammed Avenue 5 its almost as good and free. PersonallyI would recommmend doing both but for Majorelle only because it says it does charitable and similar things

Beautiful garden with a story. . If you aren't interested in nature and trees then it may not be for you. However, a lovely well spent hour, walking around the beautiful gardens and learning about the different kinds of cactus/trees. Also a museum inside and cafe :)
Pleasant but crowded. Interesting from the plant species but found the gardens at Hotel Mamounia more relaxing. Victim of its own duchess. To many people there to fully appreciate its tranquility
Pleasant and shady. Enjoyed a pleasant stroll through the shady park. There are corners devoted to Yve St Laurent who lived there.

Much more than I expected!. The gardens were so lovely and well-maintained. It was a delightful visit! I was most impressed by the museum, though - one of the few with so many artefacts, as well as info in English, lots of videos and pictures! Highly recommend! :)

Half day tour of Majorelle Gardens. Fabulous visit to these wonderful gardens on one of the hottest days of our tour. It was lovely to be able to sit in the lovely surroundings and walk through the shady and colorful areas of these well maintained gardens and house in the centre of a bustling and busy city as Marrakech.

Gorgeous!!. You must see this beautifully designed Garden. The colors are magnificent of the buildings and it is a peaceful oasis amidst the hubbub of Marrakech. Please do not miss out on the Garden Shop and Bookstore...they had utterly amazing things to buy........nothing like we saw elsewhere in Marrakech.....jewelry, fashions, home items and fabulous books.

Simply Beautiful. Well worth a visit, we thought at first it was slightly expensive, but once you enter and see how well maintained the gardens are, you then understand the cost to get in. Never have I seen garden's so beautiful, would definitely come back again.
Cool Desert Garden and Berber Museum. Awesome collection of cacti and desert plant. The Berber museum is really interesting and informative

Very touristy, but worth a visit. Blue majorelle is a color that pops up during the visit in this garden. Very small, with nothing that really stood out. But a nice change from visiting the medinas and a very different attraction from what you always see in Morocco. It is filled with many tourists, but at the same time, it is quiet and slightly more peaceful than the medinas.
perfect selfie spot. Lot's of cactuses and a couple selfie spots which you can get to via a short line of other selfie enthusiasts
Enjoyable, but Not a Must See. Very crowded at our time of visit. Not a must-see. Stayed less than 1 hour. Recommend going with a local guide who can get a quick admission into the garden.
Worth to trip. Great place to visit, a lovely garden with an assortment of local and imported plants. Easy to get to and reasonable admission fee

An oasis of tranquility. There is a reason the garden is so popular, it is an oasis of tranquility in Marrakesh. Beautifully laid out , the garden is a stunning display of a semi arid garden, with a welcome cafe and high end gift shop which wouldn't be out of place in Bond Street.

One of the finest gardens in the world!. This is a much loved garden; it is unusually beautiful and the perfect oasis in the midst of the razzmatazz, that is Marrakech. We could go back there every day, if we could. Even the restaurant is hard to beat.
Marrakech Oasis. Jardin Majorelle is a great way to spend a few hours relaxing among an amazing garden. Make sure to stop in the Berber museum; it's a great overview of the diverse Berber culture.

Mmmmm. I was expecting a little bit more, I have visited really nice gardens all over the world so thisbone was average, if you've never been I believe it's a must on your first trip to Marrakech, otherwise there's better gardens elsewhere

Quite a lot for tourists . Walked to the Majorette today. 70dh (£5) each. Cashier claimed to be unable to change 200dh note and blanked us when we protested. Scraped admission with very small change and notes rather than hump up to a round 100 each with the museum. It's very small but quite pretty. Took about arbour to see and photograph. It's crowded with 100 people - go early. And the cafe is a rip off. Eat at the Pause Gourmand opposite which is great!

A blue and green dream!. One of the most popular tourist attractions in Morocco. Yves Saint Laurent spent a lot of time in Marrakech, from the late 60s until his death in 2008. Here he found inspiration and tranquility. He and his partner Pierre Berge owned two houses in Marrakech and later also the Majorelle Garden, located next to one of their houses and now donated to the city of Marrakech. The garden is just beautiful and you need about an hour to complete your tour. Afterwards you can visit the berber museum or the shop where you can buy books or finer design items. There is also a nice restaurant where you can have lunch or a coffee! Don't miss the memorial area for Yves that is hidden deep inside the garden.
Nice place to visit if you are into this type of thing. . This is a nice relaxing oasis away from the manic marrakech Streets. Its worth a visit but is like most other gardens in other countries.
Breathtaking.. Wonderful & so before its time - so peaceful and such a feast for the eyes. You really must see the colours for yourself.

An enjoyable must-do when in Marrakech. The best collection of cactuses I ever saw, a really very beautiful garden that is very well kept in a very nice area of the city. It houses also the Berber museum that is small, but gorgeous. If you like the Berber history and especially the adornments, than this is a must-do. We were very impressed with their display of traditional clothing of the various areas of the Atlas mountains. Explanations are in French, but English hand outs are available. Not sure if tickets are for sale online, if so, better take advantage as lines can be long at the door.
Visit Visit Visit!. Absolutely beautiful. I wasn't sure i should go before and thought I might as well. Easily the best part of my visit to Marrakesh.

Relaxing if it was a quiet day!. Well laid out, peaceful gardens. Except for the crowds! On a quiet day, this would have been a beautiful place to take some time and chill out.The gardens themselves benefit from blue skies that really enhance the painted garden-ware and walls of this place.Despite the large numbers of visitors, there are still some quiet spots to be had. The museum inside is also very interesting.
what a nice place !. Lovely plants,cool and shaded ecnhanted garden ....The prices of the cafe are bit expensive but the Jardin Majorelle is a must to do if you are in Marrakech...

Beautiful Serene Place. A gorgeous garden to visit, it's a must if you love nature. The plants are exotic, can not even pick one that was my favourite. It would have been nice if there was more to see as it took an hour to walk all around the garden.

Legacy to Yves Saint Laurent. Majorelle Gardens are located on Rue Yves Saint Laurent, in Gueliz district. Jacques Majorelle (1886-1962), a French orientalist painter, moved to Marrakech in 1923 and purchased a large palm grove that became Majorelle Gardens. In 1932 he built a studio in Art Deco style, painted Majorelle blue, a colour synonymous with Morocco today. He created a garden of exotic plants and rare species and opened it to the public in 1947. After his death in 1962, the property fell into ruins until 1980 when Pierre Berge and Yves Saint Laurent purchased it, restored and expanded it. The studio was redesigned as a museum to Berber culture. Later a bookstore, Cafe, and Boutique were added. After Yves Saint Laurent's death in 2008, Pierre Berge donated the property to the Foundation Jardin Majorelle, and a stele memorial to Saint Laurent was built. Saint Laurent's ashes are in the gardens.

Beautiful garden in Marrakesh. This is Yves St Laurent's former home in Marrakesh. The gardens were designed and built by Majorelle in the fifties, and has a large collection of cacti. This would be particularly striking when in bloom in the spring. The museum has a lovely collection of native costumes, jewelry and armaments.
Relaxing place to visit. Very relaxing, cool and tranquil place to wander around listening to the birds. Interesting museum attached.
Beautiful gardens and museum. The gardens were beautiful and well maintained. The use of color is a gorgeous backdrop for the plants. The Berber museum is very interesting and informative.
A beautiful oasis. Its a must to visit this garden! It was owned by yve st laurent and is a mist beautiful place, quiet and peaceful. I went from my hotel by horse drawn carriage easy to arrange

An oasis in the city. Beautiful and shady garden in the middle of Marrakech. A nice diversion from the unit and noise. Spent about 2 hours between beautiful bamboo and amazing cactus but i think you could do it in 1 - I just enjoyed to sit still without getting hasseld

Beautiful, small garden. A beautiful garden with colours that just pop. The cafe is very good, as is the Berber museum. Drawbacks: it's small, there are loads of tourists and the museum doesn't have captions in English.

OASIS IN THE MIDDLE OF MARRAKRCH. This a calm and peaceful oasis in the middle of Marrakech, cool and shaded in parts with lovely plants from around the world. Very good information regarding the origin of the plants. There is also a small Berber museum inside , very interesting.

Overpriced and overrated, unless you like zen gardens and cactus. Costing 70d per person just for just the garden visit (the museum was extra) we were disappointed that it was quite small, taking only about 10 minutes to walk around, and quite unimaginative. It boasted some unusual and exotic plants but the arrangement was uninteresting and certainly not inspirational. Most of the planted areas were laid in large straight edged beds with plenty of space between the plants, similar in feel to a zen garden. A couple of fish ponds with a few gold fish and Terrapins broke up the planting interspersed with a few pretty tiled areas.
Nice. Nice place but a bit expensive. Restaurant offers good Moroccan specialities. Good place to relax away from the agitation of the city.
A garden gem. A tiny garden / art installation in the centre of the city, Fantastic plants and incredible colours. Quite busy but very peaceful.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens, really peaceful and quiet. The house and museum of Berber history are really worth a visit.
Beautiful and Peaceful . An absolutely beautiful garden and Museum. Even though there was so many visitors the walk around the garden was peaceful and enjoyable. A must see if your in Marrakech.

Nice Garden, But Not a Must-Go. If you're not a super fan of Yves Saint Laurent, there is no need to spend time to visit. Entrance fee of 70 DH is pretty expensive comparatively. The fee for the Berber museum inside the garden is separate and will cost you another 30 DH. The Cafe Bousafsaf inside however gives you a peaceful moment, sitting down to have lunch or good coffee and cakes. The menu also provides Moroccan choices. Having a chance to enjoy the nice gardening environment, please expect to pay pretty much. One cappuccino and one lemon tart cost 100 Dirham in total. Herbal tea about 40 Dirham. Alternative choices should be the restaurants on the road right outside the entrance.

A cool oasis in the middle of a hot busy city.. The gardens were a cool and refreshing break from the heat of the city. In comparison to some of the attractions we visited it was a little expensive but not by UK standards. It's quite small and we walked around twice to get a bit more time out of it but the plants were interesting and the iconic blue building looked great. Nice little place to clear your mind.
Nice place but crowded. This little green oasis in the newer part of Marrakesh ist worth a visit, but gets crowded fast. So be sure to be there early or be greeted by lots of people from bus tours.

lovely gardens and a fascinating museum. These gardens are tiny but really interesting. There is a museum dedicated to Berber history in the middle, which is worth visiting. There is also a very nice little café in the gardens, with tables in a courtyard setting and good food. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Marrakech
Great escape. Great way to escape the hustle and bustle of the medina and relax in the tranquility of YSL's lovely garden

Beautiful tranquil gardens in the centre of chaos!!. My husband and I visited these beautiful gardens whilst on holiday in Marrakech and it was just so nice to step out of the chaos and step into a beautiful quiet setting where you can actually clear your mind and walk around the lovely jardin marjorelle at our own speed without feeling rushed.

Beautiful but a bit pricy. A great getaway from the confusion of the medina.
The gardens, however, get crowded easily, making the experience not so good.
Go as soon as you can in the morning to escape the tour groups...
A bit pricy for the experience...

Worth a visit.. Very nice relaxing good museum. Had to pay for garden, entry 100 dms each extra for museum.Monument to Yves San Laurent not impressive. No clothes as advertised on some leaflets. Small posters instead. Gift shop very expensive.

stunning garden and a feast for the eye. Just a stunning and very special garden. There is also a great shop inside with some stunning artisan pieces which are a far cry from the touristy stuff you find in the souks
Peaceful Gardens. Lovely tranquil gardens - interesting small museum and relaxing café courtyard - lovely for a cool lemonade

Beautiful. Wasnt fussed about seeing this famous landmark, however i am so glad i went. Just beautiful, cool, calm and shaded. The Berber museum inside is amazing, really great images and artifacts (if you love clothes and jewellery you will LOVE this place.The cafe was superb, great staff, very fresh, very well priced. I would recommend a tiny diversion to the icecream cart outside the taxi rank for framboise to cap this brilliant excursion.

Worth a visit but you may not be overwhelmed. We were expecting something extraordinary after all the hype and were a bit disappointed by most of it as it consists of palms (with little or no underplanting) and cacti. However, the area around Majorelle's old studio is beautiful and really well done. The Berber museum housed in the studio is excellent and brilliantly presented.
Garden delight. What a wonderful oasis in the middle of bustling marrakech. Very restful and beautiful garden well worth a visit.

one of the top 5 attractions in Marrakesh. do not miss. The Jardin Majorelle, or Majorelle gardens in English, comprises two attractions -- the garden themselves and a fabulous small museum organized by Yves St Laurent and his former boy friend Pierre Berge.The gardens are wonderful to walk through and the museum presents a beautiful collection of masterpiece Moroccan artefacts, like jewelry, costume,etc.Not your typical boring museum experience to say the least.Go and enjoy some nature and art appreciation.There is also a cafe.
Great. Great wee idyllic garden in the craziness of marrakech. At 70d entry it's worth a wee visit. Spent around an hour there.. That was probably long enough though.

Beautiful garden, stunning displays in the Berber Museum. I am not big on gardens. But! This one is a true beauty! Especially that it is in the middle of Marrakech. iIt gives a refreshing and cool break(lots of shade) from the hot weather with its bamboos and palm trees from various parts of the world(it is signposted) and a cactus garden that is stunning. The berber museum is definitely worth the visit within the garden, amazing jewelry display! Visited twice, different times of the day and it was never too busy. It is an unexpected gem of Marrakech!

Nice but not extremely impressive. Anyone who has seen proper Japanese/ Chinese gardening/ landscaping architecture before won't be overly impressed by Jardin Majorelle. It's quite small and was packed with people when we were there (c. 11am). The many different type of cacti were interesting and the wide use of the majorelle blue paint gives everything a nice touch70 DH admission (35 for students)
Beautifully organized garden. great to stroll through the gardens during the heat of the day when it is too hot to site see or shop
Marrakeche. Morocco is so beatifull .Visit it worth it.Marrakech with Jardin Majorelle is exelente visit.thank you to our nice guide.
must must!. so glad i got to see this beautiful place! definitely worth while - the museum was the best part, it was jaw dropping unfortunately no photos allowed inside museum.

The colors are so vibrant. The colors blend together so beautifully. All of the greenery and the bright blue, yellow, and terra cotta pots and walkways. Wonderful place to take photographs. So serene.

Calm break from the city. These gardens are very beautiful and a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are a lot of cactus plants from around the world which was very interesting, and everything was done with taste. Don't forget to visit the Berber museum inside which is also a great visit and rather fascinating.

Stunning. This is a small garden with tight paths showing many mature bamboos and cacti. Lovely fish ponds and café. Of course the stunning Majorelle Blue walls and vases makes all the difference. You must go to the Berber Museum. Just 30Dhm extra but amazingly interesting. Best part in my opinion. Small shop and gallery. Plus courtyard cafe. Get in at 8 or 9am. No later as tour groups arrive and pathways become very crowded. Taxi rank outside.
Small but beautiful. Quite small but beautiful. Spent 45 mins there. Worth traveling by horse carriage to see the sights on the way.

Attractive. Expensive admission based on Marrakech standards but pretty gardens nevertheless. If you want a drink or snack go to the cafe on the corner opposite the entrance - lovely fruit based drinks and cheaper.
Do not miss!. Beautiful gardens with so much to see, easily able to lose yourself amongst all the foliage. Definitely set aside an hour to go round it all!

It was beautiful. I really enjoyed walking around these gardens, a little bit of tranquillity away from the hussel and hussel, there is beauty everywhere you look. I loved the history behind them as well, highly recommend a trip here.
just go.... An oasis of beauty and freshness in the busy and warm city. Food was excellent. We also recommend the museum, small but very beautiful collection.

Very Pretty.... This was a nice thing to do for a few hours. If you are a major fan of YSL then you will love it as there is a memorial for him there and posters he used to send out yearly (very cool)... Other than that... Its a load of cactus plants in a square surrounded but Blue and Yellow painted pots and fences... We went around 11am and it was heaving so couldnt really enjoy "the beauty" of it all. We did have coffee in the little court yard cafe and that was very pleasant. Id say its worth a morning visit - go early though!

A lovely oasis in Marrakech. It is smaller than expected, but no less lovely. We spent a relaxing few hours wandering in the garden, having lunch at the (admittedly overpriced) cafe and exploring the Berber museum and gift shop. Very interesting the see YSL's influence on the area and vice versa.

Beautiful. Despite a major attraction, which will clearly get busy with tourists, it was still enjoyable and beautiful with lots of plants and flowers, and of course stunning colours. Well worth visiting.
saint laurent morocco dream. the cactus garden is great and we found quality artisanal objects in the boutique good taste and quality ,

Oasis in Marrakech. YSL and his partner have left a legacy that all can enjoy. Initially I felt that there was too much bamboo but it grows on you and the cacti and succulents are fantasticDon't miss the Berber museum within the grounds it is well worth the extra few dollarsWell worth the visit

A pretty garden. This is a pretty place to spend an hour relaxing. I enjoyed the Yves Saint Laurent display etc. It is a small enough garden but that suited me and lots of places to sit in the shade. It is worth seeing if you have the time but I wouldnt see it an absolute essential place to visit.
well worth a visit. interesting specimen plants, shady paths, pools and an amazing studio painted a really vivid blue. A good place to pass the heat of the day
Stunning. Beautiful gardens, stunning colours. Well worth the visit, more expensive than other museum spots but I presume this is due to the designer name. Nice mosaics too.
A visual treat. A really superb garden of cacti and succulents which are mixed with great colour containers and gentle paths. It is a visual treat and worthy of Yves st Laurent.

Lovely gardens in the middle of Marrakesh.... Came here in the middle of our horse and carriage ride. Really loved these gardens in the middle of Marrakesh. So well maintained and cared for. Get there early before the coach loads arrive. We were leaving at about 10.30am and they had just turned up. Only a small site so imagine very crowded with a couple of coach loads of tourists. Had to laugh though...We asked a member of staff to take a photo of us and he took quite a few....We were well impressed until he asked for money and when we looked at our photos we were behind foliage in most of them ....So be warned!!

Yves Saint Laurent. It is really relaxing place, where you can spend you time. In really hot Marrakesh it is small oasis of beautiful plants from all over the world-especially from South America. It Is not really big. There is no something unreally special but the colour of the buildings is awesome and the atmosphere..good place to be in

Number 1? Really ?. Have to say this place was a big disappointment. There are some amazing gardens in Marrakech of which most are free. This one wouldn't even be in the top 10 of the ones I'd seen. Want to see one where you feel you could get lost in and that it's made just for you then go to La Mamounia. It's free though I would recommend getting a drink at churchills bar.

Lots of trees and not much else.... So we came here as we saw the good reviews and were recommended to come by our Riad. If you like trees and cactus plants then you'll love it. If you like a bit of colour, somewhere that's not rammed full of tourists, and somewhere with a bit of space then this isn't the place for you. Thankfully we were able to walk to the gardens from our Riad. Had we gone out of our way to come here we'd have felt very short changed.

relaxing oasis. The Jardin Majorelle was like a beautiful and relaxing oasis in the hot city of Marrakech! The blue colors and all the green and relaxing paths in the gardens was a perfect and lovely experience on a sunny afternoon. It was one of the final stops on our four day adventure from Fes to Marrakech with Said from ERG MOROCCO TOUR, After seeing Fes, the mountains, the desert and the huge dunes and the camels, I wasn't expecting such an European but also very Berber place, and our guide showed us the little Berber (Amazigh) culture museum and also the shop, which, be warned, is pretty expensive! Definitely a must-see stop for anyone in Marrakech and a perfect place to relax.
Sweet retreat. Go there early in the morning to avoid the crowds, gorgeous and very well designed. Can t wait to see the new museum open!
Peaceful and very pretty. It was peaceful and very pretty. I loved the overall appearance and appreciated the calmness of the gardens. Quite expensive to enter however it's a must see in Marrakech!
Nice gardens. A welcome respite from the heat of the day to a well laid out garden. A nice tribute to Yves St Laurent.

more tourists than plants. Hell lot of people, even queuing outside. Price for the smallish overcrowded garden is ridiculous: 70 dirham plus 30 dirham Berber museum (which is in any case better than the tiny garden showing off people instead of cactusses. Maybe the best thing is the shop (the shop!) I read somewhere Majorelle is a nice "oasis". Are you kidding me?

Oasis in a Hectic mad Marrakesh. Marrakesh is one mad hectic place but just outside the walls is an oasis of peace and tranquillity .This is a fabulous to see as it is cool quiet and very peaceful place to stroll round with various plants & pools of water and fountains.There is a courtyard cafe which is quite peaceful with a small fountain where you can eat and drink in the coolness of the courtyard.This is a place to visit just to unwind from the madness.

Take a book as it;s not that big. It was a pleasant place, worth a visit if you have some free time,but we walked across Marrakech to find it and found it to be a little small. Maybe take a book and a few hours so you can just sit back and soak up the atmosphere. It's all not for profit as well.

Fantastic Gardens!. First place we visited in Marrakesh, and we can definitely recommend it. There is an amazing diversity of plants, particularly weird and wonderful cacti and succulents. Also, it is a nice easy intro to the place as not too busy and the plants create a slightly cooler microclimate. Yves Saint Laurents blue house is also pretty cool, and the Berber museum is fascinating. Don't forget to enjoy a nice and relaxing mint tea in the cafe!
Beautiful plants. There is an amazing range of plants. The garden is very interesting. The museum isn't worth the time to be honest. 70 mad for the garden and 30 mad for the museum.

Not as good as expected. Not as impressed by the Majorelle gardens as I expected to be. The General space was pretty small, and the planting was nice but hardly magnificent. I think we are blessed in the UK with some of the best gardens in the world, so not so easy to impress.Quite expensive as well.

Beautiful Gardens . Stunning gardens and informative museum. Definitely worth a visit. The cafe is also very good for a drink and quick bite afterwards. We walked from the Medina, it was very easy to find.

Stellar. If you only visit one of Marrakech's attractions, make it this one.One of the most beautiful gardens we have ever visited - and we visit gardens wherever we go.Beautifully designed and maintained. Possibly the painter ,Jacques Majorelle's masterpiece.Rescued and added to by Yves St Laurent and his partner.Apart from the beautiful plants, there is a wonderful Berber Museum.And Marorelle Blue! The most brilliant blue imaginable.We were lucky enough to find a source for the base - thanks to the owner of our Riad..
Avoid it nothing there. I went there because of trip advisor and shouldn't have. This place is small and doesn't have anything special at all. Seen better gardens in UK. Its very expensive too!
Definitely worth a visit... Definitely worth a visit,its an amazing colorful garden but very busy with other visitors. There are prices for tourists and different prices for locals..

My Blue Heaven. These exceptional gardens are not to be missed, evening if you consider gardening not to be your thing! Created in 1931 by the French artist Jaques Majorelle, the house was later bought by Yves St Laurent and became his hideaway and favorite place to work and relax. The house is painted in an extraordinarily vibrant indigo blue and the walkways and garden pots are painted to match making it a small "Blue Heaven". We were taken to the gardens by horse carriages, which were an extremely comfortable ride and a very good way to see the city, but we couldn't help feeling sorry for the horses who had to compete against thundering great lorries on the main roads.
Lovely. Very well organized and laid out garden.Nice cafe, and v good museum.Ysl memorial could be bigger and have some more info on his life.A nice 2 hours.
Relaxing and enjoyable. Beautiful way to escape the busy market place in the Medina. About $10 to get in. But the garden was beautiful and relaxing. Short walk from Medina area
Beautiful garden. The best place to visit in Marrakech! It s a real heaven within Marrakesh. The garden can be visited at anytime. Always a pleasure to see it with different day light.

Electric Blue Dream Garden. Exquisite collection of plants from many parts of the world. Loved walking the grounds and learning the history. Reasonably priced entry. The meal at the cafe was very very good! The gift shop is overpriced, but good shopping across the street.

Disappointing gardens but interesting Berber museum. We found the gardens underwhelming, smaller than expected and lacking plants with lots of colour. Lots of nice green tropical plants and trees, but all very similar. They also get very busy, so visit earlier or later in the day to enjoy a more peaceful experience. The Berber museum in the gardens was much more interesting and was well worth the extra entrance charge.
Wonderful! . Well worth the trip. Exotic plants from around the world. Beautiful landscape. Nice shady covered walkways, and great Berber museum.

Find better places to visit . Seriously, how is this #1 place in Marrakech? Go visit Medina, take a tour of the city and skip this place. Place is super small. Took us less than 10 minutes to walk inside. They do have plants from around the world. If you came to Morocco to see plants, then certainly visit this place.

A feast for the eyes. The Marjorelle Gardens are truly magnificent. The colours and silhouettes of the various cacti, palms and bushes work beautifully against the backdrop of primary coloured pots, gazebos, bridges and summer houses throughout these magical gardens. It's a definite must-see in Marrakech and provides the perfect canvas for some truly magnificent photo opportunities.

Different scene . The garden is beautiful and very quiet. Although the garden is quite repetitive it has an interesting museum and shops also. It was a nice visit. It's 100dh for the garden and museum.
Lovely place!. I absolutely loved the electric blue & bright yellow paint that stood out from this beautiful garden. Worth a visit!

Tranquil but not much else. The loveliest bit about this garden is hearing all the different birds singing. It is beautiful but not mind blowingly so, although there are some interesting plants and it's fascinating that this was once someone's home.

beautiful oasis in Marrackech. No wonder why YSL and his partner worked so hard to restore and maintain this place. This garden is simply stunning, once inside we felt the cool and calming effect of the place very tranquil which was a great break from the busy medina. The musuem also offers a rich insight into the life and culture of the Bterber people. The 10 euro entrance fee is worth it.

Beautiful. Superb gardens to visit. Spoilt a little by the people who just seem to want to take photos on their selfie sticks with little concern for others who also want to take the odd photo. But if you wait around it clears before the next trip arrives.Take some water - it was seriously warm. You must go though!
Beautiful garden in Marrakech. Lovely gardens with many photo ops and many varieties of catch. I enjoyed the Galeries Love aalong with Yves Saint Laurent posters.

Stunning. Simply stunning - a little block of cool and colourful heaven in a great city that has its fair share of areas that aren't....maybe as nice! Wonderful plants and a must visit even if you only have a few hours to spare.

40 Years Of Love Created This Garden. A man took 40 years of his life and tremendous love to build this remarkable garden. There are so many spots to stop and linger here. Well worth a visit if you are in Morocco!

Dont forget the museum! . Overall very nice, but its much the same throughout. Must see is the museum, as very interesting history. The cafe offers good food with nice surroundings, also birds add a nice touch.

Lovely gardens. This was only a 15 minute walk from our Riad. On entering, you just felt the noise from the main road ebb away. So peaceful and relaxing. The shade from the trees and bamboo made is so cool to walk around. They had a huge collection of cacti which were in all shapes and sizes mostly from Mexico. the memorial to YSL was very plain and simple. He had donated money to set up the gardens just outside of the Medina.It was a great way to spend just over an hour before we headed to the Souks.

Small but interesting. The gardens are fairly small but it is a cool, calming place to spend a couple of hours away from the rush of the medina and traffic in Marrakech. The cafe is a lovely place to sit and take in the many different people visiting the gardens. It was interesting to see the Yves St Laurent aspect and memorial to him. Not a lot to see other than those mentioned except for the Islamic Museum which was interesting but again small.

Very well kept botanical garden.. Visited during our recent trip to Marrakech. The gardens are very well kept and provide plenty of shade from the hot sun. There is and abundance of cacti as well as numerous other plants and trees. The garden has many water features providing a home to aquatic life and the use of Majorelle Blue everywhere creates a very cooling effect. The house in the gardens was the home of Yves Saint Laurent while he was in Marrakech and has been well preserved it now houses a museum the on site shop sells quality products including the stunning Majorelle blue paint. There is also a beautiful restaurant serving fairly priced good food. well worth a visit take your time , maybe indulge in a spot of lunch or just soak up the atmosphere.

Small but amazing . The space is very nice with a small museum that you have to pay for to enter, its a garden with allot of plants from all around the world, not a very big one but yet its a different activity to do in Marrakech.

A must do for all visitors to Marrakech. In the north of the city, this tranquil walled garden is a must, stunning Palm trees bamboo and cacti, ponds and paths, the shelter and shade is so peaceful when compared to the big square. 70 dirhams entry is more than worth it. We spent nearly 2 hours there but is more likely an hour long activity.

This is a must to pay visit ..not to missed. Amazing and lovely colourful totally relaxed walking around. There have lovely cosy outdoor/indoor cafe and also shops are good too,. Weather get too hot but good lots of shades there to cool yourself down. advice go there 1st thing in morning it's more quiter than rest of day.
Nice stopover. It's a nice little getaway garden if you have the time, it takes a maximum of 30 minutes to see the whole area. It is well maintained and the variety of flora are nice.
Paradise. Lovely well maintained garden with many types of plants, trees, cactus of all type and size, a walk on the garden is a wanderful way to start your day.
best garden in Marrakech. ic an recommend this as best garden in Marrakech. perfect for enjoying time, relax with family, beloved ones. Magic place .. we felt so happy here.
Garden Tour of Marrakech. The gardens are so different from english gardens, but still very interesting to see as also art work displayed

Over-rated and expensive . Went today after seeing it as number 1 attraction, hugely disappointed. Expensive to get in, very small, YSL memorial a total let down (random pillar in middle of concrete block?), could be done in 15 minutes but we dragged it out getting into the "Love Museum", library and over priced shop which again, were a total let down. Whole place is tiny, if you like pretty colours and want away from the hustle of the Medina fine but I wouldn't recommend it and sure wouldn't make it the number 1 spot to visit!

New Town Must. Having visited Marrakech perhaps more than 20 times and having a special fondness for the medina I have to say there are some special places in the new town. Jardin Marjorelle is top of the list. Visited the first time in 2003 we "call in" to the Jardin every 2nd or 3rd visit to Marrakech. The history of the place in interesting and the miniture Islamic museum within is especially noteworthy. Surrounding the Jardin there are now some very nice shops and cafes making a trip to Jardin Majorelle a must.

A Must See. If you're visiting Marrakesh then this is one place you must visit. It's a beautiful garden to enjoy and relax in - plenty of photo opportunities, and take a sketch book if you like painting.Designed by the French artist Jacques Majorelle in the 1920/30's, it was owned by Yves St Laurent since 1980, and where his ashes were scattered when he died in 2008. It also houses The garden also houses the interesting Islamic Art Museum and includes North African textiles from Saint-Laurent's personal collection as well as ceramics, jewelry, and paintings by Majorelle.If you like to spend a couple of hours relaxing in a beautiful garden then this is one of the best you'll find anywhere.
Beautiful oasis in a hot Marrakech. Gorgeous gardens with vibrant colours. Cool and relaxing location away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. 70DH entry fee

Amazing oasis. The gardens are absolutely beautiful. The contrast between the lush greenery and the deep blue made for amazing photographs. It was a bit further out than we had expected, but well worth the trip. The gardens provided a much needed break from the heat and hustle and bustle of the medina.

A lovely garden. After the hustle of Marrakech it was lovely to walk to the Jardin Marjorelle. It is indeed a peaceful oasis in a mad town. Lots of people were there with us but because of the layout of the garden it was easy in some places to capture the serenity which surely the garden was originally intending to evoke. The plants are beautifully looked after & the garden well maintained. We had lunch in the restaurant, which was not amazing but entirely adequate. I was glad to have visited the garden.

Beautiful gardens. Tempting gift shop.. Beautifully kept gardens with incredible plants. Pierre Berger and Yves Saint Laurent's legacy. Beautifully curated mini-museum dedicated to the various Moroccan cultures. Amazing bookshop, incredibly expensive gift shop. Wonderful stop in Marrakech. Worth the visit.

Beautiful. Well worth the visit.. Yves Saint laurent lived here before he died. You have to pay a small fee to get in. You also have to pay to get in the museum . Fantastic. You wouldn't think something that beautiful was situated where it is.

Nice place to visit. Nice and clean. Very sophisticated atmosphere. We can find many different species of plants which they have special attention to take care of each of them. Very tide place, well organised and not expensive. I love it.
COLOUR, COLOUR AND COLOUR. I greatly enjoyed strolling through this beautifully laid out garden and the small berber museum is well worth seeing.
Worth going. Beautiful well kept garden, really nice! It is a magical place in the middle of Marrakech, we weren't expecting it. Go early cause q can be long

Amazing Gardens. A beautiful place, the colours and plants just take you away. A well arranged path guides you around what are quite small gardens, what they lack in size they make up for in style. A must see.

Beautiful, calm & cool.. Although quite a way from the medina ( we got a taxi) the gardens were well worth a visit. We loved the colour scheme of bright orange, yellow & blue pots. The cacti & palms cast amazing shadows on the gravel. Lovely,small cafe.

Amazing!!!. absolutey lovely scenary must see in Marrakech
Garden that has everything you can imagine.Just beautiful
What a fabulous place!!!!!. Such a fabulous place. 1000% a must visit if travelling to Marrakech. Although can get quite busy so maybe try to visit late afternoon.
Getting out of the medina. Nice, well-kept place. Not huge but will keep you occupied for an hour or so. Various spots for photo-taking. About 50dh from Jemaa El' Fnaa by taxi.

Good and wurth to see.. After a morning long walking or calecehe tour in this exotic city, his is the sherry on top of the cake. Great sights, nice museum of the Berbere art, nice samples of cactus and a bar for a tea or a refreshment. I think this is not to miss spot while in
Marrakech.

Garden of love❤️. A beautifully designed garden by the famous Yves Saint Laurent. A couple of hours is all you need though to fully appreciate what's on offer. A lovely cafe is also situated on the grounds. Never seen such a beautiful garden before. There's a shop on the grounds where you can purchase a silk scarf for €300! If you fancy! Taxi ride back to the medina was DH20.
NICE TO PARE COUPLE HOURS THERE. Small but nice garden where you will see Cactus, bamboo and palm trees only beside Y.S.L memorial..little overrated but ok to spare 2 hour there
absolutely beautiful. This peaceful garden is well worth visiting. It comes as a total contrast to the hustle and bustle of the Medina. well worth the rather hefty entrance fee.

One of the must see of Marrakesh. A lovely place, beautiful garden and not too crowded in September when we went. The house in itself can not been visited, however the Berber exhibition is excellent. Also worth stopping by the little cafe to rest far from the noise of the city!
Botanical leisure. After the hustle & bustle of Marrakesh, this stylish green haven is an excellent respite area. Cool, green, beautiful and less African then European, it's really worth a visit.

A relaxing afternoon out. Enjoyed visiting the Berber Museum - some fascinating information in there - for me the gardens were a bit of a let down - the colours are beautiful but I was expecting a lot more - though still a lovely afternoon - especially if you're wanting to take some time out.

Incredicle - Silent and Different.. Before i went to there, "why we go ?" after that "incredible , here is awesome" ; Jardin Majorelle is out the Walls of Marrakech, but you can walk from Jamaa Al-Fna. So many plants and Majorelle Blue were welcomed that designed by Yves Saint Laurent. Also dont forget to visit Yves's shop and art gallery.

Relaxing escape from heat and noise of the medina. Badly located but a welcome escape.
Definitely worth a visit and the enclosed Berber museum is the best artefact collection I came across in the city!

Surprise Peaceful Oasis. When you visit the Majorelle gardens the first thing you feel is surprise. Set in the bustle of the city of Marrakesh the gardens are amazingly tranquil and cool. Take a stroll around the paths and admire the exotic plants and ponds full of fish, enjoy the Berber museum which is an attraction in it's own right, and then take some refreshment in the on-site café. This is a delightful way to spend a couple of hours in the heat of the day.

Beautiful and tranquil. This was a haven of tranquility in the craziness of Marrakesh. Beautiful gardens where the sounds of the city just drift away. Lovely restaurant also. Nice way to spend couple of hours on a hot afternoon.

Beautiful gardens and a lovely Berber museum. Beautiful and tranquil. I'd suggest going early or late to avoid the buses! It is possible to find some quiet areas BUT it is small and so it is busy. A must for any Marrakech trip - easy to spend an hour or two here. I would suggest buying the extra supplement for the Berber museum - which is well worth visiting. (It is possible to buy this on the door too).

Like an oasis within a crazy city. Arriving in this magical place was like arriving in an oasis. I liked Marrakech big time but really enjoyed to be able to escape it's noise for a while. Such a lovely place!

It was refreshing to be outside and close to nature.. It was a garden dedicated to Yves Saint Laurent a french haute couturier. It had a few highlights like the patio with colourful flooring and benches where one could sit and rest. There were bamboo trees and date palms to look at. The garden was well kept.One can visit and buy from YSL collection of clothes, if one can afford it. Good idea to take a camera with you. It took us maybe half a hour to tour the place.

Lovely setting in the hassle and bustle of a busy city. This is a superb garden. A lot of thought has gone into the set up of the walk ways and plants. So peaceful cool and quiet. Ideal photo opportunities. Striking colours contrast of blue . 2 gift shops inside, one selling wonderful books and postcards, the other more house hold items. There is a museum to visit an extra charge. You can spend as long as you wish here. The cacti are amazing, well established and happy where they are height and flowering too.
Haven amongst the mayhem. The cost has gone up recently so we were told but at 100dhr for the gardens and the museum I think is was good value

Worth the visit. In walking distancefrom most of the town and medine. Try to visit off hours: early or late. Do NOT skip the museum. Incredible. One of the best displays we have ever met all over the world. The chick and expensive shop also worth visit to enjoy the elegant maechendise for sale.
Majorelle was beautiful. Great to see and walk through. A must do while in Marrakech. Any trip there will be with your time. Does not take long so make sure to have other activities planned after.
Lovely place to wander. Lovely place to walk around or sit and relax. Strikingly beautiful house painted blue and plenty of things to see including frogs and turtles
Must see. We visited in March this year. Absolutely stunning, peaceful and a great respite from the sun. Fantastic plants and colours. well worth a visit.

Nice but not exceptional. A beautiful walled garden I'm sure designed as a tranquil space in a busy city. We only stayed 30 minutes and it was probably the most expensive entrance fee of the trip, never the less worth a visit.
Ideal to relax. If you feel tired after a day spent at negotiating with Moroccan sales people, this is the ideal place to take a break, enjoy the buildings and the plants and take a lot of nice pics.

worth a visit. We looked at things to do in Marrakech,and this attraction was one of them recommended so we went.Took a local taxi to get there rather than join any organised trip.The entrance fee was 70 Dirham for tourist a bit cheaper for locals.Allow about 1 to 2 hours.This is a garden of a Villa full of lots of trees and shrubs and water fetchers, A very peaceful and tranquil environment in a hectic and bustling city.Ideal place to sit on a bench and watch the people doing the same thing as yourself.

Spectacular garden. This was one of my most favorite places to visit during my trip to Marrakech. With temperatures of around 37degree it was blissful to wonder around beneath the canopy of trees looking at the various flowers and cactus plants. We saw frogs and turtles in the ponds and I was thrilled to visit the YSL memorial. We had lunch in the restaurant afterwards and while being slightly more expensive than the restaurants in the city, the food was fabulous!
Very Relaxing. This is a very chilled place in a very hectic city - a perfect get away from it! Impressive plants and a good restaurant. You'll need to take a taxi there and back.

Plant life in the midst of desert life. On upon entering the garden, there is a ticket booth to purchase tickets. Make sure to arrive at a low time during the day otherwise the line will be very long. Once we bought out tickets make sure you take a receipt. The woman we purchased our tickets from didnt give us a receipt so when we went to enter the garden we had to return to the ticket booth where an argument ensued over the "lost" tickets. The garden is well suited for a distraction from the business of Marrakech life. The garden is beautiful with various plants. The garden is outside so make sure to wear comfortable shoes. Located inside the garden is the love gallery where some drawings of Yves Saint Laurent New Years Eve are located. Throughout the garden there are two gifts shops. One is the main gift shop and the other is just a small gift shop as you exit the museum. Also, within the park is a free museum that displays native Beber artifacts, clothing and intricate jewlery. Although there is no photography allowed with in the Berber displays my favorite was the jewlery. The room that houses the jewlery is made to represent a dessert night and is complete with sand and stars. Overall, it was a relaxing enjoyable experience.
prettier in pictures. Just ok - crowded, not much to see, gardens are not spectacular. Go if you have a free hour or two to spare, but don't make a point of it.

Stunning. Very very very beautiful gardens. Ideal to sit down and relax with a goo book in your hands.
Definitely worth a visit.

Average.... The colors, the garden, and in general is really beautifull...
But, you can see the all place in 20m, and they ask 70Drh to enter the place...
Cooling break. Easy to find, a relaxing way to spend a couple off hours away from the madness off marrakech. Recommend

YSL fans and botanists only need apply!. For fashion students or Yves Saint Laurent followers I'm sure that a visit here whilst in Marrakech would be a must. Similarly for keen botanists I'm sure some of the plants would be delightful to look at. If like me however you don't fall into either of these categories it's probably not worth the effort. It's a relatively small garden with little to interest the normal tourist looking for 'somewhere to visit'.

Tranquil gardens, interesting Berber museum, lovely courtyard cafe. This isn't terribly large, it was pretty full of other tourists and it's certainly one of the most expensive sights in Marrakech. That said, it was very diverting for an hour. There are some lovely ponds - one in particular is covered in lilly pads and looks like a Monet painting. They have fish and turtles in the ponds, and they are fun to watch. The Berber museum is really interesting. It costs a further entrance fee, but it tells you a lot about their everyday way of life. The cafe is sweet, I recommend avoiding the little table all the way over on the right under the tree. It looks inviting, but birds poo on unsuspecting visitors (yes, I was one of them!) There is an indoor section that is air conditioned, but people were smoking in there. I would have loved more explanation about the plants we were looking at. The bamboo is amazing and so are all the cacti, but there were loads of plants that I couldn't identify, and some signs would have helped. Overall it was a nice visit, a little different to the hustle and bustle of Marrakech streets - although as soon as you leave you are pounced on to take a taxi!
Beautiful Oasis. We visited the gardens at around 9am and we had the whole place to ourselves. It was amazing the colours, plants and buildings. Was very peaceful and beautiful well worth a visit.

An oasis inside Marrakech!. Even if you are not into plants, you NEED to go!This is like paradise inside the city! You can feel the peacefull atmosphere from the first step inside.All the trees and nature and birds singing it is just so relaxing!You can find a lot of type of flora and it is so nicely buit together!The shop is WAY TO EXPENSIVE, but also it has Yves Saint Laurent name on it.

Fabulous. Really exciting gardens and very much the European ideal of living in Morocco. The city is so grungy and a very real, current African, Muslim city that while I found our urban visit interesting, this was the one very idealize spot we went to. It is truly perfect.
wonderfull nature in Marrakech. excellent place to visit: one hour is enough to experience the atmosphere created by YSLan oasis of green and silence nearby the hart of Marrakech

Serene experience out of the hustle and bustle.. You step into an oasis of calm and cool with trickling water and stunninig colours, the Yves saint Laurent blue sets the scene,with Bougainvillea flowers of every shade, the museum in the gardens is well worth the visit. It is the combination of water flowers and colours that make it memorable.
Gardens with style and atmosphere. Garden is quiet small for the price you pay but the atmosphere and design are amazing. Definietely recommend!
Beautiful, relaxing gardens. Really worth going. The gardens are beautiful. I would advise that you leave this as the last trip to do because it is a really relaxing place to visit.

Gorgeous spot to relax. Marrakech can be a little crazy. Stepping into these gardens instantly transports you to a refuge away from the street vendors shouting, scooters, and general insanity that is walking around the city. YSL's blue paint is breathtakingly beautiful- I physically could not stop taking photos. The gardens are very quiet & calming and would be a great place to just sit and relax if you've got the time.This is what I was looking forward to most in Marrakech (besides the food and shopping) and they did not disappoint!

It's nice but not spectacular.. You can go around the Jardins and see the different types of plants. It's nice, but very expensive (70 dirhams per person plus 20/30 of taxi each way to get there) just for the gardens (the Berber Museum is other 30 Dh and you can pay inside). You can make nice pictures though. I would save my money and time and visitsomething else or spend more time in the Medina. But well, it's famous so it's not a total loss.

Oasis in the Marrakesh. Beautiful gardens and Berber museum. This is a quick spot to visit and at the recommendation of our concierge went when they opened to beat the tour groups (it was quiet and we were able to enjoy the ground by doing this).

Peaceful and Beautiful. This is a beautiful and very tranquil place to visit. Even going round at a slow pace, it's not huge so don't expect to spend the day there. It's absolutely worth a visit though and very fairly priced. The marjorelle blue is stunning and the cafe was very quaint with very tasty food and friendly staff.

Peace in a busy City!. One attraction not to miss, priced at MAD100.00 for entrance to both the gardens and the museum, it really is wonderful value for money. Beautifully laid out, even on a busy day there is still a very peaceful atmosphere to the whole garden. Worth stopping for coffee at the café, not the cheapest but good quality, served by friendly staff. The shop is really lovely with gift ideas you wouldn't normally find elsewhere, not too badly priced.Can understand why you would go back more than once if the opportunity arose.

A most beautiful garden. This is a magnificent garden right in the middle of Marrakech. It also includes a Berber museum (at a small extra charge) which is well worth a visit. Tip: go there early before the crowds get there!
Amazing place. Amazing place! well worth a visit a lot to see and take in very peacfull place for being so close to the chaos of marakesh

Felt like heaven after a crazy walk on the streets. I've visited a lot of gardens in Europe, but this one went straight to my heart. It is exquisite and intimate, very well taken care of, with a variety of plants and beautiful majorelle-blue painted walls. After a crazy walk on the streets of Marrakech, I step in and it instantly feels like heaven. I just sat on a bench and relaxed and enjoyed the view for a full half hour. I then started visiting the garden, going through every little alley, discovering every hidden corner. It really is beautiful. I also visited the Berber Museum, which was small, but impressive. I didn't quite understood why the guardians asked to see the inside of my purse (luckily I kept my two boxes of tampons in a separate bag for which they didn't show any interest), but as they talked to me in a very respectful manner, I accepted to swim down the stream (I then saw that I wasn't the only one whose insides of her purse weren't a secret anymore). I finished the visit and went straight to that little cafe, where I ordered tea and lemonade. All in all, a beautiful, not-to-be-missed sight.

4.5 Actually. This is a beautiful garden. The entryway is pretty but the real highlight of the trip through the many examples of plant species is the cactus garden toward the end of the path. This is a popular place so go early to get the nice cool air and relative privacy.

Beautiful and Relaxing. The late fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent purchased and preserved this spectacular garden. Even the road leading up to it and named after YSL was lovely, lined with quality souvenir shops and artisan boutiques. The entry fee to the garden was less than the equivalent of $1. There were idyllic walkways through a large cacti area, past a lilly pond with turtles, palm trees, flowers, whimsical pagodas and the YSL memorial. A Berber Museum was also on location (we didn't go in), as well as a boutique, book store and an exhibition room lined with YSL's annual Love sketches. A beautiful way to spend a morning or afternoon away from the crazy traffic.

Beautiful spot to spend a couple of hours!. Well worth dropping in to when in Marrakech. A slow wander around this beautiful walled garden provides a welcome respite from the sometimes frenetic atmosphere of this city. Not too big and well run by considerate staff who are keen to make your visit enjoyable and engaging; all clearly enjoy working in this peaceful and inspiring living work of garden art. There is also a fantastic cafe inside with a lovely traditional courtyard, good menu and well priced. Highly recommend. Although you will leave wanting to completely redo your own outdoor area at home in deep blue! An added bonus is the handful of boutique shops just across the road from the entrance, well worth looking in.

Relaxation at the Jardin Majorelle. Loved this excursion. I'm usually not big on plants and gardens but this one was worth it. They have different plants, flowers, trees from all over the world. They have tributes to Yves Saint Laurent. A must see if you are going to Marrakech. I have been both times that I visited Marrakech.

Stunning gardens.. A beautiful oasis in the middle of Marrakech. When you want to wind down there are plenty of benches to sit and admire the beautiful trees and plants. There's a lovely cafe there that serves delicious ice cream on a hot day.
Well worth a visit if you are in Marrakech. We easily walked here from the Medina area and loved this peaceful idyll away from the madness that you can fine in the main square.
Wonderful City OF Marrakech. Well worth the visit as these gardens are so well kept.We also did the evening trip in a Horse drawn carriage and then into themarket area and this was very interesting

Beautiful. Every time I go to Marakech I always head back to Le Jardin Marjorelle. I never get bored of this beautiful, relaxing and inspirational garden. A little piece of heaven. Lovely cool cafe with nice friendly staff. The gift shops offer items not found elsewhere in Marrakech. Don't be afraid to buy the paint, they tape up the lids securely and are quite safe packed within your check in baggage.
Peace of mind. This is a must see in Marrakech. Spend the afternoon walking in the shade through this wonderful garden. The Berber museum is also worth it. It is small but very interesting.

Not as large or as attractive as reviews suggest. 100d entry for the gardens and Berber museum which is quite expensive by Moroccan standards. The gardens are not large but attractive being principally cacti and palms. The museum is similarly small with Berber artifacts from everyday use to jewellery and examples of clothing. Descriptions in Arabic and French alongside exhibits but with a different pamphlet in each room in English you to use while in that room. OK when in Marrakech but certainly not something you would travel for.
Garden of paradise. Simply beautiful! It was a nice break from the heat and the crowds. We spent a leisurely hour and a half here. Highly recommend!

A blue paradise in the bustle of a busy city. a tranquil walk around a varied collection of cacti, plants and trees all bathed in a beautiful blue glow of yves St Laurent's signature colour. very inspiring garden for those of you who have photographic skills. we managed to get some really nice pictures on a sunny day and while away a few hours away from the bussle of the souks.
Amazing cacti. Well worth a trip, the gardens were spotless & totally different to what you would expect in the heart of a city

Pleasant escape from rush in medina. Jardin Majorelle worth a visit if you are tired from bargaining in noisy medina, but it is suprisingly small and nothing special at all. In fact it is quite pricey (70 dirhams) and rather crowdy, so that if you decide to go, the early morning visit would be perhaps more peaceful.
Nice Cacti. I'm not necessarily a massive garden fan but this one is pretty cool, lots of bright colours, weird looking cacti and it uses the plants really well to frame views within the garden.

Great with kids. A real oasis with small kids, beautiful colours and plants to study and discuss as a family. Perfect on a hot day with a lot of shade cover. We enjoyed the visit and there were plenty of taxis to take us back to our Riad afterwards. The gardens are not big but we really enjoyed a lunch and mint tea at the restaurant for a reasonable price.

Beautiful experience. Jardin Majorelle is a special experience for everyone visiting Marrakech. Harmony and tranquility rule throught the whole garden which is very calming with its water, range of greens accented with sparks of Majorelle Blue. It is such a heavenly place and it's hard to imagine that it's only few meters from hot and busy streets. I strongly recommend visiting Jardin Majorelle. There is a beautiful restaurant inside and the food is very tasty.
Beautiful . Jardin majorelle is very beautiful You can stay all the Day to relax......All the wall are very beautiful ..

Beautiful Gardens just outside the city walls. We walked to Jardin Majorelle from our Riad, we followed a map and still managed to get lost as the gardens are not visible from the main road and there are a very limited number of signs. The gardens themselves are lovely with plant pots, fences and building decorated in Majorelle Blue interspersed amongst the trees and plants. A lovely relaxing way to spend an hour.

Majestically Moroccan. An absolutely gorgeous oasis on the edge of the City. Not cheap - at 70 dnh per adult - but is an absolute must for any trip to Marrakech. Little meandering paths take you through the lush Moroccan gardens with ponds, fountains and flower adourned gazebos. Brightly couloured plant pots, mosaic paths and cactii all ead you around the bright blue museum building. Perfect setting to soak up the sun and enjoy this shrine to Yves San Lauren!
That was amazing. I love gardens and flowers since childhood. This garden is so interesting and full of beauty. Perfect and ideal place for relax.

Cool blue chilled garden. A lovely little oasis in the centre of Marrakech. Spend an hour wandering around these fascinating cactus gardens. But go in the morning to avoid crowds and the intense heat of the day.
Pretty but small. Nice colorful garden but I wouldn't rate it as the number 1 thing to do in Marrakech. We cancelled some plans to go there and we could have easily skipped it
Eye candy. Beautiful colors and a great history lesson on the Berber natives as well as all the unique plants in the YSL memorial
Gardens Beautiful and Museum Insightful. Loved the gardens which are smaller than expected. Do not miss out on the museum about Berber Culture. It was really interesting with some great artefacs.

Beautiful Gardens. We visited here as part of a tour organised by Thompson's. The gardens were absolutely stunning, there is a Berber Museum within the gardens which was an additional charge of 30 dirhams (£2.10) but it was definitely worth going into. The Gardens have been maintained to such a high standard and the colours are amazing.
cactus garden. what a beatiful place not to miss . it is crowded in the morning so try it in the afternoon . different kind of plants are in good condition . drinks are a little bit expensive there .

Not quite as expected. This was recmmended and i was looking forward to it. i went on a reiny day which made it seem a little grey. Parts of the gardens were nice but i have seen smaller and larger gardens which had more variety in terms of plants.

Nothing amazing. I visited in may 2015,so it was warm enough to see all the plants...but i was disapointed.The garden has great potencial,but isn't cured enough.The entrance fee is ok...7.5 euros,i could say is fare enough.If you pass trough marrakech it is a necessary stop...but don't wait to see paradise on earth

A well tended oasis. A visit well worth making , the layout is good utilising many opportunities to create vistas and features which is hard in essentially such relatively small garden . The typical use of water and hard features gives the skeleton to the garden and many photo opportunities are offered as a result. The planting is not hugely varied but the scale of some of the species more than makes up for that. I found some of the eye wateringly expensive retail opportunities a little incongruous and the prices in the cafe were higher than in most places but both of those need not spoil an otherwise excellent visit. Good to see cactus collections still going strong and walking through 10m high bamboo is a rarity. Maintenance standards are very high and those with less mobility should visit as the paths are very well maintained and easily navigable. Operators ought to be aware that traders on the exit from the old city are regularly telling people on foot the garden is closed for a holy day ....it's not , so just keep going !!

quiet, peace & love. yes it's a place to discover love hidding over the trees coming from all over the world.. we registered a little video for a turtle thats was diving woth her child in a little pool .. really it was amazing ..
An oasis of peace. This is a must see if your in this city, many years since last in Marrakech the addition of the museum gives a great insight into the Berber traditions of this country
Nice bright gardens . Well worth the walking into the bustling new town and to visit these gardens. Amazing colours, fascinating museum and very relaxing

Mesmerising garden!. I fell in love with Marrakesh after visiting this garden. It is just so beautiful! Its not very far from Jemaa el-fna,around 15-20mins walk. You could easily find it by using offline google map.
Tranquil & picturesque . Nice little walk around the gardens, looking at all the different types of plants xIt's nice to come here as it is so calm peaceful and cool x a photographer's heaven x
Beautiful. A definite highlight of our trip to Marrakesh, beautiful surroundings - photos don't do it justice (although I definitely took enough to try!)

It's OK. . I would say it's ok. I don't understand why this is rated No 1 on here but we didn't find it amazing. There are lots of plants and trees etc but if you've been to Kew Gardens in England then this isn't anything special. There's a small cafe inside with a beautiful surrounding. We didn't go inside the museum but I can see from outside, nothing special there. They charge separately if you want to go inside museum. I would recommend it as it's really cheap to get in and a good couple of hours spent. But I would say you spend that time in souks where you feel the real Marrakech.
The Oasis in the City. Marrakesh is loud, busy, on the move, and the Majorelle Gardens are a true oasis in the city, allowing to wind down, to cool off, to enjoy silence and tranquility.
Well worth a visit. We arrived there early afternoon and it was not crowded at all. A most pleasant spot to relax. We love that shade of blue!

Blue heaven. This is a popular destination and can get very crowded so go early or late to avoid the crowds The entrance fee is cheap and it is almost like a living painting The colours are amazing Visit the museum which presents the artefacts beautifully

Really worth a visit. Very pretty and peaceful garden Small but lovely to wander round, cool from the heat of the day. €17 entry.(approx) There was a man right inside the door selling bottled water, which I expected to be expensive but it was just normal price. Don't miss the wee gallery, it is small but has lovely art on the walls.
Good but a bit small . A good break from the busy city but quite small. Well maintained though and not too expensive. 70 Durham entry

Fascinating gardens. These gardens created by Yves St Laurent, whose memorial is inside them, was amazing. Quite small but beautifully laid out with many exotic species we had never seen.
More expensive than most local attractions but well worth it.
We had a very interesting visit, one of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech.
Cool, beautiful retreat. The Berber museum was very interesting and beautifully displayed. The gardens were a beautiful oasis in the city. Best way to arrive is by horse and carriage.
Relaxing Visit. Very pretty garden in the middle of a hectic city. This was a super relaxing visit and I'd recommend it. It's very different from the rest of Marrakech.
A must in Marrakech!. The colors, the cactus, the flowers and trees, everything is very nice to see! You really can take photos with the beautiful Bleu!!
Quiet oasis. A quiet oasis a little way out of the Medina. Beautiful peaceful gardens, rather smaller than we'd anticipated but a relaxing, cool place to visit.

Beautiful gardens. I visited the Yves Saint Laurent gardens in Marrakech with my family during our week stay. After visiting the busy old market and souks it was lovely to come to this beautiful and peaceful garden which seems a million miles away from the Marrakech city. The garden is very well kept and clean and tidy which allowed us to get some great photos. There is a courtyard cafe within the gardens which we stopped at for coffee and juices. Would highly recommend visiting the gardens during a stay in Marrakech!

Jardin Majorelle - an oasis of calm inside the manic Marrakech. Another must visit during your stay in Marrakech. as soon as you walk through the gates you enter a calming area surrounded by the manic Marrakech. Wide variety of plants including cacti. Picturesque ponds and a nice refreshment area.
Beautiful and tranquil gardens. Amid all the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh sits this beautiful garden. It is immaculately kept and is peaceful and tranquil. Well worth a visit!
Beautiful... Beautiful gardens worth a visit. Took taxis from the centre of Marakesh.. But you can do the horse & cart trip. We just didn't fancy it with 9 of us & young children.
Stunning!. Magical gardens in the middle of the city with small museum inside. Worth visiting not only for bleu Majorelle:)

Morocco's Secret Garden - Amazing. Magical.. Beautiful gardens, its something you have to do! You have to pay to get in is about £5 (£4.60) You have to pay to access the art studio, which i did not do ( poor student on holiday. i would have liked to have a look in if i was able though!) You are given a booklet which tells you all about the gardens, In English! It tells you the history and all of the stories behind the gardens and how they have developed throughout their time. There are different languages on the boards. There are also a lot of birds which make the gardens more magical. I do not have a favourite part because i thought all of it was beautiful and amazing.. minus the food. i Loved the frogs in the pond though. I have seen many gardens in my 18 years of life as my mother is a crazy passionate flower gardener freak. This was one of my favourite gardens. Well worth the visit. However, i do not recommend the restaurant, its very expensive and i couldn't eat the food served to me as it had a strange taste. The gardens do not allow you to take in your own food. There are a lot of other food places about outside of the gardens though! There are places to sit and read, you can take photos and there are toilets ( they expect you to pay but this is normal) I think it is suitable for everyone, all ages. Enjoy!

A little oasis.. Very pleased to visit the garden, albeit quite small.Everything clean and tidy, lots of seating areas, exotic planting in parts with lots of very large cacti of different types.Pleasing to the eye and the photographer.The cafe was of a good standard with excellent service when we went.Expensive shop (to suit the museum exhibition).An enjoyable and relaxing trip, if you like gardens and to learn a little more about how it came about.I would go again and take a book to relax for an extra hour or so.
Nice garden but YSL really?. Not impressed, grumpy gate staff when we arrived, walked round in 15 minutes, very small. Small court yard cafe ok.

Impressive gardens.. We went to the Jardin Majorelle while we are on a horse and cart trip. It is 70 dirhams entrance fee and when you walk in, it is amazing. It was lovely to walk round and well worth a visit.
Impressive.. Beautiful garden and pristine in its upkeep. A must see when in Marrakesh. I recommed you go early as it is a popular attraction and receives lots of visitors

Decent Enough To Visit.. A nice garden, but very busy since all the European tourists visit. What should be a place of peace is transformed into, well, not a place of peace. But still worth a visit. It's a little smaller than I expected, and the museum was closed when we went, but we enjoyed it nonetheless.
Beautiful!. Expensive. It is an oasis in the new city. VEry beautiful but expensive.I think it is necessary to have a catalogue in spanish because there are a lot of spanish tourists there
Stunning and relaxing gardens. Beautiful gardens laid out in a stunning way. The blue marjorelle colour is divine. Extremely peaceful and relaxing, a welcom escape from the heat.

Superb. One the highlights of our holiday in Marrakech. I am definitely no gardener but they are designed, laid out and maintained to the highest standard.
