Whilst the plant variety is superb the quality and number of cacti is incredible. The Berber museum is interesting with fantastic costumes and jewellery The café is the best we visited in Marrakech.
Cool haven. Stunning colours and you must pay the extra to see the Berber museum, a cool haven from the heat pf Marrakech, with beautiful gardens

Fabolous garden area. Entry was 70 dirhams each.We went earlier in the day, so was quieter. Great place for taking photos and relaxing. You could walk around in about 15 minutes, but at the same time you could spend 2 hours in there. We were in there for about an hour. The garden was laid out very nicely, and kept in top condition. Very enjoyable and definitely worth a visit!

Stunning. We decided to visit to while away a couple of hours before our flight home and I am glad we did, shady and cook compared to being in the direct sunlight, stunning colours and lovely diversion from the madness of Marraketch.The Berber museum was really imnpressive
Beautiful!. This garden is in the New Town so quite a schlepp from the Medina, particularly in the heat of the day. I got a taxi and it was well worth the visit. Absolutely beautiful gardens!

Beautiful City Oasis. Have been here twice and love the calm and tranquil atmosphere.The gardens are magnificent and the cafe makes a super pitstop to enjoy either a drink or snack.Its easy to walk to from the medina although crossing the busy roads feels a little daunting.
It's a nice garden. It was a nice garden. But while we're in a hectic itinerary we did not spend too much time here. We rather spent more time in the medina.

The nicest garden we have visited. A lovely bright and colourful garden with plenty of shade and peaceful areas away from the busy side of Marrakech. My girlfriend and I spent over two hours strolling around the gardens and watching the world go by from the many benches. Our favourite place in Marrakech.
Absolutely stunning don't come to Marrakech without a visit here!!. Amazing sanctuary and oasis of calm in the middle of the city with wonderful contrasts, a mist visit.
An Oasis of Calm!. An oasis of calm in the new town of Marrakech. These beautiful gardens are a delight to walk around and a nice break from the madness of the souks and main square in the old town.

Easy to see why Yves Saint Laurent was inspired here. Well maintained and beautiful gardens. The cactus section was my favorite area because of the unusual looking varietals. Go early to avoid big crowds!

waste of time and very expensive. For a privately owned and maintained garden, this is very impressive. For a public garden with 70dh entry fee, it's a waste. Mostly bamboo, succulents, and bougainvillea, with an admittedly nice cactus garden. Any botanical garden is infinitely more worth visiting. Saint-Laurent would roll in his grave if he could see the memorial created for him. Horrible! The museum is much better than the garden.

Relaxing break. I had the garden on my list of 'to see' while in Marrakech, and I'm glad we went. It is not at all a 'formal' garden, but a joyous, colourful and unique place to relax after the craziness of the Medina. I loved the 'Majorelle blue' everywhere, and the succulents were amazing. There are plenty of benches to sit and relax, and it was not super touristy ~ perfect change of scenery for an hour or two.The museum has some very interesting, historic pieces, and is worth the extra fee.

Lovely peaceful place. After what seemed like hours walking across the city amidst the usual traffic and incessant horns we eventually found the garden, it was a lovely and welcomed respite, garden superbly maintained and just sitting watching the world go by....This is one of the most beautiful gardens in Marakesh. This was easily my favorite spot in the city.

Lovely and tranquil. a massive collection of tropical plants, arranged and collected by Yves Saint Laurent who's remains are said to be within the grounds. Personally I love tropical plants and enjoyed walking around looking at the many varieties collected, it's a peaceful and tranquil place, in the shade due to the size of the plant life, it was like being somewhere else entirely.

Lovely time in a pretty and calm place!. I loved the garden design with its contrast of Majorelle blue and green. It has a wide range plants from different countries and small and offer a lot of spots for relaxation and beautiful pictures. The shop and YSL galleries are very nice tooIt's worth the visit!!
Lovely garden. Very nice place, not what I expected I thought they would be more formal.there is a lovely cafe in the grounds.

beautiful garden. great visit, we went in the afternoon and there weren't too many people. wonderful colors and interesting museum to see.great to wander and take some fotos and have a break in the small and cozy cafe. would go back anytime.

Interesting but not great. Some nice gardens here and interesting buildings but not really a major tourist attraction. Pleasant place to visit and has a decent café. Notable for its connection to Yves Saint Laurent. Museum inside costs extra.
Well worth the visit. A lovely cool break from the hot of the day. Don't order cappuccino from cafe because it isn't very good
beautiful. absolutely lovely scenary and reasonably priced. great place to take photos of lovely plants and art work.
Lovely garden . Worth a visit when you're in the city. One of the better places to visit in Marrakesh, there's a nice gallery as well as the gardens and cafe.
Beautiful relaxing place. What a wonderful garden, an ideal place to' spend a few relaxing hours with children before to get back to The caotic Medina.
Must See. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Such vibrant colours with a vast array of plants and flowers. Loved the turtles too.

Pretty. The entrance fee was 70 dh for the garden and 30 dh for the museum which is high in comparison to the other exhibits but it was absolutely beautiful. Didn't take long to walk round, you could sit and relax in the shade. The cafe is obviously expensive but the staff are friendly and it's got a lovely atmosphere. The museum was a lovely insight into Berber culture despite most if not all the descriptions being in French. We really enjoyed it.
Beautiful Gardens. Lovely gardens w- with amazing planting and architecture. A real calm oasis in the middle of a very busy city.

One of the glories of Marrakech. The garden may be small buts packs a big punch. A series a mini landscapes which takes you on an unforgettable sensory journey. The garden is the chef-d'oeuvre of Jacques Majorelle, painter, plant collector and scholarly enthusiast for the culture of Marrakech. It was bought my Yves Saint Laurent and his partner Pierre Berge. Well worth a few hours of your time.

Loved it!. Brilliant place to visit if u like gardens, different kind of plants etc and nature. It's worth going into the museum. 2 prices 1 for residents and another for non residents. Loved the museum and jewellery in there from the berber culture
Lovely gardens. expensive and not busy early in the day. Not a lot to see and you can arrange this trip yourself instead of using the hotel as they will charge you a lot more
Just Breathtaking.. Do not miss this ! Amazing colours and nice spot for quiet refection. Expensive gift shop but lovely cafe.

Amazing colors!. This is such a visually stunning place. The bright colors of the building (especially the Majorelle blue) are such a wonderful contrast to the greenery! The gardens are very tastefully setup and the gallery and shops are nice too. I wish there were more signs and information tidbits put up all over the place though lonely planet and DK are a good source too! Its a wonderful place for pictures!!
A Blue Heaven. Peaceful calm and quiet compared to the outside world. Pleasant cafe and interesting small museum. Lots of lovely photo opportunities. A must see in Marrakech

Over rated , expensive , a big disappointment !. I was really looking forward to seeing the gardens so set off on foot with much excitement. Finding Jardin Majorelle was not easy. The entrance is not on the main road as our map indicated but with some help we found our way. If you get to the garage you have gone too far.The road of the entrance has shops unlike most in Marrakesh, they are very western, designer and expensive. However you can get a proper expresso in the cafe opposite the entrance. It is an expensive entrance fee, but i was still excited. Once inside it was packed and very small within ten minutes we had walked the whole garden. Yes there are some beautiful plants and amazing cactus but nothing special and just so small. There is of course a cafe, which is again pricey and not that great. I would give it a miss and spend the money taking a cab out of Marrakesh and just go for a walk and you will see far more of natures beauty.
Stunning. Beautiful gardens that surround pretty fountains and statues. Really peaceful and the café is really nice and reasonably priced too.

Peaceful and beautiful. Went here on our last day for a relaxing walk round and the garden was so beautiful and unexpected in a city like Marrahkech where its chaotic and loud. For 70 dirham Jardin Majorelle is so quiet and provides lots of shade and has a lovely looking restaurant with misters to keep you cool. The menu looked so nice and not overpriced being that you were already in there and most places would charge through the nose. Enjoyed very much!

Blue and yellow!. We had a fantastic and relaxing time wondering around these stunning gardens. The lily pond was amazing and there are so many photo opportunities with gorgeous backdrops. Would definitely go back!

Don't miss. really enjoyed our visit here costs a 100 dirhams to visit the garden and Berber museum but worth every bit. The gardens are beautiful and the museum is unusual with brilliant use of such a small space.
Jardin Majorelle. It's amazing the variety of plants in this huge garden. What a great job YSL andhis friend did to save and rejuvenate this garden!
Tranquility. Enjoyed an afternoon stroll round here. It's beautiful and calming. A short walk from our Riad. We caught a horse carriage back into town.
Hyped up garden. Nothing too special in this garden. Extortionate prices for a 5 minute walk around very small gardens. Some nice ponds and plants, thats about it.

Tranquil oasis. A tranquil oasis just on the outskirts of the madness of Marrakech. A lovely garden full of cactus and bamboo plants. There are plenty of places to sit and relax and there is a lovely café/restaurant which is slightly more expensive than anywhere else, but you pay for the lovely quiet surroundings.
The staff are very friendly and helpful too..
Beautiful Jardin Majorelle. Beautiful garden with spectacular evergreen and floral displays. Lovely pleasant afternoon trip which you can make your own way to and not pay someone less to take you.

Fantastic landmarks with lovely cafe and museum inside. The Jardin Majorelle is a real gem! Thanks to Lonely Planet we enjoyed one of most fantastic gardens we have ever been. Make sure you don't miss the Berber museum and have an ice cream or a sorbet in the café inside the gardens!

Cannot be missed! . We had a blast walking around this gorgeous garden! It regroups all kind of exotic plants. It is not to be missed! As well the Berbers museum was beautiful and if you don't know much about this ethnic group, I strongly suggest you go and learn. Don't forget that if you are a student the entry costs 35 Dhs instead of 70 Dhs.

Very pleasant garden . Me and my girlfriend loved to visit this garden. It was very relaxing and great to get away from the busy medina.The Berber museum is probably the best kept museum in Marrakech. You do have to pay a lot more than other museums but you can really see the difference. Overall a very nice experience

Sweet little touristy stop. It was pretty little garden, very polished, clean and organized. I didn't find it crazy amazing, but it was pleasant. The patio restaurant was nice, though not surprisingly a little bit on the expensive side--you're paying for convenience and ambience. Food was decent though. Overall, the 70 dirham entrance was perhaps a bit steep. It might be worth it if you bring a book and make a plan to sit on a bench in the shade for a while. Otherwise it's a pretty quick stroll with a lot of other tourists. But like the other reviewers have mentioned, it is a nice setting for some pretty photos. If you have plenty of time in Marrakesh, or just need a break from the intensity of the medina, I'd recommend it.

Amazing Gardens. The Jardin Majorelle is definitely a must-see for anyone who appreciates fashion, art and nature. When YSL passed away in 2008, his ashes were scattered at the Jardin Majorelle and a memorial was built there in his name.

A very pleasant island of greenery.. When the rest of Marrakech was quiet, found the gardens relatively busy. Smaller than you would expect for the entrance fee (but reasonable compared to European standards). Notwithstanding, a must in any visit to Marrakech

Amazing garden!. Must see in Marrakesh! Entry fee abit expensive, but half price with a student card. Its a garden that has everything you can imagine. Just beautiful and vibrant colours and also a get away from the city. Its like another world.

Not to be missed. This is an unusual garden with so much to offer. The museum is particularly interesting. The colour called Majorelle blue on many of the buildings and plant pots contrasts well with the green of the foliage.

Nice to visit, go early to avoid queu. Lovely garden with awesome cactie and bamboo.
Price of ticket is relatively high and the café is way to expensive for Morroco.
If you go early you don't have to queu. We went at 11 and had to wait for 15 minuten at least.
Tip: bring your student card to get 50% discount. No need to identify with passport.

A relaxing couple of hours. A place to relax and just take your time to look around. The gardens are kept very tidy, and the water features are clear. A lovely bit of peace and quote. Just what you need qhile staying in Marrakech.It took me a while to find it, but i was on foot.

Stunning - do not miss. The garden Majorelle was truly beautiful - a tranquil environment with stunning colours, plants, and a combination of interesting factors in the garden. I highly recommend going!

Amazing. I visited here as part of my day tour in Marrakech, there is a fee of 70 dirhams to just visit the garden and additional fee if you also want to visit the museum. It lovely here and very colourful. I found it so peaceful and such an amazing place to visit. They have some amazing YSL pieces in the shop. It is defo somewhere I will visit again on my next trip to Morocco.

An oasis.... A must see place in Marrakech. It's relaxing to walk around the gardens. After a hectic walk in the city, it's a breath of fresh air to see greenery scenes. The place is covered by trees and it doesn't feel hot inspite of the summer season, We paid 50MAD for the entrance fee.

Yves St laurent. Unexpectedly peaceful and beautiful gardens situated in a less attractive part of town. Reasonably priced and plenty of space to sit and soak up the array of perfectly arranged and maintained foliage
Worth a visit. Worth a visit to this tropical haven, very well kept garden and museum, money goes towards a charity set up after YSL died.
Nice and interesting walk. Its good for a short walk for seeing beautiful things. The architecture and the painting of it, is special.
Very pretty. Very pretty, can take lovely photographs...there is a restaurant...very reasonably priced to enter ..

Haven in the middle of chaos. A haven of quietness in a somewhat hectic town. Lovely gardens and museum and we really enjoyed spending some time here. Nice cafe/restaurant on site, immaculately clean toilets and plenty of places to sit and take it all in.
Desappointing. The garden is nice but very small and the price is way to high for such a visit. I would not recommend it.

Stunning urban oasis. What I heard as a comment that it is unfortunately a designed garden, a small one and the ticket is expensive. Anyway, we decided to visit the place. From my point of view it is worth every penny. It is true that the area itself is smaller than expected, but the time you spend in is completely up to you. It is so colorful, with changing scenery and many places to sit and chill, that I could spend days there. A beautifully designed and maintained spot of peace inside of a busy city. Check out the Love exhibition, too.
Worth the visit!. Well worth the visit. Definitely go here if not only to say you went to see the the memorial of Yves Saint Laurent! It beautiful and a lovely backstory to it.
Marjolle Gardens. Interesting - Yves St Laurent's ashes are sprinkled here. There is a good cafe and shop, and the gardens were uncrowded and pretty.
Oasis in the City. Dont miss this jewel ... an oasis of calm and green but get there in the morning its cooler and the light is awesome....
Tranquil and relaxing. Its defiantly worth a visit. so relaxing and different from the hustle and bustle of the old town. Its nothing new and amazing, but just very tranquil.

Expensive, not worth it. I went on TripAdvisor to see what were some of the top things to do in Marrakech and Majorelle Gardens came up as #1. When we arrived by taxi, I was with a Moroccan friend of mine and we noticed that there were different prices for foreign tourists and local Moroccans. I thought paying the 70 dirham price would be fine until I walked in. The Gardens are much smaller than I expected, the museum was closed when we were there and although some of the plants were pretty to look at, it was full of plants from other countries, I felt it would have been better to have plants from all over Morocco. Many of the cacti and plants I had already seen from spending time abroad and traveling throughout America. Overall, I thought the gardens were overpriced and can't believe that it is the #1 thing to do in Marrakech. The souvenirs in the gardens store were quite pretty but also WAY overpriced and you can find similar gifts at the medina for much cheaper.
Tranquil . Very lovely gardens, tranquil and visually arresting. Good spot for lunch too, I recommend the cold carrot and cumin soup.

Stunningly beautiful gardens. We spent an hour walking around these gardens, they were gifted to marakesh by yves Saint laurent and are now run by a charitable foundation. It's only 70 dirram to get in approx £4.50 . The gardens are stunning with plants from all over the world.the house it self is a fabulous cobalt blue colour. If you like gardens then it's defo worth a visit.
Small, crowded, average.. Was OK. Certainly not the best attraction in Marrakech by far. Small and crowded. Certainly not 'YSL' standard or style. The tea rooms were nice though.
do not miss the JArdin de YSL. It's super. Relaxing and beautiful. The colors are really nice and the variety of plants is amazing, Do not miss it.

Beautiful, a hidden gem. I'm the only one in my family that enjoys gardens but everyone came away raving about it. I visited with my husband and kids (11, 8 & 7) as part of a horse & carriage trip. We only had about 40 mins there and I would have liked much longer. It was probably the right amount of time for the kids who started to flag in the heat. The garden itself isn't that big but the winding paths, water features and clever planting make it seem quite big. Obviously the planting is limited to the soil/climate but there are good examples of cacti & palms. There was a cafe, book shop & museum but we didn't have time to use them. I will definitely return (on my own so I can really enjoy it!)
Worth a visit. Went to visit on advice of locals and due to strong tripadvisor reviews by other users. Tranquil setting and definitely worth a visit.
A bit disappointing . It is a lively garden but i am sure of this was in another city with more tourist attractions this wouldn't be one. In marrakech is worth seeing it but is not all that

An Oasis in Marrakesh . Yves Saint Laurent gifted the Jardin Majorelle to Marrakesh.The Majorelle botanical gardens is a magnificent landscape garden filled with many divine desert cacti, tropical trees and shrubs.It also has superb vibrant architecture as part of this gorgeous exotic gardens.This magnificent place has very few steps and the paths are an easy walk.You should allow 1-2 hours to wander this site so that you can take many photos.As part of the gardens there is a small museum which is themed on the Berber people and the boutique is also not to be missed.

What a beautiful place. We spent a morning here walking around the gardens that were gifted to Marrkech by Yves Saint Laurent and his husband. It was cheap to get in and staff were very helpful. There are signs and posts around to explain where the botanical plants have come from. A lot of hard work has gone into caring for this place.If you are into gardens, nice scenery and like the designers work then it's a lovely dove to spend some time. The cafe there was my favourite place throughout our stay. Our children had crepes for a snack and I had the mint tea which was the best mint tea I had throughout my stay. I could quite happily sit in the courtyard cafe for hours just reading a book or looking around people watching. There's also a lovely bookshop and a small shop with Yves Saint Laurent goods. There's plenty to read about the designer and his story of prints. There's a museum which teaches about the different 'tribes' and times from area to times. This was fab for the children to learn about too. If highly recommend a visit here.

Nicely set out gardens and a real surprise.. This is one of the major sites in Marrakech and well worth a visit. Best to get a taxi there. Stop on and haggle the hotel or Riad will tell you what to pay. Yep tourist rate is higher than locals but cheap enough. The gardens are tranquil and well maintained.. They are well worth a visit. We planned a walk back to the Medina rather than a cab and saw some other interesting parts of the city
Pretty Garden. Fascinating!. Well planned out with plants from all over the world. Something different to see and relaxing after the busy souks

A colourful oasis. This place is wirth checking out - it provides welcome relief to the madness of the Marakesh medina - a short cab ride from the medina and probably an hour there is all you'd need. Barter with the cabbies though - they wanted to charge us a lot more than the 30dhm we ended up paying

One of the best places in town. Situated a bit from city center you need to take a long walk or a taxi if you stay in the Medina. It is amazing to think about the effort original done to establish the garden. Very impressive. Entrance a bit high.

Colorful. I enjoyed the visit to vegetation is interesting and the Berber museum also, however I think it justified the price there was some interesting activity. The colors of the house are the backdrop for beautiful photographs
Afternoon walk around. True heaven on earth. Strongly recommended for afyernoon chill around. Once you meet majorelle blue color, you easily fall in love with it.

Wonderful Gardens for photo opportunities . We visited in the afternoon and it had gotten hot, but still a beautiful and well manicured garden. As an avid photographer I spent more time than most waiting to get the shots I wanted. We were there for an hour and had plenty of time. Most people would probably spend less time. We took a taxi for only 50 dirham and he came back to pick us up and hour later. Return trip to near the main square for another 50 dirham.

Calm and tranquil. This is a beautiful tranquil place ,with some really lovely exotic plants and trees and cool shady walkways. beautiful water features with wooden bridge and decking.nice memorial to YSL and interesting Berber museum.overpriced shops and cafe though.well worth a short visit.

Beautiful colours, very touristic. When we were there it was a bit Crowded, so maybe it is good to avoid rush hours. The colours and trees are really beautiful, and it's a green, relaxing place. A bit overpriced for the size. The museum was closed.

Beautiful. This was the most expensive place we visited in Marrakech, at 70 dirham each (most other places are 10 dirhams) but it was well worth the visit for the beautiful gardens and coloured pavilion - great for photos! Be careful if the floor is wet as it is very smooth so could be slippy.

A great getaway, for a price . A very beautiful place to walk around. Must see. Not too big and a bit expensive, but worth it! The drink/food place is lovely, bit again expensive. Sadly the museum was closed.

Marvelous garden . Really worth a visit. It is like an oasis inside hot Marrakech. Beautiful colors and romantic paths through exotic plants and trees. I am sorry that i don't remember the ticket price. It isn't far from medina and you can use a taxi to go there. For sure it worths a visit

The Must visit Garden in Marrakech. You cannot go to Marrakech without visiting This fascinating gardent, YSL heaven on earth. Great variety of trees, flowers, plants, beautiful couloirs. Just wali, take picture and have rest
superb garden in the dessert. Yves saint Laurent's own design garden and home absolutely fantastic and the stunning colours you must visit this home & garden

Nothing special- quite average. We were highly recommended to visit the garden because of it's beauty and uniqeness, but in reality it's just a park with palm trees and cactuses and a tiny barbarian museum (have to pay entry ticket to the garden and separately to the museum). It is nice and quiet comparing to the whole loud Marrakesh, but we didn't find it That great to be honest. Even in Aberdeen Scotland we have similar Winter Gardens... If you're bored and have nothing else to do, you can pay it a visit ;)

Worth a visit but you won't be there for hours.. A pleasant break from the dust and bustle of the city. Some good photography opportunities if you want to capture the plants in bright pots against amazing blue buildings. Possibly overplaying the Yves Saint Laurent connection.

Not worth my time. Beautiful garden ,but not worth the trip nothing there struck me as original or creative,the entrance fee of $7/person was high for the place,especially that the museum inside was close and you could not see St. Laurant's house you can cover this small garden in less than 20 minutes , I do not recommend it

Blue Majorelle. This is a marvellous site in Marrakech. Absolutely to visit!You'll discover a beautiful and silent garden in which is still present an incredible collection of trees, cactus and palm species surrounded by a nice path that leads you to an incredible building who was an atelier for YSL and is now the museum of the Berber culture.Apparently the museum is quiet often closed and it's a real pity because it would be awesome to discover the inner spaces of this strange piece of architecture fully majorell è blue coloured.Go there and enjoy contrasts!

Beautiful tranquil oasis of calm. We were taken by a local guide, but I'd recommend going alone, as we paid double the 40 Dhiram entrance fee. It is a gorgeous shady oasis of calm in a busy city, and well worth a visit. It has the most amazing giant bamboo groves, cacti gardens, beautifully laid out ponds a nod walkways, all in a very Moroccan colour palette of bright blues, yellows and terracotta. The Art Deco house is stunning, there is a very pretty cafe and a Berber heritage museum, but even better is knowing that all the profits are ploughed back into supporting Moroccan development and educating young people here. The gardens are amazing, it was one of the prettiest and interesting visits of this's rip, and even on a scorchingly hot day outside we felt cool and shaded inside. Go for it!

Stunning garden, but only for tourists?. A truly stunning garden with amazing water features, cacti, trees and bamboo. The only downside was that there were no locals only tourists as the entry prices had deterred them.

Tranquil area. Nice area to relax and full of greenery but do gets boring after a while unless you are very much into gardens and horticulture. Worth a visit though. Calm relaxing place for an hour or two.

Museum close and the garden is not that big. We heard a lot about the garden and decided to visit. Not the easiest place to get to if walking. The museum was closed and we could only visit the gardens. Nothing special as I have seen London's Kew Gardens, Rios's Botanical Gardens and Sydney's Botanical Gardens and many more. The garden was very clean and looked after and we spend 30-45 minutes there. It is worth the visit for its history though.

Large botanic collection represented in a small area. This garden has a very large botanic collection from many countries around the world. However this collection is represented in a compact, small area. Also, it is out of the old town and its entrance price is expensive for Marrakesh (70mad). You may visit it if you bore from the old town and you want a silent green park. In addition, its earnings are reinvested for social projects by the foundation who own the garden.

Definitely worth it!. Very beautiful and a relaxing place to spend an hour or so in Marakkesh. It is a bit of a walk from some of the main sites in the city, but the walk was a great way to see more of Marakkesh. There is also a lovely little cafe here and several nice cafes on the same street.

Lovely gardens. Beautiful gardens with a great collection of plants and trees from everywhere in the world. Inside the facilities there is a bereber museum; eventhough it might seem a bit pricey, it is well worth a visit.Also, don't miss out the Yves Saint Laurent xmas cards collection and the little cafe besides it which serves lovely sweet treats (beware that they would be expensive).

An oasis of calm. This is the ideal place to relax after an exhausting morning in the Medina. Beautifully maintained with many places to sit in the shade and enjoy the garden. The museum of berber culture is a must, with its rich overview of arts and crafts production.
Lovely gardens. Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful garden - nice place to spend a couple of hours. There is also a museum inside and shop & cafe. It is maintained well.
Nice to see. This is a tourist must see however I wasn't extremely impressed. I guess it's ok to see as an experience. The staff at the berber museum were very rude. See it for the sake of it

Beautiful. This place is a peaceful haven amongst the wild rumpus of Marrakech Medina. Beautiful colours and a fantanstic museum about Berber life - do not be tempted to skip it! 100 dirham (about £7) to for the garden and the museum. It would be nice to have more information about Yves St Laurent.
definitely worth a visit. really worth going to for an hour or so even if you're not into gardens. Lots of shade on a hot day and really beautiful use of planting and water features
Chill time. Stunning gardens, peace and tranquillity in the centre of a non stop city. You can just sit back and feel the stress slipping away.
Lovely place to visit. A lovely, peaceful oasis. Absolutely worth visiting for a bit of calm outside the frenzy of the Medina.

Well mantained. Pretty and well maintained gardens. Beautiful colors that I love. But other than that? Not really. If you dont go, you are not missing much. You can look at pictures online and it will be just fine. Another tourist trap.

Clash with the senses. Quite a bizarre garden whic is situated on the outskirts of the souk. Once you find it (we walked from the souk) which took about 30 mins in heat (March). Once there it is a tranquil oasis. It was busy with lots of other tourist which spoilt the ambience a little. Lovely cafe inside - ice cream amazing!If you like cacti and succulents and the vibrate (garish) colours then go.

Pretty but underwhelming. I was underwhelmed by the garden. It was really manicured with a lot of concrete. It was also small and didn't offer moments of rest for the eye (too packed together). Well done but didn't offer the serene or inspiring experience I had hoped for.
Stunning gardens to chill in, if you can dodge the selfie sticks. Half a day spent at these beautiful gardens presented a welcome relief to the craziness of Marrakech.

Visit to the Majorelle Gardens. A must if you are visiting Marrakesh! Beautiful, peaceful gardens. Very picturesque and serene! There is a small Berber museum to visit within the gardens. A good way to spend half a day
Waste of time and money. Nothing special ! We saw better gardens for free in Marrakech ! Diferent prices for Marrocans and Tourists ! Tourist must pay more but nobody tell us why !!!

Great looking place. Definitely worth a trip to the New town for this alone, perhaps our favourite attraction we went to in Morocco.Very attractive place to walk round slowly definitely recommend. Be careful with taxis though since its a touristy place they seem to hike up the price.

Magnifique Jardins Majorelle. The most exquisite gardens I visited in Marrakesh. Every corner brims with color and vibrant desert plant life. The famous blue and yellow house is fantastic, but the whole estate is a gem in my opinion.
Nice garden. Garden was ok consideration that it's in a desert however UK parks owned by the council are far better.It provided shade in the hot climate and provided respite from the heat.

The great blue. This is a beautiful cactus garden (many sizes and many many types) , the main color is blue and if there are not too many visitors is very relaxing.There is a small museum ( different ticket) with interesting books on sale, a boutique an a very nice coffee shop where you can have nice salads, unfortunately if you want to go to the museum shop or coffee shop you will have to pay the entrance fee.

Just marvelous!. Majorelle, an amazing peacefull spot. The garden with luxuriant plants and flowers, where you can enjoy a nice walk or take beautiful pictures. The main house is an exquisite charming place to relax with a maghrebi mint tea. Enjoy the contrast colors between the green garden and the exoctic blue and yelow house. It's a must!
So peaceful, so many cactus. So peaceful. Loved the tranquility. Obviously a labour of love. The price has just increased to 70d per person..still worth it

Among main sights in Marrakesh. Must have for being in Marrakech. Especially when it's hot outside, you better take a shadowy garden and investigate it slowly. Be prepared for lots of other tourists with the same wishes.)

Nice garden. Majorelle Garden is a quiet oasis in the heart of the colourful, magical medina of Marrakech.It was designed by French artist Jaques Majorelle nearly a century ago, while Morocco was still a French colony..
Tranquil garden. Lovely tranquil garden. We enjoyed spending a few hours here. If you are visiting Marrakech make sure you visit this garden!
Taxis 35dh. Absolutely beautiful, be careful of the taxis outside they should charge no more than 35dh to get back to the main square but theu try their luck with saying a 100dh

Wonderful, Superb, Exotic!. Wonderful, Superb, Exotic! The type of things you want to discover during your holidays! Colorful, full of scents, of history. The Blue of the Building and the Sky makes is a place unique you can't forget! Definitely a place to visit in your stay at Marrakesh!

Beautiful oasis combining nature and art. This was the high spot of 5 days in Marrakech. The former home of Yves Saint-Laurent, it was beautifully conceived and painted, much of it in a stunning blue colour, with sculptures dotted about which fitted the beautifully realised gardens. A real find away from the noisy souks and squares in such a bustling city.

Colour and style,.... Fantastic house, great gardens,.... a collection of dresses, suits by YSL full of colors and great designs too.
The gardens are out of this world.

Beautiful oasis in Marrakesh. Allow an hour to stroll through the stunning gardens and pay homage to YSL at his memorial.
There is an excellent cafe and the jewellery store with designs by one of YSL's muses Lou Lou de la Falaise is not to be missed, pieces may seem expensive but they are designer pieces do buy up!

Tranquil beauty at it's best. A quiet oasis of calm outside of Gueliz's Ville Nouvelle.The gardens were created by Jacques Majorelle and then owned by Yves Saint Laurent.The gardens are beautifully laid out, the feeling of tranquility amazing. The colours and the plants blend amazingly. The ponds and pavillion are clear highlights, even if you don't pay extra for the Berber Museum.The gardens are tucked down a little side street, the entrance does take a little while to locate but it is still walkable from Gueliz.
Lovely Place!. Beautiful and interesting gardens to stroll around for a couple of hours and grab a coffee! Visit earlier in the day as gets busy in the afternoon.

A beautiful calming gem . Entering the garden, a welcome hush of quiet descends as immense palms and bamboo muffle the hectic roads of Marrakech. This really is an oasis, and despite the large volume of visitors when we visited, maintained an aura of peace and tranquility. Don't miss the Berber museum in the house- the extra money us well worth it. Artefacts are well selected and displayed. The cafe was good if a little pricey, though the cooling jets of mist were very welcome in the middle of August! Great plants, strong design, wonderful colours and atmosphere- don't miss it!

Colourful and cool!. His place is an oasis and good for escape from crowd of the city. We went there nearly 12pm and there is no ticket queue and not crowded. The colours just relaxing and the plants are huge, specially cactuses...Worth to see.
not to miss. was recommended by a friend and we were not disapointed , a very serene place with beautiful plants . it is located out in the new city but you can walk from the medina .

Not worth the effort. Absolute waste of money. we were around this whole site in 10 minutes and we were looking for the rest of the gardens. Nothing to see, other than a few really big Cacti. sorry as a gardener this was a dissapointment.

Don't Miss Out on the Berber Museum. The admission fee to the Jardin Majorelle is 70 DH and for an additional 30 DH there is a ticket to the Berber museum. Definitely buy both as the museum is so well worth a visit. The museum is small but skillfully curated; starting with a short video on the Berbers and following on with the most wonderful artifacts especially clothing, jewelry which is just exquisite to ceramics, pottery and leather work. This small museum demonstrates the rich diversity of BerBer culture and because it is small one is not overwhelmed. If you want a respite from the hustle and bustle of the Medina and heat the inclusive 10 euro entrance fee is well worthwhile.

Yes Saint Laurent gardens Marrakech. Lovely gardens including a cafe and gift shop. Worth a visit for adults but not very interesting for families with young children as there isn't much else to do other than admire the beautiful surroundings.

Blue oasis. A lovely calm cool garden with a restaurant which is a little pricey compared to being in the Medina area. Beautifully set out allowing you to meander or sit. Lots of different plants and trees of interest. We didn't go into the Museum as it was late when we arrived. Outside a couple of nice little shops at reasonable prices. Garden well worth a visit

Beautiful but. Went around 1 to avoid crowds - but still busy. No queue but bus loads of tourists more interested in selfies than the cacti. The plants are amazing - the blue paint is stunning - the cafe is a surprisingly reasonable lunch venue. It was smaller than I hoped but incredibly pretty. It will always be busy I imagine but we enjoyed it very much.

The best garden. This is number one garden in Marrakech where you can relaxing after a long walk to new city,we do recommend this garden,it offer many areas especially berber museum,we will come back again....

Disappointment - limited selection of plants and poorly described.. Tiny, packed and poorly signposted - I would certainly not recommend. My wife is a keen gardener but was disappointed at not only the range but the lack of descriptions of the various flora. Disappointing.

fantastic tribute to YSL. This small but beautiful garden , rescued from developers by Yves San Laurent is a wonderful place to visit . Its on the stops of the green route of open topped bus tour . The YSL Foundation have taken it over and it is a credit to them . The cafe is very expensive and if you wait until you go outside the garden the cafe round the corner is about a quarter of the price for drinks .If you go on open top bus tour be sure to check departure times of the next buses as there are a street full of taxi drivers offering to take you back to town as you have hours to wait ( although a bus may be due any time ) . The local taxi drivers will do anything to make a fast buck !!

Oasis in the middle of hubris. This garden, supported by the Yves St Laurent trust, is an oasis in the centre of bustling Marrakeck.Costing 70 Dhms (about £4.50) this cool place makes a welcome break, especially after miles of travelling.At first you may think the garden a bit boring as the plants at the entrance are mostly all bamboo - but pretty impressive bamboo at that. However as you progress across the mid-point then there is a greater variety of arid loving plants, mostly very large cactii.There is a cafe, well appointed, cool-air misting, interesting menu, drinks etc. But don't expect to pay local village prices. This is a place for those with money. This especially shoes in the shop!There is a museum, but we didn't go to this - cost is extra.The disappointment is that we were expecting something much greater in area, and to that extent there was some disappointment

Colourful, relaxing, soothing place!. Beautiful! Stunning! I spent another whole day here and will gladly go back. Lovely Cafe, but rather overpriced for Marrakech. The colours and plants here are amazing, and it's well worth paying the small fee to visit the small Berber Museum. Fabulous day out for everyone.
Pleasant little hide away in Marrakesh. Lovely plants and gardens. Not sure if I would go again but it was ok. If you have extra time then why not. Bit pricey for what it was.

Lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The family and I spent a lovely couple of hours here on my birthday. It was so relaxing wandering through the gardens. I would absolutely recommend this as an essential place to visit if you are in Marrakech. Kids under 12 are free and at around £5 per adult (depending on the exchange rate) I think this is excellent value for money. Be warned though the process of actually procuring your ticket can take some time!Although we didn't stop there, the cafe looked cool and inviting and the menu had something for everyone. Next time we will definitely try it out.

Peaceful oasis in the midst of the chaos!. I'm not sure it warrants being the top attraction - it is after all just a small garden. However it is a beautiful, peaceful place and interesting little museum. A great spot for pretty photos!
Beautiful must see !. Lovely experience and a must see in Marrakech!On a sunny morning is a beautiful way to start your day and to get some history in too.

A Colorful Oasis. The Jardin Majorelle is colorful, lovely and tranquil. Maybe a bit pricey compared to other attractions in Marrakech. It's 70 MAD for entry to the garden and an additional 30 MAD for the Berber Museum. The garden has a nice collection of cacti and other plants along with a water lily pond and a walking path with many nooks where you can sit and relax. There is a bookshop, boutique, café and memorial to the late, great Yves Saint Laurent. As a photographer, I particularly enjoyed the blue square for it's color, design and architecture. Overall, it's a nice break from the medina for some fresh air and nature. I might suggest going early to avoid the crowds.

Can a garden and disruptive colors be unforgettable?. Located in the outskirts of the Medina, this is truly an unique spot! You'll know more about the history of the place, and its connection with the famous YSL one you go there, because this is a spot not to be missed in Marrakech. The unlikely combination of strong colors is incredible! So are the worldwide trees scattered all around!Make sure you buy the entrance to the Museum - this will give you an opportunity to see a spectacular endlessly room of lights and small lights, plus learning a lot from Berbere history.Oh... and don't miss the nearby stores and YSL street outside of the garden - very nice... no (strong) bargaining, despite the high prices.

Average gardens. Whilst the gardens are a good respite from the glaring heat, they aren't the most fascinating gardens in the world! It can get pretty crowded and is easily done in an hour. If you are interested in photography there are plenty of photo opportunities, but you will have to be patient to get the shots you want as people always wander into the frame. If you have run out of things to do in Marrakech then by all means do visit. Otherwise, give it a miss.
A lovely respite.. A beautiful little sanctuary amidst the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.Took the children to see the garden.it provided us with a refreshingly cool break that we needed.
lovely. Lovely and varied gardens, colorful and cool on a hot day, wonderful place for photos and learning a bit about the flora

Nice but overrated . It was nice and very pleasant but seemed a bit overrated. It had beautiful cacti of all shapes and sizes but in my opinion (I must admit there is a lot of plants/greenery in my country) there were other sites that I would rank higher than this. None the less, it was beautiful.
Jardine Majorelle. A stylish garden with enchanting nooks and corners. Perfect weather in April. Restful cafe with outdoor area. Quite unique.

Okay. Nice place to visit for a break for Marrakesh bustle. Not a great variety of plants but it was nice to see little turtles, frogs, and dragonflies on the small pond. However, it's quite small and you'll be finished looking about in no time unless you sit and think/read/eat for a while. We just paid to see the gardens and I can't say it was really very good value in terms of what we got out of it. It was busy enough when we were there - not surprising as it's a fairly small place. I don't regret going as it was nice to look around and a change of pace but it's the kind of place you'd go to once and that'd be it.
A MUST!. It is a must.Loved the Berber Museum and the "love" room. 100 MAD per person to visit Garden and Musem.YSL ashes are kept in the memorial.

Beautiful Garden. Loved this garden owned by Yves Saint Laurent. You do not have to pre-pay or book a tour to visit the garden, It is accessible through a taxi and you can tour leisurely at your own place. It is a must see attraction in Makkarech,
An interesting cool spot to visit. A pleasant oasis, a ncIce cool spot. Beautiful landscaped gardens to stroll through. Nice cafe. A museum to explain the Berber culture

Impressive Gardens but overpriced!. Went to visit the gardens after reading about them online. After a 25 min walk from the Medina, we arrived. It was about 70Dhm for the entrance and another 40-50 for the museum. In terms of attractions in Marrakech this is pretty pricey! We only paid to wander the gardens, which in hindsight probably wasn't worth it. I'm sure the museum would be interesting but overall not really my thing. The girlfriend loved it simply because of the connection to yves saint laurent!
Not what I expected . This isn't what I expected more sculpture than gardens not really worth it for me. Booked as part of trip better to go on own perhaps

Very busy. It was like a little oasis in the center of Marrakesh - but it was so busy you felt like you were being pushed along all the time. You weren't left to walk where ever you wanted, you had to stick to the raised platforms and it wasn't that big. 30 mins is enough really.

Wonderful visit. We spent a wonderful morning here taking in the magnificent gardens and fantastic Berber museum. Well worth the entrance fee and a very chilled place to spend some time. Staff around the garden were very helpful taking family photos. Great place to spend a few hours and the lunch in the cafe was excellent.

Beautiful, calm, fresh. Many nice Photo shoot Spots, many different interesting cactees, beautiful blue walls reminding of Yves saint laurent. You are through in a short time, but you have to go there in Marrakesch!

external to Marakesh. The guy tried to bring from autralia and mexico plants but seems he was intentionally omitting the huge variety of trees and bushes that Marocco has.
The entrance fee for such a small collection was too high.

a wonder. designed and organized by refined touches,
a must be seen place for any one who visits marrakech and likes nature, a collection of roses, flowers and plants from all over the world
An oasis within Marrakech . These were some of the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen and the atmosphere is just delightful. Beautiful sights and a great café, shop and museum.

Berber museum is fantastic, Majorelle garden bit crowded.... The entrance for the garden is too expensive, because of the big crowd. It is interesting to to the place from former Yves Saint Laurent, but happily we took the extra ticket for the Berber museum extra, not expansive and soo much worth! We got from a historicus so much information about all the clothes, jewellry. The signification of the clothes and all other items. You feel yourself under a Sahara star sky with the illuminated sealing! A big plus!
beautifle half day. beautiful gardens away from the hustle of the city, really worth while trip easy to find. take a bottle of water. Café expensive
Gardens. Very colourful, lots of trees.Worth a couple of hours visiting.Excellently designed, a wonderful oasis in the heart of Marrakech.

Beautiful garden and museum. Great way to escape from the heat of the city center. Fantastic garden that any traveller must definitely visit at least once. The best way to get there is to grab a carriage on the main square. takes about half an hour / 80 MAD.

Pleasant green and freshness. One of the best places to visit in Marrakech and the perfect contrast to the hustle and bustle of Jemaa el Fna. Peaceful, beautiful and very well cared for, this site gives us a few moments of rest and extremely pleasant freshness.Tip: For those who are still housed in the medina is a little far, so if you're not willing to walk you can use a taxi. Not being the cheapest alternative is the fastest. Negotiate the price before entering the taxi.
Small but beautiful. This is just a small garden (by botanical garden standards) but is really bright and beautiful and well worth a visit!

A fantastic oasis from the heat of August in Marrakech!. Loved this lush oasis, well maintained and beatiful inside out. can be done in an hour, the restuarant was very expensive so gave that a miss and thr entrance fee was expensive 10 euros oer person.
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning well kept and striking gardens Lovely shade also expected it to be hot and uncomfortable but shade from trees made it a lovely experience and visit
Fantastic. Great garden, breathtaking, inspiring, incredible collection of plants, very colorfull, never seen something like that.

Simply Stunning. The gardens are very mature and the collection of cactii is the best I have seen anywhere in the world.Fortunately on the day we visited the light was exceptional, allowing for some beautiful photographs.The blue colour scheme of the structures against the astonishing vegetation is simply stunning.The museum located within the grounds of the garden is also well worth a visit. Although small, it is very well presented with some interesting exhibits, closely followed of course by your 'exit through the gift shop'.

Peaceful serenity in busy city. Hop into one of the many horse and buggy relax as you pass through the streets of Marrakech and when you arrive, relax as you stroll down the beautiful pathways of this garden. It's a hidden gem

Garden, shade and Berber Museum. Worth a visit for a nice cool escape from the Marrakech Medina bustle. Colourful photos and nice to walk through. Inside is also the Berber museum - which is interesting, informative yet small and succinct - make sure to watch the audio visual displays.
Lovely but rather small . Worth visiting, especially when you need to cool down during a very hot day. You can take some nice pictures inside. Price for tourists outside of the city 70 DH.

Ok - but shouldn't be #1. A decent place to visit - but it's certainly not the no. 1 attraction in Marrakech. This would be the souks, or at least the Ben Yousef Madersa. The gardens take about 20 mins to see (pretty small), they have a lovely design for a hot country with amazing cactuses and a gorgeous lily pond. But coming from London we're pretty luck to have amazing gardens all around town, so perhaps we're a bit spoilt. We enjoyed a nice (but expensive) brunch in the cafe.
fabulous. beautiful and cool. There is a small cafe and a museum inside too which is really informative, loved it

Lovely. Really nice place for a stroll. Mainly shaded if you want to escape the heat. Very good value (I think around £3?). Beautiful ponds, trees and cacti. Took about half an hour to walk round. Would recommend.

A great place to visit while in Marrakech. Jardin Marjorelle is a wonderful garden so close to the old centre of Marrakech and such a break from the frantic life style in the Medina. It would be wrong to visit Marrakech and not to pay a visit to Jardin Marjorelle.
Peace and beauty. Very nice and luxuriant plant, I love fashion so be in YSL garden was a blast, you can imagine him walking around the plant the animals it's peace in the city.
Tourist visit . The garden is beautiful and yet peaceful. During a hot day you should visit and cool off in the shade. And the color of the walls made a beautiful setting

Disappointing. After reading the overwhelming number of rave reviews we were disappointed. Not only was it crowded but much smaller than we had imagined but the variety of plants seemed somewhat limited with relatively little colour. Worth a visit perhaps when less crowded but still not in the top 10 in our opinion

Lovely garden. I love this place, as soon as you step inside the garden, all the hassle and stress of the traffic and sellers are gone, I have been coming to the garden with my children since they where very small, it is a safe place for them to run around, and at the same time learn about the environment!. Even now as teens they enjoy the garden.
Oasis . Beautiful cool garden. Probably the coolest place in the city in August when the midday sun is frying.

Lovely garden but not worth the effort.... Arrived early so there was no queue. We spent about an hour wandering the gardens and museum. Lovely, but not worth the 400MAD we paid to see it and really not worth going there in the heat.

a garden in marrackech. A beautiful lush refreshing experience, a great place to relax from the hustle and bustle of marrackech, and all these beautiful flowers and tropical plants amazing, go and see for yr self
Stunningly beautiful. Stunning. Well worth a visit. There can be no doubt why YSL is considered such a great designer. Tranquil, cool and well considered

Tranquil place in the heart of Marrekech. Lovely tranquil place, to rest and take a break from the bustling souks.
There is alos a nice cafe to sit and take tea. This place is must during your stay. get there early to avoid the crowds.

Pretty and pricey. This is a beautiful small garden, with some truly lovely exotic plants and trees and cool shady walkways. Attractive water features with wooden bridge and decking. What dropped the rating for me was the rip off prices. Number one it's more than double the entry cost of any other attraction or palace/garden and the cafe is so overpriced as to be a joke. A glass of lemon (citron presse) was a ridiculous 55 dirham (approx. 5 - 6 euros at the time). Sandwiches or cakes were the cost of a whole three course evening meal elsewhere. Its a beautiful place and an oasis of a place, with stunning planting but take your own refreshments or be prepared to take out a mortgage.

Amazing!. We only had 1hr at the Jardin Marjorelle, which technically was long enough to see everything (it's not very big) but I could have stayed all afternoon! It's a little oasis of cool & calm in the middle of the crazy bustle of the city, full of little corners but with so much vibrancy! The colours are beautiful! I would have liked to visit the cafe as it's meant to be lovely but we didn't have time, will definitely go on my next visit!

Stunningly beautiful garden. The colours in this artificial garden are truly stunning - and the many trees provide a welcome shade on a very hot day.However, I only gave it 4 stars as I paid 70 Dhirams (about £6) as an entrance fee, which I found to be expensive for such a small garden (easily done in 15 min if you take your time!).Do pay the extra 30 Dhirams to go in the Berber Museum: that is well worth it!

Nice place to spend a few hours. We went to the gardens and Berber museum exhibit. Entry for both was 100 MAD. The gardens were nice, well maintained - I particularly liked the cactus garden. The Berber museum was really well done and gives you an insight into their jewellery and clothing - I recommend saving this until you can't stand the heat anymore - it's air conditioned in there. You can easily get around both areas within an hour if the objective is only to see everything. The only disappointment was having to pay money to use the bathroom. 100 MAD is surely enough of an entrance fee to cover that.
Wonderful Place!. Great place to visit, clean and friendly staff. Nice shaded haven to escape the busy city. Definitely worth a visit.

Essential visit. Beautiful - an oasis of calm & tranquillity in the hustle & bustle, the heat & dust of Marrakesh. I would recommend a visit to anyone. Originally the entrance fee was for either a morning or afternoon session, but on our second trip to the city, it no longer closed over the lunchtime so was for the whole day. Although it doesn't take long to 'do' the garden, my wife and I found that it was so relaxing we simply sat on a bench reading our books for ages, before moving on to another where we could listen to the water of the poos and fountains, watching the antics of some of the local wildlife

Beautiful Oasis. The gardens are wonderful and a quiet respite from the outside world. I am shocked it is ranked # 1 in Marrakech. It is nice and worth a visit, but not the best thing to see in the city. The flora is unique for the area and well manicured. I wish more ex-pats had done similar investments.
Beautiful. Beautiful and amazing to just relax. Recommend a mint tea in the cafe to help break up slowing wondering round the gardens

an oase in marakech. A garden of eden, lovely cactusses , palmiers from whole the world, beautiful museum of berber art and the tipical colours of the Yves Saint Laurent collection the bleu was all over the walls as if he had the inspiration of marocco

Escape the noise and madness. This is a beautiful tranquil place to escape the heat, noise and madness of Marrakesh. The garden is beautiful and well maintained although a bit on the small side. I thought entrance fee was a little expensive considering you can do the gardens in under an hour. If you appreciate gardens and want to learn a little about the Moroccon culture and history than go for it. You won't be disappointed.
Beautiful and unexpected, lovely for photos. A beautiful place and well worth a visit, Thankfully we went early so avoided all the crowds, worth doing. Lovely and cool in the shade too,

Tranquil spot in a chaotic city. The gardens were a nice place to get away from the noise and madness of the square, and the heat of Marrakech. Well-maintained gardens with a wide variety of different plants to see, and all have interesting explanatory plaques. It's a nice place to walk around, to sit in the quiet surroundings, and get away from the madness.

Top ranked in Morocco? Seriously?. Look, I'm no expert on Morocco, no expert on beauty, no expert on horticulture. But, you don't need to be an expert in any of these to recognize this garden is probably the most gorgeous in Morocco. It's no wonder that the former home of YSL is ranked highest in the country. This oasis is a retreat from the heat, the masses and the hectic outside world. The gardens are fairly small--an hour or two is enough even for photo enthusiasts. The soothing architecture and vibrant colors make this sanctuary almost magical. If they'd only have a spa next to the quaint cafe, it'd be perfect. (By the way, skip paying extra for the museum--it's tiny and the types of wares inside can be seen at other Moroccan museums. Really, save your money for the cafe instead.)

So peaceful ànd colourful, really lovely !!!. Lovely day out in the gardens,it's lovely and colourful and plenty of shade on a hot day !! The Berber museum was extra to view but was worth it. Had the history of the Berbers very interesting and informative.

highlight was the berber museum. Unless you love YSL you will not be impressed with much here beyond a saturated blue house and a desert garden. However, if you pay a few extra dollars for the Berber museum, you will be enchanted with tribal photos, artifacts, and clothing. This was a beautiful introduction to the original tribes of Morocco before seeing more of the culture in the Atlas Mountains and Sahara Desert.

Tranquil scenery in a small garden. The Gardens were tranquil and an oasis amidst the hot dusty chaos of central Marrakech. It was expensive considering the size of the Gardens; probably took 30 mins to walk the entirety (mistakenly I was expecting something more akin to a botanic garden, or city park) but if you've been seen everything else in Marrakech, then this isn't a bad way to while away the time.

Beautiful scenic garden. Early morning or late afternoon is best to avoid crowds. It's much hotter at midday too although not unbearable for there are many trees. It opens 8AM to 5PM, Drop by at the cafe too, it's lovely.

Beautiful, a must for Yves Saint Laurent fans. . Worth the visit, the gardens are lovely and the museum, while small (can get round it in 10-15 minutes) is nice if you are interested in Berber culture.
Jardin Majorelle.. Visited, but was not so impressed. It is recommended by many in Marrakech; I think due to the fame of Laurent, but also the respite from the energy and busyness of the city.

Well worth a visit. A beautiful calm oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Shouldn't be missed. We took a horse and carriage ridge from the main square that included a stop here. Entrance price is extremely good value.
Colourful oasis. Nice little garden for an afternoon walk, photography and coffee at the cafeteria. Price can probably be revised to match the size of the garden.
Nice garden for a short visit.... A nice place to click a few photos and appreciate the landscaping done. An hour will probably suffice to explore it fully.
paradise. Must go and see! Strolling through the gardens of YSL is an experience not to miss. You feel like your in paradise.

Garden is disappointing, Berber museum is fasciinating. I was very disappointed in these gardens. The plants and planting is very uninspiring. However, the Berber museum inside the gardens is well worth a visit. I found that much more interesting.

arrive early. this is such a peaceful and tranquil space. I recommend arriving as early as possible and getting to a quiet spot in the garden and sitting quietly- there are fewer more placid spaces in Marrakech.

Tranquil. We loved this garden. It was a little oasis in the heart of Marrakech.and definitely worth a visit. The Berber museum was also interesting though we felt a little pressurised by staff dictating what we looked at when and being pushy about where we wanted to stand to read the English guides due to poor lighting.

Just simply beautiful. It's not a very big garden but it's definitely worth the visit. I'm very glad YSL saved the garden from the contractors. If you're an artist or photographer I would factor in plenty of time here. If you like just looking, an hour or so will do but I would recommend going with your book or a friend to chat with and spend time appreciating the surroundings and colourful contrasts. Use the many benches and take in the loveliness compared to the chaos outside.

A nice trip away from the chaos of the souks . Although slightly more expensive than the other attractions in marrakech this garden is very well maintained. The garden is filled with towering bamboo which in turn means it is not too hot. There is a museum (costs a little bit more) which has some interesting exhibitions. Worth a visit.

Beautiful haven of tranquillity . In a city of bustling noise, smells and chaos, this really is a lovely retreat. Kept beautifully and maintained to a very high standard, I'd recomend a visit whether interested in Yves Saint Lauren or not.
Lovely. We visited the gardens and where impressed with the layout and style, well worth a visit if you come to Marrakesh it's got to be on the list.

Beautiful !. We went there a few days ago, We didn't take our 3 children with us thought it would be too hot as it was 42 degrees C (youngest one is 4) but actually it is quite shaded and my youngest would of loved to have walked round there .To enter the gardens you pay 70 Dirhams which is about £4.55 and to enter the museum its 30 dirhams approx £1.95.The designer the late Yves Saint Laurent use to visit this garden with his partner years ago and then bought the land to stop a Hotel from being built there so he kept it as a garden but made it more appealing - I think it's very pretty and if you like taking pictures you will love this garden as the colours are beautiful ! It is suitable for young and old families couples or even if you just by yourself !

Great photo opportunities. I wish I were better at photography because this would be a great place to take amazing pictures. The gardens are perhaps small in comparison to other attractions but it is definitely worth spending a morning here. When you convert the entry price into pounds it is not that much considering how much the upkeep of the place must be.

Well worth a visit to escape the city!. This is a beautiful place! well worth a visit...biggest bamboo Ive ever seen!! Cafe also nice and lovely walled garden... (they also have fine mist sprays to cool you down!... Really beautiful colours and plants ...

A nice garden, but overpriced and overrated. The garden is indeed a haven of quiet, but at 70 Dirham vastly overpriced (museums in Marrakech cost 10 Dirhams!). The plants may be rare and exotic, but the arrangement is simple; the water basin and canal and the building are Bauhaus inspired blue concrete - no comparison to islamic architecture.

Gardens are okay. . The garden itself is beautiful but it not a place that you could stay for maximum of up to an hour. We took an excursion with out rep that included a few additional things ( horse ride etc ) for this reason we had an enjoyable afternoon.
Amazing colours, interesting museum. Lovely gardens with beautiful colours of buildings and fountains. Nice courtyard cafe for a drink as well.

Overpriced. I think the YSL 'brand' is the only thing going for this place. I expected luxury and decadence. I expected a really peaceful experience away from the chaos. Unfortunately it's VERY EXPENSIVE and very out of the way for what at most is a 30 minute visit? If even?If you were really into photography, I can understand the appeal. It is a photographer's 'dream' except that it is so crowded with tourists that no matter what angle you took the photo someone was in it.We paid over 100dh for entry to the garden and in to the museum. The museum was a complete let down - a total of three rooms with not much to see, we walked in and out within 3 minutes! They have a cheek to have a gift shop (which is bigger than the actual exhibits!)When we visited, there were a lot of bins sitting out and staff maintaining the ground so they spoiled any photos we took. The benches were freshly painted with wet paint signs so you couldn't sit down and take in the 'sights.' We noticed that a lot of the garden had been vandalised with graffiti or etched into the plants.If the taxi and entry fee wasn't so expensive, maybe I could have enjoyed it.If you're a photographer, yes, go, (early to avoid the crowds) but I wouldn't bother with the expense for a walk that takes less than 10 minutes!

A great deal of blue..... The gardens I believe are owned or designed by Yves St Laurent, either way they are somewhat expensive to enter but nice to walk round. Lots and lots of Mediterranean blue...which looks good in the heat, reminded me of Essaouira and all the blue there...maybe Yves got his idea from that coastal town ? Lots of alors and huge cacti which are well kept and tended, nice for a walkabout.
Not worth it. Nice, but not that special. Small. And it's 70dhs. Best thing is cafe across the street. Try looking afield for a true park experience

Beautiful.. We went here on a morning (as it is a bit cooler then) and went by cab from our hotel. It is a very nice garden, it is maintained excellently. And it has a surprisingly calm atmosphere, even with all the people wandering in the garden. The entrance is quite cheap. Definitely worth visiting.

Beautiful. Visited the gardens on a hot afternoon - but the gardens made it feel like a cool evening !Lots of trees , plenty of shade and well maintained plants .The tribute to YSL is We had a nice wander around and soaked in the atmosphere .
Beautiful.. Beautiful gardens, lovely little cafe. Not as much relaxation areas as you'd expect in a garden. Takes well under an hour to walk around. Worth a visit, especially as it's cheap to enter.

Beatiful, peaceful and calming,. Marrakesh can be overwhelming, so a chance to visit these beautiful gardens is a rewarding experience. The grounds are impeccable, whit a great variety of color displays. The museum containing clothing and jewellery provides a history of the Moroccan people and there traditions. A great way to relax and find peace with the world again.

Garden hideaway. Amazing garden in middle of city. Modest access price to see an amazing garden with eas paths to follow to the many corners, coffee shop, museum, small gallery. A nice twist in a busy city.
nice garden. nice relaxing garden with nice trees, and a few flowers. cheap entrance fee and worth visiting as well.

Onassis of calm. Well kept garden that will give you some piece and quiet if that is what you need after a few hours in the soukes. Not too much walking involved, plenty of shady places to sit, good cafe, a couple of shops, photo opportunities - enjoy the ambiance.
Worth a visit. These gardens are very beautiful and well worth a visit if you are visiting Marrakesh. On a hot day they can provide shady relief. Situated a little way outside the old town

Amazing, peaceful and fully worth a visit. Me and my friends had googled these gardens before our visit to Marrakech and knew that we wanted to go....once we arrived we were not dissapointed. My husband stayed at our hotel while me and my two friends took the visit. This is not really his thing but i did tell him after i think he would have really enjoyed it. Once there you feel like you are in a completly different area to the hustle and bustle of the city. It is so peaceful and tranquil that walking round you just have a constant smile on your face seeing the beautiful and vibrant colours, the amazing differnt cactus and plants and just genrally having a very calming experience. Yes it is just a garden but it just seems to have a differnt feel to it then 'just a garden'. At a gradual walking pace you will be there for a hour but if you want to visit the museum in the garden do allow a little longer. It is cooling with all the shade but we did arrange to go early in the morning which also meant that there were not very many people arround fighting to get a good picture or taking away the calmness. There is no wonder why this is a top rated thing to do in Marrakech and i for one highly reccommend it.

what a beautiful place. amaizing place to visit while in marrakech . far from the crowded medina and it is much better to be visited in the afternoon . we walked from our riad from the medina and we had good time in the garden . not to be missed .

"Yes, the Jardin Majorelle is beautiful, but not worth the fee!". As the temperatures were soaring, the prospect of a garden stroll sounded tempting. The garden is beautiful, but very small. Even walking slowly, it would be a 15 minute stroll, and for the trouble it took to get there from the centre, I would concentrate on other public gardens, and not spent the money on Yves Saint Laurent's private garden.
Best time in Marrakesh.. An oasis in the madness of the city. Worth a visit. Peaceful - no hassles!! Cafe is also worth a stop.

Perfect little oasis. A beautiful, colorful garden in the middle of Marrakech. Great to stroll through on a hot day or when you need a break from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The only small down side is that it's pretty far from other attractions or places you find yourself in Marrakech so to say. Nevertheless, a must see!

beautiful setting and peaceful break from the city. We’d been warned not to go with high expectations to Jardin Marjorelle but I loved it. The gardens are only a short taxi journey away from the main square (roughly 30MAD) and are the perfect place to get some space away from the bustling city. The gardens are not huge but they are beautiful so if, like me, you love taking photos then it’s easy to spend the morning there. My friends and I enjoyed a delicious tagines and some mint tea in the café too. There’s a couple of nice shops and cafes on the nearby street where you can shop without haggling. Overall a lovely day out and definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful sanctuary. A calm oasis in the northern Gueliz part of the city. Managed to bypass the queues by going in as a small group. Mainly palms, cacti, bamboo, interspersed by pools and streams. The fabulous blue pots and walls really set off the plants. A small museum of Islamic Art, worth a quick look and the gift shop has some fantastic leather goods, if price is not a deterrent! Really enjoyed strolling around, very relaxing.

Beautiful area of tranquility. Definitely worth visiting the gardens and museum The gardens are beautiful and tranquil - a huge variety of cacti, a pond with lilies that reminds one of a classic Monet paintings.The museum is stocked with Berber items and pleasantly air conditioned that makes a good break from the heat.

Average . I can only presume some of the previous reviewers we're visiting the gardens on certain days. The days when upon entering guests walk through a cloud of barely noticeable but potent opiates. Their experience is thus transformed from walking around a small uninteresting garden infested with rambling tourists. To an opulent garden - interesting - resplendent with an array of colourful and wild plants. A clever ploy from the owners but alas we went on a day where the cloud was absent.We were underwhelmed

Not to be missed. One of the highlights of Marrakech. Beautifully laid out, very clean, and with an impressive collection of cacti. The vibrant Majorelle blue complements the greenery of the garden, and the red and yellow flower pots dotted around the alleyways create a very pleasant contrast. The cafe is situated in a very pleasant courtyard and do stop by for the Majorelle juice, a refreshing blend of healthy fruit. The Berber Museum is also worth a visit, especially the jewelry room which is most impressive. The boutique is quite overpriced, but then the Yves Saint Laurent memorial must be complemented by top-end jewelry and leather products.

Lovely relaxing garden - one of the best places in Marrakech. Definitely one of the best places we visited in Marrakech! Very peaceful, full of all kinds of beautiful plants from all over the world, with a lot of shade to escape the heat. We spent here entire morning, just relaxing and taking pictures.There is a cute little "Musee Berbere" inside - small but interesting setting. Also, there is "Galerie Love" - small gallery with posters which Yves Saint Laurent made as a kind of a New Years card. As a graphic designer, I have found this very interesting. You can buy reproduction of these in a shop inside the garden, but the best ones were all sold out :(There is also lovely little cafe inside - a bit pricey but they have water sprinkles :))) It comes as a refreshment when it's 46 degrees outside like it was when we visited...:)
Pretty. Very pretty but you would see it all in less than an hour, and so i think entry fee is too expensive for what is available. Some respite from heat but at a price. Not sure it is worth it.
A must in Marrakech. Nice and relaxing visit in crazy Marrakech.70mad per person.One of the most beautiful places to visit. Better to visit on the morning.

Cool!. Well worth a visit! It was mostly shaded so was lovely and cool- it was 45 degrees outside! Look out for the staff who offer to take photos for you. They keep snapping and won't give you back your camera/ phone until you pay them- usually 20 dirhams (around £1.50).

Beautiful Garden, relaxing. Take time , and if your a photographer, take even more time to get that special photo this place is packed. There are 3 shops that are across the street from the Jardin that also are worth stopping in that have Moroccan gift ideas, you would not see in the markets

Very interesting with lots of different types of plants.. I found this trip really good and I found it interesting as there were lots of different types of exotic plants which I had never seen before. There were walking paths which you would be walking through plants which was amazing as it felt like you were in a jungle. There is a pond in the middle which is great for taking pictures with family and friends. I would recommend it but try and take your time, don't rush it as it is quite small the garden.

Must-See in Marrakech. I loved walking around this beautiful garden right outside the city center of Marrakech. Famous for its "majorelle blue," which is striking and can be found all around on pots and buildings, this is a must-see!
A small oasis. Beautiful gardens in the centre of a busy city, plenty of plants and things to see, has a delightful little cafe for refreshments, cheap to get in also

Just an OK experience. Was not impressed with the gardens. Good if you are just trying to burn a few minutes of your day, but not entirely worth the trip there. Took a few pictures and walked around for maybe 30 minutes.
Relaxing hour or so.. A nice place to spend a slow walk and rest for an hour or so. Especially in mid summer when the temperature is in the forties.
Good Place to Begin. Very peaceful and beautiful. A terrific Berber Museum on site as well. It was a great place to begin my journey
