When you look for a shadow in Marrakesh. Great place to visit, located in the north, outside of Medina. Entrance fee is a bit too high- my eprsonal opinion, as the garden is not that big. You need max 30 min to walk it through

Worth the walk. A bit of a walk from the place we were staying, but well worth it. The garden is beautiful, the museum is well laid out (though some dates would be good), and the cafe had some very tasty ice-creams.

Gardens of Boredom. Nice Gardens
well maintained
clean
not worth the over priced entry fee
good for pensioners maybe (no offence)
wouldn't appeal for 18-40 y,olds

An Oasis of Tranquillity. We were staying in the centre of Marrakesh so we took a Taxi, but most of the horse carriages from the main square can also take you for a similar fee.The Garden is quit small but perfectly formed, it is surrounded by high walls on all sides that do a great job in shielding it from the noise out side. Its an easy walk around the garden with plenty of spots to sit and soak in the peace. The birds are drawn to the many trees and offer you a nice background chorus while you admire the garden.We enjoyed it so much that we went round it several times.There is a taxi rank and a carriage rank near by, there are also a number of restaurants just outside

Do not miss Yves St Laurent's Garden!. Beautiful gardens in a cool trendy part of town. I highly suggest paying the little extra to see the Berber Museum. The cafe was beautiful and the shop was to die for.
Must visiy. Very interesting and unusual garden,a must visit so tranquil and relaxing. Great place to take photos

Tranquil Oasis Island. A French friend of mine told me that this should be the one place I should visit if I do nothing else in Marrakech ... a garden? Well he was very right - as soon as you walk through the gates its like you have entered a beautiful and tranquil island and you also get to see the Berber Museum inside ... go - simple as that !

Interesting and Odd. The gardens on the property of the latter Yves St Laurent are diverse and interesting. I have to admit, for one not of a hugely botanical slant I found them interesting and exotic. That said, by Moroccan standards the entrance fee is high and the appeal does not match. It is a decent stop if you have time to kill, but not worth going out of your way for.

An Oasis amidst the chaos of Marrakesh. It was refreshing to see this lush garden of French designer Yves Saint Laurent and his partner Pierre Bergé. 300 species of plants from around the world! And for those who are fans of YSL, they have a memorial for him. Even if he died in Paris, his ashes were scattered in the palm trees and rose gardens here. The former villa is now a Berber cultural museum (worth your time!).

What a beautiful garden!. We took the kids (10 & 6) to the Jardins Majorelle - they loved it and so did we. If you love plants, water or design, this is a must when you are in Morocco. We also enjoyed the berber museum with its fabulous starry ceiling. We arrived early in the morning and there were queues already, so do be sure to arrive early if you don't like to queue. We had lunch in the cafe which was very nice (both food and looks-wise) and relatively expensive compared to other cafes, but of course it's one of the top tourist attractions in a major city, so only to be expected .
Colourful and interesting garden. Reasonable cost for a cool and beautiful garden in the middle of the city. Would recommend for all wanting a change of pace.
Nice and peaceful. Enjoyed strolling around the gardens at our leisure taking in all the plants and flowers that were in bloom. Museum gave a good account of Berber life.

Don't miss it!. A small but perfect garden with the most vibrant blues! We almost skipped this attraction- it is on the second "out of town" circle of the tourist bus- but it was with the 70 Dirham entrance! Don't skip the museum- again it is small but well maintained and informative. There us such an amazing story attached to this attraction that almost never was!!! Thanks YSL!

Beautiful gardens, well worth a visit whilst in Marrakech. We were pleasently surprised by the beauty and tranquility of these gardens. Had a relaxing & cool (in July) wander for an hour or so, before heading back to the craziness of the city! Well worth a visit

A peaceful shady retreat from busy Marrakech. We have been to this garden before and it was an easy stop for the bus driver to make on out hotel courtesy bus on this holiday so we were keen to revisit. The garden may be difficult to find if you are a newcomer to Marrakech as its down a small side street in the new town however it is worth the search. It's a beautiful shady garden filled with lush tropical trees and there is also a memorial to Yves Saint Laurent as he died in the town in 2008 and had spent time there. There is a little section at the side of the garden showing his famous LOVE prints, he created a new version every year. They were replica LOVE postcards in the gift shop which I bought several of. There is a small Berber museum within the gardens at a small extra cost. We found the museum very interesting with lots of traditional Berber costumes on display. Definitely worth going to for an hour or too but maybe not as a main event as garden is not huge. We had mint tea in the cafe which was very enjoyable but prices were possibly a little higher in reflection of it being a well known tourist attraction. Definitely worth the visit if you venture out of the busy square.

Simply Gorgeous!!. A great tranquil gardens with a superb cafe inside. It is a bit expensive for what it is as your unlikely to spend more than an hour in the entire place.Beware of the taxi driver and horse and carriages they will almost always try to rip you off.
Terrible and a waste of money. This was ranked very high on trip adviser and I have no idea why !! It's a pretty small garden with nothing nice to see really. Was expecting much better.

A must see. The Jardin Majorelle sounded too touristic for me and my sister insisted we visit. I didn't regret it as you are truly transported into Mr. Majorelle's world and passion. It's a short but beautiful stop.

Beautiful gardens by YSL. This is a great place to cool off in Marrakech. The garden has lots of shade and is well kept. It also hosts the Berber museum which is also worth a visit. The park was sponsored by Yves Saint Laurent and there is a gallery and shop where you can buy some more expensive leather goods and jewellery.

Beware of the taxi drivers outside. Jardin Majorelle is one of our favourite attractions in Marrakech, and it's definitely worth taking a trip there even it's quite far away from everything else. A lot of photo worthy spots, and staff are generally very helpful and are willing to take group photos for you.Because of its popularity, taxi drivers outside and around the garden are particularly unscrupulous. Consider walking back to the medina or only hail a taxi streets away from the garden. Our taxi ride from the riad to the garden cost us 15dh (negotiated price), and generally wherever we go drivers are happy to take anything under 20dh. The taxi driver accosted us outside the garden (who is a part of the 'official' taxi drivers with the Majorelle Taxi t-shirts), took us to the car and asked for 100dh. We left the taxi and walked a street away in a fury, and another taxi (independent driver we suppose) offered to use the meter, which turned out to be rigged, costing over 30dh for a much shorter distance. Our riad is near one of the mosques, and despite our insistence that we do not plan to go inside the mosque but back to our riad nearby, the driver said we could not go there and took us to a wrong area 15 min walk away from our riad. His friend on the street offered to show us the way (for the tip), even the riad is definitely reachable by the taxi.

Nice visit but not the best thing Marrakesh . The garden was nice to visit and makes for some nice photos. If you have a lot if time it is worth it however it is a little over priced for the size of it and not particularly Moroccan, in fact lots of the plants were from the Americas and so were already familiar to us.

LOVLIEST YSL GARDENS. The most visited gardens in Marrakesh, owned by French artist Jacques Majorelle, and bought by the famous designer Yves Saint Laurent, where he passed some of his last years. From the botanical point of view it is inmensly interesting, with plants such as the Pyjama striped Bamboo, but from the plastic and artistic point of view it is incredible. Walls and pots are painted in bright vibrant colours, such as orange, yellow, emerald green, an all over you can see the royal blue which is so lovely and so typical of the Mediterranean art.

Colorful. It is very colorful and the buildings are painted in very bright blue, yet I have seen better parks. It is relatively small and there is not a diversity of plants. There is a museum inside that is full of wonderful Berber jewelry and costumes. It is really worth visiting, yet almost everything is written in French.
stunning garden. we were advised to visit early and what great advice. we were able to wander peacefully, take loads of photos without the coach loads of people who arrived at midday! beautiful!

Tranquil gardens. This is a lovely place to visit in the heat of Marrakech and the gardens are beautiful. They are owned by Yves Saint Laurent and there is a memorial for him there. It's great to walk around here enjoying the scenery and sitting on the benches looking at the views of all the beautiful plants.

Primary colours. We loved the Jardin Majorelle: huge swathes of brightly painted primary colours surround immaculate gardens of bamboo, cactus, agave and flowering trees and shrubs. A must see for any visitor to Marrakech.

Beautiful retreat from crazy city. Any traveller in Marrakech is likely to want a break from the bustling souks and squares at some stage and the Jardin Majorelle provides exactly this and in some style. You feel immediately refreshed as soon as you walk through the front gate and whilst the garden is not huge, it is beautifully designed.The sorbets in the admittedly overpriced cafe were also some of the best I've ever tried and definitely worth splashing out on.

Marrakech at it's best. On a very hot day there was only one place to go. Majorelle Garden (the Yves St Laurent Garden) is a delight that matches its fame. Visit early to miss the crowds and try and go solo rather than with a tour. The design is well known but the reality is even better. The colours are breath taking and planting reminds you of your North African location along with the European influences. Do stop and enjoy a refreshing Mint Tea in the on site Cafe.

Worth the walk. The walk from our hotel in the Medina was a good leg stretcher.. we found a shorter way back! - but well worth the effort. Fascinating history. Bit of a queue to get in. Well worth putting on your 'must see' list

Must see in Marrakech!. Beautiful gardens are worth a visit, the wonderful vibrant colours amongst the plants and trees are gorgeous. The temperature in here seemed cooler than outside the gardens, which was a reprieve. If you're a student don't forget your student card as the entrance fee is half price with one.

Oasis of calm. A really lovely garden to visit in the summer heat of Marrakech . Really beautifully designed. We took lots of pictures. A small ethnographic museum within the grounds is interesting but seems unrelated to the garden. The cafe is a lovely spot to stop for a mint tea. A cool spray of water around the perimeter wall keeps the place cool. Prices are a little high by morroccan standards. Watch out for the taxi drivers outside, who really want to overcharge from this spot. We bargained hard but with hindsight it might have been better to walk a little distance from the garden and hail a cab .

Just as Good second time round. Its three years ago since we visited these gardens and as you can imagine things haven't changed much but that doesn't matter as this place is a must visit when in Marrakech. The blue of the buildings as chosen by St Laurent is magical

An oasis of a garden - must visit if in Marrakech. Though this is one of the most 'touristy' things to do in Marrakech, it is for a reason. Jardin Majorelle is truly one of a kind - it is a symbol of the colours, flora, and fauna that the city typefies in its architecture and interiors. It's also fascinating how they have managed to grow species from various countries in this garden. Great photo opportunities here, since there are so many vibrant colours and patterns wherever you walk.
Pretty. Pretty little space and the food in the afe was top notch. NOt sure if entry should be 70 dhirams though
Refreshing. In the middle of hot city there is a nice and refreshing garden. I recommended very much to visit it!
Beautiful Gardens (A bit expensive). Stunning gardens I'd advise to go for lunch or breakfast as the cafe looks amazing (we only got a fruit drink but food looked lovely).

Escape to the gardens!. A lovely little oasis in the hectic city of Marrakech. Wander through the beautiful gardens (and marvel at how the leaves all stay so green in the sweltering heat!!!) The famous 'Majorelle' blue adorns everything, and it really is a beautiful colour. I would highly recommend going into the Museum and Shop as well as Yves Saint Laurent's 'Love' Gallery, which houses all his beautiful artworks that he would do annually.We also visited the cafe which serves lovely food and refreshments, whilst spraying you in cool breezes of water, and the Wifi is good there too if you ask for the code!A must-see in Marrakech.

Enjoy the fauna as well as the flora. A nice escape from the Medina and the only place worth visiting in the "new" city. The paths are well kept and plants are well labelled. Keep an eye out for the fauna around the ponds.Plenty of benches to sit and take in the natural beauty.
YSL gardens. bright blues , yellows , greens , and cacti everywhere , lovely hour walking around this peaceful garden . x

Tranquility epitomised. Such elegant grounds as you would expect from Yyves st Laurent, You meander along well kept paths with bamboo rails and can see lush cacti from many regions as well as a variety of other interesting flora.The Berber museum is a must where under a starry sky beautiful Berber jewellery is tastefully displayed and reflected in artfully placed mirrors There is another room too devoted to traditional Berber costume also well worth seeing.Finally try to take in the elegant cafe, where tables are laid in a courtyard and a fine mist dehumidifies the air. Service is prompt, staff ate very polite and helpful and the range of teas was amazing but not overwhelming. Very reasonably priced too for such an elegant environment.a must for botanists or if you just admire beauty.

beautiful gardens!. We spent a lovely couple of hours in these beautiful gardens. We ended up having to take a taxi from gueliz and glad we did as would have been a long walk in the morrocan heat. Definitely pay the extra 30dhs to go to the Berber museum. Truly inspirational. Well worth the taxi fare for this tranquil escape from the busy city!!

It is such a lovely gardens. Very unsual plants and catcus.It is better than Kew gardens in London.. You must not miss this unique gardens. Very impressive and take your breath away. The layout of the gardens are special and it is not expensive to get in. Spend the full day there.. Very impress of the people and maintain the gardens so well.

beautiful colours and planting. Beautiful gardens vibrant colours the blue is amazing contrast to the tropical planting very well laid out very busy but I guess that's because it's popular small cafe for a drink was good gardens are on the small side

Green oasis in the red city. Cool, well organised garden owned by a French foundation (YSL). Really relaxing place to visit (if there are not too many visitors). Berber museum was worth the additional fee, I thought. However, entry fees not a barrier.

Do you believe in Chromotherapy?. Jardin Majorelle is a lovely place in Marrakech: you should definitely not miss it... But beyond its fresh and shady environment - given by its plants - and quietness, what will capture your attention is the large use of cobalt blue for every manufacture. From buildings to fountains, from railings to benches: everything is blue! According to Ayurvedic Medicine, blue is known as able to give “physical and spiritual communication”, and - although it takes time and you should stay here more than the minimum time - I think there's something true in it.Highly recommended!http://photographingaround.me/2015/07/22/jardin-majorelle-marrakech-blue/

Lovely visit. The Jardin Majorelle is a lovely peaceful garden full of colour, and one of the few places in Marrakech where you can enjoy yourself without constant heckling. It's a nice change of pace if you are spending a while in this whirlwind of a city. Pity about the abhorrently rude cab drivers outside, but just lovely inside!

Beautiful. Lovely gardens, small but delightful. Only part of the original are available to the public. good amout of shade provided by the trees, so comfortable to walk around in the heat. Nice cafe inside for a tea etc

Stunning. Very worthy of a visit it cost 100 MAD each to visit the garden and Berber Museum plus taxi but was worth every penny. you will be stunned by the silence you would think you were in a remote monastery not in the middle of Marrakech. The gardens are visually a work of art.

YSL gardens. We got there by the horse and carriage service from the main square just opposite the Kutobia mosque. The place is very nice and give you a chance to relax and get away from the busy Medina. Very nice botanical garden with many different plants, a good photo opportunity. Nice cafe.

overpriced tourist trap. The shop was good, but there's little to see and it's very crowded with tourists. Certainly not the oasis of calm you might expect. Would only be worth going if you were planning on visiting the museum also- it's a taxi out from the medina.

A highlight of our trip to Marrakech. A fairytale garden housing exotic and beautiful plants from 5 continents, and the studio of Jaques Majorelle- a setting that seems to have jumped straight out of one of his paintings. A must see whilst visiting Marrakesh. More expensive than other attractions but well worth it.

A marvelous oasis!. The garden was a wonderful break from the blistering heat (45 degrees!) , offering a tranquil oasis of calm and stillness away from the bustling streets. We purchased our tickets from polite staff members, and the two guards on the door were enjoying a funny joke. We were given an information booklet upon arrival, which gave us basic but proficient information for us to get a feel of the gardens, and I don’t think in that heat we could have retained any further information!The pathways were clean and clear and obviously well kept. There were a few maintenance workers doing their day to day routines, which added to the ‘living canvas’ feel. All the plants looked well kept, and the pots and paintwork look fresh. The toilets were very clean, and a café was a welcomed treat at the end of our visit. The shop staff were quite snooty, and didn’t seem as friendly as the other staff, and didn’t seem to want to help us look for a souvenir, perhaps we weren’t dressed posh enough. The poster gallery was clean and inviting and again, was a nice addition. In conclusion, a must see attraction, away from the rush of old town, where we were staying. Worth the money, and a beautiful sight. It could have been more signposted from the main road, as we got quite lost on route.

Beautiful Gardens. These are beautiful gardens paths wind around he grounds pass lots of Cactus and beautiful flowers.A huge pond by the House with several smaller ones dotted around.There is a small museum which was quite interesting, a very expensive shop but with some beautiful leather gifts for sale. There is also a very nice cafe with indoor & outdoor areas the food and drink offered are of very good quality and a nice place to spend a hour or 2.

Marjorelle blue. We took a taxi from the square for 40 d , arrived about 11 am in 40 degree heat , it was already quite busy , the gardens were set out in winding paths with lovely marjorelle blue buildings dotted around the plant displays a very restful place with only the sounds of the many variety of birds , we had a nice coffee in the cafe although a little expensive . We'll worth a visit to this place .
Brilliant !!!!. Absolutely superb place to visit and a Must when in Marrakesh. Lovely and peaceful place. Museum is great too.
An oasis of calm in Marrakesh. Very beautiful gardens with lots of cacti. It's a bit smaller than the website and some guidebooks might lead you to believe, but still worth a visit.

a major disappointment. YSL's association really set up high expectations but NO. Pathetic water feature as y go in and in reality just an overgrown garden of troplcal plants none of which were particularly interesting or grand. Not worth the visit.

A must do in Marrakech. I think this is one of the best things to see in Marrakech. I loved spending time in every part of the gardens. Although they are much smaller than I imagined, it was so special and unique. I loved it. The café is delicious, the shop is expensive but has totally unique items and the museum is fascinating.

Worth the visit, easy access from the jump on/off bus.. We loved this garden a spot of order and peace in a chaotic Marrakesh. Not huge and doesn't take more than an hour to tour but worthwhile. Loved the cactus. There was a Berber Museum inside we didn't visit. Restaurant inside very overpriced for Marrakesh but had a nice $6 smoothie.
peaceful and tranquill. Visit you wont be disappointed and will be surprised. Get a Kalesh (horse and carriage) from the Koutoubia mosque.

The beautiful garden YSL. The garden is not big, but it has a fantastic atmosphere. An oasis of green in a fairly uninteresting part of town. An impressive collection of cacti from around the world. It is worth paying a bit more about the see Berber art museum. Just a beautiful place. An excellent example of how European taste can be inspired by North Africa.
Excellent Garden!. Lovely colours and there is a museum tucked away inside. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip!

beautiful colors and great botanical experience. Lovely garden and very different variety of things i had never seen before. The blue colors are beautiful as is the pond. The cactus are really different as well. this is just a very peaceful, lovely place to visit out of the ordinary from the busy hustle and bustle of the Medina.

Pretty but over too quickly. These gardens are gorgeous. They combine bright colours with cool, architecture plants. It's a lovely, refreshing break from the bustle of Marrakech. Interesting Berber culture museum. Loved the garden cafe here. Gorgeous environment to sit and read a book and sip a mint tea. The garden is smaller than I expected so you can cover it easily in a hour or so.
Unforgettable. Best site by far in Marrakech.Beautiful oasis away from all the hassle. Loved the Gallery of Love and the gift shops too.

Rather small for the price, but a good way to spend an hour or two.. After all the rave reviews I was expecting a bit more. We walked from the Medina (and thus saw, for the only time, the modern Marrakesh). A bit of a line for the tickets, then the small, but interesting gardens plus the small, but interesting museum. We enjoyed it, though it was a little more expensive than most things in Marrakesh.

Magical Place. Amazing place, especially for photographers. As you enter the garden, you feel isolated from the crowded noisy hot streets of Marrakech and it feels totally magical, with all the colors and plants and trees and fountains.. A must see.

A true oasis on the fringe of central Marakech!. A true oasis on the fringe of central Marrakech. If you like cobalt blue this is the famous theme. Friendly staff on hand to also be your photographer. Shaded covered areas also to escape the midday heat.
Magnificent garden. One can not visit Marrakech without spending a few hours in the gorgeous Gardens of Ives Saint Laurent!! The flowers, pottery and colorfully lined paths are amazing!!

Cool retreat.. Very interesting cacti collection from North and South America. About 20° f cooler than outside the jardin. Restaurant good, prices a little high. Barber museum is interesting, but not a must.

A little Oasis. A beautiful but quite small garden which takes you away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. Lovely plants and some beautiful birds to see. The café is really nice too. There is a YSL museum too but we didn't see this.

Peaceful break from the busy Medina. Beautiful, peaceful garden with gorgeous palms and plants just outside the Medina. A welcome respite from the heat and noise. Excellent mint tea in the trendy café nearby. Walking distance from the Medina along busy road or hop in a taxi.

Serenity in the city.. A beautiful sanctuary of calm nestled within the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. A must visit for those looking for a little greenery in this dusty city. Take a camera - you won't be disappointed!
May be a bit expensive. It may be a bit expensive for what it offers, but its a nice place to check it out and walk around for some time.

Nice garden. You need to visit this garden, specially if is too hot while you are in Marrakech. It's a true oasis in the middle of the city. You can find nice shadows there. Be aware that if you buy the student ticket you need to buy another ticket for the museum and it will be more expensive, than if you bought both at the main entrance.

Paradise. This garden is like paradise in the center of the very manic Marrakech. A nice place to visit and relax after shopping in the souks. The only shame is the graffiti etched onto all of the bamboo/plants around the garden.

Stunning!!. Amazing hidden Gem in the heart of Marrakesh. The gardens are shaded which gives you a nice break from the beaming heat! There are some amazing exotic plants to see, along with crazy paving and the YSL memorial. Recommend a visit, entry is cheap also!

Definitely worth seeing, and a peaceful oasis. A lovely place to take in, relax, and to walk to other areas in Marrakech. Take a horse drawn carriage to the museum. The foliage and the YSL posters are worth the admission, and are very interesting and relaxing. Walkable from there back to other major attractions
Beautiful. Beautiful gardens!!! I would love to go back and take more time to check everything out. We had an amazing time here and at the gallery.

Garden. Its a pretty garden, but a bit far from the medina. Would suggest it as a quick thing to do for tourists staying the new city part of Marrakech, but there is so much other historical beauty to see, I wouldn't spend long here.

Beautiful gardens. These gardens are an oasis of colour and taste, surely worth a visit, even though they are quite expensive for non-locals (the entry to the gardens costs 70 dirhams, and the entry to the museum costs 30 dirhams).

An escape from the crazy. What a beautiful and calming oasis just outside the craziness of the Medina. Lots of shade and a gorgeous cafe, although expensive compared to more central restaurants - lovely juices and Moroccan omelette made it worth it though.

A relaxing visit if you have some spare time . I don't think I would have regretted it too much if I didn't go but it's a nice few hour event if you do go. It was quite packed with people when i was there but I think it could be great for families with smaller kids. I do however strongly recommend the Berber museum at the heart of the garden, it was my favourite part of the trip as it gives a good idea of the national identity of the people.

A highlight of our visit to Marrakesh! . This garden is such an amazing haven - it's striking design and in the heart of busy Marrakesh! My only regret is not taking a book to sit and enjoy it for hours.It's a must do on your visit, and I also recommend the cafe on the corner opposite the entry to the garden. We were incredibly sick of tagines and it offered delicious cheap sandwiches in a pretty hip/trendy cafe (with free wifi). The attached design store, though not cheap, had some of the best Moroccan wares we saw whilst visiting. A gorgeous little part of the city!

Unmissable during a visit to Marrakesh!. The Jardin Marjorelle are definitely worth a visit - they are so beautiful and not that big, so even a few hours is enough time to walk around and see them. Nice selection of shops and cafes near the entrance to the gardens, too if you want a change from the Souks!

Not our thing!. Visited last year in May! It was a beautiful garden but we expected more really. People are more attracted to the fact that Yves Saint Laurent lived here, rather than the actual gardens. Very well maintained and kept and doesn't feel like it's in the centre of Marrakesh. There was a museum of his house but this was an extra cost. So if you want to spend two hours looking at trees plants and painted walls then you will love it! I appreciate history but this lacks it but does have beauty.

Yves St Laurent. The garden attached to the villa owned by Yves St Laurent. Collections of plants colours and themes, well worth going to visit but note the villa is not open to visit. Every guide or taxi can take you there but ignore the sellers who will try and sell you their wares.

Tranquil jardin majorelle gardens. Beautiful tranquil gardens with interesting berber museum, it was well worth a look, you must pay for both garden & museum on entry or you won't be able to get into the museum.the staff here were very happy to take photographs of you in the gardens.

Beautiful gardens. Hardin major else is a fantastic attraction situated in the busy city of Marrakech.It is well worth the €5 entry fee and has many beautiful water features, hanging baskets and floral arrangements. The garden is not too large to walk around and is shaded from the scorching sun, therefore you can walk around the tranquil gardens at your own pace.

Breathtaking oasis of nature and architecture. I gasped when we first entered into the gardens. The cacti are Mother Nature's architecture - a vast panorama beautifully arranged and maintained. The Morroccan blue on the walls, huge earthan jugs in vibrant oranges and yellows, and a reflecting pool overhung with flowers and vines. The gardens are extraordinary, but DO NOT MISS the Berber Museum. The room that displays the jewelry is dark, lit only by a ceiling of lights that looked like stars. The lovely tea room is also a must, with beverages and scrumptious food in a beautiful courtyard. Be sure to take the horse drawn carriage back to your hotel!
Beautiful peaceful place. Take 45 mins out of a bustling day in central Marrakech and visit these gardens..... stunning and so picturesque.

Great artists live on.... In stark contract to the hustle and bustle of the medina you can see why Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Bergé were seduced by this garden when they first came to Marrakech in 1966. It's wonderful to see the mature planting of the garden and the vibrant colours that are a feast to the eye. Shame that people feel the need to deface the bamboo by scoring their names across it.

Gorgeous!. Don't miss this attraction! It's really beautiful and peaceful. Go early before the crowds, enjoy the setting and vibrant colors. The plants are really cool, the rather expensive boutique is fun to browse through and the Berber museum is excellent -- definitely buy that ticket too.

Beautiful oasis in the middle of Marrakech. The gardens are well stocked and kept clean and tended. The history of the Jardin Marjorelle is very interesting and the sketches by Yves Saint Laurent are worth a look. We had a traditional Morrocan tea in the cafe here which I would recommend
Awesome. Beautiful garden & souvenir shop. Well worth a visit if you are in Marrakech as you can cover it about 1 hour.
Beautiful looking and calm Jardin, enjoy the blue!. Little Garden that is just the right size for a nice visit and enjoying the shades and the blue color of Majorelle.

A Must See & Do in Marrakech. The Jardin Majorelle gardens are superb, the story behind this beautiful art deco property is alluring. But the 'piece de resistance' is the amazing Berber Museum housed in the same grounds. If you want to learn more about the Amazigh culture this is the place to inform you, an outstanding collection of Berber adornments will mesmerize. Keep a good few hours aside to visit & really absorb this wonderful space.
YSL House. For the fashion lovers or not, the gardens of YSL house are amazing and deserve a visit! Prepare yourself and camera for some great pictures and lots of color!
Beatiful spot!!. Nice that YSL bought and left this place spectacular.. So beautiful and nice.. A must stop during a visit of Marrakech. The gardens are amazing...

A must see. A definite must see, absolutely stunning garden. Lovely place to spend your time, even when its blazing hot as there are many trees to provide shade and a lovely cafe to get a nice refreshing drink. This is where that beautiful Moroccan blue paint comes from. If you like the paint BUY IT! You cannot get the same colour in the UK, believe me, I've tried.
Ok but not exceptional.. We enjoyed the museum and the gardens but we were not overwhelmed and I would not rush to return. The museum was good.
Beautiful Garden. Not as big as I thought it would be from the guide books but still a lovely way to spend half a day in Marrakech. Enjoyed our visit and recommend.

Highlight of my trip. This is by far the most professional of the attractions in Marrakech. Privately owned by the Fondation Pierre Berger, it is fabulously maintained and in the best possible taste. Well worth the visit.

Beautiful. As you walk through the doors into the gardens it's like you've travelled into a different world. This place is just so tranquil and provides a welcome relief from the busy city. The ponds and water features are just stunning. There are benches all around so you can just take a minute to soak up the atmosphere. The gardens are extremely well thought out with interest at all levels. An absolute must to visit. We spent 45 minutes in there but could quite happily have stayed longer.
So pretty . Very pretty gardens with lots of interesting plants from all over the world. Lovely surrounding & a cute cafe at the end serving lots of lovely smoothies & food.

Beautiful gardens, short visit . This beautiful garden was about 15 minutes from our hotel in the Medina via taxi. It cost 70 MAD for the garden entrance, another 30 for the museum. We opted only for the garden. It was beautiful, but smaller than we anticipated. We allotted quite a bit more time there than we actually needed. Bring a camera to capture the colors and plant life. The garden is nicely shaded with options for relief from the sun if you need it. They have a small cafe, museum, gallery and gift shop. Certainly a lovely place to visit and would recommend it to all!

Nice oasis in hot Marrakech. When you enter it it looks like a paradise. High trees gives a lot of shadow that you'll love in 40 degrees of heat. Beautiful and full of color. It,s not to big as I was expecting. We spent less then an hour in there, including berber museum that is located inside. they have cafe inside too but we didn't go there so can't say anything about it. Very nice place to visit.
It was ok. Its a nice tranquil little garden with a decent shaded restaurant , A little bit off the beaten track, not much else to say really . pleasant enough but not outstanding
beautiful gardens to visit. one of the best places to visit in marrakech, beautiful gardens of majorelle,recomended attraction to visit while you are in marrakech

A garden of delight. The profusion of flowers in vibrant colors, the tranquil ponds, this a wonderful place to visit! It is a fitting memorial to aves St Laurent, and the museum is superb! The museum shop has a fabulous selection of high quality leather accessories , and silk scarves.

An oasis in Marrakech. One word describes this oasis in Marrakech, stunning. The gardens are peaceful and we'll laid out and you don't have to que which in the heat is a result. One wish I have is that I lived within the walls, they are relaxing even with the amount of people who visit, as you never feel crowded.
A great visit. It's not huge, but it's so beautiful and calming. There Berber museum was amazing and definitely worth the 30 dh.

Lovely respite from the Medina- time well spent. Beautiful gardens to wander and restore yourself in a calm and tranquil setting (although some visitors get a bit pushy doing selfies and other photos). Best to arrive early to avoid crowds.

So peaceful. We caught a taxi to the gardens from our Riad. As a note, getting a taxi afterwards back to where you need to go isn't a problem as there are lots lined up outside. The cost was 100MAD (approx £10) entrance fee for both the gardens and the museum. The gardens are well kept and a great escape from the heat of the city. You can take as long as you like to walk around. The house in the centre is fabulous and the guides will happily take plenty of pictures of you (for a small tip) the museum was ok. I preferred the gardens. The cafe is expensive but great for a cool down with the cool water mist they spray as you sit in the garden area. Definitely with a trip.

Stunning Yves Saint Laurent Gardens. This place is a must to visit when visiting Marrakech. The gardens was spectacular as well as the Berber Museum which was very informative. We also enjoyed a fantastic lunch and refreshments in the beautiful cafe set within the gardens.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful gardens. This was a welcome trip, allowing us to escape the centre of Marrakech for a little while. On a really hot day, it was lovely to stroll in the shade around the gardens. If you go into the museum, the jewellery section was particularly stunning. A very clever use of space!

Well worth a visit!. A really lovely oasis in the middle of a very hot Marrakech! Possibly a little pricey considering it is quite small and other attractions in Marrakech charge significantly less... But they are beautiful gardens so in my opinion worth the price.
Yves St.Laurent's garden in Marrakech.. Beautiful. The sense of beauty that this designer has shows through in this garden. Well worth a visit.

Show student card! . They don't say it but with student card it's worth 35 dhs, without it 70 (eventhough we saw it was 50 on Internet). It is really nice and fresh during summer. They where created by Majorelle and then reformed by Yves Saint Lauren.

Majorelle Gardens. Dont miss the Majorelle Gardens in Marrakesh, its an Oasis of green varieties and with a very interesting Museum.
Half a day is sufficient to visit.

Worth visiting if you have nothing else to di. I expected so much of this garden before i went, so I was little bit disappointed. It was a beautiful place but i felt like its worth visiting if you really really have nothing else to do.

Beautiful oasis of calm. A stunning oasis which is great for taking a break from the bustle of Marrakech. Great for wandering around for an hour and it has an interesting museum about Berber life - the highlight of which was the beautifully designed Berber jewellery room.
a good place to relax. Beautiful gardens and amazing colours it was Stunning all of it I would go and see it again. A good place to relax

Oasis in Marrakech. Lovely gardens and water features. Very relaxing with lots of vivid colors everywhere and beautiful, unusual plants. Get there before the crowds if you really want to enjoy ti and take stunning pictures.

Meh?. Don't mean to sound like a party pooper, but this wasn't as amazing as the photos and reviews made it out to be. It's a nice garden with lots of shady spots to escape the midday heat, but that's about it. Our guidebook had said entry would cost us 50Dh but when we got there, they said it was 70Dh for the garden and 100DH for the garden and house, which is basically hosting a berber museum. In my opinion, 70Dh was much better spent on the several other landmarks we visited like Bahia palace or the Ben Youssef Medersa, all of which charged 10-20Dh per person. If you're short on time, I'd recommend you skip this.

A bit plastic. The entry fee for tourists is a bit spicy, almost twice what the locals have to pay. The garden itself asides from some overgrown bamboo and cactus which is seen in nature in other destinations is a bit unnatural. A bit overrated place.

Pretty gardens!. Beautiful gardens, visit early to avoid the crowds. The little shops and museum is lovely and the gardens are picture perfect. Definitely one to see if you like beautiful architecture and cacti!There is also a little cafe outside the gardens that is very good and cheaper than the one inside!
Lovely peaceful place. Very nice garden, with lots of cactus and bamboo and interesting colourful buildings. Nice to be away from the noise of the city

Peace, calm, tranquility, and style.. Despite the entrance fee rising to 70Dhms recently, these gardens still offer a magical escape from Marrakech's heat and glorious chaos. YSL created a garden in which to linger, contemplate, and even learn a little - the Berber Museum is well worth the additional entry fee. The gardens are a draw for anyone interested in garden design and late 20th century style. You never know who you might come across!

Perfect oasis. This is an important addition to Marrakech - the gardens are a peaceful oasis but also pay tribute to the Berber culture and the Moroccan landscape. This is the perfect place to marvel at the dedication of two men who clearly loved their adopted city and paid homage to it. This was the most perfect place to visit on a hot day and the gift shop had thoughtfully sourced gifts of a unique nature.

A wonderful oasis. This is really worth a visit. A taxi from Place Jamaa el Fna should not cost more than 40DHM, we paid 30. (They will try to charge you 100 when you leave at the rank but say no- there are taxis further down the hill looking for business.)Plan to stay a while here, there are seats in the shade of beautiful plants. The Berber museum is small but worth a visit as is the cafe.

Sanctuary. This is small but well worth a visit. Yves Saint Laurent made this wonderful garden of colour and coolness, a great gift to locals and visitors. The vibrant colours and plantings are almost at a juxtaposition to its surroundings. This is better than a cold beer on a hot day!
Wonderful place. The gardens here are worth a visit. It was so peaceful and pretty. One of the guides was really happy to take lots of photos for us too
Stunning !. Beautiful gardens lots of ideas for mine! Amazing colours it was Stunning all of it I would go and see it again. Even the shop had some beautiful creations
Beautifull. Do go early before the crowds. Lovely and pictoresque. Visier by all means the museum, the mirror chambre that hosts Berber jewellery is wonderfull.

Nice gardens but.... Don't expect to be bowled over. We went expecting tropical gardens overflowing with flowers but it's not that kind of place. Most of the botanical there are cacti and it's a bit more arid than your average gardens. Saying that it's still very pretty and the Berber museum and exhibitions are well worth a look. Lunch at the a closed garden cafe is a must although a bit pricey.
Stunning colours. Beautiful gardens, we didn't visit the museum but the gardens where a perfect installment to our day.

Lovely gardens and a great place to relax. My friend and I had a great time at the gardens. The plants and trees, and the layout is beautiful. The atmosphere was very relaxing and it's a great place to have a quiet and peaceful walk around while admiring the gardens. Although the gardens itself is not massive, one can spend some time there walking around and relaxing on one of the many benches they have.Definitely visit the Jardin Majorelle :)

Beautiful but overcrowded. Jarding Majorelle is nice but overcrowded. The blue of the main building and the flower pots is something you will remember, just as the whole setting. However, be aware that all tourists seem to go here and hence the garden is very crowded and not a place to just sit and relax for a while. Probably best to go here right when they open.

Beautiful and tranquil oasis. The Jardin Majorelle was a fusion of colour - offering tranquillity and shade in the searing heat. Beautiful place to wander round and the terrace cafe served excellent food, great service and the best peppermint tea we had on our visit to Marrakech.

CALM YET VIBRANT. What a wonderful achievement to have brought this unusual garden back to life - both calm and still vibrant. The small pavilion and rill are very photogenic and were the favoured place of many a poser and amateur photographer but then everywhere you turn in this garden provides another photo opportunity. Look out for the frogs, we heard this incredible level of noise almost like a raucous peacock and were looking overhead - it took us several minutes to realize it was these tiny creatures on the lily pads in the water. The numerous species of cactus, the myriad shapes and sizes, is amazing - their stillness amidst the exuberant foliage and bright electric blue and gold pots around such a good contrast. The Museum is also worth a visit. There was an exhibition on the Amazigh (Berber tribes) which was very interesting.
Lovely Gardens. We had a lovely visit to Jardin Majorelle in June 2015. The gardens were lovely, an oasis in the city - we just wished they were even bigger

BEAUTIFUL. I wasn't expecting to enjoy the gardens as much as I did. They are beautiful. The layout, the colours, the interesting plants. It is small and perfectly laid out. Enjoy this quite magical place
Beautiful place to visit. So colourful and nice place to spend an afternoon and have some lunch. Was quite quiet when we went but it was like a little bit of paradise in Marrakesh.
Tranquil and interesting. Cool, tranquil and worth the visit. we included the Berber museum which was very interesting and had a great time.

Worth a look. Similar to the Eden project but the heat is real and not conservatory created. Worth going to if you're a fan of gardens, art or just fancy seeing something interesting or new. Only costs a couple quid too.

Beautiful and calm. A taxi ride away from the main square. Beautiful gardens - mostly under shade which was a relief from the hot sun. It was fairly busy in the morning when we went, but not so overcrowded that you couldn't find a quiet spot to enjoy the place.Amazing cactus and lovely lily pond complete with turtles.Nice cafe (bit pricey).Well worth a visit and a bit of calm in the crazy city.

Gorgeous and tranquil. We had entry to both the garden and the museum which I recommend. The garden is beautiful but smaller than I expected but this is still a lovely morning trip. There is a Berber Museum with many artifacts and is well lit and interesting. There is a bookshop with books on YSL, the garden, and travel writing on Morocco. I recommend the Eland Marrakech book, it's really interesting. There's also a boutique shop and small gallery of YSL Love prints that you can buy as postcards. You also get a free map and info leaflet. The tearooms are delightful, we had sorbet and drinks but the lunch menu looked brilliant. Maybe a little pricey but worth it. Also good WC facilities. Recommend getting a taxi there and onwards.

Pleasant gardens, great cafe!. Cost 70 dirhams (£4.60) each or half that with a student card. Pleasant enough gardens, but nothing that special. However we were glad we went for the cafe in the middle which was very peaceful with lovely food - the meat tagine (beef and prune) was delicious!

Great start to the holiday . I have just visited the jardin marjorelle and I must say it exceeded my expectations.
It's not just a garden full of plants, it is a tranquil area to explore and relax. The marjorelle blue colour is prominent and the plants are beautiful.
Definitely a must see place in Marrakech!

your new favorite shade of blue. This garden is small, but it's a special place that deserves its must-see status. Lovely plants, ponds and fountains to enjoy while listening to the birds sing in the trees...and of course an abundance of the famous "Majorelle Blue" colour all around. Visit early if possible, as I imagine big crowds detract from the tranquil atmosphere. The Berber Museum is well worth the few extra Dirhams, and provides insight that I feel enriched my understanding of Morocco overall. YSL collected a significant amount of Berber artifacts over many years, and they are artfully displayed here. The collection of various traditional Berber clothing was particularly fascinating.
Beautiful peaceful gardens. beautiful peaceful gardens. Well worth a visit. Recommend getting either a horse and cart or taxi to take you there

Beautiful setting. We visited in the morning & again at the end of the day. In the afternoon there were fewer visitors and it was easier to take photos. It's a good place to escape to. Plenty of shade among the cactus. The cafe serves good food & much needed cold drinks. The Berber museum is small but interesting. The little gallery & boutique are a nice surprise. Not cheap but worth a look. The Majorelle blue features heavily. You can buy the paint to bring home. We travelled there by horse & carriage which enabled us to sight see on the way.
Hidden gem. A peaceful oasis in a busy city. Go early to avoid coach loads.Quiet, tranquil and interesting. Beautiful colours, very interesting cactii. Worth the 70dh.

Wonderful. Wonderful and relaxing place to visit in Marrakech Lovely and rare plants from all over the world. The diversity of plant life in this one and the museum within made this the standout of our trip.

Worth a gander. A very refreshing garden after a short (<1 hour) walk from the heart of the Medina. It's a nice garden but not very 'exotic' or special about it, there are far better botanical gardens to be seen if you want to go for the plants alone. It's nice if you're interested in the history behind it but I didn't really care for it, and without, it's just a bit of a lackluster garden. Admittedly I wasn't expecting to see such greenery in the middle of Morocco, and I am pleased I went, but by no means was it excellent.

Lovely place to chill. Really enjoyed it here and plenty to photograph. Lovely colours and patterns for us photographers and great seeing a turtle dove as sadly rare in the UK these days. Spent a few hours here and although only a few acres in size there is plenty to see. Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid lots of people.

Nice relaxing visit. The price was not as thought 50dh it was 70dh (04.07) + 30dh for the museum.The garden itself is a lovely place with alot of nice plants trees and cactus.The experience was quite short (<2h) but we really enjoyed it.

A Little Gem of a Place. This really is a little gem of a place just to the north of Marrakesh - it's a delight of a place to visit and is must see material.Only a few yards the other side of the walled garden, there is chaos with the local traffic - jump into this place and it's a million miles away. So relaxing, so many lovely places to sit, this is an absolute gem of a place to visit.

Peaceful and beautiful. Lovely gardens, that are easy to reach if you take the 'red' tourist bus to stop 1 then swap to the green bus and get off at the last stop. That way you get a good tour of the city first. Gardens are beautiful, a true oasis from the heat. Lovely cafe with tasty food and fruit drinks, not bad prices. Shops has some beautiful items but expensive. Thorough recommended.

Great Garden. This may be the most peaceful place in Marrakesh. It was built in the 1920 by a French expatriate, Jacques Majorelle and has a large variety of plants from around the world on display. It's a great way to relax after leaving the hectic medina.

One of the most beautiful gardens I've ever seen. A glorious garden, with vibrantly painted ceramics and azure walls. I would even say it's more beautiful than the Park Guel in Barcelona, which it reminded me of in parts. Had a fascinating museum of Berber textiles and artefacts, and the cafe is a lovely place to admire the birds and flowers.

Cool garden - in every sense of the word. Loved the garden. It was a hot day but you instantly felt cooler on entering the garden as the shade was amazing. Try to visit the small museum on site as it contains a marvellous collection of Berber jewellery and costume.
Lovely place to chillax. Beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. Lots of places to sit (in the shade of the trees) while relaxing in this beautiful park.

Get there early. Marrakech was 46 degrees in the shade when we got there, so we go to the gardens for 8 o'clock when they opened. The gardens were tranquil and cool in the morning. That's a cafe for a sit down and nous nous. The gardens are not very big, so you don't need a lot of time to do it justice. A pleasant ans peaceful contrast to the bustling city.

A beautiful little oasis of calm in the heart of Marrakech. Small but perfectly formed garden, and a little oasis of tranquillity amidst a bustling and vibrant city. Plants and trees from all the continents in the world, plus some nice little shops containing local jewellery, artworks, books and clothing. Make sure to check out the fascinating Berber Museum and the monument to Yves Saint Laurent, whose ashes are scattered here.

Good collection of plants. Its a small garden, with amazing collection of plants from different places of the world. It takes maximum of one hour to spend. Worth visiting it if you have enough time in Marrakesh.
Cooling attraction on a warm day #honeymoon2015. Great place to visit for a cooling morning out. Very beautiful and inspiring. Lovely visitors centre. Nice place to reflect and take photos!
Only for fashion fans. Just a garden, there are bigger and nicest at botanical gardens all over the world. If u has interest about haut couture, u can use a pair of hours to visit the little museum.

Well worth a visit. Beautiful garden, well worth visiting.
It's cheaper with a student card so be sure to bring yours if you have one.

Serene escape in the middle of mayhem . Walked to this from the medina mid-morning to find pleasant gardens with very friendly and helpful staff that offered to take photos of couples if needed. Whilst it was busy, there weren't too many people that it spoiled the experience. Was surprised to see bottles of water available inside for 5Dh, very reasonable and unlike tourist attractions in many other places.
Beautiful, peaceful gardens. Lovely place. Well worth a visit - very beautiful and peaceful. A bit crowded, but we really enjoyed seeing it.

Marjorelle Blue glitters. We were able to walk here from our Riad, which was in the northern part of the Medina. As advertised it is 50 dirham to enter, but totally worth it. Just seeing all the greenery and cacti and then the colorful decor with the Majorelle Blue, was spectacular
Just a garden . It's just a garden with plants from different places but other than that there is nothing special about it. I wouldn't take it as a must place to see.

Fairytale garden. Jardin Majorelle is very peaceful. The museum and bridge is done in a beautiful blue.Outstanding gardenarchitecture with charming footpaths and of course spectacular plants. About 4 km from Djeema el Fna, the centre of old Marrakech.

Beautiful. An oasis of cool and tranquility away from the heat. Absolutely beautiful, definitely well worth a visit there is a Yves Saint Laurent exhibition and gift shop which unsurprisingly is pricy

A true oasis in Marrakech :). We visted here at the end of June during the heatwave. Wow its amazing its nothing like the rest of the city. As soon as you walk in you relax, there is lots of shade too. The plants and flowers and water features are lovely. Its so pretty and quiet. Take a book and relax there :)
Tranquil and beautiful. Stunning gardens in a peaceful setting.Would recommend going early in the morning to avoid crowds but even when it gets busier it is still lovely.
Gorgeous morning. Would definitely recommend a visit to these gardens they're gorgeous and entry fee is very cheap, about €5.

jardin majorelle. very peaceful and cool. It is best visitied early in the day as the crowds tend to be big. Buy a ticket for the Berber museum which is excellent and really interesting with a fantastic ceiling meant to look like a night sky with stars. Worth th money
Interesting. Loved the design and colours. gorgeous mature plants and individual spaces flowing from one to the other. Berber museum fascinating.

Lovely gardens, not sure about number one.... A beautiful spot a short walk out of the main medina area. Takes about an hour to wander around, see the YSL monument and take in the colors. The majorelle blue is pretty and there is a nice cafe to stop for a drink. Nice to see and get a rest from the soaring temperatures -- it's beautifully cool in there with shade and a light breeze. Not sure it's my number one for Marrakech but nice nonetheless.

A haven of peace.. Even on a rainy day in November this was well worth the journey. It's an eccentric sanctuary located in an otherwise underwhelming neighbourhood, The Majorelle blue is stunning and the gardens are crammed with flora showing how imagination and a keen eye can transform any small space. It makes you wonder how many other beautiful gardens are hidden behind the high-walled properties of the wealthier people of Marrakech.

Beautiful spot in the middle of Marrakech. The Garden and house was initIally created by French painter Jacques Majorelle and later became famous as the home of designer Yves St Laurent. It is a beautiful and tranquil escape from the hustle of Marrakech. It is only 70 dirhams to enter and an extra 30 for the Museum, which is definitely worthwhile. Even in the heat of the day the gardens remain cool and have a wonderful air of peace and tranquility. The restaurant is very reasonably priced with a good selection of coffees, soft drinks and food. This is a lovely place to spend between 1 and 2 hours relaxing.

Great place to get away from the busy city streets.. The Jardin Majorelle is small but beautiful. The plants and colours are stunning giving lots of opportunities for great photos. The cafe was quite expensive but we enjoyed the peace and surroundings - the food was very good and they offer a great range of teas and fruit juices.We walked to the Jardin from the Medina which took us about 30 minutes but I would recommend getting a taxi back - we walked! The walk there isn't that interesting. The entry price is reasonable but you pay extra to visit the museum - not too sure it's worth it.
wonderful gardens. second visit to the gardens and even better than before. The place is a one off and if you want to get the essence of Moroccan gardens this is the one

One of the musts when in Marrakech.. A must visit when in Marrakech.We took a taxi, no problem, but haggle, don't pay the first price.We then walked back to the city centre,again no problem.We had lunch with the locals at an amazing food hall in the basement.Just pick you food and find a table.The gardens are very beautiful and peaceful .
do it!. awesome, worth the taxi ride...amazing grounds , amazing colours, amazing flora, amazing shop...you must finish your trip to MRK here...

Sadly ,a bit overrated.. As one of the top ten things to do in Marrakesh we thought we'd give it a go. The garden itself is little more than a collection of cacti. A couple of overpriced,though interesting,shops and an collection of yves St Laurent new year posters . We spent about 45 minutes.

Beautiful. Lovely oasis. Great place to spend a few hours. You need to wander round a few times to fully see everything. The cacti are amazing.
The cafe serves delicious snacks too.

great to have a rest from hustle and bustle in Marrakesh. Really pleasant , funky and much cooler than rest of Marrakesh place. Nice walks in the shade and a lots of benches in quirky corners to sit down and recharge.
Peaceful place in crazy city. Beautiful and peaceful place in a busy and crazy city. I really enjoyed all cactuses in there and i spend a lovely hour in there.
Camera the ready. These gardens are beautiful such vibrant colours lovely very inspiring so much that I have taken some of the ideas for my little piece of Marrakech in ENglang
Beautiful refuge from the heat!. We had read lots about this garden and we were not disappointed. It is very calming and tranquil to walk around.
Great garden. Not in the historical center of Marrakech but definitely worth the (short) trip. Beautiful garden and also worth visiting the museum for the higher cost

Beautiful!. An oasis of calm in an otherwise crazy city! Make the journey here early in the morning. We went in the evening and found it that bit too hot. Once inside it is cool, shaded and very relaxing!

Nice quiet garden. It's a quiet and nice oasis in the middle of the city. The garden is nice and as a lot of different plants and a memorial for Yves Saint Laurent. I definitly recommend to visit it. There is a small entrance fee but it's not too expensive

Unlike any other garden you will have visited on earth.... The Jardin Majorelle in Marrakech has to be the 'must see' of this city. The fomer home of French couture designer Yves Saint Laurent, with buildings and structures and even irrigation canals painted iin stunning Yves blue, it's quite amazing. In high season be prepared to get there early by taxi, to avoid the queues. It is not a massive garden but you can spend a good couple of hours here, beneath the trees and if you are a cat lover like me, you'll be able to spot some adorable cats and their families living amongst the plants. There is a delightful little café, a chic boutique and decent loos all within the garden. Outside the garden you will find yourselves in a hip part of Marrakech, more French than Arabic - chic shops and cafes so make sure to stroll around these too.
Worth a visit. Well worth a visit, lovely gardens with some amazing plants. Great opportunity to take pictures. The gardens are extremely well maintained, visit if you like gardens.

Place of peace in a busy city. We went to this little gem on the way to the mountains. The Garden, while small is a lovely quiet place to catch your breath and relax. Please note that this is an African style a garden and does not compare (nor should it) to more European style gardens.It was not too expensive, I think it worked out at about 5 euro each and is a great way to spend an hour.

Beautiful. Beautiful gardens, not too long to walk round in the midday sun, lovely cafe too for a quick refreshment. Colours were stunning. Would visit again to see how it's changed, there were some renovations Going on when we went. But a must do and see.
Must see. Beautiful garden but the museum is outstanding also. Great place to go even when it is hot out to escape the busy city.

Beautiful Garden. Gorgeous garden and architecture. Diverse flora and every path brings you to a gorgeous end. Definitely a visit worth when in Marrakech. Enjoy the bright colours and that Majorelle blue is just breathtaking.

Beautiful grounds and museum. The gardens were beautiful and colorful, with a wide range of interesting plants and layouts. Compared to many other places we visited in Marrakech, this one was more crowded with tourists than others, but I don't think that detracted too much from the experience. The gardens were smaller than I anticipated, taking about an hour to explore, and this with many stops for artsy photos (more than the average tourist, I think!). Overall, a dirt cheap and enjoyable escape from the chaos of Marrakech.

Nice to visit but over rated. I was told by a previous visitor that this is a "must see" place in Marrakech. Its nice but not amazing. Like a lot of ordinary things, put a designer name/brand to it and it goes up in peoples perspective. It's not very big, an hour there was sufficient for me. The artwork on display was really nice but the designer shop was lost on me. I don't expect that I would re-visit.

Too expensive. The garden is nice, but nothing special.I really like the blues in it and the architecture. But it is really expensive, at least for europeans as you barely see nothing, accept of palm trees and the monument for YSL.

Wow!. A little gem ! We walked to this from our hotel through chaotic traffic BUT when you getvthere it is so worth while . Absolutely fabulous, lovely 'cafe' not rip off prices, authentic food. Allow at least 2 hours, lovelyvto regenerate calm !!

A place to catch your breath. A very interesting visit. Great for photographs with many different plant/flower subjects.Welcoming stopping place to catch your breath, have a quiet chat and generally re-charge the batteries. the Saint Laurent aspect brings some parallel interest.

Gorgeous haven away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. A beautifully laid out little garden, very peaceful and quiet. It was a perfect retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the city itself.There is also a small museum in the grounds (Ecomusee Berbere) which was really interesting and showed a great deal of the history of the Berber people.The garden was 50 MAD to enter and the Museum was an extra 25 Dirhams. Including the museum we took about 3 hours here.

piece of garden history dont miss the museum. Amazing garden small but gorgeous do not miss the museum for Berber history and costumes, the café is not cheap but the beldi drink of yogurt dates and avocado is divine

Gardens and Museum of Artists. Visited the lovely gardens on a hot January day. While not representative of the area's native vegetation, it is still beautifully landscaped and an refuge from the heat of the city. The small museum includes fantastic local arts which summarize and characterize the diverse culture of Morocco's history. The upscale shop offers an modern take on leather and other goods.

Nothing exciting.. Manages to get some nice pictures. Nothing exciting can complete the visit within an hour.
Pretty gardens
OK museum. Staff member in museum was unable to answer of my question as he could not speak good english which was a little frustrating.

Unusual and interesting. It was a rainy day and we spent a very pleasant couple of hours here. It would have been nice not getting wet but it was still enjoyable to walk round and certainly very colourful and different from other gardens visited. Nice cafe there too to shelter from the rain,
Unusual. A lovely little garden, not as big as expected, but beautifull all the same. The museum was very interesting as well, all about the Berbers.

Such a gem. I'm still not sure why this garden captured my imagination so much- I'm hardly a horticulturalist, and yet the layout, the exotic nature of the plants, and the delightfully surprising brightly coloured buildings of yellow and "Marjorelle" blue were just lovely. I recommend booking a tour through Viator (I can't remember the name of the operator unfortunately) but the slick organisation made it worth it!
Morning trip. We spent about 45 minutes exploring the gardens. Not huge but worth the 50 dirham charge to get in. Well kept and peaceful

Small but perfectly formed. Just to come and sit in peaceful greenery away from the bustle of the Medina was wonderful. Nice café in a court yard and an interesting load of plants from around the world to look at. Some water features and pots and buildings in vivid colours. Well worth a taxi fare to visit. A small entrance fee goes towards the upkeep.

A city oasis. Well worth visiting this intimate garden in the suburbs of Marrakech, to obtain a glimpse of life for Yves St Laurent, amongst the extraordinary colours which he created for the buildings, pot plants and walkways, notwithstanding the trees and plants. With a leafy cafe; a shop with Yves St Laurent and other artifacts; a really interesting small museum; and also a row good craft and other shops across the road - a good half day out in Marrakech ......

Yves had a vision and it is still fabulous. A magical, lovely ,bit out of the way hideaway of Msr.Laurent . Worth seeing if you like beautiful odd gardening, blast of blue walls,fashion and small delectable crafts. A must for the artist.

An oasis of calm. The gardens are so beautiful, it is a really lovely relaxing place to visit! Doesn't take long to walk around but was lovely to be able to sit and admire the views! Really worth a visit. There are shorter opening times due to Ramadan but this is well advertised.

My favorite part of our stay in Marrakech. The gardens around Morocco are a beautiful and relaxing way to spend a morning. The diversity of plant life in this one and the museum within made this the standout of our trip.

Start your Marrakech adventure here.... Acclimatise to the heat and hustle of Marrakech at Jardin Majorelle - if your taxi driver is more interetsed in taking you to an all natural pharacy or leather making market, pause at Majorelle for an hour or more. Wander around the gardens lined with tarracotta pots splashed with striking colours as the soothing canopy of bamboo and palms protect you from the searing heat. Take in the Yves Saint Laurent memorial and gallery of Love. A great way to start your Marrakech adventure here...
Beautiful. Such a wonderful and relaxing place to visit in Marrakech Lovely and rare plants from all over the world. Well worth a visit.

highlight of a short trip. probably the most peaceful place in marrakech. beautifully laid out, everything seems to be in the right place and most importantly it's a cool place in a rather torrid city.we went in the morning and it was quiet, it only started to pick up when we were about to leave around midday.the entrance is somewhat small and hidden and there's a100 dirhams entrance fee or 50 for the museum alone.not to be missed.

Worth a visit but doesn't take long. I found the gardens stunning and the colorful art and buildings to be a perfect setting. However, it's small, and doesn't take very long to see, so the entry fee is a bit steep for the time you spend in the garden. Still, it's a beautiful rendition of luxury gardens in this climate.

"French garden with Morrocan influence". If you need to get away from the heat and dust of the Medina, this is the place to visit.Its peaceful, tranquil with lots of cool areas to chill.The layout of the garden is easy to get round with lots of lovely areas for photo opportunities Lots of pots painted in Majorelle blue are scattered around the gardens which reflect Ysl influence. The cafe is situated in a cool courtyard ideal for a morning coffee or snack.

Not as epic as YSL. Coming to Marrakech and seeing that there was YSL's garden made us go..YES we must do it!.. However the moment you step in, the super artificial nature is too overwhelming to stay for longer than 5 minutes. Way too overpriced for what it was too.Cactus and Bamboo decorated in an artficial way. Definitely no botanical garden feel.Worth it? Nahhh.
Good place. Nice place to go in sunny day. Very beautiful garden with different kind of flowers and trees there. There is a museum of berber culture on the territory of gardens.Suggest to visit.

A lovely cool place to relax - also good for Moroccan breakfast. Try and get there early and avoid the crowds - the Moroccan Breakfast in the restaurant is excellent and worth getting there early for! Opening time is later during Ramadam, so check their website!The gardens are quite magical and the blue paintwork quite cooling. The lillies on the pond are beautiful and would make a Monet painting!Interestingly, on my visit there was an owl roosting in one of the tall trees, probably a short eared owl - quite a size though!

peace and tranquility. Peaceful and beautifully laid out and maintained with excellent photo opportunities. It can get crowded, it was a little crowded when we visited, but apparently earlier of later in the day are better times for less crowds.Our accommodation was within walking distance but found the entrance was awkward to find as the signing a little "vague". There is a taxi rank adjacent to the entrance if you can handle the hard bargaining with the taxi drivers.nevertheless well worth a visit.
Tranquil. Beautiful botanical garden with an amazing museum of Berber ethnography...wonderful place to get away from the mid day chaos.

Gardens, Architecture and YSL. If you're into gardens, architecture or YSL you should definitely visit Jardin Majorelle. It's only a short walk from the Marrakech medina and pretty easy to find. It was a bit crowded for taking photographs, but I'm assuming that it'll be less so if you go very early or right before closing.
just lovely. Delightful gardens welcome reprieve from city heat. Take a taxi and walk back into Marrakech. Gardens are interesting full of tropical plants and cacti.

Lovely few hours and some great pictures. Really enjoyed our visit here! We went in the afternoon and the tall palm trees gave us shade from the heat. We took lots of lovely photos and had ice cream in the cafe (overpriced for Marrakech but normal for London prices). Only downside was that the main fountain was under reconstruction work.

An oasis of calm. An oasis of calm in hectic Marrakech. Vibrant coloured buildings nestled in a beautiful memorial garden for Yves Saint Laurent. Definitely worth a visit. We walked there, in 38 degree heat. The return journey in a touristy horse and carriage was far cooler!

A cobalt blue oasis in the red city. With over 300 types of plants and lots of carefully placed walks and fountains, the garden is a beautiful haven you can escape to when the red of the city gets a bit too much. One of my favourite things about the garden was the dominant cobalt blue colour, or as it is known in Morocco Majorelle Blue, that was all over the garden, in the bridges, pagodas, flower pots and fountains. Within the garden itself, the combination of blue, teal, orange and yellow creates a stunning result that makes the garden both look wild and meticulously put together at the same time. I could see myself spending many hours in that garden if I had the chance, taking a stroll or just sitting in a quiet corner to read or write something. It's the combination of plants, flowers and water that make it a very tranquil space that is definitely worth visiting, so make sure you add it to your list.

What ever you do...do not miss this. Garden into Marrakech, lets say simply divine.Well, its worth spending a day here, stunning gardens and beauty courtyard cafe as shady spot where one can stop and have drink. Beautiful flowers and setting.
Great place to go. Lovely gardens and water features lovely to have a walk around and relax for a bit away from all the traffic that wants to run you over

Blue and beautiful. Tranquil cool garden, fantastic plants and cacti. An oasis of calm away from the busy city centre. Interesting museum giving history of Berber arts and crafts and showing many examples of their dress and jewellery etc.
Breath Taking Garden. The garden is amazing to admire, the museum offered a taste of the Berber culture along with the nice boutique and quaint areas to take a seat and eat.
Do not miss this. Astonishingly beautiful gardens. Never seen anything quite like it, quite breathtaking. Well worth a visit.
nice and quet. It was a nice quiet little garden with some beautiful places for taking pictures after the hustle and bustle of the market place
Amazing Gardens. Small but beautiful gardens on the outskirts of the city. Difficult to find on foot & MAD50 to get in.

Charming and a must for frenchie lovers. A lovely garden - shady and green with palms, cacti, ponds and walkways. Visit early in the morning as it is small and fills up very quickly. Yves St Laurent saved and renovated this garden. There is a charming gallery of his posters including some of his french bulldogs. The bookshop has some lovely books and the gift shop some very expensive (but fabulous) gifts. The courtyard cafe is super and not too expensive for breakfast or a simple coffee. Entry was 50 dirhams per adult (around £3.15).

A LOVELY PLACE TO VISIT. Whilst in Marrakesh, on the recommendation of Mohammed at Riad AL Badia, we visited the Jardin Majorelle. A nice tranquil place to visit - beautiful plants, well laid out with a nice restaurant on site - well worth a visit - prices reasonable. There's also a shop - but, as the saying goes - if you have to ask the prices - you can't afford it.

Lovely Surprise!. I knew these gardens would be lovely, however my breath was taken away by the calm, ordered chaos of wonderful palms,cactus,bamboo and tropical grasses. Great way to get out of the hot morrocan sun and explore the detail of this unique garden. Really enjoyed the museum to learn more about Berber history. Do not mind paying to enter the gardens and museum as this is what helps this oasis to continue to delight visitors.

The greatest tourist trap. It is a crowed and small park with some nice vegetation, but nothing out of the ordinary. There are gardens at some hotels that are much more beautiful than what this offers. I was taken by the reviews which are exaggerated.

One of those places you go to because your there.. Gardens good, Museum good, Tea room excellent. YSL connection very interesting. If you have a interest in cactus and botany then this place is for you.
Nice but small. An oasis of calm in Marrakech - lovely, clean and well kept but small gardens and worth a visit to escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina.

Hidden Gem. In all honesty, we weren't expecting much from this garden - how wrong we were! It is an oasis in the middle of the desert, it's so lush and cool, truly stunning. The highlight for us was the gorgeous blue colour of the museum. Plus a decent little cafe!
It was ok. Gardens were nice, very pretty scenery. Fair price, just wasnt anything over the top for me personally. Still glad we went and experienced it.

Well worth a visit and a perfect place for a stroll. This is a beautiful and amazing place, the plants in this garden are like something from another planet and the place has such a peaceful aura about it. I greatly enjoyed visiting here with my husband who also thoroughly enjoyed the plant life. We also enjoyed a lovely lunch in the cafe resturant. Good clean toilet facilities too.

welcomed respite. We visited here on a very hectic and hot afternoon, and were so pleased to find the cool shade of the bamboo and gardens. It was a lovely stop. There is a cafe and expensive shop, but the quality appears high and the goods are unique. I think you could spend several thousand dollars on some of the unique items. None of the staff pressured us when we were browsing. We did not eat in the cafe. The museum inside was well worth the extra cost, and was extraordinary. At the time it was a Berber exhibit. It is small, but world class presentation.
