There is also a nice museum gift shop with books, pictures and postcards - more cultural and historical than touristy.We walked there from the main square (was a little too far in the heat) but took a taxi to the Saadian tombs - which cost 50 dirhams. There is a cluster of cabs outside the gardens with some sort of ring leader who will approach you when you leave - but the driver himself arranged the price with us. The driver gave us a lovely tour on the way back.
Nice piece of nature and art. Jardin is located within a walking distance from Medina and is easy to find. Nice mix of palmtrees, waterlillies and art. In the city but perfect place to enjoy nature.

wonderful!. It is a little secret gem in Marrakech. The nature is perfectly combined with the colors of the buildings. Luxury shops snide to buy fashion clothes or accessories . Maybe a little be too busy but very quiet and calm compared to the city. You must go!

Perfect Oasis. Lovely picturesque gardens ideal to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Quite shaded inside which is ideal in high summer ( we vistited in June with temperatures of 35°+) Entrance to get in was 50 dirham pp and the museum was an extra 20 dirham pp (altogether around £4.50each). You can spend a good few hours there especially if you visit the cafe, food was lovely the service not incredible(waiter not very welcoming, didnt crack a smile) but food more than made up for it. Meal there for bread, two mains and two drinks was 320 dirhams more expensive than other places in marrakech but ambience and setting makes it a worth while visit.

Quite a haven in the heat and bustle of Marrakech. The entrance is not on the main road, signs will direct you. It cost 50Dhr to enter. The garden is well looked after and though small it seems there a quiet spots all over to sit and enjoy the garden.There plants (of course) water features, a space dedicated to YSL. But one of the nicest was the cafe, peaceful serving tea and food/snacks. Good service and a nice of traditional foods with plain food for those who are not adventurous.

Beautiful collection of cacti and palms. We enjoyed our visit. The many different cacti and palms were interesting. We also loved strolling through and taking photos. We had lunch in the cafe. Marrakech as a city was hectic so it was nice to find a quiet and serene garden like this to spend a couple of hours in.

A peaceful place. Unless you are a very keen gardener these gardens are ideal for a relaxing hour or so. The gardens are very well kept and have a good cactus collection. Some expensive shops for the ladies to spend their money.

peace and tranquility!. The gardens do not take too long to go around but they are a cooling welcome break from the Moroccan sun! The colours are beautiful and there are some interesting plants and flowers that make this a relaxing stop from the bustle of Marrakech. Enjoyed the YSL art exhibition as well!

Lovely. Such a peaceful and beautiful place. Staff are lovely, shops have nice trinkets in and also larger gifts/souvenirs. My advice would be to go at 5pm on a sunday. It was nice and quiet and not too hot. Usually the queue is out the door but at this time it was perfect. It closes at 6, but an hour is long enough. Lovely place, thank you Yves St Laurent for saving it.

Beautiful - so tranquil!. It is such a haven just out of the hustle of the main town. Really nice and relaxing. I would also recommend going to the Museum as it is only a few rooms but really interesting to learn about the Berbers

Interesting collection of plants from around the world. Marjorelle was an artist and intrepid traveler who collected plants from all over the world and creating a magnificent garden in Marrakech. The garden also house the Berber Museum which is a great way to learn about one of the original peoples of the area.

really disappointing!!!. The best thing to see in Marrakech? Definitely not!!!50 dirham (museum not included = 25dh) for 15-20 minutes of visit, it is too much!!!I deed, it is a nice and peaceful place. But it is only few bamboos and some cactuses here and there... with very few water squares..In conclusion, if you saw enough things in Marrakech and want to spend some money, you can go otherwise keep your money and do something else with it!

Little jewel. It doesn't take long to see these wonderful gardens but you do not feel like leaving. Beautiful, tranquil and stylish. Berber museum is worth an extra couple of pounds just to see the fabulous decoration.
How the other half lived !. What an amazing place. To see so many beautiful things - genuine YSL paintings, fantadtic gardens - the most incredible plants . Well worth it
Excellent!. We enjoyed Jardin Majorelle as we went off the medina. Relaxed time with my friends. We met wonderfull people there.

A tranquil place away from the hussle and bussle of Marrakech. Thanks to Pierre Berge and Yves Saint Laurent this beautiful garden was saved from property developers. Photographs cannot convey the tranquility when wandering around. Jardin Majorelle was a relaxing time after our heavy lunch at the hotel. We were unsure how YSL would react to the sculpture placed as his epitaph.

Fabulous - a little haven. This was the highlight of my stay in Marrakech!Cool and tranquil (except for the tourists who cannot shut up!)Very organised and clean - lots of staff there to keep an eye on things.50 Dinhars - great value.Would reccommend a visit - just for the cool shade of the palms and ferns

An oasis in the city. From the moment you step into the gardens, peace descends on you. This is truly an oasis from the hustle and the bustle of the city and is well worth a visit. We love plants and gardening, but even for non-garden enthusiasts, I think this place is worth going to.It has a magical feel about it and is really lovely to wander round, with lots of shady patches, water features and places to sit and watch the world go by. Even when it's very busy with people, it still feels peaceful and it's possible to find a spot to sit undisturbed.We also had a drink and ice cream at the courtyard cafe, which was really lovely. The beldi is particularly good.
Amazing place!. Ho early as it gets crowed very easily and taking nice pictures without people in your way is difficult

Restful garden with excellent museum and book shop. At first I was disappointed because the garden was not full of flowers, but of cactus and green plants. But after the exhilarating sensory overload of the Marrakesh medina, it's calm is just what you need. The museum features a few excellent examples of traditional Berber jewelry [well, more than a few there], clothing, and household and artisan articles, all with explanation sheets in English and French. The book store is the best I've seen in Morocco for works on traditional crafts and clothing, in several languages. The museum catalog is well-done, small and affordable. I go and take tour groups every year and we are never bored.
Nice break from a busy city.. Lovely gardens and water features, tributes to Yves St. Laurent and an interesting museum giving the history of the Berber people. Pricey gift shop.

wonderfull place JARDIN MAJORELLE.. it is worthseeing place,if u r in Marrakesh,it is must, it is beeutifull place,it is also food for relax u can easily relaxe there an hour or place.really good for mental relaxation.

Amazing. A must to visit. The amazing garden, the colors and contrasts. Very well maintained. You come home that you would like to paint your pots and wall with the same colors! The property is not big, one hour visit.
Explosion of colour. What a beautiful garden, away from the hustle and bustle and your senses are just bombarded with colour. A truly worthwhile visit

Beautiful, plan to spend 2-3 hours here and Berber museum together. We got here too late within just a few minutes of closing time so we spent only 10 minutes here and the small Berber museum inside closed at 6:30pm before we got there. We got to see all the zillion varieties of cactus imported from Mexico and visited the garden shop, which sells some interesting objects including some authentic, well-displayed antiques, which are extremely pricey. Note, some of the same cushion covers can be had outside for a third or fourth of the price and while the antiques too are expensive, it's possible they are far older than what you might see in the other antique shops. Don't miss going to the 33 Rue Majorelle store outside the garden, which has products from various local designers. I believe the Berber museum is very nice, with many artifacts unlike most Moroccan museums we saw. A good place to see the variety of Berber jewelry in case you intend to buy any from antique shops.

An oasis in a busy world. Beautiful & understated gardens in Marrakesh. Well worth a visit. Good bookshop & gift shop. Lovely to wander round at your own pace & enjoy the plants & flowers. Tribute to designer Yves St Laurent.

The colours in this garden take your breath away. Everyone visiting Marrakech should come here. Only takes about 15mins to walk round but nowhere in the world have I seen the blue colour exhibited here. Stunning.
Amazing colours. The restaurant in the gardens was delicious - and the garden was so colourful - the blue buildings were amazing

well worth a visit. I went about 4pm which was enough time to see the gardens and avoided all the hords of tourists. There were still plenty of people there but I'm sure it was quieter than it could be.
The garden is beautiful and you do need some quiet time to appreciate the shapes and colours of the garden.
Beautiful. Very Cheap entry, very beautiful. Worth the visit. Found it very relaxing. One of the nicest places in Marrakech

Beautiful, tranquil garden - definately worth a visit. I would 100% recommend visiting this garden in Ville Nouvelle.We spent a lovely 3 or more hours wandering timelessly through this absolutely, beautiful amazing garden, everywhere we looked there was something different to look at. It was approx. £10 each to get in to the garden including the Berber museum. All the entrance money goes back into the YSL foundation for good causes in Morocco. A huge variety of plants, flowers, cacti plants. There is a beautiful YSL picture gallery, a little store where you can buy reproduction prints of these. There is a little café serving fresh lemonade and Moroccan tea.What a beautiful afternoon in the sunshine. It was interesting and calm, peaceful. A little bit of tranquillity away from the crazy of Marrakech.

An Oasis in the hustle of Marrakesh,lovely colours,nice Berber museum and very good but highly priced cafe. A must when you love gardens and are in Marrakesh, get there by Taxi (on a fixed prize rate) or more exclusevely by horse driven calèche

A must. The gardens are a must. We enjoyed the Berbere museum. The cafe offers a good ration quality/price and allow you to have a enjoyable break during your visit.The entree fee is reasonable so there is no reason to miss it. Be aware that it can be really crowded at peak time; try to go at the opening time if you want to be able to take nice pics and enjoy the quietness of the place.

Oasis. Honestly, this place is like an oasis in the desert. Literally. It was beautiful and fresh and a well needed respite from the heat. Totally worth the trip out of the medina. But take a taxi, we walked and it was FAR!
Interesting. Since we didn't have a guide and knew nothing about the place, it didn't strike us as great. It was somewhat interested but relatively small and not especially charming for us.

A beautiful oasis of calm. A beautiful oasis of calm in this crazy city - the garden is stunning, exotic and tropical plants and cacti, cool ponds and shady arbours. The Yves St Laurent artwork, the shop, and the cafe are lovely too. We didn't pay the extra to see the museum so can't comment on that, but the building is beautiful. Inspiring.
Beautiful and not to be missed. Worth the visit out of the Medina - the gardens are stunning and a place of real tranquility even on a busy June day

Overrated. The garden was wonderful and the museum was informative and fun - they provide English translators for each room since all the sign posting is mainly in French. The gallery of YSL's art work was so beautiful. However, there are other gardens nearly as beautiful which charge no entry fee. The garden is amazing, but I believe it to be overrated.
good for the eyes. the jardin majorelle is a pleasure for the yes. and to skip from the hot climate of marrakesh. very good for a brunch
GARDEN TREAT. A tranquil and lovely place to feast your eyes! I have been painting pots in my garden to remind me of Yves Saint Laurent's place!
A haven.. The medina in Marrakech is a hustle, bustle place,full of sights and smells so it was nice to escape to the new city and visit these gardens. They are very tranquil, but can be very busy.

Truly Beautiful and peaceful. . These gardens were an oasis of calm in a busy busy city. The sense of peace and delight in all its hidden nooks and crannys was fantastic. Although a little out of the way it is very much worthwhile visiting.
Beautiful. This garden is as beautiful as "promised" - definitely a must for every Marrakesh visitor. Very different from the rest of the city.

Highlight of my trip! Not to be missed!. The breathtaking gardens transport you out of Morocco and into the exquisite detailed artistic eye of Yves St. Laurent. The lush trees, bushes, plants and flowers amidst the colorful painted urns and walls, the fabulous Berber museum offering a great history of the area, and the incredible gift shop with quality merchandise. Time well spent!

A jewel of a garden. Must see if you come to Marrakesh. I had been to Marrakesh before, but always on business. This time was for pleasure. I must confess that I made a mistake not coming to this Jardin as it is so unique in so many ways. The desert garden is one of the best I have ever seen, with cacti and other desert plants from around the world. The "Majorelle blue" color is everywhere, and it adds to the splash of colors everywhere. The ponds, fountains, sculptures...all add up to an unforgettable experience.

Beautiful Gardens. Excellent tourist stop. Beautiful, lush, extensive gardens in a peaceful Morroccan setting. Loads of desert plants against vibrant cobalt blues and bright yellows and orange backdrops of pottery. Not to be missed. Also a very nice YSL shop here.

Worth a visit. Beautiful gardens and well worth a visit here to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. We had a very relaxing time here and then a lovely lemon chicken tagine in the cafe before taking the tour bus back to the main square.A definite place to visit!

Just beautiful! . We spent an a lovely morning at the jardin majorelle, beautiful cactus and flora everywhere. Also so cheap to get in, 50 dirhams each. Just to have a wonder around, seeing all the colours, all of the different cactus, what a lovely place to be. I would definitely recommend it!

Our favourite place in Marrakech. The gardens are a beautiful, cool oasis tucked away within the hot, dusty city. We spent a whole morning here and could have stayed all day. The surroundings were immaculate and staff were happy to take photos of us and tell us the best route to walk around. The onsite Berber museum, although very small, was also really interesting (grab an English exhibit guide as you walk in as most signage is in French). The cafe was well-priced and very quaint.We could have stayed all day, however come midday it started to get crowded with tour groups so we headed on our way. Definitely make this the first stop of your day to enjoy the true essence of the place.I would also recommend visiting the Kaowa Cafe opposite for a delicious lunch or smoothie - there's even free wifi and a lovely shop next door!
Peaceful oasis . Very beautiful garden that provides a haven of peace from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Smaller than I had expected. Nice place but doesn't deserve to be the #1 attraction

Peaceful and beautiful gardens. So pleased we were told to visit here as it was a beautiful, calm and tranquil garden experience in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Gorgeous colours and amazing photographs can be taken here. Absolutely beautiful and well worth a visit.

Love love love it. Amazing a true must . The most beautiful gardens , peaceful , quiet , truly magical place to visit . Lovely cafe in the gardens just can't rave enough about this. Go early to avoid the crowds as gets very busy.

Wonderful. After the hustle and bustle of the Medina, the gardens are a delightful calm oasis in the mid of a mad city. I tried to walk here from my Riad, but got hopelessly lost so had to take a taxi in the end, so advice number one is take a taxi from the main square, it should not cost more than 30 Dirhams. The Gardens are owned by the estate of Yves St Larent and cost 25 Dirhams entry fee and a further 25 Dirhams for the museum. I cant think of any attraction in the UK that costs less than £3.50 p to get in and is well worth the money. We were in no rush and spent about an hour wandering around the gardens, and the water features, there are numerous photo opportunities as well as the Museum, a gift shop ( expensive in my opinion ) cafe and toilets.Its a lovely way to spend a couple of hours and I thoroughly recommend it.

Gardens. Beautiful place very calm and serene! Very easy to get to and the staff were very pleasant. There was an exhibition on the traditional morreccan people who live in the dessert. Plenty of photo opportunities and many different plants from around the world. I didn't know bamboo could grow so high. There was a wonderful cafe in a courtyard

Stunning, peaceful haven. Beautiful gardens with a very informative, captivating museum. Amazing colours, great photo opportunities, with a stunning array of cacti and bamboo from around the world. It is wonderfully quiet and cool, within the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. A must visit for any traveller.

Designer garden. A must to visit a tranquil oasis in the middle of the madness of Marrakech better if the sun is shining so you can appreciate the colours - we visited on a cloudy day and whilst it made walking around very pleasurable our picture didn't have the same impact.

Lovely spot to stop. We were told this was a must-see by our Riad and it was definitely a great place to spend a couple of hours. The peacefulness of the gardens is a great contrast to the city happening outside. Even for two people who aren't that into gardens, it was definitely a great stop - and the gift shop made for a very happy ending!

Stunning tranquil gardens. A must see in Marrakech. The gardens are lovely and serene and a quiet escape from the bustling activity in Marrakech. There are also lovely shops across the street that are worth checking out.

waste of time. We stayed in the medina so this was a cab ride away. I think it was 50 dirham to get in without museum, that was extra). I think maybe, being British we are spoilt with an array of fabulous gardens at home and this one just doesn't live up to the hype. We were through it and out the other side within 10 minutes, my advise is just don't bother!
oasis of calm. just outside the medina a lovely way to spend a coupe of hoursa memorial to yves st Laurent the sound of running water large variety of plants and ornamental ponds a nice treat
Arrive early before the crowds arrive. Beautiful garden and don't miss the Berber museum. the garden has incredible colours. See also the musee de la palmeraie

Worth the visit. This garden is a little slice of heaven within the craziness of morroco and well worth the visit. Beautiful colours, great photo opportunities, a stunning array of cacti from around the world. It is also wonderfully quiet and cool. We took the opportunity to just sit and take it all in a number of times - would recommend this rather than rushing through.

Stunning oasis in the madness of Marrakesh. The gardens are beautiful, peaceful, quiet, well worth a detour to see.Aside from the ponds and plants, the museum is interesting. But mostly it's the quiet and calm of the garden itself. Beautiful.

Peaceful and beautiful Jardin Majorelle. Spent the morning at this beautiful garden and the serenity is glorious. Loved all the different species of palm and the vibrant blue used to paint the pots and the building and the pathways. It is so different and very chic and such a delight in what is essentially a desert climate. All the cacti are very interesting and the whole place just has a wonderful atmosphere. The fountains are very soothing as are the fish in the pond! Just enjoyed the whole experience.The little cafe and the shop are all top notch too. Congratulations Jardin Majorelle!

The Berber museum on the garden grounds are the real treasure of this visit!. The Berber museum on the garden grounds are the real treasure of this visit! The garden was frankly nothing to right home about. It was clean and relatively small. It did offer a bit of solitude from the chaos of the souks and daily life in Marrakech. What was the real treasure at this site was the Berber museum on the grounds of the garden. Though this is a small exhibit my husband and I agreed it was probably the best thing we saw on our trip. If you are at all interested in knowing more about Berber culture this museum offers great insight as well as a stunning costume collection of traditional Berber costumes depending on tribe and region.

Lovely Garden in the middle of a bustling city. A relaxing peaceful garden to stroll around, when outside the walls is a noisey bustling city. The Berber museum is interesting and the cafe a great place for lunch. It's not a large place, so no more than 2 hours required
Lovely place. liked most of it - the design, colourdislike - some areas not suitable for wheelchair user and smokers allowed at the cafe

a garden of delight. The huge amount of Cacti on display with a lot of them in blume.
The museum is also worth the extra to visit

Oasis in Marrakech. We enjoy the hustle & bustle of Marrakech but it's always a relief to walk into the Jardin Majorelle & take a break. The lay out of the plantings are beautiful & the Majorelle Blue paint accents the serenity of the place. The Berber Museum is a treat & the gift shop always had something unique to take home as a gift or souvenir.

Highlight of our trip. Visited in May 2015 and it was a highlight of our trip - the colours were beautiful with lots of benches to simply relax and soak it all in. It's not the kind of place you would want to rush - leave 2 hours so you can enjoy it all!

YSL's Seal in Marrakech. This is a place with full of YSL colors and you can find his signature in every single corner of this garden. It is a must see place if you are in Marrakech. There is a small museum inside the garden. I advise you to avoid rush times of tourist groups if you want to enjoy more.

Garden visit. Not too crowded on the day we visited. Beautiful vibrant colours of the painted walls and pots contrasting with the greenery. Seems very modern. Had a look around the small Berber museum which is well laid out.The gardens were smaller than I had expected - very well maintained.
A MUST SEE IF YOU ARE IN MARAKECH. These amazing gardens give you a surprise at every turn! They are a delight to the senses. We loved them, and by the way, we loved, loved Morocco and its people.
jardin majorelle. This was nice to visit. Doesn't take long to look around as quite small but very cheap to get in so can't complain.

Nice place for a wander. I probably enjoyed my time here more after than during the visit. The gardens were smaller than expected but very tranquil and colourful. There was a lot of beautiful plants and a nice place to walk around. The cafe is a very calming place to cool off a little. Retrospectively it is quite a spectacular place and sticks in your mind. Very different from other places visited and a nice contrast to the old town.

Small piece of heaven- by Yves Saint Laurent 😊. It was the retirement home of designer Yves Saint Laurent Plants from the four corners of the world, very peaceful very quite. Plus their is a small berbers museum, facinating handmade clothes and jewellery.Really #1 destination in marrakech Cost:50 Dirham garden ~ 5€ 25 Dirham museum ~ 2.5€
Wonderful. Beautiful and colorful place to visit! It was great to finish my stay in Marrakech walking around this garden.
Beautiful View. It was small but very pretty and a good way to relax and take a break from the hustle and bustle of Jemaa al Finna

Quiet oasis. After one or more days in the busy medina, this is a welcome, quiet oasis. Temperature is a bit cooler and there are many spots to just sit and relax. Funny that a colour is named after this parc, the so-called blue Majorelle.

A treat to see an unusual garden in such a culturally rich city. Well organised with extremely nice staff a plenty but w were disappointed to see more plant labels and think some were incorrect - though not certain! None the less a well looked after treasure with a fascinating Berber museum that was small but well curated. The cafe attached was charming and the shop lovely but far far too expensive.
Beautiful. Go first thing in a morning before the crowds, and you will almost have the place to yourself. Stunning gardens, and definitely an escape from the hustle and bustle

nice for photo shooting. i was there for a nice walk in the afternoon. really nice garden and perfect for photo shoot. But compares the other sights in Marrakech, this one is alittle bit over priced, But in general a nice place to visit.

Vibrant, colorful gardens in Marrakesh ..lovely. The Majorelle gardens are a delight. Worth visiting. It is located in the new city of Gueliz, away from the Medina. This house was donated to the city by Yves Saint Laurent the designer as a token of his affection for the city that welcomed him and his partner. It has a big pond with water lilies that remind you of Monet's garden. The blues, yellows and reds look awesome. It was pretty cheap to get in too. Worth a visit.

Beautiful place for some time out!. Really well maintained, garden...loved the splashes of electric blue, and vast range of cacti.Disappointed the gift shop didnt stock the staff's blue 'Jardin Marjorelle' t-shirts, as I would have snapped one up!

A beautiful garden hidden in the city. This is a must visit if you are in Marrakech. It's quite small but a lovely little walled garden with vibrant colours, ponds, flowers and cactus'. Random tip. Mineral water is twice the price at the refreshment stand outside, so buy it inside instead!
Beautiful oasis. I love gardens and these are such a surprise in such a desert like city. The colours are stunning and they really are magical gardens! Do not miss out!

Lil Paradise by YSL. You might have a look to this garden where has lived the famous Yves Saint Laurent. Beautfil trees and cactus, fountains moroccan style, this Blue Majorelle house, the restaurant, the shop and the Berber Museum...in such a lil place: quiet nice! Nature Lovers would have the pleasure to read the indication of the several trees. Book lovers would like to read under alm trees while listening to birds. The restaurant is expansive but it's "a place". The entrance price is affordable and just 20DH more you can visit the museum -Have loved it, very well done! Enjoy!

Exotic Beauty. Stunning garden minutes walk from Riad Pachavana. Beautiful and shady on an incredibly hot, sunny day. Lovely plants and trees, cleverly laid out with water features and a stunning pond of water lillies with turtles. Nice cafe, Burber museum and boutique within the garden walls. An absolute oasis of calm and natural Moroccan beauty in the heart of the city - not to be missed!

YSL had exquisite taste. Loved the bright colors, along with the plants. Flat, easy to see in an hour. Worth finding your way to enjoy. You can picture people hanging out in the 70s grooving out to the vibe. Even my husband liked this excursion!
Nice cool place to visit.. Beautiful gardens and grounds with lovely planting. A nice cool place to visit in a hot city. Loved the colours of the buildings.

Stunning but busy. Gorgeous and unexpectedly beautiful garden to visit. Try and visit first thing when there aren't so many people but even when it's busy there are areas to sit and contemplate. The delicious courtyard cafe was an added bonus.
Small beautiful park. The garden is nice and beautiful. It's not very big so don't plan to spend too much time here. There's also a museum (for a separate fee) and a souvenir shop inside.
Stunningly beautiful!!. I loved all the brightly colored flower pots and gorgeous flowers! A peaceful gem tucked into the busy city. A must see when in Marrakech.

A nice visit & very helpful staff. The gardens were enjoyable and even in the heat of the June afternoon was quite cool and shady. As far as gardens go, these were average, but the staff was super helpful (and spoke several languages), the lunch and coffee/tea at the cafe was quite good and the price was very reasonable. Would definitely recommend as a mid-morning, lunch or mid-afternoon visit as a break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Bottom line, if I visit Marrakech again, I will visit the gardens again.
Beautiful gardens, peaceful.... A relaxing beautiful place. the plants are lovely and the little restaurant is worth a visit. A lovely half day out.
Cool and quiet. A small group of us spent a happy hour in the gardens admiring the plants and other foliage and taking numerous photos! Amazing place for photos!

An Oasis amongst the chaos of Marrakech!. Beautiful gardens, very peaceful, good lunch at the cafe. Tickets cost 50 dh and you can also combine with the Berber Museum for an extra 25 dh which was interesting and well worth seeing.

Blown away!!. I am not a gardener or have any interest in it but this place is AMAZING!
After the hustle, bustle & heat of outside you walk in to a cool, quiet, peaceful sight which is so pleasing to the senses.
Please don't be put off by thinking it's just a garden, it's a haven of tranquility & visual delight!

An oasis in Marrakech. Make sure you get a ticket that covers the museum as it is the best museum in all of Marrakech, beautiful gardens with beautiful buildings around, one of the must do things in Marrakech

Nothing that impressive! ! But worth a visit. Don't go in expecting to see some exotic and rear botanical beauties,it's a very artistic and peaceful garden . Beautiful colors and I loved the peace and quite.

Lovely gardens. The gardens are lovely and well worth the cheap entrance fee. There's not a lot too them however so can easily been done in a short space of time. A nice way to spend an hour or so, however probably not an absolute must-see if you have a lot to see and do on your itinerary. Still if you have a bit of spare time, it's a nice way to spend it. Peaceful, tranquil and a few photo ops but not a huge amount of diversity compared to other gardens I've visited. Has the must haves of a cafe and gift shop although we didn't make use of any of these.

wow - Big Wow!. Take your time and walk though the garden as though you were tasting a fine wine. The intricacies of the garden, the colors, and the inspiration set forth by its designer Yves St Laurent are breath taking. Enjoy.

A must do... Majorelle Garden is beautiful and YSL house is stunning. It is a disappointment that one can not visit the house. The small museum inside is well worth the additional fee. My favorite section was exhibition of the cloths and jewelry of different tribes in Morocco. There is a gift shop and a book store in premises. I had a coffee break in the cafe within the gardens and wished I had not eaten earlier so I could eat in this cozy little cafe.

Slightly disappointing. We were expecting more, I would describe as a compact garden with a couple of rooms as a museum. This was also the most expensive of the sights we visited in Marrakech. The garden was relaxing but was also a fair way out of the old town.

Beautiful and peaceful . I really enjoyed the gardens it was a nice break from the hustle and bustle. It is small and will only take about thirty minutes to go round but it is a wonderful retreat. If you are only going to do a couple of things then this should be one of them.Make sure you don't get ripped off by the taxis outside to get back to the main square. We paid 50Dh which is about right don't be afraid to haggle.

Linger and enjoy the Berber museum. I would have enjoyed more time in the gardens to savor the beauty and absorb the Berber museum. It's all compact and easy, there are many layers to it's beauty and elegance. Just like YSL I suppose.

Well worth a visit!. Pleasant serene atmosphere to appreciate an impressive garden attraction. Great backdrops everywhere to have your photograph taken by the friendly staff who volunteered to find us the best spots for our pics. We found the Berber museum informative and interesting and had time for lunch in the lovely courtyard café which was most enjoyable.

Morning visit. Pretty much everyone says visit these gardens but it was still a wonderful experience. Having gone thru the crazy traffic in the Medina U arrive at this oasis of peace and traquillity. The design of the gardens was lovely, every thing is so clean and tidy and and the water features and cactus are stunning. The Berber museum was small but very informative and the exhibition of clothing and jewellery was well worth the extra few dhirams. We ate in the cafe and found the food really good, so all in all would definitely recommend the gardens to anyone visiting Marakech
YSL the real deal. beautiful, great way to get an insight into the man's Marrakesh paradise. wonderful for garden lovers and style lovers alike
WONDERFUL PLACE!!!!. What a find, loved everything about this magical place - must see visit even if you're not mad about gardens.

Don't miss the Berber Museum. Most of the visitors skip the amazingly curated Berber Museum that showcases amazing historical and cultural items. Spend thirty minutes there. It helped me understand much more about Morocco's rich cultural heritage.And, yes, the gardens are nice too!

Beautiful but too many people!. Gorgeous garden by Yves St Laurent & Pierre Berger, but too many visitors at the same time. The Berber Museum was AMAZING, housed in an old artist's studio in the gardens. DO NOT MISS IT. Best display of jewellery I've seen in a long time.
Pretty garden bad food. Very nice walk around the garden, the pottery, the museum, but dont try the restaurant that is overpriced and bad quality food.

A must do while in Marrakech!. Such a lovely chilled out place, very cheap to visit just to have a little quiet time before heading back out into the madness that is Marrakech! Visited about 12:00 not that busy, I was worried it would be after reading previous reviews. Doesn't take long to walk around but nice to sit on one of the many benches around to just take it all in. Colours are fantastic, made me want to return home and paint my garden walls bright blue!

Beautiful spot. Whenever someone come to visit in Morocco i take them to it. Super beautiful and calm atmosphere. Lovely colors and architecture. The variety of cactus is really cool. I don't mind revisiting whenever I can.

Beautiful and peace place in crazy Marrakesh. Gardens are lovely and such a nice break from the circus that is Marrakesh. Peaceful and quiet, and cool. There is a great little cafe across the street for a smoothie or gelato stop after. Makes for a relaxing afternoon.
Stunning. Everything like the photos. Just a very cool must-see in Marrakech. There's also cute boutique shopping nearby.
Beautiful gardens. We spent a lovely afternoon here strolling through the gardens. The cafe was also lovely, although you will need to get there before the lunch hour rush to get a table.

Dream place!!. In the simplest area outside the Medina, where you would never expect a paradise so beautiful
Jardin Majorelle is a fantastic mix of cobalto blue, yellow and bright colors in a jungle of bamboos trees, cactus and pools.
Great place also to refresh and relax in a hot sunny day.
Yves Saint Laurent did it write making it his house!!!
Beautiful Experience. Not only were the gardens impressive, the house itself was lovely. It is a place to go to see what the color blue should look like.

Stunning!. So so lovely - spent a lot of time here - so peaceful and lovely - enjoyed walking around stress free and loved the monument to Yves St Laurent - so special - the cafe and shop are also worth a look! Well woth the visit!

Could have missed it. I'm going to be honest, the gardens themselves are boring, busy and not very well kept up (writing all over trees ect) which was a shame as pretty otherwise. Very small only took about 10 minutes to see the whole thing, when we went there was a dead bird under one of the trees which when mentioned with exclamation ; attracted a large group of other tourists clearly finding this the most exciting thing about the whole garden. The entrance fee is pricy for what it is and the shop pricier - 1200 dh for a vase? For the gardens alone I would say give it a miss however the Berber museum made it worthwhile (although more expensive) as it was interesting and well kept up.

A lovely oasis. The Jardin Majorelle was my favourite thing about Marrakech. It was very lush and beautiful in an area that is so hot and arid. People complain about how much it costs (which truly isn't very much) and it is worth the money. It's a bit of a hike out of the Medina but we managed to walk it. The colours of the buildings are amazing! A must see.

Magnificent gardens. Don't miss this while you are in Marrakech. One of the most magnificent gardens I have seen! A tribute to YSL and his partner. Lots of exotic plants and a beautiful setting to sit on a bench and catch up with nature and get some quiet time.

Pleasant, but not much. Its a nice, charming small garden. Its like an oasis, very different from the Marrakech outside walls, and a kind of expensive compared to other traditional sights in town. If you want to know Marrakech, thats not the place to go.

Pleasant Garden. The garden is pleasant enough but loses some of its charm with photo obsessed tourists blocking the paths.If you are in the area it's probably worth it (it's a 25minute walk from Jemaa El Fna) but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, unless you have some affinity with YSL.

If you like gardens this is a must. A tranquil, cool, place away from the bustle that is Marrakech. A beautifully designed garden combined with a pleasant courtyard café and interesting folk museum. Well worth a visit.

Better than expected. After seeing many uninspired photos of the gardens I wasn't sure how much I would actually like it especially as the entry fee is only around £3.60 (nothing compared to what you might pay to visit some RHS gardens back near London)We walked the 20 or so minutes from the medina through the busy streets and missed any signs overshooting the turning by a block so keep your eyes peeled.Luckily when we arrived the gardens weren't too busy so a leisurely stroll around, taking photos wasn't a problem. It is a shame that people have felt the need to engrave their names in the base of many of the beautiful bamboos and even cactii but it is better that than the alternative of high fenced off walkways meaning you cant get close to the planting.Nothing can prepare you for the intensity of that YSL 'Marjorelle' Blue though. Painted walkways and the central museum blow you away with strategically placed contrasting pots making fantasic photo opportunities. I did hear one man ask his partner why she was taking a picture of a bare blue wall!!?If this is you, then it is probably best to stay away as you won't get anything from you visit but if like us, you take time to soak it all in, you can have a lovely relaxing walk around.The cafe was affordably priced in comparison to London and the food very good..We do recommend their fabulous fruit juices (about £3) to quench a thirst and set you up for the short walk back into the Medina

majorelle bliss. Gardens were surprisingly nice - unexpectedly colourful for a cactus garden. YSL memorial totally underwhelming though. Beautiful photographic opportunities throughout. Expensive but beautiful shop. Nice little cafe. Kept cool by bamboo shade.

A bit underwhelming.. It is not a big garden but it is pretty with some lovely cacti, bamboo and flowers. The pools with terrapins and fish are great. As are the cobalt blue buildings. The shop is nothing special and we did not bother with the museum or café. The YSL memorial was very crowded with tourists who seem determined to carve their names into all the plants!?! Not enough for a long visit and rather pricey for Marrakesh but it is in the most pretentious bit of the new town.

Colourful. It is the amazing colours that first hit you in XSL's garden and home.They are beautiful against the green foliage and flowers. A nice restful & cool ambience after the medina. It was good to see, but quite expensive for what it is. It is small and it takes half an hour to walk the red paths that divides the thickly planted bamboo, cacti & bougainvilleas dotted with colourful pots and waterways. There is a good coffee shop outside on the corner. We went just after opening and was not crowded.

True oasis!. This is a true oasis in Marrakech. Worth spending even half a day to enjoy, take photos, visit the Berber museum, take a glass of mint tea at the cafe and to relax. This is something totally opposite to the Djema el Fna square.

Most Beautiful Site in Marrakesh. We were there in May 2015 during a heat wave at temperature of 47 C. This is a wonderful garden and very well taken care of. It is very pleasant to visit and from one part of the garden to the other the plants and trees are simply exotic. We visited the Yves St-Laurent art museum and the boutique that have superb high end items. I recommend to visit slowly and enjoy every moments. Employees are very nice and patient with tourists.

LOVE IT!!. My husband and I are gardeners here in Florida and we certainly loved the visit! Saw lots of plants that we are familiar with half way round the world from where we live! Would try to go early in the day as gets more crowded.. But had fantastic look!

Spectacular. The colours in the garden are simply stunning and despite the crowds of tourists milling through it still maintains an aura of peace - much appreciated after the madness of the Marrakech streets! The Berber museum was unexpectedly interesting and worth paying a bit more for (particularly as we went to the Mountains into Berber villages the next day - gave it all more of a context). It's inspired my husband to paint some pots and try out some of what we saw - how it will all look in the drab Kent sunlight will be interesting! I would have liked more information on the day of house and the French painter who created it to give the place more of a context and history. A little more information on how Yves St Laurent came to be involved in the place would have been interesting to. All this can obviously be found through a quick Google search but a brochure would have been good. The café by Marrakech standards was expensive but it was a very hot day and worth the extra cost to sit in the lovely courtyard in the shade.

Beautiful! It worth it. Yes, it's crowded with tourists. Yes, that fact takes away part of this garden's magic but... You can't skip it! You should go! It's an amazing paradise with a beautiful flora variety, with a gorgeous studio and it's exotic colors, flowerpots and cactus that makes you question where are you for real!I hope you'll enjoy it as much as we did
Fashionista destination!. Lovely garden, very cool in all senses of the word!! Obviously quite a trendy destination due to the YSL connection, but it is a very nice garden, well worth seeing.

Beautiful place. We were expecting something different, probably different type of flowers/plants BUT we couldnt be more amazed with the decoration, every single detail, the colours, the different type of plants, incredible big cactus, we loved it!
Magic Majorelle . Best advice go early and needs to be done twice ... It's special place look forward to the house being open up ... Magic Majorelle

Truly Beautiful. Jardin Majorelle is a peaceful beautifully designed garden by Yves St. Laurent. There are many interesting plants and lovely water features throughout. We went mid day when it was very crowded and I think it would have been even nicer at a more off peak time. The gift shop is wonderful but very pricey.
gorgeous. Had a nice coffee there. Really lovely designer stylish garden. Gets busy. Look out for owls high up in big tree! Love the yellow pots. About 5 euros entry price each. Under nines free.

Beautiful - though small and can get rather crowded. Lovely calm space with beautiful cacti palms and colours, the art deco studio is gorgeous. But it is not very bug so can get rather crowded which spoils the atmosphere a bit.
Magnifique. Stunningly beautiful gardens designed by Yves St. Laurent. Don't miss a visit to the Berber Museum inside. It's fabulous as well.
Beautiful. It's definitely worth visiting in Marrakech! It's extremely beautiful, very colorful and it has a rich history.
Beautiful gardens. Tranquil gardens, beautiful colours. Very well designed and easy to negotiate. Not extensive, but well worth a visit.

Nice, but overrated. A nice garden. Too many "watchguards" ruining a bit the otherwise very relaxing atmosphere.
The garden is not very big, rather a nice collection of succulents. The pathways are smooth an nicely done. I did not read anything about the garden, so I was not impressed enough to estimate the 50dh entrance fee. The berber museum costs extra.

Beautiful Garden. Love how serene this place is, beautiful garden and quite cool inside considering how hot it is the time we visited Marrakech. to the beautiful flowers, to the many cactus areas, to the water gardens. Great food at the Moroccan restaurant inside the area. You must visit the Berber museum inside the garden, a small extra charge is required.

Beautiful. A taxi ride to these gardens was an adventure in itself - but the gardens were beautiful. Buy the ticket for gardens and museum as the museum us fascinating. Berber art is beautifully displayed in a small museum. If you gave time, the courtyard restaurant is very good - can be pricey but our meal was delicious. Very tranquil compared to the noise of the old town of Marrakech. Go in the morning before it gets busy!
Beaytiful place very serene. This place was beautiful with the exotic plants and vibrant colours, would reccommend a visit but you do need to haggle the taxi fare.

Pretty but not essential. We had high expectations because many friends said how amazing the garden was. It's a nice garden, but costs 5 dollars per person and can be seen in under 15 minutes. Nice if you have extra time but definitely not essential.

Don't miss this quiet oasis!. I'm not a great fan of gardens, but this really caught my attention! It's quite small and if you are in a rush you can visit it very quickly, but i would suggest to spend some time there and enjoy the quiet atmosphere away from the chaos of the medina. The garden has the classic touch of YSL, but with a unique flavour.

A forest of bamboo. Fantastic garden of bamboo, cacti and succulents. Go there for the light coming through the trees and canes, the brightly coloured planters and waterways.Spot the wildlife - fish, frogs, turtles and owls in the highest trees.Good coffee and pastries in courtyard setting.

Blue garden. Everyone who visits Marrakech enjoys this haven of peace. We were told that the afternoons are quieter with less tourists and we followed this suggestion. The blue sky, "Majorelle blue " of the pots and buildings were stunning and the different varieties of cactus were unbelievable.

Sightseeing round Marrakech. Used the hop on hop off sightseeing buses to go here. It was one of the highlights of my first visit to Morocco. The colours were brilliant, the whole garden was immaculate and the staff very helpful. A definite " must see"

So tranquil. A must visit. You step off the busy road to explore this hidden gem. Tucked away is the lovely park area. It's small but once inside you feel like you are completely away from everything. It's also where Yves Saint Laurent ashes are kept. Worth a visit while in Marrakech

Beautiful!. Amazing place: do take time to visit. The colours are amazing. Although you would expect all sorts of flowers etc: the garden is still unique (even if it 'only' lists cacti and bamboo). What makes it so enchanting is the atmosphere, the bright colours, the many benches where you can sit and relax. In addition, do buy the extra ticket for the Berber museum inside the garden (amazing collection of Berber jewelry!).

Very beautiful, very blue!. A trip to Marrakech, we were told, is not complete without a trip to see Yves Saint Laurent's famous gardens. So we did just that! Student get in a little cheaper, which was nice...The gardens themselves are smaller than the guide books would probably have you believe, and to be honest you can be round them in 15 minutes or so, but they are beautiful. It sounds silly but THAT blue really is stunning in the setting. A lot of cacti and a few turtles, some shimmering in fish in the beautifully built ponds makes for a very relaxing stroll. Definitely step into the cafe for a milkshake. I had date and banana I think and it was delicious!

A must in Marrakech . Very nice place where you can see a lot of plants and great memories from Yves saint Lauren.
The place is also very well managed and great atmosphere.

My top 3 visit in Marrakech. I just love the gardens and walking around .
The story behind it and Yves Saint Laurent Heritage are great.
A must do visit
Quiet Oasis in Marakkesh. A beautiful garden with lots of tall plants, cactus, lotos, bamboo - anything you can imagine under a paradise garden. Definitely with a visit when you are in Marrakesh.

Do take the time to visit.. These gardens are not massive but the design is very good. There is a good cross section of plants, shrubs and trees. The gardens are very well cared for. We went on a rather hot day and it was nice to be in the cool shaded gardens. Don't miss the small museum, it gives an insight to the Berber culture. A nice little café too.As is the case where organised tours visit, go early if you can.A very pleasant garden to visit. Entrance fee was very reasonable.
Exotic. The gardens are not huge but they are a haven of tranquillity and beauty. Worth a visit! Also had a mint tea in the cafe, just gorgeous! Would re-visit my next time in Marrakech!
Well worth a visit. The use of colour and shapes in this garden are feast for the eyes. We enjoyed the peace and tranquility of this well designed garden in the middle of a very busy Marrakesh

The best thing in Marrakech. This is a beautiful world class garden and the only thing in Marrakech that lived up to it's claims. It's beautifully planted with fantastic succulents and cacti. The use of local colours is extremely well applied in decorating the pots and buildings, the whole garden is total eye candy. My only reservation is that it's a bit expensive and over crowded with visitors...but it's worth seeing.
Don't miss it!. Magnificent garden with all kinds of beautiful desert vegetation. There is a small museum, and an excellent gift shop, on the grounds.
A hidden gem. Well worth a visit. We paid 40 Dirham from the square and was a highlight. The gardens are amazing and entrance fees go towards maintainance and projects within Morocoo.

A pleasant garden to walk around. It was a joy to be able to walk in a lovely garden and have a break from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. The bamboo plantation was amazing to see and the cactus's were wonderful. Defiantly worth a trip during your stay in Marrakech.
wonderful place to get lost. twelve-acre botanical garden and artist's landscape garden in Marrakech that shows beauty in every corner... it is very nice to be quiet out to the stress of the MEDINA.
Not as great was was expecting. Don't get me wrong what was there was beautiful but it was very small and we where in and out within an hour or so x

Wonderful. I am not a fan of cacti and like a lot of flower colour in my gardens so on the fact of it wouldn`t like this at all. But I thought it was magical with the exquisite planting of the cacti, palms and other green foliage intermingled with the brightly coloured pots. An enchanting oasis in a wonderfully manic city. It is not a huge space and we had an hour there and could have had another 10 minutes in the small museum. So glad we went.
a highlight. A real highlight of our trip. We particularly enjoyed the museum- lots of information on life in rural Morocco presented in very engaging ways.

Beautiful! . Beautiful and peaceful garden. Great to wander around for half an hour or so. There is also a small museum dedicated to Berber culture. Well kept grounds and well shaded which is nice as it can get very hot in Morocco.

A BREAK FROM THE MAYHEM. These gardens are beautifully kept and very interesting and such a welcome escape from the mayhem that is Marrakech. They are really worth visiting just to get your thoughts back.
Small and beautiful. Well worth a visit to this small and beautiful oasis. Good cafe in the middle with decent facilities.
What a Beautifull Garden !. Relaxing and peacefull gardenHuge variety of pkants and cactusHighly recommended place to visit while in Marrakech

Beautiful Gardens. We took a 'petit taxi' (20dirhams/£1.40) here as it was quite a way from where we were staying in the medina and spent around an hour lazily looking around these beautiful lush gardens. Entry fee 50dirhams/£3.40ish or you can get a combined ticket with the Berber museum, I think that was 100dirhams.There are some lovely examples of enormous cacti, succulents and palms and the décor is very vibrantly coloured. There are plenty of shady spots with benches to sit, relax and enjoy the surroundings but the gardens aren't as big as I expected,well worth a visit though. Top tip-visit Kaowa afterwards for lovely food and drinks, it is situated just across from the entrance to the gardens.

Very Small but Beautiful Gardens. We took a taxi from the main square. The taxi driver waited for us to go around in the gardens and then he dropped us off at our next destination.Must visit whilst your in town.They have great cactus plants there.We paid less than £5.00 for entrance fee

Rainbow of colors&flowers.... This is the very best Marrakech has to offer. Once you step in Jardin Majorelle is like entering heaven... from the smell of the flowers, the singing birds to the lovely walking trails you'll find yourself in a fairytale. Forget about the chaos in Djem el Fna market and treat yourself with a visual experience you'll never forget! Amazing garden!

Gardens To Remember. Very poignant, remembering Yves St. Laurent's bequest to Morocco. Wonderful tropical plants and an oasis of calm. It is possible to do this visit via a taxi from the square in Marrakech. It isn't far.

Peaceful Oasis with taste of Berber culture. If you are lover of gardens, art and design or just a fan of Yves Saint Laurent, then you should definitely visit this place! It is unique piece of tranquillity and peace in the bustle and hustle of Marrakech with colour symphony to please your eyes. Take enough time to fully enjoy the garden as it can be busy with tourist groups, sit for a while on bench, relax and look at the game of light and colours. I also recommend to visit Berber Museum inside the garden, small but AMAZING, they did really good job and even "museumphobic visitors" like it :) Book shop has interesting collection of Berber/Amazigh literature and studies, boutique is touch of luxury and café is fine too. True, the place isn't big, tickets are quite pricey (50MAD garden/25MAD museum) and it isn't good option for "hot spot place hunters" but it is a small gem for people who can appreciate details, colours and composition.

Escape the hustle and bustle. The gardens are an explosion of colour - full of flora and fauna, towering palm trees and cacti - and are well worth a visit. Situated just outside the Medina, entrance is a very reasonable 50DH, plus another 25DH if you wish to visit the Berber Museum. The museum is small, but interesting, although you can't take photos inside of it.You can spend easily 1-2 hours here taking in the gardens, longer if you decide to have a drink or a spot of food at the cafe and visit the museum.

Tranquility in Marrakesh. Love how serene this place is, beautiful garden and quite cool inside considering how hot it is the time we visited Marrakesh. Picture perfect garden. There's a Berber Museum exhibit showcasing the Women's fashion in Morocco with a lot of Antiques inside (additional fee of MAD 25 and no photographs allowed). At the end of the garden, there's a YSL shop and small room showing YSL's yearly art which is quite nice. Next to it, there's a coffee shop where you can chill and relax - quite pricey tho.Definitely worth to go!

No words.. I think if I knew more of the history or had more of an understanding of the Garden before I went, then I would've understood more of why there was a garden and had more of a connection. I feel like the Garden is ok. There's a place inside to eat and a place to buy souvenirs. I still recommend it. Why not. The area also has souvenir stores, a supermarket, a cambio, etc.

Tranquil Garden. A garden paradise, well worth the time to visit. Sit and relax in this garden, it has many beautiful spots to enjoy the view from the bamboo garden, to the beautiful flowers, to the many cactus areas, to the water gardens. Great food at the Moroccan restaurant inside the area. You must visit the Berber museum inside the garden, a small extra charge is required.

Lovely gardens but not spectacular. I will begin by saying that I don't consider the Jardin Majorelle a 'must see' place in Marrakech. If you have plenty of time and would like a quiet place outside of your riad or hotel, then it is a pleasant place to visit. There are lots of palms and cacti. We appreciated the shade. We always enjoy gardens but found the entrance fee here o be inordinately high. We did not pay the additional fee to enter the museum. We enjoyed the walk to the garden from the medina.

50 Shades of Blue. A really gorgeous place to visit, and should be on every to-do list for visitors to Marrakech. A very calm place, great for stunning photos, and a relaxing visit. The only disadvantage is that entry into the museum (in the house itself) costs a lot more than just a wonder around the gardens.
Beautiful garden with nice cafe. We enjoyed seeing the cacti and the turtles. The cafe was expensive but quite good food and ok service. The museum was well worth the visit also.

Magnificent Gardens. These are the most lovely gardens and the perfect place to spend the morning walking through the paths and enjoying the plants and fountains in this 12 acre botanical garden. Yves St. Laurent gifted the gardens to the city and there is a wonderful gift shop their where you can purchase some of the designs with his label. Named for Jacque Majorelle, the French artist. The majorelle color blue is famous world wide because of this man and this place. Don't miss it.
Wonderful visit, entry only 50dh - bargain. Yves Saint Laurent old digs. Definitely worth a trip!! :):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):):)

Beautiful and worth a visit, but be prepared for crowds!. The garden itself and the architecture and colors within it are stunning, and it's well worth a visit...the Berber Museum here is also beautiful and interesting (it's small, though). I liked learning about the history of the garden and the fact that it was saved and restored by Yves Saint Laurent and is currently managed by his foundation (which means it's very well maintained). However, there were so many people here on the day we went that it made it very difficult to enjoy the garden or take photos. We went first thing in the morning and there was already a long line and throngs of people in the garden. I had heard this place described as tranquil and a good place to sit and read a book of an afternoon, or to meander and enjoy some peace and quiet in hectic Marrakech, but there was easily a couple bus loads of people here. It's similar to other major attractions in Marrakech in that way--like the palaces or Saadian tombs, so just be aware of that. The gift shop has some beautiful and unique items, but none of it is inexpensive. If you're going to get a taxi from the garden to the square or something, go over to the main street...don't take one of the taxis lined up directly outside the garden--they'll charge you 50 dirham to go anywhere, even for a short distance. This was one of the most exorbitant quotes we received. The max it should cost to take a petit taxi anywhere within Marrakech is 20 dirham during the day, 30 at night. We tried to haggle two of the garden taxi drivers down to 20 and they let us walk away, presumably because there are many tourists visiting the garden who are willing to pay the 50 dirham. The petit taxis have meters, but they are typically turned off when foreigners are involved, and we never succeeded in getting a single driver to turn on the meter in Marrakech despite asking repeatedly...just another issue to be aware of when getting to and from center.

Lovely Gardens with a wide range of cacti, and Berber Museum too. This was our favourite gardens that we visited whilst in Marrakech. Huge bamboos and a fantastic range of cacti in an enclosed garden, there was a wonderfully relaxing atmosphere. the Berber museum was interesting (additional charge) with information in english , french and arabic. The homage to Yves St Laurent was good too, but i was somewhat mystified as to why the monument to him was what appeared to be a piece of a doric column. There is a cafe inside, selling ice creams as well as food, but it is more pricey than the cafes which can be found very close to the entrance. We took about 2 hours to look round, and used a taxi to travel to it from our road in the medina (50 diram)

Beautiful Gardens. Visited these beautiful gardens on a very warm afternoon it was lovely to get out of the sun for a while they are beautifully kept they have some very interesting plants etc it was good they had a little plaque to tell you what the plants were and where they originated from, worth a visit

overpriced and overated. dont waste your money .... it cost 150 dirham (15 euro)- 50d for the entry and 25d for the museum each - and another 50 dirham for the taxi since it was so far away ... for two people to go into a tiny garden (smaller than some ive been in just at the back of peoples houses) .........theres no flowers, its all palm trees and cacti ... and besides the memorial for ysl and the name of the street.. nobody could have guessed it was owned and designed by one of the best fashion designers ever .... i was so disappointed a the end, the museum is tiny( but still more enjoyable than the "garden "),and the garden is tiny and all the same ... its almost shocking how unispired the whole place is considering its backround ...... its like they didnt want to push the budget ...
Absolutely stunning. Beautiful gardens and lovely cafe to rest and have lunch. Easy to get to by taxi and well worth a visit.
Very nice Garden. Although it's rather small, the garden is beautiful and has tons of cacti and other plants from dry areas. Try to go early in the morning to avoid queues and crowds.
Must see. Gorgeous, don't miss it. Worth paying a little extra to see the museum. Small but incredible. Everyone has to visit!

Oasis of blue & green. Coming to Marrakech several times, I never missed having a timeout in this wonderful green and blue oasis of silence and peace beside the busy medina and Jemaa el Fna. See this beautiful garden, calm own and relax your eyes and your ears. Connect yourself with the nature by watching the plants, following the water and listening to the birds.

Peaceful and Colorful. Yves Saint Laurent was one of two artists who restored this unusual garden established by Jacques Majorelle. The bright blues (the color majorelle) and oranges are a delight . The adjacent Berber Museum is interesting, and the gift shop has many unusual gifts and jewelry. A very nice way to spend the morning.

Stunning Tranquility. Wow! This is a most compelling and enjoyable experience. The striking colours combined with the array of flora, fauna, cactus and trees are just stunning. I'm not a big 'garden' visitor, but this is well worth the visit and relatively inexpensive entrance fee. The history associated with the place is also very interesting and its one of those places I'm glad to be able to say "I've been there"! I will certainly return the next time we're in Marrakech.

The best place we visited in Marrakech.. By far the loveliest place we visited. Good place to spend a couple of hours during the midday heat. Very shaded and plenty of places to sit and interesting views to admire. Beautiful colours. Definitely worth the 50 direrhams admission price.

Quiet oasis in the busy city. I came here as part of a tour. Marrakesh is famous for its many gardens, some a thousand years old. This one was a late-comer to the city, having been planted in 1947 by a famous French furniture designer. It was later purchased and expanded by fashion mogul Yves Saint Laurent. It is a very peaceful and relaxing refuge from the busy city streets of Marrakesh. Particularly nice was the shady bamboo forest and the extensive cactus gardens. As an added bonus, there is a Berber museum within the grounds. This museum has many interesting displays about the culture and history of the native people of Morocco. Well worth a visit!!

Nice Gardens. We visited the gardens around 2 in the afternoon which was nice because we got out of the sun for while. The gardens are nice but if you are limited on time in Marrakesh, I wouldn't make this a destination must see.

Lovely collection of plants. The garden has an interesting collection of bamboos and cacti, all set in tranquil surroundings with a predominance of the famous blue colour to add to the "cool" feeling of the place.There is a lack of seating and no obvious place to buy water ( there is a restaurant) so take bottled water with you because it can get very hot. All in all a lovely place to visit for an hour or two.

YSL's secret garden. An amazing collection of plants, palms and cacti. Very well organised, good toilets, cafe and small museum impeccably kept. Go early to avoid the crowds. This is a very popular destination. Look for the frogs and birdlife.

Stunning colour and exotic plants...a real oasis.. After the busy traffic in Marrakesh, these gardens appeared quiet and tranquil. Some fantastic specimens of cacti and other exotic plants were well-presented. There is a museum and although I did not go in, others in my tour group found it really interesting. Plenty of seating around the gardens. Great location for those interested in photography.

Beautiful!. It was really peaceful in the garden and the vibe was great. Everything about the garden from the floras/faunas to colors were stunning and picturesque. I highly recommend and would go back again.

Peaceful and wonderful garden. Gardens are a must to visit. 25 minutes walk from centre but with caleches and taxi around. Walking is best as you can absorb local activity and find it more appealing. Garden entrance is 50dhm and would def recommend to pay the additional 25dhm for the Berber museum. We had an amazing afternoon and some lovely and relaxing path to enjoy plants. A must . Toilets on site are very clean and free.
Beautiful. A beautiful place to visit. Avoid the coach trips by going either early or late. Sit and enjoy the peace and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

A fabulous gem of a garden and fantastic way to escape the medina. The garden is such a gem - a must if you are visiting Marrakesh. I visited on a day when it was 47 degrees and it gave some much needed shade too. The Berber museum should also not be missed - it is fantastic. Make sure you don't get conned of the price of your taxi getting to the garden - I heard such varied prices. It is a long walk and not through the most beautiful area so definitely worth getting a taxi.

Nice stroll in the shade. Stopped off here whilst using the hop on / off tour buses ( which is a great way of getting around Marrakech without being hounded). It was pleasant and relaxing to stroll around the garden though it doesn't really take long. There is a lovely court yard cafe where you can enjoy a pot of mint tea. There is a museum there but we didn't pay to go in so I cant comment on that and a very posh gift shop. As I say it isn't a large place to get around but nice enough to stop and relax a while.

Peace and quiet amongst the chaos. A wonderful sanctuary amid the chaos of Marrakech. We walked leisurely from the hotel, it took us a little over 30 mins but was very easy and no hassle along the way.I would recommend going first thing in the morning before it gets too hot and the queue to get in gets too long. There is little/no shade to queue in.The gardens really were beautiful and the colours fabulous, a lovely way to send an hour or so of your time in the peace and quiet.
An oasis. The colour of blue and yellow are striking. One never thought this oasis exist in the middle of Marrakesh. A couple of hours is more than enough. It is not a huge place.

Pay for anything. is the only location in Marrakech that requires 50DH to get access in...crazy!! it's a very little garden with few plants and dirty pools with dying fishes , nothing special...maybe the cost depends by the fact that now the garden is branded YSL :-(
Nice but crowded. We have visited this place and it was quite crowded. The entrance fee is 50dn. We found the gardens nice but nothing special...
Paradise in Marrakech. Peaceful and very beautiful garden. For me - it's a must to see it if you are in Marrakech. Small entrance fee to pay to feel you arrived to a different planet :-)

Stunning. It was a baking hot day and this was a perfect visit to get shade. Beautiful gardens, quiet considering the amount of people visiting. great photo opportunities, and very with the few quid paid.
Beautiful. We thoroughly our time here.Amazing cacti,pretty water features and the blues,yellows and terracotta colours are lovely.The little Berber Museum is a gem,very nicely curated.

Small But Interesting. A pretty garden with some vibrant colours. We visited during a heatwave of temperatures in the 40s and the mostly sheltered by trees environment was much appreciated. The entrance was the equivalent of around £3.50 and there's not really much there, only took us around 30-45 mins to look round so don't expect to be here long. We didn't go into the museum, that cost extra. To sum up, it's nice if you're in the area and have a spare hour but probably not worth a special trip.

Nice Gardens and tribute to YSL. I had heard a lot of good thinks about Jardin Majorelle so was very excited to visit. I was slightly dissapointed as I thought the gardens would be a lot bigger and abit more impressive. Although very pretty there isnt a lot to see and you pay 50 dirhum to get in and your trip doesn't really last more than about 30 minutes unless you go in to the museum or stay for overpriced food. Also very busy and full of tourists.

Nice and cool . Nice surroundings and is a nice cool park under the shade of the lofty trees. If you like landscapes you can just sit there for hours if you enjoy that sort of thing Has a nice cafe inside for breakfast if you go in the morning. Museum wasn't very interesting but that's my opinion others may find it more appealing.

Hyped up tourist trap. So dissapointed. After paying 75MAD per person we entered. There is no control as such at the entrance so all tourist can pile in at once making it overly busy and crowded. Everyone was trying to take the same uninspired pictures. There was no space to relax as people asked you to move.. again for some more unoriginal pictures. Although there was a wide variety of plants it was to clinical and manicured to death. Amazing plants were carved with graffiti. The museum; although a nice thought and some great displays; did not leave you time to explore. Again too small and crowded.Full of pretentious tourists that appeared to come more for the name associated with the gardens than anything else.If you are on a budget I would not recommend this at all. There some really nice gardens around Marrakesh.
Jardin Majorelle. A simple but attractive garden, filled with all sorts of plants, trees, ponds and a nice little museum. Worth a visit and didn't need any more than an hour and a half or so.
Oasis. Visit this unique place, an oasis of lush green, cactus, ponds and fountains. Not to mention Yves Saint Laurent touch and the museum. Beautiful place to visit.

Beauty in the desert. On a very hot day and after a bumpy night train from Tangier, we visited the Jardin Majorelle. It was an oasis of calm in the bustling city of Marrakech. The large trees overhead provided shade and comfort from the sun's burning rays. The blue is gorgeous, I can see why Yves Saint-Laurent found so much inspiration in this beautiful place. Definitely in my top 3 favorites of Marrakech!
Beautiful, well kept palm grove/succulent gardens. The light, colours and planting are stunning. Frogs delightfully noisy in the water features. Loved it, and the YSL poster spot.

Wonderful peaceful oasis after the hustle of the medina. Took a taxi here and really enjoyed our trip to see the gardens. Lots of lovely vistas although the garden is quite small, but really beautiful.
Greenest Garden in Marrakech. This is hands down the most exciting garden in Marrakech. Take book with you and spend couple of hours reading in this magical place.

Not impressive. Not worth it , not worth the time nor the money we paid , as acouple paying 400 MD it is very expensive specially for such a tiny place just full of cactus. I have seen many gardens way way beautiful than this and not even quarter expensive . Nothing special at all about the place where you can finish the visit in 15 minutes .

Nice garden. We visited the garden as part if our Marrakech trip.It is a must for us as my wife works in fashion, so the YSL part has to be part of the tour.I would definitely do it as part of a trip to town.Downside. They make a lot of money out of it. The other sights cost about 1USD entry. They charge about 6. Quite expensive for Marrakech.

Lovely. Its a lovely garden. Lots of interesting plants with descriptions. Its also very colorful. Popular tourist spot. You can do the trip quickly or lazily wander and rest. Lots of restaurants and shops right out front, so you can mix the gardens with shopping and/or eating. Horse drawn carriages can also bring you there.

Gorgeous!!! And get there early!!. Get to Jardin Majorelle early as it is popular and gets very busy inside. Inside you can find the gardens revived by Yves Saint Laurent after he purchased the site in a state of disrepair. The colours, plants and architecture are a real testament to design and you should allow a couple of hours to soak in the atmosphere. At the time of writing there was an excellent Berber display in the museum that is well worth visiting even though it's small, we found it fascinating. The total cost for museum and gardens is 75dh per person.

Magic hidden oasis.. What a beautiful and colorful oasis, tucked away in a very ordinary area of Marrakesh...but you must visit...it is a garden unlike any other I have seen.......cool and lush, full to the brim with wonderful plants, and vibrant colour! The Berber museum, there, is small but interesting. Yves St Laurent sure created an amazing hideaway!

Wonderful!. This was just a fabulous experience esp. if you adore plants and flowers. A lovely way to spend a morning and do make time to visit the Berber museum there and have some tea in the gardens.
Love these gardens. My second visit to Jardin Majorelle, I love these gardens they are so serine and well laid out. Highlty recommended to visit if you are staying a few days.
Lovely!. Really beautiful escape from the hustle of the medina. Reasonably priced and absolutley beautiful! Go early to avoid the crowds though!

A dream. Well, what to say ? It is the most beautiful garden I saw in my life. If you like plants, especially those who live in warm countries, do not miss this garden. Everything is well keeped, and the colors you can see there are amazing. Not only plants but also the garden's house, Yves Saint Laurent's drawings, the museum, the shop. Do not miss this all !!!

An Oasis in the madness that is Marrakech. These gardens are absolutely beautiful and very well maintained. This is one of the highlights of Marrakech in my opinion. There are gardeners sweeping up fallen leaves and painting pots all the time. There are also staff on hand to give information and take your photograph (for a tip of course). There are turtles basking in one of the pools. There are mature palm trees, huge cacti and blossom everywhere. The background buildings in blue and yellow are just lovely. There are benches around to rest your weary feet.There is a small Berber museum which is interesting. The entry fee is very reasonable but must be paid for at the main gate/kiosk.There is also a memorial to Yves St Laurent.It does get very busy however with tourist coaches of every nationality.There is a cafe in a courtyard, and unisex toilets.Outside you can get a taxi or caleche (horse & carriage) back into central Marrakech. You have to haggle though!

pleasant visit. Pleasant place to visit to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech for a while , beautiful gardens with a lot of bird life ... Can get very busy .... Best to go early .... Cost is 50 dirham ...

Beautiful Garden. We were pressed for time after waiting for nearly 20 minutes to purchase our tickets for entry. Once inside it was a peaceful and serene oasis in the heart of Marrakech. There are a variety of plants and flowers and plenty of places to sit to take it all in. I'd definitely recommend spending 1-2 hours to take it all in.
Awe inspiring. Lovely afternoon strolling through the peaceful yet vibrant coloured gardens! A must see when visiting Marrakesh!

Lovely. Not being really interested in Horticulture, I went along as it is on the Tourist trail. It turned out to be the highlight of my visit to Marrakesh. Truly beautiful, an oasis of understated glamour.
Beautifully sculptural. Loved the architectural beauty of the plants set against the amazing colours of the pots, ponds and buildings. Truly an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.

Lovely. Don't go to these gardens on your first day or you will have no idea what people are talking about when they talk about escaping the hustle and bustle. They are really beautiful and the charity does great work. We took a horse and carriage there which was a nice way to see Marrakech. Definitely worth a visit!
