Beautiful. Loved these gardens. A lovely relaxing treat away from the hustle & bustle of the medina. Gave me some ideas for my own garden! The Berber exhibition is well worth visiting. The jewellery display is particularly good.
Beautiful gardens. very calm and peaceful, lovely café in the middle for a fantastic lunch. Plenty of light and shade, could have stayed there for hours in the calm
Wonderful!. Jardin Majorelle is such a treat! Make sure you choose wisely when you visit it, it can be very crowded!

Great Garden / Museum. Wonderful park, totally unexpected. Set up by Majorelle, was bought up by jean-paul gaultier who restored it in its former beauty. Contains a small museum about Berbere with breathtaking jewellery ... Highly recommended.
Just Beautiful. Well worth a visit. Take time to visit away from the hassle and bustle of Marrakech. Go early as can get a bit busy, nice cafe for sharing a pot of mint tea.

Beautiful place to spend an hour or 2.. Calming, quiet gardens. Beautiful to walk around. 50MAD entrance fee and an extra 25MAD if you want to go to the museum (small but pretty interesting.)
The garden was a little smaller than i expected, and pretty busy. We had to queue to buy tickets. 2 hours got us round the museum, shops, and gardens at a very leisurely pace.
:|. Just speechless, the vibrant blue buildings, the yves Saint Laurent gallery, to the flowers and thorns, a true delight and again we found very well priced! A little escape!

lovely. This is a truly unique place. A very nice garden with lots of bamboo and exotic plants, beautifully decorated in strong colors, and with some nice buildings. It has something to do withh Yves Saint Laurent, whose memorial you can find at the garden as well as some posters he made for his friends. Entrance fee is relatively high: 50 dirham, whereas most sights are only 10 dirham.

A calm oasis in the madness of Marrakech........ The Majorelle gardens situated in the Ville Nouvelle area of Marrakech were laid out by the French painter, Jacques Majorelle in the twenties and thirties, and after his death in the early sixties were taken over by Yves Saint Laurent, before passing into trust after his death.The gardens which can be visited in around one/two hours offer a calm oasis from the bustle of the city. The gardens feature bamboo groves, cactus gardens, and numerous pools, as well as the striking cobalt blue house itself. Entrance is 50 Dirham (children under nine go free) with an additional 25 Dirham if you want to visit Saint Laurent's collection of Berber craftwork which is housed in Majorelle's former studio. Well worth a visit !
Beautiful oasis. Beautiful garden oasis ... Best visited in the morning when it's quitere and cooler! Good value courtyard cafe

A wee sanctuary to the nearby traffic. This is a very nice little garden with tons of interesting looking species of cacti (even if you know nothing about plants). There is also a wonderful mini bamboo forest. The whole garden is a lovely little oasis in the middle of the hot and bustling Marrakech. The history with the gardens is unusual with the artist Majorelle (whom the gardens is named after) creating it for his studio, then after falling into disrepair after his death, Yves St. Laurent restoring it. There is a monument in the garden to Yves St Laurent.
TRANQUILLITY AMID MANIC MARRAKECH. A great contrast to the rest of Marrakech. Maybe the best visit of all in this otherwise manic city.

Only if you are interested in Cactus and Bamboo. I though it is a big place and can spend whole days or something with different plants and flowers, but it was just a small garden with a Cactus and Bamboo. Paid about 50 Dh but not really worth you can spend in 5 min quick look. May be good time to spen in Souks and bargain.
nice place - a bit overcrowded. go at sun dowing to this place - at day time it is crowded by busses..you can have a nice little walk around this place.

Stunning. Have seen this on tv and read about it too. Did not disappoint. The plants are so incredible and the blue everywhere makes everything stand out even more. The small museum is also worth a look, very interesting items from Berber life.

Nice but expensive. We were told not to miss this garden, I must admit that I was disappointed. It was okay, but nothing more really. I took the walk around 3 times just to feel like I got enough for my money, which i still didn't really feel like I did. My favorite part was the special blue paint they have, but that's about it. Too expensive for so little.

YSL was no gardener.... An okay 30 minute something to do but not a lot more. Bamboo and more bamboo...Yves should have bough clump forming to contain this species. Nice little art works at the end made it worthwhile.

Dull and expensive. Ok, nice bamboo and Cactus garden, lovely concrete looking pots and pathways painted blue and it's immaculate - but you can walk around it in ten minutes and they charge £5 entry! PLUS however much you spend in a taxi getting there. Ummm, not worth it.
Beautiful garden. Really unusual and lovely garden, great for a walk around, and a great place to practice your photography skills

Not to be missed. An oasis of calm amongst the hustle and bustle of the city. Beautiful gardens with plenty to interest those who are not that keen on gardens! Well worth a visit for a couple of hours.
An oasis. Beautiful gardens, lovely and peaceful even with lots of people there. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy

Very nice garden. Situated on the Yves Saint Laurent avenue. Its a very nice garden with exotic plants and a YSL-mémorial. There is also very nice (quite state of the art) museum which shows the traditional way of Berber life and the tribes.

Paradise. This was the highlight of the trip for me. Not only is it a beautiful place but it has shaded paths that make it even more inviting. There is a small cafe in a garden and the best shopping nearby.

Peaceful Majorelle. Peaceful, calm, nice color ( Blue Majorelle), different plans from all over the world, memorial of Yves Saint Laurent, coffee on the spot and also very nice galleries near the Majorelle gardens.
Beautifull garden. Definately worth a visit. An oasis in Marrakech. Take a taxi, because it is quite a walk from the medina.

A most charming small riad in th heart of the Medina. I felt immediately at home after the warm welcome of the staff and the riad's owner Jacqueline. I felt completely spoilt and loved my huge room with its 4 poster brass bed and all the great attention to detail (own tea/coffee making facilities, leather slippers and the lovely bathroom products from Sens de Marrakech. I loved breakfast on the roof terrace and the visiting birds. A real paradise!
Beautiful gardens. We'll maintained and a quiet escape from the bustle of the main city. More expensive entry fee and cafe than other sights.
Beautiful!. What a beautiful place and cost was nominal. Well worth the visit although can imagine best to go early to avoid the rush.
A great garden. A must see in Marrakech. A great variety and colourful display of plants and nice cool place to wander through
Nice but one-note. We got to this late and the day and I might have been tired, but the gardens, while pretty, seemed a little one-note.

Lovely gardens and great cafe. A short taxi ride outside of the Medina, the gardens were definitely worth a visit (we spent a couple of hours there but didn't go in the museum), with some lovely water features and lots of large and unusual cacti, plants and trees from around the world. It only cost 50 Dirhams (about £3.50) each for entry to the gardens, plus another 25 Dirhams if you wanted entry to the museum. After a wander around the gardens we stopped at the cafe for a drink and were pleasantly surprised at the unique selection of teas and cold drinks on offer. We tried two of the cold milk drinks, one made with dates and orange blossom and the other with almonds, dates and avocado - they were delicious and we want to try recreating them now we're home! Although the gardens aren't extensive, it is a lovely place to spend a couple of hours away from the noisy medina, especially on a sunny day and the cafe makes it an even more worthwhile trip!
Blue and cactuses. Calm, tranquil, beautifully laid out desert garden. The site was a bit busy but it just showed how popular it was.

Kills an Hour. We saw these gardens as part of an all day/night tour of Marrakesh.Nice atmosphere among the high bamboo shoots with amble photo opportunities.I would recommend planning on staying in there for around an hour, maybe two if you have a keen interest in gardening. Can get very crowded, but the crowds seem to flow nicely at a leisurely pace.Good standard of toilet facilities also.

Visit. Beautiful gardens Peaceful and tranquil amid the city. Lovely colours of the pots and buildings contrast with the plants.An excellent café serving cool fruit juices.Museum is excellent and worth a tripQuite busy, so go early to beat the crowds.We walked from the Medina which was quite a trek but had a taxi home.

a gem. enjoy this beautiful garden early to avoid being pushed around as people arrive in coachloads,you can take your time to enjoy the incredible flora from all warm parts of the world., and you avoid having people on all your picsDon´t miss the museum with its incredible galaxy ceiling

time it right!. Beautiful garden with strong European flavour. Would have been absolutely enchanting but for the crowds. Early visit strongly advised. Snack bar across from the entrance is better than expected and a welcome haven

Interesting and spectacular. inexpensive way to spend an hour amongst tall bamboo and tree ferns plus many other unusual plants. Paths lead through the garden and there is a museum there too although we didn't go in.
Don't bother!. cost over £4 entrance fee which is a lot for this part of the world!! It was the worst garden I have ever visited. Took 10 mins to walk around a load of bamboo and a few cacti
Beautiful garden. This is the most beautiful garden I have ever seen. Shady, calm, large bamboos, water, wonderful colours.
Unmissable. Peace and tranquillity in the middle of a busy city and such beautiful colours my tip go early to avoid the crowds!
a quiet oasis. The new Berber museum is very good and the gardens are a pleasure to stroll through, takes an hour to tour

Relief from Heat. This oasis in the Nouvelle area of the city is a perfect place to unwind and escape the heat after an intense tour through Morocco. While there were few flowers in bloom the garden abounds with many varieties of cacti. The garden is super clean and there are benches to sit and relax in the coolness of the shade. Probably the best part is the Berber museum which is a not to be missed attraction that is 25 dirhams on top of the garden fee. It is not large but well explained with good English pamphlets. Jewellery and Berber costumes tools and other life necessities are on view. It is an excellent display. If you go in the morning stay and have lunch in the garden cafeteria. The menu is small but very good. Prices as expected are a bit high but they take credit cards. It's all about unwinding here after the hectic pace encountered in the medinas of Morocco

A tranquil break from the hustle and bustle. A peaceful and well presented garden in the new area of the city. Some impressive plants on show and a memorial to Yves Saint Laurent (financier of the gardens). Quite small though and difficult to spend much more I than 1-2hr there. Entry at 50 Dhr (approx £3.50) is reasonable. Option to go into the museum at 25 Dhr too - which again is very small but a nice break.Lovely cafe inside which serves many traditional flavoured teas and snacks - this is worth a visit. Overall a good place to go to escape the loud, energetic city. Nice opportunity for keen photographers.Tip - try to arrive before 10am to avoid the rushes of tourist groups to get the best photos.
Garden of YSL. Nice for a few hours break. Amazing bamboo and plant architecture. Fantastic photos!There are some nice shops (33 Majorelle) and restaurants (Kaowa) just outside.
Colourful serenity.. Take a morning to stroll around these beautiful gardens and definitely take in the Berber Museum which is small but very interesting.

One to Miss. A small plot with a roped off pathway containing bamboo plants, cactus, succulents, pots, more cactus, gravel, a few ponds and a blue painted area. Packed with tourists. Security present offering to take photographs yet some plants are covered in graffiti! I didn't get it. Entrance fee only cost 50 Dirhams (around £3.50) thankfully.
Nice place on a hot day. Quite unusual gardens with lots of cacti. Too many tourists can make it a hard going at times but worth a wander around.
Gorgeous!!. the gardens are exquisite and the Berber Museum just amazing. Even the gift shop was fabulous though expensive.
Fantastic. Everyone visiting Marrakech has to visit this villa with perfect garden.lovely plants lovely colors excellent outdoor architecture !

Beautiful experience. So much to see so many different plants.the services around are quite expensive but as was expected.apart from wandering in the gardens one can shop from the small boutiques or sit in the cafe.go early to avoid crowds of tourists
Blue. Musee Berber also very well put together and gift shop brilliant. Plants amazing and colours of natural pigment on walls and pots.
Lovely Gardens. These are also called Ive Saint Laurent Gardens. They are beautiful and have such a variety of plants which are actually seen as a work of art. Well worth visiting
Designer garden. Yves St Laurent's garden. A 20 minute walk from the medina and well worth a visit. The most amazing cactus garden. Entry fee of 50 dirhams per person good value

Lovely. We loved this garden. I'm not surprised that so many photos have been posted. Fabulous space, colour and interesting plants, well lots of cacti and flowers. We had our lunch in the café and had such a pleasant visit. We will definitely go back.

small and simple = not a destination. Not sure why this is on the "must do" list - just you're average garden reclaimed in a city that is full of other things to see...All the tourist buses stop here and let out all the people carrying cameras to take photos of things you can basically find anywhere.Couple of highlights: Gift shop had some unique (pricey) items; Berber Museum (especially the jewelry museum) - to clarify the museum is three rooms - and plenty small: if you enjoy jewelry/design then def go for this reason only.Otherwise - no need to go here...silly really.
Nice but small. Pretty nice, but took about 30 minutes at a casual stroll... we liked it, and glad we went, but not exactly life changing

For anyone interested in gardens, these are worth a visit.. Lovely gardens and the colours throughout are striking. Our tour of several gardens that day only allowed us an hour here, but we could easily have spent more than two hours. There's also a lovely courtyard cafe which we didn't get a chance to try. Such a shame.A fabulous opportunity for photos!
Peaceful, Lovely Garden. Peaseful, lovely garden, not what you would expect. Great place for pictures and resting. Not crowded when we were there so could enjoy for an hour or so.

Small and very crowded. We had heard that this was a really lovely garden and something not to be missed. It's 50 dhm per person for entry. We arrived about 9.30 in the morning to try and get ahead of tour groups but it was already too late. It's quite a small area and while it's pleasant enough it didn't feel that the layout or the planting was particularly interesting. There were a couple of shops with interesting vintage photos ( very expensive ) and YSL related items ( also very expensive ). The park in the city centre seemed much nicer.

The hidden gem of marrakesh. I absolutely love this place. Stunning, beautiful gardens. If you only do one thing, come here!! Away from the craziness of marrakech is this remarkable oasis just off a main road...but you would never know! It is slightly out of the main touristy areas so a taxi is more than likely needed. We stayed at The Pearl in Hivernage and paid about 50diram one way. We visited mid morning & although busy, we were still able to potter about at our own pace. There is a museum there which you pay extra for if you want to visit & also a cafe, but we didn't eat here.
Unusual Gardens. Gardens that do not fit the usual format. Not far to travel from centre of city and perfect to spend an hour or two.
Nice. Nice collection of plants, and very clean and well laid out. Nice contrast between the quiteness of the garden and the noise of the city.
Oasis of colour in Marrakech. Memorable atmospheric garden for its use of colour, texture & vistas. So much to see in a relatively small plot- well worth a visit.

A nice way to while away a morning. We liked the peacefulness of the gardens, and the beauty of it all. The berber museum is not to be missed - the displays are gorgeous. That said, there were a lot of people - try to get there early to beat the crowd.

Has to be the best garden in Marrakech. A must see for anyone who likes colour, gardens, design and is seeking a bit of cool green in a very busy city. Berber Museum is worth the wait and shold not be missed.
Color and plants out of this world. Plant collection out of this world and the use of indigo, orange and yellow fabulous! Great to know this was saved by Yves St Laurent, a gift to all of us.

Well laid out garden. Well laid out and easy to see what the plants were and where they came from. The colours of the pots added to the show. Possibly better to go when the locals are at work as it was a bit crowded.

Beautiful but pricey and a long queue. Beautiful with sympathetic planting and well-chosen wall colours (blue, yellow, terracota) which enhance the garden. But there can be a long queue to get in, and it is expensive, Try to avoid the French groups and get there ealier in the day. Worth a visit, but I wouldn't repeat if I went to Marrakech again.
cactus sanitarium. 300+ species of cactus, locked within the compound walls. It's well maintained and staffed, but I am really not the intended visitor for this type of attraction.

Ok Garden. Nice place to visit if you want some shade and foliage. Cactus garden is impressive. Painted blue pots look cheap, glazed would be more beautiful.Many 5 star hotels have nicer gardens. Museum is well done if you want to join the queue

A delight of colour and shades. The Majorelle Garden was one of the few attractions in Marrakech that I had not visited over the years and I wanted to rectify this omission at the end of a 14 day photo tour of southern Morocco. I visited mid-afternoon expecting the best light of the day and not knowing what to expect. In the event, I found that much of this magnificent garden is in shade and could perhaps be best visited earlier in the day when the light is higher. However, the major exception is the area comprising the exterior of the Berber museum and the adjoining ponds. The building is painted in the trademark deep Taureg blue with caramel coloured panels to the doors and window grilles - all of which is absolutely stunning in the late afternoon! There are so many delightful views (= photo opportunities) as you stroll round the gardens.Following my visit deep into Berber lands, it was wonderful to visit the garden's Berber museum with costumes and fantastic jewellery from many of the areas that I had just visited. The museum's presentation which looks like a galaxy of stars is just amazing!I was also fascinated by the number of original black and white photo prints that dated back to early 1900's and were for sale in the garden shop. There were also many items of YSL inspired quality available to purchase.Overall, I expected a brief visit to the gardens but ended being completely enchanted by all that was being shown. Thank you - a delightful experience!
Extremely interesting. It is simply a beautiful garden, very well laid out with lots of mature and quite rare trees. There is also a monument dedicated to Yves St Laurent who donated the gardens.

Beautiful. Small but well worth a visit - lovely cafe too. Plants were very unusual. I'm not a plant geek, but we all found it really interesting and a lovely, tranquil, clean place to spend a few hours.
Amazing. A haven of tranquillity in the madness of Marrakech. These gardens are stunning and well worth a visit.
Lovely and cool place to visit. Interesting gardens with flaura from five continents. Beautifully set out and a welcome respite from the heat of the town.

An oasis of cool and calm.. We took a Caleche (horse drawn carriage) from ths Jemaa square, the driver took us to Le Jardin Majorelle and waited whilst we walked around. Entrance fee to gardens was 50MAD each ( about £3.50). Theses gardens belonged to Ives Saint Laurent and are much visited. There are many interesting cactii and water features in the gardens, We arrived at about 10.30 am but when we left at 11.15 there was quite a queue to get in. We paid 400MAD for the caleche which I think was a bit too much but we did spend about 2 hours in it. A good experience all round.

Peaceful oasis in busy city. This is a shady quiet oasis in a bust city. The flora is beautiful, punctuated with pots of vibrant colors. There is a picture around every corner. And the small but excellent museum is not to be missed. There is a beautiful collection of jewelry and the mannequins with regional costumes were very interesting. There is a memorial to Yves St. Laurent in the garden. The shops with hus merchandise added an unwelcome air if commercialism to the experience.

beautiful. This immaculate garden and museum is well worth a visit. The gardens are a verdant haven in the chaos that is Marrakesh. the highlight for me though was the Berber Womens Museum in the grounds. The jewellery and artifacts are stunning and it is great to get an insight into the Berber way of life. Restaurant a bit expensive but it is a prime location. Cheaper places across the road and a great bookshop too.
Disappointing. Gardens much smaller than we had anticipated and perhaps not worth the 40 minute walk to get there from our Riad.
Beautiful!. A beautiful garden with some amazing cacti - lovely to walk around. A bit of a walk from the medina so may be worth taking a taxi.

Unfortunately crowded. These are lovely gardens although when we visited it was a little crowded so we couldn't appreciate it as well. There were some nice features, cool shade, a little shop and bookshop, a cafe too. Open despite eid
beautiful. Fantastic colours and lovely little café. Certainly worth a visit while in Marrakech. Wide variety of plants, etc; didn't find its museum of particular interest though.
beautiful. A quiet place in a busy city, The colours are brilliant and the range of plants are wonderful. Well worth a visit

Lovely garden. Lovely garden, although small but perfectly formed. The Berber museum is definitely well worth a visit. We weren't sure but found the presentation excellent. Lots of people in the garden probably worth getting here early.

Beautiful gardens. In the middle of the city is a fantastic garden. Next to very busy main roads but still very calming. Even in October the blooms on the plants were wonderful. Water runs around the gardens and is very soothing. Well worth a visit.

Wow!. An amazing garden as nice as Monet's Garden in Giverny on a smaller scale. It was very hot the day I visited so the shade was very welcome as were the water features. Beautiful! The Berber Museum (no photography allowed in the museum) was fascinating. The outdoor courtyard cafe serves delightful coffee, thé a la menthe, pastries etc etc. Idyllic. There is also a monument to Yves St Laurent and a shop as well as the Love Gallery.A true "must" for a visit to Marrakech. Marvel at the Majorelle Blue - the colour of the studio of Majorelle as well as the walls etc.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful retreat from the hot busy streets, very popular with other visitors, we were short of time so I would have liked to spend longer there to fully appreciate the gardens
Lovely Garden to visit. Worth looking at the Yve St Laurent Art work. Don't try to write on the Cacti albeit hundreds of people have managed to do so in the past

Beautiful. This is beautiful garden with lots of vistas. The planting is mainly Cacti and Succulents but is very impressive. Sadly many mindless people have carved graffiti on the bamboo and leaves of the succulents - vandalism!!Pay the extra to go into the Berber Museum it is excellent and the displays are very good. Spent a good hour and half walking, sitting and taking lots of photos.

Seemed sad and a little dirty. This would not be on my list to do again. The gardens are very small, nicely done enough, but it just seemed a little dirty and like no one was really on top of the gardens. I think some other attraction would have been more worth while for us.
A blue gem. A small cool tranquill corner in a hectic city, worth the visit and so is the little juice bar just across from the entrance

Small. I went to this garden without any expectations as I hadn't read up on it, even so I found it a little underwhelming. Don't get me wrong, its impressive to have so much plant life in such an otherwise baron land scape but It is small and only needs around an hour including stopping for an ice cream or coffee. Happy holidays

A bit of an anti-climax. Nice enough gardens, but you can walk around them in 20 minutes, so the entrance price is expensive for what it is. If staying in the Medina, it’s a fair walk or a taxi journey. We got there early so it was quite peaceful, but it gets busy very quickly. Not worth the effort in my view.
Lots of Bamboo. The small Garden is very packed with plants but not really worth more than 15 minutes of your time,the Bamboo is in your face.

Beautiful and Peaceful. A lovely peaceful and airy garden. So easy to relax and reflect on anything you wish. The layout is easy to walk round and the there is a small café where you can get a refreshing juice and a light snack. Well worth it.

Stunning colours. At the entrance you have to pay a very small entry fee . Once inside the bamboo trees welcome you . Its like a tropical jungle . The very few houses are beautifully coloured in blue and yellow .the pots are also coloured in blue and green . The colours are stunning and there is a few places where you can get lovely photos . There is also a shop inside the park where you can buy souvenirs , but be careful because its very expensive ! Before you leave you can enjoy a sandwich and a drink in the garden patio . Its very calm and in my opinion a must see garden when visiting Marrakesh.

Incredible beauty. I had looked forward to the gardens and they didn't disappoint. Now I know the color of Majorelle cobalt blue. The range of plants in the gardens and the maintenance of them is impressive.

Go early and with an open and receptive mind. This is not a grand garden, but it is a beautiful tranquil oasis of green and blue in the city, just marginally scarred by self regarding idiots who felt it necessary to carve their identity on some leaves and branches. You really do despair of humanity at times! It is comparatively small but there is the illusion of space generated by the brilliant planting plan and the ambient architecture. Plenty of places to sit and reflect on the birdsong and insect life but DO GO EARLY before the crowds who simply want to look at the YSL memorial. Enjoy.(This was with a Riviera Group tour so no fee)

Tranquil. Stunning. I was just dissappointed that we had to pay an entrance fee outside, and once you are inside you still had to pay to access certain parts of the garden,which I didnt bother doing ofcourse
Good place to visit. It was a hot day when I visited but was not hot inside this garden. The building is painted blue. Must visit place in Marrakech.

cool and calm. cool and calm as you walk into this Oasis , considering the surroundings its very pleasant indeed , well groomed and quite busy , have a look in the rather over the top gift shop , the prices are truly eye watering

Beautiful. full of history, it is a very beautiful place with nice garden.
Unfortunately it is a bit crowded.
But it is worth trying.

wow...stunning. We arrived her via the green route open top bus tour, upon entering you were greeted with the vivid blue that this garden is famous for. The gardens offered cool relaxing spaces to sit and enjoy the surroundings, sheltering you from the intense October sun. Despite quite a few visitors here, you felt as though you were wandering around on your own. Loved the Islamic exhibition that was on here too

Dreamy. Marrakech must see, beautifully kept gardens and amazing explosion of colours....very peaceful but try to avoid peak time to avoid tourist hoards! Around lunch time probably a good time to go!

Disappointing. The gardens are a fairly long and hot walk from the medina and rather disappointing - quite small, full of alien/non-indigenous species and just a walking path around the place. There is no space to just sit and enjoy being in a garden. Not worth the effort and the Dh50 ticket. The Kaowa coffee just outside was a find though.
Very pretty and worth visiting. Well laid out and in a beautiful condition with a small but interesting museum - pay the few pence extra for the entry price.
Inspirational. What a visual treat ..This garden is beautifully presented and maintained ...The contrast of colours is amazing ..colourful pots and water features an inspiration ..

beautiful place. this was a beautiful place to visit in the heat of marrakech. we loved the gardens and the museum and they also have a little caffe where you can relax with a drink and absorb the beauty of the place.

Restful, Blue, Beautiful. We loved the respite from the rush and noise of the city. The gardens are so beautifully blue and green. The little shop inside is fun to look in, but unless you are rich.... don't plan to buy anything.

A great Place to Escape for a couple of Hours. These are beautiful Gardens where you can just relax and take in the beauty of it all. We came by taxi from the medina (a very short ride) and stayed for a couple of hours. You can explore the gardens at your leisure, there are many places to sit as well. There is also a fascinating Berber museum well worth a visit. We enjoyed our visit here. After a drink in the cafe it was back to hustle and bustle of the souks!!
Good for a change. Great gardens,there is a cafe and a small shop in the grounds too,worth a visit,some very old unusual plants.

Nice but small. Nice place to escape the city heat but small so you dont get much for your 50 dirhams. It's also pretty crowded. We dragged the visit out to an hour, but that included a rest on a bench. 50 dirhams seems a bit steep

Wont take long. We went there as you do, but I did expected a bit more to see.
The garden is nice but not big and plants are mostly cactus.
it is some vibrant colour, musee Berbere was bit boaring too.
Only good thing it's not expensive, and it's not much to do in Marrakech.
Favourite place in Marrakech. The garden is a really chilled out place to visit to escape the hustle and bustle of the Medina. Highly recommend for some down time.

Beautiful Gardens!. Visited in October 2014, very beautiful garden with lots of different things to see and beautiful smelling plants. There were also employees around everywhere who spoke a range of languages on hand to give directions and answer questions. I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Worth a visit. A lovely and unusual garden with the Yves Saint Laurent touches. The gardens can be walked within about 15 minutes, but there are plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by, together with a lovely café.

Must see in Marrakech. Very beautiful garden just outside the medina. The bright colors and the different trees from different countries really are magnificent and make a great decor for beautiful pictures!
A total gem. A little oasis in a busy city. Absolutely stunning. Berber museum is very well done, loved the art deco buildings. The cafe was good for an ice cream and a drink.

Green, calm oasis in hectic Marrakesh. If you're tired of the hot and hectic Medina, head over to this pleasant garden just outside of the center. The garden is very well kept and peaceful. The Berber blue of the museum and some of the flowerpots is eye-catching. We spent an hour just wandering around and sitting on a park bench reading to enjoy the pleasant atmosphere. After your visit, head to Kaowa cafe just outside the garden for a healthy lunch (good if you're tired of tajine and couscous).
Beautiful gardens. Colour, a natural order, beautiful buildings and a nice cafe. Beautiful for photographers and/or botanists/gardeners alike
Beautiful gardens and interesting Berber Museum. A definite must visit when in Marrakesh, beautiful gardens and museum of Berber history, thoroughly enjoyed.

One of my favourite gardens. This isn't just a garden......it's stunning, cool peaceful and beautiful. The Moroccan colours are everywhere. Take your camera its a photographers dream. Lovely little cafe there too. Really enjoyed ourselves.

LarsB. Here you'll find exotic flowers a Berber Museum and the Galerie of Love dÝves Saint Laurent. Beautiful park with influence from Yves Saint Laurent. This is an Oas in the middle of the New Marrakech. The best way to get there is by Taxi. The touriste Buses (Hop-on Hop-Off) also has a stop here.

Go for the associated Berber Museum as prime motive.. The garden has a good atmosphere but as international gardens go it is not high on my list. Its chic rather than botanically interesting and that is the obvious drawcard when you look at the crowd mostly attracted by the YSL interest. The Berber museum can be described as thrilling.

!Not to be missed!. This place is really beautiful, extremely well maintained. The museum is very nicely laid out and there are additional book and gift shops. The locals are rightly proud of this large garden.

Lovely Oasis in Busy City. We loved the style of these gardens and were inspired by the blue architecture, pots and pools. The cacti were spectacular and we particularly liked the fact that the collection was all named!
Worth a visit for a different type of culture in this busy city.

Beautiful and well-manicured garen. Inspired by the bright spices of Morocco, the gardens have indigo, green, yellow, and red potted plants. Larger trees and cactuses are also quite beautiful. This is a great place to relax from the hustle of the medina. Don't miss the shop (even you don't buy anything) or the old B&W photographs of the Berbers from decades ago.

The second best French Garden. This beautiful spot would be the best French Garden in the world if it wasn't for Claude Monet's garden at Giverny. Like Giverny there are too many tourists (Buses full!) so it really pays to get there early. After the tour, the Cafe there is a wonderful stop.

Green oasis. Relaxing walk through the garden, with a lot of different plants, places to seat and enjoy. Colours of the walls and buildings are really special, and as I have found out you can even buy Majorelle blue in shops in Marrakesh.

A must-see. A jewel of a garden and a masterclass in garden design. Wonderful atmosphere and not to be missed. Even if you're not interested in plants or gardens as such, the atmosphere and the colour are spectacular.

'Oasis' Redefined!. This lovely garden is such a complete contrast from the 'medina' experience in so many ways, and yet is still so very much a 'real' Moroccan experience! I am a garden fiend, and so just rejoiced in the peaceful atmosphere of this garden. The range of plants was really interesting to me, as I come from a completely different climate, but I particularly loved the strong design elements of the garden, and how they emphasized the physical qualities of the plants themselves. I also appreciated the cafe! An hour or so in the garden, and an hour or so in the cafe made for a perfect morning on my travel agenda!

Amazing colours. We were expecting great things from the garden and I cannot deny that the gardens were impressive but it was expensive to get in, very busy and the Sheffield botanical gardens are as equally impressive.

Absolutely stunning. Beautiful gardens, full of style and colour. Just large enough to spend an hour walking around it taking piccies and working up an appetite for Café de la Poste (around 10 mins away by cab). Yves - you had great taste!
Absolutely beautiful. I loved the Vibe in this well-kept garden. The plants and the scenery was beautiful and it was a nice place to relax in the hectic town of Marrakech.

Magical calm and cool. What a fabulous place! Well worth the entry fees.
Cool shade provided by huge bamboo plants and palms, under planted with a stunning array of succulents and cactus plants and trees from all over the world.

YSL tastic. A real haven of peace in the mayhem of North African life. Beautifully restored & maintained, a real feast of colour, too, with a bewildering array of Cacti & Succulents from around the world. Museum is mainly Berber with barely a mention of it's creator (Jacques Majorelle) Good Cafe, too.

Just a garden. It's really not that amazingGarden with some exotic plants, it's not even big!The plants are so spaced out, you feel like you had to look at a plant to make your trip worth it.For 75 dirhams entry and museum visit, it's a complete waste of time.For those garden lovers out there, it's not a chelsea flower show, it's just a nice big back garden with stuff in the museum that you can buy goods from in the market.

Nice shady place but crowded. It`s a nice and well maintained small garden full of plants and cactus. Seems like every tourist goes there. It was very crowded on a Sunday e.g. The entrance fee is rather high. We think: Not a "must see" in Marrakech

A beautiful Oasis. Wonderful place to visit. Gardens are exceptionally well kept. Loved the huge cactuses. It felt a really calm and peaceful place to visit. The water features and colourful bougainvillea were stunning. Not a huge place but worth visiting. Coffee shop set in attractive surroundings but rather overpriced with surly waiters, I would give that a miss and find somewhere else to grab a drink and bite to eat.

Magical gardens!!. Buses and cars are parked wherever they can. One does'nt know what to expect till you are inside this wonderful property. Just stroll around the gardens and come upon the gift shop which has some exquisite but pricey souvenirs for sale Just loved Jardin Majorelle and recommend a visit.

A different side of marraksh. Just beautiful from the gardens to the paintings to the springs. Everything about the gardens is tranquil and beautiful. Little bit of a hike from the medina but completely worth it. We cab'd it for $50mad dropped at the door. Some of the higher end shopping is on the strip but mostly browsing stores. This is a must, enjoy a water and take your time.

Magic place. Exotic gardens where it is really pleasant just to wander, sit, and take pictures. You can stay hours there without noticing the time goes by. No need to be a specialist of plants ! There's a coffee with reasonable prices for food, and the gardens were not too crowded which was great ! The colours and the variety of plants are amazing ! Not to miss ! And I would recommend to pay the 250 extra dirham (in addition to the 50 dh to enter the gardens) to see the berber museum, I really enjoyed it, it was worth it and really interesting !

Rip Off. My husband and I decided to check out the majorelle since it was an easy walk from our hotel. Wish we hadn't. It cost 10 euros for the two of us and the garden is a total joke. It's tiny, poorly tended and rather unimpressive, especially when you consider that there is a many acres large park just down the street which is far more interesting and beautiful and is free and not jam packed with tourists. In our view it was a total waste of money!

Good place if you like plants. It is a not too big garden, I am not a plants fan so I did not enjoy it much, however it is an important place of the city. It is outside Medina I think so it is good to visit places outside Medina.
Truly outstanding. This was our favourite spot in Marr and is must see for all visitors. Can be crowded but this clears quickly so as not to spoil visit.Also Berber museum is a must see.
Fabulous oasis. Lovely peaceful garden with beautiful exotic plants, cafe itself makes it worth the visit, such a lovely setting.

Stunning Gardens . We visited the gardens on a sunny day and they are beautiful. Well maintained and very easy to walk around they're an oasis of calm in a very busy city. It's 50dh per person to attend and an extra 25 dh for the museum. We did both and found it a lovely morning and very interesting.

Don't miss it.. Exotic and not too crowded at the end of September.Should have spent more time there, just having coffee and soaking up the atmosphere, but was on an action packed day, with a taxi driver waiting for us.
A haven of peace and quiet. Beautiful natural plants and trees sympathetically combined with brightly coloured man made features
Magical garden in the city. A very quiet, beautiful garden full of exotic plants, water pools and singing birds. The variety of plants is amazing. The small Berber Museum is nice.

Not a "must do" but nice cool spot...then lunch!. This garden gets rather crowded. There is a lot of bamboo and some cactus. It is pretty, most importantly it is a COOL break when the streets and markets can be rather warm. I would only recommend this spot if you have extra time to burn. If you visit the gardens we highly recommend enjoying lunch at The Amal Moroccan Restaurant- a 15 minute walk or easy taxi ride (take taxi to the Polyclinic de sud and walk the additional 2 minutes) This lunch spot also offers two hour cooking lessons that run from 10-12 (you eat what you make). The best part of this lunch spot is that it is a training center for young Ladies. Their address is Angle rues Allal ben Ahmed et Ibn Sina, Quartier Gueliz. Phone # 05-24-44-68-96 The restaurant is VERY clean and you are helping a great cause!

Tranquil and well worth a visit. My husband is an avid gardener so when on holiday we like to visit Botanic Gardens where possible. We were nearly put off going to Majorelle by some other tourists in our Riad when they said that the gardens were full of Cacti. WRONG! They were obviously not gardeners. My husband and I loved the gardens very busy but still peaceful and quiet. Lovely planted areas with names of plants identified. We also stayed here for lunch which was delightful in a little courtyard at the end.

Well worth a visit. Small but beautiful. Very well kept. Impressive bamboo & cacti. Stunning colours. Worth paying the extra 25 DH to visit the Berber Museum in the grounds. When hot great place to escape the heat. Take a book, sit & enjoy the gardens & café.

Loved this place!. The majorelle gardens is really different. We loved this place although it was a bit hot and we forgot hats and sunglasses. Great little café too although expensive. Nice bookshop but agasin expensive.
worth a look. beautiful cactus and very peaceful surroundings in a hustle bustle city. A little out the way but worth the walk

Inspiring. Our first time in Marrakech and so many things to see and this was one at the top of the list, gardens restored by YSL. Overall well worth the 50 dirham. It does not cover a huge area and most of it is large palm trees of various types and cacti. It is beautiful kept and offers peace and tranquillity and lovely shades on a hot day. There is lots of wildlife of you look carefully. There is also a Barber museum but this costs an extra 50 dirham to get into, spend the money and do it its well worth every dirham. There is a cafe restaurant where you pay YSL prices, but again good quality, only to be expected. Overall a good half day. Taxis await you outside to wisk you to your next destination
Beautiful gardens. lovely gardens and nice architecture - amazing cobalt blue buildings etc. Nice small cafe. Easy to get to by cab and worth a visit for 1-2 hours

Beautiful place. This beautiful tranquil garden in the centre of Marakech was well worth the visit. With its vast variety of cacti plants and wildlife including terrapins and fish and running streams all so peaceful. Then there was the berbere museum with loads of artifacts about the history of these atlas living people. Then to finish of the café/restaurant had very edible food in all we enjoyed it all
Incredible. An oasis of cool charm and wonderfully landscaped garden. The colours were great and it was incredible to find plants outside that we would normally find indoors.

Very charming. We walked here from our hotel on a pretty warm day, which made the experience of the nicely arranged garden shades even more convincing. This is a fine place to spend approx. 1 hour to enjoy a truly charming garden.

Overpriced and underwhelming. Most expensive thing to do and not great. The gardens were fairly small and had been restored by Yves St Laurent, but there wasn't much to see. However, quiet and cool in the summer heat, I'd imagine.

overcrouded. Too many tourists in the place waiting to get it. Its all over rated and still lovely to visit if nothing to do in Marrakech. Pay 50 D for entrence and only for a garden, well looked after, but nothing amazing.

Good stop. The garden is just lovely and peaceful - not extraordinary but pleasant. The Berber museum however is definitely worth a visit. A small but well curated collection. The little adjacent boutique has beautiful and original gift and clothing items.

an oasis of tranquility. Great gardens and a great excuse to leave the Medina for a while. Can be busy so taking photographs/sitting down can be difficult, but we worth it to walk around the small gardens and relax
True Blue. An amazing place with an amazing story and history. Worth a visit, allow plenty of tie to real and enjoy the place.

A must see. A gorgeous place you must not miss. A retreat from the hot & dusty city.Please make sure you 'do' the Berber museum also. The cafe inside is busy and a little pricey but lovely and would recommend ice cream.

Why bother. It is 5 euro in to see a small garden. What more do I need to say. Save your time for something more interesting. If it had not the connection to Yves Saint Laurent there I can't imagine this place being open.

Peaceful Gardens. One of the highlights of our trip to Marrakech was the visit to the Jardin Majorelle.The garden is wonderful. More than 300 plant species from all around the world. The atmosphere is so peaceful... An oasis to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.
nice garden. a small but nice garden. Plants well marked. Difficult to find without a taxi driver. There is a small entry charge.

Beautiful and peaceful . Very peaceful and shaded area to escape from the hustle and bustle of the surrounding city. Those who know their horticulture will be in their element. For those don't know one plant from the next it is a place of tranquility and a slightly over priced restaurant
Beautiful but a little boring. Worth a visit if you are staying in Marrakech. the gardens are gorgeous and the museum very interesting.

tranquil. Tranquil garden, smaller than I expected, but never the less, well kept. What I hated was the sight of peoples carved names into the trunks and foliage if some of the large plants. Awful that people consider doing this.
So beautiful. This is a beautiful place - sumptuous colours everywhere and lovely plants. It is a small area of calm in a noisy and challenging city..
colourful. A visually stimulating and exotic setting, but disappointed that the Berber museum within the gardens were unusually closed on the day of our visit.

Beautiful Oasis in Marrakech. We really enjoyed a peaceful walk around this garden. The cafe looked like an excellent place for a nice lunch or drink. The cab cost 20 DIR to the medina, quite reasonable.

Really interesting place. Well worth a visit. The gardens are a real escape in Marrakech and the small museum is done in a really creative way,as you would expect from its connection with Yves St Laurent.

Beautiful but crowded. I was very excited to visit Jardin Majorelle. While it was quite beautiful, the garden was jam packed with so many visitors and screaming kids that it was hard to enjoy the true beauty and serenity of the place. The Berber museum was also very interesting yet again, very crowded. I would love to go back and enjoy it on a less busy day.
Beautiful Respite. The garden is truly an oasis from the hubbub of Marrakech. Cool, quiet, and an amazing display of plants. The museum and gift shop are also lovely. Definitely worth a visit.

ok. was ok - bit boring really. We love gardens and plants, but felt a lot was made out of this garden for what it was. it was something to do - but was full of people taking pictures and so every step was in someone's frame!

worth returning to. When i return to Marrakesh, I will make sure that I make a return visit to this garden. It would be nice to see this garden during different seasons too. The atmosphere is peaceful and calming, with vibrant colours - the people that work there seem to embody that too.I just went to the gardens, but there is a museum there too. I visited there late in the afternoon, closing time is at 1800 for tickets, but the gardens close 1830. It is 50DH entry, it's not a large complex, but a totally serene, vibrant and alive garden if you want to add this to your trip.
beautiful garden. this beautiful garden shows plants of all 5 continents! Amazing such a quit place in Marrakech. Nice place to escape from the crowded city for a while.

As touristy as it gets. Well, the garden is nice, there are beautiful plants, but I don't see, why this is a must see in Marrakech. Around the garden we made the only contact with unpleasant touters and unfriendly taxi drivers trying to rip you off on an otherwise great vacation in Morocco.

Worth the trek across town on a hot day. The highlight of our trip to Marrakech has to be our visit to the Jardin Majorelle and its Berber Museum. The garden is spectacular - a true labor of love with 300 plant species, in all their astounding wealth of brillant color and form. The Berber museum displays the Saint Laurent-Berger collection of artisanal crafts (wood, leather, textile, metal), as well as provides a good overview of the history of this remarkable ethnic group.

peaceful, colorful and refreshing athmospere. peace and fresh athmospere even in the hottest hour, maybe the best time to visit.you can just stay in an enjoy the place which is not a huge parkthe berber museum is nice to seesometime too big turist groups can be annoyingthe Yves Saint Laurent expensive boutique does not necessary match the place
Very enjoyable. Stunning garden and the YSL connection very interesting, a nice place to feast the eyes and soul and pas a day. Great spots to sit enjoy.

don't miss Jardin Majorelle. Easy to get to - stop 7 on route 2 of the Tourist bus (change from route 1 at stop 1 - first bus is at 13:00 last 15:00) taxi from main square absolutely no more than 40dh. A camera is a must. This is a complete haven from the madness of 'Kesh and well worth the 50dh entrance fee (museum is 25dh extra). Any photos you have seen just do not do this place justice - even the graffiti on the bamboo and cacti are now part of the whole experience. Unfortunately tho this is still ongoing and on the 2 trips we made there was very fresh carvings on some of the cacti - the security is not enough to stop it. Make sure you allow time to have a meal at the cafe - the food is some of the best we had in the 2 weeks we were in 'Kesh and reasonably priced as well.

Blue bliss in the red city. Jardin Majorelle is a peaceful garden full of cactus, flowers, bamboo, and spectacular blue accents throughout. A memorial stone of Yves Saint-Laurent is in the garden as well as a collection of his LOVE posters. The captivating Majorelle Blue colour is on the fountains, the walls, the buildings, and pot plants. The colours of the garden are striking and the calm oasis in the busy city is a must-see.
Nice Garden. but not very special and quite small. But the Berber-Museum was very good and gets a recommendation. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Lush Gardens. The Majorelle gardens are a recomend to see with the palms etcit is nicely laid out tooit is in walking distance from the red Hotel where we stayed

Splendid little garden. This is a very nice, though not large, garden. Who knew desert plants mixed with flowers and pottery could be so gorgeous? Take a camera and be prepared to take many photos....I have some great prints on my walls from this trip.
Peaceful escape. Small but lovely haven from the sensory overload of downtown Marrakech, Well cared for gardens and wonderful tribute to Yves St. Lauren.

Lovely tranquil place...such a contrast from the mania outside. We took a calleche ride here from the main square. We negotiated 150 dhms (about £12) for a round trip inc 45 mins at the gardens. It's 50 dhms (about £4) to enter. The only thing stopping it getting 5 stars was the surly, unfriendly ticket salesperson. You arrive from the madness going on outside and it's like a different world....really tranquil and pretty (if a little overcrowded mid-morning). Nice photo opportunities. We gave the cafe a miss as we wanted to visit somewhere else. Worth a visit.

Short and Sweet. Don't expect a big garden - in less than 1 hr you'll be done. It's worth a visit, and their bar serves a nice breakfast. I'd recommend going early in the morning to avoid the crowd as it gets busy really fast.
peaceful. Well worth a visit - go early. Leave a couple of hours for a gently stroll round the garden which you will find dry well tended.

peaceful and elegant. meticulously maintained gardens with plants from all over the world. the cacti are amazing in themselves. Tame birds contend with stalking well fed cats. elegant but very high end gift shop. the museum collection is of Moroccan historical treasures
OK. The gardens are very nice but it would have been good to get into the house once used by Yves Saint Laurent. Bit out of town as well so get a taxi or use the open topped bus.

Not that much going on.... This may sound strange as it is only a garden so really there won't be that much activity. I say this, however, due to the cost of entry. After spending 5 euros for admission to the garden I expected more. It is basically a maze of cactuses and palm trees with the odd water feature. It has the potential to be peaceful (especially compared to Marrakech's medina) but it is somewhat lessened by being filled with tourists all looking for the reason entry cost 5 euros. We didn't go into the museum, so perhaps this is the draw, but it costs extra.
Beautiful and colourful. This is worth the wait in the long queue as it is beautiful. we spent much longer there than need be. There is also a cafe to relax in should you wish. A must see.

Beautiful, artistic and calm.. The Jardin Majorelle is a beautiful place to visit. Not only is it calm and serene, the gardens are also so shaded it's refreshingly cool in the heat of Morocco. The gardens are beautiful and well kept, with brightly coloured pots and walls surrounding it. We visited in the morning so it was not at all busy, and walked around with plenty of space. Yves Saint Laurents memorial was signposted and very quiet. The walkway under the pergolas looked stunning, and led us to the museum, which was full of traditional Moroccan garb, jewelry and artwork. There were guides in several languages explaining everything. Will definitely return to this beautiful place.
Color. An amazing array of cactus. Stay for mint tea! A nice change of pace. Nice shopping in that area as well.

Pretty but busy. Nice, well kept but relatively small gardens. Worth a visit if in the area but not the greatest sight you will ever see. Beware the return journey to the main square as the taxis try to triple (at least) their prices.

A must when in Marrakech. Only a short taxi drive away from the Medina these gardens are a well worth a visit. Get there early to avoid the coach parties that seem to arrive mid morning. Include the Berber museum in the price of your ticket as this is a small but extremely interesting museum. The café within the gardens has a lovely selection of lunchtime food and drinks.
A little oasis of calm. Beautiful quiet gardens with water features and museum. The collection of artifacts in the museum are stunning. Berber clothing, and jewellery are amazing.

2nd best thing to see in Marrakesh. Peace and calm in a bustling city.Next time I would go early or late to avoid the other tourists. They were not a problem as such but I think I would have enjoyed it more with fewer people around

Well landscaped garden. Very busy with tourists, but still a calm retreat from the hustle of the streets - huge bamboos, strange cacti, a large lily pond, all very scenic and definately worth a visit!
A nice place to while away an hour. This was a lovely tranquil garden, would have liked to have gone when no one else around to get the full impact

Good , but only if you are interested in YSL and botanics.. Impressive collection of plants indeed. The cactus park is stunning! A relaxing cafe with a surprising choice of non alcoholic drinks and juices, very fresh! The shop ; the items sold is very expensive !

pretty & calm for a hot day. The museum was closed when we went, so it was really just a slow walk around a garden. It was pretty but a bit crowded and we were ready to leave after about 30 minutes and twice around the garden with a quick look around the gift shop and the love posters room. There is a patio cafe or coffee shop area, but we didn't stop. Exotic Garden in Sale/Rabat is much more impressive.

Expensive but worth it. Easy to find. We got a taxi to the gare routiere and walked 300m from there. 50 dihrims in Morocco is alot and few sights anywhere else cost as much, but it was really worth it. The gardens are tranquil and really well done.Cactus seems to be the main plant with ponds and pathways around.Only problem was the number of people walking around, sit on a bench a relax in Marrakech (RARE)
Stunning!. A very relaxing and beautiful experience, gardens once owned by Yves Saint Laurent , highly recommended! Check out the room of love !

Beautiful Garden. This garden is truly beautiful! 50 Morrocan dirham entrance fee is worth paying (approx $5?) I took so many pictures in every corner of the garden! I sat down in almost every chair i spotted open to feel and experience the Garden! The deep blue color painted everywhere makes it more attractive and YSL memorial is inside the Garden! I stayed more than 2 hours inside and almost didn't want to leave and just want to spend my whole day in the garden, but I have other itineraries to go to! When I'm back in Marrakech, I shall visit the Majorelle Garden again!!!!!

Coolest Place in Marrakech. The jardin is a really nice cool place to escape from the heat and hustle bustle of Marrakech. It's a wonderful place to take beautiful garden photos, enjoy watching the koi swim, buy books and framed art, or enjoy the Yves St. Laurent gallery and Berber museum.

Not to be Missed. This is the seond occasion to visit these beautiful botanic gardens, the colours are majestic, it just shows that nature can be truely wonderful, walking around the gardens is like walking through a movie. the scale of the planting is tremendous..If you ever come to visit vist Markaesh please visit this place you will be very very surprised, forget the quad bikes please see this beautiful place, you will feel like you are on another planet.Overall this is my dream place to live. EXCELLENT

A peaceful break from scooter-dodging. Anyone who has spent any time in the Marrakech medina knows you spend a lot of time dodging scooters (and some creepers. Sexual harassment is a big problem). When you need a break, head to the small but gorgeous Jardin Marjorelle. It's a little pricey by Morocco tourist attraction standards but it's worth it. (The gift shop is a LOT pricey by Morocco tourist attraction standards and I don't think it's worth it FYI)Make sure to get the ticket that also covers the small museum. Anyone who comes away from Morocco thinking "this is an Arab country" has failed. This is an Arab-Berber (aka Amazigh) country and you owe it to yourself to learn at least a little about this amazing culture.

Lovely garden and cafe.. The garden was beautiful to walk through and imagining YSL being there was more exciting! Lost of exotic plants, a museum of YSL's love cards and a Berber museum meant we spent at least 1.5/2 hours there and then sat down for a meal at the little cafe inside.

Very beautiful gardens. These gardens have many wonderful succulents that are found all over the world. It is very tranquil and a wonderful place to spend an hour. If you are a plant lover, you will love this place. They have a small museum that has an extra entrance fee. They have a lovely gift shop but it is quite expensive. There is also a restaurant for a coffee or tea. There are a lot of visitors so it can be quite crowded.

Tranquil. Peaceful and tranquil gardens, but recommend getting there early as it gets very busy. Mixture of tree, flowers and cactus. Reasonable entrance fee. There is a small cafe on site but there are places to eat and drink just outside. Plenty of taxis available.

Oasis in a hot dusty city. A quiet oasis surrounded by well planted and brightly coloured Moroccan colours. Its small by comparison to European designed gardens but well worth the visit as its a very relaxing place away from the bustle of Marrakech. A good collection of bamboo trees and cacti. Worth the small fee to keep it going. The monument to Yves Saint Laurent is humorous. Would love to have viewed the private villa but its not an option. Do bring your camera.
Beautiful gardens. These gardens were very beautiful. Cheap entry price. A welcome escape from the craziness of the medina.

Beautiful . The price wasn't the cheapest for what it was but the gardens were impressive. A lot of beautiful plants and a place to get some really great photos! You do have to pay extra to go inside the museum.

Peace and Tranquility. After the noise and pollution of Marrakech walking into the Marjorelle Gardens is like walking into another world. Make sure you get there early to be able to take your photo's without other visitors.
very tranquil. the garden is lovely, with all birds, trees and fish bonds. we enjoyed sitting there and enjoying the quietness. the Berber museum is very nice also

Blue, blue and Majorelle blue.... It' s a small but beautiful garden that you must visit if you stay more than 2 days at Marrakech! Far away from the crowded Medina, peaceful, colorful... And "Musee Berbere" worth to visit for a small fee (especially for Berber Jewels)..

Incantevoli, curatissimi. - Lovely, well-kept.. La quantità di rose è a dir poco da togliere il fiato. I girdini sono stupendi e andarci non costituisce una perdita di tempo, al contrario. L'amore e la passione con le quali sono tenuti traspaiono in ogni aiuola e viale. Bellissimi.-----The amount of roses is nothing but breathtaking. The gardens are stunning and going there is not a waste of time, on the contrary. The love and the passion with which they are kept are evident in every flowerbed and driveway and in thousand of details, plants and flowers. A beautiful, enchanting place.

Go into museum. The gardens are small and can be crowded and everyone wants to photograph the cacti! Pay a little extra and go into the small museum which houses a fantastic collection of tribal jewellery and costumes.
Go early to avoid the crowd. This garden is a very popular tourist attraction and rightly so. Therefore it's best to go early to avoid the crowds. We loved the amazing cacti.
Nice gardens. Nicely laid gardens, but spoilt by people scribing their name in the trees and bamboo!!! Quite busy too.
Beautiful. Lovely tranquil, cool spot to relax in. Beautiful tropical planting. Only issue was we were not able to stay longer as the tour had to move on.

Nice gardens to visit. These are nice gardens, but if you're used to see plants and cactae, it might not be such great wonder. I'm from Mexico, and I was interested in the type of Cactus I don't know, but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary, like some other attractions in Marrakech. The colors of the gardens still are beautiful.

Oasis of calm. We walked from the Mellah district of the Medina to visit the gardens and with our free tourist map they were easy to find. It may have been too far for some people but I am sure you could get a taxi there.The gardens themselves are quite small but we took our time to enjoy the peace and meandered along the paths. The gardens are very well kept with plenty of seats available to sit and enjoy. We visited in the morning and whilst there were others there it didn't feel busy.There is a nice little cafe where we stopped for some mint tea, they also served lunch which looked good. The waiters were polite and the service we received was good. The only downside was that the Berber museum was closed when we visited......................oh and the guy in the ticket booth was brusque and rude when we bought our admission ticket.............he did not represent the ambience and beauty of the gardens at all!
Beautiful. I went there with my friend and we just adored the gardens! The blue building was lovely and the plants there! I felt like in heaven.The "Love" gallery is really nice too.

Not to be missed. One of the most beautiful gardens in Marrakech. Designed by a painter Jacques Majorelle and then taken over by Yves Saint-Laurent, the famous French fashion designer. You can't visit the blue house but the gardens are special.

Peaceful. September to remember! I was staying in the medina and my host at the riad suggested I walk instead of taking a taxi to the jardin majorelle, it was a sunny warm day and I did.really nice quiet 30 mins walk on the way I passed the post office and mailed my post cards.when I arrived at the garden it was magnificent,it felt like a dream or a movie. The upkeep of this place is amazing.the plant life from all over the world especially south and central America that thrives on that garden is beautiful. The museum is worth going to see because you learn about the history and see the traditional clothing of the Berber people.visit the memorial if Ysl,it's really a nice quiet place to relax and enjoy nature!

An oasis of colour in the desert. Beautiful place, worth even the long walk to get there although we'd recommend taking a taxi. We didn't even have to haggle to get a good rate on the taxi on our way back. The gardens left an unforgettable impression, such vibrant colours and lush greenery. Plus a lovely cafe with great service.
Beautiful. I loved this attraction. It is very beautiful with really traditional Moroccan decor. It has a nice cafe too. We went about 12pm so it was quite busy.Great place for photos.
A gem of a garden. This very well kept garden with some extraordinary trees and cactusses was a very pleasant surprise - well worth visiting and the 50 MAD entry fee.
An oasis. Great place to escape from the heat and to enjoy the tranquillity and beauty of this place. Also to see the shop and cafe which look great.

A real oasis in the desert.. Absolutely gorgeous place, well worth a visit. Such a green, peaceful place away from the hustle and bustle of the busy Marrakech streets. The Berber museum in the grounds was also very enjoyable. Highly recommended.
ok. small but nice. part on a day trip to some other sights ,partner wanted to see the gardens cant think 50 words to say

A proper garden!. We were disappointed by our visit to other gardens in Marrakech, so didn't hold out much expectation for this one, especially as we had to pay 50 dirham each to get in, but it was well worth it! A lovely cool shady garden with plenty of benches to sit, water features and a cafe which served me freshly squeezed lemonade. It was quite busy but we took lots of photos and enjoyed sitting in the shade watching people go by. Quite a long queue for the toilets but the cafe had toilets which were clean.

fantastic!. a must see!! Jardin Majorelle is one of the most beautiful and relaxing place I had chance to visit. it's a botanical garden with a lot of cactus and rare plant species and a fantastic blue house!!
beautiful. Very beautiful, peaceful and relaxing gardens. In the middle of the hustle and bustle you can find peace. It is like being in a rainforest.
Peaceful retreat. A peaceful and lovely retreat from the hussle and bussle of Marrakesh! The beautiful blues and yellows of the garden really making it a tranquil place :-) Well worth a visit!

Pretty. Had heard great things about the garden but came away feeling somewhat underwhelmed. It's well-organized with a variety of plants from all over the world and a good range of cacti. Pleasant for a quick walkabout and coffee.

Lovely oasis in Marrakech. If you need a break from the craziness of Marrakech, look no further than the Jardin Majorelle. You can barely hear the traffic once you're in the garden and it all just seems super calm. Although you can look around the garden in half an hour or so, we spent a few hours there just relaxing in the peace and quiet (a rarity in Marrakech!). The food was decent enough as well.
worth the visit if you're in the Ville Nouvelle. Interesting, but if you don't have much time a more complete visit to the Marrakesh Medina is certainly to be preferred!
Nice Respite from the City. Beautiful gardens that are manageable in size. If you need a break from the city hustle, I highly recommend it.
A quiet garden in a busy city. It was worth the journey to visit this garden in the new town. We walked from the Medina, observing life along the way.

Lovely gardens. In the hustle and bustle of Marrakech, it's nice to know that there is such a beautiful and serene place as the Majorelle Gardens. As the gardens aren't large, you don't have to stay for very long, but it's a delightful place to linger. I loved the contrast between the gardens and the stunning blues and oranges of the pots and buildings.
Very nice place. That was a very nice place, beautiful and peaceful garden, great house, Great for pictures, Yves Laurent, french designer is a great name in fashion history

Amazing gardens and museum. This is a must see in Marrakech.The gardens are amazing and the museum is also very good. There is a coffee place in the gardens that is great also to have a drink or something to bite.

Glimpse into life of an artist. A peaceful escape from the haggling in the medina. The gardens have a fascinating collection of cactus and beautiful shaded overlooks. The intense blue of the house designed by Jacque Majorelle is stunning and the Berber museum featuring Yves St. Laurent personal collection of artefacts, costumes and jewelry is enlightening. A peaceful place for lunch but go early to beat the crowds.

Absolutely stunning gardens. Disregard what you read in the guidebooks. It's been restored since it's inception, but it retains a very special atmosphere. Tired of the constant hustle of the city? Head here - it's an oasis of calm. These gardens are cool in more than the hip sense. You can glimpse the hot African sky beyond, but there is a lot of shelter here. There is a museum of Berber life which you should not miss and the combination of palms, cacti and succulents are beautifully displayed and cared for. In all but the most fierce of temperatures, this is walkable from the city centre, but the open top bus will take you to within a mile or so. I enjoyed the best salad ever in the restaurant, so don't believe what some critics say about the cost and value. A fine spray of water refreshes you every few seconds. Delightful. You won't want to leave. Make sure you take a selfie.
Serene. It is tranquil and colourful and very pleasant. The cafe is rather expensive but if visiting during very hot weather you won't mind that too much.
Fantastic garden.. Nice place to relax in a busy city.Great photo opportunities.Cafe with interesting and tasty choices.qVery busy am from about 10 - 12

Delighful oasis. A beautiful garden where one can catch one’s breath in some of the lovely corners. The Saint-Laurent blue is everywhere, highlighted with bright accents of yellow and orange painted pots. Best to go around once and explore the various sections, rest to apease the senses and then go around once more.
Peace and quiet in marrakech. A beautiful and tranquil garden in Marrakech.We spent a couple of hours here as part of a tour organised by Click excursions.

Stunning gardens and archtecture. A very calm atmosphere, despite many other visitors there. take a taxi to the gardens as quite tricky to find, as no signposts to it. A very different and original form of garden. The Museum is also well worth a visit.

Beautiful - worth the visit. Spending a few hours exploring the serene garden is a great way to break from the heat and the crowds of Marrakech. It does cost to enter, but it is such a beautiful oasis you shouldn't miss it!
very beautiful. So very beautiful garden - colours and freshness - lots of varieties of plants - a place to walk around and dream

Nice and quiet. A small oasis inside of Marrakech. It was really nice to discover and was worth the visit. It allowed us to also rest since it was august and hot and it is definately a place to visit in Marrakech.

Colorful, beautiful and peaceful. I really recommend this place if you're and have time in Marrakesh. I never thought that the Majorelle Garden was going to be one of the highlights of my trip. And it was. You must go there to see what inspired Yves Saint Laurent during many years of his life. It is colorful and beautiful. A peaceful place to be in the crazy Marrakesh.

Beautiful gardens. Loved the juxtaposition of colours and the vivid blues. Very small though and easily swamped with visitors which reduces the enjoyment, so suggest early or late visits. Lovely cafe courtyard to enjoy mint tea accompanied by songbirds.

So beautiful!. It was really magical and surreal being to the Jardin Majorelle. I could almost feel Yves Saint Laurent in every corner. It was full of good energy and everywhere I looked I saw something beautiful. Lots of different species of plants, cactus and palm trees. You can see that they maintain it as Saint Laurent left it. The colours blue and yellow are very bright inside of the ochre Marrakech. There is a small museum about the Berber people, a book store and a café. Definetely my favourite attraction in Marrakech.
Beautiful place to visit!. This is a perfect place to avoid the extremely hot weather in Marrakech. It's a really nice garden and I loved the blue elements.
A very quiet and beautiful place. It's a very pleasant place to visit. The environment is amazing.Very quite and fresh.The berbere museum must be visited.The Cafe it's excellent.

calm in the noisy city. Everyone knows there's French designer Yves Saint laurent's house next door to it? When you're not staying in the Palmaraie, and enough of noises, why not come here ? There's also a little museum/ souvenir shop with air-con, and I found their cafe(outside, in the courtyard, without aircon---but you'll like the atmosphere, I'm sure) quite excellent. Not many choices for hot dishes, but enough and good local simple cuisine.
Beautiful.. What a lovely garden. Although not huge, there were many beautiful, exotic plants and it is a real haven in the heat of Marrakech.

A beautiful oasis in the city.. This was my third visit to Marrakech and the magnificent Jardin Majorelle. The plants, trees and water features are beautiful, all enhanced by the magical, deep 'Majorelle blue'; a colour with a life of its own. It just sings!I would recommend buying the museum ticket for an insight into Berber life, culture and history. The bookshop is also well worth a visit, though I feel that the books are overpriced. I made notes of some ISBN numbers and will try to buy on line.
Another oasis. A beautiful garden attributed to Yves St Laurent,wonderfully peaceful beautifully kept and wonderful colours.

Beautiful and relaxing. This beautiful gardens with flowers and trees from all over the world is a nice, peaceful and quiet retreat from otherwise loud Marrakech. Interesting and lovely to see with all the water plants and a cozy cafe inside.

Calm in the city. This garden is largely a collection of cacti , succulents and bamboo. The paths meander through the garden, past well tended red gravel garden beds and water features. There are a couple of pavilions around the ponds that reflect the flowering plants beautifully and make for good photo ops. It is accessible, has toilets and a cafeteria.
Beautiful gardens. The gardens are well set out and beautifully kept, but there were too many visitors, and that spoils the tranquility. some amazing specimens

OK if you have nothing else to do. A nice enough excuse to get away from the medina. Gardens are relatively nice, if small, and there is a museum on Berber culture. That said, I am not sure that this attraction warrants its admission price. If you have been to botanic gardens elsewhere, you are unlikely to find anything particularly new here. Although it's not going to break the bank, you can experience more interesting sites elsewhere in Morocco for much cheaper.
Marrakesh sights. Fantastic gardens previously owned by Yves St. Laurent. Small fee to enter, really stunning. Done in saphire blues and beige, all kinds of trees and plants.

Lovely gardens . Beautifully kept gardens with mature palms and cacti. Worth visiting to while away an hour or two away from the busy streets of the medina. Lots of places to take photos and the attendants are great as they offer to take photos for you. Cafe is in a shaded courtyard and is good if a little pricey.
Okay for a visit.... The gardens were good, but somewhat smaller than expected. However the cactus collection was very impressive.
Great Escape from the Old Town. perfect for a few hours away from the chaos of the main town - nice cafe for lunch or a drink too. A good starting point to then visit the new town

When a French-Algerian falls in love with Marrakech. It's easy to explain. YSaint Laurent fell in love with this place which had been neglected. He bought it and ask for the help of other artist to give it a new life. It's definetely a must-see because of the gardens, because of the pots are painted with the famous Saint-Laurent colours (blue, yellow, fashionistas and lovers of fashion will remember which nuance I am referring to), because the Berber museum, even if a small one, is well-conceived and designed. One must add that Marrakech has still a lot to learn as far as the (western) concept (I admit) of a museum is concerned...but the Museum settled in the Jardin Majorelle is a must-seen too...I would say that this is a nice place to visit when the temperature is rising....

The one must-see in Marrakech. If you don't see any other attraction in Marrakech make sure you visit these beautiful gardens. Visit early as it can get quite crowded but don't miss them.
