Awesome garden. Full of different types of cactus and other tress. very small garden but worth visiting even tho the price is 50dh but the experience is unique
beautiful. really nice gardens. It is especially nice when too warm in the Medina, sinds the palmtrees give a lot of shade.
nice place. i visited majorelle with friends it's a nice and good place, I advise you to visit I enjoyed the scenery
Peaceful. A quiet calm break from the heat and chaos of the city.Beautiful garden in a peaceful setting,beautifully maintained with some lovely plants.
Beautiful place. This is a colourful and charming place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Also contains a cute little museum on the Bebers which is worth a visit.

Different, Exotic but not quiet. Nice Place to get away from hustle and bustle of the city but unfortunately when we went in April 2014 it was very busy and we din't even get a place to sit down on a bench for the couple of hours that we were there

Heaven on earth. Beautiful garden and so peaceful, great for a break from the hustle and bustle. Inside the garden, the Berber museum is a must see, full of wonderful artefacts and history of the Berbers
Yves Saint Loraine garden. Mostly cacti and bamboo garden with strong YSL colors on ponds and Berbère museum, which is definitely worth visiting.

Not totally wowed. But vegetarian options at the cafe.. I'm not sorry I paid the 50 dirhams to get in but I don't think you are missing much if you skip it. The do have an expensive cafe there but it was a really pretty setting in which to chill out for awhile and they have some vegetarian stuff on the menu. Berber tangine was pretty good.

A Place of Tranquility in Marrakech. This magnificient garden is a gem of peace and tranquility away from the heat, noise and crowds of Marrakech. Beauty away from the Beast (in the nicest possible way)

Not sure what all the fuss is about. We wanted to get here because everyone said the gardens were so special but we were very disappointed. Nothing special in any way-a cool place on a hot day but if there are other things you might do, choose something else.

Berber Museum is worth it all, even if you don't like cactus. The BERBER MUZEUM within the garden is an extra small fee and was well worth it since we weren't going into the rural areas where we might see the Berber people who make up such an important part of Morocco. They had busts in full jewelry regalia including headpieces, HEAVY earrings that hang from headpieces, huge necklaces, "fibulas" that attach to shirts for other pieces to hang from and mannequins in several tribal costumes, including "the blue people". There are lifestyle items like kohl pots, cooking tools, etc. Great English speaking guide named Hassan was very helpful. The garden, house, and history are also interesting. You should know that the predominant plants in the garden area cacti. They have a great collection
A bit of Yves St Laurent. One of the best gardens in Marrakech, beautiful colours, very cool and calm place but usually quite busy. Great Berber museum. Cafe is very expensive.

Magical garden. The garden is absolutely wonderful. The planting is exceptional, and the atmosphere is calming and soothing - even despite the crowds. The vibrant bright blue and yellow colours of the buildings and pots serve as a stunning backdrop to the wonderful cacti and plants collected from all round the world. It is well worth a visit if you are in Marrakesh - but as everyone else has said, make sure you go early. We only queued for about ten minutes and it's a reasonable price to go in.

Worth more than one visit. We took a “taxi tour” on our first full day in Marrakech to get an idea of some of the main sites, and our driver dropped us off for about 45 minutes at the gardens. We were very impressed by the design of the gardens as we were unaware of its history—we later learned that it was laid out by the artist Jaques Majorelle in the 1930’s and bought by Yves St. Laurent and his partner Pierre Bergé in 1980, who continued to improve it until St. Laurent’s death in 2008. When our time was up we felt we hadn’t seen all we wanted to see, and did not take time to visit the museum, so we resolved to pay another visit before we left town. We did a few days later, did the longer circuit of the garden itself, and spent about an hour (time well spent!) in the beautifully conceived and executed museum of Berber culture. On our next trip to Marrakech we will definitely devote a few hours for the peace, quiet, and beauty of the garden.

Lovely cactus garden. I liked the fact that this garden is different from others - an incredible variety of cactii set in beautiful surroundings. The pools and clay pots are painted in the cobalt blue, so famous by the Marjorelle name.

Delightful oasis :). Entrance is charged at a reasonable 50dh and although modest in size the gardens a simply beautiful and superbly maintained. Calm and peaceful, you can barely hear the bustle of Marrakech from outside the walls.
A lovely place to wander through or sit in the shade and just enjoy.

Heaven must be a place like this. There are plenty of plants from all over the world you see garders work hard for this garden. We should be grateful to talented artist Yves Saint Laurent and his wise partner Pierre Berge. There is a great museum, which has a magnificent decors such as stars in the sky. You see lots of furniture and accessories that berberis use. Alsa bookstore and fashion shop must be seen

I'm surprised by the reviews on here. Perhaps it's because I was expecting to see a mansion painted vivid blue, but I was disappointed by Majorelle. I like gardens, I visit them often, but this is just a collection of bamboos and cactuses. The museum is great, though. I allowed 3 hours for this, but was out in an hour.

Colorful and vibrant!. For some reason, I thought that Marrakech was colorful and vibrant. Unfortunately, I had no idea that Marrakech is the 'red' city but these gardens were the only colorful and vibrant place in the whole city. Tip for tourists - Go there at 9am or whatever time the doors open because otherwise you will be standing in line to take pictures and that might be disappointing. Someone gave me that advise and I was very grateful for that!

Beautiful!. Beautiful gardens. I loved the bright blue and yellow colours everywhere! The Yves Saint Laurent memorial was also very beautiful. It was quite busy when I went but I can imagine it being a very peaceful place! The Berber museum was also very interesting.
Beautiful oasis. This garden is small but stunning with a lovely cafe in the middle where they make excellent smoothies!

Nice if you like another cactus!. We took a taxi and we allowed two hours until being picked up. Not very inspiring garden, you can get around in thirty minutes. We then waited for the remaining time in a cafe. There are really nice gardens in the old city to see.

Try to get there early or late to really enjoy the place. The gardens are a short drive outside of the medina walls of Marrakesh but our taxi only cost 30 dirham (about £2.10). The gardens are the 50 dirham to enter (we decided not to get a ticket to the museum of Berber life which is also on the grounds. The gardens are beautiful with tall palms and bamboo giving a welcome break from the sun. There are paved paths amongst the plants that you must stick to as there are many members of staff walking about to make sure you don't get tempted to wander in to the gardens. There are also many benches provided for you to sit and enjoy the lush surroundings. There are also water features and a lily pond pool and much of the garden is painted in a brilliant blue colour. We also really enjoyed the gallery of love - YSL would create a love card and send them to his friends on New Year Day each year and they display them in a small gallery at the back of the garden. I wished they had sold prints of them in the gift shop! I would recommend going either early or late so that you can really enjoy the peaceful surrounds and the feeling of sanctuary the garden gives away from the hectic environment of the Medina
Lovely Garden. One of the many gardens in Marrakesh. I liked it for the variety of flowers and to escape from the sun.
Beautiful Garden!. Very nice, a must see in Marrakech! Try to go early in the morning to avoid many tourists and to take beautiful pictures of the cacti, plants and the amazing colours!
Majorelle. Unreal - surreal - wonderful. A gem in a dusty place that would surprise the most cynical traveller - not that I would be too comfortable going pack to Morocco at the moment.

Green!. Well worth the visit. Arrive early if you can to avoid coaches of visitors - although the place is big enough to absorb everyone. The on-site cafe is very nice.
Taxis outside the gardens are a rip off. Go just down the road for a taxi costing less than half the rate requested.

Oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Very nice colours and plants from everywhere.
You can visit the memorial of Yves Saint Laurent and also the Berbere museum.
grate place. grate place to record Yves St Laurent visit in Marrakech long time after staying in Mykonos when he was young

botanical gardens with a twist. Beautiful gardens and architecture that has been home to Yve Saint Laurent to visit and I would suggest to use also as relax Oasis to escape the caos of Marrakech medina.

Beautiful!. A wonderful oasis discretely positioned in a busy suburban area. Beautiful tropical plants, stunning coloured paths and walkways, pools of water, a cool temperature and very peaceful.....but you must go first thing!! i.e. about 9:00am or close to as otherwise the garden is bombarded with coach loads of tourists making it much less tranquil and relaxing. The Berber Museum on site has also just opened and is really very good and does not take too long to go round, but again if you go later in the day it will be busy with tourists. There is a fee for the garden and for the museum but not at all expensive and well worth the visit.

Quaint, small garden - worth a visit. Firstly, Majorelle is a much smaller garden that people might think and can usually be done in a few hours. With free wifi in the garden and benches, it's possible however to spend a relaxing afternoon here. The plants are great and the place has a very tropical feel. Even if the weather is hot the gardens provide welcome relief. We actually went after a massive thunderstorm and the whole place looked like a rainforest! Easily accessible as well. A bit pricey but still worth it.

YSL Gardens. We took a horse & cart ride to the Gardens and after only short queue to get in we entered this great area. Nice walk around and the history / museum was very well arranged. I would advise to go early in the day to avoid the heat of the afternoon. Other than that a great time and inexpensive too.

Designer Garden!. This is a beautiful garden that the designer, YSL, owned and loved. His ashes are spread here so you can imagine the beauty if it was adored by a world renowned genius. There is a museum, although small, but nice. When I visited, it was a gorgeous sunny day in March so everything looked beautiful. I was taken here by my Moroccan friends so I didn't know anything about it. Although I was glad I went, I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to visit this place when in Marrakech. It is small but beautiful. If you absolutely love gardens, however, I guess I suggest you spend an hour here.

Beautiful and Tranquil. These gardens were much smaller than we expected, however, they provided a beautiful, calm, and tranquil oasis away from the bustleing medina. We arrived about one and half hours before closing yet there was still ample time to enjoy the tranquility of the Gardens.admitingly we visited in May and at the end of the day. I cannot imagine that our experience would have been as good if the Gardens were full to capacity. There are beautiful shaded areas where one can sit and just experience the calmness and tranquility. huge palms provide cooling shaded areas. the gardens are well kept with clear accessible walkways. the gardens house lovely pergoda's my favorite by a lilly pond. There is a museum inside, but there was an additional entrance fee which we felt wasn't worth paying given the timeing. There is also a resturant, and many places to take memorable holiday photo's.well worht a vist.

Jardins Magnifique. We went here on my birthday - given a choice of all the things we could do in Marrakech it was this I wanted to experience most for this special day. And, special it was. May 11 was a very hot day in Marrakech this year nudging 40 degrees so it was a welcome break to be able to meander through the shady gardens created/restored by Yves St Laurent. This place is such an oasis of calm as you step inside the gates you are transported into a peaceful haven created by a canopy of bamboo, cacti and succulents around the gardens. The centrepiece of this experience is most definitely the lily pond (complete with turtles!) another cooling sensory experience to the other water features dotted around and about. We only visited the gardens and popped into the art centre adjacent to the boutique on site.Just loved it here and will always make a point of visiting every time I re-visit this fantastic city.
A Marrakech must see!. we loved it here, so calm and interesting. lovely to walk around, so well kept with a delightful cafe/restuarant and shop.

Only go if out of options. The garden had a bunch of identical plants and was rather underwhelming, and the YSL shrine was just weird and small. Avoid the cafe, overpriced and the worst cappucino I have ever had. Paid 50dh for entry, would say 10dh is a more suitable price. Go if you have absolutely nothing else to do, but stay away from the cafe for all that is holy, it is a ridiculous tourist trap.

A must visit when in Marrakech. This is an absolute must on any visit to Marrakech. The gardens are well kept and offer a haven of relaxation among lush greenery. The Berber Museum within the grounds is well worth the extra cost. Nothing beats a stroll away from the hustle and bustle of the medina to prepare you for the next visit to the souks. The restaurant has tables nestled under shady trees with cool sprays in the Summer months and reasonable prices.

Very relaxing. If in Marrakech walk down to the gardens and get the first exposure to the city in a very relaxing manner. The gardens are beautiful with an amazing variety of plants. Takes about an hour with a relaxed stroll.

Lovely colours. Very busy , too small to accomodate all of the tourists. We visited very early in the day, hate to think what it would be like later in the day. Very nice plants and paint colours. Liked the Berber museum. Cafe nice. Gardens were a lot smaller than expected.
lovely, just lovely. buy the paintlook up in th trees for owlslook for frogs and tutles in the pondshave the sorbet in the cafe

Must see in Marrakesh. This beautiful gardens and small, but very interesting museum is a lovely addition to a wonderfulcity. We went via the Hop on/Hop off bus --green route (there is also a red route). The fee was75 DR pp and worth the price. The gardens were beautifully arranged and many plants wereblooming. The museum surprised me for even though it was small it had the most interestingartifacts from handsome swords to magnificent jewelry. The clothing displays were very attractive.I am not a museum fan but highly recommend this stop.

Garden. The gardens as smaller than expected compact but very beautiful lot of cacti and bamboo wheel chair friendly.Enterance fee was 50 dirhams each and extra 25 dirhams for Gallary if you wish,Look for large toads and terapins in pound.
Garden oasis. The gardens are lovely - I only wish they had tours of the house as well. It was a bit pricey since the Berber Museum is an extra fee.
Homage to YSL. Loved everything about this place - art, galleries, cafe, gardens, exhibitions, homage to Yves Saint Laurent. Don't pay more than 15 Dh in a taxi.
Lovely and peaceful Gardens. Nice and colourful gardens which was owned by Yves Saint Laurent before he died. Well worth the visit. Entry was only 50 Dirhams each which is about £3.70.

POURING OF RAIN BUT STILL BEAUTIFUL. This Yves San Laurent garden is a must if you like gardening or even if you don't. It was pouring with rain when we visited but it was still beautiful. Different gardens ie cactus, lily pond etc. Please visit if in Marrakech

Stunning Oasis. A must see with a bamboo forest and large cacti these gardens have sparkling water, bright and colourful displays with a lovely cafe and tribute to Yves Saint Laurent we would definitely visit again.
gorgeous quiet beautiful garden. Absolutely fabulous in a hot spread out city. Beautifully laid out paths shaded. A very nice way to spend an hour or two. Highly recommended.
Nice but expensive. Beautiful gardens but the entrance fee is too high as the gardens are not that big, you would see everything in 20 mins
very nice. Beatify variation of flowers, quiet emplacement . Visit in the afternoon (less people that in the morning )

A must in Marrakech. A very beautiful place in a busy city. For me it's a must in Marrakech. It offers a very large choice od plants and flowers from all over the world and feel the touch of the famous designer Saint-Lauren

Some peace amongst the chaos. A truly calming slice of heaven in such a dusty, hectic, hot city. It isn't huge but it's worth a wonder around. We took in a bottle of water and sat on the bench in amongst the bamboo for an hour just chatting and watching the world go by. The air is clean, it's cool thanks to all the shade and it's really great for photographers too! Get there early to avoid the really busy times.

MAJORELLE IS A MUST TO SEE. If you are in Marrakech, one of places you MUST VISIT is Jardin Majorelle. Difficult to explain the beauty. So charmy place full of different type of flowers. Sure you will spend there at leats two hours, because you will be so much impressed. Don´t forget to take your camera with you!!!!
Quality on a limited scale. A good selection of pleasant aspects. Cactii and bamboo and blue paint. A shrine for some, a nice garden for me.
Garden. Smaller than i expected but very well kept not really my cup of tea very popular attraction cost about 50 dirham (about four pound) can be seen on u tube.

Fairly small. Beautiful garden with different plants and flowers. Really great if you want to get away from the busy, dusty center. However entry was quite expensive and after 30 mins I'd seen everything

Sanctuary. An absolutely beauitful and tranquil garden and a must-see in Marrakech.
A nice little get away from the vibrant souk and the city. From medina it is an inexpensive/short petit taxi ride (40 dirahm).
We just strolled thru the garden, cooling off and relaxing. The plants/trees/flowers are so beautifully arranged and taken care of.

Fabulous. Wonderful calm and immaculate gardens with lovely tearoom. A must visit for a trip to Marrakesh. Once owned by Yves St Laurent, a memorial to him is situated in the midst of these tranquil gardens
beautiful. We loved these gardens (even my 2 teenage kids). Fabulous colours and design. Truly beautiful. There is also a small Berber museum. Worth a trip.

Lovely garden. Beautifully laid out gardens but slightly crowded.
Don't take a taxi back in to town from right outside -- they will rip you off! Take a right turn back to the main road and you can haggle for a taxi which will cost you the same as your trip out there!!

Relaxing colorful place to rest. After your walking for a bit you can take a break and get a petit taxi for 2 euros ( make sure the taxi you take is on the street and ask for a taximeter) to Jardin Majorelle. You arrive to en enchanting color blue cobalt reins in this small paradise, sit down on one of the benches and enjoy the peacefulness of this place.
A must see in Marrakesh. Go there early, it gets busy very fast. The house is now a Berber museum, and its really interesting and worth visiting. Small, but the displays are gorgeous.
Lovely haven. Beautiful park and nicely shaded in the heat. We spent a fair while here just sitting in the shade. The restaurant is quite expensive but there are cheaper ones outside

jardin visit. worth seeing as one of few attractions that seems to be cared for as you would expect.
a lot of people there taking many pictures but its a nice quiet spot once you get in

Expensive. Loved the colours
Was smaller than expected. Very crowded and the most expensive thing we did in Morocco. Def tourist priced.
Lovely. Well worth a visit, relaxing and peaceful. Get the ticket which includes entrance into the Museum as this is also good. gardens have a lovely little cafe too.
Worth a couple of hours out of your day. If you like gardens, architect and photography then a must see. Food and drink in the cafe here is really nice too
magical place. magical place and an oasis of peace and quiet in the middle of a busy dusty city. love the vibrant colours and association of plants

Jardin Majorelle. Like a cool long drink on a hot summer's day…. Jardin Majorelle is a lush garden where you can relax and unwind in the bustling city of Marrakech. Visit early in the morning or later in the day to avoid crowds.

Beautiful. Visited here a few years ago and whilst it is still a beutiful place, nothing much has changed aside from how busy it was and the amount that they had charged. Dont really agree with they way that they charge seperate admission into the Museum!

Peace and tranquility with a splash of color. We spent the morning walking through the garden admiring the stunning design, plants, color and thought that had gone into this little oasis...it is truly breathtaking. I wish we had more time to sit and enjoy the tranquility.

Beautifully cared for garden and Berber Museum. Enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere of the gardens and in particular the Museum. A modern and well planned exhibition of Berber artefacts. Briefly watched an artist capturing the plants in the garden. Ideal venue to do this.

Nice get away to a more manicured garden. The mix of plantings, architectural elements, and bright colors made this a fun place to explore for the afternoon. Definitely a must for those interested in a restful garden stroll and/or photography with interesting and colorful architecture.

A Heavenly Garden!. Take the time to visit this incredible, lush, peaceful garden in Marrakech. Take a 10 minute taxi drive from the Medina, then spend an hour strolling through this beautiful, quiet and serene spot in the city.
Small and lovely. Maybe not worth the price. Our cab driver told us there were more beautiful parks that did not charge an entrance fee. That being said it is a beautiful, small garden.

Smaller than expected. Lovely calm oasis in the centre of Marrakech.
I thought this would be bigger could walk around in 10 minutes if you did not take time to enjoy the various viewpoints. Good restaurant outside the gates. Cannot remember the full name but it was Gourmand something. Lovely tagines and pizzas.
Don't miss it!. A wonderfully colorful yet shady private garden in new Marrakech. Go late in the afternoon when the light is best. Can get crowded in high season, but definitely worth seeing.
Great, but busy!. Beautiful gardens, amazing variety of plants/flowers/trees etc. Was quite busy though so perhaps go early/late to beat the crowds. Would recommend.

Glorious!. A visit here is well worth it. The Gardens are beautiful. The Berber Museum is small, and a wonderful showcase of Berber Culture. We had a soulful, relaxing time here. A tribute to Yves St. Laurent!

Lovely oasis. This is a must see ...the beautiful use of colours is amazing . Not very big but worth seeing . Had mint tea at the café and it was served with great ceremony !! Didn't think it was over priced considering the setting.

Good but busy. Great for a spot of photography but very crowded. Go very early of last thing in the day to avoid crowds.
Quite expensive for what you get.
Beautiful but crowded. Wonderful garden. A small place but filled with a great variety of tropical plants. Also small Berber museum. Only minus is the crowds - long ticket line and crowded paths.

Worth a visit. We intended to take the advice of other visitors and arrive early but we decided to walk from our Riad and paused to look at interesting things en route so didn't get to the gardens till 10.25 by which time there was a queue! Once inside it didn't seem too busy and we didn't have to wait long to go into the Berber Museum which we thought was excellent and well worth the extra money. The gardens themselves are interesting, beautiful and well maintained but not extensive. Worth a visit.

Beautiful and unusual. Being keen gardeners my partner and I and our two very knowledgable friends had a wonderful morning here. The variety of plants and the unusual layout of the garden gave us all ideas to bring back home to our own gardens. We would definitely recommend it to anyone who is interested in gardening.

Beautiful Oasis. Beautiful little oasis away from the Marrakech madness. One of the stops on the Marrakech Red Tour Bus is very close to the garden or a taxi ride will cost 50th approx from medina. Garden can get busy during the day so visit in the morning or later afternoon if possible.

Fantastically beautiful gardens. Well thought out and attractively planned gardens, it was owned by YSL and is a place of fantastic colours and water features with an amazing collection of plants from around the world, plus a great little cafe for lunch!

Not what I thought!. Of course you have to visit the gardens when in Marrakech but we visited in April and it was mobbed. We shuffled along in a conveyer belt and were left feeling disappointed. I expected the experience to be more relaxing as it's a wonderful cool place to take shelter from the African heat but the mass of people all trying to get around spoilt it for me.

Very busy but very beautiful. Try and get there early, before the crowds. These are beautiful gardens and so well tended. One tip, the signs to the garden can be a bit misleading. The entrance is on a side road and not to be confused with the gates to Yves St Laurent's villa.They have a lovely cafe in one corner.
A quiet place in busy Marrakech. Not so much a stunning garden, but it is a welcome refuge from the city heat for an hour or so. Might be very full of other tourists, though.
Well Worth a Visit. Beautiful gardens and lovely to walk around and admire. The link to Yves St Laurent gives it extra appeal.

Very crowded and while nice, not stunning. There were so many people here (and we went early in the day) that it ruined the garden vibe. Other than the large bamboo stands, the actual landscaping is not remarkable. I'm sure it would be wonderful to be there with a few close friends.But when the sidewalks are crowded with a steady stream of visitors, all take photos with phones and ipads, all tranquility is lost, and there's very little else to see here.

A refuge from the bustle of marrakesh. Beautiful garden, well maintained, clean and the museum was well annotated. It was busy and we had to wait to get into the Berber museum, but well worth the wait. The cafe inside was peaceful with cool ray of water to cool us down from the mid day sun.
Tranquility. Very good value as worked out as about £5 to get in, very cool and tranquil to relax whilst walking around the gardens

Green-blue magic. I'm not very happy with garden visitng at all, but my boyfriend persuaded me, bless him. This was an unusual experience, full of colours, various plants, little stream, gold fishes, and bird singing. Take time to go there, walk around, and meditate for a while...it was rejuvenateing experience

Interesting to a point. What you think of this place might well depend on whether you like gardens and visit them regularly for ideas and peace. Majorelle is very nice, but can feel like you confined to a way of viewing the space by sticking to walkways and shuffling along. It is small and the crowds tell but is also shady and and peaceful.Don't expect a Sissinghurst or Villandry style day where you can wander your own path and inspect the garden, but do take the time to visit as it is still worth it.

Simply Stunning!!. During a half-day taxi tour we arrived at Jardin Majorelle to be met by a massive long queue, but for some reason we allowed to go in under the VIP status (no extra charge... and we are not VIPs) however, we didn't complain either and just queue jumped!! What's not to be liked?! Once inside, it was simply amazing what had been hiding behind the walls. So many beautiful cactus plants, trees, flowers, gardens literally made into pieces of art, dark azure blue skies as a backdrop and even though it was quite busy, there was still a hint of peace and quiet. Certainly worth visiting and if we happen to be in Marrakesh again, most definitely would return for another look.
Beautiful. Tranquil haven amidst the bustle of the city. The colours and lighting are unbelievable. Mint tea served in the cafe with huge oranges hanging from overhead trees and the smell of blossom.

Totally Yves Saint Laurent. at the beginning I did not understand what all this hustle was about until I saw the place, the building, the colours, the plants, the whole atmosphere, really worth while seeing in Marrakech

Beautiful but overpriced!. At 50 durhams, the price to enter the gardens was more expensive than the round-trip taxi fare to see them. It was beautiful but for something that takes 15 minutes to see, I'd say a bit overpriced.

One thing to see, made special by the surrounding. I was not particularly impressed with this Garden, seeing that you can get to Holland park for free, and it is extensively bigger (no comparison, this one is VERY tiny), with more landscaping going than in this garden, I did not feel that the 50MAD was truly justified, but as for something you can do around Marrakesh I guess it is another tick in the book, made popular by the lack of other things to see unless you travel further. If you can time go and see it, but if not, you are not losing much.

A haven of beauty. If you want an escape from the heat and hustle of Marrakech, come to the Jardin Majorelle! The Berber collection is outstanding and the garden is tranquil, yet vibrant and interesting (as is the YSL connection). A nice outdoor cafe that offers cold drinks, small plates and ice cream.

Stunning. If you travel to Marrakech, and you love gardens, you must visit this gorgeous place. It was serene, architecturally planted and inspiring. The shop was eye-wateringly expensive, the cafe also, but I just enjoyed the garden!

Oasis of Calm. Excellent gardens and tranquil settings. Worth a visit and time to relax from the searing heat. Well designed and maintained. Bamboo and many varieties of cacti's are ideal background for fantastic photos.

Must do once-If you are in Marrakech. An oasis once you get there and enjoy the rest from the bustle outside..Great gardens-small but some beautiful plants and ponds etc.Very busy at midday so would think it better to go early as a first trip of the day. Take a taxi as it is slightly too far to walk but make sure you negotiate the price and have plenty of change. They might say 80 and you only have a 100 note so you are really being overcharged. The smaller taxis which only take 3 people are cheaper than getting a big Merc if there are 3 or less of you.

Lovely. Everything you read about these gardens is true. They are beautiful and the Majorelle blue fantastic. If you can get there either early or late you might manage to see them without the hordes. We visited end of April when the flowers were out and there were a lot of tour parties. But the gardens kind of rise above it, they're so amazing.

Beautiful Oasis. Taxi from south end of the Medina took us to this gorgeous garden and we were lucky that a large coach group were leaving as we arrived. The lush planting, immaculate maintenance and use of cobalt blue and cool green are fabulous and we spent an hour or so wandering around this peaceful oasis, taking so many photos! Lots of benches and places to sit in the shade if needed and an extremely attractive outdoor cafeteria. An excellent contrast to the old city.

Stunning and Inspirational!!. Definitely worth a trip. A serene and tranquil setting outside the City - only a 10 minute taxi from the Square. Allow a couple of hours to meander through and appreciate the beauty and design of these magical gardens
Lush. In such an arid city, this garden seemed particularly verdant and lush. Doesn't take long to walk around, really busy outside when we queued for tickets.
Cool and peaceful, by pricey. Pros:-Cool and shaded-Quiet-Nice variety of cactiCons:-Dificult to find if walking from Medina (not well signed from street)-Pricey-Expensive restaurant

Gardens an Oasis; Berber Museum Worth Seeing. The Gardens themselves are an oasis of green in this pink city. However, while there see the Berber museum. It's not huge, but it will enrich your sense of the history of Marrakech as a desert city.

Unique gardens worth the trip. Jardin Majorelle is in the new part of town. It is walkable from the medina for the hardy, but most arrive by taxi. The collection of cacti is amazing; there are many unusual varieties, all of which seem to have shapes and textures that capture the eye. It does not take too long to walk around the garden paths, and there are many benches on which to relax and grab some shade. The gem of the gardens is really the small museum, which has a wonderful exhibit of Berber culture, dress, jewelry, tools, and photography. It is an extra fee, but do not miss it.

Awesome garden. Awesome Garden and Museum, althou shop is very expensive. Lots of nice plants from around the world. We did however find the restaurant expensive and you need to negotiate a good rate with taxis outside.

Nice small oasis in a dazzling city. Decided to come here after seeing so many great reviews on Tripadvisor:The garden itself is very tiny,, 10 minutes walk but incredibly beautiful.I would suggest to try and visit this garden once it is open as during the day it is often overcrowded.Also if you decide to stay around the gardens be prepared to pay a lot for whatever you want as you are at a tourist attraction.

Beautiful but crowded. This is a stunning, small garden with lovely architectural features. I don't know what time of day, month or year you would have to go to avoid the huge crowds, unfortunately. Tour buses go early, so perhaps toward closing would be better? We went late morning and it was mobbed. There was a very long line for the museum, but that was worth the wait. It is small but lovingly arranged and quite attractive. Small children will not have the patience for this garden if it's a crowded day- other wise interest would depend on the child.
Mystical place - go early. There were lots of tourists when we got there, at about 11. I think if you go earlier it'll be more peaceful. But we loved it. A very unique garden.
Must see!. A truly wonderful garden and an oasis to sit in and escape the city hustle and bustle. Extraordinary colours and exotic planting that keep the camera clicking away!

Don't go out of your way to visit.. Read a lot of reviews for the garden before visiting. Not really sure why has so many great reviews, maybe I missed something? Consists of some bamboo some palms and the odd water feature. Very well kept and maintained but really not a lot to get excited about. If you have a couple hours to kill then give it a go.

Didn't get it. I'm a keen gardener and was keen to see Yves Saint Laurent's garden. I must say it was underwhelming. Great as a place to shelter from the sun, and a nice way to kill time in a small city, but not worth the entrance fee. It's a very small garden and although very well kept, it wasn't anything special.

Wonderful gardens, but avoid the crowds. Jardin Majorelle is a delightful place: shady gardens with a collection of exotic plants and trees. You shoud avoid the crowds and get there at 8am when the garden opens. You will then be able to enjoy the serenity of the delightful setting. From 9am, the garden gets packed with busloads of tourists, and then the magic vanishes...

Worth visiting, yet for half-an-hour at most. Of course, it is a must see when in Marrakech. And I loved peaceful atmosphere and bit of shade as getaway from scorching sun and chaotic and loud medina / Jemma El Fnaa... but at the end of the day it is just small botanic garden, even though Yves Saint Laurent's footprint is giving it some kind of a glamour...

Haven in the heat. We had heard great things about the majorelle gardens and we decided to visit to get out of the midday sun. Very well tendered grade with the shade we needed to get out of the blazing heat. There was a Berber museum at its heart which you could pay to enter. Cost wise it was 50dhs for the garden and 25dhs for the museum so around £6 each for about 2 hours of the day.Well worth a visit.

Garden with a Difference. Of course, being in the middle of the desert there is no lawn. Gardens are nothing like those in the UK, so really good to see a different style of gardening. Interesting to see catci grow so large. A pity that people scratch grafitti into the plants. The plants are mostly green, in contrast to the vibrant colours used on buildings, seats, pots etc. The costume/jewellery museum in the centre is great. Well worth the tripl
Stunning garden. Liked: Garden was beautiful, loved itDisliked: Jam packed with tourists taking photos of themselves!
Beautiful!. Beautiful!! Photos don't do justice!! Maintenance of the garden was admirable. I highly recommend that you visit the museum.

Lovely gardens but very busy. The gardens were beautiful. But so many visitors that feels like you are just shuffling round in a queue. So, not as peaceful as I'd of hoped. Wonder if you went in morning or later evening whether it would be quieter? Berber museum is definitely worth the visit inside the garden, beautiful jewellery and clothes. And stop for an icecream at the cafe too.

Superbly presented garden.. Can get crowded, but somehow the garden manages to absorb the numbers and the tranquility and original design intent shines through it all. Another excellent cafe within the grounds, serves a great lunch at reasonable prices.

Blue is beautiful. Loved the peaceful setting and the vibrant use of colours - especailly the cobalt blue - to accent the display of the plants throughout the gardens. The Berber museum inside was especially thoughtful and interesting. Loved the head-dresses/jewelry and costumes.
Fantastic experience - a must. Absolutely enjoyed this oasis of beauty - the colours, the plants, the tranquil atmosphere were fantastic
Garden with the wow factor a must to visit. This is an amazing place to visit. The design, peace and tranquillity. You cannot go home without a visit-fantastic

Expensive for what it is. These gardens are nice but they only take about 10 minutes to walk around - which is not long for the time it takes to get to the gardens and for the price. The cafe is nice though and makes up for it.
Busy, but very enjoyable. Above says it all! Wonderful colours, good facilities. Only compliant was it was so busy, but no surprise its a great place to visit

Beautiful. The Yves Saint Laurent gardens are most beautiful. Especially in the morning with less visitors! Carry your camera along for oustanding pictures or movie clips. The Cafe in the garden is serving fine mint tea or tasty coffee. Its a must see once in Marrakesh!
Nice gardens. Gardens are well kept.Watch out for the men who work there when they offer to take photos of you. They want money!,
Nice but quite expensive. Everything is in the title.. It is very nice (though it could be quite packed) and very refreshing on a hot spring/summer day. However it is quite expensive..
Wow. Fabulous colours cool place.The staff will want a tip if they take your photo. If anyone does anything for you in Marrakesh they want money

Very pretty, but not very big. Enjoyed an hour wandering round the gardens. Weather was beautiful and whole gardens were colourful and well kept.
The afternoon we visited was quite busy, so it didn't seem like a calm place, but was still enjoyable. Good way to fill in an hour.
Beautiful. a lovely place for a morning walk in the sunshine. the small museum there was also interesting and worth a visit. i especially liked the stunning jewellery display.

Small and not that interesting. This place is an oasis in a hot and dirty city as others have said but it's just not that interesting. There are some pretty plants, I guess, but it's very small. If you've been to Mexico you've seen more impressive cacti and if you live in a city with a botanical garden I'm sure it is more impressive and provably free.
Busy tranquility.. We only visited these gardens, there are others but I cannot compare them. We completely enjoyed our hour here, could have happily spent more time.

Serenity in the midst of Marrakech madness. It's a lot smaller than we expected for a garden but it's beautiful. Try and pick an off peak time as it'll be packed with the arrival of a tour bus. The park benches are a bit limited but if you can find one, sit and enjoy the serenity.
Pretty Garden. Its nice to walk about and get out of the sunshine. You could probably spend about an hour here. It was a bit disappointing as it was quite small and busy.
Beautiful garden. This is a really beautiful garden with a nice back story, it is very small though and i thought it was expensive compared to the entry price of much better museums

Colorful place but try to be early!. Nice place in busy Marrakech but try to beat the crowds and then i think it will be more relaxing. We challenged each other to take pictures without other people on it and let me tell you, it truly was a challenge (we arrived between 10-11am) ;)

A calm oasis. A place that is a must to visit. The gardens are small , but are calm and cool in an otherwise hot and busy city. Tall bamboos to keep you cool overhead. Lovely water features and some great and unusual cacti. Buy the extra ticket for the Berber Museum, worth a visit.

The Most Tranquil Oasis In a Sea of Noise and Dust. Originally the home of artist Jacques Majorelle and later, the home of designer Yves Saint Laurent. Lovingly restored, it's hard to imagine that this place exists in the noisiest and dustiest part of Marrakech. Once you are within its walls, however, you are transported into a meditative Paradise.
Easter Visit. The gardens are beautifully laid out, as we would expect due to the previous owner. A very popular attraction with many visitors but it was still possible to find a quiet bench.

If you have time. The garden was a let down. It consists of trees, bushes, cactuses, etc. and not flowers. A few places have flowers. The colors of the walkway and pots and the main building were beautiful. The only aspect we thought was cool were the vintage posters by Yves Saint-Laurent. However, the posters don't make it worth walking there. We walked there which took about 40 minutes instead of using horse transport or taxi. It isn't a must see in my opinion but if you have time and are a YSL fan then I would go. Otherwise it can be skipped.

Beautiful place. Very colourful place --- lots of people visiting at the same time but did not feel too crowded --- good value for money too. Well worth a visit to gardens and the museum. Didn't try the cafe.
Oasis of calm in the new city. The bright blue buildings and carefully planted cactuses provide a pleasant break from the hustle and bustle outside the garden walls.
A cool and refreshingly different garden. A mixture of bamboos, cacti and palms, the one-time retreat of Yves Saint Laurent is a beautiful place to spend a couple of relaxing hours.
Not To miss. Peaceful Gardens, we visited the Majorel Gradens in Marrakech and it was a highlight of our trip to Morocco.

I had a lovely time!. It was beautiful in there! Lovely courtyard and got a horse and carriage ride afterwards. The memorial was lovely too. A lot smaller than expected though. I wrote a full review with pictures on my blog. http://www.fayemelissa.com/2014/04/majorelle-gardens-horse-ride-marrakesh.html

Oasis is the city. A lovely private garden in the city of Marrakech. Entrance fee of 50 MAD for adults and 25 MAD for children. An absolute oasis of plants and water. It is such a pity about the carved graffiti on the bamboo and the succulents. At one end of the garden is a museum dedicated to Berber arts, crafts and dress. It costs an additional 25 MAD to enter the museum. There is a cafe in the garden.
Bit disappointed. Having walked quite a way to see the gardens and having paid 50dhs each we were very disappointed... Queues of people, and not a lot to see..

Inspiring. The colors in the garden are exquisite and gave me ideas of decorative touches I can easily incorporate into my own garden. Beautiful plants and a wide variety of cacti, some of which I had never seen before. Definitely a must see in Marrakech and a good place to linger.

Brilliant Creation. The colour scheme, design and plants that make up these gardens are the best I have ever seen. When I first walked in and saw the bright yellow and cobalt blue pots and paintwork I thoght that it was a real contradiction to nature but it did not take me long to appreciate its brilliance.

A bit touristy but OK. Visited the gardens on the last day of a 5 day Marrakesh trip. It was a very hot day and the gardens were really nice and cool.
The place is really well kept and the plants are lovely but overall it was a bit touristy.

Best bit about Marrakech. I visited this garden and was blown away with the beautiful plants and variety of cactus on offer. The entrance to the garden is 50 (around £4) dirhams per person. This is definitely worth visiting as there is not much else worth seeing in Marrakech.

Beautiful!. We loved the gardens. This is a must see attraction. Look out for the cute turtles in the pond. The cafe is very pricey but very nice to sit and have a coffee. The museum here is excellent.

Must see in Marrakech!. The gardens are beautiful and maintained with great honor in Marrakech. Valentino had a special place in his heart for Marrakech and this is his tribute to the city and the country he loved. He is also buried there and has a house there right off the garden. There is a fancy shop on site and more fun boutiques accross the street.

Lovely visit - amazing colors, but not as breathtaking as expected. The gardens are worth a visit if you have time, but not the end of the world if you don't. They are nicely laid out with gorgeous colors and foliage. A very contemporary feel to the place. Despite being part of a foundation - prices seemed very steep for what it was.
Magical. If you like Art Deco you'll love this. Café very good for afternoon tea, snack or lunch. Berber Museum is very good if a bit small .

Love this place. Third time here, always peaceful and beatiful, Had lunch here in the courtyard restaurant this time. Worth the stop and the money.Do pay to visit the small museum as the jewellery and the costumes are lovely.
Majorelle blue. Fab and relaxing. Lovely cafe too. Nice and cool in the morning. Look out for the turtles in the pool
Peace & Tranquility. What a beautiful set of gardens, never seen anything like it. If you like Cactus plants you will be impressed with this and how they are laid out.

Very nice garden. We had a hard time finding the place. I found the price a little high in comparison to other attractions in Marocco given also that there are other nice public gardens with no entrance fees. Despite of this, I really enjoyed the place and I'm happy to have spend a bit of time there.

Feast for Your Eyes. After reading the reviews knew I wanted to make a visit whilst on holiday to Marrakech the Gardens and the Berber museum were definitely worth the money. Amidst the hustle and bustle this was an oasis of calm tranquility and beauty!
Do not miss. You need to visit the "Jardin Majorelle" You will realize the world of YSL. The colors and the environment are just like a dream. Even if it is to crowded the enjoyment is total.
little gem. very small garden but packed with plant life and colour -is woth a visit as its so opposite to the rest of Marrakesh so the contrast is amazing

A cool oasis. This is a must see if you like gardens but everyone should go if only for the cool tranquility of it in the heat and buzz that is Marrakech. Go first thing in the morning before the tour buses start unloading - an hour is probably plenty of time to meander in it. Note the beautiful blue and yellow jars dotted in the greenery. A nice tea room and toilets are there if needed.

Beautiful Oasis in the Busy City. This is an attraction not to be missed. It's simple and elegant and an absolutely wonderful way to spend an afternoon in Marrakech. Wander down the paths through lush and colourful plants and flowers. Read the 'graffiti' on the bamboo, sit in one of the many nooks and crannies and people watch, enjoy the cool shade from the sun... and just take it all in. I'm not even a HUGE fan of botanical gardens but this garden is inspiring with the ponds and various plants and trees and cacti. Well worth the price of admission.

A piece of Blue Heaven. I don't like Marrakech, it's hot, crowded and touristy.This garden is a completely different experience. The minute you enter, you see this omni-present blue color that is very soothing. It's a big change from the ochre and warm pink color that dominates the city.The blue on walls is complimented by vibrant pops of colors with bright yellow or orange vases.The place is very clean and very calm. It is very well maintained.

ok place. The gardens are nice, and the colors are beautiful. Its not very big, we spent about 30 mins here. Theres a lot of other stuff you can do in Marrakech for less money. But then I'm not a big fan of cactuses. If you have some spare cash and like gardens this can be a nice thing to to
Eclectic place!. A bit small but an absolute must-see in Marrakech. The gardens combine the best of tranquility, design and nature in one.
Don't Miss. We almost miss this experience and I am glad we left early to check it out. It is beautiful and great way to start the day. I wish I would have purchased something in the gift shop.

Awe inspiring. Went to the gardens as a time filler and ended up walking round twice. never been anywhere that is so inspiring. The work that has gone into the gardens is absolutely phenomenal. Every part of the gardens is set out to achieve maximum effect. The colours are amazing as are the plants and the excellent way that it has been planted and set out. Well worth a visit, highly recommended.
Pretty, but overpriced. The garden is, indeed, pretty, but it's small and can get very crowded. You pay 50 dirham in entrance which is a lot compared what you pay at other attractions.

MAJESTIC!!!!. Whether you are a fan or Yves Saint Laurent or have no idea who he is you will absolutely LOVE Jardin Majorelle! This breathtaking garden is a must see for anyone visiting Marrakesh. The garden is filled with beautiful and exotic plants, flowers, trees in bold colors. We spent around 1.5 hours here. Don't forget to check out Yves Saint Laurents LOVE gallery!
to crowded. The jardin is nice and interesting but there are to many people in the small garden. I found it to expensive.
beautiful. such a beautifully constructed garden, well worth a visit even to someone like me who is not a keen gardener

An oasis in the city. This isn't the finest garden I've ever been to. And the museum isn't the best museum I've ever been to. But this place is astonishingly high quality and unexpected for the city it's in. The gardens are beautifully kept and very interesting. Plants from the americas and asia, and all well tended. Don't miss the Berber museum, it is well worth the extra expenditure.
lovely. beautiful gardens, lots of colours, an amazing cafe in it. We spent 1.30 hour. There is a love gallery in there as well .. really enjoyed it.

A true oasis in the city. The Jardin Majorelle is an extraordinary creation of a man's vision within the city. The colours, the planting and the atmosphere are unique. It was closed this time round, so we did not manage to visit it, but I write the review as a memory of our last trip, which stands out in my mind as one of the special places in Marrakech.

Beautiful oasis garden in New City. When the sun is too harsh and you need a break from the hustle, Jardin Majorelle is a great escape.Basics- Located in the New Town. - Admission 50 Dhs,- Admission for museum +25Dhs. - Open from around 8am-5pm. - Recommend spending 1-1.5 hrs here.This is a garden as devised by Yves Saint Laurent. It contains plants and flowers from all over the World, with fantastic colours and beautiful foliage from all angles (see pictures). The garden is small and will take around 45 minutes to traverse. A great place for photos.The garden also houses Yves Saint Laurent's Love gallery, with pictures he created every year from the opening of the garden to his death. Some of these are beautiful (see pictures) and I wish prints had been available.The garden also has a shop. It sells boutique clothing and jewelry, which are sold at European prices (and not branded Yves Saint Laurent designs). They are obviously high quality though and so of the designs are fabulous.The museum hosts varying fashion/art exhibitions. I didn't find the Berber Women exhibition particularly inspiring and would only buy a ticket if the exhibition particularly caught my eye.

Beautiful early in the morning before the crowds.. We arrived early (8.30) before the crowds and heat of the day and loved the tranquility of the gardens. We spent a long time wandering the paths and soaking up the atmosphere; very pretty and lovely opportunities for photos. The gardens are a peaceful and refreshing alternative to the excitement and bustle of the Medina.

not exciting. Gardens that are funded by Yves Saint Laurent, are not avent garde enough. Too many people and overpriced at 50MAD + 25 MAD for the Berbere Musee, which has long queues and the size of my front room!

a garden lovers delight. This garden is a beautiful quiet oasis in the middle of busy, bustling Marrakech. There is a wonderful display of large succulents of types that I have never seen before. These are set against a background of vibrant blue pots, interspersed with yellow and the occasional orange. Like all Moorish gardens there is the sound of running water, pools and canals edged again in the same bright blue. The reflection of the plants and pots in the pools adds another dimension to this garden. It is only a small space but the way it is laid out makes it seem spacious,as you pass from one environment to the next. It is well worth a visit.

I Nice Slice of Paradise in Marrakech. The Gardens are small yet beautiful and a cool retreat from the hot temperatures of Marrakech. This is a fitting tribute to Yves Saint Laurent. The gardens are colorful and contain everything from bamboo to cacti. They are definitely worth a visit!
Expensive, Small. Not particularly impressive and massively expensive compared to other attractions in marrakech. It was very busy when we visited so felt somewhat herded.
Worth a visit. Brilliant it is worth going to taxi not expensive but a must as I think it would not be easy to find.

Very pretty but small. Definitely one of the best places to go in Marrakesh. Very different from the rest of the city - calm and tranquil with plenty of pleasing plant life. Decorated with bold colours, it is very refreshing, although it is not huge and won't take too long to see all of it.

Beautiful but busy.. I've been here twice before and during this April visit, it was much busier than I've ever seen before, probably due to being high season. Therefore, to enjoy the designed tranquillity of the place, it's probably best to visit during low season.
Beautiful - worth a visit!. you can take a taxi from the Medina for about 30 Dirham. Always negotiate and fix the price before you enter a taxi. The garden is very beautiful and worth a visit.

The quiet place in town. Such a beautifull garden. Magnificent collection of trees and catus. A must see when in town. Take a horse drawn wagon from the medina - do not forget to negotiate the price!!!

Cool, lovely bliss in the middle of a hot city. We weren't planning to visit the Jardin Majorelle, but were invited to join an intrepid traveler at our riad. So glad we did! The gardens were absolutely lovely and amazing. A bamboo and palm forrest, accented with an appreciable collection of cactus, bougainvillea, and water features. The designer obviously knew what he was doing, because the proportions and colors are not the sort of thing an amateur could figure out in a way that still works 85 years later. We bought the extra ticket for the Berber museum on the grounds. Again, I wasn't exactly looking forward to it, but was pleasantly surprised. I learned a great deal about Berber history and culture, and the displays of jewelry, tools and clothing were beautifully done. I highly recommend both attractions. We rather hated to return to the heat and bustle outside!

Colourful Oasis of calm. Not too sure what to expect as this wasn't a particularly large garden but it was really tranquil to walk around and there were plenty of spots dotted about the garden to sit in the shade and just relax and watch the day go by. There was a lot of the famous cobalt blue colouring in the low walling and some of the pillars which was stunning against the terracotta tiles and green of the garden.It wasn't particularly expensive to get in and they will accept Euros if you don't have the local currently - we paid €15 for two adults. We spent a very pleasant hour and half here - the one thing that did mar our visit was the sight of quite a few dead goldfish floating on the surface of the lily ponds ! However there were plenty of live ones to compensate. We paid to go around the Berber museum which was interesting and very importantly had English translations for each of the rooms and exhibits - not the case with other Museums we visited.The cafe proved to be really busy with a queue already formed by the time we got there so we just made our way back to our Riad by horse and cart which was quite an experience in itself weaving in and out of the busy traffic! You just need to make sure that you haggle with the driver before you set off otherwise it can be quite an expensive experience.
Very popular, but worth a visit. Well laid out and looked after. Interesting Berber Museum. Probably best on any day other than Sunday. It was very busy.
Stunning. This place was incredibly gorgeous, such a nice retreat from the craziness of Marrakech. It's small, but worth the visit!
Nice but small. Very Nice gardens to wander around for a short while, it is not really near anything else, so it is either a decent walk or a taxi ride away. Worth a visit though.

An oasis in the overwhelming marrakech. Coming in from the busy streets it is like entering another world, when you step through the gates! It is remarkably quiet, clean and of course beautiful. We enjoyed the well made exhibition in the museum and took a long walk through the garden (discovering new things with each round). The only downside is that it's really full with tourists (which is of course a very hypocritical thing to say but.. :) )Highly recommend this place for when you need a break from the busy city.

Peace in the hubbub. This garden along with its shrine to Yves St Laurent was a peaceful place and a beautiful space filled with exotic plants and colours. It got very busy around lunch time, but even then the sound of running water, the peaceful water lilts and the canopy taking most of the heart from the sun made this a very calming alternative to the madness of the city.The brightly coloured pots and pagodas really contrasted the greens of the palms and other plants. A must see in Marrakech.

Chromatic magic. Go early ( with a horse carriage of course) when only the house cats are around....Take a break at the coffee ( tea?) shop before leaving Pity about the excessive pricing of the boutique items..... A little cheaper you would want to buy them all ....that YSL color style trip (you miss badly in today s 'Saint Laurent' ) mixed with local craftmanship .....wow . Can 't stop going back everytime we go to Marrakesh . Kids love it .
Beautiful. Very nice place to visit, very relaxed environment, can get busy but worth the wait, didn't buy souvenirs as they were a bit pricy, the gardens are very nice

Lovely garden. Well worth a visit, it is beautiful inside. Quite small, but a nice escape from the busy streets of Marrakesh. The price was fair, and the new small museum of Berber culture within the garden was interesting and well presented. The only drawback was the queue. We waited nearly an hour to get in! You need to get there by10 to avoid this madness.

An oasis of peace and beauty. Dont miss this jewel in Marrakesh. The flowers are beautiful and the museum of bereber tribes the best in Morocco. It also gives you an idea of how the well to do French protectorate lived at the time. A lesson in contrasts.
Nr 1 must see in Marrakech. Thsi is an absolutely must see. We felt it was the most wonderful place we visited in Marrakech. Go for a drink in the cafe.

Beautiful gardens, difficult to avoid the groups of tourists.. This house and gardens belonged to a painter and then Yves Saint Laurent bought it and he spend the last years of his life improving the place with his good taste.His ashes are buried there.Every corner is worth a photo, difficult when tens of tourists are all around; try it first thing in the morning or late in the afternoon, before they close.
An oasis of calm. This garden is absolutely beautiful - the tranquility pours over you after having spent a few hours in Marrakech... it is definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful Colours. Lovely gardens with beautiful colours and array of foliage. Look out for the terrapins in the pond and take tea in the pretty cafe.

Colourful gardens. Peaceful and colourful with a brilliant courtyard restaurant for lunch. Excellent value at 50 Dirhams and for an extra 25 dirhams the Berber Museum is well worth a visit while you are there.

An oasis of calm. This was the highlight of my visit to Marrakech. It is unique and beautiful and, even with the crowds, very peaceful. A tropical paradise filled with exquisite exotic plants and birdsong. The famous majorelle blue is used to wonderful effect. I wish I had lived there!

Slight disappointment. If you'v got some time to kill, and you fancy a wander around in some greenery, then go for it. But if you're pushed for time and have other things you'd like to do, give this one a miss. Nothing wrong with it, but it's not very big, and you just follow a path around a garden of plants which in a lot of cases have sadly been graffiti'd and defaced. I'm guessing a large garden is a bit more impressive if you live in a desert country. If you come from a green country in the first place, this won't be very impressive!
Cool and colourful. Loved the colours of the pots, fountains and pools, the trickle of the water, and shade of the bamboo. Nice cafe too, shop v expensive and beautiful stuff.
Small but Amazing. Take your time to stroll around. Worth a visit while in Marrakech. Very nice cafe and restaurant inside

Impressive cacti collection and good design but rather underwhelmed. As a keen gardener I was looking forward to Jardin Majorelle and after a 24 hour flight from Sydney was looking forward to an oasis of calm and greenery. The cacti are impressive in their variety and planting design. I liked the fountain and some of the pathways painted in vivid blue.I did not find the garden relaxing as it had few "quiet corners", tourists were fed through the various pathways, the cafe was nice although very busy- possibly my expectations were too high but overall while a pleasant this visit it left me definitely underwhelmed.
Great garden. What an extensive collection of beautiful and unusual plants for a dry environment! The paths led past water features and everywhere was the vibrant colour of "Majorelle Blue".
Beautiful. A wonderful place but not to relax thanks to the busloads and busloads of tourists that swarm around it. Perhaps better in the late afternoon but by all means worth it.
Nice. Really nice background and atmosphere, took some nice photos, not really much to see other than the greenery but i saw after on a map there was bigger places to see

Nice but a shame about the price . A nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Calm atmosphere, beautifully decorated and preserved, the garden is however quite small and the price is consequently too high given the fact that it can be viewed in 15 mns !

Beautiful and well worth a visit. Stunning garden. Cool and shady in the heat. The colours of the pots and buildings are vibrant and make for wonderful photos. Get a ticket for the museum as well as the garden as the room the jewellery is housed is well worth a visit.
Jardin Majorelle. Nice garden but not very large and full of tourists. This is not a place to sit and chill out. Best garden for peace and tranquility is the Cyber Park - free and very well tended.

Small but perfectly formed. Definitely a peaceful, beautifully shady haven away from the chaotic city. Beautifully laid out and not overly busy. The small museum was an added bonus too. Lunch was delicious if you manage to get a table outside. Gift shop overly expensive but quality merchandise. If you visit Marrakech this Jardin is not to be missed!
Fabulous gardens. We loved these gardens. They gave us so many ideas for our own garden and the bright blue pots were amazing.

Garden so-so, Berber museum fantastic. The garden is actually quite small and average, although it is a small bastion of quiet when you've been walking around the Ville Nouvelle for a while. However, the Musée Berbère, which is in one corner of the garden, and though seemingly tiny from the outside, has an absolutely fantastic collection of ancient and beautiful Berber objects, costumes, and jewelry, and they are gorgeously displayed. The little museum left my wife and I with quite a memorable impression.
Pretty gardens and house. A nice short tour of the beautiful house and gardens where Yves Saint Laurent once lived. Has a cute tea rooms and shop too.

Small but nice. We booked this as a trip through Thomson's which included a calleche ride and another garden but we didn't know the museum inside was extra to our trip so unfortunately we didn't see the museum but the gardens are lovely. It was quite busy when we went but we were still amazed by the planting and colours. Worth a look.

Nicely presented garden. The garden is fairly small but contains numerous desert flora, many from Mexico. It also contains a Berber museum (admission extra) containing artifacts from the personal collection of Yves Saint Laurent. One should go early in the morning; it is a very popular tourist destination and by mid-morning is somewhat overrun with tourists. Also, walk to the end of the street to get a Petit Taxi, it will be much cheaper than using one in the taxi rank by the garden exit.
great garden to visit. Brilliant garden so refreshing and lush with plenty of shade to escape the choas and heat of marrakesh ... very nice cafe to sit and relax within the grounds

OH SO BLUE. This garden was a delight and sooooo peaceful just a shame there were hundreds of others there. It was lovely to walk around but you were never far from other people. Lots of lovely plants and all arranged and shown to their best advantage. The blue is tranquil, I think they should have a no talking policy and then you could enjoy the quiet. There was a cafe/restaurant but not cheap.

Inspiring gardens. We took a horse drawn carriage from our Riyadh to this lovely garden which is a great stress free way to travel in the heat of the morning. The Majorelle gardens as others have said is not massive, but the colours, design and beauty of the place is breathtaking and a wonderful contrast to the frenetic pace,noise and smells of the souks a few hundred meters south. You can wander around and all that there is in less than half and hour, but stay and sit in the shade and take it all in, enjoy a drink in the garden cafe, and then spend some time in the Berber museum next door. It's a fantastic way to spend a morning in the city, and then on to lunch at the cool Cafe Arabe!

Most amazing garden right in th city. We visited this on a beautiful spring day. Got a taxi from our hotel as it's a little way from the Medina. Well worth a trip, amazing plants and all in tip top condition. A little busy as it's not a huge area. Had a coffee in little cafe. Could recommend it even if you're not into gardens as it's so beautiful and unusual.
very beautiful, but smaller than expected. what I liked - the colour and the plants were stunning -the use of water - plenty of seatswhat I disliked - the crowds in the fairly small area - go early!!

Symphony in blue. Although the garden was quite crowded the colours and planting were impressive - shame abt the municipal path style pathways. We enjoyed the Berber exhibition as well and YSL's Xmas card prototypes. All in all another fascinating aspect of Marrakech culture.

Interesting but small. Very unusual, but also very compact - can be seen in 15 minutes ! we visited as part of a "Gardens of Marrakesh" excursion, the one hour allowed was too long & the subsequent visit to Menara "gardens" was a waste of time. Therefore Majorelle best visited by taxi.
Beautiful Place. The colours, the cactus, the history, fashion and the architecture make this a 'must visit' place for families and friends.
Blue. Smaller then I thought, but well worth a visit.... lots of tourists around, all taking photos. Staff here very helpful and offered to take photos of us, which was nice.

Must see!. The garden & museum is just stunning. I didn't read much about this place before our visit but I'm glad we went. It is a welcome break from the hustle and bustle; you can't quite believe you're still in Marrakesh!

Beautiful and unique garden. Created by Jacques Majorelle with palms, bamboo gardens and beautiful pools. His unique blue color has been called "Majorelle Blue." There is also a modest memorial to Yves Saint Laurent who owned the house and gardens before his death.

Stylish gardens and interesting museum. Upon entry I had not read about the museum and so bought entry tickets for the gardens as well as the Berber museum. We thought both were excellent value for money. The gardens are super stylish and beautiful to slowly wander around. I especially loved varieties of bamboo, cacti and flowers contrasting with bright blue pots, pergolas and lovely window and ornate doorways. It was not as big as I had imagined but I would definitely recommend them. There is also a display of YSL love posters and a lovely gift shop as well as a nice looking coffee shop. The Berber museum had a variety of displays of Berber dress, lifestyle, jewellery, weaponry and all in English and French guides. It took us a few hours to do both and was not too busy so we didn't have to queue at all.Our Thomson holiday rep said this was one of the best gardens to go to in Marrakech.

Nice collection of flora. Entering the garden puts you in a completely different place - from the deserty city into a small oasis of blossoming flowers and interesting cacti.An overall nice place to visit for a change in scenery and a relaxing place to be if you're in the vicinity.

Beautiful Gardens, good photo opprotunities. A definite must see when visiting Marrakesch. The gardens are beautiful and tranquil and take the edge off the hustle and bustle off the Medina. Make sure you visit the restaurant too, the menu has lots of traditional and healthy dishes and the food was delicious.

Lovely peaceful gardens with great specimens. ..with Yves St Laurent connection.. A lovely peaceful place kept immaculately. Info on plants a bit limited but hey some very interesting things including amazing cacti. Beautifully set out and not difficult to find.

Vibrant garden. This garden isn’t near the main square so not one of the most well known attractions but it is worth a visit, especially for us because it wasn’t very far from our hotel. It is not a very big garden in terms of land space, and different to the English image of a garden being lots of lawn. They have made very good use of the space and a lot of plants can be seen there, especially different types of cacti. There are also tall trees such as bamboo. Within the garden walls there is a Berber museum and a café. The museum was interesting, with a history of the people of Morocco; Berbers.
Crowded small garden. Nice garden, small and with a lot of tourists. Other parks in Marrakesh are even better and free entrance.
Stunningly beautiful. Amazing gardens with a truly exceptional selection of plants, a profusion of colours, most interesting Berber museum. Excellent restaurant

Beautiful plce , dont miss it.. Very memorable place despite the long walk. Beautiful gardens and vibrant colours. My husband saw lots of birds there too. Restaurant looked nice. Cost more than our guidebook said but even at 50 dirams each (excluding museum which is another 20 ) we were glad to have visited.

Oasis of peace. Sadly the place was very busy and there was a big queue of people but in spite of the crowd the place was incredibly peaceful and quiet inside. It is quite a beautiful garden and deserves to be popular among tourists, maybe best to go earlier in the day to have the place almost to yourself

beautiful garden designed by Yves St Laurent. Exotic plants, cacti like trees, bamboo forest, bougainvilleas galore, pleasant and peaceful place. Best to but the museum entry ticket for 55 DHM so you get into the garden for free (normally 50 DHM).

Tranquil oasis in Marrakesh. Best if you don't rush yourself.. The garden is a nice place to relax if you can avoid the worst tour bus crowds. Since the place is small it quickly becomes somewhat overrun when 2-3 tour buses arrive at the same time. Best advice I can give is to take your time to sit down, e.g. by the memorial, and just relax and take it all in.The plants are collected from all over the world, so if you are looking to explore the local fauna and flora you are better off heading outside Marrakesh.You have option of buying admission to the museum too. I would recommend doing so. Has a nice collection of Berber artifacts.
Beautiful gardens, an oasis even though busy. Even though it was pretty busy here even in March, it was impossible not to feel calm wandering around these beautifully designed gardens

Ok, but that's all. We were told this place was unmissable. But it was ok and nothing else. It wasn't a particularly relaxing place as it's quite small and there was a fair number of tourists about so not a lot of lazing about in the sun on a grassy mound by a lake was possible - which is in fact impossible as the walkways are understandly fenced meaning there is no free walking to be done (indeed, there is no lake)We grabbed a taxi there and our driver said he would wait the ten minutes it would take us to walk round, we said no thanks as we thought he was joking..... he wasn't. I wouldn't say don't go but don't expect open spaces and solitude, it's very enclosed and busy and for a couple of our age, it was a bit ...... well..... boring; there I said it.
Better. This place was pretty good, Me and my Mrs had a great time taking some beautiful pictures. I think it cost 100 dirhams for both which is around 8GBP

Not worth the entrance fee. Not at all what we were expecting. Not something we would recommend to other visitors. It is a largely Western-style garden with not a lot to see, and has the added downside of tourist shops!
oasis in the heat. Beautiful gardens. Gorgeous colours. Really interesting considering the Yves Saint Laurent biopics out
Blue heaven. a surprising garden and wonderful ethnic museum that is a must to anyone who visits this city. Be certain to purchase the book Berber Museum in the bookstore

Quiet Surrounded By Craziness. Be sure to get to this place when it first opens. You will find quiet respite from the noise and action of the city. The garden is well-laid out and there is dappled shade to wander through. The cacti collect is very good and offers close-ups that are great when they bloom. The Berber museum is outstanding and probably the highlight of the visit. The bamboos are good but too many yahoos have carved their names on the stems.

Peace and tranquility. A wonderful break from the noise and chaos of the Marrakech streets.We arrived about 1430 and it was relatively quite and there was no queue to get in.We decided to take lunch in the cafe first and that was very pleasant.The gardens are a calming environment, extremely peaceful nd pleasant to visit.We paid a little extra and visited the Berbers museum withoin the grounds of the gardens. This was truly facinating, with a fantastic picture slideshow and many interesting artefacts. A visit to the museum convinced me that next time I visit Marocco I will definetly spend some nights in the Atlas Mountains.

Lovely sanctaury. The Jardin Majorelle is a small but beautifully kept garden. Well worth a visit. The Yves Saint Laurent influence is very interesting and obvious in the design.You can easily walk around in half an hour.Amazing to see a place like this and to feel its peace and tranquillity.Try to visit when there are not too many visitors and no tour buses.
What a delight. Brilliant - calming and sorry but an oasis in a dusky city. You could spend a lovely morning here as there is a cafe inside.

Visited March 2014. Got there early so no queue to get in although by the time we finished the queues were bigger but I didnt think it still took long to get in. Not a large garden so didnt take too long to go around say an hour or so. The small museum was well worth the visit

Stunning photo opportunities in restful location. A few hours to kill led to our visit to the Jardin Majorelle. We chose to walk to the location and our guide book/map did not assist us too much in finding it and we eventually arrived hot and ready to rest. We were not disappointed once inside.If you expect to keep walking and be entertained then don't go here! If you want to sit and admire the numerous views and relax in the tranquil location then this is a great place to do it. It is not a huge place, but we found that 2 hours drifted away and we were left uplifted by the experience.Stunning photo opportunities in every direction you look.Entry price was a bit steep, but worth it.

Turtles!. Yes, it's just a garden. And I went in low season when it was quieter, which is possibly why I don't share the disappointment of a few others. But in a city as hectic and tiring as Marrakech this is a great place to come and unwind.The selection of cacti is certainly extensive, if you love green spiky plants then you won't be let down. As someone who enjoys photography I enjoyed the opportunities that the various plants and the colours afforded me.The museum was interesting as well.
