Beauty and colours. Excepcional beauty in those gardens given to Marrakech by late french designer Yves Saint Laurent. Most elegant museum of Islamic Art.

A peaceful respite. The gardens are beautiful. They are very well maintained and a peaceful respite from the noise of the city. They have a lovely cafe where you can sit and enjoy tea or a cold drink and snacks. Also a lovely gift shop, but at Yves St Laurant prices. Definitely worth going to.

A bit overpriced for the garden but nice way to spend a couple of hours.... Its a nicely maintained garden but it should be less to enter. The grounds are cool, and the restaurant/coffee area is very nice but nothing more.
wonderful visit. Beautiful gardens, incredible plants, trees, cacti and colours, just a lovely experience for a few hours.

Loved the peace of the gardens. This is quite a small gardens but has a comprehensive range of cacti and other plants clearly identified. The Berber museum is well presented with information available in English.

One of the only attractions worth visiting in Marrakech. Very small garden in honour of the wonderful Yves Saint Laurent with a charge of about 1.60GBP per person. It was a tranquil place to sit ad read a book/have a coffee within their cafe and would recommend to anyone going to Marrakech. It would take no more than 10minutes to walk around, hence the suggestion of a coffee/book session!

A touch of blue....... Hidden behind a wall all around the premises, a true Garden of Eden opens up for the audience.The intense cobalt blue house amidst the bamboo bushes, cactusses, pools (with curious turtles), all roads paved for very easy walking and the very tastefull small museum: all adds up to some hours of pleasure and tranquility!Take your time, sit down and let the atmosphere of this Paradise get over you, you won't regret it!
Colourful beauty. Loved the gardens and the Berber museum too. Worth a visit and would recommend the open top bus tour to get there.

Oasis in the Desert!. Beautifully maintained and manicured gardens. Small Berber museum showcasing intricate costumes of the tribes (unfortunately no pics allowed inside). Its refreshing to the eye especially after days of seeing the cirque du djemaa el fna.

A little oasis inside the city.... Although a bit overpriced, this garden is a nice place to relax a bit during the day..The landscaping is nice, a mixture of different plants from all over the world. It gives kind of a surreal feeling.

An oasis in Marrakech. These gardens are simply beautiful - a must-visit location if you're in the city. They are beautifully cared-for and the house is also worth seeing, for the colours alone. It's worth getting a taxi there if you're in the medina as it's a little way north in the city.

A beautiful oasis. This garden is well worth a visit. It is a little way from the city centre (I paid the taxi driver 30 dirhams to take me there) and the entrance cost was 50 dirhams. The garden contains exotic plants from various places around the world - cacti, succulents, bamboos, palms etc. It was the creation of a French artist, but later it was bought by Yves Saint Laurent.
A little gem. This was a real tonic, restful, fascinating and superbly laid out with excellent "Tea Moroccan" available.
Beautiful Gardens - a 'must do' attraction. Nice place to visit during your stay in Marrakech - only need a couple of hours at most. Admission is approx £8

An oasis in a bustling city. We loved the Jardin Majorelle (Now owned by Yves Saint Laurent) - it's a little oasis in the middle of a busy town!Water is available for 5dirham at the entrance and you can expect to see a variety of trees and plants from all over the world.
A memorable visit. Go, this has to be a highlight of your visit to Marrakech even if you're not a garden fanatic! Such a contrast and a wonderful palate of colour and light.

One of Marrakech's Best. Lovely way to spend a couple of hours in Marrakech. On the street the temperature was 33 degrees but as soon as we walked in all was cool and calm. My other half isn't too keen on gardens but even he was enchanted with this one. If there is a downside it is that the café was very expensive. The Berber Museum is small but well labelled.

Pleasant tourist attraction. This is a pleasant tourist attraction in Marrakech. It is worth visiting once. Due to the tall trees there is plenty of shade from the sun and it is much cooler. There is a Berber Museum which is worth visiting as it explains Morocco's history. The Memorial for Yves Saint Laurent is a nice addition to the place. The plants are very pretty and the cafe is very chic but expensive. Overall a good visit.

Visit if you want some peace out of the Medina. It is like a small oasis in the middle of Marrakech- nice for a stroll, but small, you couldn't stay there for more than an hour (I think they don't allow it anyway). However, I couldn't help noticing that some of the information of the plant names and origins in the gardens are not quite right! There is a small museum which is nice to visit (although they charge you for it), and there seems to be a café too, though it was closed when I visited).Entrance fee is 60 dirham, if I am not mistaken.

Pure serenity. Visited the gardens on day 2 of arriving in Marrakech...wow what an incredible place. From the melee of the bustling town to this peaceful oasis amid the hustle and bustle of town life. IncredibleCacti and exotic plants in a calm serene setting to wile away the hours it is a must see.You have to check out the Berber museum and Yves St Laurent design gallery. The garden is a sensory pleasure!

ok but not as 'amazing as Thomson would have you believe'. The Thomson rep made it sound like a 'must visit' location.....dissappointed as we did it in well under an hour including having tea and pastry in the coffee shop. If you do go spend the extra dirhams and see the Berber museum they have on site.....that was probably the highlight as the garden is all cacti and bamboo (which had lots of awful graffiti on it!)

Very nice. The place was beautiful but not the sort of place you'd visit twice. I love nature, and this place is a mini version of Kew Gardens in London, which I love. If you're staying in the old medina, take a taxi to this place.

Oasis of calm. Not big but pleasantly calm with some lovely plants. The cacti are quite spectacular. The Berber museum is very interesting, with some very attractive exhibits and the patio cafe is great.
very nice. the park was beatufil and nice i will try and back again i like the flowers and every thing the service was nice and every thing was good

Impressive but small. We wanted to see the gardens as it is listed as one of the top attractions in Marrakech. While plants, in particular cactuses were very impressive, gardens itself are quite small and can be seen in 30 minutes or so. However, they are very peaceful and it was a nice way to get away from the busy Medina.
Nice place to visit. Nice place to visit especially to get out of the heat and see some beautiful greenery... pretty pictures and lovely cafe to eat also

quiet spot away from the hustle. The gardens are located in a nice area - away from the central medina etc. Gardens themselves are nice enough. Not absolutely necessary if you are short on time - otherwise certainly not a waste of time. The Yves Saint Laurent Gallery was cool. Many folk were reading on benches, taking a break from the heat and just relaxing in the gardens. Acima supermarket is nearby to stock up on supplies i.e. food for budget travellers, water, alcohol, toiletries etc The whole area is less touristy and i found it to be a nice escape from the medina.

A must visit. You cant visit Marrakech and not add this to your itinerary. The gardens and house is stunning - the cafe/restaurant inside is also lovely and worth a stop.The taxis outside are a pain and expensive claiming they need to add on parking costs for waiting. Just walk down the road and hail one!There are some lovely cafes and funky shops that have recently opened just opposite the entrance to the gardens that are worth a look.
Tranquil & Beautiful. I had alwasys wanted to visit these gardens. Tis is a great spot to relax & cool off in the Marreakech heat
Beautiful & Tranquil. A welcome quiet space from the bustle of Marrakech with beautiful planting and shade. Well worth a visit.

Great plants but not a wow place.. Went to see as people raved about it and most plants were awe inspiring, especially the cactuses but I expected more. Of course the tranquility was there but I've seen better gardens.
Beautiful!. Morocco's very own Secret Garden-beautiful. It's so peaceful and calm- worth a visit. Take a camera and lots of photos and some water.
Oasis in the desert. Colourful and interesting gardens. Worth a visit. Not that big and can easily be visited in an hour. They have a small coffee shop.

Dedicated to hardwork and beauty. Lovely. The Majorelle gardens is spectacular from a botanical point of view with blue village and dedicated to Yves Saint Laurent.
Shops, museums and a lovely shaded garden with ponds, across the road try the smoothies...mmmm

Pretty garden but. Lovely little garden, with pretty flowers/sights situated in a cool location which takes you away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. However .. It is a little boring .. Sorry .

enter the cactus paradise of YSL. The secret garden of Yves St Laurent is now open to the public and that will be a pleasure to visit the collection of catus coming from allover the world. Unfortunatly the residence of the famous man is not open to the public.

Well worth the visit!. This was a little slice of heaven in the middle of Marrakesh! My wife and I were there in March and the gardens are stunning. The house stands in stark contract to the other buildings in the city and the Berber museum which now occupies the house is also worth a look.

so-so garden. Its a nice place to relax but unless you are interested in the "plants", I was not too enthralled by it. I would not waste time here. Other archeological ruins are more interesting in Marrakech.
Interesting and beautiful retreat. I spent an afternoon here in April 2013. The garden was very interesting and unique. It was a pleasant retreat from the hustle and bustle.
totally unexpected. went with tourguide who gave us full history and explained exhibits in museum. very educational. gorgeous gardens

"A jewel". This lovely garden was my favorite site in Marrakech. The colors make you feel in heaven. The smell and the sound of birds, fantastic !! The tranquility of the garden makes it hard to believe you are in the city center.
All in all a definitive must when visiting Marrakech.

Garden of Eden. Ives Saint Laurent and Pierre Bergé bought the garden built by a Jacques Marjorelle, painter and son of a French furniture maker of 1920's. This beautiful garden has an amazing collection of plants and hide a jewel: a small but amazing Berber's museum.

Peaceful and colorful. To take a rest. It is absolutely a great place to have a rest from the superbusy and hot medina.
Take a taxi to get there.
Marrakech oasis. A stunning hidden gem in the centre of Marrakesh: well worth the entrance fee for a sense of calm, shade, beautiful gardens, delightful cafe and excellent museum

A little piece of heaven. Even if you are not into gardens, take an hour (that is all you need as it is lovely and contained), preferably first thing in the morning when it is not too hot, and stroll around this lovely place restored to glory by Yves St. Laurent. It is an oasis of tranquility in the hot city of Marrakech and there is a lovely courtyard in which you can have refreshments near the end of the walk. Cobalt blue, bright yellow and orange urns provide flashes of vibrant colour amidst the greenery of exotic plants from all over the world. Worth the detour.

Nice. Lovely quiet gardens where you can sit and get away from the noise of Marrakech, does not take long to make your way through the whole garden but is a nice change from the streets of Marrakech. Worth a visit and not expensive, international student cards are accepted also and are given a discounted price of 30 dirhams roughly less than £3 entry.

An Oasis. A small, pretty garden. Two hours is plenty to spend in this oasis. Definitely, bring a camera. There is a chic gift shop and a bookstore inside the garden. The outside cafe is perfect for a mint tea.A refreshing break from the outside chaos.
Beautiful gardens. If you have to travel a long way to get here, it is actually quite small and quick to get round. Worth seeing for beautiful planting and vibrant colours.

Decent but small garden. Had been recommended to go here by friends - it was really small (considering the 50 dh entry fee!) and only took 15mins to wander through. The cactus garden was impressive, but the rest of it ?? I don't get it? I have a decent tropical garden at home so maybe my expectations were too high? Half the riads and hotels have more impressive gardens that this. I wouldn't bother with this again for the price of the entry fee

Waste of time.. This poor review of the garden in Marrakesh is probably because I am from California and these desert plants on display are nothing new to me. Compounding the negative factors is that this garden is dedicated to a designer. Not somebody who actually made some type of impact in the region, but simply a man who designed clothing. The gardens were pretty enough but it's not worth the high price of admission.
Strange and beautiful. This is a strange and wonderful garden in the new part of Marrakech. Well worth a visit to see the cobalt blue buildings and amazing plants.
lovely garden. Beautiful garden with cactus and bamboo and ,many other plants. Nice picturesque photos can be taken.

A tranquil oasis in the midst of chaos. The garden is a homage to Yves St Laurent and is cool and calm..amazing little oasis that takes you away from the chaos that is Marrakech. Sit on a bench and just chill out and admire the colours and fountains.

Calm and peaceful. Loved these gardens. So calm and peaceful compared to the chaos that is marrakech. It's a bit pricey to get in but you could easily stay all afternoon and get lost in your thoughts. Lovely little shop which has fixed prices and a nice selection of handicrafts
Relaxing. Good to spend a little time here, away from the busy city centre. This is quiet and peaceful. Just sit on a bench and chill out.
Beautiful detour. Well worth a visit, a lovely place for a walk around. Like so many other places in Marrakech the gardens are a refuge from the madness of the city.

Well worth a visit!. We purchased the combined ticket for the gardens and berber museum. Lovely gardens and a nice respite from the full on buzz of the main square and souks. The restaurant was closed for refurbishment. Nice place to take pictures. My children loved running around as it was quite quiet.
Beautiful. Absolute tranquility saved by Ives St Laurant and well worth a look at. The plants are amazing as in the tiling and the colours are beautiful.

Beautiful. This garden is well worth a visit. We went early in the morning and were some of the first visitors of the day. The winding pathways take you through the different areas of planting, with flashes of colour from the brightly painted pots and columns. Please pay the extra to visit the museum, it is well worth the admission fee to see the amazing photos and artifacts that are on display. A couple of hours wandering around set us up for the day haggling in the souks!

Jardin Majorelle Visit. We were looking forward to seeing this and expected to spend a fair time there enjoying it We were told that an hour should do it and we were a bit surprised it would be that quick and to be honest half an hour would have been enough ! We were very disappointed !

Beautiful!. Great setting and amazing variation of plants. A very tranquil and peaceful spot to spend an hour or two.
The Berber museum is worth the extra admission fee.

Pleasant couple of hours. Interesting garden in such a hot climate. Vibrant colours on buildings within garden were noteworthy. Fashionistas would possibly be interested in some of the books you can browse in the shop.

Lovely gardens. Beautiful gardens but very touristic and busy. Make sure you bring some water because it can get quite hot outside and the bottles sold in the gardens are overpriced. It's walkable distance from Place Laarousse in the medina and took us about 20 min.
Stunning!. Unusual tropical garden in the heart of Marrakesh. Very nice but expensive cafe in the middle and interesting bookshop. Worth the trip.

A haven in a hectic city. Jardin Majorelle is an unlikely haven in busy city. Worth a visit for some peace and quiet and interesting to read about the history and links to Yves Saint Laurent. Wasn't the highlight of my trip, but for a quiet afternoon with some shade from the hot sun it's pretty good value.If you are into botany then it will be a spectacular sight with so many varieties of plants. Trees, giant cacti.

YvesSaintLauren in Marrakech. This is a thing to do if you are visiting Marraskesh the museum inside the complex is a most make sue to pay the extra entrance fee and go inside it. the museums houses artifacts from the people who lived in Morocco before Islam.... Outside the complex you can walk the street in front of it worthwhile .. the stores are very nicely put together.

Very peaceful. Jardin majorelle is a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. It isvery peaceful early in the morning and has some lovely views. The berber museum was also quite interesting if you have any time to see it. A very nice place to relax
Lovely. Very beautiful gardens! Tranquil and cool. A great place to go especially when it is so hot outside!

Peaceful. We decided to visit the gardens first thing in the morning around 9 and were glad as it wasnt busy and we were able to soak up the tranquility the gardens had to offer. Its not a huge area however if you are lover of nature and different plants i would def recommend. We sat at different stages and chilled. It was 50dhs and a short journey from our hotel.

Lovely oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Quiet peaceful place for an afternoon. The restaurant was busy but we were seated very shortly in a very nice side room. Food was good and reasonable. Service was a little slow but that is what the garden is all about. Time to reflect and relax. Lovely tribute area dedicated to Yves saint Laurent. He provided funds for the gardens upkeep for years. Lots of green space and water features. Great way to spend an afternoon.
So peaceful. This place is well worth a visit. The plants were stunning. Loved the quiet atmosphere. Got quiet busy so suggest you get there early.
great scenery. A very nice and beautiful place, a must see, and perfect for pictures. Have a coffee at the cafe too :)
Disappointing. Was disappointed with the gardens it was very dusty and brown with not much green. However there are lots of places to sit but not very inspiring.

Beautiful gardens.. A leafy, green and exotic afternoon away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The food in the cafe was delicious, if a little pricey.
It would probably be better to visit early to beat the crowds. You can reach it on one of the hourly bus tours which are quite cheap.

Hidden oasis. Beautiful botanical feature, well maintained, lovely and full of northern African charm and other influences from around the world. Small charge to enter, cafe, wifi, gallery and Yves saint Laurent memorial.
It rained whilst I was here and that only added to the charm and bewilderment.

Gorgeous. Must see.. There's a reason everyone goes here - it's gorgeous. The succulents, the green plants and bright blue paint on the fountains and house. There is a small but very well maintained museum on Berber culture and there is also a wonderful little boutique (items are pricey but high quality) and a delightful open air cafe to have a tea in.

SImply Beautiful. No trip to Marrakech would be complete without visiting this beautiful garden. We arrived in Marrakech in the height of summer with temperatures going to 40 to 45 degrees. However, this space is a wonderful area to cool down,. You are really transported to another place while in the garden. The garden isn't really that large, and has a small museum inside. You can do a full circle of the garden in about 45 minutes or so. But it would be worth it simply to enjoy the beautiful plants, trees, and ponds.

Is it Morocco?. Absolutely amazing. The contrast between the dirty bustling streets of Marrakech and the garden in huge, it's like getting into a different world. A great collection of cacti and other plants and trees, everything is kept in perfect order and cleanliness. It's a very shadowy place and you can enjoy some shade and cool after walking through medina.

One of my favourites on our Marrakech trip. We spent several hours in Jardin Majorelle and it remains one of my highlights of the trip. Although expensive, the garden is definitely worth going to and taking your time, sitting on the numerous benches and relaxing. There is a small monument to remember Yves Saint Laurent, one of the last owners of the gardents. It's a bit odd looking.There are two ticket options, either including or excluding a visit to the house. We opted for only seeing the gardens and still had a very pleasant time. The garden can get very busy at times, especially if travelling groups are visiting. Yet, the stream of visitors seems to vary throughout the day, thus, taking it slow will help to enjoy the garden in lovely peace and quiet eventually.We did not visit the Cafe in the garden but the menu options sounded delicious. The cafe prices seemed on the expensive end though.

Majorelle Gardens Beautiful. the gardens are absolutely stunning and a must if you visit Marrakech. The only thing I would say is give the restaurant located jin the gardens a miss as it is very expensive and really not worth the money. Lovely cafes and restaurants are situated outside and better value for money
Fantastic Garden. Wonderful garden full of exotic plants with the museum and boutique and cafe to add additional interest. Great place to go on a really hot day.
Worth visiting. The gardens were nicely decorated with fabulous colours, cactus and plants are simple stunning. We had a drink while enjoying the cool weather in a boiling city.

The garden of Eden. These gardens were just exquisite! We wandered through soaking up the atmosphere. We had lunch at the little restaurant complete with a misting spray which was we,come as it was 44 degrees!!

Average!. I was expecting better and more exquisite garden.
I didn't see any reason to charge people with 50 DH for the entrance. Leave the visit for the end and if time available.

Great Way to spend a hot afternoon!. A fantastic way to spend a hot afternoon. The gardens are immaculate, not a great deal to them, as in it doesn't take too long to look round but definitely worth the 100Dhs, £8ish. Take a camera!

Small but nice place to visit.. A peaceful place with beautiful gardens. We loved the blue against the green plants and got some lovely photos. It is small, but worth a visit to get away from the busy city. Nice place for a mint tea as well.
An oasis of calm. Really enjoyed the visit and the gardens are lovely, but they're quite small so do en route somewhere rather than make a special journey

Nice, but nothing special. We walked from the Medina to the Jardin Majorelle which is quite a trek, and had to wait for around half an hour in the blistering heat just to enter. The 50 dhirams charge is not too bad, but you will probably only spend around half an hour here. We did not enter the museum, just took a stroll around the gardens, which are quite nice, but with no wow-factor by any means.

Only go if you've run out of things to do. I dont quite understand the raving reviews. It's merely ok in my opinion if you've run out of things to do or just want a change of scenery from the medina. The garden isnt very big and not that ornate. Its just a lot of green vegetation. The cafe is nice but do you really need to pay an entrance fee to go somewhere just for an average garden and ok cafe. Go at the wrong time and I imagine the flock of tourists would ruin the little ambience there is.

Absolute paradise. This trip is a must. Absolutely gorgeous! As we visited it during August, the temperature reached easily during the day 50 degrees, that is why I would recommend early morning visit.

Cool and peaceful. We took a taxi to these botanical gardens which were a 15 minute drive from our riad. We spent about an hour there (plenty!) and the driver waited for us and then dropped us back at the main square - all for the equivalent of £10. A pleasant morning out.
Loved it. This is a lovely garden. Very colourful and quiet. The coffee shop is lovely. Well worth a visit. No dislikes
Beautiful. The walk the walk through the exotic plants was vividly enjoyable.The colours and the history behind are stunning.
Well worth a visit. Stunning gardens, after walking round the city its a treat to see somethings so beautiful. A land of greenery, ponds and art work from Yves St Laurent.
real surprise. I was not sure what to expect, but it was one of the highlights of our stay in marrakesh. It is a beautiful peaceful gardens some of the plants and the lay out of them was a wonder.

Beautiful. Wonderful place for a 1 hour walk.... a must!
Bar, exhibition and restaurant inside. We only wondered why so many people wrote their names on the plants and bamboo!

Detour to see this.. After walking through many many souks, lane ways, mosques visiting these gardens now dedicated to YSL is a lovely respite from both the heat and the merchants. Beautiful gardens, nice cafe and great history with the YSL association. Spend an hour here and have a coffee.

A Wonderful Surprise!. We never would have expected this garden in the middle of Marrakesh. It has all sorts of mature vegetation and beautiful ponds and pathways. The boutique is lovely, the restaurant is a great place to grab a lemonade and the little room of "love" pictures done by Yves St. Laurent was really neat. Definitely worth a visit.

An oasis in the searing heat. Loved our trip to the Jardin Majorelle. It is a really pretty place to wander around - it could be done quickly but we really took our time as it was lovely and cool in places! Lovely relaxed feel to it with some really interesting displays. Visited the Berber museum too which was small but interesting.Reasonable admission prices - pleased we made the journey to visit here, one of the highlights of our week long trip.

Such a lovely garden. On a not quite as hot a day as the rest of our ten days, we went to Jardin Majorelle... I would have happily spent the whole day there. Sun dappled, but cool. Filled with all the plants I only know small sized for indoors, it is a lovely and quiet haven in a very busy city.We did not visit the Museum Berber in he lovely blue house in the centre of te garden. Shame, because in hindsight I was very curious to know what the house looked like inside. So go, and drop me a line...There is also a tea-room and a gift shop selling Yves Saint Laurent items. This because the garden is owned by a foundation set up by YSL and his partner. YSL bought the property somewhere in 1980. The street on which the garden lies is called Yves Saint Laurent Street.
beautiful and exotic. Go to the permanent exhibit on varied tribal cultures and jewelery. it is worth the extra admission cost and easy to find on the grounds of the garden.

Pretty place to get away from the heat. I liked the garden- it is not huge, but it is peaceful. I am from Arizona, so the cactus and such were not super impressive to me, but their collection is expansive. They take immaculate care of the plants and you will see some really interesting species. The guidebook we had said you cannot buy water inside, so we bought it from a vendor outside for something like 10 dirhams for small bottle...just inside the gate though they were selling for 5 :) It's relatively 'expensive' compared to other sites in Marrakech, 50 dirhams while palaces and museums are usually 10. If you want to take a taxi back, do not get them from near the gate! They are sooooo pricey. Instead, walk down to the main street and hail one a few meters away. Same goes for the horses- negotiate and try to find one a bit away from the gate. We got a carriage back to the main square for 30 dirhams for 2 people. They try to tell you a price, then later say it's for only one person- make sure you say TOTAL PRICE :)

Photographer's Dream Garden and a tribute to the color Blue. This garden, created by French Artist Jacques Majorelle, was bought by Yves Saint Laurent in 1980, is amazing for the design and the blue colors used. Inspired by the Berbere Culture, it's a photographer's dream! Not to be missed for the sheer beauty and unique layout. Slightly boring for children though because there is nothing for them to do there but walk along the pathway. They would much rather be at Oasiria the amazing water park with wave pool, water slides, music and tons of fun!
Not that special. The garden is rather small and it is really full of people. I was constantly asking myself "Is this it?"
wonderful. this was our third visit and we loved it even more this time. it is spotlessly clean and very lushious with incredible cacti.

The beauty of Majorelle gardens. The Riad arranged a fixed price taxi return trip, no haggling needed therefore and it was needed as a long walk in July heat would of left us v sweaty and tired. Apart from a lot of people it was surprisingly easy to find some quiet spots to sit and enjoy these beautiful gardens..I managed to do 3 watercolours.. The cacti are wonderful...it's well worth a visit. Clean and well kept, and if you take your own food, eat it discreetly as gardens are patrolled!

Expensive and not very big!. We were told by our guide we MUST see these gardens. Mmmm .... they're okay, I suppose but they're not great. It is full of bus loads of tourists and when we went was packed. It takes about 45 minutes to casually walk around the gardens, which were decorative but hardly worth the write up given by the tourist offices.The best part was the fact that it was shaded from the mid-day heat.Go if you feel you must, but one cactus looks very much like any another and a dab of blue paint on a wall or pergola here and there does not a garden make, I'm afraid!

An oasis of calm amongst the madness of Marrakech. Unmissable. Beautiful, tranquil gardens - absolutely worth a visit. My best advice would be to get there early to beat the crowds and the heat. Make sure you bring your camera for some unmissable pictures.It's well worth noting there's a lovely little restaurant for lunch here which is situated in a very pretty courtyard, highly recommended (but would, in my opinion, benefit from selling alcohol! A glass of wine after our stroll around the grounds would have been perfect!).

Pretty. It's the most expensive attraction I guess of Marrakech, but if you like Yves Saint Laurent you don't want to miss this. It's very different from the old Moroccan style and not really my thing. But I'm glad I've seen it!

pricey for what it is. the restaurant/cafe wasn't open when we went - and we were planning on having a light lunch there...so that was a bit of a shame......family of four ...€20 for a 20-30 minute wander round a garden and gift shop is a bit pricey......but it is beautiful so you have to do it really!

Calm Oasis. Certainly worth a visit especially after the hustle and bustle of the street markets. It was great to walk in the shade with the cooling ponds and streams around you. The small art gallery was an added bonus for the trip. Lots of photo opportunities.

Good for a hot day. You can visit the garden on a hot day, because the temperature is more pleasent there. The garden can be reached by foot (though not recommanded), or taxi (which is only 30dirham). It contains a variety of bamboo, (palm)trees, cactuses and others and it looks very nice.
Peacefully Pretty.. Definately worth a visit! A peaceful place with beautiful gardens. If you love Cacti it's a must see!
A lot of bamboo. Well worth a visit, thought it would be dull, but very pretty and a nice little Yves St Laurent memorial.
A quiet heaven. If you want to relax in this busy city. This is the place to be. The garden is very nice and the fountains keep the place relatively cool.
A must visit in Marrakesh.. Incredibly beautiful garden, with a very interesting past - I recommend this for a calming afternoon in the heat and bustle of the city summer.

Well worth a visit for the beautiful colours and plants.. This garden can get busy, but it is worth a visit for the relaxing atmosphere and gorgeous blue, yellow and green colours. It is 50 dirhams each (about £3/4) entrance fee to the garden itself. The morning is the best time to visit because it is cooler and less busy. Beautiful cactii, bamboo and palm trees make this a real paradise amidst the heat and dust of the city. We didn't visit the museum or the cafe as this seemed a little over-priced. Very pleasant to spend an hour sitting under the bamboo or strolling through intertwining pathways.

Tranquility in Majorelle Garden. An enchanted place...pure relaxation and silence, after a visit in Marrakech - or in between.Our kids could play hide and seek, and we lost ourselves in the beauty and calmness of this garden. In that place, I really fell into meditative mood - and my husband fell into sleep...

An Oasis of Calm. The Jardin Majorelle was beautifully tranquil after the hustle and bustle of the souk it was a welcome relief from the heat of the day, the verdant canopy taking the intensity from the 40+ degree sun, the Berber Museum is again worth the extra entrance fee. I was a little surprised by the Yves Saint Laurent memorial - but you can make your own mind up about it when you visit!

Amazing tranquil place. Really beautiful and very shaded inside don't miss this if you can get there first thing in the morning then would be less busy but we went in middle of the day and it didn't feel crowded as there are lots of different pathways to follow

Beautiful oasis in the heart of Marrakech !. We were visiting Marrakech in the midst of summer (August) ... And a visit to Jardin Majorelle was like loosing oneself in a green/ blue plant paradise !!! Stunning plants and beautiful greenery surrounding quaint bridges over mini waterways and lily ponds and fountains. Walk... Sit... Enjoy the cool refreshing sounds and colors of Morocco ... And stroll towards the cafe and enjoy a drink or two with a pastry ! Perfect !

Beautiful place to chill out. We were in Marrakech during the heat of the summer and we found Jardin Majorelle to be both beautiful and a great place to escape the heat. It was shady, for the most part. It was a nice stroll for us. You can take as little or as much time as you'd like. We didn't tour the museum on the property. As others have noted, it has an additional entrance fee (not the reason we didn't tour). There is an amazing quantity of interesting plants and they are, for the most part, well marked. Go when you want a break from the sun!
If you can;t stand the heat... go to Jardin Majorelle. Elegant lush vegetation in the garden and cooler than the surrounding area. Museum is good to see Berber tribal costumes.
Pleasant enough. It's okay. Quite pricey to get in and it really only takes 30 minutes to see the lot.Helps if you like cacti!Cafe not offering food when we went and drinks expensive.

Overpriced and over crowded. We went expecting tranquillity and it was packed out, so hardly a peaceful haven. Perhaps our mistake was to go on a Friday when there are less shopping opportunities available. It is relatively expensive to get in and even with a small child we walked the entire gardens in about 30 minutes.The gardens are very pretty and the use of blue lovely but the photos are as good if not better than the reality.
Beautiful. Especially nice respite since we were here during the highest temps of summer. Great for photos and escaping the heat. Note the museum on the property is an extra entrance fee.
lovely and relaxed. It was alittle bit of calm out of the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh! The colours are very vibrant and a lovely place to relax

Amazing, wonderful...second to Palace of Versailles.. Eve St Laurent bought it and remodeled it. How good can a French clothing stylist do? Excellent!!! The blue Majorelle color is something you will not forget.

Majorelle dreams. What a dreamlike place, this garden!If garden eden had a special design, this would it look like. I could have stayed there forever, but my family and the many other sightseeing points of Marrakech urged me to go...I want to return to this garden, one day...

Enchanting. An oasis of cool and calm in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. This hidden gem has seating under the shade of lush greenery, a huge lily pond and many examples of beautiful cacti and other exotic plants.

A pleasant park. This is a nice botanical garden especially if you like cactus and succulents. It was not as large or expansive as I had expected but nice enough. It took us about 45 minutes to see everything.

Oasis of calm beauty. We loved the cool beauty of the gardens and the pop of primary colors. Around every twist, there was a beautiful view. Worth trying to get there early as a tour group or two had it feeling a bit crowded by the time we left. It was worth the trip!

Jardin of peacer. Just an amazing unexpected, peaceful place, totally unlike any of the rest of traditional Morocco. Very minimalist, with amazing ultramarine blues, cool sandy yellows, architectural plants, pons and interesting small museum as well as YSL art

Well worth a visit. Easy access from the centre of Marrakech. The gardens are beautiful. Nice coffee shop on site. The Berber 'museum' was a bit of a waste of time. Overall, well worth the visit. Taxis will try and rip you off on the way back, but just walk away towards the centre of town and flag down another one. Plenty of 'petit' taxis (dirty yellow in colour).

An oasis. We went to these gardens on a day that was 40 degrees but it was beautifully shaded and lovely to walk around keeping out of the heat. We didn't visit the museum. The gardens were very interesting and feature a memorial of Yves Saint Laurent. The shop also had some quality produce after all the tat in the souks!

Not to be missed. This garden is one of the best I've ever visited, a true gem. Once inside the garden, the heat, dust and bustle of Marrakech is a world away. It's clam, cool and peaceful inside, the planting and cobalt blue pots create a stunning garden. If you only have time to visit one thing in Marrakech make it here. The small Berber Museum is well worth the extra entrance fee, simple but very informative. The café is expensive by Marrakech standards, although it has an interesting menu.Small but perfectly formed, an very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.

Beautiful. The garden has a lovely collection of plants and cactuses.So definitely worth while a visit.I did have the feeling to step in to an artificial world.A shame that people carve their names in the trunks of the plants.
Beautiful garden. Worth a visit - last belonged to French fashion designed Yves Saint Laurent. Very pretty and peaceful.

Small but beautiful. These gardens are a secluded little corner of Marrakesh and worth the visit. Try to get there early in the morning before the hoards of tourists arrive as it is quite small and many people spoil the serenity of the place. It is very colorful and surprising in plant selections and beautifully laid out but 1-2 hours is all that is needed to explore the area. It is amazing that it is so quiet inside being in an area of constant traffic and general noise from the main road outside.

Nothing special. It was moreso a collection of bamboo trees with a few unkept water pools that have begun to get dirty. You could say that it has a few quieter spots, but it pales in comparison to gardens in other great cities.

YSL's Hideaway from the Chaos. This was a stunning garden that belonged to French designer Yves Saint Laurent and place to visit (although the benches to rest on are few and far between) and take a breather from the chaos that is the streets of Marrakech. In June, the flowering trees towered over the shady walkways, and for a nominal fee you get to experience what it must be like to be super rich and own your own designer line. There is one particular area full of cacti that was breathtaking (not just because its so hot). Don't be surprised, the gardens are not that big, but what it doesn't have in size makes up for in beauty. Take one of the horse-drawn carriages from here but make sure the driver doesn't swindle you out of your money. I think we paid 400 dirhams to be nice, but I think 200 is more reasonable. They will intentionally drive you to a "drug store" apothecary to sell you argan oil...and since they were so nice (swindle) we bought some.
Interesting but very crowded. Would have been lovely with fewer others, we were queuing around the pathways. Very interesting though.

An oasis in a manic city. entry fees to the gardens are cheap at only 50dh, it provided a lush scenery and complete seclusion from the loud and busy city. there is a little café inside, however we didn't go there, but the gardens provide lovely photo opportunities.
YLS devotees must visit this beautiful garden. This is just stunning with gorgeous areas and designs and fabulous architecture. A lovely cool spot in the centre of busy noisy Marrakech.

A place for meditation. I enjoyed the venue with the chanting of birds. A good ecosystem for plants, reptiles and birds alike.Good spot for old memories of Yves Saint Laurent and a nice coffee shop with exquisite cocktails
Gardens. Beautiful, elegant and tranquil, with interesting Berber exhibition. café a little pricey but worth it, the terrace is cool and the food great.

Away from the madding crowd. The shaded Marjorelle Garden was a lovely respite away from the heat of summer and the bustle of the souk. Take time to enjoy a refreshment and be sure to take some snapshots as it is very photogenic.

Beautiful garden. A beautiful garden well worth a visit - the cactus , palms and use of bold coloured pots etc work really well . Nice little café and small shop. However , garden is quite small so even allowing time for a cool drink in the café , you could spend an hour or so here at most. Having said that , the place is truly beautiful.
A magical place. A nice retreat from the chaotic city, beautiful mix of colors and shapes! Stunning cactus garden and recently renovated Berber Arts Museum inside is worth an hour visit!
touristic nightmare. only go if you can do it before or after the crowds, which make the experience a disaster. The bookstore is quite good and the area nearby is worth a short visit.

Disappointing garden with a fabulous museum. A pleasant enough desert garden with some welcome shade. It's small though and not very informative so doesn't warrant more than 30 or 40 minutes.It gets crowded partly, because it is promoted (overly, in my opinion). There's a pleasant enough cafe where prices are many times what you pay on the street.For me, the best part of the visit was the museum of Berber culture. This seems to be not much more than a footnote on the publicity for the Jardin Majorelle but outshone the garden entirely. It's a beautifully presented and extensive collection of Berber costume and jewellery. 5 stars for this!NB. The garden and museum are run by the Pierre Bergé – Yves Saint Laurent Foundation. I loved the bit in the leaflet we were handed where it said that Bergé and YSL had established the foundation "to celebrate and preserve the genius of Yves St Laurent". And, no doubt, as a tribute to his modesty!
Beautiful. Really tranquil garden, nice way to spend a morning away from the busy city - very cool as well, good way to spend a morning outside but not in the heat.
Beautiful Oasis. we visited this beautiful shady garden, full of huge plants, trees & cacti. it's a clam quiet oasis in the city & worth a visit.

stunning Jardin Majorelle. If you want some peacefull time in a hectic city. This beatifull garden is the place to be. The deep majorelle blue is amazing, there is a nice café and the small Berbe museum is also worth going to.
Majorelle. A relaxing couple of hours in a little blue oasis with plenty of shade and water features.Look out for the terrapin's in the goldfish pond

Amazing Cacti. The garden is located to the about 2.5k from the famous Jemaa el-Fna square. A taxi costs around 25MAD.Its 2.5 acres of amazing cacti and palms from all over the world. There is a small and pleasant cafe and an interesting Berber museum giving an insight into their diminishing world.

Beautiful. OMG... one word.. STUNNING. The garden was so peaceful and colourful. I could have stayed there all day. crazy to think that such peacefulness could exist in Marrakech. great place to visit to reflect on life... or if you just want to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech

An oasis of calm. Really recommend - if for nothing else but to retreat from the hectic pace in Marrakech. It is very beautiful inside and you should allow an hour, though you will struggle to fill in more than a couple of hours there, especially when it is busy

Beautiful gardens. I loved visiting Jardin Majorelle. I am a cacti lover so the large oversized cacti garden was very stylish. I also enjoyed the YSL museum with Yves St Laurent's annual Love posters. Peaceful. Cool. Colourful.
Peace and tranquility in the heat. Cool, peaceful, beautiful gardens and an opportunity to get away from the city outside. Lots of interesting plants and cacti. Nice cafe as well
Wonderful. We loved these gardens and the Berber museum which is really interesting. The gardens were busy but nevertheless still felt peaceful and provided welcome shade from the blistering heat.

Fabulous!. Don't miss this unique and stylish garden when you are in Marrakech. You'll never see another one like it. The Berber museum was interesting as well. You could tell it was curated by someone with a great eye for beauty and, although small, it was very impressive. Worth the extra charge for sure. Didn't bother with the little café as it was too busy at the time we were there but overall Le Jardin Majorelle is a must see.

The oasis of beauty with YSL's memorial. The walk to get here was pretty full on, past the stinking filth and mad wide streets immediately outside the Medina to the NW. But it was worth it: you are greeted with such peace and beauty. It has quite a Western feel, though the small gardens are full of exotic plants from all over the world. A lovely place to visit, cool in the heat of the day.
Most beautiful garden. You really should go and visit this garden, only quite small, but my face lit up when i walked in and saw how beautiful and peaceful the place is.
Peace and quiet. These are a beautiful quiet and cool oasis in a hot city. The little Berber museum is superb. Yves St Laurent monument is hidden in the trees.
jardin Majorelle. it is a wonderful garden , well worth a visit , a real oasis , shop is very expensive, and café is not cheap

Lovely peaceful gardens. Superb tranquil gardens in Marrakech, these make a very welcome change from the hassle you receive in the city. Well worth a visit even if just to escape the heat of the city!

Busy and expensive. These are nice gardens but are a bit out of town and quite busy. We were expecting something a bit greener with lots of places to hide away and read in the shade but its more of a dessert garden and bustling with people. The cafe was pricey too.
Tranquil. A peaceful serenity amongst the hustle and bustle of the busy city. Quite small but I think its a must visit attraction whilst in Marrakech.

Bit too chaotic. Not the locals, the other tourists. Everyone jostling for prime position on the pictures, annoying everyone else in the meantime.They are interesting and worth viewing, yes,, but get there at 9am when it opens s o that you dont have to deal with the crowds. Unless you like the craziness, of course. In that case, go bang on midday!

Beautiful gardens. The Marjorelle gardens was not far from our hotel and many friends and families recommended as a worth while trip and it definitely was.The garden are beautiful and quiet and it is a great place to get lost for an hour or two. They are very well kept and the Marjorelle Blue is everywhere and a real theme throughout.The Yves St laurent design is fantastic and loads of great opportunity for pictures. The garden is well shaded for hot days and no worries for kids to run around. A must !

Relaxing and lovely gardens. There is not much to do here except enjoy the beautiful plants, ponds and brightly painted buildings - but it is a nice way to spend an hour walking around the gorgeous gardens.The prices in the coffee shop housed in the gardens are as pricey as you would expect.

Nice and shady, allthough not very big. The Jardin Majorelle, allthough not very big, is worth the visit, especially when out in town the weather is very hot. It's a well kept garden with a variety of trees and colourful flowers. As it is quite a distance from the city center you better go by taxi or kalesh.

Peaceful. Walked from the Medina to the gardens, which took about 20 minutes. Pleasant enough place, very quiet and peaceful, which is wonderful given how busy the Medina is, but don't expect to be blown away! Very picturesque lily pond, the cafe does awesome (expensive) juices, and an easy way to spend an hour. If you want to really relax, take a book and find yourself a quiet seat, and spend longer there!
Worth a visit. Unusual but very tranquil gardens, highly recommend. Aside from the gardens themselves the history is also very interesting. Would visit again

Small but worth a visit. This garden was smaller than I was expecting but it really was an oasis in the heat of Marrakech. Nearly all of it is under the cover of trees and you can wander around it in the shade. There are plants from all over the world. The museum was closed when I was there so I can't comment on that except to say that it too seemed rather small.

Nice break. The gardens were a nice break away from the hustle and bustle of the city. ITs a small garden, but very beautiful and relaxing, I would definetely recommend taking a stroll on a lazy day and visiting the little cafe to just listen to the sounds of the birds. Ideal location for great pictures with the stark contrasts of blue and yellow.

astonishingly vibrant primary colours. Jacques Majorelle's voluptuous gift. We spent almost 2 hours roaming this luxurious oasis in Marrakesh. Trees and exotic plants of almost fantastical origin; refreshing streams and pools filled with water lilies and lotus flowers. Air, laden with sugared fragrance like a delicious sherbet.

Well worth it. Beautiful, peaceful, spend as much time as you want here, just absorb the surroundings. Visit the museum and learn about another culture, its only small but well worth it. Yves St. Laurent's last resting place and he had taste. The cafe is also very nice, try to sit inside the conservatory if you can. Gift shop on site. Enjoy.

Nice to Experience!. The Gardens were a nice little afternoon entertainment. It was only a few pounds to get in and the museum is a must. It was nice to see YSL memorial garden and the museum explained all the history of marakkesh which was very interesting. All finished off with a little afternoon tea and cake at their little Coffee Shop

Things to see and do in/around Marrakech. This was a cool and quiet place to be during the hottest part of the day. Beautifully designed and cared for garden. There are many cacti, trees etc, which are labelled telling their country of origin.

Surprisingly brilliant. We visited the gardens expecting to only spend an hour or so there. But we ended up spending about three hours in the end!The gardens aren't very big but are stunning- a botanist would probably be able to tell you about the variety of species but I just knew that it was beautiful.We wandered around the gardens taking photos and reveling in the shade. The park wardens are very lovely and were happy to take photos of us and chat.There is a small room of posters designed by Yves Saint Laurent in the gardens during his ownership of them- if you're a fan of fashion it is great to visit as his ashes were scattered there.The real highlight of the trip though was the little gallery in the gardens. It housed artwork, tools, costume, jewellery and so on from the Berber tribe of North Africa. Which was all very interesting when explained by the BEST GALLERY GUIDE OF ALL TIME. He was very witty and spoke 5 languages, filling us in on the background to the objects and also just providing genuinely lovely conversation. I wish I could remember his name. BUT everyone should visit for him alone!

very colorful. this is one of the most popular attractions in marakesh,it has alot of different types of plants it will be interesting to people who love plants otherwise the interesting part is the story behind the garden you've to know it.

A nice cool, calm place away from the mayhem. Very pretty and a lovely cool haven away from the mayhem that is the medina. We say some amazing cactus and the largest bamboo I've ever seen. Worth an hour or two to visit.
The legend. Yves Saint -Laurent ashes are somewhere on the grounds. The garden is impeccable and embodies the magnet that this city was for a brilliant Bohemian crowd who put it on the map
Something to do. Not a must, but if you want to just linger around and take a peak. Don't need more than 45 minutes, if that. Didn't blow my mind but was pretty. Reminded of a mini botanical garden.

Peaceful Escape. After battling traffic crossings and being surrounded by people, the Jardin Majorelle offers a peaceful, tranquil setting of green. This is a beautiful park and offered some surprises--such as the many types of palms, cacti, and other types of trees and plants. We only spent an hour or so there, but it was just what we needed to rejuvenate ourselves before heading out to the other sites.

Jardin Majorelle. I went here not knowing what to expect, i was overwhelmed so many plants the history of the place i expected it to be a quick visit but was actually there for over three hours. The gardens were so tranquil, the blue such a contrast for the planting, no wonder Majorelle whose passion was flaura and fauna bought this land to create such a beautiful place.I found the museum interesting, and i am pleased the gardens were saved from becoming a hotel by being bought by Lauren and Pierre Berge. I really enjoyed these gardens and i would say they are a must visit experience.

Jardin Majorelle. Beautiful grounds and architecture. YSL has a small gallery called LOVE and his remains were scattered here. Great place for breakfast..The Gift shop is beautiful! The jardin is serene and beautiful ~
You'll only need an hour. It was incredibly crowded and much much much smaller than had been billed both to me and in the brochure. That said, it was nice, just not spectactular.
Beautiful. It was incredible. So many beautiful plants. The green and blue colour scheme of the tiles and pots were lovely. Calm, cool and relaxing on an extremely hot day - 45 degrees.
Dream Garden. This is one of the highlights of Marrakech. The garden created by Jacques Majorelle is like going into a time capsule. Here you will see the famous "blue" that Majorelle created.

Not really much to it.. I went along as it wasn't pricey. The gardens were very shaded which brought blessed relief from the heat. Museum was closed. Took me half an hour to walk around and then I wanted to leave. There are some tall plants, some colourful plants, but all in all, not one for me. Saying that, there was a lovely restaurant across the road - sold lovely pastillas.

Beautiful Oasis of Calm. Visited here on 10th July for the 3rd time in several years. Paid 50 dh just for the garden, but would cost 25dh extra to visit the museum which I have done in the past and which is interesting.Love these gardens, quite small, but very tranquil and lots of interesting plants. There is a coffee shop but this is expensive in my opinion, there are coffee shops outside of the gardens which offer better value.Loved the YSL memorial, can't recall having seen this before. Also enjoyed the YSL art exhibit which definitely wasn't there last time I visited.

Relax and cool down. The garden is a must-see place in Marrakech. First of all it is beautiful with lots of different kinds of trees and plants and very relaxed atmosphere and secondly its a great place to escape from sun and heat. If you are a student I recommend you to take a student card and you will pay 30 dh instead of 50. Overall this was one of our favorite attractions in Marrakech and we would come back any time.
Worth a trip but not essential. Quite a nice garden and worth maybe an hour's visit but not mind-blowing. Got some nice pics and was a pleasant place. Museum was closed when we went.

Great place to cool off. We walked across the city in mid-July to find the garden. The admission price (50 Dhs per person) was well spent, as it was easily 15 degrees cooler and plenty of shade! The area is well maintained and has many different kinds of plants, although most weren't flowering. Not sure if this was due to the time of year or the type of plant. Still pretty to look at, although we were expecting more color. The majority of color contrast comes from the painted planters and building walls. The cafe has a very inviting patio area, where you can sit and relax while enjoying your order (coconut sorbet - fantastic!)

Not to miss. The Jardin Majorell gardens were part owned and designed by Yves Saint Laurent ,whos ashes were also scattered in the gardens,go early to avoid crowds and have enough time to take some great photos

Jardin Majorelle, smell of YSL Opium in the air. Once you enter, air getts colder at once. This is because of the very high bamboo trees covering the sun.all the garden ''screams'' art and touch of an artist, Strong colors everywhere and a lot of plants i never seen before. YSL boutique was too exensive for me. Very nice morning spent there. only thing is that there are not many signs ob the street to direct you there.
Very nice gardens. Was very busy when we went and hard to get a photograph without someone in the background! Well worth a visit though!

Underwhelming. Jardin Majorelle is definitely a peaceful escape from the heat and craziness of Marrakech. But I wasn’t blown away.
There were no explanations as to why the gardens were built or what the plants were. Maybe my expectations were too high but all I was underwhelmed.
Unfortunately the museum was shut when we went.

Well worth a visit. Visited the YSL gardens today, it costs 50 dhs per person to get in and 25dhs extra for the museum, it is full of tourists but didn't spoil it at all really tranquil gardens beautifully kept the colours are lovely. All in all well worth the small entrance fee and the YSL gift shop I too die for. Worth a visit 100%, also my boyfriend was converted and had a really nice time loads of nice photo opportunities.

Magical Jardin Majorelle. I had dreamed of visiting Jardin Majorelle for years. I have a slight obsession with Yves Saint Laurent and his book of Love.All of my expectations were exceeded. The flora and fauna are landscaped so beautiful that I felt like I was in another world. The Berber Museum houses Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Berge's private collection of Berber artifacts. After you exit the museum make sure you go into the Galerie Love, an exhibit of Yves Saint Laurent's LOVE cards that he personally made each year to give to his closest friends on New Years. When you get hungry walk into the cafe and be greeted by puffs of cool mist floating over the dining area...... ummm yeah it's that great.Before you leave make sure you visit Yves Memorial.
Great visit on a hot day. If you have had too much of medina life, the gardens are a great escape. The museum and museum stores are wonderful...updated, with English translations.
Stunning!. Absolutely beautiful garden, you have to visit if you want a serene paradise away from the craziness of the city.
awesome. AWESOME. Especially if you're creative/love fashion. The colors. Terrace with yummy ice cream and a special collection of cactuses.
Lovely. Bigger than it appears from the outside. Peaceful was to spend an hour or two. Self-guided stroll through this garden is a nice opportunity to escape the hustle of Marrakech for a bit.

Beautiful relaxing gardens. Small gardens, we went early morning so we could walk from our hotel, lovely and small but to be honest for the price of 25 diarhrams I would recommend it just to get away from the hussle and heat! Did not go into the Berber Museum as it looked small.

Lovely week in Marrakech. Lovely gardens, it's an oasis in the "middle" of Marrakech.The gardens are well taken care and allow you to have peaceful experience.Visit it in the morning.The museum is also nice to see with all the Berberes culture in evidence.

SUPERB.................... Wow!!!A truly wonderful gardens that is so well kept and has a fantastic restuarant to cool off and have a snack/dinner etc. The gardens themselves are outsanding and mainted to a very high standard!

Good trip and good for photographs. I loved taking photos of the garden. Lovely place and very peaceful. Loved the colours and plants. It is a bit pricey, however worth a visit. An oasis in Marakech, allows you to get away from the annoying taxi drivers.

The most unusual gardens I've seen!. The colors on the walls, benches and all around are striking! Electric blues, screaming yellows and greens framimg the unusual cacti and plants make these gardens very unique and beautiful at the same time.
Very pleasant coffle shop for mint tea and cookies. The gift shop had very nice "souvenirs" (expensive but fine artesanal goods")
Peaceful. Peaceful gardens in the center of Marrakech. Very well maintained. The only drawback is that it lacks a bit of explanations and reasons why such gardens were established.
Peaceful refuge. A peaceful refuge away from the bustle of the square. Beautiful, colourful gardens full of interesting plants and creatures. Don't miss the wonderful Berber Museum in the grounds
Gardens. Spent a couple of quiet and carefree hours in these beautiful gardens so cool and restful despite the hustle and bustle in the rest of town

Beautiful place to relax in Marrakech. My husband and I had tickets for this attraction from our hotel so it was free for us but the price is cheap regardless. It is one of the only shaded areas in Marrakech so that alone is worth it! But the garden is beautiful, despite being a bit small. The museum inside is extra but, again, not expensive and its worth it to see the tribal life displays (and get some AC!). Don't let the taxi drivers charge you more than 30 dirham to take you there.
YSL Gardens. Very tranquil and peaceful, go early as to hot to go in July or August in the afternoon. We got picked up at our hotel by a horse and carriage
Beautiful even in the rain. The gardens with magic blue were perfect even in a downpour. Congrats to YSL and the designer for such a great job

Worth the visit!. You might was well visit it since you are already in Marrakech. It is a small botanical garden but very well kept with lots of green trees and bamboo, it was donated to the city by Yves de Saint Laurent at his death. Taxi should cost you €4 each way back to the main square.

Colorful garden. Decoration of the garden is great for taking photos. Meet with Yves saint laurent in a Marrakech street is such an interesting experience. Although the garden is not so big, it satisfies you.

Very nice escape from the Medina. We took a caleche (horse drawn carriage) around the city to get to Jardin Majorelle. It is a beautiful garden, with lots of shade to escape under from the hot Moroccan sun. It is fairly cheap to get in- about 20 DH plus 10 extra for the museum. We ate lunch at the very expensive cafe, but it was worth because we were so hungry.
Lovely Gardens. A nice little respite in the center of Marrakesh. The gardens were well kept and the cafe a nice little spot to relax.

The wonderful oasis of Marrakech. Quiet, serene, photogenic, colorful! That’s Majorelle Garden - the real oasis of Marrakech that will allow you to take a break. The best way to get there is by horse and carriage (caleche)..... Highly recommended
Cool place. Cool and tranquil place to visit to take time out from the frantic souks! Don't let the taxi drivers tell you it is hard to get to or over charge for a taxi!

A beautiful, cool and tranquil oasis. Even if visiting gardens isn't usually your thing (it isn't usually mine) go to the Majorelle Gardens just to cool off, find some shaded tranquility and admire just how beautiful Yves Saint Laurent's artistic man-made garden can be. You can wander at leisure along avenues of shady trees, walk beneath myriads of exotic plants and pause beside lakes, streams and water features in complete contrast to the hot and hectic lifestyle of central Marrakech. It's cheap, beautiful, calming and most of all memorable.

Very inspiring garden. Its very nice to wander around this garden for an hour or so. It is a very calm, peaceful place. As well as the plants I liked the colour scheme of the pots and stonework. I fancy trying to recreate this at home :)

Beautiful oasis in a crowded city. For us, visiting this famous garden was a much needed escape from the noisy, polluted city. This place is peaceful and full of greenery, and it is spacious despite the crowds of tourists. Wonderful collection of unique plant specimen from around the world. The blue and yellow colors were a nice tribute to Yves Saint Laurent. It's within walking distance from the center of new town (Gueliz); and the entrance fee is very affordable. This could easily be one of the best urban gardens in the world!
Very Beautiful. Very Beautiful place, good for photography and relaxation. entry to the park costs 50 MDH, entry to the museum 20 MDH
Le Jardin Majorelle. A calm oasis in another wise crazy town. Cool, shaded lush gardens to seek shade under the canopy. Worth seeing the iconic Yves Saint- Laurent's final resting place.
Lovely. The gardens were ok - have seen better but the museum topped it - lovely costume and jewellery and helpful guides.

Wonderful. Beautiful garden; tranquility in the middle of the mayhem!
Must see for all in Marrakech, one of the highlights of our stay.

Nice garden..but nothinh more. I just expected something more from that garden.
It costs 50 Dhr and we stayed inside for maximum 30min. There are just some palms and cactus with some water and fountain around. Nice place, very pacefull from the rest of the city, but it didn't surprise me at all. Too obvious and not at all clean as it should be.

Really? That's it?. Once you have seen one cactus and palm tree you have seen them all! In my opinion it was over rated and it was ok but if I had known what it was like beforehand, would I have gone? No.
Wonderful. What an oasis in the middle of mayhem. Lovely to walk around to escape the heat of the day. Sights smells meet you around every corner of this stunning garden.
The city's jewel. Go early 8am when it opens. Magnificent garden, the Berber exhibition is superb especially when you enter the jewellery room! cannot fault anything!

Worth a visit. Aim to be there when it opens and beat the tour groups and heat.Nice just to stroll around the gardens and enjoy the use of vibrant colour.Somehow it works without being jarring.Take your time to soak in the ambiance and just sit on one of the many benches dotted around the gardens.Must have been some great parties there back in the day!We walked from our riad, El Fenn , because we wanted the exercise and it took about 30 mins.
Beautiful garden. Beautiful garden, great for a photo session we love to do so much. Just wonder around a bit and escape the hectic medina
Pleasant diversion. Certainly very nice and beautifully maintained but more a half hour visit rather than any longer.Place is quite small outside of the city maybe a nightmare 10 minute taxi drive.
Wonderful colours!. This is a lovely place to visit - the variety and colours of the plants and pots is great as is the museum building! It is also like an oasis!

prob the only place worth seeing in marrakech. Nice garden to visit and relax. It is full of trees mainly. You can take some nice pics. The price is 50 dirhams which is not much and cost more than the other sight attractions in marrakech.
BEAUTIFUL. This is well worth a visit. Even children would love it. It does not take more than 30 to 40 minutes to visit. Lots to see but not much walking. Amazing cacti to see.

a real gem in the heart Marrakech. The style of the garden, and the deversity of the plants are the best things i like.
Perfect and nothing else to say , a very special gardens, don't miss when you are in Marrakech
great afternoon trip. fantastic location , entrance price a bit expensive but needs to be seen while in Marrakesh . beautiful location & full of history

Beautiful tranquil gardens offering respite from hectic Marrakech. A lovely peaceful afternoon spent strolling round these gorgeous gardens, looking at all the lovely plants and cacti. A welcome relief from the hecticness of Marrakech.

A must-do. To me, gardens are not a top priority when it comes to sightseeing. I have always found plants interesting but its not like I am super duper interested in them.However, my short trip to Jardin Majorelle was extremely enjoyable. Visited it in the afternoon after going to El Badi Palace and one other place in the morning.There are some great opportunities for taking good, colorful pictures. The plants and cacti come in many different colors, shapes and sizes, which was really cool. The house in the garden was also a very beautiful shade of blue and with a mixture of other colors, again very pretty for pictures.The gardens itself are not very big. You can be done in well under an hour if you don't stop much to take pictures.

Beautiful peaceful place. Again as with everywhere in Marrakech it is best to get there early to avoid the big groups. This is a small but beautifully planted private garden. It is quite masculine in its planting and my husband really liked it too. The cafe looked very nice but the prices are very expensive. It is pretty easy to find if you have a map and we walked there from the main square.

Picturesque Marjorelle. I didnt have any expectations of the YSL gardens so i was very surprised by their charm. Its a very simple place and a short but sweet trip but there is something really special about the Marjorelle gardens. As a lover of bright and bold colours and cactus i was taken aback by the beauty of the place. It is a respite away from the frantic mayhem of the souks and city life and a true delight to see.
A small paradise. When you want to escape the busy streets, visit this place. It is cool and your can get some serious R&R experience.
Wow incredible!!. The garden is amazing, and gets better if you arrived early (no tourist) you have the the place for you... Then make a stop at the coffe shop, it is charming.

Pretty but crowded. There is no doubt that the gardens are beautiful but we hardly got a chance to stop and enjoy due to the crowds and people trying to take photographs. We retreated to the café and had lunch (be warned this is expensive and very poor quality of food offered)
beautiful peaceful gardens. as soon as you walk in, the madness disappears and you are transported into a wonderful peaceful garden filled with various plants and trees from around the world.

maybe I expected too much. I don't know what I expected, but while I found these gardens lovely, I didn't really find them fantastic or unusually designed. it's a good place to start a tour of the Nouvelle Ville though, and the Berber museum and photo slideshow is well done.

Lovely destination... Don't go on your 1st day. Wait until Marrakech has worn you out a little bit. You'll appreciate Jardin Majorelle that much more for it's lovely greenery, beautifully bright colors, clean setting, and a visit at the busy but sweet tea garden.

Majorelle Gardens is a must see in Marrakech!. Loved the architecture, the dynamic colors (especially the Majorelle Blue) and of course the gardens! The gift store and the book store are also great (but overpriced as you might expect). Majorelle Gardens is a must see in Marrakech!
A lovely STOP for a chilly fruit drink. On a hot day try to stroll around this beautiful garden early in the morning (fewer tourists) for a glass of fresh fruit juice.

Beautiful gardens. Lovely gardens, the second time I have visited. A must see on a visit to Marrakech. Only down side is that it was extremely busy in the late morning and so hard to get photos without loads of people in them! Cafe unfortunately very overpriced, but in a beautiful little courtyard and worth going to even if just for a refreshing mint tea.

Smaller than you might imagine. This is a nice place to visit and we did enjoy our visit but it wasn't what I expected but that's more my fault for not researching. When thinking gardens I hoped for a large park type place, somewhere with grass to lay in the sun and relax. This is actually a fairly small place where you walk around set paths looking at plants from across the world.Still really nice and there are some benches to sit on but personally not somewhere I could relax and spend a couple of hours chilling away from the hustle of Marrakesh.It also does get very busy and being set paths you can end up a fair number of people in front or behind as well as queues at the 'idyllic photo' locations. A tip would be to try and visit early in the day.The charge to get in is moderate and it is a taxi ride from the main square although we did actually walk back ourselves.
Beautiful peaceful place. Highly recommended for a calm and peaceful day out, enjoy a quiet stroll through the gardens and then a drink in the café.

An Oasis. The jardin Majorelle is one of the most beautiful gardens I have seen. It has a multiple variety of plants from all over the world. The set up is unique with its blues and greens and the old house now converted in a Ber-ber museum is very interesting. It changed my opinion of Ives Saint Laurent.

Beautiful and calming. These gardens are very beautiful and I imagine if you were staying in a riad in the centre of town (we stayed in a hotel just outside), would be a lovely place to escape the noise!It was interesting to see the plants from 5 different continents, and it was helpful that they all had names and labels to tell you where they were from.We walked round fairly slowly, stopped to sit on a bench for a while and took a lot of photos, and we still only spent 45 minutes there. Although beautiful I wouldn't think the average person would spend any more time than that there, unless you went to the museum/ate at the café. Definitely worth going to see.

Nice Gardens - Check out the Berber Museum inside!. The gardens are pretty unimpressive - some pretty spots and nice cacti, but the museum is actually really interesting considering how small it is - definitely worth the 25 dhs entry fee!
Berber museum. Beautiful gardens and great Berber museum. well worth the admission price. Beautiful cacti from all over the world.

Somewhere to cool down. Today it is 44 degrees so we decided to go and get some shade in the gardens. Very beautiful, peaceful and calming. Fantastic if you like cacti as they have a very good display. Berber Museum worth a visit. We decided not to eat in the cafe as we thought it expensive so we ate Pause Goummande instead.

cactus paradise. Cactus collected from around the world and well woth a visit I spent a really enjoyable 45 minutes walking aroung and admiring the wonderful plants.They were collected by a French artist, as he travelled the world.

Pretty, but you only need a short time. These gardens are lovely, a great little respite from the heat. The plants are healthy and make it a nice cool stroll, but you don't need a huge amount of time here.
Hidden Gem. We were taken here as part of our business trip. The guys enjoyed it as much as the girls. Very interesting and a good visit. Go and see them.

peaceful and shady. great place to visit tatsefully done.wonderful shade on a hot day
Get there early-crowds could be a problem
Haven away from the crowds and heat of Marrakech. Beautifully kept garden with a great variety. Plenty of areas to sit and relax in the sheltered heat of Marrakech.
Worth a visit. Some good photo opportunities here, though not a huge variety of planting. Well maintained with good facilities.

Absolutely stunning. For 50DH each you get a fabulous look around lush gardens. A tranquil respite from the madness of Marrakech- a really great visit! The only downside is the tourists taking sooooo many photos, but it was still fabulous.

Marrakech is more than the medina. After spending a couple of days wandering around the medina, visiting museums and souks, we took a cab to these gardens. What a change in light, sounds and colours! It was very restful and very beautiful. Orange flowers against a Majorelle blue wall are spectacular. Having seen a Berber museum in the Todra valley, we passed on the one here.
YSL. Beautifully tended garden away from the colorful clutter of the Medina. Outdoor cafe was a great place to rest over cappuccinos.

Nice change to medina. A short distance from Jemaa el-Fnaa, this is a nice change and worth a visit. Costs to go in but not much. Cafe is expensive. Well kept and museum is also interesting - the Berber costumes in one of the rooms are a little creepy but another room with Berber jewellery is cool due to the mirrored walls and ceilings reflecting lights to give a celestial feel to it. Spent a couple of hours here!

Small but beautiful. Who knew there were so many different kinds of cactus, but here there were. some very interesting ones to say the least. The memorial of Yves St. Laurent in a place where he loved.

Jardin Majorelle. Lovely gardens, well priced. Took 45 mins to wonder around. Didnt pay for the museum. The book shop and boutique were lovely and the cafe was really nice, (tad expensive). Really enjoyed the morning walking around them!

yves saint laurent garden (jardin majorelle). the yves saint laurent garden (jardin majorelle) is a very exciting garden full of all sorts of exotic plants. Full of colour and style as you would have expected!!A colurful good experience @ good value, would highly recommend
Must see. Fascinating stop on the city tour, great insight into the history of the site and the resoration work
Nice to visit on a hot day!. Jardin Majorelle is a nice, cool and quiet break from the city. It's a small garden and a visit fits in a walk through the new city.
