Worth a visit. Oasis of calm sounds like a platitude, however this garden fits the bill. Unconventional, colorful and eclectic.
a beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. Marjorelle Gardens is a wonderful place to go and unwind. It is beautiful in all the Berber blues and is one of my favorite spots in the city.

An oasis of calm but rather out of the way.. The gardens were beautiful and a cool welcome break from the medina. A really chilled place to spend some time with a book (there is a book shop in the garden). It's not really near anything else and the taxis outside know this and charge a lot more. Our guide book said to walk onto the main road and flag one down there instead. The majorelle is also quite pricey in comparison with the other attractions and you had to pay extra to get into the museum.

Don't bother. Costs about S$7 each per person (US $6). Personally I thought it wasn't worth the money. The gardens are nice enough but pretty small. The best bit was the prints of YSL's Xmas card designs each year. Better things to do in Marrakech.
Touristy. overrated . thousands of tourists. Blue Blue Cobalt Blue.Seen much better gardens in Morocco. The Islamic world has much more sumptuous gardens - visit IRAN
lovely gardens. An oasis in the centre of Marrakesh. Cool and inviting
Nothing special. Was dissapointed a hommage to YSL so was expecting more .
majorell gardens. beautiful very peaceful and full of wonderful plants and shade
A Tribute to Yves St Laurent. Beautiful 1920's garden created by Jacques Majorelle but now becoming a memoir to Yves St Laurent .
Lovely gardens. These were lovely gardens. . . cool and quiet. The gift shop was very nice with interesting and high quality things.
Nice garden. It's a must see place. Very nice flora. Hundreds of different plants. YSLaurent statue is also here.
best place to have Pictures. not very big but full of beautiful plants and nice view; you can have a dozen of nice pictures outthere
YSL GOODNESS. The gardens are gorgeous. The colors are raucous and arresting. The gift shop in spendid- I bought a scarf, YSL scarf, and post cards. Don't miss this!!
Majorelle and Yves St. Laurant. Gardens lovely. Small cultural museum very well done and very interesting.
LOVELY AND TRANQUIL. So peaceful. Lovely and calm with amazing Moroccan colours.

A style shrine. A must if in Marrakech, the gardens and the house explain why Monsieur Yves Saint Laurent chose this as his winter residence...Lovely for a Sunday walk, go there and have brunch at the bar inside the Gardens.
Peaceful oasis. Great place to take a seat under the umbrella of trees and have a breather. Well kept and peaceful.
YSL & Gardens. worth a trip, beautiful settings, lovely lunch at the cafe. Interesting museum, can get a bit busy
Small but an excellent retreat. Very relaxing if you go independently and enjoy the gardens without the tourist buses.
Worth while visiting. It has to do with Eves St Loreans life beutifull garden and lots of history behind it

Peaceful place in a bustling city. This botanical garden gives an amazing feeling of tranquillity which is enhanced by verdant groves of bamboo, dwarf palm and agave, the cactus garden and the various lily-covered pools. you feel you are in an oasis.
Stunning Garden. Architectural garden of cacti and striking colours. Good cafe and berber museum

Surprisingly peaceful. You would hardly know you were in the heart of busy Marrakech when you stroll through these peaceful pretty gardens.
Plenty shaded seating, well maintained!
Would have given 5 stars were it not for some guys selling tat openly 'peeing' in full view of women and children.
Colorful garden. The Majorelle Garden is a beautiful and interesting garden to visit in Marrakesh. Don't miss the Berber Museum as you exit, it's fabulous.

An oasis in the desert. The garden is beautiful and lush and very well designed. The temperature is quite a bit lower when you get into the garden so it is a nice place to cool off and take a breath of fresh air in the middle of bustling Marrakech. The colors (of the flowers and the structures) are so vibrant and interesting. I would say that this is a must-see in Marrakech.
Small but perfectly formed. Your trip here won't take long, the gardens are smaller than I'd expected but they are quite exquisite.

very busy even in the low season. the best thinkg, for ma, as i have been to the gardens before, was the new berber museum and the cafe. the museum is really well done and gives you great info into a culture which is commercialized for tourists at the Djemna el Fnaa.

Majorelle Gardens. Great for YSL fans as this garden was destroyed and Yves Saint Laurent redesigned it. In the new city and 50dhs entrance fee makes it pretty cheap. Will take around 40 mins to see the gardens. Have to pay a bit extra to visit the museum inside.
Idyllic Gardens. Little oasis of calm in a bustling city. Very peaceful and green compared to the dusty roads outside
Nice but not outstanding. I liked best the Museum. It is a nice garden but had heard it was outstanding. Not so well kept- The Berbere museum is small but beautiful-

Gorgeous Exotic Garden. The collection of cactus as well as bamboo is amazing. The garden is exotic and relaxing. A treat to see. A lot of shade and an easy place to spend 1-2 hours relaxing and admiring the collection of plants.
A little paradise. Well worth a visit. It's so peacefull and colourful, it's a lovely escape from the heat of the mid-day sun.
tranquil. relaxing and even though it is in the middle of the city you feel that you are in an oasis.
Not sure what all the fuss is about. We thought these gardens were fine but didn't see what all the fuss was about.

Very pretty garden. This was the first thing we did when we got to marrakech, it was lovely walking around the gardens which are very well maintained. It also has the tomb of yves saint laurent. I would say this is a good place to go first thing in the morning before it gets to busy, its also a welcome break from the hustle of the markets.

Oasis. I know the word oasis is overused when describing things you liked in marrakech but this really was an excellent attraction- our favorite. Get a cab/horse and cart there from the medina for about 40dh. Beautiful gardens- loads of exotic plants- very relaxing to walk around/ sit. The museum is also well worth a visit (its air conditioned!!) Its also really interesting and has english guides to read (rare in marrakech) and nice exhibits.

Beautiful. As expected, beautiful gardens,wonderful colours and worth the visit. Do pay for the museum - one of the best bits with fabulous antiquities from old Morocco and lots of interesting history - and a surprise at the end! Go early or late in the day to avoid the tourist coach loads!
nice visit. Lovely gardens if a bit small, didn't take long to get round. Had a nice cafe with reasonably priced food and drink. Very welcome after walking from the Sofitel! £4 each to get in
lovely gardens. The gardens were nicely shaded and very well laid out. Perfect to cool off a little and relax
Stunning. Beautiful gardens, and the blue......... A heavenly place for a proposal; and she said yes!

stunning garden but main attraction ysl colours. This is a fab garden to visit with lots of shade not much peace and quiet as it gets very busy. YSL colours and structures were beautiful to see in person, wont take you long to wander around but worth a visit.
A must Visit. beautiful & tranquil gardens with a lovely museum well worth a visit

Amazing cactuses!. A bit pricey to get in relative to other attractions (50D) but if you don't live in Arizona, you'll enjoy the most amazing collection of enormous cactuses in the garden. The garden also has the largest Ponytail palm I've ever seen. A good excuse to leave the medina. We went by horse and trap which was a pleasant way to find our way there.
oasis of beauty. Tranquil place beautiful asortment of plants/cacti etc.It would have been nice to have been able sit with a drink in the grounds.

Ok. Its not very big, like its pretty much the size of a large back garden. If you love plants go see it, and the Yves Sans Laurent paintings are interesting but not as good as I expected overall, kept looking for the rest of it
Simply beautiful, a must. Simply beautiful, a must, colors, house, gardens, we liked everything
A green oasis. The garden is well worth a visit. It has a superb collection of drought resistant plants in a well designed and beautifully kept setting.

Gorgeous Gardens - Blue never looked better. In a rather non descript part of town one enters a gate and is suddenly entering a stunning, dreamy, watery landscape. magnificent planting, fab colours, and you must try the majorelle juice!
Pay the extra and see the museum. Whilst the gardens are beautiful the museum within the grounds is outstanding. Make sure you don't miss it.
Peaceful. Nice, peaceful but expensive. A lot of guides waiting for you ouside.
Worth a visit. Mosr expensive tourist site in Marrakech but a must see. Beautiful.
Different. 50DH and then an extra 25DH for the museum feels a little pricey but well worth a visit
A good trip, but busy and expensive. Great to get out the old town and see the new part of the city. The garden is beautiful, but wouldn't recommend the museum as it's nothing to do with YSL.

Visit the Berber Museum. The garden was very nice, but really was nothing unique, beyond being a nice, medium-sized botanical garden, comperable to what you'd expect to find in most major cities. It was, however, a nice respite from the heat and mayhem of the medina. I've heard that going early allows you to avoid the crowds. We went around 11 am, and it was fairly busy.A major highlight for us was visiting the attached Berber museum. Definitely worth the extra entrance fee. I thought the displayed jewelry was incredible. We had already visited some of the Berber regions of Morocco, so seeing the exhibits helped us put context to our experiences.In summary: gardens = ok, museum = excellent.
Great Spot. Nice garden with collection of plants from around the world and the house/memorial for Yves Saint Laurent. Amazing Berber museum, you have to visit!!!!

Dont spent more than 30 minutes. Mojorelle gardens are know as its historical tails there is a pool and fruit trees in the garden. Its used to be a romantic place for kings with his "cariye" ( lovers )
an oasis of calm. wonderful vibrant gardens.exquisite colours and shapes.also within the gardens is the berber museum which has undergone a transformation and is truly stunning
Great value. Beautiful, good value for money, relaxing away from the chaos of downtown Marrakech.
An inviting oasis on a hot day.. These gardens are well worth a visit. Amazing what a dry, arid climate can produce. Very well laid out and the cafe is there for a cool drink when needed.
Nothing extraordinary. Beautiful garden and worth a visit if you're into greenery. Also it's history makes it more interesting. However it's not fantastic in my eyes, nor particularly big.
Beautiful garden in a desert landscape!. Great place to enjoy the shade and calm. Only about 4 quid (50 dirums)
beautifull garden. A beautifull garden for an afternoon walk, to cool, calm and admire.

One of the places to visit in Marrakech. Full on garden lovers might be a little let down by the experience, but none the less, with it's interesting history Majorelle is one of the not to be missed destinations in Marrakech. On a hot day it's shade offers an agreeable break from the heat, frenzy and dust. Don't take a tripod for photographing, it won't be allowed and there's no where to store it.
tranquil!. very lovely tranquil gardens, a must see if going to Marrakesh!
Yves St Laurent's garden. a tranquil and beautifully laid out garden in tribute to Yves st Laurent whol lived in Marrakech. Definitely worth a visit. The cafe offered unusual teas and juices.
Stunning. A definite not to be missed attraction. Stunningly tranquil. The food in the cafe may seem a little pricey but it is worth every penny
Nice gardens. A nice way to spend half a day. Get there early to avoid the crowds, and chill out in a cool area of the garden.

Interesting attraction.. A sence of senerity, comfort you sense once you step in, the garden used to be owned by Yve saint Laurent,- his memorial is actually there- we spent around 1 hr strolling around, would highly recommend it.

MAJORELL GARDEN. Everthing in the garden in well kept and presented. The garden is not too large and prob not somewhere you would spend the whole day so you may want to combine it with other sightseeing events.You pay extra if you want to see the museum. Is is small and very good if you like the history of costume in this particular part of the world.
A oasis of calm. One of my favourite places to visit in Marrackech, wonderfully calming gardens and the superb Berber Musuem. Cafe is pricey but lovely food and juices.

A blissful hour away from the craziness........ Marrakech is a busy and bustling city but if you visit the Majorelle Gardens you can get away from this for an hour and just chill and for less than 5euros! They're not very big but there are some lovely and unusual plants (especially the giant cacti) and they're a must-visit in Marrakech! Recommended!

Beautiful. The gardens are small and you will only need up to an hour to explore and take photographs, but are a must see when in Marrakech. It was quite busy when we visited even in the morning - but this is to be expected in the Summer season. Everything about the garden is beautiful, the vast collection of plants displayed amongst the stunning blue walls and yellow pots. Expect crowding around the Yves Saint laurent memorial in the hunt for photographs. The cafe was very overpriced - Head outside instead and there is a lovely ice cream shop! Taxi's and Caleche available directly outside.

Tranquil and beautiful. This is a beautiful garden and it is lovely to find somewhere to get out of the hot sun and enjoy some peace and quite.The gardens are an abundance of different plants representing five continents. There is a lovely cafe where you can enjoy lunch orjust partake of mint tea in this lovely setting.j
The bueaty of the garden. The garden was great the layout was beautful the aray of plants was great the lilly pond was beautful. And a very quit place to be.

Majorelle garden. Easy to find although a little on the pricey side, it was well worth visiting. We found the museum very interesting and despite its relative small size, its was full of great displays
Beautiful gardens. Definitely worth a visit, the gardens are very well laid out and kept, it's a picturesque oasis in the hustle and bustle of bustle of Marrakech with a fascinating history.

Gorgeous Gardens. The Jardin Majorelle were some of the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen. Varied plants, amazing colors, and a yummy cafe. Well worth the time to visit. It is not very large, so an hour is plenty of time to see everything and take photos.
Interesting Gardens. These gardens are well worth a visit. Go early in the morning to avoid the heat and the crowds. The cafe was pleasant to sit in but overexpensive.

A good place to escape from the Summer heat. You could return to your hotel by horse and trap. Quite small but atmospheric. Insect repellant is a good idea- it was the only place where we were bitten.
Tranquil and colourful. Have a Moroccon whisky in the tea garden and enjoy the small rooms around the tea garden. Visit the museum as well it is worth it.
Peaceful garden of YSL. Garden very peaceful, lots of water features and quiet shady places to sit.

French elegance in Marrakesh. I didn't know about this place, which came as a surprise tour organisd by our private guide. I did not expect anything and found a beautiful garden, water and green, as well as the living spirits of YSL and friends... There, I understood what Marrakesh is about. There, I decided that one day, I would buy a riad in that city... Go there and let your dreams guide you!

Oasis of colour, tranquility and freshness. In total contrast with the city le jardin Majorelle is a must see. Vivid colours, well preseved gardens almost like a spa. A nice clean cafe tops up the good surprise.

Hard to find but a quiet oasis. This is not an easy place to find, get directions from previous visitors if you can. It's pricey to get into but once there you'll find it's cool, and quiet and the cafe is lovely.
Fab must see highlight of Marrakesh. Peaceful and relaxing - simply beautiful gardens with a great cafe and interesting museum
a haven of tranquility. Very interesting gardens - the cactii were amazing! Cafe was a bit pricey.
Lovely garden. Beautiful garden; refreshing after the heat of the streets.
A true oasis. A true oasis in the unrelenting heat in marrakech! If u hv time, try out the cafe, which serves ice cream in local flavours.
Excellent garden. Very beautiful and tranquil, an oasis of peace. Definitely worth visiting. The café is a little expensive.

Quirky and worthwhile...don't miss the Berber museum. The cactus gardens are spectacular and the garden easily explored in less than a hour. The little Berber museum is quite charming and creative...imaginatively presented.
Nice. It's a nice garden, nothing to wright home about, but the little museum inside is beautiful.

A must see. It is absolutely stunning there. The colours, the trees...it's just too beautiful to describe. The museum is also very good. It has been very inspiring for me. I would recommend it to ANYONE!
Gorgeous place. Nice place to walk around and take tons of pictures.
Worthwhile if you want a break. These gardens are a bit small but still an interesting change of pace if you want to do something different.

Not to be missed Garden. Yves Saint Laurent's garden in Marrakech is beautifully restored - great plantings - impeccable style. Relax and enjoy youreelf.....don't rush through. The restuarant is wonderful as well.
A heavenly place. This is a lovely garden inside Marrakech that worth a visit. Don't forget to see the Ives Saint Lorent memorial.
See It Early Morning. Best to get there early morniong before the crowds. It something out of the past. Nothing like it anywhere.
Peaceful. Beutiful gardens... very tranquille. Definately worth a visit.

Lovely but pricey. The gardens are lovely and beautifully maintained, however it was costly. I went with my friends and perhaps if I had brought my husband it would have been a lovely place to spend a romantic hour, but as I'm not much into horticulture we breezed through this place fairly quickly. I was surprised that many of the plants were not native to Africa, it was a long way to visit a cactus easily found in America! Overall, interesting but maybe not worth it.

An oasis in Marrakech. The famous Yves Saint Laurent's house in Marrakech, now is a memorial open to the public. The house has beautiful gardens, and is a relaxing place, all in royal blue. The restaurant is an excelent place for lunch. The sandwich with anchovies and the ananas and ginger juice are really delicious. And there's water spray to refresh the place from time to time!
Worth the visit, but costly. An beautiful and scrupulously maintained garden, but very expensive!!!
Relaxing garden. The garden is very relaxing even if you just sit under the trees. A total break from the Medina. The gift shop but pricey.
Just beautiful. It was much better than expected and you could see the attention to detail and love that had gone into this oasis
Majorelle Garden. Just a walk round a man made square pond that had some big fish in it.
Fab must see highlight of Marrakesh. Peaceful and relaxing - simply beautiful gardens with a great cafe and interesting museum
a haven of tranquility. Very interesting gardens - the cactii were amazing! Cafe was a bit pricey.
Lovely garden. Beautiful garden; refreshing after the heat of the streets.
A true oasis. A true oasis in the unrelenting heat in marrakech! If u hv time, try out the cafe, which serves ice cream in local flavours.
Excellent garden. Very beautiful and tranquil, an oasis of peace. Definitely worth visiting. The café is a little expensive.

Quirky and worthwhile...don't miss the Berber museum. The cactus gardens are spectacular and the garden easily explored in less than a hour. The little Berber museum is quite charming and creative...imaginatively presented.
Nice. It's a nice garden, nothing to wright home about, but the little museum inside is beautiful.

A must see. It is absolutely stunning there. The colours, the trees...it's just too beautiful to describe. The museum is also very good. It has been very inspiring for me. I would recommend it to ANYONE!
Gorgeous place. Nice place to walk around and take tons of pictures.
Worthwhile if you want a break. These gardens are a bit small but still an interesting change of pace if you want to do something different.

Not to be missed Garden. Yves Saint Laurent's garden in Marrakech is beautifully restored - great plantings - impeccable style. Relax and enjoy youreelf.....don't rush through. The restuarant is wonderful as well.
A heavenly place. This is a lovely garden inside Marrakech that worth a visit. Don't forget to see the Ives Saint Lorent memorial.
See It Early Morning. Best to get there early morniong before the crowds. It something out of the past. Nothing like it anywhere.
Peaceful. Beutiful gardens... very tranquille. Definately worth a visit.

Lovely but pricey. The gardens are lovely and beautifully maintained, however it was costly. I went with my friends and perhaps if I had brought my husband it would have been a lovely place to spend a romantic hour, but as I'm not much into horticulture we breezed through this place fairly quickly. I was surprised that many of the plants were not native to Africa, it was a long way to visit a cactus easily found in America! Overall, interesting but maybe not worth it.

An oasis in Marrakech. The famous Yves Saint Laurent's house in Marrakech, now is a memorial open to the public. The house has beautiful gardens, and is a relaxing place, all in royal blue. The restaurant is an excelent place for lunch. The sandwich with anchovies and the ananas and ginger juice are really delicious. And there's water spray to refresh the place from time to time!
Worth the visit, but costly. An beautiful and scrupulously maintained garden, but very expensive!!!
Relaxing garden. The garden is very relaxing even if you just sit under the trees. A total break from the Medina. The gift shop but pricey.
Just beautiful. It was much better than expected and you could see the attention to detail and love that had gone into this oasis
Majorelle Garden. Just a walk round a man made square pond that had some big fish in it.

Go but read about it first.. The gardens are very peaceful and cool , but there is little information about them when you go. Unfortunately someone has decided to add to alternate the yellow and blue pots with a black wicker basket for rubbish, and this does rather spoil the original creation. Haveing said that it is a lovely way to spend an hour.

Majorelle Garden. Beautiful gardens as you would expect having been renovated and re-decorated by Yves Saint Laurent. The colours are exquisite and the use of the plantings perfect to encourage a cool oasis in an otherwise barren terrain. The garden cafe served excellent fresh food in a lovely environment and it is well worth visiting over lunch to take advantage of this.

Paradise garden in Marrakech. Absolutely beautiful cactus garden, perfect place to relax after walking through the bustling streets of Marrakech. Also highly recommend the coffee shop for lunch. Its got a nice courtyard with tables outside, we had a lovely salad and club sandwich there before venturing back into the city.
very nice garden. one of the place you should go when visiting marrakesh
Tranquility amidst the bustle!. Beautiful gardens, great photo opportunity and extremely peaceful!
i want this garden!!. they had great colors, great plants and we took lots of pictures

A little gem. Worth the trip out to the new part of Marrakech to see these gardens. Really well cared for. Can feel a bit crowded as it is quite a small site so worth visiting first or last thing in the day to beat the crowds. The small museum in the middle is really worth a view as well, it has lots about the Berber way of life. The cafe is very cute and cooled by water spray so I recommend a sit down with a mint tea there if you fancy a break!
Beautiful. Very beautiful but go early to avoid crowds,the cafe is great for brunch.

idyllic garden. Nice to escape from the busy medina but I recommend going early or late afternoon to beat the queues. The Yves Saint Laurent posters on display were wonderful and the shop with postcards was good. Gift shop had such lovely things, but very pricey.
A welcome oasis. Worth a visit, even just to cool down below the trees
Superb Gardens. This is a truly astonishing garden - unlike any garden you will ever see again. The use of plants and colours so agreeable and relaxing.

Peace and Quiet. Lovely gardens providing a welcome break from the hustle and bustle and the midday sun and a very nice little cafe in which to relax.
Don't miss out on the Meuseum, which gives a great insight to the history of the Berbers.

Thanks, Yves St. Laurent!. These beautifully restored gardens, thanks to Yves St. Laurent and his partner, were donated to the city of Marrakesh as a gift for public use. It's a little bit of real peace and beauty in a crazy city.
Cool and peaceful. A nice, get-away from the madness of el Jamaa el Fna. Cool, peaceful, with a love.y cafe and a surpringly interesting Berber museum
art in nature. A beautiful garden and house built by the artist Jacques Majorelle - vivid primary colors and a fantastic array of plantings.
An oasis in the middle of town. Beautifully tended plants and great YSL Moroccon collection....

Beautiful immaculate peaceful gardens.. Definitely well worth a visit. These gardens were immaculate. Extremely peaceful and very tasteful. We enjoyed visiting the shop and the little cafe. A must do whilst in Marrakech

YSL's garden design- blue blue blue. Too many other tourists ruined it for me. The museum was not worth it, just to see a couple of dresses.
It was a picture taking occasion

A haven from the fanetic hassling of Marrakesh Street life. But it's had it's day. Maybe I'm spoilt and seen and been to to many other places but I wasn't thrilled. It all seemed a bit dated - the high contrast colours looked out of keeping. The planting and variety of shape and form as charming but lacked the WOW factor I'm afraid.
Good but not big. I was surprised at how small this was. Better to arrive early to avoid the bus tour groups
little paradis. Once in Marrakesh, it is very worth to visit these gardens. It appears to be a small paradise of plants and colours after disorder (or a bit strange order!) of souks.

Oasis, with Yves St Laurent graphics an unexpected extra. This is a delightful and beautifully laid-out exotic garden. The attached museum is informative and full of fascinating and carefully described artefacts - not to be missed

Lovely to See. In addition to the beautiful plantings, the highlight for us was the Berber Museum at a small additional cost. What a gem! Don't miss the video at the entrance which is very well done. The starlit room is truly memorable.
Majorelle Blue. One man's dream garden that is just fascinating. Never seen a garden like it and that colour blue is unique to Jacque Majorelle.
lovely oasis in a busy town. a relaxing chill out place. nice cafe too. Lots of good information and very clean and tiny.

Such a pretty place - Tranquil and quiet. I wasn't pleased that a member of the cafe team tried to send us to "His friends restaurant where they do lots of western food" - As young travellers, people shouted and tried to sell to us enough. We came to the Jardin to escape that. Not the end of the world :) The Jardin Majorelle is stunning. It's a photographers paradise. Cacti up to 10ft tall and a memorial for Yves Saint Laurent which was very nice. There's not an awful lot to say about it - It's a very beautiful place but you won't be there long as it's not very big. 50dhm entry is more than reasonable.
Blissful peace amid the city bustle. Beautiful gardens in the middle of the hustle and bustle of a major city.
Small gerden. Peaceful. Beauty & art. Nice escape after the hustle of the city.Don’t miss the Berber museum. Worth a visit.
Just wonderful. Thanks to Yves Saint Laurent ! These gardens have been restored and preserved for all to enjoy. The Museum too is very good.
Stunning. Beautiful gardens, welcome relief from the sun with all the plants and cactuses too!

Serentity in a bustling city. These gardens were beautiful and even a little bit historic with the memorial for Yves Saint Laurent. A little bit of calm in an otherwise busy and bustling city. Only need an hour here tops.

Eden in Marrakech. Gasp-worthy gardens restored by Yves St. Laurent. The Berber museum is also a must. And the gift store is one of the best-curated shops in town for fun Moroccan clothing, jewelry and home decor.
Peace and colour. Not too many plants aside from palms and succulents but beautiful vibrant colours and shapes
Peaceful!. Nice to see how peacefull and refreshing the garden is in the middle of suh a chaotic and warm city!!!!

Beautiful gardens. You must visit these gardens when you're in Marrakech. An amazing mix of plants from all over the world hidden away behind high walls, you wouldn't know you were in busy Marrakech. There is also a lovely shop and cafe to help you while away the hours. A true oasis.

beautiful but... So full of european tourists you wonder if you are really in Morroco and this makes it a bit bland. However, I have some amazing photographs of my daughter against the blue.

Nice, but overrated. Couldnt skip because of all the hpe around it, but its actually overrated. Very nice, but small. More expensive than the other state museums. A lot of people. Nt easy to take a picture withoutother travellers rushing to take the same picture. lol this is what we did, from the jemma, we dealt 80 dirham for the taxi to take us to the jardin majorelle, wait for us there, and when we got out, he took us to gueliz for shopping, he dropped us at rue de la liberté. Personally, i wouldnt get out of jemma just for the jardin majorelle.
Very worthwhile. Not what we expected - mostly cactii but brilliantly displayed and wonderfully kept.The cafe is also very good.

A pretty little oasis in the middle of the madness. No a massive attraction in terms of size, but quite a lot packed into a fairly small space, and not very expensive to get in. Very interesting to see YSL's personality stamped on this place, and a fascinating little museum too that is well worth a visit while you are there. Would go again in the unlikely event that I found myself in Marrakech again.

Disaster. So small that 15 minutes is more then enough, expensive, guards are everywhere forbidding you to do anything!?! There are few benches, but if you sit on them instead of nice plants you will see lots of tourists...

beautiful garden. I have been to this garden many times. I just love it. It is well designed and well kept. In the middle of the city yet once you are inside it is so quiet and serene. It costs about 40 dirhams if I am not mistaken but very well worth it. They have a coffee shop inside a bit pricey but worth the price. The ideal place to just sit and sip your orange juice and read a book.

Yves St. Laurent had it right. Get here early to avoid the crowds. I think the gardens open at 08:00. Arrive by 08:30 at the latest. There is a beautiful gift shop. Having tea in the cafe is also a treat.

Mind blowing garden. Apart from the design and layout as a magnificent garden, it is quite unexpected in a North African City. Particularly poignant is Yves St Laurent's memorial. Go in the morning before it gets crowded but don't miss it even if you are not a great garden fan.
Beautiful. This is a must for all visitors, its very beautiful and is a lovely tribute to Yves Saint Laurent
Cool Oasis on a Hot Day. Lovely colours, lovely relaxed atmosphere and loved the Berber Museum

A nice escape. Beautiful colors, relaxing place, and a cool ambiance (which is indeed needed when it's 42 out there)Not too big though, so complete it with some drinks/hanging out in the neighbourhood.
Lovely. Such an amazing garden with lovely flowers & colors. The best time to visit is in spring.

Enjoyable but not Outstanding. A quite nice garden to visit. There's not that much there to be honest, its main fame is due to St Laurent buying it and having his ashes scattered there. But it's a pretty and shaded place to visit with lots of bamboo and cacti. Kew gardens it's not however. It does have a pretty cafe to sit in and eat where we had a very surprisingly good quality breakfast. Worth an hour if you like gardens and tranquility although beware the coach party hordes which make it decidely less tranquil.
Interesting. Littered with exotic plants his was well worth the shot trip, with a small coffee shop to while away some time.
Stunning oasis. Deep green shade with lovely primary colors in the benches, pots, and the house.
Outstanding Oasis. A variety of unusual plants plus Yves St. Laurant art installation.
An oasis. Visit the garden when the weather is hot. It is an oasis of peace. A visit of the new museum Berbère inside the garden is worth it.

Beautiful and peacefull. Nice garden, with its typical blue everywhere.As we were told, you should do it in the morning, for its quietness.
The museum you can find in the middle of the garden really worth it (it's brand new!).And with beautiful drawings from yves saint laurent (this was actually is place!).
An absolute haven in a bustling city. Brilliant! Been there before, but always enjoy going back to this little paradise in busling Marrakech.

Take your time, relax, and it's worth it.. Can I just point out regarding some of the negative reviews, you can visit anywhere in the world, walk round as fast as you like and leave disappointed. That's not the idea here. I went fairly early so it was less busy, took a book with me, had a wander took some photos found a nice spot to read for a while. Felt very relaxed, before getting back into hustle and bustle of Marrakesh.

Not worth the 50 dirham entry. Just another garden , small at that , overrun with tour groups. It takes about 15 minutes to stroll through the entire garden , and the entrance fee has jumped from the 20 dirham in our 2010 guidebook to 50 dirhams. Pretty but definately not worth that price.
decent 2 hours spent. lovely garden, try and avoid busy times and it will be 100% better

Was expecting more. We took a taxi ride to the garden of YSL early one morning, arriving at 9.30am and it was already very busy. I guess I was expecting more in memory of an icon rather than just an obelisk and we had walked around the garden in a little under 20 minutes. Yes, the vivid blue walls are lovely for a photocall but the coloured terracotta pots are just pots.

secret garden within a busy city. After having afew days wandering the atlas mountains or in the souks, this paradise is worth going to just for a little bit of quiet and tranquility. The colours of the house and fountains are stunning and the variety of plants are astounding. Worth a visit, there is also a little cafe within Jardine Majorelle.

Beautiful, relaxing couple of hours to while away. Part of a half day trip, we were taken to the Majorelle Garden. Before we went, were in 2 minds whether to bother as not really into this type of visit, but surprised to find such a lovely spot and worth it.
Cool haven vibrantly coloured. Great place to spend an hour away from the heat of the city. Gets very busy but worth a visit. Plants are amazing.

bit of an oasis amidst the bustle. Pleasant gardens to while away Couple of hours. We talked from old town and took carriage ride back. .... got dropped off at different location to where we asked. ....

Oasis of calm. The garden was much smaller than I have thought but it is really very beautiful, calm and tidy. The plants were quite impressive especially the cactus. It is something different in Marrakech especially when your hotel is located in the loud medina.
We have reached the garden with the horse carriage and it was not expensive.
Really worth seeing as part of a trip. Very tidy and well laid out gardens. Not large but "intense. Take a camera.

A Welcome Retreat. I must admit I'm not big into spending time meandering about public gardens, but this is a must see. Do it on a sweltering Marrakech day (there are many) and you will find this Eden like retreat. Go a bit later in the day when crowds are gone.
peace and quiet. Well cared for ,but get ther early to miss the crowdes,museum and cafe worth a visit
Majorelle Gardens. Amazing cacti and other various plants. A little sea of calm. The YSL tribute was a little disappointing though.
green and shady. In a heatwave, this was a calm, green, shady oasis.
Highlight of our trip. These gardens, once a home of Yves Saint Laurent are smiply stunning. Colour and light. Take the open top bus and you will also see the Palmery - great value.

A Treat to The Senses. Our visit to Le Jardin Majorelle was an oasis far from the craziness of the Medina and city of Marrakech. It is here where YSL asked for his ashes to be scattered after his death. Walking into the garden, there is a sense of tranquility and colour that is very welcoming. The garden was originally a private garden owned by Jacques Majorelle, a French painter who took residence in Marrakech. He selected plants from all parts of the world and created an artistic palate that he shared when he opened the garden to the public in 1947. Yves Saint Laurent and Pierre Bergé were friends with Jacques Majorelle while they were living in Marrakech. When Jacque Majorelle died in a car accident, YSL and Pierre Bergé purchased the garden and restored the property to ensure its continuing existence. Within the garden, there is Musée Berbère. The museum is housed in the former painting studio of Jacques Majorelle. The exhibits are of the various indigenous tribes of Northern Africa (from the Rif Mountains to the Sahara desert). The displays were beautifully and professionally presented – a real treat to the visual senses. They provide insight into how these tribes influenced and continue to influence Moroccan culture. The museum is an extra cost to the overall price of visiting the gardens but well worth the price. There is a fabulous display of Berber jewellery (you can see YSL and Pierre Berge’s influence most prominently here – first class all the way) – this was my favourite part of the museum. It’s a shame to miss this museum as it does complete the visit of Le Jardin Majorelle. I would definitely recommend a visit to this lovely oasis in the middle of Marrakech.
Nice but just nice. Nice gardens but nothing special. Quite small and very busy.

Lovely tribute to Yves St. Laurent. The gardenia are wonderful. Mostly cactus, euphorbia and succulents. The very exotic species and creatve groupings make for a visual treat.There is a memorial there for Yves Saint Laurent. He must have enjoyed the serenity of the gardens, particularly in contrast to his otherwise frenetic life.Don't expect a major over the top "punch" The emphasis of this site is one of serenity.

Beautiful, but nothing to rave about. We visited the Jardin Mjorelle in the morning before it got too hot. Best time to go I felt. We were told that this was a must see in Marrakech and that it was well worth a visit. It was nice and it was pretty but I won't rave about it. There were plenty of diiferent kinds of plants there and it was a great place to practice our photography skills, which was a bonus. You only need about an hour to visit.
Don't miss. It's extraordinary and very beautiful. It was packed though - go early, we didn't! The cafe is wonderful but insanely expensive.
Beautiful. It was very beautiful and peaceful here! Worth a visit

Beautiful and tranquil. We must have picked a quiet time, which was a bonus, and hence the tranquility. The downside was the loos.It was lovely to visit an inspirational site, and I could understand why YSL chose to get involved.
Fabulous. Cool oasis on a very hot day. The gardens are beautiful and maintained so well. A very peaceful place to be in manic Marrakech
quite oasis in the city. Unusual colors, not only the pots and walls, but also the plants. Little too expensive though

A place to realx and enjoy a breeze. Majorelle gaordens are a relaxing place for people who want to get away from the heat and hustle bustle of the medina. It is an interesting place to enjoy the colours and the botanical plants that Jack Majorelle and Yve -Saint Leaurant achieved.
Garden Well Worth a Visit. Extraordinary collection of cackti and other desert plants, also an int eresting Berber museum.

wonderful. For taking a break from all he crowdy ten this is a nice place to hang over. Little but beautiful. A little bit overdone whit he colors bleu andere yellow but he plants andere flowers, beautiful

Peaceful oasis in Marrakech. Spent a beautiful afternoon strolling through the Majorelle Garden, which is full of botanical specimens from around the world and beautiful fountains. A feast for the senses.
fantastic secret garden. well worth a visit. The cafe is expensive but very nice
Beautiful gardens. Really beautiful landscaped gardens - excellent for taking good holiday snaps!
Very pretty, very detailed, very crowded. The books say go early and I agree. Way too many people for what should be a calm and relaxing visit. Beautiful place!
find this over rated. really i think over rated ..and i have only been oce to visit about 6 six years ago ..the shop opposite with modern cafe is more interesting

The extremely beautiful Majorelle Gardens. We arrived at 9am just as the gardens opened and were the first people through the gates so we managed to get some fantastic shots without people pollution!! The colours are fantastic, and it is surprisingly quiet once inside. There is a café/restaurant and a museum you can visit once inside. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful tranquil place. If you go early, ie before 10.00 am to avoid coach tours, this s a lovely place full of beautiful shrubs and plabnts aprticularly bamboo. Superbly kept - it was restored by Yves St Laurent in 1960s and his ashes were apparently scattered here when he died in 2008 (?).

Colourfull. The gardens were further than expected, but it is walkable from the main square about 15/20 mins. but once there they are magical not what we expected at all. very colourful but try and be early as once some of the main tour parties arrive it can be difficult to appreciate it all
Great Place to be. You must visit to know what I am talking about, very great space full of greens and flowers, too good to see such place
beautiful. stunning and tranquil, a beautiful oasis. try to visit early in the day before it gets too busy

Strikingly beautiful garden. In a suburban area of Marrakech this magnificent garden offers an amazing array of trees, shrubs and cacti, bright blue buildings, water features and a new museum of Berber artefacts. Once owned by Yves St Laurent and his partner
bring a camera. Nice to take pictures of vibrant colors, great gift shop. Not very grand as gardens go but worth stopping here. Check out great artisan cooperative store right across the street.

Come only if you are fan of YSL and cacti.. No doubt this is an oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. It is cooler with the plants around you But it does not offer the tranquility one may expect with tourists in the throng. Yes there are many species of cacti here, an a memorial of YSL, but the entrance fee of 50 MAD is overpriced.Give this a miss unless you are a fan of YSL and cacti
Always a stop on every visit. The most lovely and serene garden. Visit the concept store across the street.

Well worth a visit. A new Berber museum in 2012. I always make a point of spending a couple of hours at the Jardin Majorelle when I visit Marrakech. The bright colours are stunning and always make me smile.There are some of the most amazing cactuses I have ever seen, some from South America and some local. Many of them are huge. The gardens are not huge, but are packed with interesting features including pools with terrapins and goldfish, coloured pots, the Yves St Laurant memorial. There is also a nice cafe.They have just opened a new Berber museum in 2012 within the grounds (entry 25DH). The exhibits are very well presented and include costumes, cooking pots, jewellery and some interesting videos and pictures.Over all it's a great place to spend a couple of hours, and there are some nice restaurants opposite the gardens to complete the visit.
Beautiful escape from noise of city life. Bamboo, Cactus, water elements, and a lovely shop.. It was a refreshing break from the buildings and busy-ness of the tour.
Stunning. A little more expensive than other attractions in Marrakech but well worth it. These gardens are BEAUTIFUL.
Beautiful place. A beautiful place. Can be a bit crowded. Nice cafe inside with good food.

Loved it.. I loved this garden, so very different from all the noise and chaos outside its wall. It is a place of tranquility. Lots of cacti and bamboo, bright blue paint (to be expected really!!) and water.
A spectacular experience. Around Morocco Travels is a brilliant company for trips with amazing tour guides. These gardens were absolutely superb well worth a visit!
Oasis. Very beautiful, tranquil gardens, perfect peace away form the medina bustle. Have some mint tea in the lovely little cafe.
Majorelle - beautiful. Le Jardin Majorelle is a beutifull oasis where you can have some rest and admire the explosion of colours and great plants and flowers.We spend there fantastis time
Lovely. An Oasis of calm. Beautiful, cool and peaceful. Very popular though worth a visit.

Beautiful Blue. Bamboo, flowering Cacti of many varieties, Bougainvillea in full bloom a fusion of red, orange, yellow, pink, white - stunning. May has to be the perfect time to visit! The tranquil water features including a lily pond, a fish pond and many pots and walls painted in cobalt blue with contrasting yellow. A must visit garden.
Beautiful. Great way to spend a few hours. Try to go before or after the rush of tourists (4pm onward is best). Colours are fantastic, make sure you have a good camera! Maybe take a book?

Gorgeous gardens. A must see attraction in Marrakech. Take a horse drawn carriage to the gardens and spend some time exploring and enjoying the gardens. The gardens are lovely. Jardin Majorelle was a bit crowded when we visited in April 2012. We had lunch in the cafe which was not fantastic in terms of food, but the setting was lovely.

Lovely oasis of calm. A nice little trip away from the chaos of the city, the gardens are lovely but their small scale means you will never have the place to yourself! Book a ticket that includes the museum - its fabulous. We had a good lunch in the cafe too.

if you see only one garden in Marrakech go to this one.. 50 dirhams entrance (25 extra for museum). a bit overcrowded with tourists but maybe less in the morning. we went a bit late. good photos to be taken here. also try the ice-cream in the cafe - passion fruit and orange blossom were fantastic :-)

So peaceful. Very very beautiful and so different to anythng else we vistited, is a must for anyone visiting Marrakech. As it is a dry dusty city this is a welcome change - cool and fresh. Please don't skip this.

A little out of the way. See other sights first.. Not sure what all the hubbub is about. Kind of ordinary gardens with a memorial to YSL. I'd see all the sights in the Medina before going to Jardin Majorelle. If you have time go, but see everything else first.

Worth a second visit. I visited Marrakech for the second time in March, 2012. I had been to the Majorelle Gardens before in October of previous year but I had rushed through the gardens that first time so this time, I took my time and enjoyed the gardens with a different frame of mind and found it even more engaging and captivating as I concentrated on the surroundings, the textures and the colours. I even noticed this time the "architecture" of the plants and had a great time photographing them. I especially enjoyed looking at the stark vibrant blue of the buildings that you don't find anywhere else in Marrakech. For 50 dirhams I experienced again the Matisse-like painting in living colour! Spend some quality time here!
pretty garden. A pretty garden and a nice escape from the city, but not a must-see if your trip is short.

Fabulous Gardens Well worth a visit. We thoroughly enjoyed these gardens last week in Marrakech. A quiet tranquil haven away from all the noise and hustle and bustle of the city. 50 Din. each which is about £4. Lovely little cafe and shop, though quite expensive.
wonderful!. We visited these gardens in a few hours, but they were lovely, shaded and a cool tranquil escape from the crazy outside world.

Wonderful and now with Fantastic Berber museum too.. A beautiful and unexpected garden where majorelle blue is the dominant colour. Nice cafein lovely setting but pricey. The Berber museum set in grounds is well worth the trip.
Yves St Laurents garden. a lovely place to visit but a bit out of town and very crowded. It seemed to be something of a pilgrimage for French people.
Worth a visit. Beautiful garden but quite small. Entrance fee was 50 Dirhams per person. Worth a visit.
Gardens. Beautiful plants and colour schemes - lovely relaxing coffee shop
The YSL garden. We enjoyed the garden very much. it had a cool 80:ies touch. In addition was there a very nice giftshop with some very nice items for the home.

Don't miss the Berber museum. The garden is of course a must if you are into that kind of thing. Make sure you don't miss the Berber museum while you is here. Especially interesting if you have been up in the Atlas mountains, but well worth a visit anyhow.
~Stunning gardesn. These gardens are well worth a visit as is the Berber Museum there too. We enjoyed lunch in the Cafe there in very relaxed surroundings with white bourganvillia everywhere.
Beautiful oasis. Lovely cool place to get a bit of shade, beautiful gardens & litte terrapins swimming in the pools. Good photo opportunities :)
really beautiful gardens. Definately worth visiting. Beautiful and colorful gardens
Beautiful. Absolutely magnificent place. A long walk from the medina though - perhaps get a taxi or caleche

Quiet and Peaceful. We visited the Gardens as part of our tour early in the morning. It costs us 100Dh to get in and it was worth every penny. It was beautiful inside and so hard to believe that on the other side of the walls there was horns blasting away! I wasn't too keen on visiting this attraction as I'm not normally into gardens, but this one was good fun! I would definitely go in the morning before the herds of tourists arrive!
Bleu maroc. A wonderful peaceful place. Nice cafe. No dislikes.
peace at last. Beautiful garden to while away a few hours in tranquillity to escape the hub bub of the medina

Beautiful. Very well kept and in the better part of Marrakech. We spent an hour in the gardens before going to the airport and this was just the right amount of time. It isn't vast but it is extremely vibrant and well kept.

Oasis of calm in a busy city. We really enjoyed our visit to these gardens and they reminded me of the Palm House in Kew Gardens. There was plenty of colour and the lilies were out in the pond. The bright blue buildings and pots made attractive views with the different shapes of the plants. There is a good selection of Cacti.The garden is quite small so unless one paid extra for the museum or used the the rather expensive cafe , a visit does not take long but we enjoyed the beauty and calm after the busy city. Entrance fee for gardens is 50D per person.
Beautiful Gardens. Admission fee a bit steep 50 dirhams. Beautiful pristine gardens, but very busy. Lots of photo opportunities

Best place to go. Even me who can't take a good picture got some absolute belters!So cool, calm and collected.Go early and avoid the tourists. Germans everywhere with their leader under a brolly prattling away! Truly breaks the atmos..Well worth the 100 dirhams or whatever. Close enough to walk back to place du 16 novembre, where they did the sex and the city filming i think...Cannot praise it enough, you could stay for hours and you must try the cafe!
not worth the effort. Disappointing as apart from one small corner there was little in the way of colour apart from the terra cotta pots which were brightly painted.

Complete Rubbish. Having visited the Majorelle Garden in 2011, I am absolutely gob smacked to find that it is on "the most talked about attractions" on Trip Advisor.I assumed it was only talked about because it was outstandingly mediocre and as such was shocked to read that there have been many positive reviews about this place.I guess, if a person likes concrete, not very inspiring plant display, cacti and not a lot to see then it's the place to go.
Tranquil and stunning garden. This garden is a lovely way to spend an hour or two, very relaxing and arty !
Great garden. well worth an hour or two to visit this well maintained garden. The gallery and tea gardens are wonderful.

Beautiful. A beutiful garden very well laid out. It is not huge, I would recommend you give yourself 2 hours though to fully enjoy the gardens, boutique, gallery and finally the tea gardens - for any women that appreciates their surroundings, this is simply wonderful, and the waiters are very charming.
Amazing gardens - a real work of art. Such a beautiful place and so peaceful. You have to be there to appreciate what an incredible piece of living art this is.
Chill out time. Great place for a visit especially after the hustle and bustle of the markets. Try the lamb tagine for lunch in the cafe it was excellent!
Wonderful colours and well kept area. It was really well laid ouit easy to navigate and a lovely setting for tea
Don't go to Marrakech without seeing this. Possibly one of the most beautiful gardens in the world, you must go and take your time to look over these gardens.
Spectacular. Must be unique - a beatiful garden oasis well worth the visit

Incredible oasis in the Red City. Easily one of my favorite places in Marrakesh. The gardens house a unique museum dedicated to the Berbers and Yves St. Laurent memorial. The amount and variety of plants and cactus and trees that are contained in the gardens are amazing and very thoughtfully laid out.
Tranquility. The contrast with the Medina makes one appreciate the calm and peaceful atmosphere besides being a lovely and immaculatly kept garden and villa.
Very peaceful. Definitely worth a visit-very calming in the madness of Marrakech. Visit the little cafe it is lovely.
Worth a visit. Beautiful colours, very restful and tranquil. Twenty minutes was sufficient to have a decent look. Cafe prices were expensive.
Very average. Expensive for not a lot. Better things to do in Marrakech.

Paradise. Majorelle Gardens are perfect to enjoy on a scorching day beacuse the heat is not that bad there. I am not very fond of gardens myself but I really loved this place. It is a coloufu garden full of fountains and ponds! There is also an art exhibition with paintings by Yves Saint Laurent...looks like this garden also got into him :)
peace within the madness. a quite place outside the main square. 10 dh for entrance
A piece of heaven. A lovely tranquil place to escape to . Fabulous lunch in the bistro.
cool gardens. originally laid out gardens with shady walks and colourful pavillion
peace at last. very tranquil and a break from the real madness! nice toliets
Yves Saint Laurent's restored gardens. We had a relaxing afternoon after the frenetic pace of the medina!
Beautiful. Really worth visit and take your time. Beautiful and very relaxing. Food quite price but very nice.
Beautiful gardens. Compact but stunning and beautifully kept, the colours and settings are very stylish
Fabulous. We went here on a guided tour and had far too little time to fully appreciate the beauty of the place - go on your own and take your time
A must. If you love Gardens -flowers -Colour Get yourself over to see this wonderful garden

Very nice landscaped garden, different from others. The garden is a beauty, not very large, wonderful pavillions. European prices in the cafe/restaurant (which means overpriced for Morocco!).
Don't pay more than 30 dirham for the petit taxi to get you there or bring you back.

Fashion pilgrim !. We walked from town out to the gardens, a mile or so. The only bad thing was not so bad but the young woman at the desk had a bit of attitude, the translation of "both" meaning a ticket to both the museum and the gallery, resulted in two tickets for the gardens, and the misunderstanding was taken in bad humour by the ticket seller who was on her phone with earphones in, not your usual customer relations for such a big tourist place ! The gardens were truly amazing, the forest of huge bamboo rustling like the sea, all manner of splendid mature cacti, little places to sit, I did a drawing and took photographs of people taking photographs, there were lines of sight down long waterways and many visitors of all kinds. The colours were splendid and the museum was amazingly designed. Well worth a visit.
exquisite blue. Stunning Majorelle blue, yellow and orange mixed with cactus and bright pink bougainvillea. Berber museum in the grounds.
A peaceful oasis. A pleasure to wander around and loved the cactus garden. Just try to get there earlier in the day to avoid the tour buses and enjoy the tranquility in peace.

an ok garden. it is definitely exciting to discover a garden like that in the middle of marrakech although i think it is an overrated site. i only visited on my second trip to marrakech. it is rather small and overcrowded .... definitely not peaceful. if you have traveled in asia you will be very disappointed seeing this little patch of exotica. the museum though is excellent new and very well presented
Pretty and interesting, but quickly done.. The colours are vivid, the cactuses are interesting - and the café is OK, but it is not a place where you spend hours.

A highlight of my stay. While not a cheap endeavour, the garden instilled a great sense of calm and tranquility in me during my visit. The vivid Cobalt blue contrasted with plants from 5 continents, ranging from Cacti to Palm to Bougainvillea. I was pleasantly surprised and can highly recommend this to visitors of this city.
Peacefull garden. Lovely and peaceful and the cacti looked stunning all together. Couldn't see St Laurent memorial garden as they were filming. Enormous bamboo plants. Well worth a visit
Lovley Experience!. Nice to spend an hour or so walking around...followed by mint tea at the cafe.Great photo opportunties, colours look amazing.

Don't bother!. Pretty tacky looking, garishly painted walls, and quite small. Absolutely nothing special. We couldn't understand why people flock to see this, and the only thing we marveled at was that people were kneeling down to get the perfect shot with their cameras of what looked like very ordinary cactus plants. If you are expecting beautifully and tastefully arranged gardens, as we were, you will be very disappointed. All we could think was that this was the beneficiary of a lot of undeserved tourist hype.
beatiful. very colourful gardens.Those interested in garden design and plants will find inspiration here.But good walk from medina but fine.
Elegant, stylish and peaceful. The gardens are beautifully and artistically laid out. They make you feel calm and rested. The Berber museum is interesting and informative.

Garden design. Those interested in garden design and plants will find inspiration here. Wonderful colours, combination of plants, trees and water. The museum is also very good with beautiful Berber jewellery and costumes.
Too many people. It was a beautiful garden but totally ruined by the number of people allowed in at one time.
Fabulous. very colourful gardens, loved all the cactus and the pond, we went later in the afternoon when it was quiet
Must See. A beautiful gift from Yves St Laurent to the people of Marrakech.
A monument to YSL. There is a very modest but moving monument to Yves St. Laurent . The gardens are magical especially when not crowded. We went during siesta time and it was not crowded

Gentle. £4 to get in, pretty, out in an hour maximum. We walked from Jemaa el Fna and it took under an hour and we saw a lot of Marrakech on the way. Most people were taking the Cadeche. Couldn't see the point of it unless you are lazy or tired.
Beautiful gardens. Haven of peace, good walk from medina but fine. Tranquil gardens with fabulously sculptured plants.

Yves St Laurent's dream. beautiful, exotic, relaxing...if you can ignore the dozens of other tourists and clicking cameras. Fascinating, if long, walk direct from Katoubia Mosque through lively urban streets
Beautiful!. An oasis of peace and beauty! The just opened museum inside the gardens is also very much worth visiting: it gives a great idea of the Berber civilazation!
Astonishing!. Great use of Colours! A beautifull contrast between natural colours of the plants and the buildings! A Must See!

Beauty combined with good museum. I found the gardens to be beautiful, and I also really enjoyed the Berber museum on site. I don't often enjoy museums, but seeing traditional Berber clothing, jewelry, and other objects was fascinating. I would highly recommend this attraction to anyone.
Yves St-Laurent. This is a beautiful park, and Majorelle is clearly recognised as the instigator. But very corwded and very narrow pathways. Try to go late in the evening, an hour before closing.
Over-rated garden trading off the YSL name.. YSL name sells this - it is not really a large garden/park as we first thought. You could completely do it in 15 minutes.
Pretty Gardens. We were taken to the gardens by our driver of the horse drawn coach we rented. It is beautiful. We had lunch in the restaurant which was a welcome break from all the sight-seeing.
Lovely gardens.. Great retreat from the madness of the medina. The museum is worth a visit too. Amazing Isalmic jewellery and costumes. The garden restaurant is expensive, but a lovely treat.
calm oasis. When you need a break from the noise and excitement of the Medina come and chill to the sound of birdsong
a must see. stunning garden and museum -the highlight of our trip!

A feast for the eyes. A beautiful place of tranquility in an otherwise hectic city. So many photographic opportunitieis in a small space with a variety of plants in different colours and shapes. There is much to appreciate even if you are not a gardener and it is immaculately maintained. The museum is well worth the extra admission charge for the jewellry display alone. The Yves st Laurent influence with strong blue and yellow paintwork is striking and provides a vibrant backdrop to the natural colours of the flowers and foliage.
Beautiful Gardens. This was our first stop in Marrakech and the most beautiful place of all.

Nice option if you've got some extra time on your hands in Marrakesh. Jardin Majorelle is a nice option if you've got some extra time on your hands in Marrakesh, but don't expect an amazing garden as the garden is fairly small and there's only so much you can grow in a arid climate.One of the nice things about this trip is that the complex also houses the Berber museum, which you can incorporate in your visit as well. The entry to the garden costs 50 Dhiram and the Berber museum 25 Dhiram. Expect the visit to last about 1 to 1.5 hours.
Average. History museum gave insight on berber culture and history. Overly touristic.
Impressive. Who knew there were so many varieties of cactus in a small(ish) garden in Marakech. Very nice place to relax, or also to just take a comfortable walk.
Relaxing garden. a breathtaking place...loved it, it was nice to relax there in the afternoon after hectic day
Very blue. The Majorelle Garden is a nice to see. I expected it to be a bit bigger though.
A Mini Oasis. After spending 4 days in Marakech, I can well understand why Yves St. Laurent created this garden hideaway. It's a great escape from all the hubbub of marakech.

Interesting but expensive for what it is. It get's a lot of hype but takes 10 mins, 15 mins max to walk around and you have to go out of your way to get there. There is an open air cafe in there which serves decent food but the service was poor (again) and their is a slightly stressful air in the cafe area. My wife and I both commented on it. It's a bit of a calming thing to do after the Medina and main sq but it's not amazing by any stretch.
Gorgeous. BEAUTIFUL definitely a must visit....if only to see the huge cacti.
Great place to visit. Beautiful gardens with vibrant colours and interesting plants - definitely worth a visit!
Overrated. We decided to walk from south Medina all the way up to Jardin Majorelle. It's OK at best - much overrated and tiny.
Marjorelle. It's pleasant but overrated since it's the only garden in Marrakech that has paid entry

Stylish and tranquil. Loved the aloes & agaves - all so well tended - amazing water features - so cooling just to look at in the heat of the afternoon. Managed to see the gardens when not too crowded - just as we left about a hundred tourists descended on the gardens & destroyed the tranquility somewhat.

Beautiful Gardens/Fabulous Museum. This is a gem of a site and the museum is fantastic, should be on your list of to-dos in Marrakech. Great for kids too as the gardens are not too big, but fun to explore.
Yves St Laurent Garden. the colour and the cacti - sadly cannot replicate in Aberdeen

Pleasant enough for an expensive 30 minutes. A pleasant atmosphere but small . A good place to avoid the city heat but 30 minutes was enough. Entrance is now 50 MAD plus the musuem and the cafe was very pricey,

Pleasant but did not match expectations. Quite a pleasant spot to spend awhile , but for me it lacked the solace and interest of a real garden. Here everything was very neat and prim, but many of the plants were positioned in the garden solely for artistic effect - almost like a flower bowl. Large cacti admired by all were obviously regularly replaced by nursery stock from Teneriffe. Not a great garden of the world, but still a place to enjoy.
Designer chic. Fabulous,exotic garden,lovely vibrant colours,harmonious design. plants all well tended and all the landscaping immaculate. A must see!
so naturel. worth to go that garden plenty of tree n flowers .
a must see while in marrakech. this was one of my favorite spots - see why the beautiful majorelle blue is so special. It's a little garden oasis within the bustling city
Great specimens. Smaller than I imagined,cafe very expensive.Take your own drinks.
A long walk but worth it!. This was a botanical delight. From the bustle of Marrakech streets into this peaceful 'oasis' made this a must-see attraction.

Beautiful garden, tour the Berber Museum as well. The garden was originally designed by a French architect, who also had his design studio on the property. It fell into disrepair after his death. The garden was purchased by Yves St. Laurent, who refurbished the grounds, and turned the design studio into a Berber museum. While the garden is beautiful, the Berber museum is the gem of the property. It is well worth adding to your garden visit.

A Beautiful, Personal Garden and Oasis of Shape and Color. If you like plants, garden design, use of color, enjoy gardens, or want to spend some time in a serene place with plenty of nooks for resting or contemplation, you will not be disappointed by a visit here. I was struck by the maturity and size of the cactus and other plant specimens, the design and scale of the garden, and the juxtaposition of different plants with water features and the color of the buildings. This is a beautiful, incredibly unique place, and possibly one of the great personal gardens of the world.
Must do in Marrekech. Loved the gardens and exhibitions absolutely beautiful,found the tea garden pricey and a little snooty unlike anywhere else we visited in Marrekech

Lovely piece of heaven amidst the madness!!. We walked from the centre in just ubnder half an hour and got here early enough to avoid the numerous coach parties.We were rewarded with a sublime experience - these gardens arent huge, but you can tell the creative forces of Marjorelle and Saint Laurent were used to great effect.Not only are the gardens a great botanical collection, they have been used to architectural effect in combination wih the stunning blue house and gazebos, bridges etc.I've read that some think this is poor value - I disagree - 50MAD each for entry hardly breaks the bank and the great service and surroundings of the cafe are worthy of a 35MAD charged for a cappucino!Highly recommended if you like gardens and architecture.
OK. Probably worth a visit just to say you've been and the Yves Saint Laurent connection is quite interesting but did not personally find the gardens that amazing!

Busy but worth it. The gardens were lovely but very busy with bus loads of people wandering through. I loved the centre with all the clothing and jewellery from the different areas of Morocco. Well worth a visit but maybe go early!!
Sublime!!!. Beautiful, simply beautiful, peaceful, refreshing.
A little piece of heaven. We have been many times and the gardens are better tended than ever. All looking great and not to be missed
A fairyland!. This garden was redorated and saved by Ives St Laurent. His house is at the edge of the garden. Unusual plants and all very exotic.........a must!
Oasis in the city. A lovely garden and paths to stroll in the middle of the hectic city.
Nice little garden. Lovely colors and beautiful dessert plants. It is worth to spend some time here.

Nice garden. This attraction is one of the best.
Recommand you to do it in the morning
Peaceful, inspiring place. Beautiful gardens, fascinating museum - take the time to learn something there about Berber culture in all its richness

A heavenly little interlude in a noisy rushed city. This is an interesting (though not large) artist's garden planted mostly for dry and arid conditions. Lots of cacti, palms, bamboos, with lots of water, winding path through the whole. The garden is not huge - you would be hard pressed to spend more than an hour in it - but it is well worth a visit if you like gardens at all. The blue paint used is a shade invented by the person who planted it, and the whole works very well.
Beautiful gardens. Impeccable gardens, beautiful plants, first heard about it on a travel television show, interesting bamboo fences
Lovely gardens. Beuatifully cared for with some lovely vivid colours
A Jem Tucked Away. The gardens were very peacful and beautiful to visit in the hussle and bussle of the city. Tucked away in a back street it was amazing to see just what vision it was created with.
yves st laurent gardens. a must see although much smaller than expected. the gorgeous succulents and cactus give an otherworldly appearance. go later in day to avoid the crowds.
Beautiful!. Visit is worth, nice, calm, hidden from the crazy Medina.
Pleasant Gardens. Worth a visit. Small but richly designed gardens with a brightly painted villa at its heart. Food at the restaurant was a little disappointing.
A photographer's paradise. Smaller than I expected, but still a feast for the eyes. Took lots of pictures. Worth the trip out to see it, but quite pricey to get in (50 dirham I think).
peaceful escape. lovely place to visit for a more serene experience and some lovely plants to see.

A must visit away from the madness of Marrakech. There aren't that many 'tourist' sites in Marrakech but I would say that this is a must to visit if only for a bit of peace and tranquility away from the madness 'outside'. It is a definate oasis and somewhere to relax and enjoy although the gardens are not huge they are well laid out.We visited them late morning in late March and yes there were others around but not that busy to stop our enjoyment and stacks of space for taking the many photos. The cost was 50drms plus 25 for the museum which we bypassed.We also had a pleasant lunch in the cafe. Including lunch we spent about three hours here.Enjoy the peace.Brian - homeexchange50plus

Wonderful. We visited on a very hot afternoon when the shade in the gardens was most welcome. After a busy morning shopping in the souks, an afternoon in the gardens, where its calm and tranquil with a book and refreshments was wonderful.The gardens themselves are really beautiful, a pleasure to the senses, well worth the entry fee.

Absolutely beautiful - Fantastic museum. This place draws a big crowd for a very good reason - it is absolutely beautiful. The plants and colors are just gorgeous. I went through a camera battery just in this one place so be sure to bring several. The small museum is wonderfully done too. My kids loved this place. The tour groups come by the bus load so ask your concierge about the best time to go. We went on a Saturday around noon and it was packed.

Seen better. It's a nice garden in this crazy city, but it's quite small. And an entrance fee of 5€ is steep, compared to what you can see in Europe for that price. Our visit took about 15-20 minutes, and I wasn't that impressed.
Exquisite. Really a deam garden with an exquisite color named after Majorelle.
Oasis of calm. We visited late in the afternoon when there were not that many visitors left. It was a beautiful garden and made you forget that you were in the middle of Marrakesh.
Small but perfectly formed.. We went to these gardens one afternoon. They were lovely, and the shade was welcome, but it took only 30 mins to look round and that included 5 mins in the gift shop!

Peace and Tranquility in the busy city. The gardens are lovely and peaceful, a shady spot in the bustle of Marrakech. They're best visited earlier in the day before the coach trips disgorge as the gardens as small. However their clever design gives a feeling of space and you can wander around easily for a couple of hours. You really need your camera as every turn in the path brings another photo opportunity! Stunning bright colours and you can really see how the garden would have inspired Yves st Laurent.. A lovely restful place and its hard to believe that the madness of Marrakech is just outside those walls. There is a cafe/resturant there and you can buy water at a kiosk at a reasonable price. There is also a small gift shop and a somewhat 'up tight' boutique shop.
fantastic cactus garden. the most amazing variety and display of cactus i have seen anywhere.
Gorgeous. This is one of my favourite gardens in teh world, and in Marrakech. Beautiful, original, inspiring and tranquil.
Beautiful and tranquil. An oasis in a sea of haste! This beautifully looked after garden is a quiet place for reflection and solitude.

Stunning colours, beautifully maintained. This is a unique garden with tropical planting and strident primary colours that would not transfer to temperate climes. The mechanised entrance booth, standard of maintenance, goods for sale in the shop and cost of admission indicate its European foundation
A very pleasant way to spend a couple of hours, when combined with the Berber museum.

Very mediocre for the price. From the guidebooks I was expecting to find lush and extensive gardens full of exotic plants yet in reality the gardens are small and mainly filled with bamboo, cacti and few flowering plants to really catch the eye. The waterfeatures are interesting, but not outstanding. We paid a total of 150dh for two to visit the gardens and the small museum on berber culture and history (exchange rate at the time £1 =13.3 dh). Glad we spent the extra on the museum otherwise we would have been in and out out very quickly. There are other, free gardens around the city (e.g. next to the Koutoubia mosque) which were far more pleasant.

A must see in Marrakech. The gardens are easy to find and a lovely combination of Moroccan design with stunning Art Deco. We went in the middle of the day and the shady palms created a calm and peaceful outing. I wish we had ignored our guidebook's dismissal of the cafe as 'expensive'. The prices were comparable with London prices but it looked charming and the menu described fresh, interesting Moroccan drinks and dishes.

A little bit of peace in a bustling city.. This Garden was beautifully peaceful even though it was very busy. The blues and yellows of the buildings and pottery was stunning and the plants were abundant. Certainly worth a visit especially for the drink I had at the cafe - grapefruit, lemon, ginger and mint - very refreshing.
surprising oasis in busy Marrakech. combination of beautiful garden and museum with photos and objects of berber population
A little Oasis in busy Marrakech. Wonderfully green and jungly garden created by the painter Majorelle, NOT by Yves Saint Laurent as a lot a of people seem to think.
Worth a visit. Loved this place. Its so well manicured and the atmosphere is very calming

Like an oasis in the middle of the city. Going to the gardens was a really relaxing way of spending some time away from the bustle of the medina - it was like an oasis in the middle of the city - also it has an excellent small museum on site
Don't expect too much. whilst a good hour spent it was not the most inspiring of gardens

Beautiful garden of Yves Saint Laurent.. Now with new museum open from january 2012
. Yves Saint Laurents collection of Moroccan silver jewellery, ethnic and tribal clothes.

One of the highlights of a visit to Marrakech. The Jardin Majorelle must be one of the most beautiful gardens in the world. Bought by fashion designer Yves St Laurent and his partner many years ago when it was almost condemned to be destroyed, the gardens are now a bouquet of vibrant colours and exquisite textures. Take your time walking through this small paradise to appreciate the many tropical plants, their arrangements and the amazing landscaping. Come early because the tour bus crowds will take away your full enjoyment of this treat if you arrive after 11 AM. Also by coming early you may have breakfast at a gem of a an outdoor cafe inside the Gardens, and savour the bright morning sun and chirping of the birds. Don't miss the museum of Berber Arts inside the Gardens. Painted a brilliant blue, this small museum will open your eyes to the culture and lifestyle of the indigenous Berbers. All in all a wonder of a place, and one of the reasons why we travel. I tip my hat to Monsieur St Laurent and his partner. Merci beaucoup!
calm oasis lovely plants. loved the plants/trees/ponds&,frogsenjoyed the museum
Nice colors!. The plants, the pots, but specially the colors; I had never seen such a bright yellow and a powerful blue. We didn't visit the museum, but the rest was quite interesting.

Small, expensive, and a little removed from everything else. at 50dh this is expensive compared to the other attractions in Marrakech. A 20dh taxi out there and 20dh back doesn't really help the argument.
