Inside you approach the bamboo section and as some people have already mentioned there are a few etched in initials in the bamboo which is a bit of a shame. YYou then walk towards the big blue building (the museum) and before you reach it you come accross the monument to YSL which is a bit anti-climatic. We took in the gift shop and the little room showcasing some of YSL's art work which shows why he stuck to being a designer. You then come to the cactus area which was my favourite section and then you find yourself out of the exit. Give this a skip, even the taxi driver on the way said to go to the Palmeraie instead.
Among Marrakesh's foremost sites, outside the medina. Excellent Berber museum, exhibiting pieces collected by the property's owners, in addition to a mini botanical garden.
Beautiful Oasis. This is a beautiful, restful and peaceful setting in a loud bustling city. I would highly recommend taking a an hour or two to enjoy this lovely garden setting.

An Oasis in the dust. The Jardin Majorelle is not to be missed. It is perhaps one of the smallest gardens I have ever visited, but with an unbelievable atmosphere or tranquillity and privacy. It is no surprise that Yves St. Laurent had his ashes left there. The arrangement of the garden is wonderful, and provides a welcome coolness in the heat of the Marrakech day - we were there in March and it was already 30 degrees C. Perhaps the most spectacular aspect is the use of colour through-out the garden - wonderful and inspiring.
Cactus and bamboo. I found it a little disappointing .. The cafe expensive , and too many tourist groups

Refreshing sanctuary in busy city. After a hectic first day in the markets and souks, we went to ville nouvelle. After visiting the main square (circle in this case) and seeing a small boy get hit by a motorbike, we thought it was time to go somewhere a little more relaxing. It was a very hot day and this was a shady haven in a very busy city. Small and not much to see, just lots of cacti and bamboo, but worth it for the sit down in the shade.
Things to do. Not as big as i thought but worth trip large taxi 6 Adults back to square 80dh
Only went as friend advised it was good. was well kept but not my thing really, if you like cactus plants then cool and there is a shrine for YSL there but that's it.
BEAutiful. A beautiful paradise away from the busy streets of Marrakesh. Well worth a visit if you like flowers and stuff. Lovely colours and some great coffee served in the coffee shop!!
Yves St Laurent. Peaceful and beautiful oasis in the heart of the new town - great little cafe for drinks and snacks or lunch

Memorable Majorelle. We visited early afternoon on a Friday and there was no queue or too many people, so it did not feel crowded. I do not understand how anybody could say they didn't enjoy the wonderful vibrant colours of this beautiful place. We knew it wasn't huge, but this is quality not quantity. When we had walked all around in one direction, we turned around and had quite different views in the opposite direction. It was so tranquil and we enjoyed the birds singing. The exhibits in the Berber museum were different, interesting and unique. Entrance is now 60D, with extra 20D for the museum/Our only complaint was the cafe - there were so many people smoking (as smoking is not permitted in the gardens itself) and the open area had a covering of strips of canvas which only served to keep the smoke in. Also the prices were exhorbitant, but we ordered the soup at 60D (£5) and sat for about 30 mins before the waiter came back to say there was no soup!! Disgusted that he had not told us that on ordering it, we left and took our custom elsewhere. Drinks were also 60D. We would advise people to avoid this overpriced, smokey tourist trap (cafe) and eat elsewhere, but the gardens are well worth a visit - there's nothing like them anywhere else we have been.

Worth a visit. In my opinion, not the stunning destination that some people rave about (I found the garden away from the house and the expanses of concrete paths a bit boring), but that's just my view and it was definitely worth the visit. Certainly, the area around the museum itself was very impressive. Don't overlook the small courtyard just inside the entrance (easy to do in the rush to get into the main garden). With its elegant pool, it is a lovely oasis of calm between each wave of new arrivals. Don't overlook this. Enjoy!
A feast for the eyes. Loved getting horse and trap from square - paid 100 d but maybe could have got it for less - to gardens. Not massive but the colours were amazing

Oasis in the middle of the craziness. Brilliant collection of plants, amazing garden, cooling you down from the heat of the traffic in the city. You almost forgot how crazy it all is there. The scheme of colours was amazing, and some parts of it absolutely magical
Very Dissapointing. Not sure if we were at the right time of year for this but it was nto very pretty and extremely dissapoinitng. Not worht the visit

oasis in the madness. the majorelle gardens are an oasis of tranquility and coolness in a very vibrant and hot city
calm and stunnign the cafe is superb as well !1

Beautiful Gardens out of the bustle of the Medina. I walked from Jemna El Fnaa to Majorelle Gardens which was a fair walk, but it was well worth it! It a beautiful gardens, of every kind of cactus there is (or so it seems!) with beautiful colours, set against fabulous blues. It's a perfect place to sit and think, have some lunch and just get away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. It is the most expensive attraction I went to (50dirham) but was worth it.
I've got a bigger back garden.. Worth seeing, but not worth paying to see! Just looks like an eclectic collection of greenery. Don't bother if you've got other things to see.

Worth a visit, but not the prettiest garden around. Not the prettiest garden around. Lots of cacti and bamboo, which unfortunately has been carved into by visitors claiming their love for one another. There's a museum which we did not visit, which cost 30Dh extra to the 20Dh garden fee. The neatest part of the garden was the little gallery of Yves St Laurent artwork; very cute pieces in there!The Marjorelles built the garden, and YSL later bought and owned it.Worth a visit, but it's not that exciting of a place.
A peaceful place to visit. The garden would have been better if the morons who visited did not scratch there names on the bamboo and palms

Too pricey for what it was. We were expecting something larger. When we had looked at the bamboo and cactii and Yves St Laurent's memorial, we wandered around, thinking we had just explored one corner, only to find we had seen it all! It's pretty enough, and quiet away from the bustle of the streets nearby, but we felt we had paid quite a lot to look round a very small garden and felt a bit ripped off. We were going to have something to eat and drink in the cafe, but the prices there seemed high too, so we went to the cafe across the road instead. I would not recommend this to friends visiting the city.

not worth the money. Marjorelle Gardens is given this big hype because of its connections but unless you like bamboo or cacti i would give it a miss. Our hotel was giving away free passes and i am glad we didn't pay! It only took about 20 minutes to walk round, very disappointing! To be honest the Artisan Centre that the taxi driver insisted on taking us to was better!

Wonderful Garden.. A garden made up of mainly cacti and palm trees! Wonderful! It had amazing composition so it did not need bright flowers. The walls and pillars were painted a bright cobalt blue and urns were painted yellow and terracotta. The effect was electric and contrasted strongly with the muted greens.

beautiful gardens in a peaceful setting. A small garden but worth a visit.Stunning plants, flowers and varieties of cacti.Lovely fountains and pools with water turtles. Also an interesting museum detailing berber jewellery and carvings etc.
Oasis. This garden was a welcome respite from the heat and very relaxing.The pond and beautiful shade of blue used everywhere was really lovely
Worth a visit. Superb little garden just outside the old city walls, definitely worth visiting to get away from the chaos of Marrakech.

Overpriced Park. It is pleasant enough, but suffers from being a temple to YSL. It presents itself as an icon of beauty, but betrays its real purpose by being overpriced. Profits go to a foundation, but when you check the foundations aims it isn'y clear it is doing much for anyone. It is a area of very pleasent gardens, but is busy and very small... if you like gardens there are better finds elsewhere

Very pretty. Very pretty little garden in Marrakech. Worth visiting for a little stroll around if you are interested in gardens, design, garden design (!) architecture or YSL. You have to pay extra if you wish to visit the museum. There is a cute little exhibition of collages by YSL, several featuring his pet dog.
Not to miss!. One of best cactus collection of the world. A very relaxing place for walking, reading or just having a tea or coffee in a cozy bar
Beautiful. My favourite place. Definitelly recommend. Very tranquil and serene.
An oasis ofcalm and colour. This was an unexpected experience. Wonderfully well kept and the colours and plants are fabulous.
love...majorelle gardens. love it here, every time i come to marrakech i always come and visit...check out the love exhibition.
Marjorelle backyard. Feels like a 'backyard!' Awfully small and you feel as it you are 'pushed' along the path! Impossibly unhelpful staff in the shop.
calm and tranquil. A beautiful garden in a cool and serene setting .A total contrast to the frenzied activity of the city
Lovely gardens. Lovely gardens to walk around very cool. Lovely museum and cafe, you must try the chocolate and almond pancakes with a cup of hot chocolate mmmmm....
A must-visit!. Vibrant colours, beautiful space, and guaranteed to have the most amazing pictures of your trip! :p
Relaxing oasis. Well worth a visit for some peace and quiet after visiting the Souks. The plants have a way of communicating without wanting your money!

Chic and peacefully. This Jardin is a very nice attraction. Modern, very well designed it mixes the yellow, blue and green in its walls, bamboos, cactus and fountains. In my opinion it's a "must do" if you are visiting Marrakech.

A Good Private Garden and a Sophisticated Museum. Obviously mr Marjorelle who was born into a well known French Family had a good upbringing and education and his culture shows in this collection of plants from around the world and also the newly opened berber museum in which the costumes of various berber regions are painstakingly correct and displayed with a finesse only the French are capable of

Nice garden but slightly overpriced entrance for what you're seeing!. My husband and I visited Majorelle Garden as we had heard it was a must see!We paid around £6-7 per person to see a small garden with some impressive cactus and plants. It was a nice relaxing place to sit and do nothing for an hour!I think the entrance should have been slightly cheaper to reflect what you're actually going to be seeing!If you're a nature lover and like plants etc, but you might appreciate the place more than we did.I think the place is over hyped due to the Yves Saint Laurent connection to the garden (as his ashes are scattered in this garden).Lets put it this way - you're not going to miss out if you don't go there!!!

Majorelle. Lovely garden, not as big as we expected but very enjoyable and beautifully designed. We particularly liked the Berber Museum within it, gave a us quite an insight into Berber traditions and we thought the various costumes and adornments quite something. Certainly well worth a visit.
A lovely urban garden.. A very beautiful, restful spot. I especially loved the recently-opened Berber museum right in the middle of the garden, one of my favorite experiences.
Beautiful if small!. It was worth paying to go around these gardens but as they are not large, it gets quite busy.
Oasis. A lovely garden well designed, peaceful and serene.
Beautiful. What a lovely spot - about a 30 minute walk from the main square. Lovely settings for plants and water features and the museum was so interesting. Lots of coach parties so go early or late
Worth it!. Felt like a piece of heaven....We got a nice sunshine there
I LOVED IT!!!. Great place , not to be missed , very beautiful and peaceful place , we were close of skipping it but we enjoyed every minute of our stay.
stunning. step into a different world from the busy life outside to the relaxing piece and quiet of the gardens but don't forget your camera
Worth a look, I suppose.. I was expecting something larger. It was nice to have few hours in a quiet cool place, but I wasn't that impressed. Good restaurant, though.
Not worth the trip. Marrakech has some really nice parks and gardens. Majorelle was small, had nice trees and cactus, but I enjoyed the parks (like Cyber park) way more then this place.

beautiful. The fusion of colours is amazing and so beautiful The design is stunning and the little coffee shop is an ideal place to sit back and be with nature.The cacti is huge!! Well worth a visit however short or long....
A delightful oasis in the heart of the city. Fabulous garden where you will feel at peace. I totally understand why YSL loved it so much.
Definitely worth a visit. beautiful garden but also really interesting museum, full of heritage of Morocco. Spent quite a long time in here looking at everything, jewellery, clothing and cookware.

Overpriced disappointment.. Attractive though the garden is and with some amazing cacti in particular, our visit to the garden was our biggest disappointment of our trip, mainly due to the price - 50 Dirham entry (€5) - the garden isn't particularly large, there is no information on the planting - and 25 Dirham (€2.5) for the Berber museum (Interesting, but 15 minutes unless you stop to read everything). Add in a cab there and back (having had to haggle down from an especially high rate on departure too) and it was easily our most expensive visit during our stay. We didn't linger in the cafe when we saw the cheapest food was 70D and a club sandwich 120D!
A beautiful tranquil setting. A truly wonderful garden, with an amazing collection of cactus. A great place to rest for a while. We only had coffee at the restaurant there but the food looked great.

Nice place to relax in the midst of a hectic city. Jardin Majorelle is perhaps one of the best places to visit in Marrakech if you want to escape the smell and the hectic in the streets. Though crowded with people (February), it was a very serene and nice place. Fresh air, hoorah! Minor thing is the price. To see the gardens we paid 100 MAD, which is about 10 euros for the two of us. This is quite some money for just half an hour looking around. Of course you can spend more time by sitting in the restaurant or visiting the museum, but that would only mean spending more money. We enjoyed the photogenic surroundings and peaceful atmosphere, but it was a pity that so many people did the same.
Haven of peace and colours. The peaceful atmosphere, the fun colours in contrast - would like to return in full bloom of flowers. Get there early 10 a.m. or prepare to queue :)
beautifull and tranquill. Beautifull quiet oasis.Shop very priceyLoos boardering on dodgy,but if you enjoy looking at gardens well worth a trip
Tranquil. serine and tranquil to say the least beatiful and must see place.
A little bit of heaven in crazy Marrakesh. These gardens are well worth a visit to get away from all the noise and traffic of Marrakesh. The little cafe within the gardens is good also.
Stunning. A haven of peace and tranquillity. You will not want to leave! Go later on in the afternoon for less crowds.
A bit of peace in a busy city. The gardens represent a beautiful example of plants from around the world. The garden is well maintained and the staff are welcoming and friendly.

Beautiful. If you like gardens, this a place to see. I loved the cobalt blue colors of the buildings which made a lovely backdrop to the wide variety of plants and cacti St. Laurent collected over his lifetime.

Well designed, a bit crowded. Enjoyed walking through the garden seeing lots of tropical specimen plants. The buildings and pools were brightly painted and led to the sense of an artistic retreat. The guards were rude. The bathrooms were clean. It was crowded.

Nice, tranquil space in the city. Pretty but small garden - good range of cacti
Nice place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city, often the horse and cart tours will drop you here, we only stayed for approx half an hour but this was probably long enough for those not serious about plants!
Beautiful. Beautifully maintained gardens and fantastic museum, well worth a visit

Nice Gardens...nothing brilliant. A nice garden in the new city part of Marrakech. Parts of the garden pay homage to the deceased YSL. Lots of different plants and a nice walk with a partner. No very big and only took us about 1.5 hours maximum which included the museum within the gardens.I cant remember exact cost, but I think it was around 60 Dirhams each. Not really worth it. Something to do but not a major experience and nothing to remember. Would not go out off my way but worth implementing as part of a visit to the new city.
Eclectic gardens. So many different and interesting plants from palm trees, bamboo to cacti. We skipped the museum. There's a great little lunch place down the street from the entrance.
a must visit. the best garden in Marrakesh , better than the menara by far - visit the museum inside the gardens.

A lovely little Oasis but expensive.. They must be raking in the cash here, a lovely place to spend an hour or longer if you have a drink in the very expensive cafe.Lush grounds and pools make a cool and shaded place to visit on a hot day, but surprising small given the cost of admission!
Tourist trap, but worth it!. There were ques of tourists waiting to get in, but the visit was worth it. Well kept, and very nicely done.

Stunning. Stunning garden , i have never seen such a variety of rare plants all well taken care of , Yeve Saint Laurent apparently lived here for some years in this beutiful small house painted in a vivd blue ....simply stunning !

Beautiful, quiet garden. Just a few minutes with taxi out of the city centre, and so quiet and beautiful. A nice little cafe inside as well, and benches to relax on. We stayed only one hour but could've stayed much longer!

Tranquil garden, interesting planting and Museum. Museum of real interest and not too many exhibits which can sometimes leave you confused. Lovely cafe with delicious food to relax in after your wander!
beautiful. a must see for any trip to marrakech - beautiful and peaceful.

Gorgeous gardens in the middle of busy Marrakech. The gardens were lovely, the colours were vibrant. This is definitely worth a visit. There is a great juice bar and cafe across the road and a fabulous shop 33 Rue Majorelle for clothing and gifts also across the road. If you have time and like beautiful gardens do go.
Quite pretty and romantic but not really worth 5 euros. Quite pretty and romantic but not really worth 5 euros

Peaceful Gardens. These gardens are a nice place to spend a few hours escaping the surrounding madness! They're beautiful and peaceful and it's nice just to sit and take it in. We also had an enjoyable fruit cocktail in the little cafe there and enjoyed the YSL memorial.

Fabuloso!. I loved this Garden. The layout and the colours are just so unexpected and inventive. So many unusual plants and so many great viewing points! I took sooo many photos. Not so large to be tiring..it felt a very intimate experience, a very personal garden, you could feel the design was from one person and a very talented person at that. Loved it.
Disappointed. Thought ot was going to be a lot bigger and better from previously seen reviews.
boring. no plant names, it takes 5 minutes to walk around, pointless and rather sad.
the blue garden. it was nice but not a must do. i think its more for people who are into botanicals
Must see. Calm, peaceful, cool and beautiful. A welcome escape from the madness of the Medina.

An oasis of calm in a busy city. This Jardin is only a 5 minute walk from the medina walls (Bab Doubkalla) and is an absolute oasis and haven away from the hustle bustle of marrakesh. spend a couple of hours wandering around this well managed and preserved garden before heading into the cafe area and the boutique. Only £4 entry - well worth the visit!

An oasis of calm in a busy city. This Jardin is only a 5 minute walk from the medina walls (Bab Doubkalla) and is an absolute oasis and haven away from the hustle bustle of marrakesh. spend a couple of hours wandering around this well managed and preserved garden before heading into the cafe area and the boutique. Only £4 entry - well worth the visit!

An oasis on a hot day. You walk off the busy road into an oasis of calm. The garden is well presented and very clean. Moroccan colours bring the place alive but the setting is really peaceful. You are able to sit and enjoy the greenery. I am sure that at different times of the year colour is added by the various plants. You can pay to visit the museum. We choose just to visit the garden. Once inside the garden it is hard to image the chaos you have left outside the walls of the garden.
Beautiful. The home of Yves St Laurent Stunning gardens with vivid colours and a very interesting museum in the middle.A quiet and cool oasis for an hour or two in a busy city
Stunning place to visit. Stunning gardens, worth a visit and cheap to enter.

Peace and cool beauty in a hectic city. Every vista is a photograph or painting! The colours are beautiful and after a couple of days you just want to get away from the hustle of the Medina and sit on a bench in this lovely garden. However I am sure that occasionally it is overcrowded..go early or in the winter!
Yves St Laurent Gardens. Even if you don't like visiting gardens -don't miss this one! It was superb. You will not see another like it!

Beautiful, and a must see, especially for garden lovers. Really wonderful, and completely different. A must see in Marrakesh. However, do not eat there....the prices are as designer as the gifts you can get in the gift shop (leave credit card at your Riad!). Take a book, and spend some time reading in the tranquility of the garden. Wonderful place to get some great photos, as colour abounds. If you love plants and gardens, this is a must see on your trip.
Splendid!. Do not miss these heavenly gardens. The small Berber museum inside is also worthwhile.
Nice way to spend a couple of hours. Well worth a look even if its just to spend an hour or so out of the heat of the city. Cost 50 dirhams entry. The little museum inside was not worth going in.

Completely Different Gardens. Absolutely lovely - As a non-artist I appreciated the thought which went into the designe of the garden.I liked the succulents in their display.The Berbere Museum was great.

Don't miss the exhibition of Love prints. The gardens are beautiful and so well tended. The colours used in the hard areas are amazing. Dont miss the little room in the top right corner which displays a selection of YSL's annual Love prints.

Tranquil Garden. Not as many plants as we imagined but the bright buildings/pots among the green made it a very pleasant, relaxed walk around after a busy walk round the Medina.
The museum within the gardens is worth a look and the display of Yves Saint Laurent artwork.
An absolute must. The incredible plantings of cactus and palm trees and the magnificent layout and other structural decorative elements are a real joy to behold.

beautiful. a simple very well kept cactus garden , a spectaciular blue,(yes you have to pay , and its worth it), with great examples of the maitrise of local artisan on work displayed at the shop, and a clean and free bathroom

Pleasant but am I missing something?!. A trip here was recommended to us by two different trusted friends so we went. It's outside the medina so you either need to take a taxi or walk. To be completely honest, I really don't know what the fuss is about. If you really like cacti it would be quite interesting and it's certainly a peaceful haven on frenzied Marrakech but for me that was about it! I'm not really a gardener though, so I walked round it in 5 minutes, peered into the stagnant pond and then moved onto the art!What in my opinion it IS worth going for is the little gallery with all the 'Love' prints that YSL made-they are unique and beautiful and I thoroughly enjoyed looking at them.I'm sure if you were here in the summer this place would be a cool, shady godsend, I just wouldn't put it at the top of your agenda in Morocco.

Surprise in dusty area. Very coulorful and quiet. Staff is grumpy at entrance and cafe-outlet. Don't let this influence your visit. Take a minicab back to Djemnaa Al Fna square and pay no more then 50 durham.
Amazing Garden. Well worth a visit, an amazing display of tropical and cacti plants against a Moroccon blue. Get there early to avoid tours to get the best sense and magic of the garden.
Good place. Easy access, nice all around great to take some pictures but restaurant a bit steep on prices.

A GREAT EXPERIENCE. These gardens are a must for anyone visiting Marrakech. It is a peaceful oasis in the middle of a busy metropolis. The trees and plants are amazing and contrast with the blue paint wwhich is used on most of the buildings and it certainly is a lasting tribute to Yves St Laurent.
Revisit. 2nd time ther. We are keen gardeners and we will go again and again.
An oasis of calm. Such a beautiful place. The stylish blue of the buildings, the immaculate planting and the serenity of the lily pools, I loved it.
Wonderful on a sunny day. try to visit this beautiful garden in quieter periods - the colours are spectacular in the sun
Beautiful Oasis in Marrakech. If you want a couple of hours of peace then go along to the gardens. Have lunch in the small cafe in the gardens. it was wonderful

Must-visit place. Don't miss this garden which is one of the main places of interest in Marrakech ! The place used to be the house of Yves St Laurent and the gardens are stunning.
I'd recommend to take a carriage to get there if the weather is not to cold. It is definitely romantic !!!! Don'! miss it :)

an oasis you must visit. These gardens are just stunning, both times i've been i have taken mint tea in the courtyard as well. take your camera for some stunning photos and allow a couple of hours to fully relax and enjoy the tranquility
Beautiful. A beautiful garden, that is definitely worth going to.
Better than expected. Not very large but a convival half hour with beautiful plants and colours. A fitting tribute to Yves St laurent.

Beautiful - a Must-See of Marrakesh. You really must visit Majorelle Gardens while you are in Marrakesh. They are gorgeous, intimate and make for amazing photo ops. I recommend going early in the morning to avoid the crowds, then enjoy a late breakfast at the lovely little cafe while the other visitors start streaming in late morning. The gift shop is curated by a noted stylist and is expensive but divine. An excellent and peaceful way to spend a morning in this stylish Moroccan city!

cactus garden very well planned. Beautiful cactus garden and interesting as this was once a private residence. The restaurant inside is nice for a relaxing tea after your walk. Beautiful bamboo stands also.

A tranquil setting away from the souks. We visited the gardens on a beautifully warm day. Whilst there were a lot of people there, it didn't feel crowded. I could imagine that this would not be the case in the summer. The cafe serves a range of snacks food and drinks and is reasonably priced. If you are getting a taxi back to the main square, barter hard. We paid 50 d for our trip.
Nice, exotic gardens. Aside from the gardens, the Berber cultural museum is very well laid out and well worth the visit.

A bright injection of colour. Loved the variety of gardens created using bright colour, water features, and every cactus it seems under the sun. Most people advise going early to avoid the coach parties, but we went late (About 3.30pm) and managed to avoid all but one group who were leaving.
Beautifully maintained and quirky with the best display of cactus I have seen. A charming oasis of colour and shade. Worth the trip
YSL gardens. Colourful, quiet and pleasant. Relatively small. Easy to find, good coffee, inexpensive and worth an hour or so.
tanquil oasis. Well worth the visit. Lovely 20 acre tropical gardens a short taxi ride from the centre of Marrakech.

Like an oasis in a crowded city. Here you will enjoy walking peacefully among the trees, flowers and around the ponds to get some rest from the crowded Medina. We enjoyed lunch in the garden of the restaurant, good food, very couteous service and reasonable price. We visited the shop, beautiful hand crafts but the price seemed high.
The Garden. Whilst a tranquil garden with an ownership history, I would not view it as a must to visit.
disappointment. We heard so much about the garden and a must place to visit. There wasn't much to see for what we paid. It took us less than 10 minutes to walk around the garden.

a must !. well kept and super for the pictures!entrees ca. 4 Euro p/p
museum itselfs, extra payment

Beautiful. We went here with low expectations, but found the garden to be absolutely amazing. So peaceful and tranquil with colourful, but calm decorations. Probably one of the best bits of our trip in terms of places to visit. Would recommend a visit to anyone.
Beautiful. I have visited this on both my trips to Marrakech it is is beautiful and takes you far away fro the hustle and bustle of the city
wonderful garden. brilliant day out to this wonderful garden restored by Yves Saint Laurent

Is this really in Marrakech?!. Apart from the ticket lady, this is a great little oasis of serenity away from the typical Marrakech craziness.A beautiful well maintained garden, housing a variety of cacti and plants I had never before seen.There's no need to allocate more than half an hour to wander around (unless you want to visit the pricey cafe), but this place is definitely worth seeing if you want calmness to defuse the stress you may feel from visiting Marrakech!

Not worth a detour. I was very disappointed about le Jardin Majorelle; expensive in Maroccan standards (40Dh/person) and not a lot to see: bamboo, cactus and some succulent plants. I was expecting some more variety. If you would like to go there: try to be as early as possible, because it might get crowded over there. A tip; visit some other gardens in Marrakesh; most of them are free, and have the same variety.
Tranquil. Smaller than we thought, but worth the visit - beautiful
a calm peaceful oasis. beautiful, cool, peaceful escape from chaos outside the walls
Beautiful. Absolutely stunning gardens and there is a nice little cafe outside where you can chill after visiting the gardens with some nice mint tea!
Beautiful oasis. These gardens are beautiful. It doesn't take long to visit them, but stay an hour to really appreciate the calm.
Beautiful designed - vivid colours. Vivid blues and yellows of the building/pottery contrast against the beautiful forms of the planting. A delightfully, elegant place and well worth a visit.
Majorelle Gardens Marrakesh. Absolutely stunning - and oasis of calm and beauty within the city of Marrakesh- an absolute must!
Wandering in an oase of quiteness. Beautiful combination of colours and peace! Also, take a look in the love garden of YSL, there you have a collections of his wish cards, nice!
Beautiful garden in the new town. Gorgeous garden in the new town, very European looking. Nice place to sit and relax and decide what to do next!
spectacular garden. Purchased by Yves St. Laurent, the gardens are beautiful but very busy. Recommend going early in the day to get in front of the crowds.
well worth a visit. lovely place to visit complete contrast to the rest of marrakesh

Gorgeous oasis and resting place for YSL. The majorelle gardens and their eponymous blue are such a contrast from the rest of Marrakech, so peaceful, leafy, green and soothing. The contrast is total. The new musem, though small, is most excellent. There is also a very nice little cafe now. You can also take a caleche from the drivers there and make this a part of a trip around the ramparts of the old city.

Absolutely not be missed. My husband and I were somewhat horrified by the queues going into the gardens but despite the numbers we still found the whole complex stunning. Bright yellow and blue painted pots contrasting with the limpid pale turquoise of the fountain waters, combined with the extraordinary sculptural shapes of the cactus garden (including some really unusual species) make it an aesthete's heaven. I would also highly recommend the new Berber Museum - the best museography in Morocco - and the erudite but accessible commentary. It really brought home the millennial character of Berber culture and how miraculously it has survived today, grafted onto Arab culture, having maintained extraordinary decorative skills combined with that tradition of hospitality, an ancient echo of their hunter gatherer origins.
Majorelle Gdns. Small but beautiful gargden, the biggest bamboos we have ever seen.

A bit boring!. Everyone advised us to visit the gardens but personally I found the gardens quite boring and disappointing. I can see how it could give a little respite from the hot summer but unless you have a passion for cactus I would advise you to give it a miss!!! Only highlight for me was the cactus that looked like a rampant rabbit (can I say that!!!) which I challenge you to find if you do go!!!

Lovely, calm, beautiful. After the crowds, noise and chaos of the medina, this place was literally and figuratively a breath of fresh air! Small, but beautifully laid out, it was a pleasure to stroll around, and look in the high end gift shop and little nook of YSL memorabilia. I hope to return and want to have a snack in the cafe next time. Don't miss these gardens!

A fascinating and beautiful garden, but busy with tourists.. A visit to the garden is basic on many organised tours. It is a refreshing delight but is also busy. Expensive and slightly snooty cafe on site - we enjoyed expensive ice cream!

Amazing. It was nice and clean, looked after really well, islamic arts musem had to go looking for it but then decided not to visit as there was an additional fee the painting collection by YSL is amazing and there is also a small monument for YSL
tranquil. Gorgeous gardens, amazing plants and trees. It is quite a small place but worth a visit.

Small garden behind a wall. Just not my thing. A nice but small garden with a few pools of water and some big palm trees, oh, and a memorial to YSL, also nothing to get excited about. Alot of pretentious oohing and ahhing mainly by americans but failed to impress me. Save yourself a little money and use the time to better purpose.
A haven. A wonderful place to visit, extremely peaceful and beuatifully kept...amazing cacti
Dreamy. Not to be missed. You enter the world of Jacques Majorelle with the famous blue that bears his name. See the little monument to Yves St Laurent - very moving.
definately worth a visit. a beautiful garden. a tranquil oasis in amongst a manic city. the berber museum is very interesting... amazing workmanship.

An oasis you must go to. We visited Jardin Majorelle in the beginning of February. After four days in the Medina it was nice and relaxing to come here. All the green from the plants was amazing together with the bright pots in yellow, orange and blue.There was an interesting museum where we learnt much about the berber people. In the garden is also a very nice café where we had a very good café latte and later a very tasty carrotsoup.
Beautifull colors!. We did this garden just before we left to the airplane, a nice way to leave this wonderful city!
Best Gardens In Marrakech. Small quaint but a must see in Marrakech.Went in January but still worth the money for the garden and the tranquility
Fabulous colors. It is tiny... But magnific. The museum, the gardens, even the shop are worth the visit ( and the inevitable marrakech taxi rip off)

Beautiful place to visit. A lovely setting, to walk around and marvel at the wonderful plants and colours. The cafe is great too.
The gardens are a great tonic for the chaos of Marrakech!

Fabulous garden. As you might expect from YSL a gorgeous garden with cacti to die for. Beautiful, immaculate. The buildings and structures painted azure blue and citrus yellow contrast pleasingly with the greenery. An unexpected bonus was the museum in the grounds. Small but perfectly formed, it tell the story of the Berbers in a way that stays with you. I highly recommend it.

Stunning colours and cacti.. It had a beautiful layout of plantations and the bright blue colours everywhere. It was really peaceful and tranquil. The architecture is stunning and a great couple of hours spent there.
Little Oasis. Quiet, clean serenity in the midst of a busy, noisy city. We went in January and it was lovely. In July, it must be absolute bliss.

A real oasis in the city.... A wonderful collection of plants, cacti and trees well worth a visit as a break from the noise and heat - even in February. A must-see is the museum of Beber culture and art.Warning - the security guards at the gate may try to give you a fast track entry - for the standard 40 dirhamms fee - as they are the one's who check the tickets. Go and buy a ticket from the official kiosk. The guard who offered us entry had a face like a smacked bottom when we went legal!
BEAUTIFUL GARDEN.. You must see it. It is a garden where Yves St. Laurent put all his artistic flair and all his art in that piece of paradise.

Beautiful gardens. Really pretty gardens just outside the walled city of Marrakech. We went mid-morning, and it definitely got busier after lunchtime. We didn't go in to the YSL exhibition, but the gift shop was open and well stocked. Nice bamboo plantations and fountains. We got a taxi there and then walked back into Marrakech (getting a bit lost in the souk - but that's part of the adventure).
Beautiful colors. Berbere bue and yellow are the dominant colours... The plants have nothing special, but nice atmophere...

Not to be missed. This small garden is a walk away from Central Marrakech where all the chaos of the souks and the main square Jemaa el Fna are. It is peaceful and calm, lots of stunning cacti and beautiful blue, orange and lemon coloured pots. A fascinating blend of Morrocan and European design. Nice cafe, small museum, classy and quite expensive gift shop. Outside there are some more boutique -type gift shops, quite a contrast to the hustle and bustle of the Medina. In January this wasn't too crowded and the temperature was perfect. Take a good camera!
Amazing colours. A stunning garden - striking combinations of plants and buildings.
A beautiful place. Cameras at the ready, around every corner was a picture, vibrant yet calming
beautiful majorelle. Beautiful gardens,lovely colours and artwork,worth a visit

Get your garden on..... The term "garden" seems inappropriate in describing this lush little oasis of YSL... as if The Metropolitan Museum could be called a "gallery". Upon entering one finds a complete contrast to the sometimes dusty roadway of Morocco - be tantalized with blasts of blues and greens and yellows. Note the attention to detail along each line of the architecture, and leafy pathways. Don't forget to stop at the shops - there are some amazing posters and smaller sized art perfect for gifts or home. We booked an hour to explore Majorelle and grabbed a nibble nearby.

An oasis of calm. Located in the new town this is a little far form the hectic centre but is worth a visit for the calm atmosphere. Well tended with beautiful planting and combinations - worth a vsit!
Majorelle Garden. This garden was ok, nice cacti takes about 30 minutes tops, afterwards you can walk to Gueliz the new city area.
Worth a visit. Interesting, nice and cool on a hot day, good for wheelcahir users.
Jardins Majorelle. Vibrant colours of vivid royal blue and bright yellow house and garden pots plus variety of greens in the 3 garden types ( desert, tropical and Mediterranean).

serene. a little walk through the gardens, the bamboo itself was enough for me, but the cactus plants were very special. I highly recommend taking a seat in the garden restaurant, the food is fabulous, I had a salad, which they say not to eat and it was delicious.
Oasis of Calm. Beautiful, with a lovely cafe, nice to escape the hot city and enjoy this garden, very different from others in Marrakech.
Beautiful gardens. Really lovely examples of cacti and other flora. Well maintained. An enjoyable way to spend an hour or two
Peaceful spot. Probably worth 40 DH for the peace and quiet and lack of hassle.
STUNNING. What a beautiful tranquil inspiring place. The Yves St Lauren garden is beautiful.
An oasis of calm. We walked from the old town to here on Christmas Day. Colourful and calming. Smaller than you expect.

A beautiful oasis of calm. The Majorelle Gardens are an ideal oasis of calm in this vibrant city. Lush foliage and spiky cacti fill this colourful garden and offer the visitor a peaceful, cool escape. The restaurant, although pricey, serves delicious food and drinks and has a cooling water mister in summer. The shop's prices are unbelievably high but there is enough to enjoy in the gardens to make up for it.

Stunning garden, as long as you like Blue!. The colours are amazing , Blue & Yellows of the man made features amongst the greenery of the plants grown for their foliage rather than flowers. Cafe really expensive.

Pretty...but better in the summer. We visited the garden in the winter. Although it was still very pretty i can imagine it being absolutely magnificent during the summer when the flowers are in full bloom.The garden itself is very quiet and calm and a definite oasis in the hustle and bustle of the city.
Breathtaking. These gardens were beautiful, a peaceful oasis among the chaos. If I had seen nothing else these gardens would have made the trip worthwhile

Good for families, would be good respite from heat. This is a very family friendly site. Strollers would be fine and it would be a very welcome sanctuary from the heat in summer. As it was for us, visiting in winter time, it was just so so. The cacti are interesting and the bamboo is lush. There is a nice cafe in the gardens, and nearby the entrance (on the outside) there is a great fresh juice cafe - the pure freshly squeezed grapefruit juice was lovely to have for the walk in the gardens.

After all the pink of the Medina, wow! all the blues and yellows!. Our trip to Jardin Majorelle was our one foray outside the Medina during our 5-day visit to Marrakech. We hired a horse-drawn carriage at Jemma el Fna to take us there, wait for us, and then return us to Jemma el Fna. What a lovely trip!The most noteworthy aspects of the Jardin Majorelle are the wonderful vibrant colors, and the peaceful atmosphere. After all the bustling madness of the souks and the Medina, it was so nice to have a respite like that. When we were there, an exhibit about fashion icon Yves Saint Laurent's patronage of the garden had just ended; but his presence was still keenly felt.Incidentally, our driver was very nice, the drive through the urban sprawl (nondescript hotels and apartment buildings, etc.) was fun, and as I remember it, the driver's charge was very reasonable.

Colourful and peaceful. Majorelle gardens are beautiful, not huge but gloriously colourful pots and painted walls make the experience amazing. Whilst there go into the museum next to the cafe, its so worth the couple of quid it costs. A very professional display of items.
Small but interesting. We thought it would be grander and larger but it was worth seeing the garden that Yves Saint Laurent loved

What is all the fuss about?. Located in the middle of New Town, this took about 40 minutes to walk from the old city. Upon leaving the old city you get into the new town which has nothing to see apart from new hotels that have been built. The garden cost 40MAD or £3 to enter and consisted of numerous cactus, some palm trees and bamboo. The garden is extremely small for what I expected upon visiting other gardens around the world. There really isn't much to see in the garden and it is not near anything else. I didn't go inside the museum in the gardens based on other reviews read on here and to be honest I couldn't wait to leave after arriving and being utterly disappointed. You could better spend your time rather than visiting this place.
A work of ARt. This garden is exquisite, unusual and vibrant. A memorial to Yves St Laurent, it is a mix of zen and art. Shapes, colour, reflections. Beautiful
nice pleace. we love it hope to see it again with my parents and all the friends a good place but the coffe little expensive
an oasis in the hectic Marrakech. It's really nice to discover the gardens of Ive's Saint Laurent and how well the are conserved. Deserves a visit!
nice outing. nice to see where Yves Saint Laurent lived and also to wonder what his partner may be doing on the other side of the fence, nice garden and wide variants of plants and layouts too.
An oasis in the madness. The peace and tranquility is a welcome escaoe from the frantic pace of the city outside.

Fantastic even in January. Great place to walk around - smaller than you might expect for 40Dh entry, but worth it- entrance is round the side - so if you see the main gate that says YSL house turn back and its on the right. Must be a feast of colour in the summer but the bright pots make up for lack of flowers in January.The Berber Museum is 25Dh has over top level of security but its got nice pieces inside we didn't see anywhere else.
Tranquil escape. A little outside the old Medina but well worth the walk or short taxi ride
Sublime. An oasis, of calm, and blue and 1930s architecture. Shop and cafe rather pricy for Marrakech!

Stunning Garden, bits closed off though!. Really stunning and beautiful garden, amazing palms and cacti, wonderful pools and cobalt backdrop villa. Lots of stylish YSL touches.
Some areas were closed off, which was disappointing, but understand the need for continual upkeep. Couldn't take photos in the boutique either, which was a bit extreme. Still, well worth a visit, very calm and relaxing, easy on the eye.
must see. A quiet and inspiartional space in the middle of a bustling city
Beautiful. Beautiful place. Very attractive and calm nice place to take photos
A nice retreat. You only need 30/40 mins at this place and costs about £2 each but is worth it as the plants are gorgeous and is a very quiet retreat from the busy streets outside
not what I expected. nice but expected a bit more wish there was some history and description. walking there from the medina was worth it though
Jardin Majorelle. It was quite magical. Especially if you like cacti. Check the cafe prices before you order however.

Colorfull. Nice smaller garden with beautifull colours. Good picture material. The restaurant is sprinkled with water droplets in summer and sitting there, after a walk in the garden, is very comfortable.

beautiful cacti. Had expected more actually. Had never known there were so many different sorts of cacti (or is it cactuses?) and that they could be so beautiful. Jardin Majorelle is also a good starting point to explore the modern part of the city.

Beautiful and enchanting!. The colors are very seductive. The majorelle is indeed the highlight, but citrus yellow and tangerine orange make the place come lively! A true fantasy garden! The museum offers a stunning ceiling made of dotted lines that reminds one of a constellation. Le musee berbere inside the Majorelle Garden is a must see. It's truly one of the most beautiful ones that I have ever visited.
Peacful and lovely. Visited a few times as found it very peaceful even when full of people. Good to sit a relax as ell as admire scenery.

Ok for a quick visit.. We enjoyed the walk from the Medina to the Garden. The Garden was much smaller and underwhelming than we thought it would be, and it was also crammed with tourists. The highlight was the new Berber museum in the former home.
oasis. this was a great find and it took us a long walk in hot weather to find it, we got lost, but once there it was a lovely calm oasis
Must go there once. For the colors and the quietness, the garden is very well arranged and taken care of.
Beautiful gardens. Fans of YSL and spectacular gardens will be in heaven. There is also a very impressive cactus collection.
Tropical. The gardens were well kept and even in off season were beautiful to look at

Sweet Memory. Mon cher Yves, you have left a slice of Heaven, tiny and intimate in the vibrant city of Marrakesh. It is a must for all garden lovers. Not very big, bit take your time, you can rush through within 5 minutes or take your personal breath for an hour or longer. There is even a nice café with a patio and a bit hefty prices, but so what? Enjoy. The bamboo collection is especially for me as a bamboo lover amazing.

An oasis of peace in a hectic world. This was a wonderful experience. The calm as you step into the gardens was heavenly. The contrast of the natural plants and the brightly colored urns was surprisingly wonderful. The museum was spectacularly presented - what else should I have expected of a haute designer displaying clothing and jewelry, albeit ancient Berber? Admittedly, the museum budget must have been high, but it didn't have to be so really well done. The beauty of the presentation equalled the beauty of the objects displayed.The cafe was delightful also. Not only a beautiful environment, but yummy food.
simply magnificent :). simply magnificent..... i loved it and the people working there are very friendly and nice :)) would love to go again !
Peaceful haven away from the hustle and bustle!. Beautiful gardens, definitely worth a visit.We spent around 2 hours which was more than adequate.

Beautiful quiet oasis of calm. If you want some time away from the hustle and bustle, take a trip here for a quiet hour or so. The gardens are beautiful and the colours vibrant. Different species of cactus to admire and a vast array of palm trees. Also a memorial to yves st laurent. Its only small but very peaceful.
Beautiful and serene. After the bustle of the souks this place is heavenly. The garden is sublime with exquisite planting and design; an exquisite place.
A day out among the triffids. Amazing plants - be sure to go when they are casting shadows on the immaculately-tended ground so you get ace photos!
Brilliant colour. The gardens full of shade, and cactii; the museum has an interesting historical artifacts of the Berber people, beautifully displayed.
Amazing Cactus garden. Very pretty not large best cactus garden I have ever seen. there are varieties you wont believe

Way better than expected!. My friend and I had ventured to the garden on a suggestion from our guidebook and we were completely blown away by how much we enjoyed it. It's not full of colorful flower beds or shrub art, it's more of a green space. There are tall bamboos everywhere, hundreds of different cacti and succulents and interesting architecture as well. Once you're inside, the car sounds and fumes completely disappear and you immediately become tranquil. We walked there from the djemaa al fna which took about 30 mins. I would recommend it to anyone even if it's slightly out of the way.
An oasis. It shows YSL's taste everywhere. The shops and cafés around are worth discovering.
Fantastic city garden. Never been to anything quite like it. Very lush and whimsical. A great place to spend a couple of hours. Don't miss the Islamic museum and artwork by Yves San Laurent.

an oasis in the middle of the traffic. Very pleasant. The nature plus the colourfull building trasmit a peacefull sensation. Is the perfect visit to do after an intense and maybe caoting seightseeing in the rest of the city.
Good to see. It is a nice tribute to Yves Saint Laurent, but after seeing many gardens in may different places it didn't impress me too much. It is definitely interesting, but gets packed.
Mini Kew Gardens. A beautiful tranquil place, lots of singing birds.

beautiful oasis in Marrakech. A real treat away from the heat and dust, the gardens are beautiful full of mature plans and cacti and well worth a visit. NB The gift shop is v chic and not cheap (although the exhibition of original Yves St Laurent artwork is definitely worth a look)
Beautiful gardens. Wonderful for a wander on a sunny afternoon - a little tropical rainforest in the middle of Morocco!
Interesting garden. Worthwhile spending an hour to view this beautiful garden.
Beautiful. Lovely little oasis. Vibrant colours. Easy to catch a cab. The concept stores on the street opposite are great too.
Stunning. simply stunning , a must see , entrance is affordable , mechandise at the gift shop is too expensive though ... pictures are not allowed to be taken inside the shop , very strange
Jardin Majorelle review. Nice garden but quite pricey! Even at a leisurely pace, we were done viewing it in 30 minutes or so. Lots of cactus variety, but not many colourful flower blooms..
Fantastic. The gardens were amazing, but equally interesting was the Berber museum full of interesting information and treasures.

An oasis of peace inside a bustling city. We took a walk from our hotel up to Majorel Gardens, evading marauding Moroccan drivers, who are quite honestly mad as hatters on the roads!We followed the map until we saw a sign for the gardens, and continued following the signs until we came upon it. There was a small charge to get in, and another small charge if you wanted to visit the museum that's inside as well. We opted for just the gardens, and spent a very nice hour or so wandering around, and taking pictures of the flowers and plants. It's amazing how peaceful the gardens are, considering the noise of the traffic which is just outside its walls.There is a small tea garden, where you can order beverages and snacks, slightly higher prices than you would expect in a normal Moroccan café, but clean, tidy surroundings, and good service.There is also a small boutique where you can buy various items, much dearer than you can barter for, but if you're not much of a one for bartering, then it's nice to have prices on things...for all I know you might even be able to haggle in there!There was a room with a selection of paintings to view, and some books on Moroccan art to browse through.All in all, a nice way to spend an hour or two!
sort of disappointing in the winter. If you're there in the winter, go to the Majorelle garden (take a taxi) only if you have an insane love for cacti.

Worth a visit!. Enjoyed walking around the beautiful garden. I particularly enjoyed the Baber Museum (have to pay separately) . While the museum was small, all my senses were wonderfully stimulated with the music, light, sights of display, etc. Loved the exhibition and was able to understand the Baber culture better. Cafe inside serves nice sandwiches and drinks. There are a few interesting shops and a supermarket just near the entrance of the Garden. We ended up spending so much time inside and outside of the garden and truely enjoyed the whole experience. You could take a bus #12 and walk just about 200m.

Vastly overrated. We went here on the strength of it being one of Marrakech's top sites. What a waste of time. Sure, there are some funny-looking cacti that will amuse you for two minutes, and a New Age-style store on the premises selling incense, soap, or whatever: but as a garden it is pokey, concretey, and the layout is completely uninspired. A real poor-man's morning out. Don't waste your time and money when there are so many better sights in Marrakech.
A bit disappointing. Visted Marrakech 20 + years ago and have an abiding memory of the beauty of the Jardin Majorelle. Jacques Majorelle must be turning in his grave. Not worth the trip.

Fantastic Treat. a beatiful garden like no other in the word , very rare plants ,i love the rare cactuses . Actually there is a unique bleu house where E Sain Lorent used to live , you would never gessed it in the middle of nowhere
Beautiful garden. Beautifully designed garden with brightly coloured villa containing a well-documented collection of Moroccan artifacts, clothes and jewelry. Well worth a visit
nice but.... .... yeah... it was okay.. very small. We went to see Cyber park and the park in the Plaza. They were free and from my perspective just as nice or better !
so nice. Really nice, cute flowers, very interesting museum (even though u have to pay again) and an amazing blue wall perfect for pictures!!!!!
A wonderful garden. The garden is beautifully laid out, easy to get around, full of interesting succulent plants and cacti, wonderful for photographs!

Heaven on Earth. Visited in the morning on my own when it was quiet and not overrun with tour groups. Was there about 3 hours soaking up the atmosphere and watching the turtles. Also went in the museum and cafe - both of which I'd recommend

Worth a Visit. Beautiful gardens tucked away in the desert. It only takes an hour (max) to see the gardens so I would recommend making it a stop as a part of a larger tour of various sites around the city.
Majorelle Gardens. What a bore. Nothing to see other than a few cacti and bamboo! oh and some gross bright blue building which was a memorial to YSL
Beautiful, tasteful. Small but very nice, beautiful an peaceful place away from the hectic of the city
A tidy little garden featuring Yves St Laurent's special blue. It won't take long to see this garden with it's bamboo, cactus and bright blue house, but it's worth a trip.
I LOVE THE BLUE. What a wonderful garden. Even if it was not Yves saint laurents, I would still have enjoyed it as much.

Worth a quick visit - overcroweded so maybe not a place to linger, good ice cream opposite!. Well worth a visit. Certainly seems that many people have the same opinion judging by how many people were there when we went!We followed the path around, taking in the calm and peacefulness of the gardens and being impressed with the array of cacti. Also a cafe and gift shop, but we got ice cream across the road, which was really tasty.Walked there from the old town, and then got a horse and carriage back, which made a good morning of it.

Stunning oasis.. Lovely and unique gardens. Impressive collection of plants whcih are set off beautifully with the vibrant coloured hard surfaces. Very well tended gardens.Cafe is set in a courtyard area and is lovely. Food and drinks were excellent and, while more expensive then other places, not overly priced.

Pretty, but not a botanical marvel. The garden is attractive, but it is certainly not a botanical marvel that exhibits an array of plants. It is pleasant for a stroll and for taking pictures, but the tea garden is ridiculously overpriced. Furthermore, the area in which the garden is situated needs to be cleaned up by the city council as it is rather filthy.

Loved it!. The gardens are a little out of town bit walkable.Before you go in I suggest you go to the shop/cafe just outside on the corner. It's very modern and has some great art and fresh smoothies and wheatgrass juices.. yummy.The gardens themselves are mainly cacti and a very distinct Blue building with a small gallery of Yves Saint Laurents prints that he drew whilst in Morocco for his Christmas Cards. Lovely little cafe to rest in too.

Wonderful Oasis of calm. This place is definitely worth a visit - and a very reasonable entry fee.The gardens are lovely, and this is an ideal spot to escape the bustle for a couple of hours of tranquility...

small, not cheap but quiet and interesting. I went here on Christmas dear. I´d describe the place as a very quiet and relaxing but small park or garden in what is otherwise a bustling city. I can imagine that on warmer days it is even nicer to sit in the shade there.
White & Blue garden. The only white and blue building. A nice garden within the city. Lots of trees and cactus diversity.

blu elettrico. giardino meraviglioso e molto ben conservato che contiene molte piante rare.Il colore dominante delle fontane e dei muretti e' il blu elettrico che accompagna durante tutta la visita ,rappresenta una vera oasi di pace e relax in una citta' davvero troppo caotica

Great escape from hustle and bustle of medina!. Beautifully maintained gardens and great lunch spot. Highly recommend visiting! Also great gift shop for those looking for something extra special. We loved the gardens, learning about YSL and the Berber museum. Definitely a must-see!

Majorelle Gardens The Last Resting Place of Yves Saint Laurent. If you happen to be in Marrakech, Morocco this is a must. There is a largest collection of cactus plants that I have ever seen. I visited it in November and also New Year's Eve.It cost 40 local dirhams or roughly 4 Euros and additional 20 (2 Euros) if you choose to visit the Berber museum within the compound. The November visit was just stunning and that is what made me visit again to record some video. I was a wee bit disappointed for there was lack of colours and not as many flowers. The sun being low on the horizon at that time of the year took away from the magnificent colours of the first visit. So you should go as early as possible and morning preferably. Take a taxi of horse drawn carriage but make sure you fix the price of the ride before embarking.

Lovely little oasis. We walked from our hotel and took a packed lunch. Took lots of photos of the cactus. had a lovely stroll through the gardens.not as big as i thought it would be but well worth the visit.

fabulous!. it's an amazing garden of exotic plants, but most of all the colours of the house and the vases make it so special. the berber museum is also very interesting. after the visit spend some time in the garden-cafeteria, fruit juices are awesome.
A little piece of Heaven.... Le jardin Majorelle is like heaven on earth. With no one pestering you, just relax and take in the tranquility of it all. Good on ya Yves Saint Laurent...

Idyllic Ambience @ Majorelle. A most refreshing experience, visiting the Majorelle Garden in Marrakech. The idyllic surroundings of the Garden is indeed a journey into an oasis within a desert. Eventhough the Gardens are in an urban area, you are transposed into a forest-like environment.
Style over substance. Garden small but beautifully kept. Cafe stylish but pricey.

WOW!. Amazing gardens! So peaceful, so beautiful! Amazing colors everywhere. I've never seen so many cactus befrore and types I've never encountered. The Berber exhibit in the museum is not to be missed - absolutely spectacular!

no big deal. Ok, it's a nice garden, beautiful cactuses, so what? it' s the most expensive place in Marrakech and certainly a marketing success but I don't really see the point of going there. By the way it seems copied from Frida Kahlo house in Mexico. Have a tour in the palmeraie instead !

An urban oasis with cactus gardens and amazing colors. The intensity of the blues of the house, which included the Berber museum, and the cactus varieties in the gardens, made this one of our highlights in Marrakesh. The museum provided an excellent overview of Berber life, and the gift shop offered some unique, comtemporary items that reflected Moroccan patterns and colors.

Most beautiful spot in Marrakech. An oasis of beauty and tranquility in the midst of this bustling, noisy city. You may face a long lineup for tickets to enter - stick with it, it is well worth the wait.

Smaller than I expected. This was not what I expected.. it was too manicured for me...and only a short walk round.. nice canes, big cactuses but small! Not worth the entry ticket....try Botanic Gardens Sydney instead!

A stunning oasis out of town. Just as beautiful as the pictures we'd seen. The cacti were amazing and we had a great little lunch in the cafe.
We arrived about noon and by the time we left there was a fairly long queue to get in.

Not sure what the big deal is about?. This garden was quite small and not overly diverse. The cactus garden was the most interesting part. We found the gardens 'la koutoubia' much nicer to walk around, though it does not have the range of plants that majorelle had.

Marjorelle is da bomb. For any fashion aficionado it is a MUST......gorg colors, agriculture and a tribute to the maestro.....Yves. I loved my visit on Jan 3, 2012. A must is a collaborative visit to the"Colette" of Marrakech, 33 located across from the gardens.....what a treat filled store filled with brave art, local designers and a rhythm that is all Marrakech.

High fashion gardens. We were recommended to visit the gardens and went out to find out more about a typical north Arabic designed garden. There is a modest entrance fee and the garden with its cacti, bamboos and palm trees would hold your interest for a hour or so.The gardens fell into disrepair some years ago and was spruced up by the fashion designer Yves Saint Laurent whose memorial is also in the gardens. Its a good place to get some calm from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.Contained within the gardens is a separate Berber museum with its own entrance fee with artefacts, costumes and history of the Berber people from the region. There are also cards in English which explains the artefacts in question and its easy to overlook this.

Crowed but amazing. Well worth the crowd and entrance fee. The gardens are huge, but so well maintained and really great landscaping. Lots of color and texture. Great photo op!!Go early to avoid the crowds...

Oasis in Marrakech. This was a wondeful way to spend an hour of our day. So many different and beautiful species of plants and flowers. The vibrant colors took you to another world. Great refuge and would visit again.

Pretty and Quiet. The garden is very pretty, but if you are a seasoned traveler and have seen the gardens of the Alkazar in Seville, or the Alhambra in Granada, this is a shadow of the real thing. There is a small museum of Berber artifacts and history, but you must pay extra to go in. A good place to go for a respite but in my opinion, not worth the entrance fee if you have a chance to see the real thing elsewhere. However, since all the current king's palaces are closed to the public, it might be worth seeing if you've never been in a typical Arabic garden.
A must.. Really special spot. Just go!!! The cobalt blue is unforgettable. Great shopping at boutique 33 & delish salads across from entrance. A perfect afternoon outing.
Haven of calm. We liked the YSL exhibition. The shop was very high end and expensive. The gardens were peaceful and calm having come straight from the medina
nice stroll. it is just a nice stroll in the gardens. great get away from all the noise and chaos of town. little heaven in the ville nouvelle.
relaxing and beautiful. It's an escape from old medina,colorful gardens not so big but enough,the trees and bamboos are amazing you can just sit in the bench and read your book.
Beautiful place in a hustle bustle of a city. If you don't like gardens you might not like it but I would find it truly amazing if you didn't like it

nearly didn't bother but SO GLAD I DID !!. I nearly didnt bother to go see these gardens as gardens are gardens right ?? After a big recommendation from the Riad owner i decided as it was only a short 10 min walk i may aswell kill a morning.....it was easy to find, entrance fee 40dhms, not too busy but it was 26th dec, the gardens are beautiful, very peaceful, hard to believe the busy main road is so close but couldn t hear it.the buildings, water features etc were lovely, it was nice to see Yves Saint Laurents gallery and memoriam, nice little cafe if you want a snack or drink, lots to photo, good array of plants and in my opinion worthy of the time although a couple of hours is long enough.
beautiful oasis. Lovely, quiet setting. Don't miss the new Berber museum on the premises.

beautiful garden...more impressive museum of Berber artifacts. I love gardens like this, but was blown away by the museum. I had no idea Yves St-Laurent has such a large collection of Berber tools, clothing, jewelry, and cultural artifacts. I love the audio-visual media that accompanies certain artifacts. Really nice!
All sorts of plants!. Loved seeing all the different kinds of plants and trees. Beautiful scenery.

The best of Marrakech attractions. Visit early in the morning before the crowds. It's clean, bright and green. The cacti collection is unique You can also visit the museum of Islamic art. Majorelle isa welcome change from hustle and bustle of the medina
colourful garden. great for taking very colourful pictures - got there by a kalech ride - try and do it in the afternoon when the sunlight is coming at nice angle.
Beautiful garden. Well worth a visit. A beautiful oasis just outside the medina. A lovely cafe there too, where I enjoyed a chocolate icecream!

Lovely Garden. I highly recommend a visit to the Jardin Majorelle. The bamboo trees and the water features are very calming. The gardens are a little smaller than I imagined but well worth a visit. Ticket was 40dhms.
A contemporary feel to this green garden. The layout of the garden, the vibrant colors of the house. Note across the road are two very good shops well worth checking out.
Wonderful Oasis. Second visit. Just gardens. One hour enough. A treat to the senses.
Peaceful and beautiful. Lovely plants and cacti. Tranquil and romantic place to visit.

An Oasis of Calm in the Madness of Marrakech !. Beautiful gardens in memory of Yves Saint Laurent, with a splash of colour. Vibrant, yet calming, cooling and relaxing. Then stop off for a refreshing break in the beautiful Cafe within the gardens. Definitley a gem not to be missed.

Wow...Les Jardins Majorelle. A beautiful & peaceful way to spend time in Marrakech away from the "maddening crowds" of the City. Yves St. Laurent is buried here and certainly maintained these gradens & house in a most beautiful way. The colors are spectacular & the cactii & succulents magnificent!

very disappointed. had known about the gardens for years so my expectations were higher than if i was going blind, but i was very disappointed indeed. the gardens are tiny, the flora and fauna not particularly interesting, and wasn't cheap to get to and get away from. they're nicely kept, however, and there's a sweet little yves saint laurent poster gallery, but not much else going for it
A beautiful retreat. A place of quiet and calm after the craziness of the souks and Jemaa el-Fna.
not to be missed. the most incredible colors and collection of beauty. you feel so serene and so connected with the colors of yves st laurent- not to be missed

Escape from Marrakech mayhem!. We had such an enjoyable afternoon wandering through these beautiful gardens, every direction you turn your eyes are captured by beautiful scenes.
Such a relief from the mayhem of Marrakech.
Definitely worth a visit!!

Excellent Cafe and Tranquil Gardens. Although the weather was terrible we enjoyed walking around the tranquil gardens. There’s not a tremendous amount to see but we enjoyed it. There is a lovely cafe within the gardens and the food and drink we had here was surprisingly good. They even had an open fire which we enjoyed as the weather was particularly rainy. There is also a small shop but we did find that to be slightly expensive. On another note it's very accessible due to the fact the open top bus stops outside.

Nice oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Loved the gardens and the Yves Saint Laurent exhibition in the annex building. Would have loved to visit the cobolt blue home of St Laurent. Nice place for a contemplation after visiting souks and markets.

Serenity away from the madness. Quite a long walk (about 20 mins) through the modern (and not very interesting) part of town but worth it. More so if you arrive early or late and avoid crowds of tourists which somewhat spoil the serenity. An hour probably long enough to spend there.

Relaxing & stressless. In the middle of busy Marrakech, this place is is like a gold mine of calming surroundings. And for a guy travelling solo I found this place facinating. If you're like me and also feel like walking the souk is too hectic and stressing, then you're going to love this place. Though it mostly appeals to the female audience, it was a great place to buy souvenirs to my sister and girl-friends. The restaurant there is good. I even had pan-cake with icecream. And I loved every bit of it.

Enjoyable garden to walk through; something to do besides shop in Marrakech. We enjoyed our time at the Majorelle Garden; it wasn't amazing, but we enjoyed it never the less. The cacti garden was pretty good.

Classy place. This is such a classy, unique and stylish garden that surpassed expectations. The elegant and shrewd placing of the plant collections entwined with sweeping paths, colourful urns, water features, moroccan features makes this a wonderful place to spend some an hour or two. It is definately worth the effort.
Beautiful garden. Its magical and lots of cactus plants and palms. Very quaint indeed
Small but beautiful. Very stylish and inspiring garden that belonged to Yves St Laurent.

The colourful chilled oasis in the new part of Marrakech. Make sure you do not miss this gardens hen you are in Marrakech. Come in the early morning (as of 9)to enjoy the quiet time as it is considered to be the most visited place of interest in Marrakech. Pass by the newly opened Musee Berbere, it is definitely worth visiting - the extract of all the treasures of the Moroccan history in one place. Very neat , colourful and taken care of. The cafe serves nice food, has chilled patio, however be prepared for the european prices (specially for drinks).

Pretty but not worth the price. Cost 40 MAD and can be walked in 15 min.Small garden with interesting plant life but nothing is labeled. If you are just looking for a tranquil spot to escape from the city for a 1/2 hr this is your place but other thaa that it can be skipped.
Best Gardens in Marrakech. Nice day out with good food and desert in the cafe
Bliss. We found it by using the bus and walking, but it was well worth the visit without anyone else there it would have been Paradise.

Smaller than we expected but a nice escape from the hustle and bustle. We got a taxi up to these gardens thinking we would pass a few hours here, but we were round and out in less than 30 mins! It was worth the trip for the tranquility and wonderful colours... But don't expect extensive grounds!
beautiful. Just a lovely place where you have to got to. It is so much different to the rest of the city.
An Amazing Garden. Everybody will love this beautiful garden. It's tastefully arranged. The ceramics with vivid colors are stunning. It's very soulful and beautiful. A real treasure.
Pretty :). Very pretty tropical garden, wasn't very busy which was nice in December, only MAD40 to get in! Got a horse and carriage ride outside to another part of town.

Beautiful Horticultural Oasis. Beautifully designed gardens that could benefit from some signage indicating what one is admiring. The museum has been closed on the the two occasions that I have visited.
Quiet beautiful place to relax.. Great to get out of the loud city and relax.The restaurant has a small-nice international food menu.

Serenity at a small price. These Gardens are rightly one of the most popular attractions in Marrakech and have been for years. It's not hard to understand why. You pay your entry fee (a neccessary expense to maintain the gardens and pay the large groundkeeping staff) and immeadiately enter a tranquil and peace inducing garden layed out beautifully. The pathways lead you round the whole garden from dappled shade in the bamboo space to sunny, open areas round the ponds and the museum building. There are numerous benches where you can sit in the calm atmosphere and reflect.It's generally best to visit earlier (before 11.00) or after 15.30 as the bus parties tend to visit in the middle of the day and it can get crowded as it's not a huge garden.I don't understand how anyone could fail to be charmed by this place.
Fabulous!!!. A beautiful location for reflection and tranquility.
Nice, but small. Nice, quiet place, but small for the DH 40 afmission
peaceful place. nice park worth to visit, disapointed that you have to pay a fee to enter

Save your money and time, it's a hyped up tourist trap, a boring one at that!. Do not believe the high reviews of this place in Marrakech, we have been to Marrakech twice, absolutely loved the country but I have to inform anyone reading this that the Majorelle Gardens was a waste of time and not to bother going. Before going to Marrakech we bought several guide books to swat up on, all boasting that "Majorelle Gardens" is the place to go and is a "must see" when visiting Marrakech. When we finally got there what an anti-climax! We should have listened to the taxi drivers and even the hotel manager who was directing us to visit other gardens or the Palmerie. I thought they just wanted our money and a longer fare but they turned out to be right. We were greeted at Majorelle Gardens by two rather obnoxious security guards, the place looked very small and we wanted just general information about the place, we had our own food and wanted to know if there was an area we could sit and eat, the ticket seller said yes, the security guards saw we had our own food and said no and tried to take our food. We did not want to eat in a touristy cafe on garden ground which we were envisaging selling overpriced european food ala hotel food. We decided to walk round the garden, there was no picnic eating area, the garden had no open air and in Febuary in Marrakech the shade can get very very cold, even in the day. There was nothing to this garden but paths through lots of bamboo. There was not one thing in this "garden" that I could justify paying the 40DH entry for. I would avoid this place like the plague, do not believe the mindless rubbish the guide books try and feed you with. This was the lowlight of our trip and something we would never do again nor recommend to anyone ever thinking of visiting Marrakech. Instead visit the Palmarie, not a "garden" as such but that was far more interesting and not so much a tourist trap with only one thing in mind which is to squeeze every tourist for every last penny they have. If you want a good garden the Cyber Parc beat this by far. In my opinion though there are a million and one more interesting things to do than visit the gardens, especially the Majorelle Gardens. It is very small and could be walked round in 5-10 minutes.

peaceful retreat away from the madness. These gardens aren't very big but it is really peaceful and serene to wonder around looking at the different areas. I think it was around 40 dirhams each to enter, which is fairly good value. Not a huge variety of plants - mostly bamboo, palms, cacti and succulents but some really pretty parts and definately worth a look.
